Recipe ID: 1291e511-8ccb-496a-95ef-2e457133cd6b
Recipe Title: Slow-Simmered Rosemary Roast and Vegetables
Recipe Summary: The recipe for this tender, slow cooked Rosemary Beef Pot Roast comes with its own side-dish of braised vegetables.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 200
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Boneless Blade Pot Roast
	- Salt and pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 leeks, white portion only, coarsely chopped
	- 10 baby potatoes, quartered (or 3 to 4 cups/750 mL to 1 L cubed peeled potatoes)
	- 6 cups (1.5 L) coarsely shredded red cabbage
	- 2 carrots, cut into small sticks
	- 1 apple, skin on, cut into cubes
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) beef broth
	- ½ cup (125 mL) red wine or apple juice
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 2 whole black peppercorns, crushed
	- 2 whole cloves
	- 4 sprigs fresh rosemary (or 2 tsp/10 mL crumbled dried rosemary)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Boneless Blade Pot Roast
	- Salt and pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 leeks
	- 10 baby potatoes
	- Red cabbage
	- 2 carrots
	- 1 apple
	- Beef broth
	- Red wine or apple juice
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Black peppercorns
	- 2 whole cloves
	- 4 sprigs fresh rosemary (or 2 tsp/10 mL crumbled dried rosemary)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat roast dry with paper towel and rub all over with salt and pepper to your taste. 
	2. Heat a lightly oiled Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster over medium-high heat; brown roast, turning with tongs, for about 10 minutes until browned all over. Add leeks, potatoes, cabbage, carrots, apple, beef broth, red wine, bay leaf, peppercorns, cloves and rosemary. Bring to just a boil.
	3. Reduce heat, cover and simmer on stove-top or in preheated 325°F oven for about 3 hours or until beef is fork-tender. (Note: oven is best for maintaining a simmer.)
	4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Remove cloves, bay leaf and rosemary stems from sauce. Slice roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with the braised vegetables and sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Browning Pot Roast before cooking helps to develop beef flavour but, if pressed for time, you can skip this step without too much sacrifice.
---
Recipe ID: 12fb8cdf-7be5-4665-9439-7f23362abd9a
Recipe Title: Vietnamese-Style Noodle Salad with Grilled Steak
Recipe Summary: Barbecued Flat Iron shines in sandwiches and salads like this one! 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 510
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 shallot, finely chopped
	- 5 tsp (25 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH fish sauce and soy sauce
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Grilling Steaks, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	-  Noodle Salad 
	- 8 oz (250 g) fine rice vermicelli 
	- 3 cups (750 mL) EACH shredded lettuce and fresh bean sprouts
	- 12 fresh mint sprigs
	- Half English cucumber, julienned
	- 1 tomato, cut into wedges (optional)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) cold water
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) granulated sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fish sauce
	- 1 Thai chile pepper, thinly sliced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped roasted peanuts
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 shallot
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Vegetable oil
	- Fish sauce
	- Soy sauce
	- Pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Grilling Steaks, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Fine rice vermicelli
	- Lettuce
	- Fresh bean sprouts
	- 12 fresh mint sprigs
	- English cucumber
	- 1 tomato
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Granulated sugar
	- Fish sauce
	- 1 Thai chile pepper
	- Chopped roasted peanuts
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine garlic, shallot, brown sugar, oil, fish sauce, soy sauce and pepper in large resealable freezer bag. Pierce steaks all over with fork. Add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 hours or up to 24 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer steak to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	3. Noodle Salad: Meanwhile, cook vermicelli according to package instructions. Drain and place in shallow bowl or platter; top with lettuce, bean sprouts, mint, cucumber and tomato (if using). Combine water, lime juice, sugar, fish sauce and chile in a small bowl, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Splash sauce over salad and toss to combine.
	4. Cut steaks across the grain into thin slices and serve with Noodle Salad; garnish with peanuts.
Recipe Tips:
  - Marinades are all about building steak flavour and juiciness. Piercing steak all over with a fork is what helps tenderize the steak.
---
Recipe ID: 138e1076-34bb-42e0-a8a4-267216b9b0d9
Recipe Title: Hot Pulled Beef Bunwiches
Recipe Summary: This hot pulled beef sandwich is best served with a knife and fork to eat along with a side salad or French fries and coleslaw. If you want, you can skip the bun and serve over oven-roasted potato wedges with some cheese curds for a poutine-style dish.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 110
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 120
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) thick-cut Boneless Beef Simmering Short Ribs (about 6)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion, halved and sliced
	- 3 cloves garlic, thinly sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2½ cups (625 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) herbes de Provence
	- 6 Kaiser buns, warmed and halved
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) thick-cut  Boneless Beef Simmering Short Ribs  (about 6)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- All-purpose flour
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Dijon mustard
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Herbes de Provence
	- 6 Kaiser buns
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim fat from meat, if desired. Pat dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef, in batches, for about 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a plate. 
	2. Drain off all but 1 tbsp (15 mL) fat from pot. Reduce heat to medium. Cook onion and garlic, stirring, for about 4 minutes or until softened. Sprinkle with flour; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in beef broth, then mustard, Worcestershire and herbes de Provence. Bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up brown bits from bottom of pot. Return beef and accumulated juices to pot, turning ribs to coat with sauce.
	3. Cover and bake in preheated 325°F oven for 1½ to 2 hours or until meat is fork-tender.
	4. Transfer beef to a bowl and cover to keep warm. Skim fat from sauce. Strain the sauce through a sieve, if desired, and return to pot. Shred the meat with 2 forks, removing any fat. Pile the meat on the bottom half of a bun and ladle sauce over top; sandwich with bun top.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can cook the beef a day ahead. At the end of step 3, let cool, then cover and refrigerate in an airtight container. Remove fat from sauce; bring sauce and meat to a simmer over medium heat in a large saucepan; simmer until hot then proceed with step 4.
---
Recipe ID: 13a15bd7-4493-4070-bfec-56e36f7f1fb2
Recipe Title: Oven Roast Beef with Au Jus
Recipe Summary: Au Jus is just a fancy name for making a beef gravy without adding any flour or cornstarch for thickening. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 7-in (17.5 cm) long x 5-in (12.5 cm) wide x 4-in (10 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 190
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Rib Eye Oven Roast
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) chopped fresh thyme or rosemary (or 1 tsp/5 mL crushed dried)
	- Coarse sea salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Dry red wine (optional)
	- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Rib Eye Oven Roast
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Fresh thyme or rosemary (or 1 tsp/5 mL crushed dried)
	- Coarse sea salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Dry red wine (optional)
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rub garlic, thyme and salt and pepper to your taste all over roast. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast.
	2. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2½ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done) 
	NOTE: see ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts. 
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before carving. 
	4. Meanwhile, pour roasting pan drippings into a glass measuring cup and skim off any excess fat that rises to the top. Pour drippings back into pan. Heat over medium heat on stove-top; stir in a splash of red wine (if using), stirring up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Stir in broth and bring to a boil; reduce heat and boil gently until reduced by about a third. Strain if desired. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot just over thinly sliced roast beef.
Recipe Tips:
  - When buying a boneless beef oven roast, buy 6 to 8 oz (175 to 250 g) beef per person.
---
Recipe ID: 13d21a10-463a-4e50-be5a-5ef03add8a8d
Recipe Title: Mediterranean Ground Beef and Pasta Bake
Recipe Summary: Not your typical Mac’ n’ Beef, this recipe makes hearty and healthy go hand-in-hand. If pressed for time, skip the baking and use as a stove-top dish. For a potluck affair, the recipe can easily be doubled, baking in a 13 x 9-inch (3 L) baking dish.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cups (500 mL) whole wheat rotini or penne pasta (uncooked)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Chuck 
	- 1 medium onion, chopped
	- 1 cup (250 mL) sliced mushrooms
	- ½ EACH sweet red and green pepper, diced
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) pasta sauce (about half a jar)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
	- ½ cup (125 mL) crumbled light feta cheese
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped pitted Kalamata olives
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) prepared basil pesto
	- Fresh Italian parsley leaves (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Whole wheat rotini or penne pasta (uncooked)
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Lean Ground Beef Chuck 
	- 1 medium onion
	- 1 cup (250 mL) sliced mushrooms
	- 1 EACH sweet red and green pepper
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Pasta sauce
	- Shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
	- Crumbled light feta cheese
	- Chopped pitted Kalamata olives
	- Prepared basil pesto
	- Fresh Italian parsley leaves (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
	2. Meanwhile, cook ground beef, onion, mushrooms, red and green peppers and garlic over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet, breaking up beef with a spoon and stirring often, for 8 to 10 minutes or until meat is cook thoroughly and any liquid has evaporated or drain, if necessary. Remove from heat.
	3. Stir in pasta sauce, half the mozzarella, feta, olives and pesto; gently stir in pasta. Spoon into 8-inch (2 L) square baking dish and sprinkle with remaining mozzarella. Tent loosely with foil.
	4. Bake in 350°F oven for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 minutes or until hot, bubbling and cheese is melted. Garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Ground beef is 100% beef with no additives, fillers or colours.
---
Recipe ID: 1451da0e-421b-4bcb-8405-8d523335bfd0
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Peppercorn Sauce
Recipe Summary: Enjoy juicy Beef Rib Eye Grilling steak served with a simple flavourful pan sauce as a special family meal.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped onion
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) coarsely cracked peppercorns, or to taste
	- Salt
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) steak seasoning, or to taste
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Butter
	- 1 onion
	- All-purpose flour
	- Beef broth
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Coarsely cracked peppercorns
	- Salt
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2)
	- Steak seasoning
Recipe Methods:
	1. Melt butter over medium heat in a skillet. Add onion, reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring frequently, for about 10 minutes or until onion is light brown. Add flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in broth, Worcestershire, vinegar and peppercorns and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and boil gently, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes or until sauce is thickened and reduced to about 1 cup (250 mL). Season with additional pepper and salt to taste. Cover and keep warm. 
	2. Meanwhile, pat steaks dry with paper towel. Rub steaks all over with seasoning to your taste. Grill or broil over medium-high heat for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	3. Transfer steaks to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice across the grain and serve with sauce. 
	Seasoning prior to grilling enhances the flavour of steaks better than if you season the steaks after grilling.
Recipe Tips:
  - Seasoning prior to grilling enhances the flavour of steaks better than if you season the steaks after grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 14c2a6f0-6872-4c80-bbba-9936cfb163a2
Recipe Title: Braised Beef Roast with Roasted Vegetable Sauce
Recipe Summary: Now here’s a neat trick – just purée the roasted vegetables to create a hearty, flavourful sauce. Serve with mashed potatoes accented with Parmesan cheese.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 195
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fennel seeds, crushed
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- 3 to 4 lb (1.5 to 2 kg) Beef Cross Rib Pot Roast
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 2 onions, chopped
	- 4 carrots, diced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) beef broth
	- 3 bay leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fennel seeds
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 to 4 lb (1.5 to 2 kg) Beef Cross Rib Pot Roast
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 onions
	- 4 carrots
	- All-purpose flour
	- Beef broth
	- 3 bay leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine fennel with ½ tsp (2 mL) each of the salt and pepper, rub all over roast. Heat 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the oil in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster over medium-high heat; brown beef all over, turning with tongs, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Reduce heat to medium. Add remaining oil to pan, if necessary; cook onions, carrots and remaining salt and pepper, stirring, for 4 minutes or until just golden. Sprinkle with flour; cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
	2. Add beef broth and bay leaves; bring to boil, stirring and scraping up brown bits from pot. Return meat and any accumulated juices to pot. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for about 3 hours or until fork-tender. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	3. Meanwhile, discard bay leaves. Skim fat from sauce if necessary. Transfer sauce and vegetables to blender or food processor in batches or use immersion blender in the pot; purée until smooth. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices serve with roasted vegetable sauce. 
Recipe Tips:
  - To cook in slow cooker, follow Step 1, not adding flour. Transfer meat and vegetables to 6-qt (6 L) slow-cooker. Add broth and bay leaves to pot as in Step 2; pour into slow-cooker. Cover and cook on LOW for 7 to 8 hours or until fork-tender. Transfer roast to a cutting board; discard bay leaves. Skim fat from sauce. Whisk flour with ¼ cup (60 mL) cold water; whisk into slow-cooker. Cover and cook on HIGH for about 15 minutes or until thickened. Purée as directed.
---
Recipe ID: 157fcb97-1b20-49d7-8f3a-667b8b206f90
Recipe Title: Caraway Oven Roast with Port Wine Sauce
Recipe Summary: A fragrant crust and elegant port-wine sauce to finish, dresses up this Eye of Round Roast. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 7¼-in (18 cm) long x 5½-in (13.5 cm wide) x 3-in (7.5 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 160
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) minced fresh parsley
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) crushed caraway seeds
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- Kosher salt and coarsely ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- Port Wine Sauce
		- 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) butter, divided
		- 2 shallots, minced
		- 1 cup (250 mL) red wine
		- ½ cup (125 mL) ruby port
		- 1½ cups (375 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp (30 mL) cold water
		- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh parsley
	- Crushed caraway seeds
	- Olive oil
	- Kosher salt and coarsely ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- Butter
	- 2 shallots
	- Red wine
	- Ruby port
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Cornstarch
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine parsley, caraway seeds, olive oil and salt and pepper to your taste in a small bowl. Press all over roast.
	 2. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	3. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	4. Port Wine Sauce: Meanwhile, if there is less than 2 tbsp (30 mL) fat and drippings in roasting pan, add 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the butter. Heat drippings and butter over medium heat on stove-top. Add shallots; cook, stirring, for about 3 minutes or until softened. Stir in wine and port; bring to a boil, scraping up any browned bits from pan. Reduce heat and simmer for about 7 minutes or until reduced by half. Stir in broth and bring to a boil. Gradually whisk in cornstarch mixture; simmer, stirring for about 2 minutes or until thickened. Strain (if desired) and return to pan. Whisk 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter into sauce; season with salt and pepper to taste.
	5. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with Port Wine Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - When oven-roasting roast beef, roast without a lid for best browning.
---
Recipe ID: 15d26c50-3619-4b6e-baea-78a9efe553f2
Recipe Title: Oven Roasted Greek Stuffed Peppers 
Recipe Summary: This recipe is an updated version of traditional stuffed peppers, having the peppers roasted before stuffing and using heart-healthy ingredients.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 large sweet red or yellow peppers, halved lengthwise, seeded
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) chopped zucchini
	- 1 small onion, finely chopped
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried oregano, crushed
	- 1 cup (250 mL) sodium-reduced beef broth
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dried orzo pasta
	- 1 cup (250 mL) fat- and sodium-reduced pasta sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) crumbled light feta cheese
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped pitted Kalamata olives
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 large sweet red or yellow peppers, seeded
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef
	- Zucchini
	- 1 small onion
	- Dried oregano
	- Sodium-reduced beef broth
	- Dried orzo pasta
	- Fat- and sodium-reduced pasta sauce
	- Crumbled light feta cheese
	- Chopped pitted Kalamata olives
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place peppers, cut side down, on a lightly oiled rimmed baking sheet. Bake in preheated 450°F oven 15 minutes or until skins start to blister and peppers are tender but not overcooked. Remove from oven; cover and keep warm.
	2. Brown beef, zucchini, onion and oregano over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet until meat is thoroughly cooked and most of liquid has evaporated. Drain if necessary.
	3. Stir beef broth and orzo into pan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 8 minutes or until orzo is cooked and liquid is absorbed.
	4. Meanwhile warm pasta sauce over medium heat in small saucepan until bubbling; remove from heat and keep warm.
	5. Divide beef mixture among pepper halves, packing lightly. Top each with feta and olives. Spoon pasta sauce over all. Tent loosely with foil and bake in 350°F oven for 15 minutes or until hot and topping is browned.
Recipe Tips:
  - Ground beef is 100% beef with no additives, fillers or colours.
---
Recipe ID: 163218f7-f75c-4332-8805-ee09daa5788f
Recipe Title: Pantry Chili with Garlic Loaf
Recipe Summary: This is a snap to pull together with simple pantry ingredients. If you prefer a fiery version, add a teaspoon or so of chopped canned chipotle peppers. Learn more about ground beef at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean or Lean Ground Beef
	- 1 large onion, diced
	- 1 large sweet pepper, diced (any colour)
	- 2 to 3 tbsp (30 to 45 mL) chili powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground cumin
	- 1 can (796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 1 can (398 mL) tomato sauce
	- 1 can (540 mL) red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) thawed corn kernels
	- 1 pkg (284g) Furlani® Garlic Bread 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Extra Lean or Lean Ground Beef
	- 1 large onion
	- 1 large sweet pepper (any colour)
	- Chili powder
	- Ground cumin
	- 1 can (796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 1 can (398 mL) tomato sauce
	- 1 can (540 mL) red kidney beans
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) thawed corn kernels
	- 1 pkg (284g)  Furlani® Garlic Bread 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook beef, onion, sweet pepper, chili powder, to your taste, and cumin over medium heat in a large saucepan or Dutch oven, stirring and using back of a spoon to break up beef into chunks, until meat is thoroughly cooked and liquid has evaporated.
	2. Stir in tomatoes, tomato sauce, beans and corn; increase heat to medium-high and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to medium and boil gently, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes, until chili is thickened and flavours are blended.
	3. Meanwhile, bake Furlani Garlic Bread according to package directions. 
	4. Serve chili with slices of toasty hot Furlani Garlic Bread.
Recipe Tips:
  - If you add some chopped fresh dill to the chili near the end of cooking, it plays up the fresh vegetable flavours. If you have kids that would rather not have kidney beans in the chili, mash the beans with a potato masher or in a food processor until smooth prior to adding to the chili. Learn more about beef at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway
---
Recipe ID: 1645b8b9-b0c4-49a9-bd0d-af3cd1fe76ca
Recipe Title: Pear with Grilled Steak Salad with Garlic Croutons
Recipe Summary: Peppery watercress is accented with sweet pear, tangy goat cheese and garlicky croutons in this upscale salad. Top with slices of flank steak or use leftover roast beef.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 18
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 33
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 loaf (284g) Furlani® Garlic Bread (for *Garlic Croutons)
	- ¾ lb (375 g) Canadian Beef Flank Marinating Steak 
	- ¾ tsp (3 mL) salt, divided
	- Half a shallot, minced
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) sherry vinegar or wine vinegar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 8 oz (250 g) watercress or baby arugula (about 2 packages)
	- 1/3 cup (75 mL) thinly sliced red onion
	- 1 ripe pear, peeled, if desired, and thinly sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) crumbled goat cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 loaf (284g)  Furlani® Garlic Bread  (for *Garlic Croutons)
	- ¾ lb (375 g)  Canadian Beef Flank Marinating Steak 
	- Salt
	- 1 shallot
	- Sherry vinegar or wine vinegar
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- 8 oz (250 g) watercress or baby arugula (about 2 packages)
	- Red onion
	- 1 ripe pear
	- Crumbled goat cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Garlic Croutons: Use Furlani Garlic Bread to make homemade croutons for this and many more summer salads. Preheat barbecue to medium-high heat (400˚F/200˚C). Cut Furlani Garlic Bread into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes. Arrange bread cubes, in an even layer, in a large foil pan. Place pan off to one side of barbecue and turn off the burners directly under the pan. Cook in closed barbecue, tossing occasionally, for 20 to 25 minutes or until croutons are golden brown and crispy all the way through. Let cool. Set aside 1 cup (250 mL) for this Pear and Grilled Steak Salad. (Let the remaining croutons cool for 2 to 4 hours before transferring to an airtight container to store for up to 1 week.) 
	2. Pat the Canadian Beef Flank Steak dry with paper towel. Sprinkle with ½ tsp (2 mL) of the salt and all the pepper. Barbecue over medium-high heat, turning a least twice with tongs, to your desired level of doneness. The temperature for medium-rare is 145°F (63°C), 160°F (71°C) for medium, and 170°F (77°C) for well-done. Place steak on a cutting board; let stand 5 minutes. 
	3. Meanwhile, combine shallot, vinegar, oil and salt in a mini chopper; pulse until mixture is almost smooth. Set aside.
	 4. Pour half of the dressing over watercress in a large bowl; toss to coat. Arrange on serving plates; top each serving with onion and pear. Carve steak across the grain into thin slices. Top each serving with sliced steak, 1 cup (250 mL) reserved *croutons and goat cheese; drizzle each with remaining dressing.
Recipe Tips:
  - Learn more about over 70 cuts of beef with recipe how-to-videos and more at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
---
Recipe ID: 16af1053-d33a-498a-9b6b-8361f2b7d2d9
Recipe Title: Oven-Roasted Savoury Ground Beef Sliders
Recipe Summary: These lean mini burgers are oven baked for maximum juiciness and easy cooking.
Recipe Prep Time: 35
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 35
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 70
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 pkg (½ oz/14 g) dried porcini mushrooms
	- 1 cup (250 mL) boiling water
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- 4 cloves garlic (unpeeled)
	- 1½ lb (750 g)Extra Lean Ground Beef Sirloin  
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely chopped fresh tarragon
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) pepper
	- 24 dinner rolls or slider buns, split in half horizontally
	- Baby arugula leaves
	- 3 oz (90 g) soft goat cheese or crumbled feta cheese
	- 14 cherry tomatoes, sliced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 pkg (½ oz/14 g) dried porcini mushrooms
	- Olive oil
	- 4 cloves garlic (unpeeled)
	- 1½ lb (750 g)Extra Lean Ground Beef Sirloin    
	- Fresh tarragon
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- 24 dinner rolls or slider buns
	- Baby arugula leaves
	- Soft goat cheese or crumbled feta cheese
	- 14 cherry tomatoes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine porcini mushrooms with boiling water in a heatproof bowl; let stand for 20 minutes. Drain and rinse; chop finely and set aside.
	2. Heat oil over medium heat in small skillet. Add unpeeled garlic; cook, stirring often, for about 10 minutes or until softened and skins are golden. Remove from skillet; let cool slightly. Squeeze garlic out of skins into large bowl, mashing with back of spoon. 
	3. Add mushrooms, beef, tarragon, salt and pepper to garlic; gently combine with a fork (don’t over-mix). Shape into twenty-four ½-inch (1 cm) thick patties. Place on rack on parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet, spacing them apart.
	4. Bake in preheated 375°F oven, for about 25 minutes or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of several patties reads 160°F (71°C).
	5. Place patties on bottom half of each bun and top each with arugula, tomato slices, goat cheese and bun tops.
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Using a digital instant-read thermometer is the most reliable way to determine ground beef is cooked to the proper doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 1772028a-eeef-4023-844c-486d440f8989
Recipe Title: Braised Beef Kidney with Dijon Mustard and Vermouth
Recipe Summary: Serve this with crusty bread to mop up the sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 100
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 115
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 Beef Kidneys (about 1 lb/500 g each)
	- Salt
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry white vermouth
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced shallots
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whipping cream
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed fresh parsley leaves
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) smooth Dijon mustard
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
	- 6 drops hot pepper sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced chives or tops of green onion
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2  Beef Kidneys (about 1 lb/500 g each)
	- Salt
	- Dry white vermouth
	- Shallots
	- 1 clove garlic
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whipping cream
	- Packed fresh parsley leaves
	- Smooth Dijon mustard
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- 6 drops hot pepper sauce
	- Chives or tops of green onion
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut the beef kidneys in half lengthwise. Trim out any fat and membranes. Combine 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt and 4 cups (1 L) water in a medium pot. Add the kidneys and bring to a boil over high heat. Turn off the heat and let stand for 15 minutes. Drain and rinse under cool water, removing any scum. Clean out the pot and add 4 cups (1 L) fresh water. Return the kidneys and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for about 1 hour or until the kidney is tender. Drain and rinse. (Make ahead: The kidneys can be prepared up to 1 day in advance. Cover and refrigerate.)
	2. Combine vermouth, shallots and garlic in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Boil for 6 to 8 minutes or until the vermouth reduces to about ¾ cup (175 mL). Add the cream and boil for 3 to 4 minutes or until liquid is reduced to about 1½ cups (375 mL). 
	3. Meanwhile, cut the kidney into ¼-inch (5 mm) thick slices. 
	4. Transfer half of the cream mixture to a blender and add parsley. Blend until smooth and return to the pan. Reduce heat to low and stir in smooth and grainy mustards and hot pepper sauce. Stir in kidneys; simmer for 2 to 3 minutes or until heated. Stir in chives. Serve immediately. 
Recipe Tips:
  - The initial cooking tenderizes the kidney and makes it milder in flavour.
---
Recipe ID: 179e44e0-b3db-4393-be3a-22dd71a5fc8b
Recipe Title: Pan-Fried Beef Liver with Mixed Mushrooms and Pancetta
Recipe Summary: Liver is one of the most nutrient-dense foods on the planet – so much nourishment for so little investment. Liver can also be used in a wide variety of really delicious dishes, like this one featuring a creamy mushroom sauce and smoky Italian bacon. To avoid overcooking, remove liver from heat when it is still pink on the inside and slightly springy to the touch. Serve with steamed green beans and mashed potatoes. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) diced pancetta or thick-cut bacon
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced mixed mushrooms, such as button, cremini, oyster and shiitake 
	- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper, divided
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) whipping cream
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped fresh sage leaves
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 4 slices Beef or Veal Liver, ¼ inch (5 mm) thick (about 1 lb/500 g) 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter
	- Chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Pancetta or thick-cut bacon
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced mixed mushrooms, such as button, cremini, oyster and shiitake 
	- 1 small onion
	- Salt and pepper
	- Whipping cream
	- Fresh sage leaves
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- 4 slices Beef or Veal Liver, ¼ inch (5 mm) thick (about 1 lb/500 g) 
	- Butter
	- Chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Scatter pancetta in a large nonstick skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes or until crisp. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Set aside.  
	2. Add mushrooms and onion to skillet; sprinkle with half of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes or until tender and pan is almost dry. Stir in cream, sage, vinegar and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Transfer to a bowl; keep warm. 
	3. Pat liver dry with paper towel and season all over with remaining salt and pepper. Heat butter in the same skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook liver, turning as needed, for 4 to 5 minutes or until slightly pink in the center and still springy to touch. (Liver is best when cooked to medium doneness, at most.) Serve liver topped with mushrooms, crisp pancetta and parsley (if using) with mashed potatoes and green beans alongside. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Fresh liver should be dark red to maroon and glisten. To properly prepare the liver make sure to remove the thin membrane, arteries and veins.
---
Recipe ID: 1984d36a-8ab3-422c-a061-a0dfa8ff9612
Recipe Title: Foil-Wrapped Barbecue Braised Roast
Recipe Summary: Take the heat out of the kitchen with barbecue-braising. This recipe works using Simmering Steaks too, but cook them for only about an hour.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 165
Recipe Marinating Time: 720
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 895
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) barbecue sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH Worcestershire sauce and steak sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) red wine
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) ketchup
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Boneless Blade Pot Roast
	- 1 medium onion, cut lengthwise into wedges
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Steak sauce
	- Red wine
	- Ketchup
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Boneless Blade Pot Roast
	- 1 medium onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine barbecue sauce, Worcestershire Sauce, steak sauce, red wine and ketchup in large sealable freezer bag. Pierce beef all over with fork and add to bag, massaging to coat; seal and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours.
	2. Preheat barbecue to medium (350°F).
	3. Remove meat from marinade, reserving marinade. Place roast on double layer of heavy-duty foil; scatter onion and garlic over roast. Cover with second double layer of foil; seal edges tightly. Turn one burner off; place roast on grill over turned-off burner. Close lid and cook for 2½ to 3 hours or until meat is fork-tender. 
	4. Remove from grill, sliding foil packet onto baking sheet. Open packet and transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and keep warm.
	5. Pour cooking juices and onion mixture into medium saucepan; add reserved marinade and bring to boil over medium-high heat. Gradually stir in cornstarch mixture; boil stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Slice beef across the grain and serve drizzled with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - When buying a boneless beef pot roast, buy 6 to 8 oz (175 to 250 g) beef per person.
---
Recipe ID: 1a5ab64c-0c64-41be-a45a-22306cb2ec48
Recipe Title: Pan-Seared Steak with Berry Salad
Recipe Summary: More than just leafy greens, this salad recipe has substantial staying-power with the protein punch from the pan-seared steak. The steak can also be cooked on the barbecue as an option.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 23
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 73
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) vegetable oil
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) cider or white wine vinegar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) strawberry jam, warmed or mango chutney
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) liquid honey
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
	- 2 green onions, minced
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Hanger Grilling Steak 
	-  Strawberries
	- 12 large strawberries (see Tip below), quartered
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) vegetable oil (optional)
	- Granulated sugar (optional)
	-  Salad
	- 1 medium mango or peach, peeled and cut into wedges (optional)
	- 6 cups (1.5 L) mixed baby lettuce greens
	- 1 stalk celery, diced
	- ½ Spanish, sweet or red onion, diced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil
	- Cider or white wine vinegar
	- Strawberry jam, warmed or mango chutney
	- Liquid honey
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- 2 green onions
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Hanger Grilling Steak 
	- 12 large strawberries
	- Granulated sugar (optional)
	- 1 medium mango or peach (optional)
	- Mixed baby lettuce greens
	- 1 stalk celery
	- Spanish, sweet or red onion
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk together oil, vinegar, warmed jam, honey, mustard and green onions; season with salt and pepper to taste. Place half in sealable freezer bag; set aside remaining mixture for salad dressing.
	2. Pierce steak all over with a fork. Add steak to bag, massaging with marinade; seal and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes.
	3. Discard marinade from meat. Pat steak dry with paper towel and season lightly with salt to your taste. Heat a heavy cast-iron or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Lightly oil skillet and pan-fry steak for 18 to 22 minutes for 1½-inch (4 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	4. Strawberries: Meanwhile, if roasting strawberries, toss with oil on a parchment lined baking sheet. Sprinkle lightly with granulated sugar and roast in a preheated 350°F oven for 5 to 10 minutes or until fragrant and just starting to exude juice. Let cool before serving.
	5. Salad: Divide salad greens, berries, mango (if using), celery and diced onion among 4 plates. Carve steak across the grain into thin slices on the bias and arrange on top of each salad. Drizzle each with a portion of the reserved dressing.
Recipe Tips:
  - Roasting the strawberries brings out the flavour and is especially good for imported winter berries. If you’re using in-season strawberries, you can leave them fresh.
---
Recipe ID: 1bd52029-5bc2-4d0b-a5c1-7069393a826f
Recipe Title: Thai Curry Beef ‘Ramen’
Recipe Summary: Warm and rich Thai flavours come together in this take on a popular street food. Featuring slurp-worthy noodles and plenty of colourful vegetables, this recipe is a complete meal in a bowl.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tsp sesame or vegetable oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) extra lean ground beef
	- 3 tbsp Thai red curry paste
	- 2 red Thai chili peppers, seeded and finely chopped
	- 1 tbsp low-sodium soy sauce
	- 2 tsp EACH liquid honey, and minced ginger
	- 1 tsp minced garlic
	- 4 cups sodium-reduced chicken broth
	- 1 can (400 mL) coconut milk
	- 1 tbsp fresh lime juice
	- ½ tsp salt
	- 150 g whole-grain spaghettini
	- 4 baby bok choy, halved
	- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
	- 8 oz (250 g) button mushrooms, thinly sliced
	- 4 cups lightly packed baby spinach
	- 1 cup fresh basil leaves, torn
	- ¼ cup chopped roasted peanuts
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Sesame or vegetable oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) extra lean ground beef
	- Thai red curry paste
	- 2 red Thai chili peppers, seeded
	- Low-sodium soy sauce
	- Liquid honey
	- Ginger
	- Garlic
	- Sodium-reduced chicken broth
	- 1 can (400 mL) coconut milk
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Salt
	- 150 g whole-grain spaghettini
	- 4 baby bok choy
	- 1 red bell pepper
	- 8 oz (250 g) button mushrooms
	- 4 cups lightly packed baby spinach
	- 1 cup fresh basil leaves
	- ¼ cup chopped roasted peanuts
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil in a Dutch oven or large saucepan set over medium-high heat. Crumble in beef and cook, stirring often and breaking up with a spoon, for 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer beef to a plate using a slotted spoon; cover and set aside.
	2. Stir curry paste, chili peppers, soy sauce, honey, ginger and garlic into saucepan. Cook mixture for 1 to 2 minutes or until red colour deepens. Pour in broth, coconut milk and lime juice; stir in salt. Bring to a boil; add spaghettini and stir until submerged. Cover and reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until tender but still toothsome.
	3. Return beef to pan and stir to combine. Layer the bok choy, bell pepper, mushrooms and spinach over broth. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Toss to combine.
	4. Divide noodles and vegetables evenly among 4 wide serving bowls. Ladle broth over top. Garnish with basil and peanuts. Serve with lime wedges.
Recipe Tips:
  - For a gluten-free option, use brown rice or soba noodles instead of the spaghettini, and tamari instead of the soy sauce. Garnish with additional finely chopped red Thai chilies for those who like the heat.
---
Recipe ID: 1cfd1792-e3ca-45d8-a459-04d8343ba84f
Recipe Title: Persian Beef Kabobs Marinated with Pomegranate, Molasses and Walnut (Torsh Kabob)
Recipe Summary: Kabobs take pride of place among other meat dishes in Persian cuisine. There are many different kabob recipes from all over Iran and, of course, the middle east! Kabob is more of a family meal in Iran. It’s a dish that definitely gets served on special occasions, but more than that, kabob is a picnic food! Making kabob for picnics is something that every kid in Iran grows up with. My childhood memories are tied to the weekends that my mom was marinating kabob the night before the picnic and my dad cooking kabobs over charcoal grill in the park. Torsh kabob originates in the north of Iran. There is an herb for marinating this kabob and it’s specifically just grown in northern Iran called Chochagh. As I’m trying to adopt the recipes to where I live, I’m using other aromatic herbs instead. Kabobs are best cooked on a charcoal grill to get the smoky flavor but a gas barbecue is also fine. However, if you crave for kabob in winter and you live in a city with brutal winters, then a cast-iron pan is the best choice. Two best things to serve with kabob are lavash bread and/or saffron rice. There are many side dishes which go very well with kabob such as Mast-o Moosir (yogurt and Persian shallot dip), Torshi (pickled vegetables), Shirazi salad or fresh herbs.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 720
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 760
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Juice of ½ lemon
	- ½ cup (125 mL) walnuts
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH packed fresh cilantro leaves and parsley leaves
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed fresh mint leaves
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil (approx)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) golpar (Persian hogweed), optional
	- 2 Beef Rib Eye Steaks (about 1½ lb/750 g total)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) pomegranate molasses
	- Bamboo skewers
	- Green Thai chili peppers or other hot peppers
	- Cherry or small tomatoes on the vine
	- To Serve (as desired)
		- Lavash bread, Plain yogurt, Torshi (pickled vegetables)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lemon
	- Walnuts
	- Garlic
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Fresh parsley
	- Fresh mint
	- Green Thai chili peppers or other hot peppers
	- Cherry or small tomatoes on the vine
	- Lavash bread (optional)
	- 2 Beef Rib Eye Steaks (about 1½ lb/750 g total) 
	- Olive oil
	- Salt
	- Pepper 
	- Golpar (Persian hogweed), optional
	- 1 cup (250 mL) pomegranate molasses
	- Torshi (pickled vegetables), optional
	- Plain yogurt (optional)
	- Bamboo skewers
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine lemon juice, walnuts, garlic, cilantro, parsley, mint, 2 tbsp (30 mL) oil, salt, pepper and golpar (if using). Process until finely chopped and mixed together, stopping and scraping down the sides of the bowl once or twice. Transfer to a large bowl, add pomegranate molasses and stir to make a paste. Set aside.
	2. Cut beef into 1½-inch (4 cm) cubes and add to paste in a bowl; stir until the beef is well coated. Cover and refrigerate for 12 hours. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	3. Remove beef from marinade; discard marinade. Thread beef onto the soaked skewers, about 4 to 5 pieces per skewer. Pat dry with paper towel. Set aside.
	4. Heat a cast-iron skillet over a medium-high heat until very hot. Thread the chilies onto a soaked skewer. Cook the chilies and tomatoes for 3 to 4 minutes, turning the chili skewer, until you get a nice char. Transfer to a serving platter.
	5. Return skillet to medium-high heat, adding a splash of oil, if necessary. Cook beef skewers, in batches as necessary, for about 6 to 8 minutes, turning to char beef all over, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted in the beef reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Add to the platter.
	6. Serves the Torsh kabob, chilies and charred tomatoes with lavash bread, plain yogurt and/or Torshi (pickled vegetables), as desired.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 1da07ee9-11b5-4119-ad0c-4ca009dad5c2
Recipe Title: Pan-Seared Skirt Steak with Mushrooms and Spaetzle  
Recipe Summary: This recipe highlights two things for me: first is the spaetzle simmered in a mushroomy, buttery, brothy reduction, taught to me by my first chef, the Alsatian Olivier Muller — what a delicious combination. Second is the incredible flavour and texture you can find in Canadian Beef, especially using outside skirt steak — one of my favourite cuts. Outside skirt steak is thicker than inside skirt. It’s technically a tougher cut, but when sliced across the grain it becomes more tender and it is ideal for one-pot dishes like this one or a stir-fry. Alternatively, you could use blade steak or shoulder-end rib eye which are also very flavourful, tougher cuts. This recipe was adapted from Chef Heinrich’s original and modified to cook at home.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 7 oz (210 g) Beef Outside Skirt Marinating Steak
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) canola or sunflower oil
	- ⅓ cup + 1 tsp (80 mL) unsalted butter, cut into cubes
	- 2 cloves garlic, lightly smashed
	- 1 sprig EACH fresh rosemary and thyme
	- 2½ oz (75 g) cremini mushrooms, sliced
	- 2½ oz (75 g) shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, caps sliced
	- 1 small shallot, minced
	- 6 tbsp + 2 tsp (100 mL) dry white wine
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) concentrated beef broth (see Tip*)
	- 1⅓ oz (40 g) trimmed kale, cut into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces
	- 14 oz (400 g) cooked spaetzle (see Tip**) 
	- Chopped fresh chives
	- White truffle oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Fresh thyme
	- 2½ oz (75 g) cremini mushrooms
	- 2½ oz (75 g) shiitake mushrooms
	- 1 small shallot
	- Kale
	- Fresh chives
	- 7 oz (210 g) Beef Outside Skirt Marinating Steak
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- White truffle oil
	- Concentrated beef broth (see Tip*)
	- Salt 
	- Pepper
	- Cooked spaetzle or dry broad German egg noodles (see Tip**)
	- Unsalted butter
	- Dry white wine
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut steak across the grain into pieces about 3 inches (7.5 cm) long and ½ inch (1 cm) thick. Pat dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Set aside.
	2. Heat a large sauté pan or deep skillet over high heat; add oil and swirl to cook. Add steak pieces, cut side down. Reduce heat to medium-high and cook steak until well caramelized on the bottom. Flip over and add 2 cubes of the butter, the garlic, rosemary and thyme. Cook, continuously spooning the butter over beef, until beef is cooked to desired doneness. Transfer beef, herbs and garlic to a plate using tongs and leaving butter in pan; set aside.
	3. Return pan to high heat. Add cremini and shiitake mushrooms; cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until golden. Reduce heat to medium and add shallots. Cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Pour in wine and boil, scraping up brown bits stuck to pan, until liquid is almost evaporated. Pour in beef broth, ¾ cup (175 mL) water and kale; bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes.
	4. Meanwhile, strip rosemary and thyme leaves from stems; discard stems. Finely chop herbs and garlic; add to pan along with any accumulated juices from beef. Stir in spaetzle and remaining butter cubes; cook, stirring gently, until butter is melted. Adjust sauce consistency as desired by simmering to reduce or adding more water to thin. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
	5. Spoon spaetzle, mushrooms and sauce into serving bowls, top with beef and garnish with chives and a light drizzle of truffle oil.
Recipe Tips:
  - *The concentrated broth is convenient alternative to Chef Heinrich’s homemade beef jus and is available in cartons in the soup aisle at the grocery store. If you don’t have concentrated broth, use 1 cup (250 mL) no-salt-added beef broth and reduce water to ¼ cup (60 mL) in step 3.
  - **Prepare your favourite spaetzle recipe to use for serving, or substitute about 7 oz (210 g) dry broad German egg noodles; cook according to package directions before serving.
---
Recipe ID: 1dc9e98a-8d99-4c1d-ac5b-da3fa87911bb
Recipe Title: Grilled Balsamic and Beer Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: This delicious beef steak recipe can be enjoyed served with grilled vegetables or it can be sliced thinly, tossing slices with greens to make a main-dish salad, using the hot marinade sauce as the dressing.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 505
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 small onion, finely chopped
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) beer (ale or lager) or sherry
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) ketchup
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) grainy or Dijon mustard
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chili powder
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper 
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Flank Marinating Steak
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 small onion
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Beer (ale or lager) or sherry
	- Ketchup
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Grainy or Dijon mustard
	- Chili powder
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Flank Marinating Steak
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine onion, garlic, beer, ketchup, vinegar, mustard, chili powder, salt and pepper in large sealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with a fork; add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Remove meat from marinade and reserve marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel.
	3. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	4. Meanwhile, bring marinade to boil over high heat in a small saucepan; boil for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. 
	5. Slice steak thinly across the grain on a 45-degree angle and serve with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Carve Marinating Steaks across the grain to maximize tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: 1ea12e08-5f29-47b1-965e-81f137fd9e7d
Recipe Title: Barbecued Foil-Wrapped Tangy Marinated Beef Roast
Recipe Summary: Barbecue-braising is a novel way to have pot roast in the summer while you take the heat out of the kitchen: foil-wrapped pot roast simmers in its own juices while it cooks. Serve with the sauce you make from the marinade, baked potatoes, fresh corn on the cob and garden-fresh salads for a super relaxed summer dinner that you get to sit and enjoy rather than tending the grill.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 165
Recipe Marinating Time: 720
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 895
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) barbecue sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH Worcestershire sauce and steak sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) red wine
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) ketchup
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Cross Rib Pot Roast
	- 1 medium onion, cut lengthwise into wedges
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Steak sauce
	- Red wine
	- Ketchup
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Cross Rib Pot Roast
	- 1 medium onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine barbecue sauce, Worcestershire Sauce, steak sauce, red wine and ketchup in large sealable freezer bag. Pierce beef all over with fork and add to bag, massaging to coat; seal and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours.
	2. Preheat barbecue to medium (350°F).
	3. Remove meat from marinade, reserving marinade. Place roast on double layer of heavy-duty foil; scatter onion and garlic over roast. Cover with second double layer of foil; seal edges tightly. Turn one burner off; place roast on grill over turned-off burner. Close lid and cook for 2½ to 3 hours or until meat is fork-tender. 
	4. Remove from grill, sliding foil packet onto baking sheet. Open packet and transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and keep warm.
	5. Pour cooking juices and onion mixture into medium saucepan; add reserved marinade and bring to boil over medium-high heat. Gradually stir in cornstarch mixture; boil stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Slice beef across the grain and serve drizzled with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - When buying a boneless beef pot roast, buy 6 to 8 oz (175 to 250 g) beef per person.
---
Recipe ID: 1eeaccd2-6044-4a5c-b35c-557c11ff30e6
Recipe Title: Grilled Marinated Beef Fajitas
Recipe Summary: For serving ease of this recipe, set out a variety of toppings and wraps and let each person build their own beef wrap. Slicing steak into strips and cooking in the grill basket helps to keep the heat out of the kitchen in the summer season.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 260
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 lime
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) orange juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) soy sauce
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced or 1 tsp (5 mL) garlic powder
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) mild or medium chutney (such as mango)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground cumin
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Steak, cut thin in strips
	- 4 large whole wheat flour tortillas or flavoured wraps
	- 1 large sweet red pepper, cut into strips
	- 4 green onions, trimmed
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil (optional)
	- Fresh cilantro leaves (optional) 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lime
	- Orange juice
	- Soy sauce
	- 2 cloves garlic or 1 tsp (5 mL) garlic powder
	- Mild or medium chutney (such as mango)
	- Ground cumin
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Steak, cut thin in strips
	- 4 large whole wheat flour tortillas or flavoured wraps
	- 1 large sweet red pepper, cut into strips
	- 4 green onions
	- Vegetable oil (optional)
	- Fresh cilantro leaves (optional) 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine lime zest and juice, orange juice, soy sauce, garlic, chutney and cumin in a shallow dish. Add beef strips, turning to coat; cover and refrigerate for 4 to 12 hours.
	2. Grill red pepper and green onions in a closed preheated barbecue over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes, turning once, or until grill marked and tender. Transfer to a cutting board and set aside. Increase grill to medium-high heat.
	3. Grill tortillas, for about 1 minute per side, turning once, or until grill marked. Wrap tortillas in foil and set aside. Increase grill to high heat (if using for beef).
	4. Discard marinade from meat; pat beef dry with paper towel. Heat a grill basket on barbecue. Add beef to basket and stir-fry on barbecue for 2 to 3 minutes or until browned. Alternatively, heat oil in a large nonstick skillet; add beef strips and cook for about 1 minute per side or until browned. Transfer to a plate.
	5. Top warmed tortillas with beef strips, grilled peppers and green onions and fresh cilantro (if using); fold up to eat.
Recipe Tips:
  - For best browning and flavour, pat beef strips dry with paper towels before grilling or pan frying.
---
Recipe ID: 1f661409-f57a-45c3-873d-18d1651a7492
Recipe Title: Persian Tiny Meatballs (Koofteh Rizeh)
Recipe Summary: Koofteh is a Persian term for meatballs and Rizeh in Farsi means mini and tiny. There are many recipes for koofteh (also called kofta) in Middle Eastern cuisines. In Iran there are various recipes from different regions with most of them being from Azarbaijan province. There are many tips and tricks for making any kind of koofteh and usually grandmas are the experts. All koofteh recipes have one ingredient in common which is ground beef though the rest of ingredients may change. Some recipes have cooked rice, others yellow split peas and some might have chopped fresh herbs. Almost all of the koofteh recipes are finished by simmering in tomato sauce. Fried potatoes and tomatoes are here to bring extra flavors and texture to this recipe. This dish is commonly served with bread such as lavash or barbari. Torshi (pickled vegetables) and fresh herbs also pair beautifully with koofteh.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 90
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅔ cup (150 mL) yellow split peas
	- 3 small white potatoes
	- 1 large onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH fresh ground pepper and turmeric 
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- 4 tbsp (60 mL) olive oil, divided (approx)
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) tomato paste
	- Boiling water
	- 8 oz (250 g) cherry tomatoes on the vine (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 small white potatoes
	- 1 large onion
	- Garlic
	- 8 oz (250 g) cherry tomatoes on the vine (optional)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Olive oil, divided
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Ground turmeric 
	- Yellow split peas
	- Tomato paste
Recipe Methods:
	1. Fill a medium saucepan half-full with water and bring to a boil over high heat. Add split peas, reduce heat and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside to cool completely.
	2. Meanwhile, fill a medium bowl half-full with cold water. Peel potatoes and cut into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes. Add to water and set aside for at least 15 minutes to release the starch from potatoes.
	3. Cut onion in half. Finely dice one half and coarsely chop the other half. Set aside separately.
	4. Combine split peas, coarsely chopped onions, garlic, salt, pepper and turmeric in a food processor. Blend well for 1 to 2 minutes or until smooth. Scrape into a large bowl.
	5. Add ground beef to the split pea mixture and use your hands to mix everything together for 1 to 2 minutes, ensuring it is well mixed. Scoop beef mixture into 1½-inch (4 cm) meatballs, rolling between hands to make sure they are round.
	6. Heat 1½ tsp (7 mL) of the oil over medium-high heat in a heavy enamelled cast-iron pan or deep nonstick skillet. Fry meatballs, in batches, turning until golden brown all over. Transfer to a bowl.
	7. Add diced onions to pan and cook, stirring, for about 3 minutes or until translucent. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, for about 1 minute. Return meatballs and accumulated juices to the pot. Add about 2 to 3 cups (500 to 750 mL) boiling water to fill the pot enough to come halfway up the meatballs. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or until the sauce is thick and a digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several meatballs reads 160°F (71°C).
	8. Meanwhile, drain potatoes and pat dry with a paper towel. Add 3 tbsp (45 mL) oil to another heavy saucepan or skillet. Add potatoes and fry over medium-low heat, stirring often, for about 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown and tender. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
	9. If garnishing with the vine tomatoes, return the pan to medium heat. Add remaining 1½ tsp (7 mL) oil to the pan. Cook tomatoes, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until blistered and slightly softened. Remove from heat.
	10. Spoon potatoes and meatballs onto a platter or serving plate. Drizzle meatballs with tomato sauce and garnish the platter with the blistered tomatoes (if using).
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 1fe7b14a-4ee2-45f0-b8d9-fa5413904151
Recipe Title: Barbecue-Roasted Steak with Tuscan-Inspired Rub
Recipe Summary: Flavoured with rosemary, garlic and good-quality olive oil, this simple Tuscan-style grilled steak is inspired by the classic Florentine recipe. Bistecca alla Fiorentina is traditionally prepared with a T-bone steak; here we’re using a Frenched Rib Steak (similar to a Tomahawk-style) which makes for a stunning presentation at your dinner table. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 48
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 63
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Frenched Rib Steak, 1-bone thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 clove garlic, minced 
	- Post-sear Rub
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) good-quality extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated lemon zest
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) anchovy paste
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes 
	- Coarse salt and cracked pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Frenched Rib Steak, 1-bone thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- Vegetable oil
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Fresh parsley
	- Good-quality extra virgin olive oil
	- Lemon
	- Anchovy paste
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Coarse salt and cracked pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Fill drip pan part way with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). 
	2. Meanwhile, pat teak dry with paper towel. Combine oil, rosemary, salt, pepper and garlic in a small bowl. Rub mixture all over steak. 
	3. Place steak on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Insert an oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into centre of steak, avoiding fat or bone. Close lid and cook for about 40 to 50 minutes, or until the thermometer reads 120°F (49°C).
	4. Post-sear Rub: Meanwhile, combine parsley, oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, anchovy paste, garlic and hot pepper flakes in a small bowl. Drizzle half over a large cutting board; set board and remaining oil mixture aside.
	 5. Move steak to grill that is over the burner that is turned on. Cook for 8 to 12 minutes, turning once, for medium-rare until evenly browned on both sides, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	 6. Transfer steak to reserved cutting board, turning twice or more to coat with herb mixture. Cover loosely with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	 7. Carve meat from the bone, then into thin slices. Arrange steak on a large platter with the bone. Drizzle remaining herb mixture over sliced steak. Sprinkle with coarse salt and cracked pepper.
Recipe Tips:
  - Wrap the bone in foil prior to grilling for a cleaner presentation if desired. A Frenched Rib Steak is similar to a Tomahawk-style Steak that is cut 1-bone thick with an exposed bone. For the Frenched Rib Steak, the bone is cleaned or “Frenched” and about 4 inches (10 cm) long.
---
Recipe ID: 209a9fc6-aab9-4582-8a90-e37453741743
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Basil Pistou
Recipe Summary: Serve grilled beef steaks with boiled new potatoes. Pistou is the French version of Italian pesto sauce. Serve with boiled new potatoes and steamed vegetables
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 cup (250 mL) packed fresh basil leaves (about two 28-g packages)
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) freshly grated Parmesan cheese
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) tomato paste
	- 3 tbsp (45mL) olive oil
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 2 T-Bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
	- 1 lemon, cut in half crosswise (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Packed fresh basil leaves (about two 28-g packages)
	- Freshly grated Parmesan cheese
	- Tomato paste
	- Olive oil
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 2 T-Bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
	- 1 lemon (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Chop garlic and basil in mini chopper or tall cup using an immersion blender, pulsing 10 to 20 times. Add Parmesan and tomato paste and pulse about 10 times or until blended. Add 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the oil and purée until blended; add enough of the remaining oil until desired consistency. If you prefer a thinner sauce, add a little water. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
	2. Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat, turning at least twice, for about 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Meanwhile, if desired, grill lemon halves, cut-side down, for about 4 minutes or until browned. 
	3. Transfer steaks to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Brush steaks with some of the pistou. Slice across the grain and serve with grilled lemons (if using) and pistou on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to let steaks rest for about 5 minutes after cooking so that the juices get the chance to settle before you serve or slice.
---
Recipe ID: 20c4409f-d716-4372-b314-9b8bbebfe685
Recipe Title: Grilled Asian-Marinated Steak with Mango Salad
Recipe Summary: This recipe features a unique combination of flavours—ginger flavoured beef steak with the fresh tart flavours of the mango. This makes a great warm main course salad.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 6
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 56
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH soy sauce and vegetable oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) wine vinegar
	- 2 green onions, minced
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced gingerroot
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) granulated sugar
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sesame oil
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Porterhouse Grilling Steak,½ to ¾ inch (1 to 2 cm) thick 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	-  Salad 
	- 1 mango, peeled and diced
	- 1 tomato, seeded and diced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) diced red onion
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) minced fresh cilantro
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lime juice
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 large Belgian endive
	- 6 cups (1.5 L) mixed baby greens
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Soy sauce
	- Vegetable oil
	- Wine vinegar
	- 2 green onions
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- Granulated sugar
	- Sesame oil
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Porterhouse Grilling Steak,½ to ¾ inch (1 to 2 cm) thick 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 mango
	- 1 tomato, seeded
	- Red onion
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 large Belgian endive
	- 6 cups (1.5 L) mixed baby greens
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, oil, vinegar, onions, garlic, gingerroot, sugar and sesame oil in small bowl. Place half of the marinade in large sealable freezer bag, reserving remainder for dressing. Add steak to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 30 minutes or up to 2 hours, turning occasionally.
	2. Remove steak from marinade; discard marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper to your taste.
	3. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ to ¾ inch (1 to 2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	4. Salad: Combine mango, tomato, red onion, cilantro and lime juice in a medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste; set aside. Cut endive crosswise into ½ inch (1 cm) slices to separate out the leaves. Add to mixed greens in a large bowl and toss with reserved dressing.
	5. Divide greens among 4 dinner plates. Carve steak across the grain into thin slices; layer steak slices on top of the dressed salad greens. Top each salad with mango mixture.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak, avoiding fat and bone, for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 214a1c34-bff0-4cf0-93b9-4cff945bd61c
Recipe Title: Pizzaiola with Mushrooms and Gnocchi
Recipe Summary: This tomato sauce typically made with classic Italian ingredients like olive oil, garlic, oregano, garlic and wine is the perfect flavour combination to simmer beef in. My version has some fa-vourite southern Italian ingredients that my family loves like mushrooms, black olives and gnocchi to make it a whole meal quick enough for a weeknight dinner, Italian style. 
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Fast-Fry Steaks
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms, thinly sliced 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) diced onion
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) San Marzano tomatoes with basil leaf
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) dry red wine
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried oregano leaves
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) black olives, preferably sun-dried, pitted
	- 1 pkg (500 g) gnocchi
	- Freshly grated Parmesan (optional) 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Fast-Fry Steaks
	- Salt and pepper
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Butter
	- 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms, thinly sliced 
	- 1 onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) San Marzano tomatoes with basil leaf
	- Dry red wine
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Black olives, preferably sun-dried, pitted
	- 1 pkg (500 g) gnocchi
	- Freshly grated Parmesan  
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place steaks on a cutting board in a single layer. Pierce the steaks all over with a fork. Cut crosswise into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces and toss with salt and pepper. 
	2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Cook beef strips for about 1 minute per side or until browned but still pink inside. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
	3. Return skillet to medium-high heat and add butter. Add mushrooms, onion and garlic; cook, stirring, for 8 minutes or until mushrooms start to brown. Reduce heat to medium.
	4. Cut tomatoes in the can with scissors or crush with your hand one by one while adding to skillet; pour in juices from the can. Add wine and oregano; bring to a simmer. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until starting to thicken. Return beef and accumulated juices to skillet; stir in olives. Simmer for about 5 minutes or until heated through.
	5. Meanwhile, cook gnocchi in a pot of boiling salted water for about 5 minutes or according to package directions, until al dente. 
	6. Lift gnocchi out with small sieve or slotted spoon and add to sauce. Toss to coat. Serve sprinkled with Parmesan, if desired. 
Recipe Tips:
  - You can substitute any fast-fry steaks for the Sirloin Tip. If they are thicker than ¼ inch (5 mm) you can pound them with a meat mallet before piercing them with the fork. You can use shelf-stable, fresh or frozen gnocchi for this recipe. Do check the package directions for the recommended cooking time. This sauce is usually made as a slow simmer to help tenderize beef cuts which can lengthen dinner preparation time; by using these quick fast-fry steaks you get the fresh flavour of the tomato sauce and tender beef that comes together in under an hour.
---
Recipe ID: 2170df6d-6792-4f29-a649-4a4e67f3f53b
Recipe Title: Thai-Style Pan-Fried Beef Heart Salad
Recipe Summary: Use the lettuce leaves for wrapping up spoonfuls of the salad. Serve with a side of cooked jasmine rice.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 2
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 27
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) piece Beef Heart 
	- Salt
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fish sauce
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) granulated sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely minced lemongrass
	- 1 cup (250 mL) loosely packed mint leaves, coarsely chopped
	- 1 cup (250 mL) loosely packed cilantro, leaves and tender stems, coarsely chopped
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 1 Thai chili, thinly sliced (approx)
	- Leaf or butter lettuce leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) piece  Beef Heart 
	- Salt
	- Vegetable oil
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Fish sauce
	- Granulated sugar
	- Lemongrass
	- 1 cup (250 mL) loosely packed mint leaves
	- 1 cup (250 mL) loosely packed cilantro, leaves and tender stems
	- 2 green onions
	- 1 Thai chili (approx)
	- Leaf or butter lettuce leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rinse heart under cold water. Trim off fat, membranes and any fibrous tissue from the heart. Cut into ¼-inch (5 mm) thick slices and season all over with salt to your taste.
	2. Heat oil over high heat in a large skillet. Add the heart slices and sear for about 45 seconds on each side or until medium-rare (145°F/63°C) at the most. Transfer to a plate and let cool slightly. Dice the heart into 1/8-inch (3 mm) pieces and transfer to a bowl.
	3. Add lime juice, fish sauce and sugar to heart, tossing to coat. Add lemongrass, mint, cilantro and green onion. Add sliced chili, to taste. Mix again and serve immediately with lettuce leaves. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Heart is a very lean and muscular meat. It’s best cooked to medium-rare at the most to keep it tender.
---
Recipe ID: 21ad0fd0-7cd0-433d-967a-a19952adbcb7
Recipe Title: Cocktail Hour Grilled Beef Burgers
Recipe Summary: A burger inspired by a Canadian-favourite cocktail? This one is sure to make summer barbecues even more fun and delicious! Using pre-made Ground Beef Patties is quick and convenient, leaving you more time to enjoy the fun. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Patties
	- 4 hamburger buns, split
	- 4 EACH cornichon pickles and pickled cocktail onions
	- ½ cup (125 mL) Sriracha mayonnaise
	- 4 large cherry tomatoes, sliced
	- Caesar rimmer seasoning or celery salt
	- Hot pepper sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Patties
	- 4 hamburger buns, split
	- 4 cornichon pickles
	- 4 Pickled cocktail onions
	- Sriracha mayonnaise
	- 4 large cherry tomatoes
	- Caesar rimmer seasoning or celery salt
	- Hot pepper sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Grill patties on a lightly oiled grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 10 to 14 minutes for ¾-inch (2 cm) thick patties, turning twice or more, or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each patty reads 160°F (71°C).
	2. Meanwhile, toast hamburger buns. Thread 1 pickle and 1 cocktail onion onto each of 4 toothpicks.
	3. Place each patty on a toasted bun. Spread each with Sriracha mayo and top with tomato slices. Sprinkle with Caesar seasoning and hot pepper sauce to taste. Sandwich with bun tops and push garnish toothpick into top of each burger.
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Use a digital instant-read thermometer as the most reliable way to determine that ground beef patties are cooked to the proper doneness.
