Recipe ID: 2217159f-d428-4785-ac87-038ae5c5a83c
Recipe Title: Jamaican Jerk Steak with Grilled Pineapple Salsa
Recipe Summary: Wing Steaks have the big beefy flavour that holds up to Jerk seasoning on the grill. Also known as Bone-in Strip Loin Grilling Steaks, you can also substitute with traditional boneless Strip Loin Steaks if you can’t find the bone-in version. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) dry Jerk seasoning (no salt added)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ cup (125 mL) diced sweet red pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 2 green onions, finely chopped 
	- 5 fresh pineapple rings, each about ½ inch (1 cm) thick
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Wing Steaks, ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 2)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Dry Jerk seasoning (no salt added)
	- Salt
	- Sweet red pepper
	- Fresh lime juice
	- 2 green onions
	- Fresh pineapple
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Wing Steaks, ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 2)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine Jerk seasoning with salt in a small bowl. Stir 1 tsp (5 mL) of this seasoning mixture with red pepper, lime juice and green onions in a small bowl; set aside. 
	2. Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season all over with remaining seasoning mixture. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	3. Meanwhile, grill pineapple for 4 to 6 minutes, turning once, or until well-marked and lightly caramelized; let cool slightly. Chop pineapple and stir into red pepper mixture to make a pineapple salsa. 
	4. Carve steaks off the bone and cut into thin slices across the grain. Serve sliced steak on a platter along with the bones with pineapple salsa alongside. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Look for a dry Jerk seasoning and check the ingredients to be sure there is no salt added. It can be found in the spice section or the international section of well-stocked supermarket. For a fiery salsa, add up to 1 minced Scotch bonnet pepper to the salsa.
---
Recipe ID: 222f416b-c27b-4942-ba5e-d58acb7a4bd5
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak Oscar
Recipe Summary: Go upscale with this take on a classic steak and seafood dish made mainly with pantry ingredients. You can add even more flavour by seasoning the meat with your favourite steak spice.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 oz (250 g) fresh or thawed shelled raw shrimp (or shrimp and scallop mix)
	- 8 spears fresh or frozen asparagus, cut into 3-inch (7.5 cm) pieces
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef T-bone Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1)
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 2/3 cup (150 mL) whipping cream
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) honey
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) hot pepper sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) dried parsley or tarragon
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) grated Parmesan cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 8 oz (250 g) fresh or thawed shelled raw shrimp (or shrimp and scallop mix)
	- 8 spears fresh or frozen asparagus
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef T-bone Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1)
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Whipping cream
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Honey
	- Hot pepper sauce
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Dried parsley or tarragon
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook shrimp and asparagus in large saucepan of boiling, salted water over high heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until shrimp are pink and asparagus is bright green. Drain and set aside.
	2. Pat steak dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat, turning at least twice, 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks cooked to medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	3. Meanwhile, heat oil over medium-high heat in a skillet. Sauté garlic for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Stir in cream, mustard, honey, hot sauce, lemon juice and parsley; bring to a boil, stirring. Reduce heat to boil, stirring, for 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Add cheese, cooked seafood and asparagus; stir to coat and heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat.
	4. Slice steak across the grain and spoon seafood, asparagus and sauce over top to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Seasoning steak prior to grilling enhances the flavour better than if you season the steaks after grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 224850bb-f873-4a58-8472-5ca77ef7ed5f
Recipe Title: Barbecued Herb and Mustard-Crusted Roast Beef with Apple Salsa
Recipe Summary: The savoury herb and mustard crust on a juicy Top Sirloin Oven Roast, cooked to perfection over indirect heat on the barbecue. Use a meat thermometer to cook your roast to the doneness that you like the best – without overcooking it! NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) grainy or plain Dijon mustard
	- 3 large cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) Worcestershire sauce 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dried oregano, thyme and rosemary, crushed (or 1 tbsp/15 mL each chopped fresh)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast
	- Apple Onion Salsa (optional)
		- 1 large tart apple, such as McIntosh, diced
		- 1 plum (Roma) tomato, seeded and diced
		- ⅓ cup (75 mL) chopped green onions
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH apple cider vinegar and chopped fresh cilantro or parsley
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) prepared horseradish
		- 3 to 4 tsp (15 to 20 mL) minced fresh or pickled jalapeño peppers
		- 1 clove garlic, minced
		- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Grainy or plain Dijon mustard
	- 3 large cloves garlic
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Dried oregano
	- Dried thyme
	- Dried rosemary
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast
	- 1 large tart apple, such as McIntosh
	- 1 plum (Roma) tomato, seeded
	- Green onions
	- Apple cider vinegar
	- Chopped fresh cilantro or parsley
	- Prepared horseradish
	- Fresh or pickled jalapeño peppers
	- 1 clove garlic
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine mustard, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, thyme, rosemary and pepper to make a thick, spreadable paste. Spread all over roast.
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	 3. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 40 to 50 minutes for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: see ‘ESTIMATED COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	Apple Onion Salsa (if using): : 
		4. Meanwhile, combine apple, tomato, green onions, vinegar, cilantro, horseradish, jalapeños, to taste, and garlic in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix well and let stand for 30 minutes. Taste and season before serving.
		 5. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Slice thinly across the grain. Serve with Apple Onion Salsa, if desired. 
Recipe Tips:
  - To serve roast beef, carve across the grain into thin slices to optimize tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: 228e8f26-7664-430d-86cb-a39621b7a724
Recipe Title: Classic Roast Beef Wellington with Mushroom Madeira Sauce
Recipe Summary: Beef Wellington is a true show-stopper to bring to the table! Use your sharpest knife for the carving and let the crust crumbs fall as they may. Amazing and not that difficult to make if you just tackle one component at a time. 
Recipe Prep Time: 45
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 105
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2½ lb (1.25 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut, trimmed, about 4-inches (10 cm) in diameter
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- Coarsely ground salt and pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter, divided
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 shallots, thinly sliced
	- 1 green onion, thinly sliced
	- 2 cups (500 mL) finely chopped mushrooms
	- 2½ oz (75 g) chicken or duck liver pâté, thinly sliced
	- 1 pkg (397 g) frozen puff pastry dough, thawed
	- All-purpose flour
	- 1 egg, beaten
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth
	- ⅔ cup (150 mL) Madeira
	- Whipping cream
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tsp (5 mL) cold water (optional)
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2½ lb (1.25 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut, trimmed, about 4-inches (10 cm) in diameter
	- Olive oil
	- Coarsely ground salt and pepper
	- Butter
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 shallots
	- 1 green onion
	- 2 cups (500 mL) finely chopped mushrooms
	- 2½ oz (75 g) chicken or duck liver pâté
	- 1 pkg (397 g) frozen puff pastry dough
	- All-purpose flour
	- 1 egg
	- Beef broth
	- Madeira
	- Whipping cream
	- Cornstarch (optional)
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. If roast is tied, remove twine. Rub all over with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the butter with the vegetable oil over medium-high heat in heavy skillet; brown meat for about 8 minutes, turning to brown on all sides. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
	2. Melt remaining butter in same skillet. Add shallots and onion; cook, stirring, for about 1 minute or until softened. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 to 10 minutes or until liquid has evaporated and mushrooms start to brown. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer mushroom mixture to a bowl and set pan aside to use for Madeira Mushroom Sauce.
	3. Pat reserved tenderloin dry with paper towel; top with pâté slices and mushroom mixture, pressing mixture onto tenderloin to hold. Set aside. Line rimmed baking sheet with foil or parchment paper; spray lightly with non-stick spray. Set aside.
	4. Roll out the puff pastry dough on lightly floured surface (if your pastry is a block, place the smooth side up before you roll), into a 13 x 12-inch (32 x 30 cm) rectangle, rolling over the seam to hold the 2 squares together. Place over tenderloin and tuck dough around the sides and ends. Gently turn over, wrapping dough around underside and ends of tenderloin to fully enclose; brush some beaten egg along edges of seams where dough overlaps, pressing gently to seal.
	5. Place Beef Wellington seam side down onto baking sheet. Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes or up to 1 hour. (If refrigerated 1 hour, let the Wellington sit at room temperature 30 minutes before baking.)
	 6. Adjust oven rack to lowest position and preheat oven to 450°F (230°C) oven. (NOTE: The Beef Wellington is roasted on the lowest rack of a very hot oven to help create a crispy crust.) Cut 3 slits across the top of pastry to allow steam to escape while baking; brush all over with beaten egg.
	 7. Bake Wellington until golden brown (shielding with loose cover of aluminum foil if getting to brown), and digital instant-read thermometer inserted into centre of roast reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness, about 35 minutes.
	8. Madeira Mushroom Sauce: Meanwhile, place reserved skillet over medium-high heat; add beef broth and bring to a boil, stirring up brown bits from bottom of pan. Boil for 15 to 20 minutes to reduce to about 1⅔ cups (400 mL). Stir in Madeira and continue to boil for about 5 minutes or until liquid is reduced again to 1⅔ cups (400 mL). Stir in a generous splash of whipping cream to taste. If desired, thicken sauce by stirring in cornstarch mixture; cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes until slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour onto gravy boat to serve.
	9. Remove Beef Wellington from oven and let rest for 10 minutes; transfer to carving platter. Carve into thick slices and serve with Madeira Mushroom Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - If you buy puff pastry in pre-rolled sheets, stack the 2 sheets and pinch around edges to squeeze the sheets together making sure there are no air bubble between the sheets. Roll out to the rectangle as directed in the recipe. The package sizes may range between 397 g and 500 g and any of these will work for this recipe.
---
Recipe ID: 230e542f-8804-4876-b228-55b6d84c59fa
Recipe Title: Grilled Pineapple-Glazed Marinated Miami-Style Beef
Recipe Summary: A sticky Hawaiian-style glaze gives these thin-cut beef ribs a spicy-sweet flavour in this recipe. Serve grilled pineapple slices and colourful, crunchy coleslaw on the side.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 525
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cups (500 mL) unsweetened pineapple juice
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) soy sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 cloves garlic, sliced
	- 1-inch (2.5 cm) piece gingerroot, peeled and thinly sliced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) dried thyme
	- Pinch hot pepper flakes
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Miami/Korean-cut Bone-in Short Ribs, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick
	- Pineapple slices (optional)
	- Green onions, sliced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 cups (500 mL) unsweetened pineapple juice
	- Soy sauce
	- Packed brown sugar
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1-inch (2.5 cm) piece gingerroot
	- Dried thyme
	- Pinch hot pepper flakes
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Miami/Korean-cut Bone-in Short Ribs, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick
	- Pineapple slices (optional)
	- Green onions
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine pineapple juice, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, ginger, thyme and hot pepper flakes in large sealable freezer bag. Pierce rib meat all over with a fork. Add to marinade, turning to coat; seal bag, place on plate and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or up to 24 hours. 
	2. Remove ribs from marinade, reserving marinade. Set ribs aside. Bring marinade to boil in medium saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium; boil for 15 to 20 minutes or until reduced to about 1 cup (250 mL).
	3. Grill ribs over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue, for 6 to 10 minutes, turning often and basting with reduced marinade, until browned and tender. If desired, grill pineapple slices alongside, for 2 to 3 minutes per side. Serve ribs sprinkled with green onions and grilled pineapple on the side, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - When cut into thin slices across the bone, short ribs can be marinated and grilled. This type of cut is known as Miami- or Korean-style Short Ribs.
---
Recipe ID: 234c8285-722e-429a-b6d4-c74d80683821
Recipe Title: Grilled Big Basted Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Lots of folks ask how to best grill a marinated steak. This one is steeped and finished with a flavourful big baste and dipping sauce. As a way to maximize tenderness, cook to medium-rare or medium doneness at most, and carve into thin slices to serve. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 495
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) steak sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Medallions, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about four 6-oz/175 g steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- Sliced green onions (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Steak sauce
	- Dijon mustard
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 green onions
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Medallions, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about four 6-oz/175 g steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine steak sauce, mustard, garlic and green onions in large sealable freezer bag. Transfer ¼ cup (60 mL) to a small bowl for basting and ¼ cup (60 mL) to another bowl for dipping sauce; cover and refrigerate both bowls. Pierce steaks all over with a fork. Add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C), brushing with reserved basting sauce, for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾-inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
	3. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 5 minutes before serving. Cut into thin slices and serve with reserved dipping sauce. Garnish with green onions, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Marinades are all about building steak flavour and juiciness. Piercing steak all over with a fork is what helps tenderize the steak.
---
Recipe ID: 235d8eac-d6e2-4cb9-9704-8dd99515e10e
Recipe Title: Yorkshire Puddings 
Recipe Summary: There isn’t a more classic pairing with roast beef than Yorkshire Puddings – they’re the perfect match for rich roast beef gravy. This traditional recipe is inspired by an old edition of Home & Gardens cookbook. Yorkies aren’t difficult to make if you follow a few key steps: let the batter rest before cooking and make sure your oven and pan are up to temperature. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 12
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) all-purpose flour
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- 1 cup (250 mL) milk
	- 2 eggs
	- Fat from roast pan drippings, melted bacon fat or vegetable oil
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine flour and salt in a large bowl. Add milk and eggs; beat with electric mixer just until smooth. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or for up to 8 hours, until ready to cook (Note: if refrigerated longer than 1 hour, allow batter to return to room temperature before baking).
	2. Pour or spoon in enough fat to make a thin layer of fat in the bottom of each cup of a 12-cup muffin pan; heat the pan in preheated 425ºF oven for 5 minutes.&nbsp;
	3. Working quickly and carefully, divide batter among the muffin cups. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until puffed and golden brown. Serve immediately.
Recipe Tips:
  - To get your timing right to serve with your roast, mix the Yorkshire Pudding batter while the roast cooks, and bake them while the cooked roast rests for 15 minutes before carving.
---
Recipe ID: 245569a8-1251-4594-8f7d-13000352e7dd
Recipe Title: Grilled Marinated Steak with Spinach Salad and Candied Pecans
Recipe Summary: This steakhouse-style lunch/dinner is not so complicated to make if you do the tasks in stages: marinade, candied pecans, steak! Pre-washed baby spinach is a real time-saver.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 505
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) raspberry or balsamic vinaigrette dressing, divided
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Outside Round Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) granulated sugar
	- ½ cup (125 mL) broken pecan halves
	- Steak spice
	- 5 oz (142 g) container baby spinach
	- 4 oz (125 g) Roquefort or other blue cheese, crumbled
	- Fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Raspberry or balsamic vinaigrette dressing
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Outside Round Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Granulated sugar
	- ½ cup (125 mL) broken pecan halves
	- Steak spice
	- 5 oz (142 g) container baby spinach
	- Roquefort or other blue cheese
	- Fresh ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pour ½ cup (125 mL) of the dressing in resealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with fork and add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	 2. Meanwhile, heat sugar with pecans in heavy skillet over high heat for 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until sugar is melted, golden and syrupy and pecans are coated. Immediately remove pan from heat and use 2 forks to scoop out pecans onto parchment paper to cool.
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat steak dry with paper towel. Season all over with steak spice to your taste. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue, or pan-fry or broil using medium-high heat for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	4. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, toss spinach with remaining vinaigrette dressing and divide among serving plates. Carve steak across the grain into thin slices; place on spinach. Top with crumbled cheese and pecans. Sprinkle with pepper to taste.
Recipe Tips:
  - For best browning and flavour, pat steaks dry with paper towels before grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 24e72c84-a03f-4781-8a98-119adb5d6253
Recipe Title: Crispy Chow Mein with Beef and Vegetables
Recipe Summary: A comforting, chow mein with saucy and savoury tender beef and crisp vegetables. The saucy beef and vegetables are served over a layer of crispy chow mein, allowing the noodles to soak up that full-bodied sauce while having the crunchy pieces still stand out. This dish is packed full of umami, flavour and crunch.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Beef
		- 8 oz (250 g) Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH soy sauce and Chinese cooking wine
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
	- Sauce
		- ¾ cup (175 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Chinese cooking wine
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH oyster sauce and soy sauce
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) sesame oil
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) cornstarch
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) granulated sugar
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground white pepper and black pepper
	- Noodles
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) canola or avocado oil
		- ½ lb (250 g) fresh chow mein noodles
	- Stir-fry
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) canola oil, divided
		- 1-inch (5 cm) piece gingerroot, minced
		- 5 to 6 cloves garlic, minced
		- Half onion, thinly sliced
		- 2 carrots, julienned
		- 3 heads baby bok choy, quartered lengthwise
		- 5 oz (150 g) oyster mushrooms, coarsely chopped
		- 3 green onions, cut into thirds, cutting white sections in half lengthwise
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Gingerroot
	- Garlic
	- 1 onion
	- 2 carrots
	- 3 heads baby bok choy
	- 5 oz (150 g) oyster mushrooms
	- Green onions
	- ½ lb (250 g) fresh chow mein noodles
	- 8 oz (250 g) Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Canola or avocado oil
	- Soy sauce
	- Chinese cooking wine
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Oyster sauce
	- Sesame oil
	- Cornstarch
	- Salt
	- Granulated sugar
	- Ground white pepper
	- Ground black pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Beef: Cut beef across the grain into ¼ inch (0.5 cm) thick slices. Place in a medium bowl. Add soy sauce, cooking wine, cornstarch and salt; mix well to coat beef and set aside.
	2. Sauce: Whisk together beef broth, Chinese cooking wine, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, sugar, white pepper, black pepper and ¼ cup (60 mL) water in a medium bowl until smooth. Set aside.
	3. Noodles: Heat a wok or large deep nonstick or cast-iron skillet over high heat until hot and starts to slightly smoke. Add oil and swirl to coat. Spread chow mein noodles over pan and cook, without stirring, for 30 to 60 seconds, until noodles start to brown. Quickly flip the noodles over with a spatula or chopsticks and fry the other side for 1 to 2 minutes or until noodles are crispy and golden brown. Transfer to a large serving plate and set aside. 
	4. Stir-fry: Return wok to high heat. Add 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil and swirl to coat. Add gingerroot and garlic to taste; stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add beef with marinate and cook, without stirring, for 30 seconds to char slightly. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until cooked to medium-rare. Transfer to a clean bowl and set aside.
	5. Add remaining oil to wok with onion and stir-fry for 30 to 60 seconds or until wilted. Add carrots, baby bok choy, oyster mushrooms and ¼ cup (60 mL) water. Cover and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are slightly softened.
	6. Pour over cooked beef, stirring to coat. Add beef mixture to wok, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring often, for 1 to 2 minutes or until sauce is thickened. Garnish with green onions.
	7. Spoon the Stir-fry into the middle of the Noodles, leaving a border around the edges for the noodles to remain crispy. Serve immediately.
Recipe Tips:
  - Fresh chow mein noodles are highly recommended; they’re found in the refrigerator section of the Asian grocery store and well-stocked supermarkets. You may also substitute with dry chow mein noodles. Cook according to the package until al dente, drain well and let cool. Pat dry before you fry them.
---
Recipe ID: 24fa7914-c857-4bd9-af9d-826d233c6961
Recipe Title: Pan-Fried Asian-Style Beef Salad
Recipe Summary: Experience Asian flavours at home with little effort and time. Top sirloin is a lean cut of beef and turns this salad into a satisfying meal.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated orange zest
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) orange juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH sodium reduced soy sauce and rice vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH minced gingerroot and liquid honey
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) cornstarch
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH sesame oil and Asian chili sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) canola oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak, sliced into thin strips
	- 1 cup (250 mL) sliced mushrooms
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH julienned carrot, thinly sliced sweet red or yellow pepper and red onion
	- Hot pepper flakes (optional)
	- Salad greens
	- Orange slices
	- Fresh cilantro leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 oranges
	- Sodium reduced soy sauce
	- Rice vinegar
	- Minced gingerroot
	- Liquid honey
	- Cornstarch
	- Garlic
	- Sesame oil
	- Asian chili sauce
	- Canola oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak, sliced into thin strips
	- Mushrooms
	- Carrots
	- Sweet red or yellow pepper
	- Red onion
	- Hot pepper flakes (optional)
	- Salad greens
	- Fresh cilantro leaves
Recipe Methods:
	Sauce: : 
		1. Whisk together orange zest, orange juice, soy sauce, vinegar, gingerroot, honey, cornstarch, garlic, sesame oil and chili sauce in small bowl; set aside.
	Beef: : 
		2. Pat beef strips dry with paper towel. Heat oil in large skillet or wok over high heat. Stir-fry beef for 2 to 3 minutes or until browned but still pink inside; transfer to a bowl. Add mushrooms, carrot, peppers, onion and 4 tsp (20 mL) water to pan and bring to boil; reduce heat, cover and cook for 2 minutes or until tender-crisp.
		3. Return beef and any juices to pan. Stir in reserved sauce and return to boil; cook, stirring for 1 to 2 minutes or until thickened. Sprinkle with hot pepper flakes (if using). Toss with individual servings of greens and garnish with oranges and cilantro leaves.
Recipe Tips:
  - For best browning and flavour, pat steaks dry with paper towels before stir-frying.
---
Recipe ID: 26d299aa-aae6-4842-af38-e2cb9ad20b1e
Recipe Title: Greek Pan-Fried Minute Steak Sandwich
Recipe Summary: This light approach to the typical steak dinner has lots of fresh flavours from the garden veggies.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) plain Greek yogurt
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) mayonnaise
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) dried oregano leaves
	- ¾ tsp (3 mL) salt, divided
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH diced cucumber and diced tomato
	- 1 green onion, sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH crumbled feta cheese and sliced pitted Kalamata olives
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Greek-style vinaigrette dressing 
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Minute/Sandwich/Fast-fry Steaks, cut into four pieces
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) garlic powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 4 to 8 butter lettuce leaves (such as Bibb or Boston) 
	- 2 Greek-style pita bread, (no pocket pita), halved, warmed
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Plain Greek yogurt
	- Mayonnaise
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) dried oregano leaves
	- Salt
	- Cucumber
	- Tomato
	- 1 green onion
	- Crumbled feta cheese
	- Sliced pitted Kalamata olives
	- Greek-style vinaigrette dressing
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Minute/Sandwich/Fast-fry Steaks, cut into four pieces
	- Garlic powder
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 4 to 8 butter lettuce leaves (such as Bibb or Boston) 
	- 2 Greek-style pita bread, (no pocket pita)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine yogurt, mayonnaise, oregano and ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt in a small bowl; set aside.
	2. Combine cucumber, tomato, onion, feta and olives in medium bowl; add vinaigrette dressing, tossing to coat. Set aside.
	3. Pat steaks dry with paper towel. Sprinkle both sides of steaks with garlic powder, pepper and remaining ½ tsp (2 mL) salt. 
	4. Heat a lightly oiled nonstick skillet over medium heat; cook steaks, in batches as necessary, for 4 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more until steaks are cooked to medium (160°F/71°C) at the least.
	5. Spread each of the warmed Greek pita bread with some of the yogurt sauce. Layer lettuce leaves on top of pita; top each with a steak and top each with the tomato/cucumber mixture and serve remaining yogurt sauce alongside.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during cooking.
---
Recipe ID: 277dbf2b-fea4-4649-9152-21148b198a28
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef Sausage with Caramelized Onions
Recipe Summary: Enjoy this classic Canadian street food at home. For a gourmet touch, you can add some crumbled dried sage to the onions while cooking. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sausages (about 4)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH butter and olive oil 
	- 1 large onion, halved and thinly sliced 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- Salt and pepper
	- 4 sausage buns
	- 1 tomato, seeded and cut into chunks
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Sausages  (about 4)
	- Butter
	- Olive oil
	- 1 large onion
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Salt and pepper
	- 4 sausage buns
	- 1 tomato, seeded
Recipe Methods:
	1. Melt butter and olive oil over medium heat in medium saucepan; heat until butter is melted. Cook onion, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes or until very soft and caramelized (reduce heat as necessary to prevent burning). Stir in balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
	2. Meanwhile, grill the sausages on a lightly oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 14 minutes, turning often, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted lengthwise into centre of each sausage reads 160°F (71°C). Transfer to a plate and keep warm. Toast the buns lightly, split side down on the grill. 
	3. Assemble sausages into toasted buns and top with the Caramelized Onions and chunks of tomato to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer to best judge if sausage is done. Cutting sausages open to check for doneness reduces the juiciness of sausages and is not a true way to test doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 27c27386-87f3-4476-be98-bcb70d6aa00b
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef Pinwheels with Cantaloupe Salad
Recipe Summary: Serve with the suggested salad or just serve as beef bites with the reserved dressing as a dipping sauce. If you want more of an orange flavour in the dressing, try adding a teaspoon or so of orange juice concentrate (undiluted). 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 6
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 266
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH vegetable oil and teriyaki sauce
	- ½ cup (125 mL) minced onion
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 large orange 
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH hot Asian chili sauce and sesame oil
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH minced garlic and gingerroot
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Inside Skirt Marinating Steak 
	- 10 to 12 bamboo skewers
	- Salt and pepper
	- 8 cups (2 L) mixed salad greens
	- 4 cups (1 L) salad ingredients: chopped cucumber, cantaloupe chunks, sweet pepper chunks
	-  Citrus Salad Dressing 
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) olive oil
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) apple cider vinegar or white vinegar
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil
	- Teriyaki sauce
	- Onion
	- 1 large orange
	- Hot Asian chili sauce
	- Sesame oil
	- Garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Inside Skirt Marinating Steak 
	- 10 to 12 bamboo skewers
	- Salt and pepper
	- Mixed salad greens
	- 4 cups chopped cucumber
	- 4 cups cantaloupe chunks
	- 4 cups sweet pepper chunks
	- Olive oil
	- Apple cider vinegar or white vinegar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine vegetable oil, teriyaki sauce, onion, orange zest and juice, chili sauce, garlic, gingerroot, and sesame oil in large sealable freezer bag or container. Transfer 1 cup (250 mL) of the marinade to a large bowl and set aside to use in Citrus Salad Dressing.
	2. Pierce steak all over with a fork and add to bag or dish, massaging to coat; seal and refrigerate for 4 to 8 hours. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat steak dry with paper towel and season lightly on both sides with salt and pepper to your taste.
	4. Slice steak across the grain into about thin strips, each about 1 inch (2.5 cm) long. Roll each strip into a pinwheel shape and thread onto soaked skewers to make lollipops. (NOTE: you can thread several 'lollies' onto each stick like you would kabob cubes.)
	 5. Grill lollipops on a well-oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of lollipop reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer to a plate, cover loosely with foil and let rest for 5 minutes.
	6. Citrus Salad Dressing: Meanwhile, whisk add olive oil and vinegar to reserved 1 cup (250 mL) marinade and whisk to combine. Toss dressing with salad greens and other salad ingredients.
	7. Divide salad among serving plates and top with lollipops.
Recipe Tips:
  - If you would rather just serve slivers of cooked steak with the salad, you can skip making the lollipops and cook steak whole, carving it across the grain to serve. Grill as directed in step 5 for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steak.
---
Recipe ID: 27d6de53-9ecc-4340-bd79-5a2d7c5a386d
Recipe Title: Bulgogi-Style Braised Beef with Bok Choy
Recipe Summary: Braising is one of the simplest ways to make a truly impressive meal without much time spent at the stove – your oven does all the work.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 130
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) thick-cut Beef Bone-in Chuck Short Ribs (about 6)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) sesame oil, divided
	- 1 whole head garlic, separated into cloves and peeled
	- ½ cup (125 mL) soy sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) minced gingerroot
	- ½ cup (125 mL) coarsely chopped green onions
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) rice vinegar or cider vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
	- 6 baby bok choy, halved lengthwise
	- Toasted sesame seeds and/or chopped cashews (optional)
	- Steamed rice or noodles (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) thick-cut Beef Bone-in Chuck Short Ribs (about 6)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Sesame oil
	- 1 whole head garlic
	- Soy sauce
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Gingerroot
	- Green onions
	- Rice vinegar or cider vinegar
	- Cornstarch
	- 6 baby bok choy
	- Toasted sesame seeds and/or chopped cashews (optional)
	- Steamed rice or noodles (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim fat from meat. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat 2 tbsp (30 mL) oil over medium-high heat in large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef in batches, adding more oil as needed, for about 10 minutes, until browned all over. Transfer beef to plate as it’s browned, then return to pot with any accumulated juices.
	2. Combine garlic, soy sauce, brown sugar, gingerroot, onion, vinegar and 2 cups (500 mL) water in a medium bowl. Pour over beef; bring to a boil, scraping up browned bits from bottom of pot. 
	3. Cover and bake in preheated 325°F oven for 1½ to 2 hours or until meat is fork-tender. Transfer beef to platter with a slotted spoon; cover and keep warm.
	4. Heat remaining 1 tbsp (15 mL) sesame oil over medium-high heat in large skillet. Cook bok choy, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes, flipping occasionally. Add half of the cooking sauce and stir in half of the cornstarch mixture; cover and cook for about 3 minutes or until simmering and sauce thickens slightly.
	5. Meanwhile, skim fat from remaining cooking sauce. Stir in remaining cornstarch mixture; boil over high heat, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes, until bubbling and thickened slightly. Spoon sauce over beef. Portion beef and bok choy onto plates; garnish with sesame seeds or cashews (if using) and serve with steamed rice or noodles, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Simmer beef in the oven rather than on the stove-top for a constant simmer with less chance of scorching.
---
Recipe ID: 291f6de9-1b57-4410-9847-b5577f36f38f
Recipe Title: Grilled Slow-Roasted Carolina Spice-Rubbed Beef 
Recipe Summary: Simple spices combine to make a unique rub for hearty beef ribs. Paired up with a matching barbecue ‘mop’ (Southern U.S. BBQ lingo for barbecue sauce), this combo makes an authentic slow-roasting Southern barbecue rib experience for cooking by indirect heat on the barbecue or smoker.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 180
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 330
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH paprika and granulated sugar
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH brown sugar, chili powder, ground cumin and dry mustard
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground dried thyme, garlic powder, coarse salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH ketchup and tomato sauce
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) EACH packed brown sugar and cider vinegar
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) corn syrup
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH garlic powder, onion powder and smoked paprika
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH chili powder, pepper, celery seeds
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground cinnamon
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Paprika
	- Granulated sugar
	- Brown sugar
	- Chili powder
	- Ground cumin
	- Dry mustard
	- Ground dried thyme
	- Garlic powder
	- Coarse salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- Ketchup
	- Tomato sauce
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Cider vinegar
	- Corn syrup
	- Butter
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder
	- Smoked paprika
	- Chili powder
	- Pepper
	- Celery seeds
	- Ground cinnamon
Recipe Methods:
	1. Ribs: Combine paprika, granulated and brown sugars, chili powder, cumin, mustard, thyme, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Place ribs on a platter and rub all over with spice mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight.
	2. Uncover ribs and roast on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet in a 250°F oven, or cook in a closed barbecue or smoker over indirect heat on low (250°F), for 2 to 3 hours until crispy and browned. Transfer to a cutting board and let cool slightly.
	3. Mop: Meanwhile, combine ketchup, tomato sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, corn syrup, butter, garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, chili powder, pepper, celery seeds and cinnamon in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring often, for about 20 minutes or until thickened. (Make ahead: sauce can be cooled, covered and refrigerated for up to 3 weeks.) 
	4. Grill rack of ribs over medium heat in a closed barbecue or broil on baking sheet, for 5 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally while brushing generously all over with the Mop, until hot, browned and well-glazed. Cut into individual ribs and serve with extra Mop for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - For a less crispy version of Beef Back Ribs you can shorten the cooking time, roasting in a 350°F oven for 45 to 60 minutes.
---
Recipe ID: 293cc165-776c-42ee-8a27-66ce1342b5a6
Recipe Title: Chimichurri Pan-Fried Beef Liver Sandwiches with Tangy Slaw
Recipe Summary: Similar to pesto, chimichurri is an Argentinian herb condiment, often served with beef. It’s made with fresh cilantro and parsley, vinegar and a touch of heat and in this recipe, the chimichurri is used to marinate strips of beef liver, dress the coleslaw and stirred into mayo for a creamy sauce. The tartness of the vinegar and freshness of the herbs are the perfect complement to the rich beef liver. Take care to not overcook liver.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) red wine vinegar 
	- 3 cloves garlic, finely chopped
	- 1 large shallot, finely chopped
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) finely chopped fresh cilantro
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley 
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) dried oregano
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes 
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced Beef Liver, about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick
	- ½ cup (125 mL) light mayonnaise 
	- 4 cups (1 L) shredded coleslaw blend 
	- 6 soft buns, such as brioche, Kaiser or ciabatta, split and toasted
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Red wine vinegar
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- 1 large shallot
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Fresh parsley
	- Dried oregano
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced Beef Liver, about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick
	- Light mayonnaise
	- 4 cups (1 L) shredded coleslaw blend 
	- 6 soft buns, such as brioche, Kaiser or ciabatta
Recipe Methods:
	1. Stir vinegar with garlic, shallot, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Let stand for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cut liver slices into ½-inch (1 cm) wide strips (similar to steak stir-fry strips). Stir cilantro, parsley, oregano and hot pepper flakes into vinegar mixture. Whisk in olive oil. Pour ½ cup (125 mL) of the chimichurri over liver strips in another bowl, stirring to coat; cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
	2. Stir 2 tbsp (30 mL) chimichurri into mayo in a small bowl; set aside. Add remaining chimichurri to coleslaw blend in large bowl; toss until well coated. Cover and refrigerate both mayo mixture and coleslaw until ready to serve. (Make-ahead: keep refrigerated in a covered container for up to 1 day.) 
	3. Heat a cast-iron skillet or other heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Pat liver dry with paper towel, reserving any marinade in bowl. Pan-fry liver strips, in batches, for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until evenly browned on the outside and still slightly pink on the inside and springy to the touch. Transfer liver to a clean platter as it’s cooked. Add reserved marinade to pan and bring just to a simmer. (Liver is best when cooked to medium doneness, at most.) 
	4. Spread chimichurri mayo on bottom half of each bun. Top with cooked liver and coleslaw. Sandwich with top half of bun. 
Recipe Tips:
  - One of the reasons some people don’t like liver is because it has been overcooked. Liver can be served slightly pink. Overcooked liver develops a mealy texture. When thinly sliced, liver just needs a quick sear, followed by a minute of reheating in the sauce.
---
Recipe ID: 2b16862d-9cea-408a-a5bb-78b7b85ca3e8
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak Dippables
Recipe Summary: Serving steak as a nibbler is a great way to make it stretch – this recipe is a bit like a summer version of fondue! The steak can be
 grilled ahead to take with you for tailgating or picnic – just cut the cooked steak into cubes when you're ready to serve. Serve on picks with olives, marinated mushrooms, roasted red pepper strips, chunks of feta or blue cheese or large capers along with dipping sauces. 
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Horseradish Dip, Canadiana Dip and Bombay Dip (see recipes below)
	- 1 lb 6 oz (800 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Flap Grilling Steak,1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (2 steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) minced mild fresh herbs, such as chives and parsley
	- Anchovy or miso paste
	- Lemon wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Plain Greek yogurt
	- Mayonnaise
	- Prepared horseradish
	- Lemon juice
	- Barbecue sauce
	- White vinegar
	- Maple syrup
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Garlic powder
	- Mango chutney
	- Green onion or chives
	- Curry powder
	- Garlic
	- 1 lb 6 oz (800 g)  Beef Bottom Sirloin Flap Grilling Steak,1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (2 steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- Mild fresh herbs, such as chives and parsley
	- Anchovy or miso paste
	- Lemon wedges
Recipe Methods:
	1. Prepare dips; cover and refrigerate until serving. (Make ahead: Dips can be refrigerated for up to 1 day).
	 2. Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. 
	3. Meanwhile, mix oil, herbs and a dab of anchovy or miso paste on a cutting board.
	4. Transfer steaks to cutting board and flip the cooked steak on the smeared board a couple of times to lightly coat it with the herb mixture. Let rest for 5 minutes. Squeeze a bit of fresh lemon juice over steak and cut into bite-sized cubes. Serve with dips.
	Horseradish Dip: Combine 1 cup (250 mL) plain Greek yogurt, ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH mayonnaise and minced fresh herbs (e.g. parsley, basil, tarragon, chives), 3 tbsp (45 mL) prepared horseradish, 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste.
	Canadiana Dip: Combine ½ cup (125 mL) barbecue sauce, ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH white vinegar and Worcestershire sauce, 2 tbsp (30 mL) maple syrup, 1 tbsp (15 mL) lemon juice and ½ tsp (2 mL) garlic powder.
	Bombay Dip: Combine ⅓ cup (75 mL) mayonnaise, 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH white vinegar and mango chutney, 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced green onion or chives, 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH curry powder and minced garlic.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 2b185be9-980d-4b8a-8c35-884c95164a60
Recipe Title: Cashew and Peppered Beef Grilling Steak Salad on Bed of Endive 
Recipe Summary: Canada Beef was a proud partner of Food & Drink’s 30th Anniversary Event where guests enjoyed this recipe, adapted from the original created by Marilyn Bentz-Crowley for the Autumn 2006 issue of Food & Drink magazine. This meaty medley is a terrific starter, or in larger portions can be a light entrée. Serve with epi, the very decorative form of baguette that is so easy to pull apart. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 16
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 eggplant (unpeeled)
	- 1 onion
	- 1 large sweet red pepper
	- 2 zucchini
	- ⅓ (75 mL) olive oil
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) red or white wine vinegar
	- 1 large clove garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) finely chopped fresh thyme leaves (or ¼ tsp/1 mL dried)
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- Salt
	- 1½ lbs (750 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steaks, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (2 steaks)
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 1 head radicchio
	- 1 large Belgian endive
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) roasted salted cashew pieces
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 eggplant
	- 1 onion
	- 1 large sweet red pepper
	- 2 zucchini
	- Garlic
	- Fresh thyme (or dried)
	- 1 head radicchio
	- 1 large Belgian endive
	- 1½ lbs (750 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steaks, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (2 steaks)
	- Olive oil
	- Red or white wine vinegar
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Roasted salted cashew pieces
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut eggplant and onion into ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices. Cut sweet pepper in half and trim out seeds and core. Cut zucchini lengthwise into ¼-inch (5 mm) thick slices. Whisk together oil, vinegar, garlic, mustard, thyme, hot pepper flakes and ½ tsp (2 mL) salt in a small bowl. Set aside.
	2. Lightly brush vegetables all over with some of the oil mixture; pour remaining oil mixture into a large bowl and set aside.
	3. Grill vegetables in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 5 to 10 minutes, turning, until softened and tinged with brown. Transfer to a plate as they are cooked. Let cool.
	4. Meanwhile, trim most of fat from edges of steaks; discard. Pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	5. Cut vegetables into bite-size pieces; add to reserved oil mixture in large bowl. Cut steaks across the grain into ¼-inch (5 mm) thick slices; add to vegetables and toss to coat.
	6. Decoratively line serving platter or individual plates with radicchio and endive leaves. Stir half of the cashews into salad. Heap salad onto radicchio and endive leaves and garnish with remaining cashews.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 2b5a61e9-7e19-4700-a8fe-73fbe12a24bb
Recipe Title: Mixed Herb-Stuffed Rolled Oven Roast
Recipe Summary: Follow the video instruction to see the technique that turns tenderloin from a delicious roast, to a recipe fit for steakhouse presentation. Use the homemade pesto recipe provided or use your favourite purchased prepared version. The wine sauce makes a tasty finish for the dish.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 80
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH fresh parsley leaves and basil leaves
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh rosemary leaves
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) Dijon mustard
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) pecans
	- ½ cup + 1 tbsp (135 mL) extra virgin olive oil 
	- ½ cup (125 mL) freshly grated Parmesan cheese
	- Coarse salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3½ lb (1.75 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- Coarse salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 shallots, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) no-salt-added beef broth
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Fresh parsley leaves
	- Basil leaves
	- Fresh rosemary leaves
	- Dijon mustard
	- Pecans
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Freshly grated Parmesan cheese
	- Coarse salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3½ lb (1.75 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 shallots
	- Dry red wine
	- No-salt-added beef broth
Recipe Methods:
	1. Mixed Herb Pesto: Mince garlic in food processor; add parsley, basil, rosemary, Dijon and pecans; pulse until minced. With processor running, gradually add oil, processing for about 3 minutes or until incorporated and smooth. Transfer to bowl and stir in cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste; set aside.
	2. Beef: Using a carving knife, slice roast lengthwise stopping when you are about ½ inch (1 cm) from bottom of the roast. Open the roast up like a book and cut one side to ‘unroll’ the roast to be about ½-inch (1 cm) thick. Repeat with the other side so that you end up with a rectangular piece of meat that is about ½-inch (1 cm) thick.
	 3. Spread ¾ cup (175 mL) pesto over the beef (reserving the remaining pesto for another use). Starting at the long side, roll roast up jelly-roll style. Tie with kitchen twine, at about 2-inch (5 cm) intervals. Rub all over with 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil and season lightly with salt and pepper.
	4. Place roast on a rack in shallow pan. Insert oven-safe thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast for about 40 minutes for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	5. Sauce: Meanwhile, add oil to roasting pan and heat over medium-high heat. Add shallots and cook, stirring, for about 4 minutes or until shallots are softened. Add red wine and bring to a boil; boil for about 4 minutes or until almost completely evaporated. Stir in Dijon and beef broth; bring to boil, scraping up any browned bits from pan. Boil, stirring often for about 10 minutes or until thickened and reduced to about 1 cup. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 
	6. Carve roast across the grain into thick slices and serve with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Refrigerate extra pesto in an airtight container for up to 2 days. Here are a few ideas for using any extra pesto mixture. Mix with mayonnaise for a quick sandwich spread. Toss with cooked pasta for a quick dinner idea with leftover meat, cheese and thinly sliced roasted red peppers or use on pizza dough instead of a red sauce and top with goat cheese and salami pieces.
---
Recipe ID: 2b7c7324-94f3-4de3-a811-a501d7f06afa
Recipe Title: Barbecued Dill-Marinated Roast Beef Sandwiches
Recipe Summary: Don’t let anything go to waste with this unique recipe idea! Make your marinade from the pickle juice and serve up these deli-style beef sandwiches with the crunchy pickles themselves. Put your mortar and pestle to good use to crush the spices, or simply place in a sealable bag and crush with the bottom of a heavy skillet. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 300
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 550
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket Pot Roast, Flat/First Cut section 
	- 1 jar (1 L) garlic dill pickles
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) bold deli mustard
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) pickling spice mix, coarsely crushed
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH sliced onion and packed brown sugar
	- Soft Kaiser rolls
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Brisket Pot Roast, Flat/First Cut section 
	- Garlic dill pickles
	- Bold deli mustard
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) pickling spice mix, coarsely crushed
	- Onion
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Soft Kaiser rolls
Recipe Methods:
	1. Drain pickles pouring juice into large sealable freezer bag (about 2 cups/500 mL); set 6 pickles aside, returning remaining to jar for another use. Add mustard, pickling spice, onion and brown sugar to pickle juice in bag. Pierce roast all over with fork and add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 4 hours or up to 12 hours.
	2. Fill drip pan with ½ inch (1 cm) water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to 250ºF.
	3. Remove roast from marinade, and set aside. Strain marinade into a saucepan; bring to boil over medium heat and cook until slightly thickened. Separate out ¾ cup (175 mL) to serve as a sauce with the cooked beef and use the remainder to baste the meat.
	4. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast, fat-side-up, on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan, close lid and cook at constant temperature, turning every 2 hours and basting with marinade occasionally, for 5 to 6 hours until fork tender when tested with a barbecue fork or skewer, and thermometer reads between 180°F (82°C) to 200°F (100°C).
	5. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Slice reserve pickles Carve brisket across the grain into thin slices and arrange on a platter with reserved sauce and pickles and Kaiser rolls to make sandwiches.
Recipe Tips:
  - Once drained, you can add equal parts vinegar and water to the remaining pickles in the jar to keep them moist. Store them in the refrigerator for another week or two.
---
Recipe ID: 2cb5f260-b0c5-4f6f-a004-2d4c9189b4db
Recipe Title: Grilled Honey-Ginger Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: The honey and ginger give this combo marinade, basting and dipping sauce a touch of Asian influence. You can add a splash of soy sauce and sesame oil if you want to enhance the Asian flavours even more. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 495
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) steak sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) minced peeled gingerroot
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Medallions, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about four 6-oz/175 g steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Steak sauce
	- Liquid honey
	- Dijon mustard
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 green onions
	- Gingerroot
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Medallions, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about four 6-oz/175 g steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine steak sauce, honey, mustard, garlic, green onions and ginger in large sealable freezer bag. Transfer ¼ cup (60 mL) to a small bowl for basting and ¼ cup (60 mL) to another bowl for dipping sauce; cover and refrigerate both bowls. Pierce steaks all over with a fork. Add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C), brushing with reserved basting sauce, for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾-inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
	3. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 5 minutes before serving with reserved dipping sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 2d1d812b-ebc1-41df-8f82-39524f79b556
Recipe Title: Slow Cooker Braised Beef with Noodles
Recipe Summary: Beef and mushrooms are a perfect match in this restaurant-style braise that’s made super simple with the help of your slow cooker. Perfect served with the egg noodles as suggested, but also good served with whole grain rice or mashed or baked potatoes.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 440
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 460
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg) Beef Cheeks (about 2 or 3) 
	- 1¼ cups (300 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine
	- 1 large onion, sliced
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced mushrooms
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH minced garlic, dried rosemary and dried thyme
	- 3 large carrots, thickly sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) cornstarch
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) prepared horseradish	 
	- 12 oz (375 g) broad egg noodles 
	- Chopped fresh parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg)  Beef Cheeks  (about 2 or 3) 
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Dry red wine
	- 1 large onion
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced mushrooms
	- Garlic
	- Dried rosemary
	- Dried thyme
	- 3 large carrots
	- Cornstarch
	- Prepared horseradish
	- 12 oz (375 g) broad egg noodles 
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large heavy skillet. Brown beef, turning occasionally, for about 8 minutes or until dark golden-brown all over. Add broth, red wine and 1 cup (250 mL) water; bring to a simmer, scraping any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. 
	 2. Transfer the beef and liquids to a minimum 4-qt (4 L) slow cooker. Stir in onions, mushrooms, garlic, rosemary and thyme. 
	3. Cover and cook on LOW for 6 hours. Stir in carrots; cover and cook for 1 hour or until beef and carrots are fork-tender.
	4. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the beef to a plate; cover and set aside. Scrape the broth and vegetables into a deep skillet or large saucepan. Whisk the cornstarch and horseradish with about ¼ cup (60 mL) cold water to make a smooth paste. Gradually stir into the skillet and bring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes until gravy is glossy and thickened. 
	5. Meanwhile, cook egg noodles in a large pot of boiling water according to package directions. Drain well.
	6. Break the beef into large chunks with a fork. Place hot cooked noodles in serving dishes and top with beef; spoon vegetables and gravy over meat and noodles. Garnish with parsley. 
Recipe Tips:
  - To make without the slow cooker, brown the beef in a Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. After adding the liquids in Step 1, add onions, mushrooms, garlic, rosemary and thyme to the pot. Cover and cook in preheated 325ºF oven, for about 1½ hours. Stir in carrots and cook another 30 minutes or until beef and carrots are fork-tender.
---
Recipe ID: 2d514119-da85-4c8d-a07c-94260c48fb6a
Recipe Title: Stir-Fried Sandwich Steak Strips and Broccoli
Recipe Summary: Serve this stir-fry over cooked rice or egg noodles for a homemade version of the takeout classic. For those who like it spicy, Increase the chili sauce or provide additional at the table. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) soy sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Asian chili sauce, such as sriracha or sambal oelek 
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced gingerroot
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) sesame oil
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Sandwich Steaks, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) wide strips 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 4 cups (1 L) small broccoli florets
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sesame seeds
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Soy sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Asian chili sauce, such as sriracha or sambal oelek
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- Sesame oil
	- Cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Sandwich Steaks, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) wide strips  
	- Vegetable oil
	- 4 cups (1 L) small broccoli florets
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Sesame seeds
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, chili sauce, garlic, gingerroot, sesame oil and cornstarch in a large shallow bowl. Add beef strips, tossing to coat.
	2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet; stir-fry beef strips for 4 to 5 minutes. until cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF) and meat is browned but still pink inside. Transfer meat to a clean bowl.
	3. Add broccoli florets, ¼ cup (60 mL) water, salt and pepper to skillet; stir-fry for 3 to 5 minutes or until almost tender-crisp. Return beef with accumulated juices to skillet. Stir-fry for 1 to 2 minutes or until beef is heated through and broccoli is just tender. Remove from heat; sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Recipe Tips:
  - Adding a splash of water with the broccoli helps to prevent scorching. For added flavour, substitute water with no-salt-added beef broth.
---
Recipe ID: 2d6dcb8c-efb5-4718-9152-3c6bcd3815bb
Recipe Title: Steamed Beef Rice Rolls (Beef Cheung Fun)
Recipe Summary: This is one of the top dim sum dishes you order when having Sunday dim sum. A classic dim sum dish featuring soft and smooth, freshly steamed rice rolls with marinated juicy beef sandwiched in between. Served with a sweet soy sauce infused with ginger and green onion. An easy recipe that teaches you to make a comforting and iconic dim sum dish to serve at home.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Beef
		- ½ lb (250 g) Lean Ground Beef
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH granulated sugar and oyster sauce
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH chicken bouillon powder, cornstarch and sesame oil
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground white pepper
		- 1 green onion, finely chopped
		- Pinch salt
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) baking soda
	- Rice Roll (Cheung Fun)
		- ⅓ + 1 tsp (80 mL) rice flour
		- 2 tbsp + 2 tsp (40 mL) tapioca starch
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
		- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Sauce
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) soy sauce
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) granulated sugar
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) sesame oil
		- 1-inch (2.5 cm) piece gingerroot, sliced
		- Three 2-inch (5 cm) pieces white ends green onions
	- Garnish
		- Sliced green onions
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Green onions
	- Gingerroot
	- ½ lb (250 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Soy sauce
	- Oyster sauce
	- Sesame oil
	- Chicken bouillon powder
	- Cornstarch
	- Ground white pepper
	- Salt
	- Granulated sugar
	- Baking soda
	- Rice flour
	- Tapioca starch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Beef: Combine ground beef, sugar, oyster sauce, chicken bouillon, cornstarch, sesame oil, white pepper, green onion, and salt. &nbsp;Add baking soda and ¼ cup (60 mL) water. Mix thoroughly for 5 minutes by hand or with a stand mixer using the paddle attachment on medium speed until thoroughly combined. Set aside.
	2. Rice Roll (Cheung Fun): Whisk together rice flour, tapioca starch, 2 cups (500 mL) water and salt in a bowl until well blended and smooth. Set aside.
	3. Sauce: Combine soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, ginger, and green onions and 1 cup (250 mL) water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Strain through a sieve, discarding solids. Set sauce aside and let cool.
	4. To cook rice rolls, bring 2 cups (500 mL) of water to a boil in a large steamer or wok (or enough to fill steamer with 1 to 2 inches/2.5 to 5 cm water). Place a shallow trivet on the bottom of steamer and place an 8-inch (20 cm) square nonstick baking pan on trivet. Cover steamer with a tight-fitting lid. Steam for 2 minutes to ensure the pan is hot enough to prevent the rice roll (Cheung Fun) batter from sticking to the bottom.
	5. Brush ½ tsp (2 mL) oil over bottom of pan. Stir the rice roll mixture and carefully pour in ½ cup (125 mL) into the oiled pan. Cover and steam for 1 minute. Remove the lid and spoon 3 heaping tablespoons (45 mL) of the beef mixture, about 2 inches (5 cm) from the left side of the pan in a vertical line on top of the rice roll. Cover and steam for 3 minutes or until beef is thoroughly cooked (see Tip). Carefully remove pan from steamer and let cool for 1 minute. 
	6. Using a scraper or rubber spatula, working from the edge closest to the meat, carefully fold the edge of the rice roll over the meat and continue to roll up the rice roll, to enclose the meat and form a cylindrical shaped roll. Carefully transfer the rolled rice roll onto a serving plate and top with 3 tablespoons (45 mL) of the Sauce and garnish with green onion. Repeat with remaining rice roll batter and beef mixture to make 5 additional rolls. Serve hot as soon as possible.
Recipe Tips:
  - To ensure the ground beef is thoroughly cooked, insert a digital instant-read thermometer lengthwise into beef mixture to ensure the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C). If beef is not cooked, cover and steam a few minutes longer.
---
Recipe ID: 2e121ea1-f511-43bb-a5d9-31525197bcd6
Recipe Title: Roasted Beef Marrow Bones with Lemony Salsa Verde
Recipe Summary: The tangy and herbaceous sauce pairs perfectly with the richness of the marrow.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 pieces Beef Marrow Bones, Canoe-cut
	- Salt
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) drained brined capers
	- 2 oil-packed anchovy fillets
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) packed fresh Italian parsley leaves 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) packed fresh basil leaves 
	- 1/2 cup (125 mL) packed fresh mint leaves
	- Grated zest of ½ lemon
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lemon juice (approx)
	- ½ to 1 cup (125 to 250 mL) extra-virgin olive oil 
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh ground pepper 
	- 8 large, thick slices toasted crusty bread (or more)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 8 pieces  Beef Marrow Bones, Canoe-cut
	- Salt
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) drained brined capers
	- 2 oil-packed anchovy fillets
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Fresh Italian parsley leaves
	- Fresh basil leaves
	- Fresh mint leaves
	- Grated zest of ½ lemon
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lemon juice (approx)
	- Extra-virgin olive oil
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh ground pepper 
	- 8 large, thick slices toasted crusty bread (or more)
Recipe Methods:
	1. To prepare marrow bones, with the back of a sturdy knife, scrape off any meat clinging to the outside of the bones. In a large container or nonreactive bowl, stir 3 tbsp (45 mL) salt and 4 quarts (4 L) water together until salt is dissolved. Add the marrow bones, cover and refrigerate overnight or for 24 hours. Drain bones well.
	2. Combine capers, anchovy fillets, garlic, parsley, basil, mint, lemon zest and lemon juice in a food processor or blender and pulse until the ingredients are coarsely chopped. With the motor running, add enough olive oil through feed tube to make the mixture fluid. 
	3. Place the marrow bones 2 inches (5 cm) apart on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Brush bones lightly with oil and season lightly with salt and pepper. Bake in preheated 350ºF for 20 minutes.
	4. Divide the bones between 8 plates and drizzle with salsa verde. Serve with the toast and remaining salsa verde on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - When preparing the Marrow Bones, the soaking step helps firm up the marrow and helps it be a creamy white. Scraping helps make the bones look more attractive. You can skip this step if you prefer.
---
Recipe ID: 2e5e6dea-066f-4492-905c-a588a99362c4
Recipe Title: Grilled Chilean Pebre-Seasoned Steak and Pasta
Recipe Summary: Pebre is a slightly hot pesto-like sauce that makes a wonderful accompaniment to beef and pasta. In Chile, this fresh herb sauce is a staple on the table. 
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 90
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH fresh parsley and cilantro leaves
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH chopped onion and bottled oil-and-vinegar salad dressing
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH hot pepper sauce (or more to taste), salt and pepper
	- 4 small Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1½ lb/750 g)
	- 3 cups (750 mL) penne pasta (uncooked)
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) grape tomatoes, quartered
	- Freshly grated Parmesan cheese
	- Fresh parsley leaves, torn
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh parsley
	- Cilantro leaves
	- Onion
	- Bottled oil-and-vinegar salad dressing
	- Hot pepper sauce
	- Salt and pepper
	- 4 small Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1½ lb/750 g)
	- Penne pasta
	- Grape tomatoes
	- Freshly grated Parmesan cheese
	- Fresh parsley leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine parsley, cilantro, onion, dressing, hot pepper sauce, salt and pepper in blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Transfer half to medium-size bowl and set aside. Place remaining half in large sealable freezer bag and add steaks to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes.
	2. Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large pot of boiling, salted water for about 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain and add to parsley mixture reserved in bowl; toss to coat and let cool.
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. 
	4. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steaks reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	5. Let steaks rest for 5 minutes before serving. Add tomatoes to pasta and serve as a side to the steaks, garnished with Parmesan and parsley.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways for best judgement of doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 2e8d966b-372d-4616-9168-085152f8d1f8
Recipe Title: Stir-Fried Honey-Ginger Fast-Fry Steak Strips
Recipe Summary: The stir-fry method refers to cooking food over medium-high to high heat, stirring and tossing often, so everything cooks evenly. Serve over cooked fragrant basmati or jasmine rice. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH soy sauce and liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sriracha 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil 
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Fast-fry Steaks , cut into ¼-inch (5 mm) wide strips
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH minced garlic and gingerroot
	- 1 large carrot, thinly sliced
	- 1 sweet red pepper, thinly sliced
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) baby corn, drained and rinsed
	- 8 baby bok choy, quartered
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Soy sauce
	- Liquid honey
	- Sriracha
	- Cornstarch
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Inside Round Fast-fry Steaks , cut into ¼-inch (5 mm) wide strips
	- Garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 1 large carrot
	- 1 sweet red pepper
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) baby corn
	- 8 baby bok choy
	- 2 green onions
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, honey, sriracha and cornstarch in a small bowl; set sauce aside.
	2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in large wok or nonstick skillet. Add beef strips, garlic and gingerroot; stir-fry for 2 minutes or until meat is cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF) and browned but still pink inside. Transfer to a clean bowl; tent with foil to keep warm.
	3. Add carrot, red pepper, baby corn and bok choy to skillet; stir-fry for 3 to 5 minutes or until almost tender-crisp. Return beef with any accumulated juices to skillet, along with the reserved sauce; bring to a boil. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and thickened, beef is heated through and vegetables are just tender. Remove from heat; stir in green onions.  
Recipe Tips:
  - Save prep time by using 4 cups (1 L) Asian-blend frozen vegetables in place of the carrot, sweet pepper, corn and bok choy, and use tubes or jars of puréed garlic and gingerroot, found in the produce section.

Recipe ID: 2f81d0c6-38a3-4d26-9cf0-ed2498fcbb3a
Recipe Title: Stovetop Greek-Style Ground Beef Wraps
Recipe Summary: In this warm hand-held fold over wrap, you can enjoy gyro-like flavours made simply at home with ground beef. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¾ lb (375 g) Regular Ground Beef
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 green onion, thinly sliced
	- 1 small carrot, finely grated
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) wheat germ
	- ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) Greek vinaigrette salad dressing
	- 4 whole wheat pitas or flatbreads, warmed
	- Toppings
	- Shredded iceberg lettuce, diced tomato, sliced red onion, crumbled feta cheese, sliced green onions
Recipe Shopping List:
	- ¾ lb (375 g) Regular Ground Beef
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- 2 green onions
	- 1 small carrot
	- Wheat germ
	- Pepper
	- Greek vinaigrette salad dressing
	- 4 whole wheat pitas or flatbreads
	- Iceberg lettuce
	- Tomato
	- Red onion
	- Crumbled feta cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine ground beef, Worcestershire sauce, green onion, carrot, wheat germ and pepper in a large nonstick skillet. Cook over medium-high heat for 8 to 10 minutes, breaking up meat with back of spoon until browned and completely cooked. Remove from heat; drain.
	2. Add vinaigrette to beef mixture and stir to combine. Arrange lettuce, tomato, red onion and feta cheese, as desired on top of pitas and spoon on beef mixture; sprinkle with green onions, if desired. Fold pita over the beef filling to eat hand-held.
Recipe Tips:
  - Ground beef is 100% beef with no additives, fillers or colours.
