Recipe ID: 303f365a-27b0-4eb9-92ee-27ce1513b25b
Recipe Title: Sous Vide Eye of Round Roast
Recipe Summary: This lean oven roast benefits amazingly from the low-and-slow cooking method of sous vide. The preset temperature of the water bath determines the internal doneness temperature of your roast so you know it will cook perfectly and evenly all the way through. The natural beef juices are sealed in keeping the roast flavourful, tender and juicy. It’s just the thing to serve hot or cold, thinly sliced and piled on sandwiches, topped with caramelized onions and Swiss cheese.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 2170
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 2175
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast, centre cut (3 to 4 inches/7.5 to 10 cm diameter), tied
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) dried rosemary, crumbled
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) garlic powder (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast,  centre cut (3 to 4 inches/7.5 to 10 cm diameter), tied
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Salt
	- Vegetable oil
	- Dried rosemary
	- Garlic powder (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 130°F (54.5°C) for medium-rare or 140°F (60°C) for medium according to manufacturer’s directions.
	2. Pat beef dry with paper towel and season all over with pepper and salt. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a skillet. Brown roast, turning to brown all sides. Transfer to a plate and let cool slightly. 
	 3. Rub beef with rosemary and garlic powder (if using). Place in a medium bag for sous vide (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Remove as much air as possible and vacuum or manually seal. 
	4. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure it to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Cover water bath with foil or plastic to reduce evaporation. Cook sous vide for 36 hours, replenishing water as necessary.
	5. Remove beef from water bath. To serve cold, chill in a bowl of ice water, replenishing ice as necessary until cooled, then refrigerate for 1 hour. (Make ahead: Chilled roast can be refrigerated in the bag for up to 3 days.) 
	6. To serve warm, immediately remove beef from bag, discarding liquid and transfer to a cutting board. Carve across the grain into thin slices and serve on warmed plates.
Recipe Tips:
  - This works best with the centre-cut portion of the Eye of Round that is 3 to 4 inches (7.5 to 10 cm) in diameter for even cooking. You can cook more than one roast at a time, just place each piece in separate bag and ensure there is plenty of space in the water bath to circulate around each roast to cook evenly. If you prefer a hotter temperature for serving, you can pat the cooked roast dry after removing from the bag and give it another quick sear in a hot, oiled skillet before slicing.
---
Recipe ID: 3049759e-b07c-4611-ade9-74a811b61f66
Recipe Title: Grilled Souvlaki-Style Beef Skewers
Recipe Summary: The beef in this recipe gets served off the skewer into a warm pita but would also be great served over rice or with roasted potatoes. To prevent beef cubes from spinning on the stick during cooking, thread beef cubes fairly tightly together on the skewer (without squishing) as the beef cubes will shrink in size as they cook. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 265
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) red wine vinegar
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dried oregano leaves and salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 4 long bamboo skewers
	- 4 large pitas 
	- 2 cups (500 mL) shredded romaine lettuce
	- 1 cup (250 mL) finely chopped tomato
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped onion
	- ½ cup (125 mL) prepared tzatziki
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Red wine vinegar
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 4 long bamboo skewers
	- 4 large pitas 
	- Romaine lettuce
	- Tomato
	- Onion
	- Prepared tzatziki
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine olive oil, lemon juice, vinegar, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper in a large sealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with fork, cut into 1- inch (2.5 cm) cubes and add to bag, massaging marinade into meat; seal and refrigerate for 4 hours. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	2. Discard marinade from meat. Pat beef cubes dry with paper towel. Thread beef cubes evenly onto skewers.
	3. Grill skewers in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown on all sides, until cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Lightly grill pitas during the last 1 to 2 minutes of cooking, or until just warmed.
	4. Remove beef from skewers. Place pitas on serving plates. Arrange lettuce, beef, tomato, onions and tzatziki evenly over warm pitas; serve immediately.
Recipe Tips:
  - Bamboo skewers need to be soaked in cold water for at least 30 minutes before using to avoid charring. You can use metal skewers instead, which do not require soaking; however, they draw the heat into the centre of the beef and can cook meat faster, so cooking time may need to be adjusted. Cutting beef into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes is perfect for grilling–any smaller and you risk over cooking the meat.
---
Recipe ID: 306e898e-e54d-4fc6-89ae-4f36e59e652a
Recipe Title: Slow-Simmered Beef Roast and Root Vegetables
Recipe Summary: This Beef Brisket, braised in red wine, is truly a one-pot wonder recipe that will stand the test of time. Make sure to serve with a baguette to sop up all the flavourful sauce. Browning the brisket prior to cooking ensures a richer sauce. 
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 195
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 220
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Point Portion (Pot Roast)
	- 1¼ tsp (6 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- 1 onion, finely chopped 
	- 2 stalks celery, finely chopped
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh thyme
	- 2½ cups (625 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) tomato paste
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1½ lb (750 g) yellow-flesh potatoes, peeled and cut into 2-inch (5 cm) chunks
	- 4 large carrots, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH grainy Dijon mustard and finely chopped fresh parsley 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Point Portion (Pot Roast)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- Butter
	- 1 onion
	- 2 stalks celery
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Fresh thyme
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Dry red wine
	- Tomato paste
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1½ lb (750 g) yellow-flesh potatoes
	- 4 large carrots
	- All-purpose flour
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat beef dry with paper towel. Season all over with 1 tsp (5 mL) each salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster; brown beef, turning, until browned all over. Transfer to a large plate. 
	2. Reduce heat to medium and add butter to pot; swirl until melted. Add onion, celery, garlic, thyme and remaining salt and pepper. Cook, stirring often, for 3 to 5 minutes or until starting to soften. 
	3. Meanwhile, combine broth, wine and tomato paste in a large measuring cup or medium bowl. 
	4. Return beef and any accumulated juices to pot; add bay leaves. Pour broth mixture over meat. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for 2 hours. Stir in potatoes and carrots to submerge as much as possible; cover and cook for 1 to 1½ hours or until meat is fork-tender and vegetables are tender.
	5. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Transfer vegetables to a large bowl with a slotted spoon and cover with foil to keep warm. Skim fat from sauce and remove bay leaves; discard. 
	6. Meanwhile, whisk together flour and ¼ cup (60 mL) cold water in a small bowl until smooth. Set sauce in pot over medium-high heat; bring to a boil. Gradually whisk flour mixture into the sauce; bring to a boil, whisking constantly. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, stirring often, for 5 to 7 minutes or until sauce thickens to a rich gravy consistency. Stir in grainy mustard and parsley; keep warm over low heat. 
	7. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices. Arrange brisket slices and vegetables on a warmed platter or serving plates and serve with sauce. 
Recipe Tips:
  - A mixture of potatoes, carrots, parsnips and turnip also works nicely in this recipe. Use about 2½ lb (1.3 kg) total. When buying a boneless beef brisket, buy 6 to 8 oz (175 to 250 g) meat per serving.
---
Recipe ID: 3088741d-87fe-4adf-aaa6-36febfb4760a
Recipe Title: Grilled Sous Vide Steak with White Bean and Arugula Salad
Recipe Summary: Cooking a grilling steak sous vide takes the guesswork out of cooking to a perfect doneness–the temperature you set your water bath is the internal temperature your steak will cook to, every time! Evenly cooked (all the way through), juicy, tender steak is definitely worth the longer cooking time. A quick, hot sear at the end adds that delicious browning. The accompanying salad with white beans and arugula makes a nice change from your typical garden salad. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 152
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 172
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Steak
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) garlic powder
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) red wine vinegar
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak,  1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Olive oil (optional)
	-  Salad
	- 2 medium tomatoes, chopped
	- 1 cup (250 mL) chopped cucumber
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh basil (or ½ tsp/2 mL chopped fresh rosemary)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) drained rinsed canned or cooked white kidney (cannellini) beans
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) red wine vinegar
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 cups (1 L) baby arugula and/or other baby greens, about 4 oz (125 g)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic powder
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Dijon mustard
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak,   1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 2 medium tomatoes
	- Cucumber
	- Fresh basil or fresh rosemary
	- 1 cup White kidney (cannellini) beans
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Red wine vinegar
	- 4 cups (1 L) baby arugula and/or other baby greens, about 4 oz (125 g)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Steak: Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 130°F (54.5°C) for medium-rare or 140°F (60°C) for medium according to manufacturer’s directions.
	2. Combine garlic powder, ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper, oil, vinegar and mustard in a small bowl. Pat steak dry with paper towel. Place in a large bag for sous vide (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Pour in oil mixture, massaging to evenly coat meat. Remove as much air as possible and vacuum or manually seal. 
	3. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure it to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Cook sous vide for 2½ hours.
	4. Salad: About 15 minutes before serving, combine tomatoes, cucumber, basil, beans, oil and vinegar in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste and toss to coat. Set aside.
	5. To serve, preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C) or cast-iron pan or grill pan over medium-high heat until very hot.
	6. Remove the beef from the water bath Remove steak from bag, discarding liquid from bag, and transfer to a plate. Pat steak dry with paper towel; season lightly all over with salt and pepper. Lightly oil pan, if using. Grill or pan-fry steak for 2 to 4 minutes, turning once, or until sizzling and well-browned on both sides. Transfer to a cutting board.
	7. Add arugula to salad and toss to evenly coat. Arrange on a platter or serving plates. Cut steak across the grain into thin slices and serve with Salad.
Recipe Tips:
  - To prepare this ahead, after removing from water bath, immerse steak in bag in a sink or bowl of ice water and chill, replenishing ice as necessary until cold. Refrigerate in bag for up to 3 days. Reheat in a 130°F (54.5°C) or 140°F (60°C) water bath for 30 minutes, then proceed with grilling or pan-frying. The salad is can be prepared up to 30 minutes before serving.
---
Recipe ID: 31342a6c-de84-4a70-a886-50772e499d4b
Recipe Title: Pepperoni Pizza Beef Burger
Recipe Summary: This kid-friendly burger will get rave reviews from the whole family. You can change up the flavours by switching up the toppings–for example, for a Hawaiian pizza-inspired burger, substitute ham or bacon for the pepperoni and add a grilled pineapple ring. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 oz (60 g) thin pepperoni slices
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) shredded mozzarella cheese
	- 6 Lean Ground Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- ½ cup (125 mL) pizza sauce
	- 6 burger buns, split
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 oz (60 g) thin pepperoni slices
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) shredded mozzarella cheese
	- 6  Lean Ground Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Pizza sauce
	- 6 burger buns, split
Recipe Methods:
	1. Stack pepperoni slices into small towers and cut crosswise to create thin matchsticks. Toss with mozzarella in a medium bowl; set aside. 
	2. Make a thumbprint depression in centre of each burger (to prevent puffing while grilling). Grill burgers on oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 minutes, turning twice. 
	3. Spread pizza sauce over burgers and top with pepperoni-mozzarella mixture. Grill for 4 to 6 minutes longer for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick burgers or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each burger reads 160°F (71°C), cheese has melted and pepperoni is crisp. 
	4. Meanwhile, grill buns, cut sides down, on barbecue for 30 to 60 seconds or until well-marked and toasted. Place grilled burgers in toasted buns.
Recipe Tips:
  - Burgers can be pan-fried on the stove top over medium heat in a cast-iron skillet or grill pan. Broil for 1 to 2 minutes to melt the cheese and crisp up the pepperoni. Toast buns in skillet or under broiler.
---
Recipe ID: 3154c773-09ea-4498-ae44-57dccc7460f1
Recipe Title: Classic Skillet Steak Diane
Recipe Summary: This recipe for Beef Steak Diane is a steak-house classic that's an elegant dinner for two.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter
	- ½ lemon, cut into 3 wedges
	- 2 small Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks , 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 12 oz/375 g) 
	- 2 shallots or green onions, chopped
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce and steak sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sherry
	- Salt and pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) cognac or brandy
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Butter
	- 1 lemon
	- 2 small Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks , 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 12 oz/375 g) 
	- 2 shallots or green onions
	- Fresh parsley
	- Tomato paste
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Steak sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sherry
	- Salt and pepper
	- Cognac or brandy
Recipe Methods:
	1. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Using fork, rub 1 lemon wedge around side and bottom of pan, squeezing juice into butter.
	2. Add steaks to butter and sear for 2 minutes on each side. Add shallots, parsley, tomato paste, Worcestershire and steak sauce; cook steaks for 6 to 8 minutes longer for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning at least twice, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Add sherry and season sauce with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat.
	3. Microwave cognac in 1-cup (250 mL) microwaveable glass measure on High for 30 seconds or until warm. Carefully ignite with match. While flaming, pour over steaks. Serve steaks immediately with sauce. Garnish with remaining lemon wedges.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways for best judgement of doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 3159298c-b312-4112-b01f-7ef4c0d46e49
Recipe Title: Oven Roast Beef with Brandied Gravy
Recipe Summary: This simple version of a classic French beef recipe makes a very special dinner. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 7-in (17.5 cm) long x 5-in (12.5 cm) wide x 4-in (10 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 165
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 175
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) cracked pepper
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Rib Eye Oven Roast
	-  Brandied Gravy 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped onion
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) brandy
	- 1¾ cups (425 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) whipping cream
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Dijon mustard
	- Cracked pepper
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Rib Eye Oven Roast
	-  Brandied Gravy 
	- Butter
	- Onion
	- All-purpose flour
	- Brandy
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Whipping cream
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine mustard and pepper in a small bowl; rub all over roast. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast.
	2. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2½ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: see ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before carving. 
	4. Brandied Gravy : Meanwhile, drain off fat and all but 1 tbsp (15 mL) fat from drippings from roasting pan. Heat pan drippings and butter in roasting pan over medium heat on stove-top. Add onion; cook, stirring, for about 3 minutes or until softened. Stir in flour; cook, stirring, for 1 minute until moistened. Stir in brandy and bring to a boil. Stir in beef broth; bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up any brown bits from pan. Reduce heat and boil gently, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add cream and boil, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until sauce is thickened to desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a gravy boat to serve with roast.
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your oven roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: 32255ca2-8625-4cf3-b087-4450caea8c62
Recipe Title: Beef Samosa
Recipe Summary: Spiced ground beef enveloped in pastry and fried to perfection, these beef samosas make the best kind of appetizer. I prefer using lean ground beef for this recipe. Traditionally samosas are deep-fried though sometimes when we get uncooked samosas from our families we use the air fryer. The samosa wrappers can be found in the freezer section in well-stocked supermarkets and at Southeast Asian grocery stores.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 90
Recipe Servings: 25
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Lean Ground Beef 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) garlic paste*
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) gingerroot paste*
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH ground cumin and coriander
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) salt
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) ground red chili pepper (see Tip**) 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground turmeric
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice 
	- 1 small onion, chopped (about ½ cup/125 mL)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) chopped green onions 
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped fresh cilantro
	- Canola oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 25 samosa wrappers (trapezoid or rectangle-shaped)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic paste*
	- Gingerroot paste*
	- 1 lemon 
	- 1 onion
	- 2 bunches green onions
	- Fresh cilantro
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Lean Ground Beef 
	- Canola oil
	- Ground cumin
	- Ground coriander
	- Ground red chili pepper**
	- Ground turmeric
	- Salt
	- All-purpose flour
	- 25 samosa wrappers (trapezoid or rectangle shape)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Brown ground beef over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven, stirring and breaking up beef into small chunks with the back of a spoon, for 8 to 10 minutes or until thoroughly cooked. 
	2. Stir in garlic, gingerroot, cumin, coriander, salt, ground red chili pepper, turmeric and lemon juice. Cook, stirring often, for about 30 minutes, until the liquid has evaporated. Stir onion, green onions and cilantro. Transfer to a bowl and let cool completely.
	3. Fill a deep-fryer or large, heavy saucepan with at least 4 inches (10 cm) of oil. Heat over medium heat to 350°F.
	4. Combine flour with just enough water in a small bowl to make a paste with glue-like consistency.
	5. Fold one wrapper to form a cone, overlapping tightly so no filling goes through the hole. Fill the pocket with a couple spoonfuls of the meat mixture. Brush the edges with the flour-paste, then fold over to seal and make a triangle. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling.
	6. Deep-fry samosas, a few at a time to avoid crowding pot, turning once, for about 10 to 12 minutes, until golden and crisp. Transfer to a paper towel-lined baking sheet to drain. Serve hot or at room temperature. 
Recipe Tips:
  - *For the garlic and gingerroot paste, you can use the purée or paste found in jars in the grocery store or use a fine grater, such as a Microplane, to make your own purée in small amounts just as you need it. **Ground red chili pepper is available in Indian grocery stores and well-stocked supermarkets. It is ground up dried red chili peppers and may be labeled as lal merch. Cayenne can be substituted but has a harsher flavour so you may wish to use less. You can test that your frying oil is hot enough for cooking adding a piece of wrapper to the hot oil. If it is ready, the wrapper will float to the top. If you have an air fryer, arrange samosas in the air fryer basket, leaving space between each. Follow the manufacturer’s directions to air fry the samosas until golden and crisp.
---
Recipe ID: 32521d70-f43b-4c14-84df-2ab4946b7160
Recipe Title: Moroccan-Style Oven Roast with Kasbah Couscous 
Recipe Summary: Make the simple Kasbah couscous side dish while the roast beef is cooking for your Moroccan-inspired meal. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 7¼-in (18 cm) long x 5½-in (14 cm) wide x 3¼-in (8 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH ground cinnamon, paprika, turmeric and garlic salt
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) ground ginger
	- ¾ tsp (3 mL) EACH ground cumin, salt and pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast
	- Kasbah Couscous
		- 1½ cups (375 mL) couscous
		- 1½ cups (375 mL) chicken broth
		- 3 green onions, chopped
		- ⅓ cup (75 mL) EACH raisins and diced dried apricots
		- ⅓ cup (75 mL) EACH Italian dressing and toasted slivered almonds
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) finely grated lemon zest
		- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Paprika
	- Turmeric
	- Garlic salt
	- Ground ginger
	- Ground cumin
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast
	- Couscous
	- Chicken broth
	- 3 green onions
	- Raisins
	- Dried apricots
	- Italian dressing
	- Toasted slivered almonds
	- Lemon
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine cinnamon, paprika, turmeric, garlic salt, ginger, cumin, salt and pepper in small bowl. Rub evenly all over roast
	2. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	3. Kasbah Couscous: Meanwhile, bring chicken broth to a boil over high heat in a large saucepan; stir in couscous. Remove from heat, cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Gently fluff couscous with a fork and stir in green onions, raisins, apricots, Italian salad dressing, almonds and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
	4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Carve across the grain into thin slices and serve with Kasbah Couscous.
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your oven roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices to settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: 32523e65-24ef-4963-b0ef-68b06abe604c
Recipe Title: Grilled Korean-Style Marinated Beef Kabobs
Recipe Summary: Cornstarch is often used in marinades for Asian-style cooking to give the sensation of tenderizing. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH vegetable oil and soy sauce
	- 1 green onion, chopped
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH sherry and cornstarch
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH grated gingerroot, sesame oil and sweet Asian chili sauce
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Bamboo skewers
	- Sliced green onions (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil
	- Soy sauce
	- 2 green onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Sherry
	- Cornstarch
	- Gingerroot
	- Sesame oil
	- Sweet Asian chili sauce
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Bamboo skewers
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine vegetable oil, soy sauce, onion, garlic, sherry, cornstarch, gingerroot, sesame oil and chili sauce in large sealable freezer bag. Add beef cubes, massaging with marinade. Seal and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	2. Discard marinade from meat. Pat beef cubes dry with paper towel; thread beef cubes onto soaked skewers. 
	3. Grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides, until cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Serve garnished with green onions, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Marinating kabob cubes takes less time than marinating a whole steak or roast.
---
Recipe ID: 33106a55-d327-4af8-946b-712800ee492f
Recipe Title: Ground Beef Stir-Fry with Holy Basil and Fried Egg (Pad Gaprao Neua)
Recipe Summary: If I had to pick a national dish of Thailand, this would be it. It’s a simple stir-fry that features the flavour of holy basil. Holy basil is hard to find here, but at my parents’ house in Thailand it grows like weeds! There are holy basil plants literally sprouting up from the cracks in the pavement, wherever the seeds fall so this dish reminds me very much of my mother’s abundant home garden. Holy basil is nearly impossible to find in Canada, but the good news is that good old Italian basil works fantastically as a substitute and has a close enough flavour that it satisfies my cravings just fine. Thai basil, if you can find it, will also be delicious though the flavour will be quite different. A Thai-style fried egg is a classic accompaniment, and a must-have if you ask me. What makes them Thai-style is the fact that they’re fried in a lot of oil to get crispy, browned bubbly edges. I’ve provided 2 different methods for frying the eggs, depending on the desired doneness of the yolk. This recipe is the traditional version of this pad gaprao, which is very simple, with no vegetables and seasoned simply with fish sauce and sugar. More modern versions include vegetables such as onions and long beans and involve more complex seasonings such as oyster sauce and dark soy sauce. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 3
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Prik Nam Pla (optional) 
		- 1 to 2 Thai chili peppers, chopped
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fish sauce 
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) fresh lime juice
	- Stir-fry
		- 2 to 3 Thai chili peppers
		- 6 cloves garlic
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped mild red peppers (see Tip)
		- ¾ lb (375 g) Lean Ground Beef 
		- 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) canola or sunflower oil
		- 1 tbsp + 2 tsp (25 mL) fish sauce (approx)
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) granulated sugar (approx)
		- ⅓ cup (75 mL) julienned mild red peppers (see Tip)
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) water or no-salt-added chicken broth (approx)
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) pepper
		- 1¼ cups (300 mL) holy basil or regular basil leaves 
	- Thai-style Fried Eggs
		- Canola or sunflower oil
		- 3 eggs
		- Hot cooked jasmine rice
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 to 5 Thai chili peppers
	- Fish sauce 
	- 1 lime
	- Garlic
	- Mild red peppers (see Tip)
	- Holy basil or regular basil leaves 
	- ¾ lb (375 g) Lean Ground Beef 
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- No-salt-added chicken broth (optional)
	- Granulated sugar
	- Pepper
	- Jasmine rice
	- Eggs
Recipe Methods:
	1. Prik Nam Pla (if using): Combine Thai chilies, fish sauce and lime juice in a small bowl. Let stand while you make the stir-fry.
	2. Stir-fry: Pound Thai chilies, to taste, into a fine paste using a mortar and pestle. Add garlic and chopped mild peppers and pound just into a coarse paste. Set aside.
	3. Heat a wok or a large skillet over high heat until very hot then add beef and spread it out. Sear beef without moving until the underside is browned. Toss the beef and cook until beef starts to release liquid; cook, stirring, until all juices have evaporated, and the beef starts to sizzle in its own fat. Once the beef is sizzling, cook, without stirring, for 15 to 20 seconds to brown the beef and develop flavour, then toss, and repeat the browning 1 to 2 more times.
	4. Reduce heat medium and push beef to one side of the pan. Tilt the pan so remaining oil covers empty side of pan. If there isn’t much oil in the pan, add enough oil to the empty side to make 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL). Add the garlic paste to the oiled side of the pan and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds until aromatic and the garlic starts to turn golden; toss it with the beef.&nbsp;
	5. Increase heat to high then add ¼ cup (60 mL) water, fish sauce and sugar; toss to mix well.&nbsp; Add the julienned mild peppers and cook, tossing, for 30 seconds; if it’s looking too dry, add a splash more water or broth.&nbsp;
	6. Turn off heat, add basil and toss just until wilted. Taste and adjust seasoning with more sugar or fish sauce as needed or add a little more water if it feels too dry. Set aside while you fry the eggs.
	7. Thai-style Fried Eggs: Fry eggs 1 at a time to prevent them from sticking to each other. There are 2 options for frying eggs:&nbsp;
	For crispy whites and semi-set yolk: Pour about ¼&nbsp;inch (0.5 cm) of oil into a small nonstick skillet. Heat over medium-high heat until hot. Add 1 egg and cook until egg white starts to bubble. Use a spoon to occasionally baste the top of the egg with oil to cook the yolk, and. cook until whites are crispy and browned around the edges and the yolk is set to your liking. Transfer to a plate with a slotted spatula and repeat with remaining eggs, adding more oil to pan as needed.&nbsp;
	For eggs with crispy whites and runny yolk: Working with 1 egg at a time, separate the egg white and the egg yolk. Pour about ¼ inch (0.5 cm) of oil to a small nonstick skillet. Heat over medium-high heat until hot. Add egg white and cook until edges start to turn brown, using a spatula to push down the middle of the white down to make an indent for the yolk to sit in. Cook until browned around the edges, then carefully place the yolk on top of the white, and cook, using a spoon to baste some oil around the edges of the egg yolk to help it stick to the egg white. Transfer to a plate with a slotted spatula and repeat with remaining eggs, adding more oil to pan as needed.
	8. Spoon hot jasmine rice onto 3 serving plates, spoon the beef over half of the rice, and top everything with a fried egg. Drizzle the Prik Nam Pla on top of the egg, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - The mild red chilies are for colour and flavour, and the Thai chilies are for heat. While the mild ones can be a sweet red pepper, preferably you want to use something with thinner flesh and not as watery, such as red Anaheim, Shepherd or mini sweet pepper.
---
Recipe ID: 3351ab0c-9bf9-4c5c-840c-5268df4e32c9
Recipe Title: Braised Island-Inspired Beef Stew
Recipe Summary: This beef stew recipe features undertones of cinnamon and ginger with a hint of heat, bringing flavours reminiscent from a warm, tropical island to your dinner table.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 120
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive or vegetable oil, divided (approx)
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 large onion, cut lengthwise into eighths
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) finely grated gingerroot
	- 1 cup (250 mL) beef broth
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced plum tomatoes, with juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH paprika and Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried sage, crushed
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 1 cinnamon stick
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH hot pepper flakes, salt and pepper
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH raisins and green olives
	- 1 sweet green pepper, coarsely chopped
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive or vegetable oil
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- All-purpose flour
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 large onion
	- Gingerroot
	- Beef broth
	- Plum tomatoes, with juice
	- Paprika
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Dried sage
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 1 cinnamon stick
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Salt and pepper
	- Raisins
	- Green olives
	- 1 sweet green pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat half the oil in heavy sauté pan (with lid) or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown beef, in 4 batches and adding more oil as needed, for 8 to 10 minutes, turning until browned on all sides. Transfer beef to a bowl. Sprinkle browned beef with flour; set aside.
	2. Add garlic, onion and gingerroot to pan; cook, stirring for 3 to 4 minutes, until just softened, adding more oil, if necessary. Stir in broth, scraping up browned bits from pan. Stir in reserved beef and accumulated juices, tomatoes with juice, paprika, Worcestershire, sage, bay leaf, cinnamon stick, hot pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer.
	3. Simmer, covered, on stove-top or in 325°F oven for 1 hour until beef is fork-tender; remove cinnamon stick and bay leaf. Add raisins, olives and green pepper; simmer for 30 to 40 minutes longer until green peppers are tender.
Recipe Tips:
  - Cook stew in the oven instead of on the stovetop, to maintain an even heat with less risk of scorching.
---
Recipe ID: 33531c0a-f919-46ff-8bee-a781395597e2
Recipe Title: Bahamian Stew Beef with Coconut Jasmine Rice
Recipe Summary: Bahamian beef stew is a unique zesty tomato-based comfort dish that is typically served over rice and enjoyed throughout the year. Beef stew cubes are perfect for this slowly braised dish; the delectable tender meat melts in your mouth. Prepare the Steamed Coconut Jasmine Rice while the stew simmers. This recipe serves 4 adults in my household and there are never any leftovers. 
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 95
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 120
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fine sea salt
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) garlic powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH onion powder and smoked sweet paprika
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground cumin
	- ½ cup + 2 tbsp (155 mL) olive or canola oil, divided
	- 1 sweet onion, sliced
	- 1 sweet green pepper, diced
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- 2 cups (500 mL) canned diced tomatoes
	- 2 large carrots, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
	- 2 large white or yellow-flesh potatoes, cubed
	- 1 cup (250 mL) ketchup
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 1 Scotch bonnet pepper, diced (optional)
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) fresh thyme leaves
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh Italian parsley leaves, chopped
	- Fine sea salt and pepper
	- Steamed Coconut Jasmine Rice (recipe follows)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 sweet onion
	- 1 sweet green pepper
	- Garlic
	- 2 large carrots
	- 2 large white or yellow-flesh potatoes
	- 1 Scotch bonnet pepper (optional)
	- Fresh thyme
	- Fresh Italian parsley
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- Olive or canola oil
	- 1 cup (250 mL) ketchup
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth
	- Fine sea salt
	- Pepper
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder 
	- Smoked sweet paprika
	- Ground cumin
	- Bay leaf
	- Tomato paste
	- 2 cups (500 mL) canned diced tomatoes
	- Steamed Coconut Jasmine Rice
	- Garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- Jasmine rice
	- Coconut oil
	- Coconut milk
	- Salt
	- Light brown sugar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim beef and set aside in a large bowl. Combine 2 tbsp (30 mL) salt, garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika and cumin in a small bowl. Drizzle ¼ cup (60 mL) of the oil around perimeter of the beef in the large bowl; sprinkle beef with spice mixture and toss to evenly coat.
	2. Heat ¼ cup (60 mL) of the oil over medium-high heat in a large Dutch oven or enameled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef, in batches (do not over-crowd the pot), turning, for about 6 to 10 minutes or until browned on all sides. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
	3. Add remaining oil to pot and reduce heat to medium. Cook onion and green pepper, stirring, for 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes. Add carrots and potatoes; cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes. Stir in ketchup, Worcestershire sauce and broth; bring to a boil. Return beef and any accumulated juices to the pot. Stir in bay leaf, Scotch bonnet pepper (if using) and thyme.
	4. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for 1½ hours or until meat is fork-tender. Skim off fat and discard bay leaf. Stir in parsley and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over Steamed Coconut Jasmine Rice.
	Steamed Coconut Jasmine Rice: 
		This aromatic rice is a wonderful complement to savoury dishes.
		Place 4 cups (1 L) jasmine rice (uncooked) in bowl and add water to cover; stir to rinse. Drain and repeat until water is clear; drain and set aside. Heat 3 tbsp (45 mL) coconut oil over medium heat in a large saucepan. Add 2 cloves garlic, minced, and 2 tsp (10 mL) minced gingerroot; cook, stirring for 1 minute. Increase heat to high. Add the rice, 1½ tsp (7 mL) salt; cook, stirring, for 3 minutes. Stir in 2½ cups (625 mL) hot water, 1 cup (250 mL) coconut milk and 1 tbsp (15 mL) light brown sugar. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until water evaporates and rice is tender. Fluff with a fork.
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: 33e32dbe-ef85-44c3-8f9c-3236dbdeb7a8
Recipe Title: Singapore-Style Beef Satay with Rojak Salad
Recipe Summary: Satay are a perfect “sharing” food, whether served as appetizers or part of a bigger meal. Satay is traditionally cooked over charcoal in the street-markets in Singapore, and although not a typical pairing, the rojak salad does make a great match with this flavourful satay.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 4
Recipe Marinating Time: 60
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 94
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Satay 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) coarsely chopped onion
	- 1-inch (2.5 cm) piece peeled gingerroot, sliced
	- 2 cloves garlic, peeled
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) maple syrup or granulated sugar
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) ground turmeric
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground coriander
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Hanger Grilling Steak
	- Bamboo skewers
	- Salt
	-  Satay Sauce
	- ½ cup (125 mL) peanut butter
	- ½ cup (125 mL) coconut milk
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) maple syrup or granulated sugar
	- Sambal Oelek or Sambal Belacan
	- Rojak 
	- 2 cups (500 mL) diced fresh pineapple (about ½)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) diced cucumber
	- 1 mango, peeled and diced
	- 1 large apple, diced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) diced firm tofu
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH hoisin sauce, soy sauce, maple syrup or granulated sugar and fresh lime juice
	- Sambal Oelek or Sambal Belacan
	- Toasted sesame seeds and chopped peanuts
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 Large onion
	- 1-inch (2.5 cm) piece gingerroot
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Maple syrup or granulated sugar
	- Ground turmeric
	- Ground coriander
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Hanger Grilling Steak
	- Bamboo skewers
	- Salt
	- Peanut butter
	- Coconut milk
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Sambal Oelek or Sambal Belacan
	- Fresh pineapple
	- Cucumber
	- 1 mango
	- 1 large apple
	- 1 cup (250 mL) diced firm tofu
	- Hoisin sauce
	- Soy sauce
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Toasted sesame seeds
	- Peanuts
Recipe Methods:
	1. Satay : Combine onion, ginger, garlic, maple syrup, turmeric and coriander and 1 tbsp (15 mL) water in a blender; purée to a smooth paste. Measure out 2 tbsp (30 mL) for the satay sauce and transfer the rest to a sealable freezer bag.
	2. Cut beef across the grain into thin strips; add to bag, massaging with marinade. Seal and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 6 hours. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	3. Satay Sauce: Meanwhile, combine peanut butter, coconut milk, lime juice, maple syrup and the reserved 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the satay marinade in a small saucepan. Warm over medium heat, whisking until smooth. Add Sambal to taste and set aside.
	4. Rojak Salad : Combine pineapple, cucumber, mango, apple, tofu, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, maple syrup, and lime juice in a large bowl; toss to coat. Season with Sambal to taste. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. 
	5. Discard marinade from meat. Pat beef strips dry with paper towel. Thread beef strips onto skewers and season the beef lightly with salt. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over high heat (500°F/260°C) for about 2 to 4 minutes, turning twice or more or until browned and cooked to medium-rare (145°F/63°C) doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	6. Serve the Satay immediately, with the Satay Sauce and Rojak on the side. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and peanuts.
Recipe Tips:
  - Traditional rojak uses jicama instead of the apple used here. Jicama offers a crunchy texture and has an interesting starch/sweet flavour.
---
Recipe ID: 34130655-1c44-405e-9181-1c117b2aab31
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef Skewers with Mango Salad and Peanut Sauce
Recipe Summary: Fresh, bright and bold, this recipe is as delicious as it is beautiful. Marinating the steak in the sweet and savoury blend of Asian ingredients imparts incredible flavours, while also tenderizing the specialty cut. Plus, bringing all the elements to the table, makes for a fun and interactive meal! For a spicy peanut sauce, add up to 1 tbsp (15 mL) more Asian chili sauce. 
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 518
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Skewers 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) soy sauce
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH packed brown sugar and vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH sesame oil and grated gingerroot
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) fish sauce
	- 8 to 10 bamboo skewers
	- 1 Beef Inside Skirt Marinating Steak (about 1 lb/500 g)
	- 3 cloves garlic, smashed
	- 1 red Thai chili, thinly sliced
	-  Mango Salad 
	- 1 EACH mango and sweet red pepper, cut into matchsticks 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded purple cabbage
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH thinly sliced red onion and chopped fresh cilantro
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH fish sauce and vegetable oil 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) liquid honey
	-  To Serve
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) natural peanut butter 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) Asian chili sauce, such as Sriracha or Sambal Oelek
	- 2 green onions, finely chopped
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) crushed unsalted roasted peanuts
	- Lettuce leaves, such as Boston, Bibb or leafy green
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Soy sauce
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Vegetable oil
	- Sesame oil
	- Gingerroot
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) fish sauce
	- 8 to 10 bamboo skewers
	- 1 Beef Inside Skirt Marinating Steak (about 1 lb/500 g)
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- 1 red Thai chili
	- 1 Mango
	- 1 Sweet red pepper
	- Purple cabbage
	- Red onion
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Fish sauce
	- Liquid honey
	- Natural peanut butter
	- Asian chili sauce, such as Sriracha or Sambal Oelek
	- 2 green onions
	- Unsalted roasted peanuts
	- Lettuce leaves, such as Boston, Bibb or leafy green
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Methods:
	1. Skewers: Whisk together soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, vegetable oil, sesame oil, gingerroot and fish sauce in a small bowl to make marinade. Measure out ¼ cup (60 mL) and set aside for peanut sauce. 
	2. Pierce steak all over with fork. Cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) wide strips. Place in a large sealable freezer bag and add remaining marinade, garlic and sliced chili, massaging to coat. Seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours. Soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	3. Mango Salad: Toss mango with red pepper, cabbage, onion and cilantro in a bowl. Whisk lime juice with fish sauce, oil and honey in a small bowl. Drizzle over salad and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve, for up to 1 day. 
	4. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Pat meat dry with paper towel. Position a soaked skewer at the end of one strip of steak; similar to a flagpole. Add two more strips of steak. On the opposite side, thread a second skewer, through the three strips of steak so strips are arranged horizontally between skewers. Repeat process with remaining steak. 
	5. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	6. To Serve: Whisk ¼ cup (60 mL) water, peanut butter and chili sauce into reserved marinade to make peanut sauce. Remove skewers and serve steak strips in lettuce leaves topped with peanut sauce, green onions and peanuts with a side of Mango Salad. Serve with lime wedges. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Indoor method: Omit skewers. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil in a cast iron or heavy-bottom skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook steak strips, in batches as necessary, turning at least twice, for 5 to 6 minutes for medium-rare (145°F/63°C) at the least.
