Recipe ID: 34716640-db30-4e42-9eb1-445179b1982c
Recipe Title: Mom’s Mikma Chili and Bannock
Recipe Summary: My mom's recipe may sound like a basic chili except that traditionally she would use bison and it was never too spicy. When I smell it now, it takes me back to setting the table and us kids getting excited because we just knew it was going to be a good dinner. Everything in the fridge used to go into the chili, even raw apples. When the huge pot was placed on the table, all of us kids would dip into it with bannock or bread. I’ve recreated her recipe using two different beef cuts to achieve an almost-perfect replica. Enjoy.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 80
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Beef Chili
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) canola or sunflower oil
		- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH coarsely chopped celery, carrot and onion 
		- 3 cloves garlic, minced 
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
		- ¾ lb (375 g) Beef Blade Steak, cut into ¾-inch (2 cm) cubes
		- ¾ lb (375 g) Lean Ground Beef
		- 2 bay leaves
		- ½ tsp to 7 tsp (2 to 35 mL) hot pepper flakes
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh cracked pepper
		- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) EACH black beans and navy beans, drained and rinsed 
		- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) crushed tomatoes
	- Bannock
		- 1¾ cups (425 mL) all-purpose flour
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) granulated sugar
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) baking soda
		- 1½ cups (375 mL) canola or sunflower oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Celery
	- 1 carrot
	- 1 onion 
	- Garlic 
	- ¾ lb (375 g) Beef Blade Steak, cut into ¾-inch (2 cm) cubes
	- ¾ lb (375 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Bay leaves
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Salt
	- Cracked pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Granulated sugar
	- Baking soda
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) black beans
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) navy beans
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) crushed tomatoes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Beef Chili: Heat oil over high heat in a large deep skillet. Add celery, carrot, onion, garlic and salt; cook, stirring often, for about 5 minutes or until just starting to soften. Add cubes of beef and ground beef to the pan and cook for about 10 minutes, breaking up ground beef with back of a spoon and turning beef cubes, until browned. Add bay leaves, hot pepper flakes to your taste, pepper, black beans, navy beans and crushed tomatoes. Cook, stirring often, for 15 minutes or until ground beef is completely cooked.
	2. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 45 to 60 minutes until beef cubes and vegetables are fork-tender.
	3. Bannock: Meanwhile, combine flour, sugar, salt and baking soda in bowl. Add ¾ cup (175 mL) water and fold together just until the mixture is shaggy and barely mixed (the trick is not to over mix). Let dough rest in a warm place for 15 minutes. 
	4. Heat oil over medium heat in a heavy skillet until a drop of dough sizzles when added to oil. Drop dough by large scoopfuls into sizzling oil and fry for about 5 to 10 minutes, turning once, until both sides are deep golden brown and centre is cooked. Adjust heat as necessary to prevent burning. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate with a slotted spoon.
	5. Cut Bannock into halves and serve with hot Beef Chili.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 34a8d64e-e63a-447a-98a1-7bfc2bdcca79
Recipe Title: Braised Barbecue-Basted Pot Roast
Recipe Summary: This saucy Beef Brisket is super simple to prepare! Simply add everything to the pan, cover, and oven-braise low and slow. Enjoy the enticing aromas wafting in the kitchen while waiting for the magic of the braise to make its delicious end-result! 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 195
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter, softened 
	- 1 large onion, finely chopped
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chili powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Flat Portion (Pot Roast)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) ketchup 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) tomato paste
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH grainy Dijon mustard and Worcestershire sauce
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) cider vinegar
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Butter
	- 1 large onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Chili powder
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Flat Portion (Pot Roast)
	- Ketchup
	- Tomato paste
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Cider vinegar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Spread butter over bottom of a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Add onion and garlic to pan. Combine chili powder, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat beef dry with paper towel and season all over with spice mixture. Place beef on top of onion mixture. 
	2. Whisk together ketchup, tomato paste, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, sugar, vinegar and 2 cups (500 mL) water in a large measuring cup or bowl until smooth. Pour mixture over roast. 
	3. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for about 3 to 3½ hours or until meat is fork-tender.
	4. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. 
	5. Skim fat from sauce in pot; discard. Set pot over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 to 15 minutes or until sauce is thickened to desired consistency.
	6. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - If you do not have a Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster, use a large oven-safe saucepan, high-sided skillet or a deep roasting pan. If the pan does not have a lid, cover tightly with foil. If using foil, check occasionally to make sure there is enough liquid in the pan to keep roast braising, adding water or broth as needed so the roast is partially covered.
---
Recipe ID: 34b38c5e-0340-4632-a570-44eedfb3b30b
Recipe Title: Beer and Spiced Braised Beef (Draadjesvlees) 
Recipe Summary: My Oma always told me that all you need is a Dutch oven and you can make a delicious meal. Of course, it’s no surprise the Dutch created the Dutch oven—a staple in most households these days—since they are the kings of slow cooking. Draadjesvlees simply means threaded meat and is typically cooked with various spices such as juniper berries, cloves and cinnamon. I add a bottle of “hoppy” beer to create depth of flavor and let the Dutch oven do the hard work. Serve the stew with Dutch potatoes, rice or pasta.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 240
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 255
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Salt and pepper
	- 3 onions, coarsely chopped
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) unsalted butter
	- 3 cloves garlic, smashed 
	- 1 bottle/can (about 355 mL) hoppy beer, such as IPA
	- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth (approx)
	- 2 sprigs fresh oregano
	- 4 whole cloves
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1 stick cinnamon
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) juniper berries 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 onions
	- Garlic
	- Fresh oregano
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Beef broth
	- Whole cloves
	- Bay leaves
	- Cinnamon stick
	- Juniper berries 
	- Unsalted butter
	- 1 bottle/can (about 355 mL) hoppy beer, such as IPA
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat a thin layer of oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven. Add beef, season with salt and pepper to your taste, and cook, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes or until browned all over. Add onions and butter; cook, stirring, for about 8 minutes or until onion is soft and begins to caramelize. Stir in garlic. 
	2. Pour in beer and beef broth, adding enough broth to cover beef. Add oregano, cloves, bay leaves, cinnamon and juniper berries. 
	3. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer on the stovetop, stirring occasionally and adding water, if necessary, or bake in preheated 350°F oven, for 3 to3½ hours or until beef is fall-apart tender.
	4. Discard bay leaves, whole spices and oregano stems. There should be enough sauce in the Dutch oven to serve as a gravy for the beef. If sauce is not as thick as desired, transfer beef with a slotted spoon to a bowl (keeping warm), and boil the sauce on the stovetop until reduced to desired thickness. &nbsp;
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 3513dead-a180-4596-8baf-37b25934aac6
Recipe Title: Pizza Topped with Pastrami-Spiced Grilled Steak
Recipe Summary: With chef-inspired special cheeses and pastrami-spiced steak, pizza steps-out!
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 35
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 65
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH freshly ground pepper and minced garlic (3 cloves)
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) ground cinnamon
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground allspice and salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) cayenne pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 2 sweet red peppers, cut into quarters
	- 2 medium red onions, cut in half
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil
	- Salt and pepper
	- ½ cup (125 mL) pizza sauce or prepared pesto 
	- 4 small pizza shells or flatbreads (5 to 6 inches/12 to 15 cm)
	- 4 oz (125 g) Havarti cheese, shredded
	- 3 oz (90 g) soft goat cheese (chèvre)
	- Baby arugula leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Freshly ground pepper and Salt
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Ground allspice
	- Cayenne pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 2 sweet red peppers
	- 2 medium red onions
	- Olive oil
	- Pizza sauce or prepared pesto
	- 4 small pizza shells or flatbreads (5 to 6 inches/12 to 15 cm)
	- 4 oz (125 g) Havarti cheese, shredded
	- 3 oz (90 g) soft goat cheese (chèvre)
	- Baby arugula leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine pepper, garlic, cinnamon, allspice, salt and cayenne pepper in resealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with a fork. Add to spice mixture; seal bag and shake to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour.
	2. Meanwhile, toss peppers and onions with olive oil, salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to grilling basket and grill peppers and onions over medium heat in a closed barbecue for about 10 minutes for peppers and 20 minutes for onions, or until tender. Transfer vegetables to cutting board as they are cooked. Let cool slightly and cut into equal-sized strips.
	3. Spread sauce evenly over pizza shells and sprinkle with Havarti cheese, then top with the grilled peppers, onions. Set aside.
	4. Grill steak over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes
	5. Meanwhile, bake pizzas in 325°F oven for about 5 minutes or until cheese is just melted.
	6. Slice steak thinly across the grain. Remove pizzas from oven. Top with spoonfuls of goat cheese, the thinly sliced steak and arugula; cut pizzas into wedges to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Instead of grilling, you can use an indoor grill pan to cook vegetables or broil in a single layer on a baking sheet, until tender. To pan-fry steak, heat a large oiled skillet over medium-high heat; add steak and pan-fry for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
---
Recipe ID: 356967ed-e699-4b13-ae67-4bf563b81d36
Recipe Title: Easy Beef Shawarma Stir-Fry Strip Skewers (Inside Round) 
Recipe Summary: This is a simple way to stretch your steak budget: taking a less premium steak–such as inside round as stir-fry strips–that you marinate to optimize tenderness. The shawarma flavours are on-trend and you can get two meals from one: serve over rice with a side salad for dinner and then in a pita with salad the next day for lunch! Enjoy with store-bought hummus, and tzatziki for a speedy meal that is both healthy and satisfying. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) ground cumin
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH sweet smoked paprika and ground turmeric
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground coriander, granulated garlic and onion powder
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground cinnamon, cardamom and ginger
	- Salt and pepper 
	- 1¾ lb (875 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-Fry Strips
	- Grated zest of 1 lemon
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh lemon juice 
	- 3 to 4 cloves garlic, finely minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- Metal skewers
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lemon 
	- Garlic
	- 1¾ lb (875 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-Fry Strips
	- Olive oil
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Ground cumin
	- Sweet smoked paprika
	- Ground turmeric
	- Ground coriander
	- Granulated garlic
	- Onion powder
	- Ground cinnamon, 
	- Ground cardamom
	- Ground ginger
	- Salt 
	- Pepper 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine cumin, paprika, turmeric, coriander, granulated garlic, onion powder, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger and ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper in a small bowl. 
	2. Pat beef strips dry with paper towel and place in a reusable container; add lemon zest and juice, garlic to your taste, olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Stir to coat. Add spice mixture, stirring to ensure the beef is evenly coated. Cover and refrigerate overnight or for up to 24 hours.
	3. Remove beef from marinade; discard marinade. Pat beef dry with paper towel; season all over with salt to your taste. Thread beef onto metal skewers like a ribbon: starting with one end of the beef strip, push it through the skewer; fold the beef over and push through the skewer and repeat until each piece is threaded along on the skewer, pushing ribbon tightly together. Repeat with remaining beef strips and skewers.
	4. Grill on preheated barbecue over high heat (500°F/260°C) for 4 to 6 minutes per side or cooked to medium-rare at the least (145°F/63°C). Transfer to plate and let rest for 10 minutes.
	Set up your grill for direct-heat cooking. Place lit charcoal directly in the centre of the grill, where you plan to cook the skewers. If you’re looking for a smokier flavour, add a couple chunks of wood to the lit coals before adding the grill grate. Sugar maple or apple wood would be a nice flavour pairing with this recipe. Close the lid and allow the grill to preheat to 500°F (260°C), for approximately 10 to 12 minutes. Grill the skewers, with the lid closed, on the grill grate directly over top of the coals for 4 to 6 minutes per side or cooked to medium-rare at the least (145°F/63°C). Transfer to plate and let rest for 10 minutes.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - Charcoal BBQ Instruction
---
Recipe ID: 35bda7b8-011b-44b1-bb4e-8837280447d2
Recipe Title: Slow-Roasted and Grilled Steak with Gremolata-Style Sauce
Recipe Summary: This reverse-engineered method of cooking steak works really well with thick cuts and roasts too. The anchovy in the Gremolata adds a hit of umami flavour while the lemon adds a pop of fresh to counterbalance the richness of the meat.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 55
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 70
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Tomahawk-style Rib Grilling Steak, 1-bone thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- 1 to 2 tsp (5 to 10 mL) steak spice
	-  Gremolata
	- 1 cup (250 mL) chopped fresh parsley (about 1 bunch, stems removed)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) grated lemon zest (about 2 lemons)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 anchovy fillet, minced (or ½ tsp/2 mL anchovy paste)
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) extra virgin olive oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Tomahawk-style Rib Grilling Steak,  1-bone thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- 1 to 2 tsp (5 to 10 mL) steak spice
	- Fresh parsley (about 1 bunch)
	- 2 lemons
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Anchovy fillet or anchovy paste
	- Extra virgin olive oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steak dry with a paper towel. Generously season all over with steak seasoning to your taste.
	2. Place steak on a wire rack on top of a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Insert an oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into steak, avoiding fat and bone. Cook in preheated 275°F oven for about 50 minutes or until the thermometer reads 120°F (49°C). 
	3. Gremolata: Meanwhile, stir together parsley, lemon zest and juice, garlic, anchovy and oil in a bowl; set aside.
	4. Remove steak from oven. Sear steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C), turning once, for 4 to 6 minutes per side for medium-rare, until nicely browned and removing from grill when 10°F (6°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	5. Transfer steak to cutting board, cover loosely with foil and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes. Carve meat from the bone and across the grain into thin slices. Smear Gremolata onto a large serving platter, top with slices of steak, place the bone on the side for a dramatic presentation.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can dry steak prior to cooking by placing steak on a rack on a platter uncovered in the fridge overnight.
---
Recipe ID: 35c15ac6-6459-4bb6-ad68-1ce95d75987b
Recipe Title: Moroccan-Style Grilled Beef Brochettes
Recipe Summary: This recipe features a zingy lemon dressing that works as a 3-for-1 bonus: you get a marinade for the meat, dressing for the couscous and dipping sauce for the brochettes. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 65
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) minced fresh cilantro
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced gingerroot
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 lemon
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) mild curry paste
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) olive oil
	- Pinch salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak,1 inch (2.5 cm) thick, trimmed and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 8 bamboo skewers
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whole wheat couscous
	- 1 EACH sweet red and green pepper, seeded and cut into 1½ inch (4 cm) chunks
	- ½ cup (125 mL) low-fat plain yogurt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 green onions
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Gingerroot
	- 1 lemon
	- Mild curry paste
	- Olive oil
	- Pinch salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak,1 inch (2.5 cm) thick, trimmed and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 8 bamboo skewers
	- Whole wheat couscous
	- 1 EACH sweet red and green pepper, seeded
	- Low-fat plain yogurt
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine ½ cup (125 mL) water, garlic, green onions, cilantro, gingerroot, lemon zest and juice, curry paste, olive oil and salt in a large resealable freezer bag. Pour about ½ cup (125 mL) into measuring cup or bowl and set aside. Add beef to bag, massaging with marinade; seal and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Soak skewers in water for 30 minutes. .
	2. Meanwhile, prepare couscous according to package directions, using 1¼ cups (300 mL) water; stir in ¼ cup (60 mL) of the reserved dressing while fluffing couscous with a fork. Set aside. 
	3. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Pat beef cubes dry with paper towel. Thread beef onto skewers and pepper chunks alternating onto skewers.
	4. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides, until cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	5. Meanwhile, stir remaining reserved dressing into yogurt for dipping sauce. Serve grilled brochettes with couscous and dipping sauce. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Ensure beef cubes are all of similar size to ensure the cubes cook at the same rate.
---
Recipe ID: 35e7e197-04f0-49e3-9812-1c5d2c5c2668
Recipe Title: Stir-Fried Cajun Beef with Couscous 
Recipe Summary: This recipe captures the spicy flavour of jambalaya in a fraction of the usual preparation time. You can buy Cajun spice or make your own in minutes using the recipe here.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 15
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) paprika
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH dried basil and oregano
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) dried thyme
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) garlic powder
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH cayenne pepper and ground mace
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes, drained and juice reserved
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stir-Fry Strips
	- Vegetable oil
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH chopped onion, sliced celery and chopped sweet green pepper
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) corn kernels, frozen, thawed or drained canned
	- Salt and pepper
	- Hot prepared couscous
	- Fresh thyme sprigs or chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) paprika
	- Dried basil
	- Oregano
	- Dried thyme
	- Garlic powder
	- Cayenne pepper
	- Ground mace
	- 1 can diced tomatoes
	- Cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stir-Fry Strips
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onion
	- celery
	- sweet green pepper
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 cup (250 mL) corn kernels, frozen or canned
	- Salt and pepper
	- Hot prepared couscous
	- Fresh thyme sprigs or chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cajun Spice Mix: Combine paprika, basil, oregano, thyme, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, mace and pepper in a glass jar or small bowl. Set 2 tsp (10 mL) aside for stir-fry and store remaining in an airtight container for up to 6 months. (Makes about 3 tbsp/45 mL).
	2. Combine reserved tomato juice and cornstarch in large sealable freezer bag. Add beef strip, massaging marinade into meat; seal bag and refrigerate for 15 to 30 minutes.
	3. Drain meat through colander set over bowl, reserving marinade. Cook beef strips over medium heat in hot lightly oiled nonstick skillet for 1 minute per side, or until browned but still pink inside. Transfer meat to clean bowl.
	4. Add onion, celery, green pepper and garlic to skillet; stir-fry for 3 to 5 minutes or until almost tender-crisp. Stir in the 2 tsp (10 mL) prepared Cajun Spice Mix. Return beef to skillet along with any accumulated juices, reserved marinade, tomatoes and corn. Bring to boil; cook, stirring for 1 to 2 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and thickened slightly. Season with salt and pepper to taste, if desired. Serve over hot couscous and garnish with parsley, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Adding a splash of water to the pan when stir-frying veggies will help prevent scorching.
---
Recipe ID: 36b1ee2f-82ce-4e52-9f8b-0abd43a8f38d
Recipe Title: Baked Ground Beef Enchiladas
Recipe Summary: With a can of this, and a can of that, these enchiladas are a snap to make. If you prefer a fiery version, add a teaspoon or so of chopped canned chipotle peppers in adobo sauce with the tomatoes.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Chuck 
	- 1 large onion, diced
	- 1 large sweet pepper, diced
	- 2 to 3 tbsp (30 to 45 mL) chili powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground cumin
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) tomato sauce
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) black beans, drained and rinsed
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) frozen corn kernels
	- 8 small whole wheat tortillas
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded Cheddar cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Lean Ground Beef Chuck 
	- 1 large onion
	- 1 large sweet pepper
	- Chili powder
	- Ground cumin
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) tomato sauce
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) black beans
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) frozen corn kernels
	- 8 small whole wheat tortillas
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded Cheddar cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook beef, onion, sweet pepper, chili powder and cumin in large saucepan over medium heat or Dutch oven, breaking up beef with a spoon and stirring often, for 8 to 10 minutes or until meat is completely cooked and any liquid has evaporated or drain if necessary.
	2. Stir in tomatoes with juice, tomato sauce, beans and corn. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover, reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes or until slightly thickened.
	3. Spread 2 cups (500 mL) of the chili in 13 x 9-inch (3 L) glass baking dish; set aside. Spoon ½ cup (125 mL) chili onto centre of each of 8 tortillas. Roll up; place seam side down in baking dish. Spoon remaining chili over enchiladas. Sprinkle with cheese. 
	4. Bake in 350°F oven for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbling. 
Recipe Tips:
  - All ground beef comes designated as Extra Lean, Lean, Medium or Regular, based on the maximum fat content. This designation is the same for all ground meats: beef, turkey, veal, chicken, pork and lamb.
---
Recipe ID: 3715d461-efab-444b-9b47-e9bdb3216e82
Recipe Title: Baked Individual Ground Beef Wellingtons  
Recipe Summary: These individual Beef Wellingtons are made with ground beef instead of the traditional beef tenderloin, making them a delicious, yet cost effective, way to serve a special meal to your family and friends. The ground beef is seasoned well, topped with duxelles (a mixture of chopped mushrooms, shallots, garlic, and thyme), neatly folded into thin slices of prosciutto, then wrapped in prepared puff pastry to create beautiful little packages, which are bursting with big flavour. 
Recipe Prep Time: 45
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 50
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Duxelles
		- 1 lb (500 g) cremini mushrooms
		- 2 shallots, chopped
		- 4 cloves garlic, chopped
		- 3 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves removed, stems discarded
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) unsalted butter
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Marsala wine
		- ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Beef Patties
		- 2 eggs
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Dijon mustard
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) prepared horseradish
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) Worcestershire sauce
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt, fresh ground pepper, onion powder and garlic powder
		- ⅓ cup (75 mL) panko bread crumbs
		- 2 lb (1 kg) Lean Ground Beef
	- To Assemble
		- 2 sheets cold puff pastry (about 1 lb/500 g), thawed if frozen 
		- All-purpose flour
		- 16 thin slices prosciutto (about 8 oz/250 g)
		- 2 eggs
	- Marsala Mushroom Sauce (optional)
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) unsalted butter
		- 8 oz (250 g) cremini mushrooms, sliced
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) all-purpose flour
		- 1 cup (250 mL) Marsala wine
		- 1½ cups (375 mL) beef broth
		- 3 small sprigs fresh thyme
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) cremini mushrooms
	- 2 shallots
	- Garlic, chopped
	- Fresh thyme
	- Panko bread crumbs
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Lean Ground Beef
	- 16 thin slices prosciutto (about 8 oz/250 g)
	- Dijon mustard
	- Prepared horseradish
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Onion powder
	- Garlic powder
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- 2 sheets frozen or prepared cold puff pastry (about 1 lb/500 g) 
	- Eggs
	- Unsalted butter
	- Marsala wine
	- For Marsala Mushroom Sauce (optional)
	- 8 oz (250 g) cremini mushrooms, sliced
	- Beef broth
	- All-purpose flour
	- 1 cup (250 mL) Marsala wine
	- Unsalted butter
Recipe Methods:
	1. Duxelles: Combine mushrooms, shallots, garlic and thyme in a food processor; pulse until finely chopped.&nbsp;
	2. Heat a large sauté pan or skillet over medium heat; add butter and swirl until melted. Add the mushroom mixture, Marsala, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring often, for 10 to 12 minutes or until most of the liquid has evaporated. Set aside to cool.
	3. Once cooled, use a cheesecloth or fine mesh strainersieve to drain the mushroom mixture of any remaining liquid; discard liquid. Separate mushroom mixture into 8 equal portions and set aside until ready to assemble.
	4. Beef Patties: Beat eggs, Dijon mustard, horseradish, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, onion powder and garlic powder with a fork in a large bowl. Mix in bread crumbs, then ground beef with the fork until thoroughly combined (careful not to over-mix). Scoop beef using a ½-cup (125 mL) measuring cup and form into 8 equal beef patties, about 1¼ inches (3 cm) thick. Place on a plate.
	5. To Assemble: Roll out one sheet of the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a 12-inch (30 cm) square, then cut into 4 equal squares.
	6. Lay 2 pieces of prosciutto onto each square of puff pastry, overlapping as necessary (the prosciutto will extend beyond the pastry square). Place one beef patty on top of the prosciutto; place one portion of the mushroom mixture on top of each beef patty and flatten out into an even layer. Flip the beef patty over so the mushroom mixture is sitting on the prosciutto. Fold the prosciutto slices over the beef to completely wrap the patty. Flip the bundle over, so the prosciutto ends are on the puff pastry.
	7. Fold the puff pastry up and over the prosciutto-wrapped patty as though wrapping a package. Using a pastry brush or your finger, dampen the puff pastry at each edge where the pastry folds over itself to securely seal all edges. Place the individual packages seam-side up on a large parchment paper-lined baking sheet, spacing them apart. Repeat with the remaining puff pastry and filling.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	8. Beat 2 tbsp (30 mL) water into the eggs in a small bowl to make an egg wash. Brush mixture over the tops and sides of each package. Pierce each Wellington with a sharp knife to create a ½-inch (1 cm) vent on top.
	9. Bake in preheated to 400°F oven for about 40 to 45 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown and a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into each patty reads 160°F (71°C). Transfer Wellingtons on baking sheet to a rack and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
	10. Marsala Mushroom Sauce (if using): Melt butter over medium-high heat in a large sauté pan or skillet. Cook mushrooms and thyme, stirring, for 7 to 8 minutes or until starting to soften. Sprinkle with flour and cook, stirring for 1 minute. Add Marsala and cook, stirring, for 1 minute; add beef broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring often, for about 5 to 8 minutes until sauce is thickened. Serve alongside the Individual Ground Beef Wellingtons.
Recipe Tips:
  - To make ahead, prepare the Duxelles Beef and Patties and wrap in prosciutto. Wrap well and refrigerate for up to 24 hours. You can assemble the puff pastry packages up to 2 hours in advance. Cover and refrigerate, then brush with egg wash just before baking. In place of the Mushroom Marsala Sauce, you can make your favourite beef gravy to accompany the Ground Beef Wellingtons.
---
Recipe ID: 375e5410-f42d-4fa5-95d8-e3309f066ee2
Recipe Title: Stir-Fried Honey-Ginger Fast-Fry Steak Strips 
Recipe Summary: The stir-fry method refers to cooking food over medium-high to high heat, stirring and tossing often, so everything cooks evenly. Serve over cooked fragrant basmati or jasmine rice. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH soy sauce and liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sriracha 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil 
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Eye of Round Fast-fry Steaks, cut into ¼-inch (5 mm) wide strips
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH minced garlic and gingerroot
	- 1 large carrot, thinly sliced
	- 1 sweet red pepper, thinly sliced
	- 1 can (14 oz/398mL) baby corn, drained and rinsed
	- 8 baby bok choy, quartered
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 1 large carrot
	- 1 sweet red pepper
	- 8 baby bok choy
	- Green onions
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Eye of Round Fast-fry Steaks
	- Vegetable oil 
	- Soy sauce
	- Liquid honey
	- Sriracha 
	- Cornstarch 
	- 1 can (14 oz/398mL) baby corn
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, honey, sriracha and cornstarch in a small bowl; set sauce aside.
	2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in large wok or nonstick skillet. Add beef strips, garlic and gingerroot; stir-fry for 2 minutes or until meat is cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF) and browned but still pink inside. Transfer to a clean bowl; tent with foil to keep warm.
	3. Add carrot, red pepper, baby corn and bok choy to skillet; stir-fry for 3 to 5 minutes or until almost tender-crisp. Return beef with any accumulated juices to skillet, along with the reserved sauce; bring to a boil. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and thickened, beef is heated through and vegetables are just tender. Remove from heat; stir in green onions.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - Save prep time by using 4 cups (1 L) Asian-blend frozen vegetables in place of the carrot, sweet pepper, corn and bok choy, and use tubes or jars of puréed garlic and gingerroot, found in the produce section.
---
Recipe ID: 37e47a09-643d-4fe8-bba6-f25ca393c869
Recipe Title: Beef Kreplach
Recipe Summary: This kreplach recipe by Chef Phillip Walters is a uniquely-presented version of these Jewish traditional dumplings in broth. The dumplings, filled with beef seasoned with fresh herbs, in an aromatic, richly-flavoured chicken broth are elevated even further with crispy carrot chips and a fresh dill oil for garnish. 
Recipe Prep Time: 90
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 660
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 750
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Carrot Chips
		- 1 medium carrot
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and granulated sugar
	- Broth
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) black peppercorns
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH fennel seeds and dill seeds
		- 1 whole chicken (about 4 lb/2 kg), quartered
		- 7 medium carrots, chopped
		- 2 large onions, quartered
		- 4 sprigs thyme
		- 3 bay leaves
		- 8 cups (2 L) unsalted chicken stock or broth
		- 1 bunch EACH fresh parsley and dill
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Dill Oil
		- 1 bunch dill (2 oz/60 g)
		- 1 bunch parsley (2 oz/60 g)
		- ½ cup (125 mL) neutral-flavoured oil, such as canola or grapeseed 
	- Dough
		- 3 cups (750 mL) all-purpose flour (approx)
		- 4 eggs
	- Filling
		- Half onion, finely chopped
		- 1 EACH carrot and stalk celery, finely chopped
		- 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
		- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef 
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH chopped fresh thyme, parsley and dill
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH smoked paprika and Worcestershire sauce
		- 1 egg, lightly beaten
		- ½ cup (125 mL) cold cooked rice
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper (approx)
	- Kreplach Assembly
		- 1 egg
		- Additional fresh herbs (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 9 medium carrot
	- Salt 
	- Granulated sugar
	- Black peppercorns
	- Fennel seeds and dill seeds
	- 1 whole chicken (about 4 lb/2 kg), quartered
	- 3 large onions
	- 4 sprigs thyme
	- 3 bay leaves
	- 2 L unsalted chicken stock or broth
	- 2 bunches EACH fresh parsley and dill
	- Canola or grapeseed oil
	- All-purpose flour  
	- Eggs
	- 1 stalk celery
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef 
	- Smoked paprika 
	- Worcestershire sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Carrot Chips: Cut carrot crosswise into very thin slices using a mandolin or sharp knife. Arrange in a single layer on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet&nbsp; and season lightly with salt and sugar. Dehydrate for 8 hours in a preheated 150°F oven or until crispy. Let cool completely. Set aside. (Make ahead: Chips can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days).
	2. Broth: Combine peppercorns, fennel seeds and dill seeds in a large pot. Toast over low heat, stirring, just until fragrant. Add chicken, carrots, onions, thyme, bay leaves and chicken stock. Bring to a simmer. Simmer, skimming often, for 2½ hours. 
	3. Turn off heat and add parsley and dill. Let stand to infuse herbs for 30 minutes. Strain through a cheesecloth-lined colander into another large pot; discard solids. Season with salt and ground pepper. Set aside. (Make ahead: The broth can be cooled, covered and refrigerated for up to 3 days.)
	4. Dill Oil: Meanwhile, combine dill, parsley, salt and oil in a blender. Blend until the mixture is very smooth and starts to warm slightly. Pour through a cheesecloth-lined sieve set over a measuring cup or bowl and let oil drain. Discard solids and transfer green oil into a squeeze bottle. Set aside at room temperature. (Make ahead: Oil can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.)
	5. Dough: Combine flour and eggs in a food processor or stand mixer fitted with dough hook and process or mix until a smooth dough forms. Transfer dough to a lightly floured work surface and knead for several minutes until the dough springs back when pressed with fingers. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and let it rest in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour. 
	6. Filling: Cook carrot, onion, celery and garlic over medium heat in a large skillet, stirring occasionally, for about 7 minutes or until translucent and just starting to soften. Remove from heat, transfer to a bowl and refrigerate until cold.
	7. Combine cold vegetable mixture, ground beef, thyme, parsley, dill, smoked paprika, Worcestershire sauce, egg and rice in a stand mixer with paddle attachment or bowl. Mix or knead by hand until the filling comes together and has a tacky feel. Season with salt and pepper to your taste. 
	8. Kreplach Assembly: Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface using a rolling pin until very thin (about ⅛ to 1/16 inch/1 to 2 mm thick), see Tip. Cut out rounds using a 3-inch (8 cm) round cutter, cutting a total of 40 rounds of dough. Discard the trim.
	9. Whisk egg with 2 tbsp (30 mL) water in a small bowl to make egg wash. Working with a few at a time, place 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the filling in the centre of each round, brush edges of dough with the egg wash. Fold dough in half over filling to create a half-moon shape; pinch around the edges to seal. Place kreplach on a floured baking sheet, spacing them apart; cover and refrigerate until ready to poach, for up to 12 hours.
	10. To Serve: Bring chicken broth to a boil over medium-high heat in a large saucepan. Bring another pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add kreplach to boiling water, in batches as necessary to avoid crowding the pot, and cook for about 3 minutes or until dumplings are al dente and filling is thoroughly cooked. Lift from boiling water using a slotted spoon or metal sieve and place 5 kreplach into each warmed serving bowl.
	11. Garnish with a carrot chip and fresh herbs, as desired. Ladle hot broth into each bowl until it half submerges the beef kreplach. Squeeze a couple of dollops of dill oil around the broth and serve immediately. 
Recipe Tips: ???
Recipe Tips:
  - When rolling out the dough you’ll need a very large work surface as the dough must be very thin. Divide the dough in half or thirds and roll out in batches, as necessary, keeping the remaining dough wrapped and the filling separately and in the refrigerator until needed. Extra carrot chips can be enjoyed as a snack or as a chip for dipping, or as a salad or carrot dessert garnish. Extra dill oil can be incorporated into a vinaigrette, for fish crudo or in a marinade.
---
Recipe ID: 38310692-2440-4aef-bbdb-b2d062bf75cb
Recipe Title: Grilled Slow-Roasted Maple Basted Beef
Recipe Summary: Not for the faint of heart, this gooey beef rib recipe offers rib-eating satisfaction from ear to ear and are great for dramatic presentation. This makes lots of sauce for dipping!
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 150
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ½ cup (125 mL) barbecue sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 onion, diced
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) tomato sauce
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) EACH maple syrup and red wine vinegar
	- ¼ cup (50 mL) tomato paste
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced canned chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 onion
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) tomato sauce
	- Maple syrup
	- Red wine vinegar
	- ¼ cup (50 mL) tomato paste
	- Minced canned chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- Worcestershire sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Season ribs with salt and pepper. Grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 5 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally, until browned all over. Transfer to a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet.
	2. Thin barbecue sauce with 2 to 3 tbsp (30 to 45 mL) water and pour over ribs. Fold foil over or over-wrap with another sheet of foil and seal edges to make a foil pouch. Roast in 250°F oven, or over indirect heat on low (250°F) in a closed barbecue, for 2 to 3 hours until meat is fork tender.
	3. Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in a saucepan. Cook garlic and onion, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in tomato sauce, maple syrup, vinegar, tomato paste, chipotle peppers and Worcestershire sauce and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat. Reserve approximately 2 cups (500 mL) of sauce for dipping.
	4. Unwrap ribs and drain off liquid. Brush ribs all over with the remaining sauce. If desired, grill over medium-high heat for 2 to 3 minutes, turning once, until ribs are grill-marked and glazed. Cut between ribs and serve with the reserved sauce for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use bottled smoky-flavoured barbecue sauce instead of making one from scratch for basting and dipping. You’ll need 2 to 3 cups (500 to 750 mL).
---
Recipe ID: 38ac6d45-066c-4899-a149-4499b331cb36
Recipe Title: Porcini-Rubbed Oven Roast with Red Wine Sauce
Recipe Summary: The combination of mushrooms, beef and red wine is a classic that’s always a favourite. The ground porcini mushrooms create a delicious crust on the roast and provide big flavour to the gravy. Look for dried mushrooms in the produce section of the grocery store. ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 195
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 210
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ oz (14 g) dried porcini mushrooms
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) salt 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH fresh ground pepper and dried thyme leaves
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 5 lb (2.2 kg) Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	- Red Wine Sauce
		- 1 pkg (227 g) sliced white button or cremini mushrooms
		- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine 
		- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and freshly ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- ½ oz (14 g) dried porcini mushrooms
	- Dried thyme leaves
	- Vegetable oil
	- 5 lb (2.2 kg)  Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	- Red Wine Sauce
	- 1 pkg (227 g) sliced white button or cremini mushrooms
	- Dry red wine
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Cornstarch
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pulse dried porcini mushrooms in a spice grinder or mini food processor until finely ground (makes about 2 tbsp/30 mL powder). Combine ground porcini, salt, pepper and thyme in a small bowl. Transfer 2 tbsp (30 mL) to another small bowl and reserve for the gravy. 
	2. Drizzle oil all over roast and sprinkle with remaining porcini seasoning; rub all over meat until evenly coated. Place roast, bones down, on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast avoiding fat and bones. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2¾ to 3¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before carving. 
	Red Wine Sauce: : 
		4. Meanwhile, drain off all but 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the fat from drippings and discard. Set roasting pan over medium heat; add mushrooms and cook, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes or until tender and browned around the edges. Stir in reserved porcini seasoning until well combined. Add wine; simmer, stirring and scraping up brown bits from pan, for 2 minutes or until reduced by half. Add broth and simmer for 5 minutes. Combine cornstarch with ½ cup (125 mL) cold water; gradually whisk into sauce and simmer, whisking, for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened and glossy. Season with salt and pepper. 
		 5. Cut twine from roast and discard. Position roast with the thick side down and bones vertically on cutting board and cut meat along the bone to separate meat from the bones. Carve meaty portion of the roast across the grain into slices and serve with Red Wine Sauce. Cut between bones into individual ribs and serve on the side, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can substitute dried porcini mushrooms with a mixture of other dried mushrooms.
---
Recipe ID: 38cbdfef-34fb-4b5f-aef0-dccdf5ad514c
Recipe Title: Sheet-pan Roasted Mediterranean Vegetables
Recipe Summary: This medley of vegetables roasts all on one pan, and low-and-slow to pair along with your favourite beef oven roast.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 110
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 oz (250 g) zucchini (about 2) 
	- 3 plum tomatoes, cored and quartered
	- 1 small red onion, cut lengthwise into thin wedges
	- 1 baby eggplant, cut into chunks
	- 1 EACH sweet red and yellow pepper, seeded and cut into chunks
	- 4 oz (125 g) mushrooms, quartered
	- 6 cloves garlic, peeled
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) prepared basil pesto
	- Vegetable oil cooking spray
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) liquid honey
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut each zucchini in half lengthwise; cut each half crosswise into ½-inch (1 cm) slices. Place in a large bowl.
	2. Add tomatoes, onion, eggplant, red and yellow peppers, mushrooms, garlic and pesto; toss to coat. Spread on foil-lined rimmed baking sheet lightly coated with vegetable oil cooking spray.
	3. Roast vegetables in preheated 275°F oven for about 1½ hours or until tender.
	 4. Scrape vegetables into large serving bowl with a heatproof spatula; toss with vinegar and honey.
Recipe Tips: ???
