Recipe ID: 3ac7f61f-3ed4-4936-93d1-b5d77f4032e5
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Beef Osso Buco
Recipe Summary: If you’ve never had the time to try out this classic braised dish you may now have the opportunity if you have a programmable pressure cooker in your kitchen. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter, divided
	- 4 slices Beef Centre Cut Shank, each 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground black pepper
	- 1 onion, finely diced
	- 2 carrots, finely diced
	- 1 stalk celery, finely diced
	- 3 cloves garlic, sliced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- ½ cup (125 mL) dry red wine
	- 1 cup (250 mL) drained canned diced tomatoes
	- ½ cup (125 mL) beef broth
	- 4 sprigs fresh thyme
	- 2 sprigs fresh rosemary
	- 2 bay leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Butter
	- 4 slices  Beef Centre Cut Shank,  each 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground black pepper
	- 1 onion
	- 2 carrots
	- 1 stalk celery
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Tomato paste
	- Dry red wine
	- Canned diced tomatoes
	- Beef broth
	- 4 sprigs fresh thyme
	- 2 sprigs fresh rosemary
	- 2 bay leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Preheat electric pressure cooker on the sear/sauté function.
	2. Season the beef all over with salt and pepper. Melt 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter in pressure cooker pot. Add beef shanks, in batches, and cook, turning once, for about 5 minutes per side or until browned. Transfer to a plate and repeat with remaining shanks.
	3. Add remaining 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter to pot. Add onion, carrots, celery and garlic; cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until softened. Stir in tomato paste and red wine and simmer for 2 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, beef broth, thyme, rosemary and bay leaves. Nestle the beef shank back into the pot and pour in any accumulated juices.
	4. Seal the electric pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to HIGH and time for 40 minutes.
	5. When the timer beeps, let pressure release naturally for 10 minutes. Quick release any remaining pressure. Carefully lift the meat with the bone from the sauce with a slotted spoon into serving bowls. Discard herb stems and bay leaves from sauce. Spoon sauce over beef.
Recipe Tips:
  - The flavours of braised beef in sauce meld together as the dish sits so it tastes better the next day. Gently re-heat in the electric pressure cooker, oven or slow cooker to serve.
---
Recipe ID: 3afcd047-2187-4088-a037-4331b547a567
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Sweet and Sticky Beef Pot Roast
Recipe Summary: With a sweet and tangy cola-based sauce, this brisket is tasty when sliced and served in burger buns topped with your favourite coleslaw. It’s also great served with steamed rice and broccoli, and a garnish of green onions and sesame seeds. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 100
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sweet paprika
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Flat Portion (Pot Roast)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided (approx.)
	- 1 onion, finely chopped 
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH cola and ketchup
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH Worcestershire sauce, balsamic vinegar and soy sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Sweet paprika
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Flat Portion (Pot Roast)
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 onion
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Cola
	- Ketchup
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Soy sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Preheat electric pressure cooker on the sear/sauté function.
	2. Combine paprika, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat beef dry with paper towel; if beef is too large to lay flat in pot, cut into 2 equal pieces. Season all over with spice mixture. 
	3. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil in pressure cooker pot. Brown beef, one piece at a time if necessary, turning and adding more oil as needed, until browned all over. Transfer to a plate. 
	4. Add onion and garlic to pot. Cook, stirring constantly, for 2 to 3 minutes or until starting to soften. 
	5. Meanwhile, combine cola, ketchup, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar and soy sauce in a medium bowl. Return beef to the pot with any accumulated juices; pour in cola mixture. 
	 6. Seal the electric pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to HIGH and time for 60 minutes.
	7. When the timer beeps, let pressure release naturally for 10 minutes. Quick release any remaining pressure. 
	8. Transfer beef to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Skim fat from sauce; discard. 
	9. Meanwhile, set electric pressure cooker on the sear/sauté function; bring sauce to a boil. Boil, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes or until thickened to the consistency of a thin barbecue sauce.
	10. Carve beef across the grain into thin slices and serve with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Add 1 tsp (5 mL) sriracha or sambal oelek in step 5 to give the sauce a touch of heat.
---
Recipe ID: 3b1ade6f-fca8-4bbc-bf2f-05775a8d441b
Recipe Title: Smoky Mexican-Style Braised Beef Roast
Recipe Summary: Flavoured with smoky canned chipotles in adobo sauce and accented with citrus and cumin, this braised beef is so satisfying served with rice and beans with fresh salsa, or use as a filling for tacos, burritos, enchiladas, or quesadillas, or as a topping for nachos.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 195
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 210
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Point Portion (Pot Roast)
	- 1¼ tsp (6 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 1 onion, finely chopped
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) ground cumin
	- 2 canned chipotles in adobo sauce, finely chopped
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) adobo sauce
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) strained puréed tomatoes (passata)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ½ cup (125 mL) fresh orange juice
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) packed brown sugar
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Point Portion (Pot Roast)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 onion
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Ground cumin
	- 2 canned chipotles in adobo sauce
	- Adobo sauce
	- Strained puréed tomatoes (passata)
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Fresh orange juice
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Packed brown sugar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat beef dry with paper towel. Season all over with 1 tsp (5 mL) each salt and pepper. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster; brown beef, turning, until browned all over. Transfer to a plate. 
	2. Reduce heat to medium and add remaining oil to pot. Add onion, garlic, cumin and remaining salt and pepper. Cook, stirring often, for 3 to 5 minutes or until starting to soften. Stir in chipotles and adobo sauce; cook for 1 minute. 
	3. Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, broth, orange juice, lime juice and sugar in a large measuring cup or medium bowl. 
	4. Return beef and any accumulated juices to pot. Pour tomato mixture over meat. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for about 3 to 3½ hours or until meat is fork-tender. 
	5. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Skim fat from sauce; discard. Keep sauce warm over low heat. 
	6. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - For a party-style taco feast when feeding a crowd, serve with warm tortillas, guacamole, sour cream and shredded Monterey Jack or crumbled feta cheese.
---
Recipe ID: 3b1cd0e6-b51f-49ed-9d3c-e4054c4ca2c3
Recipe Title: Polenta with Cheese and Herbs
Recipe Summary: Change up your potato and pasta routine with soft polenta – the ultimate comfort food. You can also change up the cheese and herbs in the recipe to suit your tastes or whatever ingredients you have on hand. This is a super simple side dish for saucy slow-cooked braised pot roasts, beef osso buco or short ribs.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 cups (750 mL) 2% milk
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) salt
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) coarse cornmeal
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) grated Parmesan cheese
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh basil or parsley
	- Fresh ground pepper (optional)
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine milk, salt and 3 cups (750 mL) water in a deep saucepan. Bring just to a boil over medium-high heat. Gradually sprinkle in cornmeal, whisking constantly, until incorporated.
	2. Switch to a wooden spoon to stir. Reduce heat to medium-low and boil gently, stirring and adjusting heat as necessary to maintain a gentle boil, for about 10 minutes or until thick enough to mound on a spoon, the grains are tender and polenta is fairly smooth. Remove from heat and stir in Parmesan and basil. Season with pepper to taste, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Spread any leftover polenta into an oiled baking dish, let cool, then cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Remove from the dish and cut into squares. Reheat spaced apart on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet in a 375°F (190°C) oven for about 10 minutes or pan-fry in an oiled nonstick skillet over medium heat.
---
Recipe ID: 3b42b35e-61a9-4f3b-bcab-35776b86b598
Recipe Title: Asian-Style Oven-Roasted Beef with Barley and Mushrooms
Recipe Summary: The beef is marinated with Asian seasonings just for flavour, reserving the marinade to use in the flavourful Finishing Sauce. Although relatively easy to make, there are quite a few components to this recipe. Simplify the dish by making the Barley and Mushrooms ahead warming them just before serving.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 75
Recipe Marinating Time: 120
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 215
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Marinade and Beef
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH oyster or soy sauce and rice vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH granulated sugar and fish sauce
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) miso paste
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Oven Roast, Petite Tender
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH coarse salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Mushroom Barley
	- 1 cup (250 mL) pearl barley
	- 3 cups (750 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 pkg (½ oz/14 g) dried mushrooms
	- 1 cup (250 mL) boiling water
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced fresh parsley
	- Sautéed Mushrooms and Finishing Sauce 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) butter
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) extra virgin olive oil 
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced 
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) mixed fresh mushrooms, about 6 cups (1.5 L), thinly sliced 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH coarse salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) minced fresh parsley
	- 1 cup (250 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Oyster or soy sauce
	- Rice vinegar
	- Granulated sugar
	- Fish sauce
	- Miso paste
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Oven Roast, Petite Tender
	- Coarse salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Pearl barley
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Dried mushrooms
	- Fresh parsley
	- Butter
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) mixed fresh mushrooms, about 6 cups (1.5 L)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Marinade and Beef: Combine oyster sauce, vinegar, sugar, fish sauce, miso paste and garlic in a sealable freezer bag. Add beef, massaging with marinade; seal and refrigerate for 2 hours. 
	2. Mushroom Barley: Meanwhile, combine barley and beef broth in a medium saucepan. Bring to boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for about 30 minutes or until barley is tender. 
	3. Combine dried mushrooms with boiling water in a heatproof bowl; let stand for 10 minutes. Drain, reserving liquid for Finishing Sauce; coarsely chop soaked mushrooms. Stir chopped soaked mushrooms and parsley into barley in saucepan; keep warm. (Make-ahead: Transfer to airtight container and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Reheat in saucepan over medium-low heat or microwave before serving.)
	4. Beef: Remove beef from marinade; pour marinade into a bowl, cover and refrigerate. Pat beef dry and season all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat in heavy oven-proof skillet; add beef and cook, turning, for about 8 minutes until brown all over.
	5. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer lengthwise into centre of roast and place a small rack in the pan. Roast on rack, uncovered, in preheated 350°F oven for about 25 to 30 minutes for medium-rare or until thermometer reads 145°F (63°C) at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	6. Sautéed Mushrooms: Meanwhile, cooking in two equal batches, heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) each butter and olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat; add half each of the garlic, mushrooms, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, for about 12 minutes or until liquid is evaporated and mushrooms are golden brown; transfer to a bowl and set aside. Repeat with second batch. Add reserved mushrooms back to pan; stir in parsley. (Make-ahead: Transfer to airtight container and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Reheat in skillet over medium heat before serving.)
	7. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover loosely with foil and let rest for at least 5 minutes
	8. Finishing Sauce: Heat pan drippings in roasting pan over medium-high heat. Add reserved marinade, reserved mushroom soaking liquid and beef stock; bring to a boil, scraping up brown bits from pan. Increase heat to high heat and boil for about 5 minutes or until reduced by half. Stir in remaining 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter until melted. 
	9. To serve, carve beef across the grain into thin slices and serve with Mushroom Barley and Sautéed Mushrooms; top with Finishing Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Patting beef dry before cooking helps bump up beef flavour since the beef browns better.
---
Recipe ID: 3b5eeed7-cecd-4cf9-8797-05ebb4201227
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Classic Beef Stew
Recipe Summary: An electric pressure cooker cooks up melt-in-your-mouth tender beef and vegetables in a fraction of the time and with minimal effort. Have a hearty, warming stew on the table in less than an hour.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 45
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 65
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg) Beef Centre Cut Shank, 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick pieces
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 onions, diced
	- 3 cloves garlic, sliced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) tomato paste
	- ½ cup (125 mL) beef broth
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce 
	- 3 carrots, diced
	- 2 celery stalks, diced
	- 2 sprigs fresh thyme (or ½ tsp/2 mL dried)
	- 1 sprig fresh rosemary (or ¼ tsp/1 mL dried)
	- 4 yellow-fleshed (Yukon Gold) potatoes, peeled and quartered (about 1 lb/450 g)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
	- 1 cup (250 mL) frozen peas
	- Fresh parsley leaves (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg)  Beef Centre Cut Shank,  1-inch (2.5 cm) thick pieces
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 onions
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Tomato paste
	- Beef broth
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- 3 carrots
	- 2 celery stalks
	- 2 sprigs fresh thyme (or ½ tsp/2 mL dried)
	- 1 sprig fresh rosemary (or ¼ tsp/1 mL dried)
	- 4 yellow-fleshed (Yukon Gold) potatoes
	- Cornstarch
	- Frozen peas
	- Fresh parsley leaves (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Preheat electric pressure cooker on the sear/sauté function.
	2. Season the beef all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil in pressure cooker pot. Add beef shanks, in batches, and cook, turning once, for about 5 min per side or until browned. Transfer to a plate and repeat with remaining shanks.
	 3. Add onion and garlic; cook, stirring, for 3 to 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in tomato paste, Worcestershire and beef broth. Scraping any bits off the bottom with a wooden spoon. Stir in carrots, celery, thyme and rosemary, then potatoes. Layer beef on top and pour in any accumulated juices
	4. Seal the electric pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to HIGH and time for 25 minutes.
	5. When the timer beeps, let pressure release naturally for 10 minutes. Quick release any remaining pressure. Remove the beef bones with a fork, pulling the meat into bite-sized pieces as you go. Scoop the marrow from the centre of the bones and stir it back into the stew.
	6. Set pressure cooker to Sauté or necessary setting to keep the sauce at a simmer. Stir cornstarch mixture and gradually stir into the stew along with the peas. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until stew thickened and peas are hot. Serve garnished with parsley, if desired
Recipe Tips:
  - Browning the beef before simmering gives beef stew a rich colour and flavour. Brown beef in batches to avoid overcrowding the pot. Overcrowding will cause the meat to steam rather than brown.
---
Recipe ID: 3b977aac-de2d-4523-ab33-3759589fbd6b
Recipe Title: Grilled Pub-Style Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Create that British pub steak experience at home with this easy, yet packed-with-flavour marinade–no long marinating time required for tender Grilling Steaks, just enough time to infuse the flavour. Serve roasted root vegetables alongside your juice steak.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH prepared horseradish and grainy Dijon mustard
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried thyme, crushed (or 1 tbsp/15 mL minced fresh parsley or chives)
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 2 Beef T-bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Vegetable oil
	- Prepared horseradish
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Fresh parsley or chives (or 1 tsp/5 mL dried thyme)
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 2 Beef T-bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine Worcestershire sauce, oil, horseradish, mustard, thyme, garlic and pepper in a sealable freezer bag. Add steak to bag, turning to coat; seal bag and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes. 
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat dry with paper towel. Grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
	3. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice across the grain to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 3d9f117a-f1c6-4af9-9c30-4e3b07698911
Recipe Title: Thai Yellow Curry with Beef (Gaeng Garee Nuea)
Recipe Summary: In Thailand, yellow curry or gaeng garee is a specialty of Thai Muslims, so beef is a common meat pairing. In Thailand, when we make curry with beef, we like to cook it separately from the curry sauce so that the curry will maintain bright colour, and it also saves time as the curry sauce can be made while the beef is being cooked. I’ve chosen the well-marbled top blade steak for this as it isn’t too lean, and it’s also not too chewy which reduces the amount of cooking time. Since beef can take a long time to tenderize, the way to make this curry weeknight-friendly is to thinly slice the beef rather than cutting it into large cubes; a trick I learned working in a Thai restaurant. This will also allow the flavor of the curry to penetrate the beef in a shorter amount of time. Another stew-friendly cut can also be used, though it may take longer to cook. Serve the curry with steamed jasmine rice.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Top Blade Simmering Steaks 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- 5 to 6 tbsp (75 to 90 mL) Thai yellow curry paste (store bought or recipe in Tip*), divided
	- 2 cups (500 mL) coconut milk, divided
	- 4 tsp to 2 tbsp (20 to 30 mL) finely chopped palm sugar or brown sugar
	- 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) tamarind paste
	- 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) fish sauce
	- 10 oz (300 g) mini potatoes or new potatoes, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks 
	- Half onion, cut lengthwise into slivers
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) halved grape or cherry tomatoes
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 10 oz (300 g) mini potatoes or new potatoes 
	- 1 onion
	- Grape or cherry tomatoes
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Top Blade Simmering Steaks 
	- Salt
	- 5 to 6 tbsp (75 to 90 mL) Thai yellow curry paste (store bought or see recipe)
	- 2 cups (500 mL) coconut milk
	- Palm sugar or brown sugar
	- Tamarind paste
	- Fish sauce
	- Homemade Yellow Curry Paste
	- 1 stalk lemongrass
	- Gingerroot 
	- Galangal
	- Fresh turmeric (or ground turmeric)
	- Garlic
	- Shallots
	- Dried mild chilies
	- Coriander seeds
	- Cumin seeds
	- White peppercorns
	- Salt
	- Curry powder
	- Fermented shrimp paste
Recipe Methods:
	1. Slice the steak across the grain into ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick slices and place in a saucepan. Add enough water to completely submerge the beef; add salt and 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of the curry paste. Bring to a simmer over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or until fork tender.
	2. Meanwhile, bring ¾ cup (175 mL) coconut milk to a boil over medium-high heat in a large heavy saucepan. Stir in remaining curry paste, mixing well. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring constantly, for 5 to 8 minutes or until very thick and coconut oil separates from the paste (the oil may not separate depending on the coconut milk you’re using; this is okay).
	3. Stir in remaining coconut milk, 4 tsp (20 mL) sugar, 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the tamarind paste and 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the fish sauce and bring to a boil. Add potatoes and onion and simmer for 5 minutes (the potatoes should not be fully cooked at this point). Remove from heat and set aside.
	4. When beef is tender, use a slotted spoon to transfer the beef into the curry sauce. Stir in just enough of the beef cooking liquid to keep beef and vegetables barely submerged.&nbsp;
	5. Bring curry to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Taste the sauce and adjust seasoning with more fish sauce, tamarind or sugar as needed.
	6. Stir in the tomatoes. Turn off heat and allow the tomatoes to soften in the residual heat for about 1 minute.
Recipe Tips:
  - *To make Homemade Yellow Curry Paste: Combine 0.7 oz (20 g) dried mild chilies, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) chunks, 1 tbsp (15 mL) coriander seeds, toasted, 1½ tsp (7 mL) cumin seeds, toasted, ½ tsp (2 mL) white peppercorns in a spice or coffee grinder and grind into a fine powder.To use mortar and pestle: Combine 1 stalk lemongrass, bottom half only, finely sliced, 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped gingerroot, 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped galangal and 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh turmeric (or ½ tsp/2 mL ground turmeric) and 1 tsp (5 mL) salt in mortar and pound with pestle into a paste. Add 6 cloves garlic, finely chopped, ½ cup (125 mL) finely chopped shallots and 1 tbsp (15 mL) curry powder and pound into a paste. Add ground chili mixture and 2 tsp (10 mL) fermented shrimp paste and pound into a fine paste. To use immersion blender: Combine 1 stalk lemongrass, bottom half only, finely sliced, 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped gingerroot, 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped galangal and 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh turmeric (or ½ tsp/2 mL ground turmeric) and 1 tsp (5 mL) salt, 6 cloves garlic, finely chopped, ½ cup (125 mL) finely chopped shallots, 1 tbsp (15 mL) curry powder and 2 tsp (10 mL) fermented shrimp paste in a narrow container such as a glass measuring cup and purée with immersion until fine. You’ll need to lift and reposition the blender multiple times as the paste is thick. Once the paste is fine, add the ground chili mixture and blend to mix well. Use immediately or store curry paste in airtight containers in the freezer for up to 6 months.
---
Recipe ID: 3df6ac06-209c-4fed-ab19-46ef67cbb345
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef Tongue with Chimichurri
Recipe Summary: Beef tongue is easily tenderized by slowly poaching for a couple of hours. Once poached and skin is removed, it can be sliced thinly for a quick sear on the grill before serving with a bright sauce like the chimichurri, an Argentinian classic!
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 185
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 215
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Tongue  (2 to 3 lb /1 to 1.5 kg)
	- 1 large onion, cut in half
	- 6 whole cloves garlic
	- 4 whole cloves
	- 4 bay leaves
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) whole black peppercorns
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH coriander seeds and mustard seeds
	- Salt
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil, divided
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh Italian parsley
	- Ground pepper
	-  Chimichurri Sauce 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH minced fresh cilantro and Italian parsley
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced fresh oregano
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced red onion
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) red wine vinegar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- Salt and ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Tongue   (2 to 3 lb /1 to 1.5 kg)
	- 1 large onion
	- Red onion
	- 9 cloves garlic
	- 4 whole cloves
	- 4 bay leaves
	- Whole black peppercorns
	- Coriander seeds
	- Mustard seeds
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh Italian parsley
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Fresh oregano
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Salt and ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine tongue, onion, whole cloves garlic, cloves, bay leaves, peppercorns, coriander seeds, mustard seeds and 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt in a large stock pot. Add enough cold water to cover by 1 inch (2.5 cm). Bring to a simmer over a medium-low heat. Cook for 3 hours or until a skewer easily pierces the meat and slides out smoothly. Remove the tongue from the water and let cool; discard poaching water and solids.
	2. When tongue is cool enough to handle with rubber gloves on, peel off the skin. Start at the back end and use a small knife to lift up the skin; then, using your fingers, peel off the skin like removing a mitten, being careful to not rip the meat at the tip. Discard the skin, trim off any fat, gristle or bumps at the back of the tongue. Place the tongue in an airtight container and refrigerate overnight. 
	3. Slice the tongue into medallions about ½-inch (1 cm) thick and return to container. Combine 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil, minced garlic, parsley and salt and pepper to taste in a small bowl. Pour over the tongue slices, cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
	4. Chimichurri: Meanwhile, combine cilantro, parsley, oregano, hot pepper flakes, garlic and red onion in a medium bowl. Whisk in red wine vinegar and olive oil until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside.
	5. Remove tongue from marinade; discard marinade. Grill slices of tongue in a closed preheated barbecue over high heat (500°F/260°C) for about 5 minutes, turning twice or more, or until golden brown on both sides until hot all the way through. Place the meat on a platter and drizzle the Chimichurri all over the slices. Serve warm.
Recipe Tips:
  - The tongue can be prepared through step 2 and refrigerated for up to 1 week. Proceed with step 3 thirty minutes before serving.
---
Recipe ID: 3e509dbf-8138-4e21-84d3-4a5382e34407
Recipe Title: Charcoal-Grilled Steak in Reverse on Bruschetta Naan
Recipe Summary: The ‘reverse’ here refers to the sear and the marinade, both of which are done after the steak is grilled which is opposite to the norm. Serve these hearty flatbreads as a main course with a side salad or cut each naan crosswise into 4 slices to serve as appetizers. Note: the recipe was developed and tested on The Big Green Egg brand of charcoal grill/smoker. Most charcoal grills are similar; vents and lids differ but have the same purpose. Always refer to the user manual for light up, heating instructions and indirect-heat and direct-heat cooking for your grill. To use a gas grill, see the alternate method below.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 28
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 43
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Natural lump charcoal
	- Fresh sturdy herb sprigs, such as rosemary and sage (optional)
	- ½ lb (250 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt
	- Reverse Marinade 
		- Half small red onion, thinly sliced
		- 1 clove garlic, thinly sliced
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil 
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar 
		- Salt and pepper
	- Bruschetta
		- 1 tomato, finely chopped
		- Half small red onion, finely chopped
		- 1 clove garlic, finely minced
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced or torn
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) olive oil
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) balsamic vinegar
		- Salt and pepper
	- To Serve
		- 2 naan flatbreads, each about 9½ x 6½ inches (24 x 16 cm) 
		- ½ cup (125 mL) traditional ricotta cheese
		- Balsamic glaze 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 small red onion
	- Garlic
	- 1 tomato
	- Fresh basil
	- Fresh sturdy herb sprigs, such as rosemary and sage (optional)
	- 2 naan flatbreads, each about 9½ x 6½ inches (24 x 16 cm) 
	- ½ lb (250 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Olive oil 
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Balsamic glaze
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Traditional ricotta cheese
	- Natural lump charcoal
Recipe Methods:
	1. Load fire bowl of kamado-style grill with&nbsp;natural lump charcoal in an even 2-inch (5 cm) thick layer. Light the charcoal with a paper towel in the coals or charcoal-safe fire starter and place the diffuser plate in the fire bowl. Fill a foil drip pan part way with water, adding herb sprigs (if using) and place on the plate (see Tip). Place the grill grate over the diffuser plate. Close lid and preheat to Low (250°F/121°C), adjusting the top and bottom vent to achieve this constant temperature.
	2. Pat steak dry with paper towel. Pierce steak all over with a fork and season liberally with salt. Place the steak on preheated grill, insert an oven-safe programmable thermometer sideways into steak and close the lid. Cook for about 22 minutes or until thermometer registers 135°F (57°C). 
	3. Reverse Marinade: Meanwhile, combine onion, garlic, oil, vinegar and salt and pepper, to your taste, in a shallow dish that will fit the cooked steak. Set aside.
	4. Transfer partially-cooked steak to a clean plate and set aside. Remove the diffuser plate and drip pan; lower the grill grate closer to the charcoal for high-temperature, direct-heat grilling. Brush the grate clean and close the lid. Adjust vents as necessary to heat to a temperature of about 600°F (315°C); this should take about 2 to 5 minutes. 
	5. Return steak to grill, and sear over high heat with grill lid open for 1 to 2 minutes per side or until thermometer registers 145°F (63° C) for medium-rare (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Remove the steak from the grill and place it directly into the Reverse Marinade. Let rest for 10 to 12 minutes. 
	6. Bruschetta: Meanwhile, combine tomato, onion, garlic, basil, oil and vinegar in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
	7. Transfer steak to a cutting board and carve across the grain into thin slices. Return to marinade and stir to coat.&nbsp;Set aside.
	8. To Serve: Grill naan over direct heat until lightly toasted and grill marked on both sides. Transfer to a clean cutting board.&nbsp;
	9. Spread ricotta evenly over naan and top with Bruschetta mixture, dividing equally. Arrange steak slices on top and drizzle with balsamic glaze. Cut each naan in half to serve. 
	Gas Grilling Method: You can use the reverse-sear method in a three-burner gas grill, too! Simply turn on the two end burners, leaving the centre burner off; place drip tray over unlit burner. This is your indirect heat zone, where you’ll put your steak. Turn the end burners to low heat and preheat grill to 250°F (121°C). Cook steak in closed barbecue over unlit burner for about 22 minutes or until thermometer registers 135°F (57°C). Remove the steak and drip pan from the grill. Turn all burners to High and preheat for about 10 minutes, until the grill is 600°F (315°C). Return steak to grill and sear over high heat for 1 to 2 minutes per side or until thermometer registers 145°F (63° C) for medium-rare (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
Recipe Tips:
  - The drip pan with water under the steak provides moisture during grilling and including hearty herbs in the drip-pan water permeates the air inside the grill with an herbaceous aroma, adding a subtle nuanced flavour to the beef. If you have a half-moon plate/griddle diffuser accessory for your barbecue, cook steak over the diffuser for the indirect heat cook, and then transfer steak to side directly over the coals to sear and complete the cooking. If you don’t have any type of diffuser, push the charcoal to one side and place the drip pan under the grill on the other side for indirect-heat cooking. When ready to sear, move the steak over to the live coal side of the grill.
---
Recipe ID: 3f409dda-1e06-4518-b80e-09dffcecb1c7
Recipe Title: Grilled Shrimp and Curry-Spiced Steak
Recipe Summary: Grilled Beef Strip Loin Steak seasoned with savoury curry spices and skewers of shrimp— an easy but elegant surf and turf recipe.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 15
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH fresh ground pepper, ground cumin and ground coriander
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sugar
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH curry powder, celery salt and garlic salt
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steaks, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 4 small)
	- 4 bamboo skewers, soaked
	- 12 large fresh prawns/shrimp, shells removed and tails on
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Ground cumin
	- Ground coriander
	- Sugar
	- Curry powder
	- Celery salt
	- Garlic salt
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steaks, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 4 small)
	- 4 bamboo skewers
	- 12 large fresh prawns/shrimp, shells removed and tails on
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine pepper, cumin, coriander, sugar, curry powder, celery salt and garlic salt in small bowl. Rub steaks all over with seasoning mixture; place on a plate, cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. 
	2. Grill steaks over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 6 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Let rest for 5 minutes.
	3. Meanwhile, thread 3 prawns onto each skewer and grill over medium-high for 2 minutes per side, turning only once, or until shrimp are firm and opaque. Serve with steaks.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 40632f1a-402a-40b7-bc79-1a07c7f5efdb
Recipe Title: Cantonese-Style Braised Beef with Daikon Radish
Recipe Summary: This is a gentle tasting stew that can be served with rice, noodles or steamed bok choy. Daikon radish is similar to turnip though less starchy and becomes sweet and mild when cooked. You can find Shaoxing wine, a rice wine for cooking, or other cooking wine in Chinese grocery stores or the Asian section of well-stocked supermarkets or use a medium-dry sherry instead.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 200
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Boneless Hind Shank (Bubble Meat)
	- 3 whole star anise
	- 5 whole cloves
	- 3 bay leaves
	- Six 1/4-inch (5 mm) thick slices fresh gingerroot
	- ½ cup (125 mL) Shaoxing wine (Chinese cooking wine) or medium-dry sherry
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) light soy sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) dark soy sauce
	- 3 cups (750 mL) beef broth (approx)
	- 1½ lb (750 g) daikon radish
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) water (optional)
	- 3 green onions, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- Steamed bok choy (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Boneless Hind Shank (Bubble Meat)
	- 3 whole star anise
	- 5 whole cloves
	- 3 bay leaves
	- Six 1/4-inch (5 mm) thick slices fresh gingerroot
	- Shaoxing wine (Chinese cooking wine) or medium-dry sherry
	- Light soy sauce
	- Dark soy sauce
	- Beef broth
	- Daikon radish
	- 3 green onions
	- Steamed bok choy (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Slice the meat in half lengthwise and cut each piece crosswise into 2-inch (5 cm) lengths. Place the beef in a heavy pot that holds at least 4 quarts (4 L) and add cold water to cover by 2 inches (5 cm). Bring to a boil over high heat; boil for 5 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water, removing any visible scum from the meat. Rinse pot.
	2. If desired, enclose star anise, cloves and bay leaves in a cheesecloth bundle, tea ball or spice infuser. Return meat to the pot and add spice bundle or individual spices, gingerroot, wine, light and dark soy sauce and broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours.
	3. Meanwhile, peel the daikon radish and cut it into about 1-inch (2.5 cm chunks. Stir into the beef mixture. There should be enough liquid to just cover the radish, add more if necessary. Cover and simmer for 1 hour longer until the beef and daikon are very tender.
	4. At the end of cooking, the liquid should just cover the ingredients. Remove the spices. If you wish to thicken the stew, turn the heat to high and stir the cornstarch and water. Drizzle it into the pot, stirring constantly. Reduce the heat and boil for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Stir in green onions and serve with steamed bok choy, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Centre-cut Shank can be used as an alternative to the Bubble Meat, just skip Step 1.
---
Recipe ID: 4069513c-e64a-4c3b-9bd3-7ec77edfeaad
Recipe Title: Dutch Meatballs (Bitterballen)
Recipe Summary: This classic pub food was one of the first Dutch dishes I recall eating at a restaurant and it is usually the first item my Dutch friends ask me to make. Its creamy beef filling and crispy exterior make it hard to eat just one so luckily this recipe will make more than enough to satisfy your group. We typically use a spicy Dijon mustard to cut through the richness of the filling but you can serve it with any mustard you like (or none at all!). 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 110
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Half onion, roughly chopped 
	- 3 sprigs fresh thyme 
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) whole black peppercorns 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) unflavoured gelatin powder
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cold water
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) unsalted butter
	- 1 shallot, finely diced
	- 2½ cups (625 mL) all-purpose flour, divided 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) milk
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) Dijon mustard
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 4 cups (1 L) canola or sunflower oil (approx)
	- 3 cups (750 mL) dry bread crumbs
	- 4 eggs
	- Spicy Dijon mustard or additional Dijon mustard
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 onion
	- Fresh thyme 
	- Fresh parsley
	- 1 shallot
	- 3 cups (750 mL) dry bread crumbs
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 4 cups (1 L) canola or sunflower oil (approx)
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Whole black peppercorns 
	- Unflavoured gelatin powder
	- All-purpose flour 
	- Dijon mustard
	- Spicy Dijon mustard (optional)
	- Unsalted butter
	- Milk
	- Eggs
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place beef in a medium saucepan and add water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add onion, thyme, bay leaves and peppercorns. Reduce heat and simmer for about 1 hour or until beef is fork-tender.
	2. Strain beef through a large sieve or colander, reserving liquid and beef. Discard onion, thyme stems, bay leaves and peppercorns. Let beef cool. Measure 1 cup (250 mL) cooking liquid and set aside, reserving any remaining for another use. Finely dice cooled beef and set aside.
	3. Meanwhile, sprinkle gelatin over cold water in a small bowl. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes or until softened. 
	4. Melt butter over medium heat in clean saucepan. Add shallot and cook, stirring, for about 3 minutes or until soft. Sprinkle in ½ cup (125 mL) of the flour, whisking constantly; cook, whisking, for 1 minutes. Gradually whisk in milk and reserved 1 cup (250 mL) beef liquid.
	Stir in diced beef, softened gelatin, 4 tsp (20 mL) mustard and parsley. Remove from heat.
	5. Transfer beef mixture to an airtight container and refrigerate overnight to set.
	6. Place remaining flour in a bowl, place bread crumbs in another bowl and whisk eggs until blended in a third bowl. Set aside.
	7. Heat about 2 to 3 inches (5 to 7.5 cm) oil (enough to cover meatballs when added to the pot) in a deep fryer or heavy saucepan over medium heat to 350°F (180°C).
	8. Meanwhile, scoop about 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the meat mixture and roll into balls. Place on a plate.
	9. Dip each ball first in flour, then egg, then in bread crumbs, rolling to coat. Dip again in egg then bread crumbs. (Do not skip the double breading or your filling may leak when frying.) Return to plate. Discard any excess flour, egg and bread crumbs.
	10. Deep-fry the meatballs, in batches of 4 to 6 at a time, for about 2 minutes or until golden brown. Remove with slotted spoon and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to remove excess oil. Adjust heat as necessary between batches to maintain oil temperature. Serve meatballs hot with mustard.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 40c3926c-743a-4833-8be2-58a0f9574f52
Recipe Title: Mini Meatball and Potato Frittata (Frittata di Polpettine e Patate)
Recipe Summary: My grandmother always had something in the fridge to make a bite to eat. She could make everything delicious in a frittata. If you have leftover meatballs use those instead of making the mini meatballs in this recipe. Cooking everything in the skillet makes for easy clean up and the result makes for happy bellies. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 oz (250 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) grated parmesan cheese, divided
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 1 small clove garlic, minced
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) canola or sunflower oil
	- 12 oz (375 g) potatoes (about 2), diced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) diced sweet red pepper
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper, divided 
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped cooked rapini or other cooked greens or peas (optional)
	- 8 large eggs
	- Tomato basil pasta sauce, heated (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh parsley
	- Garlic
	- 12 oz (375 g) potatoes (about 2)
	- 1 sweet red pepper
	- Rapini or other greens or peas (cooked, optional)
	- 8 oz (250 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Salt
	- Pepper 
	- Tomato basil pasta sauce (optional)
	- 8 large eggs
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) grated parmesan cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine beef, ¼ cup (60 mL) of the cheese, parsley and garlic in a bowl using a fork (careful not to over-mix). Scoop heaping teaspoons (5 mL) of beef mixture and roll into small meatballs. Place on a plate. 
	2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add potatoes and cook, stirring often, for 5 to 8 minutes or until starting to brown. Add meatballs and cook, stirring, for about 3 minutes, or until browned. Reduce heat to medium. Add red pepper and ¼ tsp (1 mL) each of the salt and pepper; cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in rapini, if using.
	3. Meanwhile, whisk together eggs, remaining ½ cup (125 mL) Parmesan and remaining salt and pepper in a large bowl. 
	4. Pour egg mixture into skillet, lifting and gently stirring for egg to run underneath meatballs and potatoes. Cook, without stirring, for about 3 minutes or until edges and most of centre is set. Invert a plate over top the skillet and carefully flip skillet and the plate so frittata ends up on the plate. Slide the frittata back into the skillet and cook the other side for about 5 minutes or until meatballs are thoroughly cooked, a knife inserted in centre of egg comes out clean and bottom is golden.
	5. Slide frittata onto serving platter or cutting board and cut into wedges. Serve with pasta sauce, if desired. 
Recipe Tips:
  - This meal can be enjoyed any time of day. It’s always a favourite grabbed cold out of the fridge for an on-the-run breakfast! Need lunch? No problem, tuck it into a soft bun with a slice of your favourite cheese and you’re ready to enjoy.
---
Recipe ID: 40cd0f0f-759b-4889-ba7b-072aae142e08
Recipe Title: Pan-fried Garlic Rice
Recipe Summary: Cooked basmati rice gets a quick pan-fry with aromatic garlic and green onions until it crackles and is fragrant. Serve this side dish with Asian-marinated steaks or roast beef, or beef satay or kabobs. You can cook the rice ahead, then finish off with the frying step just before you plan to serve it.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 33
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 38
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) basmati rice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) canola or sunflower oil
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 4 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rinse the rice in a sieve until water runs clear through it. Bring 3 cups (750 mL) water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add rice, cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for about 12 minutes or until the water is fully absorbed. Let stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Transfer the rice to a bowl to cool. (Make ahead: Cover cooled rice and let stand at room temperature for up to 1 hour.)
	2. Heat a large sauté pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil and swirl to coat; add rice. Let the rice crackle and fry, tossing occasionally, for about 10 minutes until warmed and a little crispy. Add garlic and green onions; cook, folding into rice, for 1 minute. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: 4143dffb-b6b5-435c-a9ed-c7cf5557f8f3
Recipe Title: Stuffed Grape Leaves (Dolmeh Barg-e Mo)
Recipe Summary: Dolmeh is a very common dish in Middle Eastern/Mediterranean countries. Dolmeh (also called dolma) is a term given to a variety of stuffed vegetables such as sweet peppers, zucchini, onions, cabbage, etc. There are many dolmeh recipes with different ingredients depending on the region from where it originates. Dolmeh Barge-e Mo means stuffed grape leaves in Farsi. The best grape leaves are usually found in spring and summer. Fresh leaves might be hard to find so most people use canned or jarred versions. Dolmeh can be either sour or sweet-sour; they can be wrapped as very thin rolls or in a square shape. I remember my grandma had a grape vine in her house and when grape leaves were in season, we would have a ritual of making dolmeh. My mom used to take me and my sister to my grandma’s house where she would already had grape leaves washed and the stuffing ready. We would sit for hours wrapping dolmeh tightly and thinly. She taught me how to make this dish with all the tips and tricks, how to be careful with delicate grape leaves and how to patch two leaves together if they had a hole so there is no waste. This dish is usually served with thick yogurt and with or without bread.
Recipe Prep Time: 90
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 100
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 190
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) basmati rice
	- 4 green onions, finely chopped
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) fresh parsley leaves, finely chopped
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) fresh dill, finely chopped
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh mint leaves, finely chopped
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- 1 cup (250 mL) plain Greek yogurt
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil, divided
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dried marzeh (summer savoury), optional
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH fresh ground pepper and ground turmeric
	- 1 lb 10 oz (800 g) grape leaves (fresh or jarred)
	- Juice of ½ lemon
	- Plain Greek yogurt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Green onions
	- Garlic
	- 1 large onion
	- Fresh parsley
	- Fresh dill
	- Fresh mint
	- 1 lemon
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Olive oil
	- Dried marzeh (summer savoury), optional
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Ground turmeric
	- Basmati rice
	- 1 lb 10 oz (800 g) grape leaves (fresh or jarred)
	- Plain Greek yogurt
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place rice in a medium bowl, add cold water and swish the rice. Drain off water and repeat 3 more times until the water in the bowl is somewhat clear. Drain rice well.
	2. Place rice in a medium saucepan and fill the pot with cold water. Bring to a boil over
	medium-high heat; boil for 4 to 5 minutes or until rice grains are partly cooked (the middle of the grains should be still hard). Drain the rice in a sieve or fine colander and immediately rinse with cold water to stop the cooking process. Set aside to drain.
	3. Combine onion, green onion, garlic, parsley, dill and mint in a large bowl. Add drained rice, 1 cup (250 mL) yogurt, 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the olive oil, marzeh (if using), salt, pepper and turmeric. Mix in ground beef with a fork until all the ingredients are well combined (using your hands for mixing, if necessary).
	4. Spread 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil in the bottom of a large pot. Arrange enough grape leaves in pot to make a layer across the bottom.
	5. To wrap dolmeh, trim stems from grape leaves. Lay a leaf on a board with the shiny side down. Add about 4 tsp (20 mL) stuffing in the center of the leaf. Fold the sides and the bottom of the leaf to the middle over the filling and roll up tightly. Place in the pot. Repeat this process until all the leaves are rolled, packing the rolled dolmehs in the pot very tightly together and layering as necessary.
	6. Drizzle the remaining olive oil and lemon juice over the dolmehs. Place an ovenproof plate upside down on top of the dolmehs and press it a bit down. (This way they won’t move once you add the water to the pot.) Add enough water to cover the dolmehs.
	7. Cover and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat. Simmer for 1 hour. Remove the plate and add more water, if necessary to keep moist. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove one dolmeh from the pot and test for doneness: the leaf and rice should be tender and the beef thoroughly cooked. If not, add a bit more water, cover and simmer until cooked through.
	8. Remove from heat and let rest for about 30 minutes. Serve dolmeh with Greek yogurt.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 419b2339-54df-482a-8cd4-585961be3c3b
Recipe Title: Orange-Braised Beef
Recipe Summary: When it comes to favourite recipes, these slowly braised beef short ribs in a rich herb-orange flavoured sauce are the quintessence of comfort food. Serve with chunky grilled or roasted mixed vegetables.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 125
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Bone-in Short Ribs, about 2 inches (5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 2 onions, chopped
	- 3 cloves garlic, finely chopped
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dried rosemary and thyme, crumbled
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth (approx.)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) canned diced tomatoes, including juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 3 strips orange zest (each 3 inches/8 cm long)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Bone-in Short Ribs, about 2 inches (5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- 2 onions
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Dried rosemary
	- Dried thyme
	- Beef broth
	- 1 cup (250 mL) canned diced tomatoes, including juice
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Orange zest
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat short ribs dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil in Dutch oven or large pot over medium-high heat; brown short ribs, in batches and adding more oil as needed, until browned on all sides. Transfer to plate.
	2. Reduce heat to medium. Add onions, garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt and pepper to pot; cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened.
	 3. Add broth, tomatoes with juice, Worcestershire sauce and orange zest. Return beef and accumulated juices to pan; bring to boil. 
	4. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for about 1½ to 2 hours, adding additional broth to keep beef covered while braising, or until beef is fork-tender. 
	5. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Skim any fat from sauce and discard. Cut ribs into 6 portions and serve with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Braised meats are great for entertaining since they can be made a day ahead. Flavours meld together as it sits so it tastes better the next day. Gently re-heat in the oven, microwave or slow cooker to serve.
---
Recipe ID: 4257396e-04a6-489c-b80f-5bc953457094
Recipe Title: Broiled Balsamic Steaks with Gorgonzola
Recipe Summary: Gorgonzola is a creamy Italian blue-veined cheese with a strong flavour that compliments the beefy flavour of this grilling steak well but feel free to substitute with goat cheese, Brie or any other blue cheese. And if you can’t find the Wing steaks (a.k.a. Bone-in Strip Loin Grilling Steak), go for the traditional boneless Strip Loin cut.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 6
Recipe Marinating Time: 15
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 31
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Dijon mustard
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped fresh basil, divided
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary 
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1½ lb (750 g)Beef Wing Steaks, ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 2)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 oz (60 g) Gorgonzola, other blue cheese or goat cheese, crumbled
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Olive oil
	- Dijon mustard
	- Fresh basil
	- Fresh rosemary
	- 1 clove garlic
	- 1½ lb (750 g)Beef Wing Steaks, ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 2)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 oz (60 g) Gorgonzola, other blue cheese or goat cheese, crumbled
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk together vinegar, oil, mustard, half the basil, rosemary and garlic in a large shallow dish. Add steaks and turn to coat evenly with marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 15 minutes. 
	2. Remove beef from marinade; discard marinade Pat steaks dry with paper towel. and season all over with salt and pepper. 
	3. Position the oven rack in the top-third of the oven (but not the very top). Place steaks on a rack on a rimmed baking sheet and broil for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more and topping steaks with cheese in the last 2 minutes of broiling, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	 4. Carve steaks off the bone and cut into thin slices across the grain. Serve sliced steak on a platter along with the bones and sprinkle with remaining basil.
Recipe Tips:
  - Cooking steaks under the broiler produces a sear and caramelization similar to that of the barbecue and can be done in any weather any time of year. Like grilling, the rendering fat on a steak can sometimes cause flare-ups, so be sure to stay close by. Consult the owner’s manual of your oven to learn if the door to the oven should be fully closed or left ajar during broiling.
---
Recipe ID: 42b7f1e9-1203-46fa-afb8-1c38f554a709
Recipe Title: Red Chili Beef Honeycomb Tripe Soup
Recipe Summary: Traditionally a rustic soup, revered as a hangover cure in Mexico, Menudo can be eaten at any time just because it’s delicious. To serve as an elegant appetizer, as pictured, serve in shallow bowls with a small amount of broth as a sauce, and reserve extra broth for another meal.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 210
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 240
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Honeycomb Tripe 
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Soup Bones, 2-inch (5 cm) pieces
	- Salt
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) finely diced onions
	- 6 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) dried oregano, preferably Mexican
	- 5 dried guajillo chili peppers (or ancho or pasilla peppers) 
	- 2 cups (500 mL) boiling water
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) cumin seeds
	- Pinch ground cloves
	- 1 can (30 oz/850 g) white hominy, drained and rinsed
	-  Garnish 
	- 2 limes, quartered
	- ½ cup (125 mL) finely diced onion
	- ½ cup (125 mL) coarsely chopped fresh cilantro
	- Dried oregano, preferably Mexican
	- Ground chilies, such as piquín
	- Sliced serrano chilies or hot pepper sauce 
	- Corn tortillas
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Honeycomb Tripe 
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Soup Bones,  2-inch (5 cm) pieces
	- Salt
	- Onions
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Dried oregano, preferably Mexican
	- 5 dried guajillo chili peppers (or ancho or pasilla peppers) 
	- Cumin seeds
	- Pinch ground cloves
	- 1 can (30 oz/850 g) white hominy
	- 2 limes
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Ground chilies, such as piquín
	- Sliced serrano chilies or hot pepper sauce 
	- Corn tortillas
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place the tripe and soup bones in a large pot. Add cold water to cover by 1 inch (2.5 cm) and add 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt. Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes. Drain through a colander, discarding water. Rinse the tripe and bones well in cold water.
	2. Cut the tripe into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces. Return to the pot with the bones. Add 5 quarts (5 L) fresh water, onion, garlic, oregano and 1½ tsp (7 mL) salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours until the tripe is barely tender, replenishing the liquid as necessary to keep it just above the meat.
	3. Meanwhile, snip off the stem end of each chili pepper with scissors and split each chili open lengthwise. Open up and scrape out seeds and membranes. Heat a heavy medium-size skillet over medium heat. To toast the chilies, place one or two in the pan skin side down and press it with a metal spatula until it softens and blisters. Flip the chili over and toast the inside being careful not to burn it. Transfer to a heatproof bowl and continue with the remaining chilies. Pour boiling water over the chilies and let soak while you prepare the rest of the ingredients.
	4. Add cumin seeds to the pan and toast until fragrant. Remove to a plate and let cool. Grind to a powder with a mortar and pestle or in a spice grinder.
	5. When the tripe is almost tender, drain the chiles, discarding soaking water. Place chilies in a blender with 1 cup (250 mL) of the cooking liquid from the pot; purée until smooth. Add another cup (250 mL) of the cooking liquid and blend again. Press through a fine-meshed sieve into the pot of soup; discard solids. 
	6. Add toasted cumin, cloves and hominy to the pot; simmer, uncovered, for 1 hour or until meat is tender. Add water to thin it out to a soup consistency, if necessary. Season with salt to taste.
	7. Place the garnishes in bowls on the table and serve the soup, bones and all, for each person to garnish the soup to taste. Serve tortillas alongside.
Recipe Tips:
  - Tripe should be rinsed or blanched before proceeding to cook. Shallow slashes on the smoother side of the tripe will help reduce curling during cooking.
---
Recipe ID: 4399aa17-e6a4-4774-8e7b-51fe43a098a9
Recipe Title: Skillet Fast-Fry Steaks with Simple Cranberry Pan Sauce 
Recipe Summary: Bold flavours and a simple technique elevate this quick-cooking moderately-priced steak to a weeknight date night or solo dinner (with leftovers). Serve with mashed potatoes, whipped cauliflower or crusty bread to help soak up all the delicious sauce! 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ lb (250 g) Beef Inside Round Fast-fry Steaks (about 2 steaks)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth 
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) dry red wine
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) whole berry cranberry sauce or red pepper jelly
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cold butter, cut into cubes
	- Chopped fresh parsley 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- ½ lb (250 g) Beef Inside Round Fast-fry Steaks (about 2 steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Dry red wine
	- Whole berry cranberry sauce or red pepper jelly
	- Butter
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper.
	 2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in nonstick skillet; cook steaks, for 4 to 6 minutes, turning once or more until steaks are cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF) and browned but still pink inside. Transfer to a plate, cover loosely with foil to keep warm; set aside.
	3. Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic and rosemary to skillet; cook, stirring, for 30 to 60 seconds or until fragrant. Pour in beef broth and red wine; bring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 3 to 5 minutes or until reduced by half. Stir in cranberry sauce. Reduce heat to low. 
	4. Add butter, one cube at a time, stirring or swirling skillet to allow each piece to dissolve before adding the next. Move skillet back and forth from heat, for about 2 to 3 minutes or as needed, to dissolve butter to a creamy consistency. 
	5. Serve sauce over steaks. Sprinkle with parsley. 
Recipe Tips:
  - The secret to this luscious sauce is the cold butter. Using cold butter to finish a pan sauce adds body and sheen, and is a classic French technique called mounting. There are a few key elements needed for success; the butter must be cold and the heat cannot be too high or the sauce will separate. Be sure that each piece of butter is fully incorporated before adding the next piece. If the sauce is getting too hot, just remove from the heat for a few seconds before adding the next butter cube.
---
Recipe ID: 439f53bc-ea54-4903-94eb-b0d8bbb2ac04
Recipe Title: Pepper Pot Beef Stew
Recipe Summary: A hearty Caribbean-style beef stew with tender beef chunks and rich flavour, lightly seasoned with bay. Serve with mildly-spiced, curried rice and flat bread, such as roti, papadams or naan.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 146
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 166
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg) Beef Centre Cut Shank, 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick pieces
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ½ cup (125 mL) all-purpose flour
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) vegetable oil, divided (approx)
	- 2 EACH small sweet green peppers and carrots, diced
	- 1 onion, diced
	- 2 stalks celery, halved lengthwise, chopped
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dried marjoram
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) dried thyme
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground cloves
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 4 medium potatoes, peeled and diced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg)  Beef Centre Cut Shank,  1-inch (2.5 cm) thick pieces
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 small sweet green peppers
	- 2 small carrots
	- 1 onion
	- 2 stalks celery
	- Beef broth
	- Dried marjoram
	- Dried thyme
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Ground cloves
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 4 medium potatoes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Season beef all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Place flour in a shallow dish and coat shank pieces in flour, shaking off excess; reserve flour. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Cook beef, in batches, turning to brown all sides. Transfer to a plate. Add more oil between batches, as necessary.
	2. Reduce heat to medium and add remaining oil to pot, as needed. Add green peppers, carrots, onion and celery; cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until starting to soften. Sprinkle in reserved flour; cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until vegetables are softened. Gradually stir in broth and bring to a boil, scraping up browned bits from bottom of pan. Stir in marjoram, thyme, hot pepper flakes and cloves; bring to a simmer. Season with salt and pepper. Return beef to pot along with accumulated juices, spooning sauce over top.
	3. Cover and cook in preheated 350°F oven for 1½ hours. Stir in potatoes; cover and cook for 40 minutes longer or until beef and potatoes are tender. Discard bay leaf and skim fat from sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
	4. Using tongs, remove any trim and bones from the stew, leaving chunks of meat behind. Using forks, break meat into bite-sized pieces. Ladle into bowls or onto plates to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Stew flavours meld together as the dish sits so it tastes better the next day. Gently re-heat in the oven, microwave or slow cooker to serve.
---
Recipe ID: 448f104f-9255-4415-9a0e-f297515037ff
Recipe Title: Grilled Orange-Ginger Beef
Recipe Summary: Flavourful ribs are easy to make with this simple marinade. If you want a short-cut, use any purchased Asian-style salad dressing as the marinade.
Recipe Prep Time: 8
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 498
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Grilling Short Ribs (thin-cut Maui/Korean-style)  
	- 2-inch (5 cm) piece peeled gingerroot, minced
	- Finely grated zest and juice of 1 orange
	- 1 green onion, chopped
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) teriyaki sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Asian chili sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Grilling Short Ribs  (thin-cut Maui/Korean-style)    
	- 2-inch (5 cm) piece gingerroot
	- 1 orange
	- 1 green onion
	- Teriyaki sauce
	- Asian chili sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine gingerroot, orange zest and juice, green onion, teriyaki sauce and chili sauce in a sealable freezer bag. Pierce short ribs all over with a fork. Add ribs to bag, massaging to coat; seal and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or up to 24 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from ribs. Pat ribs dry with paper towel. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning twice or more or until cooked to medium-rare doneness (145°F/63°C) at the most.
	3. Transfer to a cutting board. Cut between bones with scissors to create bite-sized pieces.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can freeze the ribs right in the marinade so the beef marinates as it thaws – a great convenience tip if you buy extra beef and make an extra batch of marinade. Freeze the ribs in the marinade for up to 3 months; let thaw in the refrigerator overnight before grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 44a2a184-3c4f-4ea0-a965-58dcaf6333df
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Fresh Tomato Salad
Recipe Summary: Grilled steak with a garden-fresh salad is the quintessential Canadian dinner to enjoy in the backyard in summer. Make this recipe at the height of tomato and basil season to bring out the best flavour.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 6
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 21
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Fresh Tomato Salad
	- 1 to 2 tomatoes, diced
	- ½ English cucumber, diced
	- 1 sweet red pepper, diced
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 1½ tbsp (22 mL) red wine vinegar
	- 1 garlic clove, minced
	- 8 to 10 fresh basil leaves, cut into thin strips
	- Salt and pepper
	-  Steak
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Porterhouse Grilling Steaks,½ to ¾ inch (1 to 2 cm) thick 
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil
	- 1 garlic clove, minced
	- 2 to 3 tbsp (30 to 45 mL) coarse salt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 to 2 tomatoes
	- English cucumber
	- 1 sweet red pepper
	- 2 green onions
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) chickpeas
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Garlic
	- 8 to 10 fresh basil leaves
	- Salt and pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Porterhouse Grilling Steaks,½ to ¾ inch (1 to 2 cm) thick 
	- Olive oil
	- Coarse salt
Recipe Methods:
	1. Fresh Tomato Salad: Combine tomato, cucumber, red pepper, green onion and chickpeas in a large bowl; add oil, vinegar, garlic and basil. Toss to coat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
	2. Steak: Pat steaks dry with paper towel. Stir olive oil and garlic together in a small bowl and brush this all over the steaks. Sprinkle a generous amount of salt all over the steaks. 
	3. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ to ¾ inch (1 to 2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	4. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes before serving. Carve across the grain into slices and serve with Fresh Tomato Salad.
Recipe Tips:
  - The trick of basting the surface of the steaks with oil before salting prevents the salt from dissolving into the meat, which is why you can salt generously. The salt on the surface helps to create a bit of a crust on the outside.
---
Recipe ID: 45438af8-22b1-4c6f-a1af-558dc58e6aee
Recipe Title: Dijon-Crusted Oven Roast with Shallot Gravy
Recipe Summary: This restaurant-style roast beef gets rave reviews like this one: “The roast was perfect! It was delicious. And the thermometer – what a difference! The meat cooked PERFECTLY! No guessing. No opening the oven. No stressing. The whole meal was delish!” The shape of the roast has as much to do with the cook time as the size and the cut. Our time-test results are based on a 3-rib roast that was about 7-in (18 cm) long x 6-in (15 cm) wide x 3-in (8 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 240
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 255
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 7 lb (3.15 kg) Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	- 8 cloves garlic, cut into thin slivers
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ½ cup (125 mL) coarsely chopped fresh parsley
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) herbes de Provence seasoning or dried thyme
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- Shallot Gravy
		- 3 shallots, coarsely chopped
		- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) Worcestershire sauce
		- 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) cornstarch mixed with equal amount of cold water
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 7 lb (3.15 kg) Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	- 8 cloves garlic
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Fresh parsley
	- Dijon mustard
	- Herbes de Provence seasoning or dried thyme
	- Vegetable oil
	- 3 shallots
	- Beef broth
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut shallow slits all over roast; insert garlic slivers into slits. Rub all over with Worcestershire sauce, and salt and pepper to your taste. Combine parsley, mustard, herbes de Provence and oil in a bowl. Set aside 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the mixture for Shallot Gravy, rubbing remainder all over roast.
	2. Place roast, bones down, on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 3½ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: see ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before carving. 
	4. Shallot Gravy: Meanwhile, drain off fat and all but 2 tbsp (30 mL) drippings from roasting pan. Heat pan drippings in roasting pan over medium heat. Add shallots and reserved herb rub to pan; cook, stirring, for about 3 minutes or until shallots are softened. Stir in beef broth and Worcestershire sauce; bring to a simmer, stirring up any browned bits from pan. Gradually whisk in cornstarch mixture (amount depending on desired thickness) and bring to boil. Boil, whisking, for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Strain into a gravy boat to serve with roast.
Recipe Tips:
  - When buying a beef oven roast, buy 12 oz (375 g) beef per person for bone-in-roasts.
---
Recipe ID: 45a6d4b9-867b-4de9-a56c-da6b0da30d82
Recipe Title: Corned Beef Knishes with Herb Salad and Horseradish Mustard Sauce
Recipe Summary: These Jewish baked dumplings are filled with a delicious potato, corned beef, onions and herb mixture and accompanied by a savoury mustard horseradish sauce. Serve with a refreshing herb salad and enjoy.
Recipe Prep Time: 40
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 145
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Dough
		- 2 cups (500 mL) all-purpose flour 
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) baking powder
		- ¾ tsp (4 tsp) kosher salt
		- ⅓ cup (75 mL) sunflower oil
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) warm water
		- 1 large egg, lightly beaten
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) white vinegar
	- Filling
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sunflower oil, divided
		- 1 large onion, sliced
		- 1 large yellow-fleshed potato, peeled and cut into chunks
		- 1 large egg
		- 1 large egg yolk
		- 1 lb (500 g) cooked Corned Beef Brisket, shredded
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh thyme
	- Egg Wash
		- 1 large egg, beaten
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) kosher salt
	- Mustard and Horseradish Sauce 
		- 3 cloves garlic, roasted (see Tip)
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH Dijon mustard and fresh lemon juice
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) prepared horseradish
		- 2 large egg yolks
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) sunflower oil
		- Kosher salt and fresh ground pepper
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) minced fresh chives
	- Herb Salad
		- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH fresh Italian parsley leaves, dill fronds and baby arugula
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH olive oil and fresh lemon juice 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 large onion
	- 1 large yellow-fleshed potato
	- Garlic (roasted)
	- Fresh thyme
	- 1 lemon
	- Fresh chives
	- Fresh Italian parsley 
	- Fresh dill
	- Baby arugula
	- 1 lb (500 g) cooked Corned Beef Brisket, shredded
	- Sunflower oil
	- Olive oil
	- White vinegar
	- Dijon mustard
	- Prepared horseradish
	- All-purpose flour 
	- Baking powder
	- Kosher salt
	- Pepper
	- Eggs
Recipe Methods:
	1. Dough: Whisk together flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Whisk together oil, warm water, egg and vinegar in a medium bowl or measuring cup. Make a well in the centre of the dry ingredients and pour in the liquid ingredients. Stir to combine until a ball of dough forms. Transfer dough to a clean work surface and knead for 1 to 2 minutes or until flour is evenly incorporated.&nbsp;Return dough to the bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rest at room temperature for 30 minutes to 1 hour. 
	2. Filling: Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium heat in a skillet. Add onion and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until wilted. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring often, for about 30 minutes or until very soft and caramelized. Let cool.
	3. Meanwhile, place potato in a saucepan and add cold water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat. Season water with salt. Reduce heat and boil gently for about 15 minutes or until soft. Drain and return to pot. Mash until smooth. Let cool.
	4. Whisk together egg and egg yolk in a large bowl. Add caramelized onion, mashed potato, remaining oil, corned beef, thyme and stir until combined. Cover and refrigerate until cool.
	5. Divide dough in half; keep one half covered with plastic wrap. Roll out half of dough into a large rectangle, about ⅛ inch thick and between 12 and 15 inches (30 and 38 cm) on the long side. 
	6. Spoon half of the filling onto the dough, 1 to 2 inches (2.5 to 5 cm) from the long edge closest to you, and shaping it into a 3-inch (7.5 cm) wide log. Lift the long edge of dough closest to you over the filling, then carefully roll up into a cylinder, enclosing the filling. Arrange so the seam is on the bottom and adjust roll if needed so that filling is evenly distributed. 
	7. Trim ends of the dough so it is even with the filling. Using the dull side of a knife, make a light indentation every 2 to 2½ inches (5 to 6 cm) so that your cylinder is divided into 6 equal-sized pieces. Cut through each knish with the sharp side the knife to make 6 log-shaped rolls.
	8. To shape knish, gently press the filling inward on one end of the log with your finger, then stretch the dough over the filling and pinch to seal. Place the pinched end (now the bottom) onto work surface. For the top, use your thumbs and pointer fingers to pinch two opposite sides of the cut edges of dough in towards the center, so there is a slight indent and some filling showing. Place knishes on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, spacing them apart. Repeat with remaining dough and filling.
	9. Egg wash: Whisk egg with 1 tsp (5 mL) water in a small bowl. Brush over knishes and season with salt. 
	10. Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 35 to 40 minutes, rotating pan halfway through, until golden. Let cool on a wire rack.
	11. Mustard and Horseradish Sauce: Combine garlic, mustard, lemon juice, horseradish and egg yolks in a small food processor or in a tall cup using an immersion blender. Purée, slowly drizzling in oil to make a thin emulsion. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl and stir in chives. Cover and refrigerate until serving, for up to 1 day.
	12. Herb Salad: Combine parsley, dill, and arugula in a bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice and toss to combine.
	13. Slice each knish in half crosswise and serve on a platter along with Mustard and Horseradish Sauce and Herb Salad alongside.
Recipe Tips:
  - To cook Corned Beef Brisket: remove Corned Beef Brisket from packaging and place in a Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster; add enough cold water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat.
