	- 1 small onion, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH minced gingerroot, hot curry powder and fresh lemon juice
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH chili powder and salt
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast
	- Cumin-Scented Dressing
		- ¾ cup (175 mL) EACH mayonnaise and ranch dressing
		- 1½ tsp (7 mL) ground cumin
		- Chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Plain yogurt
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 small onion
	- Gingerroot
	- Hot curry powder
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Chili powder
	- Salt
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast
	- Mayonnaise
	- Ranch dressing
	- Ground cumin
	- Chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine yogurt, garlic, onion, gingerroot, curry powder, lemon juice, chili powder and salt in large sealable freezer bag. Pierce roast all over with fork and add to bag, massaging to coat in marinade; seal bag and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours.
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	3. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1¾ hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: see ‘ESTIMATED COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	4. Cumin-Scented Dressing: Meanwhile, whisk together mayonnaise, ranch dressing, cumin and cilantro, to taste (if using) in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate 1 to 2 hours for flavours to develop.
	5. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest 15 minutes. Carve across the grain into thin slices and serve with Cumin-Scented Dressing.
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your oven roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices to settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: 53cafa2d-c609-44d5-83af-6ed631b7c413
Recipe Title: Two-Step Slow Cooker Beef and Mushroom Pot Pie
Recipe Summary: This make-ahead pot pie is prepared in two steps. The beef stew filling is prepared in the slow cooker one day, and then topped with puff pastry and baked for dinner the next day. This recipe is great for potlucks, ski parties, cottage dinners or even homey weeknight dinners. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 630
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 650
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- ½ lb (250 g) potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
	- ½ lb (250 g) mushrooms, halved or quartered if large
	- 1 EACH carrot, onion and stalk celery, chopped
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) tomato paste
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH Dijon mustard and Worcestershire sauce
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 2 bay leaves
	- ½ cup (125 mL) frozen peas
	- 1 sheet (8 oz/250 g) frozen puff pastry, thawed (about 10-inch/25 cm square)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cream or milk
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- ½ lb (250 g) potatoes
	- ½ lb (250 g) mushrooms
	- Carrot
	- Onion
	- Stalk celery
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Tomato paste
	- Fresh rosemary
	- All-purpose flour
	- Dijon mustard
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Frozen peas
	- 1 sheet (8 oz/250 g) frozen puff pastry
	- Cream or milk
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine beef, potatoes, mushrooms, carrot, onion and celery in a 3½- to 6-qt (3.5 to 6 L) slow cooker. Whisk together broth, tomato paste, rosemary, flour, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, salt and pepper in a measuring cup or bowl; pour over meat and vegetables. Add bay leaves; stir to combine. 
	2. Cover and cook on LOW for 8 to 10 hours or on HIGH for 4 to 6 hours or until beef is fork-tender and sauce is thickened and bubbling. Transfer to a deep 9-inch (25 cm) square baking dish. Stir in peas and let cool slightly. Cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. 
	3. To serve, roll out and/or trim pastry to fit over baking dish or pie plate, allowing for a 1-inch (2.5 cm) overhang. Drape pastry over filling and crimp edges around edge of baking dish.
	4. Brush cream over pastry. Cut a few steam vents in centre of pastry. Bake in preheated 425°F oven to for 30 to 35 minutes or until pastry is golden brown and filling is heated through and bubbling. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. 
Recipe Tips:
  - For individual pot pies, divide filling among 4 individual 2-cup (500 mL) baking dishes or ramekins. Place puff pastry on lightly floured surface and cut into 4 equal squares. Top each mini pot pie with a pastry square, trimming and crimping to fit if necessary. Brush pastry with cream and cut a steam vent in centre of each pie. Reduce baking time to 20 to 25 minutes or until pastry is golden brown and filling is heated through and bubbling. For freezer mini pot pies, prepare as above for individual pies, freezing before baking. Wrap pot pies in baking dishes in plastic wrap, then overwrap in foil and freeze for up to 1 month. Bake from frozen. Uncover and place baking dishes in cold oven then set oven to 400°F (200°C). Bake for about 45 to 50 minutes or until pastry is golden brown and filling is heated through and bubbling. It is important that dishes go into a cold oven and gradually warm as the oven heats to prevent the dish from cracking. 
---
Recipe ID: 540dbe0d-dac7-49da-ba67-0a3b1eb8e7dc
Recipe Title: Chili and Coffee Rubbed Oven-Braised Beef
Recipe Summary: These incredible dry-rubbed beef ribs are a nice change from the ooey-gooey glazed variety and just as tender! Perfectly spiced and slow-cooked until tender, these meaty ribs are still going to leave everyone licking their fingers!
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 195
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 210
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH chili powder, finely ground coffee and cracked peppercorns
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH salt, dried oregano leaves and dry mustard
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH garlic powder and onion powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sweet smoked paprika
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- Lime wedges 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Chili powder
	- Finely ground coffee
	- Cracked peppercorns
	- Salt
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Dry mustard
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder
	- Sweet smoked paprika
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs  (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- Lime wedges 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine sugar, chili powder, coffee, peppercorns, salt, oregano, mustard, garlic powder, onion powder and paprika in a small bowl. 
	2. Place ribs on a large foil-lined rimmed baking sheet and rub all over with spice mixture. Fold foil over or over-wrap with another sheet of foil and seal edges to make a foil pouch. Roast in preheated 250°F oven for 3 to 3½ hours until meat is fork tender.
	3. Carefully unwrap ribs and set on a large cutting board. Drain liquid from foil into a small saucepan. Return ribs to baking sheet; set aside. 
	4. Boil liquid over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, for 5 to 8 minutes until reduced to a glaze, about the consistency of maple syrup. 
	5. Broil ribs on middle rack, or remove from baking sheet and grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium heat (350°F/180°C), for 5 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally while brushing generously all over with the glaze, until hot, browned and well-glazed.
	6. Transfer to a cutting board. Cut rack into individual ribs. Serve on a platter with lime wedges.
Recipe Tips:
  - Removing the silverskin from the rack before rubbing with the spice mixture allows the flavours to penetrate the meat better, and enhances tenderness. To remove it from the rack, slide a thin knife between the meat and the membrane, pull up until there is enough to grab hold of with a paper towel. Like removing wallpaper, pull it off with even pressure to remove as one large sheet.
---
Recipe ID: 54d79191-6d0c-48c4-a7ff-0487d6113fcc
Recipe Title: Barbecued Lime-Chipotle Marinated Roast Beef
Recipe Summary: Take a trip south with the flavours of lime and smoked chipotles. Indirect heat-barbecuing makes for a juicy, evenly cooked roast. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 7¼-in (18 cm) long x 4¼-in (10.5 cm wide) x 4½-in (11.5 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 720
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 825
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) minced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH vegetable oil and packed brown sugar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) hot pepper sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground cumin and Dijon mustard
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- Vegetable oil
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Hot pepper sauce
	- Ground cumin
	- Dijon mustard
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine lime juice, chipotle peppers, vegetable oil, brown sugar, hot pepper sauce, cumin, mustard and garlic in large sealable freezer bag. Pierce roast all over with fork and add to bag; massaging to coat; seal and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours. 
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	3. Remove meat from marinade. Transfer used marinade into a small saucepan; set aside. Pat roast dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1½ hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: see ‘ESTIMATED COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, bring reserved marinade to boil over high heat; boil for 1 minute. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with boiled marinade as a sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Carving roast beef across the grain into thin slices optimizes tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: 54dfdf34-a96b-4f68-9b73-218936a6ebc3
Recipe Title: Avocado Toast with Steak, Pickled Onions and Black Sesame  
Recipe Summary: Ever-popular avocado toast makes a nice lunch or a light dinner when topped with the protein boost of sliced beef steak. This recipe is a great way to use leftover steak or roast beef as well. It has been adapted from the original by Chef Vitiello to make at home. 
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Quick Pickled Onions
		- ½ cup (125 mL) rice vinegar
		- 1½ tsp (7 mL) granulated sugar
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) kosher salt
		- Half clove garlic
		- Pinch hot pepper flakes
		- Half red onion, sliced into 1/2-inch (1 cm) moons
	- Sweet Pea and Avocado Guacamole
		- 1 ripe avocado
		- 1 cup (250 mL) blanched sweet peas (fresh or frozen)
		- 1 jalapeño pepper, minced
		- 1 clove garlic, finely grated
		- 1 green onion, thinly sliced
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh cilantro
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) kosher salt
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) freshly squeezed lime juice
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- Toast
		- ½ lb (250 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak or Flank Steak, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick, trimmed
		- Kosher salt and fresh ground pepper
		- Olive oil
		- 4 slices crusty sourdough bread, cut ½ inch (1 cm) thick
		- 1 clove garlic, halved
		- 2 radishes, thinly sliced
		- 2 sprigs fresh dill, picked from stems
		- Persian or mini English cucumber, thinly sliced
		- Black sesame seeds
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic
	- 1 red onion
	- 1 avocado
	- Sweet peas (fresh or frozen)
	- 1 jalapeño pepper
	- Green onions
	- Fresh cilantro
	- 1 lime
	- 4 slices crusty sourdough bread, cut ½ inch (1 cm) thick
	- 2 radishes
	- Fresh dill
	- 1 Persian cucumber
	- ½ lb (250 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak or Flank Steak, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick, trimmed
	- Olive oil
	- Rice vinegar
	- Kosher salt
	- Pepper
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Black sesame seeds
	- Granulated sugar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pickled Onions: Combine vinegar, sugar, salt, garlic and hot pepper flakes in a small saucepan; bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring to dissolve sugar and salt. Pour over onions in a heatproof bowl and let stand for at least 15 minutes. (Pickled onions can be made ahead and stored in a jar with a tight-fitting lid in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.)
	2. Sweet Pea and Avocado Guacamole: Combine avocado, peas, jalapeño, garlic, green onion, cilantro, salt, lime juice and oil in a medium bowl; mash with potato masher or fork until chunky but cohesive. Set aside.
	3. Toast: Pat steak dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C), or pan-fry in an oiled skillet using medium-high heat, for 6 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	4. Toast the bread in toaster until well browned. Place toast on a serving platter, drizzle with about 2 tbsp (30 mL) oil and rub the toast with the cut sides of the garlic clove.
	5. Cut steak across the grain into thin slices. Spread a generous amount of Sweet Pea and Avocado Guacamole on each slice of toast; top with radishes, steak, Pickled Onions, cucumbers and dill. Garnish with an extra drizzle of olive oil and a heathy pinch of salt, pepper and black sesame seeds. Serve any extra Sweet Pea and Avocado Guacamole on the side or reserve for another use. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Leftover Sweet Pea and Avocado Guacamole can be covered with food wrap directly on the surface and refrigerated for up to 1 day.
---
Recipe ID: 550b9616-29bc-460a-a245-097dca0b22aa
Recipe Title: Seared Beef Heart with Blue Cheese Butter, Frizzled Shallots and Garlic Chips
Recipe Summary: Heart has a deep, beefy flavour that works well with the tang of blue cheese. Serve with a simple tomato salad and roasted potatoes.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) crumbled blue cheese
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) softened butter
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 2 lb (1 kg) piece Beef Heart 
	- 6 large cloves garlic, peeled 
	- 3 medium shallots, peeled
	- Vegetable oil
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) crumbled blue cheese
	- Softened butter
	- Fresh parsley
	- 2 lb (1 kg) piece  Beef Heart 
	- 6 large cloves garlic
	- 3 medium shallots
	- Vegetable oil
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Mash blue cheese, butter and parsley together in a small bowl. Form into a 4-inch (10 cm) log, wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours, or for up to 3 days.
	2. Rinse heart under cold water. Trim off fat, membranes and any fibrous tissue from the heart. Cut into 4 equal, steak-like pieces.
	3. Thinly slice the garlic cloves crosswise into 1/16-inch (2 mm) thick slices using a very sharp knife or mandoline (with caution). Repeat with shallots, keeping separate from garlic; separate the rings of shallots.
	4. Heat 1 inch (2.5 cm) of oil over medium-low heat in a small, heavy skillet. Add sliced garlic and cook, stirring occasionally and watching carefully, for about 4 to 5 minutes or until pale gold. Strain through a sieve into a heatproof bowl, saving the oil. Place the chips on a paper towel-lined plate to cool.
	 5. Return the oil to the skillet and reheat over medium-low heat. Add the shallots and cook, stirring occasionally and watching carefully, for about 5 to 6 minutes or until the shallots are a shade past golden brown. Strain through a sieve into the same heatproof bowl. (Save the oil to use in salads and marinades.) Place the shallots on another paper towel-lined plate to cool.
	6. Season the heart with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add the heart and cook for 4 to 6 minutes, turning twice or more, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into steaks reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the most. Transfer to 4 heated plates. 
	7. Cut the blue cheese butter into 8 slices. Place 2 pieces on each piece of heart. Pile the shallots evenly on top then sprinkle with the garlic chips. Serve immediately.
Recipe Tips:
  - If using a mandoline, use the hand guard, ideally, and exercise extreme caution. You can cook the heart in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 4 to 6 minutes, turning twice or more, until instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into steaks reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the most.
---
Recipe ID: 554263e4-2927-4f85-b8d4-258853fc1f3a
Recipe Title: Grilled Asian-Style Beef Kabobs with Eggplant
Recipe Summary: When is an amazing steak not a steak? When it becomes amazing kabobs!
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 12
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 27
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Bamboo or metal skewers
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH hoisin sauce, soy sauce and ketchup
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH maple syrup, minced gingerroot and garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Hanger Grilling Steak , cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) Chinese five-spice powder
	- Salt and pepper
	- 3 baby eggplants, sliced ½-inch (1 cm) thick
	- Toasted sesame seeds (optional)
	- Chopped green onions (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Bamboo or metal skewers
	- Hoisin sauce
	- Soy sauce
	- Ketchup
	- Maple syrup
	- Gingerroot
	- Garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Hanger Grilling Steak , cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Chinese five-spice powder
	- Salt and pepper
	- 3 baby eggplants
	- Toasted sesame seeds (optional)
	- Green onions (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Soak bamboo skewers (if using) in water for at least 30 minutes.
	 2. Meanwhile, combine hoisin, soy sauce, ketchup, maple syrup, gingerroot and garlic in a small bowl. Pour half into a separate bowl; reserve one portion to baste the meat and one to baste the eggplant.
	3. Pat beef cubes dry with paper towel. Season beef cubes all over with Chinese five-spice powder and salt and pepper to your taste. Thread onto skewers. 
	4. Grill skewers in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides and basting with one portion of the sauce near the end of cooking, until cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer to a plate. Discard any remaining meat basting sauce. 
	5. Meanwhile, place eggplant slices on grill in single layer; with clean basting brush, lightly baste upper side with the reserved eggplant basting sauce. Grill 2 to 3 minutes; turn and baste lightly. Grill for 2 to 3 minutes until just softened. Transfer to serving bowl and drizzle with any remaining eggplant basting sauce. Serve with beef kabobs; garnishing with sesame seeds and green onions, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - For best browning and flavour, pat steak cubes dry with paper towels before grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 56893d90-ab52-4af1-9928-2ffe0f71d830
Recipe Title: Roast Beef with Peppercorn Wine Sauce, Yorkies and Fried Shallots
Recipe Summary: A simple pan sauce, Yorkshire Puddings (a.k.a. popovers) and crispy Frizzled Shallots accompany this simple roast beef to create an upscale meal. The Yorkies recipe here is courtesy of an old edition of Home &amp; Gardens cookbook. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 8-in (20 cm) long x 6½-in (16 cm) wide x 2½-in (6.5 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 12
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast
	- 5 cloves garlic, cut into slivers
	- Coarse sea salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Yorkie Puddings
		- 1 cup (250 mL) all-purpose flour
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
		- 1 cup (250 mL) milk
		- 2 eggs
	- Frizzled Shallots
		- ½ cup (125 mL) vegetable oil
		- 8 shallots, peeled, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced (about 1¼ cups/300 mL)
		-  Peppercorn Wine Sauce
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
		- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH sodium-reduced beef broth and red wine
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) cracked mixed peppercorns
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast
	- 5 cloves garlic
	- Coarse sea salt and fresh ground pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Salt
	- Milk
	- 2 eggs
	- Vegetable oil
	- 8 shallots
	- Sodium-reduced beef broth
	- Red wine
	- Cracked mixed peppercorns
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut shallow slits all over roast; insert garlic slivers into slits. Rub all over with coarse salt and pepper. Place, fat side up, on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F. Cook for about 2 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	Yorkie Puddings: : 
		2. Meanwhile, combine flour and salt in a large bowl. Add milk and eggs; beat with electric mixer just until smooth. Cover and refrigerate until ready to cook (note allow batter to return to room temperature before baking). 
	&nbsp;Frizzled Shallots: : 
		3. Heat vegetable oil in heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add half of the shallots and cook, stirring constantly, for 6 to 7 minutes or until just golden. Remove using slotted spoon to paper-towel lined plate. Repeat with remaining shallots. (Make ahead: store refrigerated for up to one week in air tight container.)
		4. Transfer roast on cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for at least 15 minutes. 
		5. While roast rests, bake Yorkie Puddings: Pour off all but 2 tbsp (30 mL) fat from roasting pan into a liquid measuring cup; set roasting pan aside. Pour a bit of the reserved fat into each cup of a 12-cup muffin pan; heat the pan in 425ºF oven for 5 minutes. Divide Yorkie Pudding mixture among the muffin cups and bake for 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown. Serve immediately.
		6. Peppercorn Wine Sauce: Heat reserved fat and pan drippings in roasting pan over medium-high heat. Whisk in flour; cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in beef broth, red wine and peppercorns. Bring to a boil, stirring up any browned bits from bottom of pan; cook, whisking, for 4 minutes or until sauce is thickened. 
		7. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with hot Peppercorn Wine Sauce and Yorkie Puddings. Top with a few Frizzled Shallots.
Recipe Tips:
  - When buying a beef oven roast, buy 12 oz (375 g) beef per person for bone-in-roasts or for boneless roasts, buy 6 to 8 oz (175 to 250 g) beef per person.
---
Recipe ID: 56a61f79-3b50-431f-a76e-fc494f058f8c
Recipe Title: Grilled Mucho-Mexican Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Explore some of the flavours of the world’s cuisines right in your own back yard with this Mexican-inspired marinade, featuring smoky chipotle peppers and herbaceous cilantro. Serve with grilled sweet peppers and onions and a corn and bean sauté seasoned with lime.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 500
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) steak sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) pizza sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH vegetable oil and chopped fresh cilantro
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- 1 green onion, sliced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Steak 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Steak sauce
	- Pizza sauce
	- Vegetable oil
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Minced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- 1 green onion
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Steak 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine steak sauce, oil, pizza sauce, chipotle peppers and green onion in a sealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with fork and cut into 2 equal pieces. Add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. 
	3. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. 
	4. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steaks across the grain to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Carve Marinating Steaks across the grain to maximize tenderness.
  - No grill? Pan-fry these steaks over medium-high heat in an oiled skillet or place on a rack over a rimmed baking sheet and broil instead of grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 56d55113-c7c5-4d55-a609-81656fc10378
Recipe Title: Braised Beef Bourguignon
Recipe Summary: What could be classier – or easier – than serving classic Beef Bourguignon when you host your next soirée? Serve this recipe with mashed potatoes, egg noodles or rice.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 195
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 slices bacon, diced
	- 2 medium onions, sliced lengthwise
	- 8 oz (250 g) mushrooms, halved
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- Vegetable oil (if necessary)
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) red wine
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) beef broth
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried thyme
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 slices bacon
	- 2 medium onions
	- 8 oz (250 g) mushrooms
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- Vegetable oil (if necessary)
	- All-purpose flour
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Red wine
	- Beef broth
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Dried thyme
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pan-fry bacon in Dutch oven or enamelled cast iron roaster over medium-high heat, stirring, until lightly browned. Transfer bacon to a medium bowl with a slotted spoon and set aside. Add onions and mushrooms to pot and cook, stirring, for about 8 minutes or until just browned. Add to the bacon; set aside.
	2. Brown beef, in batches and adding vegetable oil if necessary, turning to brown all sides. Transfer beef to a second large bowl as it’s browned, and then return to pot with any accumulated juices. Sprinkle flour over meat. Stir in garlic, wine, broth, bay leaf, thyme, salt and pepper into the pot; bring to a simmer, scraping up brown bits from pot.
	3. Cover and cook in 325°F oven for 2 hours. Stir in reserved bacon, onions and mushrooms; cover and cook for another 30 minutes or until beef is fork-tender. Discard bay leaf.
Recipe Tips:
  - To use slow cooker: After Step 2, transfer meat to 6-quart (6 L) slow cooker. Cover and cook on Low for 8 hours, adding reserved bacon, onions and mushrooms in final hour.
---
Recipe ID: 5745f943-68c1-4f90-90ee-38a1b8a5e5ab
Recipe Title: Simply-Seasoned Grilled Steak with Garlic and Herb Butter
Recipe Summary: Much like topping a finished steak with a traditional compound butter, this perfectly grilled steak gets finished with a fresh herb butter without the bother of making and chilling the butter in advance of serving. This technique of smearing the seasoned butter on the cutting board allows the hot steak to become coated in the herb butter as it rests before carving. This steak is also known as a Porterhouse Grilling Steak and it has the same type of bone you find in a T-bone Steak.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) butter, softened 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh chives and parsley 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) anchovy paste (optional)
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 Beef Porterhouse T-bone Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and freshly ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Butter
	- Fresh chives
	- Fresh parsley
	- Anchovy paste (optional)
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 Beef Porterhouse T-bone Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine butter, parsley, chives, anchovy paste (if using), hot pepper flakes and garlic on a large wooden cutting board until evenly blended. Brush the butter mixture over the surface of the board. Set aside.
	2. Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper. 
	3. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for about 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	4. Transfer steaks to buttered board. Drag both sides of each steak over the butter until well coated; let rest for 5 minutes. Carve meat from bone, then across the grain into slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use this board butter with any grilling steak, such as T-Bone, Strip Loin and Rib Eye.
---
Recipe ID: 583b8ed6-5bcc-45d0-ae63-ee71cfd924bd
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef Roulade-Style with Smoked Salmon
Recipe Summary: Smoked salmon has long been a favourite in the Eastern provinces. Resourceful Easterners find unique ways to use this delicacy as demonstrated here in this Roulade. What better way to enjoy smoked salmon than to pair it with grilled beef?
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 35
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Outside Round Marinating Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick 
	- 4 oz (125 g) chive and garlic flavoured spreadable cream cheese, such as Boursin
	- 4 oz (125 g) thinly sliced smoked salmon
	- 2 green onions, finely chopped
	- Fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Outside Round Marinating Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick  
	- Chive and garlic flavoured spreadable cream cheese (such as Boursin)
	- 4 oz (125 g) thinly sliced smoked salmon
	- Green onions
	- Fresh ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pound one side of the steak with a jagged side of the meat mallet until about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick. Spread pounded side of steak with cream cheese to within ¼ inch (5 mm) of edge. Sprinkle with green onions and pepper to your taste. Cover completely with smoked salmon slices in a single layer, overlapping edges of salmon as necessary. Starting with a long side, roll up like jelly roll. Tie tightly in 1-inch (2.5 cm) intervals with soaked butcher’s twine to secure, or hold together with metal skewers. 
	2. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 30 to 35 minutes, turning about every 8 minutes to brown all sides, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted in centre of roll reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	3. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Place seam-side-down, remove twine or skewers and carve crosswise into ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to let roulades rest for about 5 minutes after cooking so that the juices get the chance to settle before you serve or slice.
---
Recipe ID: 58c2ca11-3523-4329-afbf-9a30b551b4c0
Recipe Title: Saucy Barbecue-Smoked Cowboy Beef Strips
Recipe Summary: The boneless strips of beef used in this recipe are cut from meat between Beef Back Ribs. A good amount of marbling makes them flavourful and perfect for longer cooking times like smoking. This recipe adds a light smoker-like flavour, without the use of a smoker. Serve with tangy coleslaw and potato salad or roasted fingerling potato wedges.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 136
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 151
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Wood chips, soaked according to package directions 
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat(about 8 pieces)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH chili powder and sweet paprika
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH freshly ground pepper, packed brown sugar, finely ground coffee and ground cumin
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and garlic powder
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH cayenne pepper and ground cloves
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) barbecue sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) maple syrup
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Wood chips, soaked according to package directions 
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat(about 8 pieces)
	- Chili powder
	- Sweet paprika
	- Freshly ground pepper
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Finely ground coffee
	- Ground cumin
	- Salt
	- Garlic powder
	- Cayenne pepper
	- Ground cloves
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Maple syrup
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
Recipe Methods:
	1. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). Turn off burner under drip pan. 
	2. Add soaked wood chips to smoker box. Alternatively, wrap 2 cups (5 oz/150 g) wood chips loosely in foil to create a small pouch, punching a few holes at the top of the pouch to let the smoke out. Place smoker box or pouch on the grill grate above the burner that is turned on for 10 to 20 minutes, or until starting to smoke.
	3. Meanwhile, trim excess fat from the meat to your taste. Starting at the thicker end of each piece of meat, make a cut in between the meat and the fibrous silverskin, lifting the fat and silverskin away from the meat while you trim along the strip of meat. (Tip: Grip the silverskin with a paper towel to prevent slipping.). Discard the trim. Place meat in a large bowl.
	4. Combine chili powder, paprika, pepper, sugar, coffee, cumin, salt, garlic powder, cayenne and cloves in a small bowl. Sprinkle spice blend over meat and toss until evenly coated.
	 5. When wood chips start to smoke, place meat on grill over drip pan (off the heat). Close lid and cook for about 2 hours or until fork-tender.
	6. Meanwhile, combine barbecue sauce, maple syrup and mustard in a small bowl; set aside for basting.
	7. Move meat to grill that is over the burner that is turned on. Cook for 6 to 8 minutes, basting with reserved sauce and turning as needed, or until lightly charred and caramelized. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute the homemade seasoning blend with about 3 tbsp (45 mL) of your favourite store-bought spice blend, such as barbecue, chipotle or Tex-Mex. The fibrous silverskin on finger meat is tough. Removing it before cooking makes the meat much more tender. Double the recipe to serve a hungry crowd. Substitute finely ground coffee with instant coffee or espresso powder.
---
Recipe ID: 58e981bd-d4c4-45aa-b2bd-b974fbbdb09a
Recipe Title: Slow-Simmered Beef and Carrots with Uzbeki-Style Pilaf
Recipe Summary: This national dish of Uzbekistan is mild and deliciously spiced. The garlic is cooked as a whole head and becomes buttery soft. It’s meant to be shared and squeezed from the peel to eat with the pilaf. If you’re a garlic fan, use two heads of garlic instead of one.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 cups (750 mL) medium-grain rice, such as jasmine
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat 
	- 2½ tsp (12 mL) salt, divided
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) finely diced onion
	- 2 cups (500 mL) batons (1½-inch/4 cm long) carrots
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) ground cumin
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) sweet paprika
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground coriander
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 3 bay leaves
	- 1 head garlic, papery outer skin removed
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Medium-grain rice, such as jasmine
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Rib Finger Meat 
	- Salt
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onion
	- Carrots
	- Ground cumin
	- Sweet paprika
	- Ground coriander
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 3 bay leaves
	- 1 head garlic
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place rice in a large bowl and cover with cold water. Swish it around with your hand 3 to 4 times then pour off the water. Repeat 3 to 4 times or until the water runs clear. Cover again with cold water and let stand for 30 minutes while you prepare the rest of the ingredients. Drain through a sieve and reserve.
	2. Trim excess fat from the meat to your taste. Starting at the thicker end of each piece of meat, make a cut in between the meat and the fibrous silverskin, lifting the fat and silverskin away from the meat while you trim along the strip of meat. (Tip: Grip the silverskin with a paper towel to prevent slipping.). Discard the trim. Cut the meat crosswise into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces. 
	3. Season the beef all over with 1 tsp (5 mL) salt. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over high heat in a large Dutch oven or deep enamelled cast-iron roaster. Add half the beef and, cook, turning, until browned on all sides. Transfer to a plate. Add 1 tbsp (15 mL) more oil and brown remaining beef. Transfer to plate. 
	4. Reduce heat to medium heat and add the remaining 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil to the pot. Cook onions, stirring frequently for about 5 minutes until onions start to brown. Add cumin, paprika, coriander and pepper; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Return the beef and any accumulated juices to the pot, stirring to coat with onions and spices. Add 2 cups (500 mL) water, bay leaves and head of garlic. Stir well and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 1½ hours or until beef is tender. Add a splash of water if the liquid is reducing too quickly and lower the heat. The liquid should be reduced by half at the end of cooking. 
	5. Set garlic aside. Arrange carrots in a layer over beef mixture. Add rice to the pot, leveling it with the back of a spoon. Stir remaining 1½ tsp (7 mL) salt into 1 cup (250 mL) water; pour over rice. Add enough additional water (about 2 to 3 cups/500 to 750 mL) to cover the rice by ½ inch (1 cm). Place the whole head of garlic on the rice, root end pointing down. Bring to a boil over high heat.
	6. Reduce heat to medium and boil, uncovered, until the water reaches the level of the rice and bubbles are breaking over the surface of the rice. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes until all the water is absorbed and the rice is tender. Remove from heat and let rest for 10 minutes. Remove the garlic. Fold rice and beef mixture gently to distribute the ingredients and transfer to a large serving dish. Discard bay leaves. Place the garlic head on top as a garnish. The garlic is meant to be shared and squeezed from the peel to eat with the pilaf.
Recipe Tips:
  - To save time, you can use an electric pressure cooker to cook the beef then finish the dish on top of the stove. Brown the beef then transfer to the pressure cooker. Follow Step 3 for cooking the onions and spices and add to the pressure cooker. Add 2 cups (500 mL) water. Seal the electric pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to High and time for 20 minutes. Quick release pressure, then transfer the mixture to a pot on top of the stove. Continue with Step 4.
---
Recipe ID: 5a013873-6225-4ec7-a754-59d1b64e809b
Recipe Title: Baked Ground Beef, Spinach and Cheese-Stuffed Shells
Recipe Summary: Although this recipe may seem a bit fussy, it has a two-pan plan: it makes two pans, so you can freeze one for a future meal. Since stuffed shells are showier and easier to serve than lasagna, this recipe is perfect for potluck and buffet-style dinners.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 55
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 box (340 g) jumbo pasta shells (about 44 shells)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Chuck 
	- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
	- 2 to 3 large cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried Italian herb seasoning
	- 1 tub (454 g) light ricotta cheese
	- 1 pkg (300 g) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese, divided
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) pepper
	- 4 cups (1 L) pasta sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) grated Parmesan cheese (approx)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 box (340 g) jumbo pasta shells (about 44 shells)
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Lean Ground Beef Chuck 
	- 1 medium onion
	- 2 to 3 large cloves garlic
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- 1 tub (454 g) light ricotta cheese
	- 1 pkg (300 g) frozen chopped spinach
	- Shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
	- Pepper
	- Pasta sauce
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook pasta shells according to package directions. Drain and rinse; set aside. (Don’t worry if some shells tear as you won’t need them all.)
	2. Meanwhile, cook beef, onion, garlic to your taste, and Italian seasoning over medium heat in large deep skillet, stirring and breaking up beef with a spoon, for 10 minutes or until beef is completely cooked and any liquid has evaporated or drain. Remove from heat. 
	3. Stir in ricotta, spinach, 1 cup (250 mL) of the mozzarella and pepper; combine well. Spoon 2 tbsp (30 mL) into each of about 32 shells.
	4. Spread 1⅓ cups (325 mL) pasta sauce into each of a 13 x 9-inch (3 L) baking dish and 9-inch (23 cm) glass pie plate. Place 20 filled shells in baking dish, and about 12 in pie plate. Top shells in baking dish with remaining pasta sauce (none needed for pie plate). Sprinkle Parmesan and remaining mozzarella over shells in both dishes. (Can be covered and refrigerated for up to 2 days or frozen.)
	5. Cover loosely with foil and bake in 350°F (180°C) oven for about 30 minutes (40 minutes if refrigerated; about 1½ hours if baking from frozen) or until hot and bubbling. Uncover and bake for 5 minutes. Serve garnished with more Parmesan cheese, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Eating beef along with spinach actually increases the amount of iron absorbed from the spinach by 150% - this is known as the Meat Factor.
---
Recipe ID: 5af53651-b06b-4e80-b377-d6b6241d1e18
Recipe Title: Spicy Mandarin-Style Beef Noodle Soup
Recipe Summary: This spicy soup is a classic that’s enjoyed throughout the Mandarin speaking world. 
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 80
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 110
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Soup
	- 2 whole small-sized Beef Digital Flexor Meat (each about 10 to 12 oz/300 to 375 g)
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH Shaoxing wine (Chinese cooking wine) or medium-dry sherry 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH light soy sauce, dark soy sauce and tomato paste
	- Four ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices fresh gingerroot
	- 8 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ large onion
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt (approx)
	- 1 small cinnamon stick
	- 2 EACH whole star anise, dried hot chili peppers, bay leaves and Chinese black cardamom pods (tsao ko)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) Szechuan peppercorns
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) doubanjiang (chili bean paste)
	-  Noodles and Garnish
	- 4 baby bok choy, cut in half lengthwise
	- 14 oz (400 g) Chinese-style thin, round, fresh wheat noodles
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) coarsely chopped fresh cilantro
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- Optional garnish: Zhenjiang black vinegar, chili oil, sesame oil and pickled mustard greens (zhacai)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 whole small-sized  Beef Digital Flexor Meat  (each about 10 to 12 oz/300 to 375 g)
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Shaoxing wine (Chinese cooking wine) or medium-dry sherry
	- Light soy sauce
	- Dark soy sauce
	- Tomato paste
	- Fresh gingerroot
	- 8 cloves garlic
	- Large onion
	- Salt
	- 1 small cinnamon stick
	- 2 whole star anise
	- 2 Dried hot chili peppers
	- 2 Bay leaves
	- 2 Chinese black cardamom pods (tsao ko)
	- Szechuan peppercorns
	- Doubanjiang (chili bean paste)
	- 4 baby bok choy
	- 14 oz (400 g) Chinese-style thin, round, fresh wheat noodles
	- Fresh cilantro
	- 2 green onions
	- Optional garnish: Zhenjiang black vinegar, chili oil, sesame oil and pickled mustard greens (zhacai)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut each Digital Flexor Meat in half lengthwise, then cut each piece in half crosswise. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add meat and cook, turning with tongs, until browned on all sides. Transfer to electric pressure cooker. 
	2. Add 6 cups (1.5 L) water, sugar, wine, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, tomato paste, ginger, garlic, onion and salt to pressure cooker pot. If desired, enclose cinnamon, star anise, chili peppers, bay leaves, cardamom and Szechuan peppercorns in a cheesecloth bundle, tea ball or spice infuser and add to pot, or add spices loose, then add doubanjiang. Seal the pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to High and time for 1 hour. 
	3. When the timer beeps, let the pressure release naturally. Remove the lid. Scoop out beef with a slotted spoon and set aside. Strain the broth through a colander or large sieve into a large bowl; discard solids. Return the liquid and meat to the pot; set your pressure cooker to keep soup at a simmer. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt.
	 4. Noodles and Garnish: Bring 8 cups (2 L) water to a boil over high heat in a large pot. Add the bok choy and boil for 1 to 2 minutes, until the leaves turn bright green. Scoop out of water with a strainer or slotted spoon and transfer to a bowl. Add the noodles to the water and return to a boil; cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until just tender. Drain and quickly distribute between 4 bowls. Place 2 pieces each of the beef and bok choy on the noodles. Pour the hot soup into each bowl and garnish with the cilantro and green onions. Serve with optional garnishes at the table.
Recipe Tips:
  - To substitute for Szechuan peppercorns, grind 2 tsp (10 mL) black peppercorns in a spice grinder and combine with 1 tsp finely grated lemon zest. Measure out the 1 tsp (5 mL) that you need for the recipe and store the remainder covered in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
---
Recipe ID: 5b174df5-0e00-4535-a225-31236cf95335
Recipe Title: Grilled Soy-Marinated Steak with Garlic Smashed Potatoes
Recipe Summary: There is nothing quite like a simple meal of grilled steak and potatoes. Serving with tender grilled asparagus spears would complete the meal.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) soy sauce
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) minced gingerroot
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 1½ lb (750 g) mini potatoes, scrubbed
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cider or rice vinegar
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Soy sauce
	- Packed brown sugar
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 1½ lb (750 g) mini potatoes
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Cider or rice vinegar
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, sugar, garlic and gingerroot in large sealable freezer bag. Cut steak into 6 equal pieces. Add steaks to bag, turning to coat; seal bag and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes.
	2 Garlic Smashed Potatoes: Place potatoes in a pot of cold water; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and boil gently for about 12 minutes or until tender. Drain and let cool slightly.
	3. Flatten each potato lightly with your hand while keeping it intact. Whisk together oil, vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add potatoes and toss gently to coat; set aside.
	4. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Meanwhile, grill potatoes for 3 to 5 minutes, turning once, until crisp and golden. Return to bowl and coat with any remaining vinaigrette.
	5. Let steak rest for 5 minutes. Serve with warm potatoes.
Recipe Tips:
  - Thin steaks grill too quickly, becoming dry and overdone. Look for steaks cut at least 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick.
---
Recipe ID: 5b27ced4-9edc-40f6-9db3-0f2057b5d7d1
Recipe Title: Grilled Teriyaki Temptation Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Explore a taste of Japan right in your own back yard with this teriyaki marinade, made with ingredients you likely have on hand. Marinate an Inside Round steak in the morning and be ready for a quick grill at dinner time.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 495
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH Worcestershire sauce and soy sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH rice vinegar and vegetable oil
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH sesame oil, liquid honey and garlic powder
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground ginger
	- 1 green onion, sliced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Soy sauce
	- Rice vinegar
	- Vegetable oil
	- Sesame oil
	- Liquid honey
	- Garlic powder
	- Ground ginger
	- 1 green onion
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, vegetable oil, sesame oil, honey, garlic powder, ginger and green onion in a sealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with fork and cut into 4 equal pieces. Add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. 
	3. Grill in a preheated closed barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	4. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steak across the grain to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Marinades are all about building steak flavour and juiciness. Piercing steak all over with a fork is what helps tenderize the steak.
  - No grill? Pan-fry these steaks over medium-high heat in an oiled skillet or place on a rack over a rimmed baking sheet and broil instead of grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 5b8def19-9d67-42f3-b162-ac831108eb53
Recipe Title: Traditional Fast-Fry Chicken Fried Steak 
Recipe Summary: Chicken or steak? This odd ball named steak is a Southern U.S. diner steak classic, that has the crispy coating resembling fried chicken. The key to success is to have your ingredients all at the ready before you start to cook – don’t skip this important step. For a classic Southern meal, serve with mashed potatoes, green beans and warm biscuits.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 12 Beef Eye of Round Fast-fry Steaks, each 6 inches (15 cm) long (about 1½ lb/750 g total)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) all-purpose flour
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) milk
	- 2 eggs, beaten
	- ½ cup (125 mL) vegetable oil, divided (approx)
	- Gravy
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) butter
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
		- 3 cups (750 mL) milk
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
		- Fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 12 Beef Eye of Round Fast-fry Steaks, each 6-inches (8 cm) long (about 1½ lb/750 g total)
	- Vegetable oil
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Eggs
	- Butter
	- 3¾ cups (925 mL) milk
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper. Place flour in a shallow bowl. Whisk milk with eggs in a separate shallow bowl. Working with one slice at a time, coat steak in flour, dip in milk mixture and then return to flour. Coat steak completely with flour; pressing firmly yet carefully, so that the coating adheres to the meat. Arrange steaks in a single layer on a large baking sheet.&nbsp;
	2. Heat half the oil over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet; cook steaks, in batches, for 4 minutes, turning once, until meat is cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF), coating is golden brown and meat is still pink inside. Transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and keep warm in preheated 250ºF oven. Add more oil to skillet as needed between batches. (If steaks begin to brown too quickly, reduce heat slightly or if steaks are not sizzling when added to the pan, increase heat.)&nbsp;
	3. Gravy: Discard any remaining oil from skillet. Wipe skillet with paper towel to remove any overly browned bits. Melt butter over medium heat in skillet. Sprinkle in flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes or until a lightly browned paste forms. Pour in about ½ cup (125 mL) of the milk, whisking constantly, until mixture is smooth. Whisk in remaining milk; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and boil gently, stirring occasionally, for about 3 to 5 minutes or until sauce has thickened to gravy consistency. Season with salt and ½ tsp (2 mL) pepper.&nbsp;
	4. Serve sauce over steaks and finish with additional pepper, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Avoid crowding the pan during the frying to ensure an evenly golden coating and don’t layer the cooked steaks on top of each other, as this will cause the coating to steam and become soggy. You can elevate the cream sauce by adding a splash of white wine and up to 1 tsp (5 mL) dried thyme or crumbled sage leaves before whisking in the milk.
---
Recipe ID: 5bb021ce-d340-4300-bbbe-31cb1812940e
Recipe Title: Slow-cooker Pulled Beef Poutine
Recipe Summary: Why do take-out when it’s simple enough to make at this yummy poutine at home – no deep-fryer required! For super simple last minute prep, cook the pot roast the day ahead. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 480
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 500
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) barbecue sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH red wine, steak sauce and Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 onion, cut lengthwise into wedges
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Cross Rib Pot Roast
	- 4 large potatoes
	- Olive or vegetable oil
	- Coarse salt
	- 1 cup (250 mL) cheese curds
	- ⅔ cup (150 mL) sliced green onions
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Red wine
	- Steak sauce
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Cross Rib Pot Roast
	- 4 large potatoes
	- Olive or vegetable oil
	- Coarse salt
	- Cheese curds
	- Green onions
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine barbecue sauce, red wine, steak sauce, Worcestershire sauce, onion and garlic in minimum 5-qt (5 L) slow cooker. Add beef, turning to coat.
	2. Cover and cook on LOW for 8 to 10 hours (or 4 hours on HIGH) or until beef is fork-tender. 
	3. Meanwhile, cut potatoes into chunky sticks or wedges and toss with some oil and coarse salt to your taste in a large bowl. Arrange in a single layer on foil-lined baking sheet that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Roast in preheated 400°F oven, turning occasionally, for 20 to 30 minutes or until browned and tender.
	4. Transfer roast to a bowl and cut off twine; use two forks to pull beef into shreds. Skim fat from sauce; return shredded beef to sauce, tossing to coat. Serve beef with sauce over cooked potatoes and top with cheese curds and green onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - Pot Roasts actually taste better when made the day ahead! Here’s how: Refrigerate cooked pot roast overnight in its braising sauce. Next day, skim any fat from sauce and thinly slice roast crosswise; place meat in ovenproof casserole. Heat sauce and pour over meat. Cover and heat in 350°F oven for about 25 minutes.
---
Recipe ID: 5c0e7a06-53dd-43e3-b561-1cd4d263dd88
Recipe Title: Swedish Meatballs
Recipe Summary: The fresh bread crumbs are easy to make with any stale bread and when soaked in the milk, become the secret to tender juicy meatballs – the panade. Meatballs are browned and cooked in the skillet before adding to the simmering cream sauce so they have good colour and flavour but don’t discolour the sauce. Stir in the sour cream just at the end so the cream sauce does not curdle or break. Serve over cooked potatoes or with buttered egg noodles. This recipe was adapted from Chef Alexandra Feswick’s original and modified, as necessary, for home cooks.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 35
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Sauce
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) unsalted butter
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) all-purpose flour
		- 1 cup (250 mL) beef broth, warm
		- 1 cup (250 mL) whipping cream
		- ½ to 1 cup (125 to 250 mL) sour cream
	- Meatballs
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) canola or sunflower oil, divided (approx)
		- ½ cup (125 mL) finely chopped onion
		- ½ cup (125 mL) fresh white bread crumbs
		- ½ cup (125 mL) milk
		- 1 egg
		- 1 egg
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) dry mustard
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground cardamom and nutmeg 
		- Pinch ground cinnamon
		- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- Garnish
		- Fresh dill sprigs
		- 1 green onion, sliced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 onion
	- Fresh dill
	- Green onion
	- White bread (for crumbs)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Beef broth
	- Salt
	- Dry mustard
	- Ground cardamom
	- Ground nutmeg 
	- Ground cinnamon
	- All-purpose flour
	- Unsalted butter
	- Milk
	- Egg
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whipping cream
	- Sour cream
Recipe Methods:
	1. Sauce: Melt butter over medium heat in a saucepan. Add flour and cook, stirring, for about 4 minutes or until bubbling, but not browned. Whisk in warm beef broth until blended and smooth. Gradually whisk in cream and bring to a gently boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer gently, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until thick. Remove from heat and set aside.
	2. Meatballs: Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil over medium heat in a nonstick skillet. Cook onions, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until soft. Transfer to a large bowl and let cool slightly. (Reserve skillet.)
	3. Combine bread crumbs and milk in a small bowl; let soak for 5 to 10 minutes.
	4. Add egg, salt, dry mustard, cardamom, nutmeg and cinnamon to onion in bowl; beat with a fork until blended. Gently mix in beef and bread crumb mixture until blended (careful not to over-mix). Scoop meat mixture by a heaping teaspoonful (5 mL) and roll into small meatballs; place on a plate.
	5. Return skillet to medium-high heat. Add 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil and swirl to coat. Cook meatballs, in batches and turning as needed, for about 5 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a clean, paper towel-lined plate. Add more oil to skillet between batches, as necessary.
	6. Drain fat from pan. Return meatballs to pan; cover, reduce heat to medium-low and cook for about 5 minutes or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into several meatballs reads 160°F (71°C). 
	7. Return sauce to medium-low heat; whisk in sour cream, adding enough to make sauce the desired consistency. Reheat until steaming (do not let boil). Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add meatballs and stir gently to coat.
	8. Serve garnished with dill and green onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - To make fresh bread crumbs, grate about 1 slice of bread or a bun using the large holes of a box-style cheese grater (freeze the bread for 15 minutes to firm it up for easier grating) or simply tear the bread into very small pieces; measure ½ cup (125 mL) for this recipe. You can freeze any extra for another use.
---
Recipe ID: 5c1645be-ca63-4105-9c28-1c49bf9c8cc2
Recipe Title: Stir-Fried Thai-Style Beef and Broccoli
Recipe Summary: Vary the vegetables in this colourful beef stir-fry recipe according to your family’s tastes; snow peas, sweet peppers and bean sprouts are all good additions. For time-efficiency, let the meat marinate while you prepare the vegetables. Handy tip: wear rubber or plastic gloves when preparing hot peppers, and wash your knife and cutting board in hot soapy water immediately afterward. Serve the stir-fry over Thai rice noodles or steamed jasmine rice.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 15
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) beef broth
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH cornstarch and Thai fish sauce or soy sauce 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) finely grated lime zest
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH sugar and sesame oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stir-Fry Strips
	- Vegetable oil
	- 3 cups (750 mL) small broccoli florets
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) baby corn, drained and halved
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) minced gingerroot
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) minced seeded hot chili pepper
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) grape tomatoes, halved
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) slivered fresh basil leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Beef broth
	- Cornstarch
	- Thai fish sauce or soy sauce
	- Lime
	- Sugar
	- Sesame oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stir-Fry Strips
	- Vegetable oil
	- Small broccoli florets
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) baby corn
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- Seeded hot chili pepper
	- Grape tomatoes
	- Slivered fresh basil leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine beef broth, cornstarch, fish sauce, lime zest and juice, sugar and sesame oil in large sealable freezer bag. Add beef strips, massaging marinade into beef; seal and refrigerate for 15 to 30 minutes.
	2. Drain meat through colander set over bowl, reserving marinade. Cook beef strips over medium heat in hot, lightly oiled nonstick skillet for about 1 minute per side or until browned but still pink inside. Transfer meat to clean bowl.
	3. Add broccoli to skillet and stir-fry over medium-high heat for 3 to 5 minutes or until almost tender-crisp. Add baby corn, garlic, ginger and hot pepper; stir-fry for 30 seconds or until corn is starting to brown. Return beef with accumulated juices and reserved marinade to skillet. Bring to boil; cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and thickened. Stir in tomatoes and heat through. Remove from heat; stir in basil.
Recipe Tips:
  - Adding splash of water to the pan when stir-frying helps prevent veggies from scorching.
---
Recipe ID: 5c39b23d-ab80-4f74-9477-068f4497af47
Recipe Title: Braised Provençal-Style Beef
Recipe Summary: Simmering steaks are a great start to making comforting stews, since the cutting into meat into cubes is already half-done for you! Cutting onion lengthwise for braised dishes like this one helps the onion keep its shape and texture even with a lengthy cook-time. If you don’t have herbes de Provence, make your own blend with an equal mix of dried thyme, oregano, marjoram, savoury and/or rosemary leaves – crush the herbs in your hand to help release their flavours. You can add a touch of lavender too if you have it on hand and don’t worry if you don’t have each and every herb in the mix.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 150
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive or vegetable oil, divided (approx)
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Simmering Steaks, cut in 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 8 oz (250 g) button mushrooms
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 large onion, cut lengthwise into eighths
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced plum tomatoes
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH Worcestershire sauce and balsamic vinegar
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) herbes de Provence
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 2 cups (500 mL) cut green beans
	- ½ cup (125 mL) Kalamata olives, pitted
	- Chopped fresh parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive or vegetable oil
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Simmering Steaks, cut in 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- All-purpose flour
	- 8 oz (250 g) button mushrooms
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 large onion
	- Dry red wine
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced plum tomatoes
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Herbes de Provence
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Green beans
	- Kalamata olives, pitted
	- Chopped fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster until sizzling hot. Brown beef, in 4 batches and adding more oil as needed, for 8 to 10 minutes, turning until browned on all sides. Transfer beef to a bowl; sprinkle with flour. Set aside.
	2. Add mushrooms, garlic and onion; cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until just softened, adding more oil if necessary. Stir in wine, and bring to a boil, scraping up browned bits from bottom of pan. Stir in beef and accumulated juices, tomatoes, Worcestershire, vinegar, herbes de Provence, salt, pepper and bay leaf. Bring to simmer.
	3. Simmer, covered, on stovetop or in preheated 325°F oven for 1 hour. Stir in green beans and olives; cook, covered, for 30 minutes or until beef and vegetables are fork-tender. Serve garnished with parsley.
Recipe Tips:
  - A tight-fitting lid and a heavy pot are essential for best braising.
---
Recipe ID: 5c3a93cd-108b-4026-91ba-c0aee0b607c8
Recipe Title: Sous Vide Chili Citrus Strip Loin Roast
Recipe Summary: A tender strip loin roast cooks to juicy perfection, and perfectly evenly all the way through in the sous vide. There’s no more guessing if your roast will cook to the right internal temperature–the pre-set temperature of the water bath makes sure it does! The punch of chili and lime and lemon zest compliment the beef flavour in this simple rub. For a quick condiment to serve with the roast, stir some grated lime zest and chopped fresh oranges into your favourite salsa. Thin strips of leftover roast tucked into corn tortillas will take taco night to the next level!
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 368
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 378
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) chili powder
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) chipotle pepper powder
	- Salt
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated lemon zest
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) grated lime zest
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg) Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast (untied)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Chili powder
	- Chipotle pepper powder
	- Salt
	- Lemon (for grated lemon zest)
	- Limes
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg)  Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast  (untied)
	- Vegetable oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 130°F (54.5°C) for medium-rare or 140°F (60°C) for medium according to manufacturer’s directions.
	2. Combine chili powder, chipotle powder, ½ tsp (2 mL) salt, lemon zest and lime zest in a small bowl. Pat beef dry with paper towel and rub all over with chili powder mixture. Place in a large bag for sous vide (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Remove as much air as possible and vacuum or manually seal. 
	3. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure it to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Cover water bath with foil or plastic to reduce evaporation. Cook sous vide for 6 hours, replenishing water as necessary.
	 4. Remove beef from water bath. Remove beef from bag, discarding liquid. Gently pat roast dry with paper towel (trying not to remove seasoning) and season all over with salt to your taste. 
	5. Heat oil in a large cast-iron or heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Sear roast in hot skillet, turning with tongs, for about 6 to 8 minutes or until browned on all sides. Transfer to cutting board. Carve across the grain into thin slices and serve on warmed plates with lime wedges to squeeze over beef.
Recipe Tips:
  - When purchasing the roast, be sure it is an appropriate size to fit into the bag you plan to use for sous vide cooking. If you want to cook more portions at the same time, use 2 roasts and 2 bags and make sure the water bath is large enough for good circulation around the bags. For convenience, you can cook the roast in step 3 for up to 8 hours.
---
Recipe ID: 5c9e6939-e945-46ed-a861-a7158d07e234
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak Involtini
Recipe Summary: This show-stopper uses the same technique as the classic German beef roulade, flattening out a Sirloin Tip Steak with a mallet or bottom of a heavy pan to tenderize. Serve the involtini slices warm, with assorted grilled vegetables and, for added flair, drizzle with a store-bought or homemade balsamic glaze.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 oz (125 g) soft peppered goat cheese (chèvre) or feta with black pepper, crumbled
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) dried oregano, crumbled
	- 2 cups (500 mL) fresh spinach leaves
	- 12 sun-dried tomato pieces (oil-packed)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- Olive oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 oz (125 g) soft peppered goat cheese (chèvre) or feta with black pepper
	- Dried oregano
	- Fresh spinach leaves
	- 12 sun-dried tomato pieces (oil-packed)
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Olive oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut steak into about 6 equal rectangular pieces. Pound each steak with a mallet or bottom of a heavy pan to 1/8-inch (3 mm) thickness. Season with salt and pepper.
	2. Divide goat cheese into 6 equal portions. Spoon a dollop onto each steak, within ¼ inch (5 mm) of edge. Sprinkle each with a generous pinch of oregano. Divide spinach and tomatoes into 6 equal portions. For each steak, top with a layer of spinach, tomatoes and then remaining spinach. 
	3. Starting with long edge, roll up each steak like a jelly roll. Tie tightly in several places with butcher’s twine or hold together with skewers (presoak wooden skewers for 1 hour). Brush outside of each beef roll with balsamic vinegar and olive oil; season with salt and pepper.
	4. Grill over medium heat in a closed barbecue for about 6 to 10 minutes, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least, or 160°F (71°C) for medium, or 170°F (77°C) for well-done. 
	 5. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Remove string or skewers and cut diagonally into 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital read instant thermometer inserted sideways into roll, ensuring tip of probe is in meat, for best judgement of doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 5d44c603-0736-4d24-b120-8aed8cd9d300
Recipe Title: Slow-Roasted Double Mustard and Horseradish Beef
Recipe Summary: Easy to prepare, yet so impressive! Cooking the ribs low and slow tenderizes and allows the flavours to really penetrate the meat. Finishing under the broiler caramelizes the edges and locks in all the juices. Serving ribs with the remaining horseradish sauce balances the richness of the ribs. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 185
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 200
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) prepared horseradish
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH smooth Dijon mustard and grainy Dijon mustard
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh thyme and liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH olive oil and Worcestershire sauce
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- Additional prepared horseradish (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Prepared horseradish
	- Smooth Dijon mustard
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Fresh thyme
	- Liquid honey
	- Olive oil
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs  (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine horseradish with the smooth and grainy mustards, thyme, honey, oil, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Transfer ½ cup (125 mL) to a separate bowl to brush over raw ribs; reserve remaining for glazing the ribs while cooking.
	2. Place ribs on a large foil-lined baking sheet and brush all over with the ½ cup (125 mL) horseradish-mustard mixture. Fold foil over or over-wrap with another sheet of foil and seal edges to make a foil pouch. Roast in preheated 250°F oven for 3 to 3½ hours until meat is fork tender.
	3. Carefully unwrap ribs and set on a large cutting board. Drain off liquid and discard; return ribs to baking sheet. Brush reserved horseradish-mustard glaze over ribs. 
	4. Broil ribs on middle rack, or remove from baking sheet and grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium heat (350°F/180°C), for 5 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally, until hot, browned and well-glazed.
	 5. Transfer to a cutting board. Cut rack into individual ribs. Serve on a platter with additional horseradish, if desired. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Removing the silverskin from the rack before brushing with the horseradish-mustard mixture allows the flavours to penetrate the meat better, and enhances tenderness. To remove it from the rack, slide a thin knife between the meat and the membrane, pull up until there is enough to grab hold of with a paper towel. Like removing wallpaper, pull it off with even pressure to remove as one large sheet.
---
Recipe ID: 5e1a5387-fc25-4564-9fc8-b35e04db6e61
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Beef and Rice Taco Bowls
Recipe Summary: With all the flavours of taco night, this fun and family-friendly recipe allows everyone to gather at the dinner table and assemble their rice bowl to suit their own personal taste. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 70
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 85
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) chili powder
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) ground cumin
	- 1 cup (250 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) barbecue sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH tomato paste and fresh lime juice 
	- 3 cups (750 mL) cooked long grain rice
	- Assorted toppings, such as shredded Cheddar cheese, black beans, corn kernels, chopped avocado, cherry tomatoes, sliced cucumber, diced red onion and tortilla chips
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1½ lb (750 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Chili powder
	- Ground cumin
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Tomato paste
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Long grain rice
	- Assorted toppings, such as shredded Cheddar cheese, black beans, corn kernels, chopped avocado, cherry tomatoes, sliced cucumber, diced red onion and tortilla chips
Recipe Methods:
	1. Preheat electric pressure cooker on the sear function. Pat stew cubes dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper. 
	2. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil in pressure cooker pot. Brown beef, in batches and adding remaining oil as needed, turning until cubes are browned on all sides. Transfer to a bowl with a slotted spoon.
	3. Add garlic, chili powder and cumin to pot. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until fragrant. Return browned beef and any accumulated juices to the pot. Stir in broth, barbecue sauce, tomato paste and lime juice. 
	 4. Seal the electric pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to High and set time for 35 minutes. When the timer beeps, let pressure release naturally for 10 minutes. Quick release any remaining pressure. 
	5. Remove beef from pot with slotted spoon to a clean bowl and shred with 2 forks. Skim fat from sauce. Return beef to pot. Set electric pressure cooker on the sear function. Bring to a boil, stirring, for about 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened slightly and beef is warmed through.
	6. Serve beef over rice on a platter or in individual warmed serving bowls. Place assorted toppings of cheese, beans, corn, avocado, tomatoes, cucumber, onion and tortilla chips in individual bowls and serve at the table so everyone can assemble their own taco bowls. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Save any leftovers to make burritos, quesadillas, nachos, sloppy joes or tacos.
---
Recipe ID: 5e56f51b-2a2e-4ec8-b23a-24fb63b59244
Recipe Title: Slow Barbecue-Roasted Beef with Molasses Bourbon Sauce
Recipe Summary: Beef ribs are cut from Prime Rib so they’re rich and hearty, making them the perfect canvas for the full-flavoured Molasses Bourbon Sauce. There are many ways to prepared beef ribs and this version uses a low-n-slow cooking method to enhance the tenderness of the meat. Brush ribs generously with the sauce during the last few minutes of grilling to maximize the caramelized crusting - just be sure to watch carefully to avoid scorching. Feel free to substitute whisky or rye for the bourbon. The sauce is also delicious with grilled Strip Loin or Rib Eye steaks, brushed on in the last 2 minutes of grilling.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 195
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 210
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chili powder
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH packed brown sugar, salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH garlic powder and onion powder
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
