	- Molasses Bourbon Sauce
	- ½ cup (125 mL) fancy molasses
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH bourbon and apple cider vinegar
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Chili powder
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- Fancy molasses
	- Bourbon
	- Apple cider vinegar
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine chili powder, brown sugar, salt, pepper, garlic powder and onion powder in a small bowl. Place ribs on a platter and rub all over with spice mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
	 2. Molasses Bourbon Sauce: Meanwhile, combine molasses, bourbon, vinegar, sugar, mustard, salt and pepper in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring often, for 4 to 5 minutes until slightly reduced. (Make ahead: sauce can be cooled, covered and refrigerated for up to 1 week.)
	3. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to low (250°F/120°C) or preheat smoker to 250°F (120°C) according to manufacturer’s directions. 
	4. Unwrap ribs. Place ribs on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan or place ribs in smoker. Close lid and cook for 3 to 3½ hours until meat is fork tender. 
	5. Carefully remove drip pan and turn barbecue burners to medium heat (350°F/180°C). Grill ribs over direct heat for 5 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally and basting often with some of the Molasses Bourbon Sauce, until well-marked and well-glazed. 
	6. Transfer to a cutting board. Cut rack into individual ribs. Serve on a platter with remaining Molasses Bourbon Sauce. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Removing the silverskin from the rack before rubbing with the spice mixture allows the flavours to penetrate the meat better, and enhances tenderness. To remove it from the rack, slide a thin knife between the meat and the membrane, pull up until there is enough to grab hold of with a paper towel. Like removing wallpaper, pull it off with even pressure to remove as one large sheet.
---
Recipe ID: 5e5a3cc0-7ee1-46f3-a091-f6410e2a8a22
Recipe Title: Pistachio-Crusted Oven Roast
Recipe Summary: With Middle Eastern flavours, this pistachio- and herb-crusted Beef Tenderloin roast makes for a colourful and impressive gourmet feast. For an entertaining-worthy presentation, garnish roast platter with a light drizzle of pomegranate molasses, fresh pomegranate seeds, chopped pistachios, a drizzle of olive oil and fresh parsley and mint leaves. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 85
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 105
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) shelled salted pistachios
	- ½ cup (125 mL) panko bread crumbs
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH packed fresh parsley and mint leaves
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) grated lemon zest
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut, tied
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Dijon mustard
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Shelled salted pistachios
	- Panko bread crumbs
	- Fresh parsley
	- Mint leaves
	- Olive oil
	- Lemon (for grated lemon zest)
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut, tied
	- Dijon mustard
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pulse pistachios in a food processor until finely chopped. Add bread crumbs, parsley, mint, olive oil, lemon zest, garlic, and half each the salt and pepper. Pulse until a chunky paste is achieved. Scatter in an even layer on a large baking sheet; set aside. 
	2. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Combine mustard and remaining salt and pepper in a small bowl; brush all over roast. Roll roast in crumb mixture, pressing as needed to adhere, until roast is fully and evenly coated. 
	3. Place roast on a rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast for about 1¼ to 1½ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	4. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	5. Snip the string at the base of the roast and pull off one string at a time. Pat back any crust that falls off. Carve roast across the grain into thick slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - Pomegranate molasses is a thick syrup that is made by cooking down pomegranate juice. It is a perfect pantry item to have on hand to drizzle on dips, or to jazz up salad dressings or sauces with wonderfully balanced sweet yet tangy accents. Look for pomegranate molasses in the international aisle of your supermarket and Middle Eastern specialty stores or substitute with balsamic reduction.
---
Recipe ID: 5f90a275-17b1-450f-8c7e-fc8de49e7e5d
Recipe Title: Skillet-Seared Beef Heart with Middle Eastern Schug and Salad
Recipe Summary: Schug is a fiery sauce of Yemenite origin that’s enjoyed throughout the Middle East.
Recipe Prep Time: 40
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 5
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) piece Beef Heart 
	-  Schug 
	- 6 medium serrano or jalapeño peppers
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH fresh cilantro and parsley leaves and tender stems
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground cumin and coriander
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt (approx)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) caraway seeds
	- Large pinches EACH ground nutmeg, cardamom and cinnamon
	- 6 tbsp (90 mL) extra virgin olive oil 
	-  Tahini Salad 
	- 2 small ripe tomatoes, diced
	- ¼ English cucumber, diced
	- 4 green onions, thinly sliced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) coarsely chopped fresh parsley leaves
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) stirred tahini paste
	- 2 large cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 2 radishes, thinly sliced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) piece  Beef Heart 
	- 6 medium serrano or jalapeño peppers
	- Fresh cilantro and Parsley leaves and tender stems
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Ground cumin
	- Coriander
	- Salt
	- Caraway seeds
	- Ground nutmeg
	- Cardamom
	- Cinnamon
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- 2 small ripe tomatoes
	- English cucumber
	- 4 green onions
	- Fresh parsley leaves
	- Stirred tahini paste
	- 2 large cloves garlic
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- 2 radishes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rinse heart under cold water. Trim off fat, membranes and any fibrous tissue from the heart. Cut into ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices.
	2. Schug: Cut stems from serrano peppers, then cut peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes (if you like it very spicy, leave in seeds and membranes). Place in a food processor; add cilantro, parsley, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, caraway, nutmeg, cardamom, cinnamon and oil. Pulse until finely chopped (do not purée). Scrape into a bowl and season to taste with salt, as desired. Set aside.
	3. Tahini Salad: Combine tomato, cucumber, green onions and parsley in a bowl. Slowly stir the lemon juice into the tahini in a small bowl; stir in salt and garlic (the mixture will be thick but will loosen up when mixed with the vegetables). Set both bowls aside.
	4. Coat both sides of the heart slices with 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the Schug. Heat a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Cook heart slices for 2 to 4 minutes, turning twice or more, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into slices reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the most. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil to keep warm. 
	5. Add tahini mixture to salad, tossing to coat, and garnish with radishes. Serve Tahini Salad with the heart and remaining Schug on the side
Recipe Tips:
  - You can cook the heart in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 2 to 4 minutes turning twice or more, until instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into slices reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the most.
---
Recipe ID: 60760628-5a20-42ab-9ff9-e9397022c2cc
Recipe Title: Roasted Steak with Sun-Dried Tomato & Blue Cheese Butter
Recipe Summary: When you don’t want to barbecue outside, this oven cooking method of high temperature oven-searing and then roasting at a reduced oven temperature works well for this thick cut of steak. Using an oven-safe thermometer takes the guesswork out of trying to figure out doneness, as it lets you know the internal temperature of the steak at all times. Serve with boiled potatoes or slices of fresh bread to use up any extra whipped butter. (If there is any!)
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Frenched Rib Steak, 1-bone thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	-  Whipped Seasoned Butter
	- ½ cup (125 mL) butter, softened 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cream (any type) or milk
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely crumbled blue cheese
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped drained oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated lemon zest
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Frenched Rib Steak, 1-bone thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Butter
	- Cream (any type) or milk
	- Finely crumbled blue cheese
	- Oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes
	- Fresh parsley
	- Lemon (for grated lemon zest)
	- 1 clove garlic
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steak dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper. 
	2. Place steak on a wire rack on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Insert an oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into centre of steak, avoiding fat and bone. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 50 to 60 minutes for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	3. Whipped Seasoned Butter: Meanwhile, combine butter and cream in a medium bowl and beat with an electric mixer on medium-low speed until smooth. Increase speed to high and beat for 2 to 3 minutes or until fluffy and pale yellow in colour. Add cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, parsley, lemon zest, garlic, salt and pepper. Beat for 1 to 2 minutes or until well combined. 
	4. Transfer steak to a cutting board. Smear top of steak with one-third of the whipped butter. Cover loosely with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	5. Carve meat from the bone, then into thin slices. Arrange slices of steak on a large platter with the bone. Serve steak with remaining whipped butter on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - For a whipped butter variation, substitute blue cheese with goat cheese and parsley with basil. For a tasty appetizer, serve leftover steak slices on toasted crostini spread with the whipped butter and garnish with arugula leaves. A Frenched Rib Steak is similar to a Tomahawk-style Steak that is cut 1-bone thick with an exposed bone. For the Frenched Rib Steak, the bone is cleaned or “Frenched” and about 4 inches (10 cm) long.
---
Recipe ID: 615296ae-46cb-4465-80e8-1e0853e1dd7e
Recipe Title: Double-up Shepherd’s Pie
Recipe Summary: This doubled-up recipe makes 2 pies, so you can bake one right away for dinner and tuck one away in the freezer for a future meal or to take to a friend in need. You can also choose to just bake the entire recipe in a 13 x 9-inch (3 L) baking dish to serve a large family or if you want to have leftovers; it’s also the perfect casserole for pot luck events.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) yellow-flesh potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
	- 1 cup (250 mL) milk 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) butter, cut into cubes
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground nutmeg
	- Beef Filling
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter or vegetable oil
		- 2 lb (1 kg) Extra Lean Ground Beef 
		- 1 large onion, finely chopped
		- 2 EACH stalks celery and carrots, finely chopped
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) dried thyme leaves
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
		- 3 cups (750 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth 
		- ½ cup (125 mL) tomato paste
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
		- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH frozen peas and corn
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) yellow-flesh potatoes
	- Milk
	- Butter
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Ground nutmeg
	- Butter or vegetable oil
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Extra Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 large onion
	- Celery
	- Carrots
	- Dried thyme leaves
	- All-purpose flour
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Tomato paste
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Frozen peas
	- Frozen corn
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place potatoes in a large saucepan, cover with cold water and season generously with salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat and boil gently for 15 to 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from heat and drain potatoes well. 
	2. Return to saucepan over medium-high heat for 1 minute to evaporate any water; remove from heat. Add milk, butter, salt, pepper and nutmeg; mash until light and fluffy. Place a layer of paper towel directly on the surface of the mashed potatoes and cover with a lid to keep warm. Set aside. 
	Beef Filling: : 
		3. Meanwhile, melt butter over medium heat in a large, deep skillet. Cook beef, onion, celery, carrots, thyme, salt and pepper, stirring often and using back of spoon to break up meat into small chunks, for 8 to 10 minutes or until beef is browned. 
		4. Sprinkle flour over top. Cook, stirring for 1 to 2 minutes, or until blended. Gradually add broth, stirring continually; bring to a boil. Stir in tomato paste and Worcestershire sauce until incorporated. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes or until sauce is thickened. Remove from heat; stir in peas and corn. 
		5. Divide beef filling between two greased freezer-to-oven-safe 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dishes or deep-dish pie plates. Spoon warm mashed potatoes evenly over top of each pie; smooth tops. Set one pie aside and let cool to room temperature; cover the entire dish tightly with plastic wrap and foil, then freeze for up to 3 months. 
		6. Meanwhile, bake the remaining pie in preheated 400˚F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until topping is golden brown and filling is bubbling. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. 
Recipe Tips:
  - To bake pie from frozen; remove any plastic wrap, cover top with foil and place in a cold oven. Set temperature to 350°F and bake for 90 minutes or until starting to bubble at the edges. Remove foil and bake for an additional 25 to 30 minutes or until topping is golden brown, filling is bubbling vigorously and digital instant-read thermometer reads 160°F (71°C) when inserted into the centre of the pie. Garnish the top with paprika or finely chopped parsley leaves before serving. Sprinkle with some shredded Cheddar cheese or grated Parmesan cheese during the last 15 minutes of baking for a cheesy potato topping.
---
Recipe ID: 6195830b-960e-463a-980f-ce2c8ad68742
Recipe Title: Lasagna Soup
Recipe Summary: This Lasagna Soup recipe is a spin-off of a classic! It’s packed with all of the best lasagna flavours, but in a one-pot soup. This warming, hearty soup is packed with Lean Ground Beef, veggies and three types of cheese. Check out more lean ground beef recipes at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil 
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion, diced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH minced garlic and tomato paste
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) dried Italian herb seasoning
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH pepper and hot pepper flakes
	- 4 cups (1 L) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) tomato pasta sauce
	- 1 can (398 mL) diced tomatoes with Italian seasoning
	- 1 Parmesan rind (optional)
	- 2 cups (500 mL) dry small pasta or broken lasagna noodles (about 4 oz/125 g)
	- 4 slices Furlani® Garlic Texas Toast 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) chopped fresh spinach
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) ricotta cheese
	- ½ cup (125 mL) shredded mozzarella cheese
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) grated Parmesan cheese
	- Chopped fresh parsley and basil (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion
	- Garlic
	- Tomato paste
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Tomato pasta sauce
	- 1 can (398 mL) diced tomatoes with Italian seasoning
	- 1 Parmesan rind (optional)
	- Dry small pasta or lasagna noodles (about 4 oz/125 g)
	- 4 slices Furlani® Garlic Texas Toast 
	- Fresh spinach
	- Ricotta cheese
	- Shredded mozzarella cheese
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
	- Fresh parsley (optional)
	- Fresh basil (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large pot or Dutch oven. Add ground beef and onion; cook, stirring and breaking up beef into chunks with back of a spoon, for about 8 minutes or until beef is thoroughly cooked and onion is softened. 
	2. Stir in garlic, tomato paste, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper and hot pepper flakes; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in broth, pasta sauce, diced tomatoes and Parmesan rind (if using); bring to a boil. Stir in pasta (see Tip). 
	3. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until pasta is al dente and flavours are blended.
	4. Meanwhile, arrange Furlani Garlic Texas Toast slices in a single layer on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Bake in preheated 425°F oven for 5 to 6 minutes, flipping slices halfway, until toasted.
	5. Discard Parmesan rind, if necessary. Stir spinach into soup. Ladle soup into bowls and spoon a dollop of ricotta cheese into each bowl and sprinkle with mozzarella and Parmesan. Garnish with parsley and basil, if desired, and serve with Furlani Garlic Texas Toast.
Recipe Tips:
  - The soup can be made ahead through step 3, cooled, covered and refrigerated for up to 3 days. Reheat over medium heat, stirring often, before serving then proceed with step 4. Simmering the pasta right in the soup saves using an extra pot. If you’re planning make the soup ahead it’s best to cook the pasta separately so the noodles don’t get too soft and mushy. Cook the soup as directed without adding pasta, then just before serving, cook the pasta in a pot of boiling water until al dente, drain and stir into soup with the spinach. The Parmesan rind adds a boost of flavour to the soup, but it’s not essential if you don’t have one on hand. Get recipes and more for over 70 beef cuts at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
---

Recipe Title: Korean-Style Cucumber Salad
Recipe Summary: This refreshing, crispy salad adds a bit of zing to any grilled or stir-fried beef dish.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 0
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 5
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???

	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) rice vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) reduced-sodium soy sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) granulated sugar
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) Korean chili paste (gochujang) or sriracha
	- 2 English cucumbers, diagonally sliced
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	Whisk together vinegar, soy sauce, sugar and chili paste in a large bowl. Add cucumbers and toss to coat. Cover and set aside for at least 15 minutes or for up to 2 hours, until ready to serve.
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: 6275b6cb-2698-447f-a0df-dcad162c614d
Recipe Title: Middle Eastern-Style Grilled Beef Pockets
Recipe Summary: This hand-held casual grilled steak dinner is a nice way to serve steak when you want something other than ‘meat & potatoes’.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 90
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) red wine or cranberry juice
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) mild curry paste
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) rice vinegar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil (optional)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 pita breads, warmed and halved
	- Cucumber slices
	- Plain yogurt or tzatziki
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Cucumber
	- 3 pita breads
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Mild curry paste
	- Rice vinegar
	- Olive oil
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Plain yogurt or tzatziki
	- Red wine or cranberry juice
Recipe Methods:
	1.&nbsp;Combine wine, garlic, curry paste, vinegar, olive oil (if using) and Worcestershire sauce in large sealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with fork and add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2.&nbsp;Discard marinade from meat; pat steak dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.&nbsp;
	3.&nbsp;Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steak thinly across the grain. Tuck slices into warm pita halves along with cucumber slices and yogurt.
Recipe Tips:
  - Carve Marinating Steaks across the grain to maximize tenderness.

Recipe ID: 62c7e08e-c4e5-4365-9c8b-aef940a437be
Recipe Title: Cedar-Planked Smoked Beef Roast
Recipe Summary: Rubbed with a rosemary-garlic butter and grilled using indirect heat on a cedar plank, this roast gets infused with herb and subtle smoky flavours. Easy to prepare, it’s the perfect recipe for a fuss-free summer barbecue dinner. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments. Serve roast with prepared horseradish or your favourite barbecue sauce and a selection of salads, such as potato, coleslaw or mixed greens.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 65
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 large cedar plank (or 2 if necessary, see Tip below)
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) butter, softened
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) coarse salt, such as kosher or sea salt
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, center cut, tied
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 large cedar plank (or 2 if necessary, see Tip below)
	- Butter
	- Fresh rosemary
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Coarse salt, such as kosher or sea salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, center cut, tied
	- Vegetable oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Soak cedar plank for at least 2 hours in a container with enough warm water to cover, weighing down with heavy jars to submerge.
	2. Partially fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high heat (400˚F/200˚C). 
	3. Combine butter, rosemary, garlic, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat roast dry with paper towel and rub all over with butter mixture.
	4. Discard soaking liquid from plank. Heat plank in the closed preheated barbecue directly over the hot grill (not over the drip pan) for 3 to 4 minutes or until plank crackles and smokes. Using tongs, transfer plank to side of the grill with drip pan and brush top side of plank with oil.
	 5. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on plank; turn off burner under drip pan. Cook in closed barbecue, without turning, for about 1 to 1¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	6. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Let plank cool completely and discard.
	7. Carve roast across the grain into thick slices and serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Serve roast with prepared horseradish or your favourite barbecue sauce and a selection of salads, such as potato, coleslaw or mixed greens. For added flavour, soak cedar plank in beer, wine or apple juice. Depending on the size of your roast and the cedar planks, you may need 2 planks. The meat should fit on top over plank (or planks) without overhanging. If using 2 planks, push them together on the grill as close as possible before placing the roast on top.
---
Recipe ID: 62f40a30-6f3c-4f0b-9f10-0406680b7eea
Recipe Title: Chipotle Mole Braised Beef
Recipe Summary: An exceptional short rib dish with a Mexican flare. Packed with a variety of enticing and interesting flavours such as chipotle peppers, almonds, spices and chocolate. There’s just the right amount of chipotles in the stew for a but you can add more for a spicier dish. Serve with rice and sour cream, garnished with sliced red onions, tomatoes, avocados and fresh cilantro.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 140
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 1 EACH medium onion and sweet green pepper, sliced
	- 1 clove garlic, thinly sliced
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) beef broth
	- 2 to 3 canned chipotles in adobo sauce
	- ½ cup (125 mL) whole blanched almonds
	- ½ cup (125 mL) raisins
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sesame seeds
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) instant coffee or instant espresso
	- 5 whole black peppercorns
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground cinnamon and ground coriander
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) fennel seeds
	- Pinch ground cloves
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) thick-cut Boneless Beef Simmering Short Ribs (about 6)
	- 1 oz (30 g) unsweetened chocolate, finely chopped
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Medium onion
	- Sweet green pepper
	- 1 clove garlic
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- Beef broth
	- 2 to 3 canned chipotles in adobo sauce
	- Whole blanched almonds
	- Raisins
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Sesame seeds
	- Instant coffee or instant espresso
	- 5 whole black peppercorns
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Ground coriander
	- Fennel seeds
	- Pinch ground cloves
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) thick-cut  Boneless Beef Simmering Short Ribs  (about 6)
	- 1 oz (30 g) unsweetened chocolate
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil over medium heat in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Cook onion, sweet pepper and garlic, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add tomatoes with juice, beef broth, chipotles to taste, almonds, raisins, sugar, sesame seeds, instant coffee, peppercorns, cinnamon, coriander, fennel and cloves and ½ tsp (2 mL) each salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes or until slightly thickened.
	2. Meanwhile, pat beef dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Place ribs in a single layer on a rack in a foil-lined shallow roasting pan or rimmed baking sheet. Roast in preheated 450°F oven for 20 minutes or until browned. Transfer ribs to a paper towel-lined plate and set aside. Discard fat. Reduce oven heat to 325°F.
	3. Remove sauce from heat and stir chocolate into sauce until melted. Let sauce cool slightly. Purée in the pot using an immersion blender or transfer to a blender or food processor, in batches, until smooth; return to pot if necessary. 
	4. Place ribs in the pot with the sauce, turning to coat with sauce. Cover and cook in oven for 1½ to 2 hours or until beef is fork-tender. Skim any fat from sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Recipe Tips:
  - A tight-fitting lid and a heavy pot are essential for best braising.
---
Recipe ID: 6336037a-a95f-4e0a-87eb-e12c6e47860b
Recipe Title: Grilled Wine-Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Aromatic vegetables and herbs and wine permeate Eye of Round steaks as they marinate. This is a perfect special meal made with value-priced steaks. Grill tender carrots and new potatoes to serve alongside. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 500
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH white wine, chopped onion, carrots and celery
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
	- 2 cloves garlic, crushed
	- 2 sprigs EACH fresh thyme and rosemary, crushed
	- 8 small Beef Eye of Round Marinating Steaks, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- Flaky sea salt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- White wine
	- Onion
	- Carrots
	- Celery
	- Olive oil
	- Garlic
	- Fresh thyme
	- Sprigs rosemary
	- 8 small Beef Eye of Round Marinating Steaks, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- Flaky sea salt
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine wine, onion, carrots, celery, oil, garlic, thyme and rosemary in a large sealable freezer bag. Pierce steaks all over with fork and add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. 
	 3. Grill in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steaks reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. 
	4. Let rest for 5 minutes. Serve sprinkled with flaky salt to taste.
Recipe Tips:
  - Marinades are all about building steak flavour and juiciness. Piercing steak all over with a fork is what helps tenderize the steak.
  - No grill? Pan-fry these steaks over medium-high heat in an oiled skillet or place on a rack over a rimmed baking sheet and broil instead of grilling.

Recipe ID: 63fd068b-b7a6-40e3-ae84-c2fa065acab8
Recipe Title: Berry Herb Salad
Recipe Summary: This colourful salad is a celebration of summer berry season and takes advantage of the first tender herbs from the garden too. Serve alongside your favourite grilled steak or burger or carve the steak and serve slices on top as a main-course salad. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) halved small fresh strawberries
	- ½ cup (125 mL) whole fresh blueberries (halved if large)
	- 1 small jalapeño pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar (white or regular)
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) grated gingerroot
	- 3 cups (750 mL) baby greens (such as spring mix, arugula or spinach)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) fresh herb leaves (basil, mint, parsley, cilantro), torn
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine berries, jalapeño, honey, vinegar and gingerroot in a medium bowl, tossing gently to coat. Let stand for at least 15 minutes to let flavours combine. (Make ahead: This can be covered and refrigerated for up to 2 hours.)
	2. Add baby greens and herb leaves into berry mixture and toss gently to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: 64052aec-c6cb-458b-9736-b3dc4c757d61
Recipe Title: Pan-seared Steak for Two with Saucy Sautéed Onions
Recipe Summary: Simple, yet so delicious, this steak is perfect for both casual and celebratory dinners for two. Serve with steamed green beans and either mashed potatoes or rustic Italian bread for sopping up the sauce. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 12 oz (375 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 1 large onion, sliced (about 1½ cups/375 mL)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried thyme leaves
	- 1 cup (250 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ½ cup (125 mL) dry red wine 
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) cold butter, cut into cubes
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 12 oz (375 g)  Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Dried thyme leaves
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Dry red wine
	- Butter
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steak dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper. 
	2. Heat half the oil over medium-high heat in a cast-iron or ovenproof heavy-bottomed stainless steel skillet. Cook steak for 4 to 6 minutes, turning once, until browned on both sides; transfer steak to a plate.
	3. Return skillet to medium heat and add remaining oil. Cook onion, Worcestershire sauce and thyme, stirring often, for 10 to 12 minutes or until softened. Stir in broth and wine; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 8 to 10 minutes or until reduced by about half. 
	4. Place steak back in skillet; stir any accumulated juices into sauce. Cook steak in sauce in preheated 450°F oven for 6 to 8 or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	5. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. 
	6. Meanwhile, return skillet to stove top (off the heat). Add butter to sauce, one cube at a time, stirring until each piece melts before adding the next. 
	7. Slice steak across the grain and arrange on a platter. Pour onion sauce over steak and sprinkle with parsley. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Be mindful that the skillet handle will get hot and retain heat for a while, so do keep oven mitts close by.
---
Recipe ID: 642c2499-79bb-4551-bec7-ec76839ab7bb
Recipe Title: Classic Texas-Style Beef Chili
Recipe Summary: This recipe, made with chunky beef stew cubes, is based on a classic Texas-style chili that is traditionally prepared without tomato or beans. It often gets thickened with a corn flour called masa harina, but we used corn tortilla, which results in the same flavour and texture. We also added a cup of coffee to this chili, just like a Texas cowboy would do!
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 150
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 1 large onion, chopped
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chili powder
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) ground cumin
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sweet smoked paprika
	- 4 cups (1 L) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 cup (250 mL) strong brewed coffee
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 5 small (about 5-inch/12 cm) corn tortillas 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) packed brown sugar 
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) white vinegar
	- Sour cream
	- Green onions, thinly sliced
	- Jalapeño, thinly sliced (optional)
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Chili powder
	- Ground cumin
	- Sweet smoked paprika
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Strong brewed coffee
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 5 small (about 5-inch/12 cm) corn tortillas 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) packed brown sugar 
	- White vinegar
	- Sour cream
	- Green onions
	- Jalapeño (optional)
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat stew cubes dry with paper towel and season all over with half each the salt and pepper. 
	2. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven. Brown beef in batches, turning and adding up to 1 tbsp (15 mL) more oil as needed, until browned on all sides. Transfer beef to a bowl using a slotted spoon.
	3. Add remaining oil to pot; reduce heat to medium-low. Cook onion and garlic, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until starting to soften. Add chili powder, cumin and paprika: cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes, or until fragrant. Pour in broth and coffee. Increase to medium-high and bring to a boil, stirring to scrape up any browned bits from pan. Stir in beef and any accumulated juices, bay leaves and remaining salt and pepper. 
	4. Reduce heat to low and simmer, partially covered and stirring occasionally, for 1½ to 1¾ hours or until beef is fork-tender. Tear tortillas into pieces and stir into chili; simmer, uncovered, for 12 to 15 minutes or until thickened. Alternatively, cover and cook in preheated 325ºF oven for 1½ hours or until beef is fork-tender. Remove lid, tear tortillas into pieces and stir into chili. Return to oven and cook, uncovered, for 15 to 30 minutes or until thickened.
	5. Discard bay leaves. Stir in brown sugar and vinegar. Serve chili in bowls garnished with sour cream, green onion and jalapeño. Serve with lime wedges.
Recipe Tips:
  - Patting the stew cubes dry and cooking beef in batches to avoid overcrowding in the pan will help beef to sear and brown instead of steam. Chili flavours intensify after a day or two so leftovers will be even more delicious.
---
Recipe ID: 64c2ce0d-c6f1-4472-be94-e7747b1d0180
Recipe Title: Peri-Peri Oven Roast Beef with Potatoes
Recipe Summary: This Portuguese-inspired roast and potato recipe features a peri-peri spice rub that explodes with yummy flavours. Double the cayenne pepper if you love a higher heat level. Serve with store-bought peri-peri sauce for dipping. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 115
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 130
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sweet paprika
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) salt
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dried oregano leaves
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH granulated sugar, smoked sweet paprika and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground cardamom, coriander, cumin and ginger
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH onion powder and garlic powder
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) cayenne pepper (approx)
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast 
	- 2 lb (1 kg) potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil, divided
	- Peri-peri sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Sweet paprika
	- Salt
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Granulated sugar
	- Smoked sweet paprika
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Ground cardamom
	- Ground Coriander
	- Ground Cumin
	- Ground Ginger
	- Onion powder
	- Garlic powder
	- Cayenne pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast 
	- 2 lb (1 kg) potatoes
	- Olive oil
	- Peri-peri sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine paprika, salt, oregano, sugar, smoked paprika, pepper, cardamom, coriander, cumin, ginger, garlic powder, onion powder and cayenne, to your taste, in a small bowl. Measure out 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the spice blend and set aside for potatoes. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Rub remaining spice blend all over roast. 
	2. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. 
	3. Toss potatoes, reserved spice blend and oil in a large bowl. Arrange in single layer on parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
	4. Place potatoes in bottom-third of oven and roast on middle rack in preheated 450°F to oven-sear for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered and tossing potatoes occasionally, for about 1¾ to 2¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	5. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	6. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices. Serve with roasted potatoes and peri-peri sauce. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Double or triple the spice blend to have on hand for the next time you want to prepare this recipe. Store in airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 months. It is also delicious on Beef Back Ribs and Grilling Steaks.
---
Recipe ID: 64cbfd59-25e1-459e-99ca-2b92dfa3265d
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Glazed Mushrooms
Recipe Summary: This classic combination of steak and mushrooms is ready in minutes. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) barbecue sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 3 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) crumbled dried rosemary
	- 1½ lb (750 g) assorted mixed mushrooms (such as button, cremini, portabello, shiitake or oyster)
	- 1 sweet onion, cut into wedges
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- 3 green onions
	- Dried rosemary
	- 1½ lb (750 g) assorted mixed mushrooms (such as button, cremini, portabello, shiitake or oyster)
	- 1 sweet onion
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Butter
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine barbecue sauce, lemon juice, garlic, green onions and rosemary in bowl. Remove ¼ cup (60 mL) for basting; set aside.&nbsp;
	2. Cut mushrooms and into large chunks, keeping oyster mushrooms whole. Toss with onion, and salt and pepper to your taste. Pan-fry in butter in nonstick skillet over medium heat, stirring, for about 12 minutes or until slightly caramelized and liquid has evaporated. Stir in remaining barbecue sauce mixture; heat through.
	3. Meanwhile, season steaks all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, brushing with reserved sauce occasionally and turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	4. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steaks thinly across the grain and serve with mushrooms and onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 658e632b-4179-4bf0-a00f-71a9c7a7defb
Recipe Title: California-Style Fried Sandwich Steak
Recipe Summary: ???
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 16
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 36
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 Beef Sirloin Tip Sandwich Steaks (4 to 6 oz/125 to 175 g EACH)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Tex-Mex or Cajun spice, divided
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 eggs, beaten
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry seasoned bread crumbs
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) mayonnaise
	- 4 sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, drained and finely chopped 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated lemon zest
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 4 crusty rolls, split
	- 4 lettuce leaves
	- 1 avocado, halved and sliced
	- 8 slices tomato
	- 4 thinly sliced red onion rounds
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 Beef Sirloin Tip Sandwich Steaks (4 to 6 oz/125 to 175 g EACH)
	- Tex-Mex or Cajun spice
	- All-purpose flour
	- 2 eggs
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry seasoned bread crumbs
	- Vegetable oil
	- Mayonnaise
	- 4 sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil
	- 1 lemon
	- 4 crusty rolls, split
	- 4 lettuce leaves
	- 1 avocado
	- 2 fresh tomatoes
	- 1 red onion
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; season all over with half the Tex-Mex seasoning. Combine remaining Tex-Mex seasoning with flour in a shallow bowl. Place beaten eggs and bread crumbs in two additional separate shallow bowls. Working with one steak at a time, coat steak in flour mixture, dip in egg, then coat in bread crumbs; pressing firmly yet carefully, so that the coating adheres to the meat. Arrange steak in a single layer on a large baking sheet. 
	2. Heat half the oil over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet; cook steaks, in batches, for about 4 minutes, turning once, until meat is cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF), coating is golden brown and crisp, and meat is still pink inside. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate in a single layer to drain. Add more oil to skillet as needed between batches.
	3. Meanwhile, combine mayonnaise, sun-dried tomatoes, lemon zest and lemon juice in a small bowl.
	4. Spread mayo mixture all over cut sides of rolls. Layer lettuce on bottom of each roll; top with steak, avocado, tomato and onion. Cut in half on a bias to serve. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute this from-scratch flavoured mayo with store-bought garlic aioli or flavoured mayonnaise. The key to a deliciously golden coating is to have your ingredients all at the ready before you start to cook – don’t skip this important step. Avoid crowding the pan during the frying to ensure an evenly golden coating and don’t layer the cooked steaks on top of each other, as this will cause the coating to steam and become soggy.
---
Recipe ID: 65967a6a-87b1-48fc-b679-3921a5ef3071
Recipe Title: Korean-Style Noodle Bowl with Fast-Fry Steak Strips
Recipe Summary: Skip takeout and prepare this deliciously sticky noodle dish at home. Serve family-style on a large platter or serve in individual bowls so everyone can dig right in! Rice noodles can be found in the international aisle or can be substituted with angel hair pasta. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 5
Recipe Marinating Time: 20
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) soy sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH Asian chili paste, such as Gochujang, and minced gingerroot
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Fast-fry Steaks, cut into ¼-inch (5 mm) wide strips
	- ½ lb (250 g) vermicelli rice noodles 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 cups (500 mL) shredded butter (Bibb or Boston) lettuce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sesame seeds
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Soy sauce
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Asian chili paste, such as Gochujang
	- Minced gingerroot
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Inside Round Fast-fry Steaks,  cut into ¼-inch (5 mm) wide strips
	- ½ lb (250 g) vermicelli rice noodles 
	- Vegetable oil
	- Butter (Bibb or Boston) lettuce
	- Sesame seeds
	- 2 green onions
	- Limes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, chili paste, gingerroot and garlic in a large shallow bowl. Add beef strips, tossing to coat; cover and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes. 
	2. Meanwhile, cook or soak rice noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. 
	3. Heat oil over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet; cook beef strips with the marinade for 2 to 4 minutes, stirring often, until meat is cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF) and browned but still pink inside, and sauce is sticky but not dry. Remove from heat.
	4. Arrange noodles on a large, shallow platter. Top with shredded lettuce and saucy beef. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and green onions. Serve with lime wedges. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Gochujang is the most authentic chili paste when preparing Korean dishes. It can be found in the international aisle of well-stocked grocers or at specialty Asian markets, but you can use sriracha or sambal oelek as a substitute. For a less spicy version, reduce chili paste to 2 tsp (10 mL) or omit completely.
---
Recipe ID: 65a3f343-de54-4c67-a346-61534068f064
Recipe Title: Baked Beef Meatballs with Greek Vegetable Sauté
Recipe Summary: A yummy Greek-style vegetable sauté pairs well with ground beef meatballs and your favourite creamy Greek salad dressing or tzatziki as a dipping sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Meatballs, about sixteen 1-inch (2.5 cm), uncooked
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 onions, cut into wedges lengthwise
	- 1 EACH sweet yellow and orange pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH dried oregano, salt and pepper
	- Creamy Greek salad dressing or tzatziki
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Lean Ground Beef Meatballs, about sixteen 1-inch (2.5 cm), uncooked
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 onions
	- Sweet yellow and orange pepper, seeded
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH dried oregano, salt and pepper
	- Creamy Greek salad dressing or tzatziki
Recipe Methods:
	1. Arrange meatballs on parchment paper- or foil-lined rimmed baking sheet, spacing apart. Bake in preheated 375ºF (190ºC) oven for 15 minutes until digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several meatballs reads 160°F (71°C).
	2. Meanwhile, heat oil over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet; Add onion wedges, yellow and orange peppers, oregano, salt and pepper, Cook, stirring, for about 8 minutes or until vegetables are softened and slightly golden.
	3. Serve meatballs with vegetables and dressing for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Use a digital instant-read thermometer as the most reliable way to determine that ground beef meatballs are cooked to the proper doneness.

Recipe ID: 65b1cffe-dfe2-45cc-a82f-3bf42be70288
Recipe Title: Grilled Maple Orange Beef Kabobs
Recipe Summary: A maple-y marinade recipe gives these beef kabobs a Canadian accent — even more so if you substitute Canadian whisky for the orange juice.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) cider vinegar
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped green onions
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH maple syrup and vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) orange juice or whisky
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground cloves
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Bamboo skewers
	- 2 oranges, peeled and cut into large chunks
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Cider vinegar
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Green onions
	- Maple syrup
	- Vegetable oil
	- Orange juice or whisky
	- Ground cloves
	- Salt and pepper
	- Cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Bamboo skewers
	- 2 oranges
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine vinegar, garlic, onions, maple syrup, oil, orange juice, cloves, salt and pepper in large sealable freezer bag. Pour 2 tbsp (30 mL) into a small bowl and set aside for basting. Mix cornstarch into marinade in bag until dissolved. Add beef to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	2. Discard marinade from meat. Pat beef cubes dry with paper towel. Thread beef cubes onto soaked skewers alternating with orange chunks.
	3. Grill kabobs over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for about 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides, until cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
Recipe Tips:
  - You can use Beef Inside Round Marinating Steak to cut your own Marinating Kabob Cubes if you like. Use a steak that’s cut 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick.
---
Recipe ID: 65cb6dc7-9efc-4e14-bb90-3d6ee82228f4
Recipe Title: Grilled Cheeseburger Wedge Salad
Recipe Summary: Beef burger patties deliver an excellent source of protein, zinc and vitamin B12 – not to mention, flavour!
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Patties
	- ½ cup (125 mL) Thousand Island salad dressing
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) prepared yellow mustard
	- 1 small head iceberg lettuce, cut into 4 wedges
	- 1 cup (250 mL) halved grape tomatoes
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH shredded Cheddar cheese and sliced dill pickles
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Patties
	- Thousand Island salad dressing
	- Prepared yellow mustard
	- 1 small head iceberg lettuce
	- Grape tomatoes
	- Shredded Cheddar cheese
	- Dill pickles
Recipe Methods:
	1. Grill patties on a lightly oiled grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 10 to 14 minutes for ¾-inch (2 cm) thick patties, turning twice or more, or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each patty reads 160°F (71°C).
	2. Meanwhile, whisk salad dressing with mustard in a small bowl. 
	3. Divide lettuce wedges among 4 plates, top each with a cooked patty, tomatoes, Cheddar and pickles; drizzle with dressing mixture.
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Use a digital instant-read thermometer as the most reliable way to determine that ground beef patties are cooked to the proper doneness.

Recipe ID: 661405b9-fee8-494e-ad4a-ce3c8ec90764
Recipe Title: Glazed Meat Loaf with Roasted Veggies
Recipe Summary: This old-fashioned meat loaf with a tangy ketchup glaze is tasty, moist and juicy. Spice up the glaze with a little sriracha for a modern twist. 
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 85
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Meat Loaf
		- 1 cup (250 mL) seasoned dry bread crumbs
		- 3 eggs, beaten 
		- 1 onion, grated
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH Dijon mustard and Worcestershire sauce
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
		- 1½ lb (750 g) Lean Ground Beef 
	- Glaze
		- ⅓ cup (75 mL) ketchup
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) packed brown sugar
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cider vinegar
		- Roasted Veggies
		- 2 lb (1 kg) red skinned potatoes, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
		- 4 large carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks 
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dried fine herbes or Italian herb seasoning
		- ¾ tsp (4 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
		- 1 cup (250 mL) frozen peas
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) seasoned dry bread crumbs
	- 3 eggs
	- 1 onion
	- Fresh parsley
	- Dijon mustard
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Lean Ground Beef 
	- Ketchup
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Cider vinegar
	- 2 lb (1 kg) red skinned potatoes
	- 4 large carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks 
	- Vegetable oil
	- Dried fine herbes or Italian herb seasoning
	- Frozen peas
Recipe Methods:
	Meat Loaf: : 
		1. Combine bread crumbs, eggs, onion, parsley, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Gently mix in ground beef with a fork (careful not to over-mix). Form ground beef mixture into a loaf shape (about 9 inches/23 long by 5 inches/12 cm wide) on a parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet; set aside.
		2. Glaze: Combine ketchup, sugar and vinegar in a small bowl; set aside.
	Roasted Veggies: : 
		3. Combine potatoes, carrots, oil, herbs, salt and pepper in a large bowl; toss to coat. Arrange in an even layer on another parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet. 
		4. Bake vegetables on the bottom rack and meat loaf on the middle rack in preheated 400°F oven, tossing vegetables occasionally, for 40 minutes. Brush meat loaf with reserved glaze. Bake for 20 minutes, scattering peas over vegetables in the last 5 minutes of baking. Meat loaf is done when a digital instant-read thermometer inserted into the centre of the loaf reads 160°F (71°C). Tent meat loaf with foil and let stand for 10 minutes. (Return potatoes and carrots to oven while meat loaf rests, if needed.)
		5. Cut meat loaf into slices and serve with Roasted Veggies. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Add 1 tbsp (15 mL) Asian chili sauce, such as sambal oelek or sriracha, to the glaze for a sweet and spicy topping.
---
Recipe ID: 665e951f-7112-4ef2-9f1f-4e13ac5676a2
Recipe Title: Singapore Noodles 
Recipe Summary: This fragrant noodle dish with curry, ginger and garlic is loaded with flavour, yet simple to put together, and made with ingredients you likely have on hand. Vary the vegetables with what you have in the crisper or the freezer and vary the spice level to your taste with mild, medium or hot curry powder. Add some pan-fried ground beef or beef strips to make it a meal if you like or serve as a side to beef satay or your favourite steak.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 12
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 27
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 6 oz (175 g) rice vermicelli noodles or angel hair pasta, broken in half
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 4 green onions or 1 small onion, thinly sliced
	- 1 large carrot, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 sweet red pepper, seeded and cut into thin strips
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced gingerroot
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) curry powder (mild, medium or hot)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth (approx)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) soy sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sambal oelek or sriracha (approx)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) granulated sugar
	- 1 cup (250 mL) halved snow peas or frozen peas (thawed)
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Soak or cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
	2. Meanwhile, heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Cook onions and carrot, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until carrots start to soften. Add garlic, red pepper, gingerroot and curry powder; cook stirring, for 2 minutes or until fragrant.&nbsp;
	3. Stir in ½ cup (125 mL) broth, soy sauce, sambal oelek, sugar, and peas; bring to a boil. Add noodles; lift and stir gently using two spatulas or tongs, until noodles are hot and well coated, adding a little more broth or hot water, as necessary to moisten. Season with more sambal oelek to taste, as desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Depending on the noodles you use, you may need to add more broth or hot water to help coat the noodles so have some ready as you combine the noodles with the sauce just in case.
---
Recipe ID: 6682087f-be3a-444f-b5fa-59ebf06067a3
Recipe Title: Beef Mini Meat Loaves with Veggie Pizza Sauce
Recipe Summary: Mini meat loaves are the perfect meal for families who have staggered schedules as you can make a batch to tuck some in the fridge or freezer and reheat as needed. Click here to get all the skinny on lean ground beef at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway. Using the Furlani Garlic Bread/milk mixture (known as a panade) ensures tender, juicy meat loaves along with a bonus garlic flavour hit.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sunflower or canola oil
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) diced onion (about 1 small)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) finely shredded carrot (about 1 medium)
	- 1 pkg (284g) Furlani® Garlic Bread
	- ½ cup (125 mL) milk
	- 1 ½ lb (750 g) Canadian Lean Ground Beef
	- 1 egg, beaten
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried Italian herb seasoning or dried oregano leaves
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper
	- 1 can (213 mL/7.5 oz) pizza sauce, divided
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH grated Parmesan and shredded mozzarella or Havarti cheese
	-  Veggie Pizza Sauce 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- 1 cup (250 mL) sliced mushrooms
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH diced sweet green and yellow pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Sunflower or canola oil
	- Onion (about 1 small)
	- Carrot (about 1 medium)
	- 1 pkg (284g) Furlani® Garlic Bread
	- Milk
	- 1 ½ lb (750 g) Canadian Lean Ground Beef
	- 1 egg
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning or dried oregano leaves
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- 1 can (213 mL/7.5 oz) pizza sauce
	- Grated Parmesan
	- Shredded mozzarella or Havarti cheese
	- Olive oil
	- 1 cup (250 mL) sliced mushrooms
	- Sweet green and yellow pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a medium nonstick skillet. Cook onion, stirring, for 3 minutes, until starting to soften. Add carrot and cook, stirring for 2 to 3 minutes or until softened. Remove from heat; set aside and let cool.
	2. From the mid-section of one piece of the Furlani Garlic Bread loaf, cut two 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick slices. Tear the slices into pieces, and combine with the milk in a large bowl; let stand 5 minutes.
	3. To the soaked bread, add the beef, egg, reserved carrot and onion, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper and 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the pizza sauce. Mix lightly but thoroughly to blend.
	4. Divide mixture among 12 muffin cups, pressing into cups. Use ¼ cup (60 mL) of the remaining pizza sauce and spoon about 1 tsp (5 mL) on top of each mini meat loaf; reserve about ½ cup (125 mL) for the Simple Veggie Pizza Sauce. Combine the cheeses; dividing evenly, sprinkle on top of the meat loaves.
	5. Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted into centre of several meat loaves registers 160°F (71°C). 
	6. Meanwhile, bake the remaining Furlani Garlic Bread according to package directions. Make the Veggie Pizza Sauce: Heat olive oil in nonstick skillet over medium-high heat; add mushrooms and sweet peppers and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until browned and any liquid has evaporated. Add reserved pizza sauce; heat through, adding a splash of water to thin the sauce, if necessary. 
	7. Serve meat loaves with the Veggie Pizza Sauce and warm Furlani Garlic Bread.
Recipe Tips:
  - Including the grated carrot is a good way to get more veggies into the meal and enhance the juiciness of the meat loaves. With info on 70+ beef cuts, explore the Canadian Beef Information Gateway for all things beef!
---
Recipe ID: 66c97511-44ce-4b52-93d1-7fbc9743bf67
Recipe Title: Dutch Beef Stew
Recipe Summary: The Dutch love to slow cook and this is no exception. I tend to make this classic feel-good recipe for those days I want to curl up on the couch. Baby onions, Dutch baby potatoes, and fork tender Canadian beef bring this stew up a notch from the traditional stew. This is one recipe I enjoy most when it's just finished cooking. Adding the ingredients at just the right time allows each ingredient to be cooked to perfection avoiding the “mushy” texture you can get when cooking a stew. Try it out yourself!
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 140
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) cremini mushrooms, sliced 
	- 3 carrots, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes 
	- 3 stalks celery, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes 
	- 3 shallots, diced
	- 2 cups (500 mL) dry red wine
	- 8 cloves garlic, smashed 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth, divided (approx)
	- 6 sprigs fresh parsley
	- 4 sprigs fresh thyme
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 2 cups (500 mL) Dutch (yellow flesh) baby potatoes, cut in half 
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) pearl onions, peeled and cut in half 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Dijon mustard
	- Additional fresh parsley leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) cremini mushrooms, sliced 
	- 3 carrots 
	- 3 stalks celery
	- 3 shallots
	- Garlic
	- Fresh parsley
	- Fresh thyme
	- 2 cups (500 mL) Dutch (yellow flesh) baby potatoes 
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) pearl onions
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth (approx)
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Bay leaves
	- All-purpose flour
	- 2 cups (500 mL) dry red wine
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat a thin layer of oil over medium-high heat in a medium to large Dutch oven. Add beef in batches, season with salt and pepper to your taste, and cook, stirring, until browned on all sides. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate with a slotted spoon. Set aside.
	2. Add more oil to pot, if necessary. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and lightly browned. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. 
	3. Add carrots, celery and shallots to pot; cook, stirring, for about 7 to 8 minutes or until shallots are soft and beginning to caramelize. Pour in red wine and bring to a simmer, stirring and scraping up brown bits from pot. Stir in garlic. 
	4. Whisk flour with ¾ cup (175 mL) of the beef broth in a bowl to make a slurry. Gradually stir into pot. Return beef to pot. Pour in enough beef broth to cover beef. Stir in parsley, thyme and bay leaves. 
	5. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour. Stir in potatoes; cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in mushrooms, pearl onions and Dijon mustard. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, until beef and potatoes are fork-tender. Discard bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve garnished with fresh parsley to serve. 
Recipe Tips:
  - This beef stew tastes delicious the next day! Let cool and refrigerate in an airtight container overnight or for up to 3 days. Reheat on the stovetop over medium heat until steaming to serve or freeze for a quick meal at a later time! Freeze in an airtight container for up to 3 months and let thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
---
Recipe ID: 66d2e2cd-2e68-4318-9cf8-501256525915
Recipe Title: Tomato Mint Salad
Recipe Summary: This bright salad, accented with mint, lends a touch of Middle Eastern flair to your meal. Top with crispy baked pita croutons for extra crunch.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 0
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 15
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) liquid honey
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 pkg (142 g) mixed greens (about 6 cups/1.5 L)
	- 2 ripe tomatoes, seeded and cut into chunks
	- Half English cucumber, sliced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) fresh mint leaves, torn (or coarsely chopped fresh parsley or cilantro)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped red onion
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk together oil, lemon juice, honey, salt and pepper in a large bowl.
	2. Add mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, mint and red onion to dressing; toss to combine. Serve immediately.
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: 6718741c-70a1-48f5-85a7-4330718cdfe9
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Tomato and Nectarines Salad 
Recipe Summary: This recipe, adapted from the original by sister grill champions Maddie and Kiki, takes advantage of all that Canadian gardens and orchards have to offer in the late-summer season. The pairing of tomatoes with nectarines may seem like an unlikely combination, but tomatoes are a fruit after all.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Steak
		- 2 garlic cloves, finely minced 
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH olive oil and white wine vinegar 
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced fresh oregano (or ½ tsp/2 mL dried oregano leaves)
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) hot pepper flakes (optional)
		- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Flank Marinating Steak 
		- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- Dressing
		- 1/4 cup (60 mL) olive oil 
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) white wine vinegar 
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH Dijon mustard and liquid honey 
		- 1 clove garlic, finely minced
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) minced fresh oregano (or ¼ tsp/1 mL dried oregano leaves) 
		- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Salad
		- 3 to 4 ripe nectarines or peaches, halved 
		- Avocado oil spray
		- 2 cups (500 mL) multi-coloured cherry and/or grape tomatoes, sliced 
		- 1 to 2 large heirloom tomatoes, sliced 
		- One-quarter large red onion, thinly sliced 
		- 3½ oz (100 g) feta cheese, crumbled 
		- Microgreens for garnish 
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Steak: Combine garlic, oil, vinegar, oregano and hot pepper flakes (if using) in a large sealable freezer bag. Pierce the steak all over with a fork. Add to bag, turning to coat. Seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.&nbsp;
	2. Dressing: Meanwhile, combine oil, vinegar, mustard, honey, garlic, oregano and salt and pepper to your taste in a jar with a tight-fitting lid; seal and shake to combine.&nbsp;Set aside.
	3. Remove meat from the marinade; discard marinade.&nbsp;Pat steak dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue (see Tip*) over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes, turning twice ore more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-one). Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 10 minutes.
	4. Salad: Meanwhile, spray nectarines with avocado oil. Grill, cut side down, for 2 to 3 minutes until grill-marked. Set aside to cool.&nbsp;
	5. Cut steak across the grain into thin slices.&nbsp;Arrange tomatoes, nectarines, onion and feta on a large serving platter or individual plates. Top with the steak and drizzle the dressing over top. Garnish with micro greens.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - *To grill on a charcoal barbecue, set up your grill for direct-heat cooking: light the charcoal and place directly where you plan to cook the steak (normally right in the centre of the grill). Close the lid, adjust vents as necessary, and allow the grill to preheat for 10 to 12 minutes to 400°F (200°C). Grill the steak over direct heat for 10 to 12 minutes, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-one). Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 10 minutes.
---
Recipe ID: 67494b40-228f-443f-9872-010f614efa28
Recipe Title: Madras-Spiced Oven Roast with Curry Pan Sauce 
Recipe Summary: Wonderfully fragrant with a touch of heat, this curry-inspired roast beef dinner will delight the senses. It’s even more delicious served with basmati rice, roasted cauliflower and sautéed spinach. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 120
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) curry powder
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) salt 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground pepper, cumin and coriander, chili powder and paprika
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) cayenne pepper
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground cinnamon
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH minced garlic and gingerroot 
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast 
	- Creamy Curry Pan Sauce
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
		- 1 onion, finely chopped 
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) tomato paste 
		- 1 can (400 mL) coconut milk
		- 1 cup (250 mL) reduced-sodium chicken broth
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped dried apricots 
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Curry powder
	- Salt
	- Ground pepper
	- Ground cumin
	- Ground coriander
	- Chili powder
	- Paprika
	- Cayenne pepper
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Vegetable oil
	- Garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Inside Round Oven Roast 
	- Butter
	- 1 onion
	- Tomato paste
	- 1 can (400 mL) coconut milk
	- Reduced-sodium chicken broth
	- Dried apricots
	- Fresh lemon juice
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine curry powder, salt, pepper, chili powder, paprika, cumin, coriander, cayenne and cinnamon in a small bowl. Stir in oil, garlic and gingerroot. Transfer half of the curry mixture to another bowl and set aside for pan sauce. 
	2. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Rub half of the curry mixture all over roast.
	3. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 1¼ to 1¾ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts. 
	4. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. 
	Creamy Curry Pan Sauce: : 
		5. Meanwhile, heat pan drippings and butter in roasting pan over medium heat. Add onion and reserved curry mixture. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 5 minutes or until onions are starting to soften and spices are fragrant. Increase heat to medium-high. Stir in tomato paste; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in coconut milk, broth and apricots; bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up browned bits from pan. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 to 15 minutes or until sauce thickens. Stir in lemon juice. 
		6. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with Creamy Curry Pan Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - For an extra rich and nutty flavour, stir 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) natural almond butter or peanut butter into sauce with the coconut milk. Stir finely chopped fresh mint, cilantro or parsley leaves into sauce just before serving for a fresh pop of flavour to finish. To prevent apricots from sticking to the knife while chopping, dip the knife blade in flour between cuts.
---
Recipe ID: 69435767-614b-476b-a14b-e0324003d259
Recipe Title: Grilled Teriyaki-Style Pineapple and Beef Skewer Bites
Recipe Summary: Prepared on mini skewers, these pint-sized kabobs make for a fun and kid-friendly weeknight dinner that the whole family will love. They’re also fun as an appetizer for casual gatherings.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) teriyaki sauce, divided
	- 1 peeled cored pineapple, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks (about 24 pieces)
	- 2 sweet red peppers, seeded and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks (about 24 pieces)
	- 12 small bamboo skewers
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick 
	- Teriyaki sauce
	- 1 pineapple
	- 2 sweet red peppers, seeded
	- 12 small bamboo skewers
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pierce steak all over with fork, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces (about 24 cubes). Add steak and half the teriyaki sauce to a large sealable freezer bag, massaging sauce into meat; seal and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for 30 minutes.
	2. Remove beef from marinade; discard used marinade. Pat beef cubes dry with paper towel. Thread 2 beef cubes, 2 pineapple chunks and 2 red pepper chunks on each skewer. 
	3. Grill skewers in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown on all sides and basting with remaining teriyaki sauce during the last 2 minutes of cooking, or until peppers are tender and beef is cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	4. Transfer to a warmed platter and serve. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Store-bought teriyaki sauce varies from brand to brand, so if the sauce is too thick for basting, stir in up to 2 tbsp (30 mL) pineapple juice or water to thin slightly. Make sure to remove the beef, pineapple and red pepper from skewers before serving to young children. Serve skewers over steamed rice or noodles, and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and green onions, if desired.
---
Recipe ID: 69c2ce9b-f988-43c8-805e-51e5f86ac982
Recipe Title: Asian-Style Noodle Soup with Beef Sausage
Recipe Summary: Instead of making meatballs from scratch, try dropping beef sausage meat into a simmering broth to poach. It’s a super-simple way to get both tender juicy meatballs and a flavourful soup broth too.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sausages (about 4)
	- Vegetable oil
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh cilantro leaves, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH minced gingerroot, green onion and garlic
	- 2 boxes (each 900 mL) chicken broth
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes, or to taste (optional)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) cut frozen or fresh green beans
	- ½ cup (125 mL) julienned or grated carrot
	- 1 cup (250 mL) broken spaghetti or spaghettini
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Soy sauce
	- Chopped fresh cilantro and sliced green onions (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Sausages  (about 4)
	- Vegetable oil
	- Fresh cilantro leaves
	- Gingerroot
	- Green onion
	- Garlic
	- 2 boxes (each 900 mL) chicken broth
	- Hot pepper flakes (optional)
	- Frozen or fresh green beans
	- Carrots
	- 1 Spaghettini
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Soy sauce
	- Fresh cilantro (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine cilantro, gingerroot, green onion, garlic, hot pepper flakes (if using) and broth in a large saucepan; bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. 
	2. Cut sausage casing open on one end of each sausage and pinch out teaspoonful (5 mL) portions of meat, carefully dropping into simmering broth; simmer for 1 minute. Stir in noodles and return to a simmer, stirring. Reduce heat and boil gently, stirring occasionally, for about 8 minutes or until spaghetti is almost tender. 
	3. Stir in green beans and carrot. Return to a simmer and cook for 6 minutes until beans are tender and sausage is completely cooked. Season to taste with fresh lime juice and soy sauce. Garnish with additional cilantro and/or green onions, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a honey-garlic sausage for the best flavour match with the soup.
---
Recipe ID: 69fdec56-c51d-49ff-822e-ba672701e6b4
Recipe Title: Open-Faced Roast Beef Sandwich with Caramelized Onions
Recipe Summary: In this recipe, the onions slowly cook and caramelize in the oven with the roast resulting in a delicious sauce with all the flavours of classic French onion soup. You can scale up the cheese option to a Gruyère or Emmental, if you like. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut.
