A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 120
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh thyme
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast 
	- Caramelized Onions
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) butter, melted
		- 5 cups (1.25 L) thinly sliced onions (about 1½ lb/750 g) 
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Pan Sauce
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) butter, divided
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) all-purpose flour
		- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine
		- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
		- 2 sprigs fresh thyme
		- 2 bay leaves
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh chives
	- Sandwich
		- 8 thick slices sourdough bread
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
		- 16 slices Swiss cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh thyme
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Olive oil
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Inside Round Oven Roast 
	- Butter
	- Onions (about 1½ lb/750 g)
	- All-purpose flour
	- Dry red wine
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- 2 sprigs fresh thyme
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Fresh chives
	- 8 thick slices sourdough bread
	- 16 slices Swiss cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine thyme, garlic, oil, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat roast dry with paper towel and rub thyme mixture all over roast.
	2. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place on middle rack of the oven. Oven-sear roast in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. 
	Caramelized Onions : : 
		3. Meanwhile, toss melted butter with onions, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Arrange evenly on large baking sheet. Transfer to oven on the rack above the roast in the top-third of oven. 
		4. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered and stirring onions occasionally, for about 1¼ to 1¾ hours until onions are tender and roast is cooked to medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
		NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
		5. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Set Caramelized Onions aside.
	Pan Sauce : : 
		6. Meanwhile, melt butter in roasting pan over medium heat. Sprinkle with flour; cook, stirring for 2 to 3 minutes or until smooth. Gradually whisk in red wine; bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up any browned bits from pan. Stir in broth, Worcestershire sauce, thyme sprigs and bay leaves; bring back to a boil. Stir in Caramelized Onions and reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 to 15 minutes or until sauce is thickened and flavours are blended. Remove thyme sprigs and bay leaves; discard. Stir in chives. 
		7. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices.
	Sandwich: : 
		8. Place bread slices on a foil-lined baking sheet. Broil for 1 to 2 minutes per side or until golden and toasted. Spread butter on bread slices and top each with 2 cheese slices. Broil for 1 minute or until cheese starts to melt. 
		9. Place each slice of bread in a shallow bowl or pasta plate. Top with sliced beef and top with gravy.
Recipe Tips:
  - Jazz up sauce with a splash of brandy, sherry or cognac before adding broth, if desired. Use sliced beef, sauce and Swiss cheese to make a grilled cheese sandwich. Serve with extra sauce on the side for dipping.
---
Recipe ID: 6a199c23-ae9f-4e48-bcfb-26f541d77209
Recipe Title: Oven-Roasted Beef Marrow Bones with Onion Jam
Recipe Summary: Toasted bread spread with marrow and topped with Beefy Onion Jam is sheer luxury. If you wish, you can omit the beef from the jam recipe. It will still be delicious.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 105
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 pieces Beef Marrow Bones, Canoe-cut
	- 1 whole small-sized Beef Digital Flexor Meat (about 1 lb/500 g) 
	- Salt
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 4 cups (1 L) very thinly sliced onions
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) strong brewed black coffee
	- 5 tbsp (75 mL) apple cider vinegar (approx)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH packed light brown sugar and maple syrup (approx)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) freshly ground black pepper
	- Large pinches EACH ground allspice, cloves, ginger and cinnamon
	- 8 large, thick slices crusty bread, toasted (or more)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 8 pieces  Beef Marrow Bones, Canoe-cut
	- 1 whole small-sized  Beef Digital Flexor Meat  (about 1 lb/500 g) 
	- Salt
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onions
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Strong brewed black coffee
	- Apple cider vinegar
	- Packed light brown sugar
	- Maple syrup
	- Freshly ground black pepper
	- Ground allspice
	- Ground cloves
	- Ground ginger
	- Ground cinnamon
	- 8 large, thick slices crusty bread, toasted (or more)
Recipe Methods:
	1. To prepare marrow bones, with the back of a sturdy knife, scrape off any meat clinging to the outside of the bones. In a large container or nonreactive bowl, stir 3 tbsp (45 mL) salt and 4 quarts (4 L) water together until salt is dissolved. Add the marrow bones, cover and refrigerate overnight or for 24 hours. Drain bones well.
	 2. To make the Jam: Cut the digital meat in half lengthwise and cut each half crosswise into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces. Place in an electric pressure cooker with 1 tsp (5 mL) salt and bay leaf; add 3 cups (750 mL) water. Secure the electric pressure cooker lid making sure the valve is closed. Set pressure to HIGH and time for 1 hour. 
	3. Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in a medium-sized pot. Add onions and garlic; cook, stirring frequently, for about 8 to 10 minutes or until the onions are soft and lightly browned. Add the coffee, vinegar, sugar, maple syrup, pepper, allspice, cloves, ginger, cinnamon and ½ tsp (2 mL) salt, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Remove from the heat.
	4. When the pressure cooker timer beeps, let the pressure release naturally. Drain off water, transfer beef a bowl and let cool slightly. Shred into small pieces.
	5. Add beef to the onion mixture and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered and stirring frequently, for 30 to 40 minutes or until the onions are meltingly soft and the liquid is thick and syrupy. If the mixture looks dry, add a touch of water. Taste the jam and adjust it with whatever you think is lacking, be it salt, sugar or vinegar. (Make ahead: The jam can be made in advance. Let cool and refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 4 days or freeze for longer storage.)
	 6. To serve: place the marrow bones 2 inches (5 cm) apart on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Brush bones lightly with oil and season lightly with salt and pepper. Bake in preheated 350ºF for 20 minutes. Warm the jam in a small saucepan over medium-low heat while the bones are roasting, adding a touch of water if it is too thick.
	 7. Serve 1 bone per person with the toast and jam on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - When preparing the Marrow Bones, the soaking step helps firm up the marrow and helps it be a creamy white. Scraping helps make the bones look more attractive. You can skip this step if you prefer.
---
Recipe ID: 6a5f19cf-38bd-44bb-b6a0-d7492af326ab
Recipe Title: Pan-Seared Steak with Bourbon Peppercorn Sauce
Recipe Summary: Use thick-cut Grilling Steaks for the ultimate steak-house experience at home. The rich, flavourful peppercorn sauce spiked with bourbon takes this steak up to the next level.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter, divided
	- 1 large shallot, finely diced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) beef broth
	- ½ cup (125 mL) bourbon
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) green peppercorns in brine, rinsed and drained
	- Salt and coarsely ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) steak seasoning, or to taste
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Butter
	- 1 large shallot
	- All-purpose flour
	- Beef broth
	- Bourbon
	- Green peppercorns in brine
	- Salt and coarsely ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Steak seasoning
Recipe Methods:
	1. Melt 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter over medium-low heat in a large skillet. Add shallot and cook, stirring frequently, for about 10 minutes or until shallot is light brown. Add flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in broth, bourbon and green peppercorns; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and boil gently, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes or until sauce is thickened and reduced to about 1 cup (250 mL). Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat and keep warm.
	 2. Rub steaks all over with seasoning to your taste. Melt remaining 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter over medium-high heat in a large cast-iron or heavy skillet. Pan-fry steaks for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer steaks to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	3. Slice steaks across the grain and serve with peppercorn sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 6abd785d-dc4d-48a3-bb26-6f15f298de5c
Recipe Title: Asian-Style Slow Cooker Beef
Recipe Summary: Serve this slow-cooked dish with steamed rice or Asian noodles tossed with a splash of sesame oil.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 375
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 405
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Bone-in Short Ribs, about 2 inches (5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sesame oil
	- 1 large red onion, cut lengthwise into thick wedges, layers separated
	- 1 large carrot, sliced
	- 2 stalks celery, sliced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shiitake mushrooms, halved
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped garlic
	- 1 carton (900 mL) sodium-reduced beef broth
	- ½ cup (125 mL) hoisin sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH soy sauce and rice vinegar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chili garlic sauce (or splash of Sriracha or sambal oelek hot sauce)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 4 baby bok choy
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whole baby corn
	- Green onions, sliced
	- Sesame seeds
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Bone-in Short Ribs, about 2 inches (5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Sesame oil
	- 1 large red onion
	- 1 large carrot
	- 2 stalks celery
	- Shiitake mushrooms
	- Garlic
	- 1 carton (900 mL) sodium-reduced beef broth
	- Hoisin sauce
	- Soy sauce
	- Rice vinegar
	- Chili garlic sauce (or splash of Sriracha or sambal oelek hot sauce)
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- 4 baby bok choy
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whole baby corn
	- Green onions
	- Sesame seeds
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat short ribs dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat sesame oil over medium-high heat in a heavy pan. Brown short ribs, turning, until browned on all sides. Transfer to a large bowl. 
	2. Add onion and carrots to pan; cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until starting to soften. Add celery, mushrooms and garlic; cook, stirring for 3 minutes or until starting to soften. Transfer to a bowl with beef.
	3. Add broth to pan and bring to a boil, scraping up any brown bits. Stir in hoisin sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, chili sauce, and Worcestershire. Set a minimum 5-qt (5 L) slow cooker to LOW setting. Transfer beef, vegetables and any accumulated juice and sauce to the slow cooker.
	4. Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours or until beef is fork-tender. 
	5. Meanwhile, cut bok choy in half lengthwise. Stir bok choy and baby corn into slow cooker. Cover and cook on LOW for 15 minutes or until bok choy is tender crisp.
	 6. Transfer short ribs and vegetables to platter with a slotted spoon; keep warm.
	7. Skim any fat from the top of sauce and discard. Cut ribs into 6 portions. Drizzle sauce over ribs and vegetables. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.
Recipe Tips:
  - Braised meats are great for entertaining since they can be made a day ahead. Flavour melds together as it sits so it tastes better the next day. Gently re-heat in the oven, microwave or slow cooker to serve.
---
Recipe ID: 6ad13e1f-5027-4a9d-9566-3a54fb921b88
Recipe Title: Meatball Parmigiana
Recipe Summary: These tender meatballs are perfect to serve with your favourite pasta but even more delicious tucked into a soft kaiser bun to enjoy as a sandwich or with, pasta, rice or polenta. As a kid, meatballs were one of my favourites (and they still are)! 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 45
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 65
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅔ cup (150 mL) fresh bread crumbs
	- ½ cup (125 mL) grated Parmesan cheese
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped onion
	- 1 large clove garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried oregano leaves
	- 1 large egg
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) whipping cream
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) all-purpose flour
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) tomato basil pasta sauce (homemade or store-bought)
	- Topping 
		- 1 ball (125 g) fresh mozzarella or bocconcini cheese, drained
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh grated Parmesan cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 onion
	- Garlic
	- Fresh parsley
	- Fresh bread crumbs
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- All-purpose flour
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) tomato basil pasta sauce (homemade or store-bought)
	- 1 ball (125 g) fresh mozzarella or bocconcini cheese, drained
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
	- Whipping cream
	- 1 large egg
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine bread crumbs, Parmesan, onion, garlic, oregano, egg, parsley, cream, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Gently mix in ground beef with a fork or your hands (careful not to over-mix). Roll into about twenty-two 1½-inch (4 cm) meatballs. 
	2. Place flour on a plate. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large ovenproof skillet or wide saucepan. Roll meatballs in flour a few at a time to coat, then add to pan. Cook, shaking pan gently or turning meatballs as needed, for about 8 minutes until browned all over. Reduce heat to medium, add pasta sauce and bring to a simmer.&nbsp; 
	3. Cover and bake in preheated 400ºF oven for 30 to 40 minutes, stirring once until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several meatballs reads 160°F (71°C) and sauce is thickened. 
	4. Topping: Uncover skillet. Tear mozzarella into small pieces and sprinkle over meatballs; sprinkle with Parmesan. Bake, uncovered, for 5 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. 
Recipe Tips:
  - These meatballs freeze well, simply let the baked meatballs cool at the end of step 3. . Freeze in an airtight container for up to 1 month. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator before reheating in the oven or on the stovetop until heated through and add Topping, then bake as directed to finish. Fresh bread crumbs are made by using fresh bread (sliced or buns) that still have moisture in them. Toss the bread slices or torn buns into a food processor and pulse until fine crumbs. Freeze any leftovers in a resealable bag until you need fresh bread crumbs again.
---
Recipe ID: 6b0fc02c-060d-4f45-89e1-81923e28950b
Recipe Title: Braised Beef Curry
Recipe Summary: This mildly spiced curry is easy to pull together and takes advantage of convenient Beef Stew Cubes. Serve this saucy curry spooned over steamed rice.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 150
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes, 1½-inch (3.5 cm) cubes, trimmed
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided (approx)
	- 1 large onion, cut lengthwise into wedges
	- ½-inch (1 cm) piece unpeeled gingerroot, thinly sliced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) yellow curry paste
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground turmeric
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) chicken broth
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) coconut milk
	- 1 large carrot, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
	- 1 large sweet red pepper, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
	- ½ cup (125 mL) halved green beans
	- ½ cup (125 mL) coarsely chopped kale
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Fresh cilantro leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes, 1½-inch (3.5 cm) cubes, trimmed
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion
	- ½-inch (1 cm) piece of gingerroot
	- Yellow curry paste
	- Ground turmeric
	- Chicken broth
	- Coconut milk
	- 1 large carrot
	- 1 large sweet red pepper
	- Green beans
	- Kale
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Fresh cilantro leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Season beef cubes all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil in a Dutch oven or enamelled cast iron roaster over medium-high heat until sizzling; brown beef, in batches, turning until brown all over and adding more oil, as necessary, between batches. Transfer to a bowl; set aside.
	2. Add onion and gingerroot to pan; sauté for about 3 minutes until just softened. Add curry paste and turmeric; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in broth, scraping up brown bits from pot. Stir in coconut milk. Stir in reserved beef and any accumulated juices.
	3. Cover tightly; cook in a 325°F oven for 1 hour. Stir in carrot; return to oven and continue cooking for 40 minutes or until carrots and beef are almost tender. Stir in sweet pepper and green beans; return to oven and cook for another 20 minutes, until beef is fork-tender and veggies are tender. Remove slices of gingerroot and stir in kale. Season with fresh lime juice to taste. Serve garnished with cilantro.
Recipe Tips:
  - Browning the beef before simmering gives beef stew a rich colour and flavour. Brown beef in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan. Overcrowding will cause the meat to steam rather than brown.
---
Recipe ID: 6c5518a3-b2b8-4960-bc5c-5fd0b3ef7669
Recipe Title: Chipotle-Honey Grilled Beef Fajitas
Recipe Summary: Family-friendly and festive, this fajitas dinner is a crowd-pleaser. Marinating the steak the night before and using store-bought condiments make this recipe quick and easy to get to the table. For less spicy fajitas, reduce chipotle by half, and for a gluten-free dinner, use corn tortillas.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 720
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 750
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH fresh lime juice, orange juice and liquid honey
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped canned chipotles in adobo sauce 
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) red wine vinegar
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground cumin and dried oregano leaves
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak,1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 red onion, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) thick rounds
	- 1 EACH sweet green and red pepper, halved lengthwise and seeded
	- 8 medium flour tortillas
	- 1 cup (250 mL) prepared salsa
	- 1 cup (250 mL) prepared guacamole
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) shredded Tex-Mex cheese blend
	- ½ cup (125 mL) sour cream
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Vegetable oil
	- Canned chipotles in adobo sauce
	- Red wine vinegar
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Ground cumin
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak,1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 red onion
	- Sweet green and red pepper, seeded
	- 8 medium flour tortillas
	- Prepared salsa
	- Prepared guacamole
	- Shredded Tex-Mex cheese blend
	- Sour cream
	- Limes
	- Orange juice
	- Liquid honey
	- Dried oregano leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine lime juice, orange juice, honey, oil, chipotles, vinegar, garlic, cumin and oregano in a small bowl.
	2. Pierce steak all over with a fork. Place in a sealable freezer bag and pour in half the marinade, massaging marinade into meat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours. Cover and refrigerate remaining chipotle-honey sauce.
	3. Remove steak from bag; discard used marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	 4. Meanwhile, toss onion and peppers with 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the reserved chipotle-honey sauce; grill over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until lightly charred and tender. Grill tortillas for 30 to 60 seconds or until just warmed through; wrap in foil to keep warm. Cut onions and peppers into thin strips.
	5. Slice steak thinly across the grain. Arrange steak and veggies in a single layer on a platter; drizzle remaining chipotle-honey sauce over top. Serve in warm tortillas with salsa, guacamole, cheese, sour cream and lime wedges. 
Recipe Tips:
  - For a flavour twist, substitute orange juice with pineapple juice and grill pineapple spears along with steak and vegetables for tacos al pastor-style fajitas dinner. Insert two soaked wooden skewers through onion rounds to hold layers together. This makes turning during grilling easier and ensures they don’t fall through the grate on the barbecue.
---
Recipe ID: 6c690a43-8044-4dfb-8135-89b39d1b5645
Recipe Title: Grilled Parisienne-Style Marinated Beef Sandwiches
Recipe Summary: This easy beef sandwich recipe is a variation of the French classic baguette à l’échalottes. Serve sandwiches with a green salad, grilled tomatoes and pommes frites.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 520
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) red wine
	- 1 shallot, minced
	- 2 cloves garlic, crushed
	- 1 sprig fresh thyme (or ½ tsp/2 mL dried)
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Flank Marinating Steak
	- 2 French baguettes (each 14 inches/35 cm long)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 4 oz (125 g) Brie cheese, thinly sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped walnuts (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Red wine
	- 1 shallot
	- Garlic
	- Fresh thyme (or dried)
	- Bay leaf
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Flank Marinating Steak
	- 2 French baguettes (each 14 inches/35 cm long)
	- Dijon mustard
	- 4 oz (125 g) Brie cheese
	- Chopped walnuts (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine red wine, shallot, garlic, thyme, bay leaf, salt and pepper to your taste in large resealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with a fork; add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.&nbsp;
	2. Remove steak from bag and reserve marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel.
	3. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for about 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. (Leave grill on.)
	4. Meanwhile, bring reserved marinade to a full boil over high heat in a saucepan; boil for 1 minute. Discard thyme sprig and bay leaf.
	5. Slice steak thinly across the grain on a 45-degree angle. Cut baguettes in half lengthwise, then cut each crosswise into 4 equal pieces. Spread insides with mustard, top with sliced steak and cheese.
	6. Grill sandwiches over medium heat in closed barbecue for about 5 minutes or just until cheese is slightly melted and bread is toasted. Sprinkle with walnut pieces, if desired. Serve immediately with boiled marinade for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - Marinades are all about building steak flavour and juiciness. Piercing steak all over with a fork is what helps tenderize the steak.
---
Recipe ID: 6c82c884-ec0b-4d32-80f1-f4e276c2725c
Recipe Title: Slow Cooker Sweet-and-Sour Beef
Recipe Summary: With simple family-friendly flavours, this slow cooker beef can be served in a variety of ways depending on what is in your fridge and pantry. Double the recipe to have leftovers for fast and easy meals any night of the week. This versatile beef dish can be served in a variety of ways. For tacos, tuck into warmed flour or corn tortillas with salsa, guacamole, sour cream, Tex-Mex cheese and shredded lettuce, or try in lettuce cups garnished with shredded carrots and green onions. For tasty sandwiches, serve in toasted buns with your favourite coleslaw. Or, simply serve over cooked rice with steamed broccoli.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 380
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 395
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chili powder
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- ½ cup (125 mL) grated onion
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) ketchup
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) packed brown sugar
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH cider vinegar and tomato paste
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat
	- Chili powder
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Ketchup
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Cider vinegar
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Tomato paste
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim excess fat from the meat to your taste. Starting at the thicker end of each piece of meat, make a cut in between the meat and the fibrous silverskin, lifting the fat and silverskin away from the meat while you trim along the strip of meat. (Tip: Grip the silverskin with a paper towel to prevent slipping.). Discard the trim. Cut meat crosswise into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces.
	2. Combine chili powder, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add beef pieces to bowl; toss to evenly coat.
	3. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Brown beef in batches, turning and adding remaining oil as needed, until browned on all over. With slotted spoon, transfer to a 4- to 5-qt (4 to 5 L) slow cooker.
	4. Return skillet to medium heat. Add ¼ cup (60 mL) water, stirring to scrape up any browned bits. Stir in onion, garlic, ketchup, sugar, vinegar, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce and mustard until smooth. Remove from heat and pour over beef in slow cooker; stir to coat. 
	5. Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours or HIGH for 3 to 4 hours or until beef is fork-tender and sauce is thickened and bubbling. 
Recipe Tips:
  - The fibrous silverskin on finger meat is tough. Removing it before cooking makes the meat much more tender.
---
Recipe ID: 6cca7903-0460-4ff8-9d84-fb2c375abfd6
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Chimichurri Sauce
Recipe Summary: Juicy grilled steaks get a fresh, garlicky kick from a drizzle of Chimichurri, Argentina’s parsley-packed cousin to basil pesto. As an option, you can turn the sauce into a chunky Chimichurri Salsa studded with tomato and cilantro.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 cups (750 mL) lightly packed fresh parsley leaves (about 1 bunch)
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper sauce
	- ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) salt
	- Pinch fresh ground pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh parsley leaves (about 1 bunch)
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Hot pepper sauce
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine parsley, garlic, hot pepper sauce and salt and pepper to your taste, in food processor or blender until parsley is finely chopped. With motor running, gradually blend in olive oil and lemon juice until mixture resembles pesto. (Make-ahead: Chimichurri Sauce can be prepared up to 12 hours in advance and kept refrigerated in an airtight container.)  
	2. Set aside 3 tbsp (45 mL) of sauce and reserve; cover and refrigerate. Add remaining Chimichurri sauce to sealable freezer bag. Add steaks to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes.
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Grill steaks over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	4. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steaks thinly across the grain and serve with a spoonful of reserved sauce or Chimichurri Salsa (see Tip, below).
Recipe Tips:
  - To make Chimichurri Salsa, Add 1 large plum tomato, diced and 2 tsp (10 mL) chopped fresh cilantro to the reserved portion of Chimichurri Sauce.
---
Recipe ID: 6ed09a79-f2af-4ed8-ac60-cdb3c78e1397
Recipe Title: Classic Beef Chili
Recipe Summary: Finally, a down-sized chili that’s good for a small household. Make this for two – or for one – with enough to make quesadillas the next day from any leftover chili. Serve topped with some shredded Cheddar cheese, sour cream, sliced jalapeño and torn fresh cilantro. If you’re ambitious, bake up some cornbread to sop up the bowl.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- ½ cup (125 mL) diced onion 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) minced garlic
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) tomato paste 
	- ½ lb (250 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) chili powder 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) brown sugar 
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) ground cumin 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) fresh ground pepper 
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) beef broth
	- 1 cup (250 mL) finely chopped tomatoes (fresh or drained canned) 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) strained tomatoes (passata)
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) drained rinsed canned kidney beans
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 onion 
	- Garlic
	- Tomato paste 
	- ½ lb (250 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Olive oil
	- Beef broth
	- Chili powder 
	- Brown sugar 
	- Ground cumin 
	- Salt
	- Pepper 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) finely chopped tomatoes (fresh or drained canned) Strained tomatoes (passata)
	- Canned kidney beans
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil over a medium-high heat in a medium pot for 1 minute. Cook onion, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes until soft and translucent. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or just until fragrant. Stir in tomato paste and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes.
	2. Add beef and cook, stirring often and using back of spoon to break up meat into small chunks, for 6 to 7 minutes or until beef is browned. Stir in chili powder, sugar, cumin, salt, and pepper.
	3. Stir in broth, chopped tomatoes, strained tomatoes and beans. Bring to a gentle boil; reduce and gently simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
	4. Ladle chili into bowls and garnish with toppings, as desired.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 6fd6da9d-f160-4126-8bea-cd857d799e0c
Recipe Title: Thai “Waterfall” Steak Salad (Nam Tok Neua)
Recipe Summary: This salad hails from the northeast region of Thailand, where my mother’s side of the family is from, so northeastern food has a special place in my heart. When most people think about a steak salad, they envision a salad made of leafy greens, with sliced steak on top. But nam tok neua is actually a salad made almost entirely of steak! No vegetables, just lots of fresh herbs, and a spicy and tart dressing. The term “waterfall” or nam tok refers to the dripping (i.e. falling) of meat juices as it’s being grilled. Here in Canada, I love making this in the summer when the grilling season is in full swing. The combination of steak and an abundance of herbs in this salad strikes the perfect balance of not too heavy, yet not too light, and is perfect for a summertime dinner. For a side dish, this salad is served with sticky rice to complete the full northeastern Thai experience (see Tip for Thai Sticky Rice recipe). One of the key ingredients in this salad is toasted rice powder which has a wonderful nutty, toasty aroma, adding depth to the salad and balances the acidity of the lime. It’s a staple ingredient in Northeastern Thailand, and it’s added to many salads, soups and dipping sauces. It is a must-have ingredient in waterfall steak salad.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 31
Recipe Marinating Time: 120
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 171
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Steak
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) canola or sunflower oil
		- 1½ tsp (7 mL) oyster sauce
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) soy sauce
		- ¾ tsp (4 mL) granulated sugar 
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper
		- 8 oz (250 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak, Bottom Sirloin Tri-tip or other grilling steak, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salad
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) uncooked jasmine or Thai glutinous rice
		- 1 makrut lime leaf (optional)
		- 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) water or no-salt-added chicken or beef broth
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) fish sauce
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lime juice
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) granulated sugar
		- ½ to 1 tsp (2 to 5 mL) hot pepper flakes, roasted (see Tip)
		- 1 small stalk lemongrass, bottom half only, thinly sliced
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) thinly sliced shallots
		- ½ cup (125 mL) loosely packed fresh mint leaves 
		- ½ cup (125 mL) loosely packed chopped fresh cilantro
		- 2 to 3 leaves sawtooth coriander, chopped (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 makrut lime leaf (optional)
	- 1 lime
	- 1 small stalk lemongrass
	- Shallots
	- Fresh mint 
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Sawtooth coriander (optional)
	- 8 oz (250 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak, Bottom Sirloin Tri-tip or other grilling steak, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- No-salt-added chicken or beef broth (optional)
	- Oyster sauce
	- Soy sauce
	- Granulated sugar 
	- Pepper
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Thai glutinous rice, for serving 
	- Jasmine or additional Thai glutinous rice
Recipe Methods:
	1. Steak: Combine oil, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar, pepper and 1½ tsp (7 mL) water in a small bowl, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Place steak in a sealable freezer bag or a container that fits steak snugly and pour in marinade, turning to coat. Seal bag or cover container and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to overnight, turning the steak at least once.&nbsp;
	2. Remove steak from marinade; discard any excess marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare (or 160°F/71°C for medium or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer to a plate and let rest while you prep the salad, keeping all the juices that pool on the plate.&nbsp;
	3. Salad: Place rice and makrut lime leaf (if using) in a dry small skillet and cook over high heat, stirring constantly, until the rice is toasted and dark brown. Pour onto a plate and let cool slightly. Grind leaf and rice into a powder using a mortar and pestle or a spice or coffee grinder. Set aside.
	4. Thinly slice steak across the grain into bite-sized pieces. Place in a bowl along with the accumulated juices. Add 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of the water, fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, chili flakes, to taste, and the toasted rice powder;&nbsp;toss to mix well. Add the lemongrass, shallots, mint, cilantro and sawtooth coriander (if using) and toss to combine. Taste and if the flavour is a little too salty, add the remaining water or stock to dilute. Serve immediately with Thai Sticky Rice (see recipe below).
Recipe Tips:
  - To roast hot pepper flakes, place in a dry small skillet and roast over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 1 to 2 minutes or until dark red and fragrant. Immediately transfer to a bowl and let cool. Thai Sticky Rice: Place 1 cup (250 mL) Thai glutinous rice in a bowl, add cold or room temperature water to cover and swish, then drain. Repeat 3 to 4 times until the water runs mostly clear. Add room temperature water to cover rice by about 2 inches (5 cm) and let soak for at least 3 hours, preferably 4, and for up to 12 hours. To cook rice, drain rice well. Place in a traditional bamboo cone steamer or cheesecloth-lined steamer rack and steam over boiling water for 20 to 25 minutes or until tender. Let stand, covered, until serving.
---
Recipe ID: 70aa09dc-cb5a-4d9b-848e-feeed341c594
Recipe Title: Grill-Roasted Potatoes
Recipe Summary: A summer grilled feast wouldn’t be the same without these potatoes. Grilled in foil with aromatic onions and thyme, they roast up flavourful and tender, with a few, extra-tasty crispy edges.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Vegetable oil cooking spray
	- 3 russet potatoes, thinly sliced
	- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter, cut into cubes
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 sprigs fresh thyme
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Spray a single sheet of heavy-duty foil with cooking spray. Add potatoes, onion, olive oil and butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste and toss with your hands to mix. Spread out in an even layer. Top with thyme sprigs and cover with a second sheet of sprayed foil. Crimp edges of foil to make a packet.&nbsp;
	2. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for about 30 minutes, turning packet often, or until potatoes are soft and beginning to crisp up. 
	3. Place foil packet on a heatproof platter. Cut open packet and discard thyme stems. Serve straight from the foil packet.
Recipe Tips:
  - There’s no need to peel the potatoes. Just scrub them well with a soft brush under running water then cut into even, thin slices.
---
Recipe ID: 70fd5df4-9de4-4ec9-b6e8-2f4d6ef3a473
Recipe Title: Beef Liver and Red Pepper Stir-fry
Recipe Summary: Stir-fry recipes are true weeknight heroes since they come together quickly and are packed with flavour. Plus, by pairing an iron-rich animal-protein, like beef liver, with a plant-based source of iron, like fresh spinach, this recipe has an impressive iron punch. Finish the dish with lemon juice to boost iron absorption and perk flavours. Liver is the most delicious when it is still a bit pink inside and is slightly springy to the touch.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 cups (1 L) baby spinach 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH minced garlic and gingerroot
	- 1 red chili pepper, thinly sliced (optional)
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced Beef Liver, about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sodium-reduced soy sauce, divided
	- 2 sweet red peppers, thinly sliced
	- 1 onion, thinly sliced
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) broccoli florets (optional)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- Green onions, thinly sliced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Baby spinach
	- Vegetable oil
	- Garlic
	- 1 red chili pepper (optional)
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced Beef Liver, about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick
	- Sodium-reduced soy sauce
	- 2 sweet red peppers
	- 1 onion
	- Broccoli florets (optional)
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Green onions
	- Gingerroot
Recipe Methods:
	1. Arrange spinach in an even layer on a large shallow platter; set aside. 
	2. Cut liver slices into ½-inch (1 cm) wide strips (similar to steak stir-fry strips). Pat dry with paper towel. 
	3. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook garlic, gingerroot and chili pepper (if using), stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. 
	4. Add liver to skillet. Pan-fry for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Stir in 1 tbsp (15 mL) soy sauce. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until liver is evenly browned on the outside, still slightly pink on the inside and springy to the touch. (Liver is best when cooked to medium doneness, at most.) Spoon liver over the spinach and cover with foil to keep warm. 
	5. Heat remaining oil in the same skillet set over medium-high heat. Add sweet peppers, onion and broccoli (if using). Stir-fry for 5 minutes or until softened. Add lemon juice and remaining soy sauce. Stir-fry for 2 minutes or until vegetables are tender-crisp. 
	6. Return liver with spinach to the skillet. Toss for 1 minute or until spinach is wilted. Garnish with green onion. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Fresh liver should be dark red to maroon and glisten. To properly prepare the liver make sure to remove the thin membrane, arteries and veins.
---
Recipe ID: 716ab931-f777-400b-b2a0-3ec496c69bd4
Recipe Title: Steak and Egg Breakfast Burritos with Pico de Gallo
Recipe Summary: This is an interesting take on traditional steak and eggs for breakfast – a lighter, fresh version that’s terrific for a weekend brunch or breakfast and perfect for cottage-cooking. Any extra Pico de Gallo can be added to a vinaigrette dressing or stirred into mashed avocado for a dip. This recipe was adapted from ChefHayden’s original and modified, as necessary, for home cooks.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 12
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 42
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Pico de Gallo
		- 2 plum tomatoes, finely diced
		- ½ cup (125 mL) finely diced red onion
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely chopped fresh cilantro
		- 1 clove garlic, minced
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) minced jalapeño
		- Juice of 1 lime
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried oregano leaves
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground cumin, toasted
	- Burritos
		- 8 oz (250 g) Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Steak
		- Olive oil
		- Salt and fresh ground pepper
		- 4 eggs
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) finely chopped mixed fresh herbs (parsley, chives, thyme)
		- 2 tbsp (39 mL) unsalted butter, cubed, divided
		- ¾ cup (175 mL) shredded aged white Cheddar cheese
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) julienned red onion
		- 1 cup (250 mL) thinly sliced romaine lettuce
		- Half avocado
		- 2 large flour tortillas
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) hot pepper sauce (approx)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 plum tomatoes
	- Red onion
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Garlic
	- Jalapeño
	- 1 lime
	- Fresh herbs (parsley, chives, thyme)
	- Romaine lettuce
	- Avocado
	- 2 large flour tortillas
	- 8 oz (250 g) Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Steak
	- Olive oil
	- Hot pepper sauce 
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Ground cumin
	- Unsalted butter
	- Aged white Cheddar cheese
	- Eggs
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pico de Gallo: Combine tomatoes, onion, cilantro, garlic, jalapeño, lime juice, oregano and cumin in a bowl. Set aside.
	2. Burritos: Pat steak dry with paper towel and cut across the grain into thin strips. Place in a bowl, drizzle lightly with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to your taste. Toss to combine and set aside.
	3. Whisk eggs in a bowl until blended; whisk in mixed herbs and season with a pinch each of salt and pepper.
	4. Melt 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the butter over medium heat in a nonstick skillet. Add eggs and cook, stirring with a heatproof spatula, for 2 to 3 minutes or until eggs are fluffy, dry and well scrambled. Season with salt to taste. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
	5. Clean pan and return to medium-high heat. Add beef strips and cook for about 1 minute per side or until browned by still pink inside. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate; set aside. Clean the pan again and place on medium-low heat.
	6. Scoop the avocado out of its skin and mash well using a fork; season with salt and pepper to taste.
	7. Gently warm the flour tortillas in the microwave for 30 seconds. (Warming the tortillas makes them easier to roll.)
	8. Place tortillas on a work surface. Arrange beef in a line down the centre, dividing equally between tortillas. Top with scrambled eggs, avocado, cheese, red onion and romaine lettuce. Fold ends over filling and roll up tightly.
	9. Add remaining butter to the skillet and heat until frothy. Add burritos with the seam side down. Cook, pressing down with a heatproof plate, a small skillet or skillet lid and turning once, for about 6 to 10 minutes or until golden brown on both sides. 
	10. Serve toasted burritos with Pico de Gallo and hot pepper sauce, as desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Toasting ground cumin brings out the flavour and adds a deeper taste to the pico de gallo. To toast, place ground cumin in a small, dry skillet and toast over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, for about 1 minute or until slightly darker and fragrant. Immediately transfer to a bowl. Chef Hayden recommends having extra tortillas on hand in case they rip when stuffing and rolling the burritos.
---
Recipe ID: 721937c3-cfea-41a8-93cf-efc89dc68898
Recipe Title: Braised Venezuelan-Style Dark Beef Roast
Recipe Summary: Comforting and so tasty, this Latin-inspired recipe is sure to become a family favourite. Asado Negro translates to dark roast beef that is braised until tender. Our recipe cooks the roast in a mixture of aromatic vegetables with a sweet and tangy caramel-red wine sauce. Fluffy rice with green peas is the perfect accompaniment to soak up all the rich, luscious sauce. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 210
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 230
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) granulated sugar
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) EACH white vinegar and dry red wine
	- 1 Beef Bottom Sirloin Ball Tip Oven Roast (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 Spanish onion, coarsely chopped
	- 1 EACH sweet green and red pepper, coarsely chopped
	- 2 EACH carrots and stalks celery, coarsely chopped
	- 6 cloves garlic, crushed
	- 1 cup (250 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) soy sauce
	- 2 bay leaves
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) coarsely chopped fresh cilantro 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Granulated sugar
	- Packed brown sugar
	- White vinegar
	- 1  Beef Bottom Sirloin Ball Tip Oven Roast (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 Spanish onion
	- Sweet green and red peppers
	- 2 Carrots
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Soy sauce
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Dry red wine
	- 2 stalks celery
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine granulated sugar and brown sugar over medium-high heat; in a heavy-bottom saucepan; pour in 1 cup (250 mL) water and bring to a boil. Boil, without stirring, for 8 to 10 minutes or until sugar has dissolved and mixture turns a dark caramel colour. Carefully pour in the vinegar and wine (it will bubble up); bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring to dissolve caramel, for about 2 minutes or until fragrant. Remove from heat and set aside. 
	2. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Season all over with 1 tsp (5 mL) each salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster; brown beef all over, turning with tongs, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Reduce heat to medium. Cook onion, green and red peppers, carrots, celery and garlic, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in remaining salt and pepper. 
	3. Add broth, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce and bay leaves; bring to boil, stirring and scraping up brown bits from pot. Return meat and any accumulated juices to pot. Pour in reserved caramel mixture. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for about 2½ hours or until fork-tender. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	4. Meanwhile, discard bay leaves. Skim fat from sauce if necessary. Carefully transfer sauce and vegetables to blender or food processor in batches or use immersion blender in the pot; purée until smooth. Return purée to pan; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until thickened. 
	5. Carve roast across the grain into ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices. Nestle beef into sauce; simmer for 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve sprinkled with cilantro. Bring any extra sauce to the table so everyone can help themselves to a little more.  
Recipe Tips:
  - A tight-fitting lid and a heavy pot are essential for best braising.
---
Recipe ID: 72925e0b-0c36-4797-929e-88734f52de7d
Recipe Title: Breaded Leftover Roast Beef Slices with Dijonnaise
Recipe Summary: Prepared with thin slices of cooked roast beef, these cutlets are a tasty way to use up leftovers for the next evening’s meal. Serve with a side of boiled new potatoes and steamed broccoli or on a crusty roll with lettuce, tomato and shaved red onion. You could also make this with raw fast-fry steaks or thicker-cut cooked roast beef, if preferred. Cut the recipe in half if you don’t have a full pound of leftover roast beef. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 eggs
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) seasoned dry bread crumbs
	- 8 slices leftover Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast, ¼ inch (5 mm) thick (about 1 lb/500 g)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) vegetable oil, divided (approx)
	- Dijonnaise
		- ½ cup (125 mL) mayonnaise
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh lemon juice
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 eggs
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) seasoned dry bread crumbs
	- 8 slices leftover  Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast, ¼ inch (5 mm) thick (about 1 lb/500 g)
	- Vegetable oil
	- Mayonnaise
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Lemon
Recipe Methods:
	1. Beat eggs in shallow dish or pie plate. Add bread crumbs to second shallow dish or pie plate. One at a time, dip beef slices in beaten egg and then dredge in bread crumbs until well coated. Discard any excess egg and crumbs.
	 2. Heat half the oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Cook breaded cutlets, in batches and add more oil to the skillet as needed, for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Transfer to a paper-towel lined baking sheet. Keep warm in a preheated 200°F (100°C) oven.
	 3. Dijonnaise: Meanwhile, combine mayonnaise, mustard and lemon juice in a small bowl.
	4. Serve beef cutlets with Dijonnaise. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Tips: For simple oven roast beef, season a 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast all over with coarse salt and freshly ground pepper. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 1¾ to 2¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Serve cutlets and Dijonnaise in buns with lettuce, tomato, onion and Swiss cheese slices for a tasty sandwich version of this recipe. Omit the Dijonnaise and serve with a store-bought garlic aioli, peri-peri sauce or barbecue sauce.
---
Recipe ID: 72a6df32-caf8-43aa-9005-86577d48c7c8
Recipe Title: Grilled Marinated Beef Sandwich with Melted Onions
Recipe Summary: Marinades don’t have to be complicated – just use some ingredients you have on hand from the fridge like barbecue sauce or salad dressing. Melted onions are a sophisticated way to up-scale a simple roast beef sandwich.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 510
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 tbsp (60 mL) Greek or Italian-style vinaigrette salad dressing, divided
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) barbecue sauce
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Outside Round Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Kosher salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 sweet onion, sliced
	- 1 baguette, cut into 4 pieces, halved lengthwise and toasted
	- Arugula
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 tbsp (60 mL) Greek or Italian-style vinaigrette salad dressing, divided
	- Barbecue sauce
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Outside Round Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Kosher salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 sweet onion
	- 1 baguette
	- Arugula
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the salad dressing, barbecue sauce and garlic in a sealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with fork and add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	 2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	3. Meanwhile, pan-fry onion in remaining dressing over medium heat in a skillet, stirring, for about 10 minutes or until soft and golden; set aside.
	 4. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Carve steak across the grain into thin slices; layer onto bottoms of baguettes and top with the fried onions and arugula; top off with baguette tops.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways for best judgement of doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 72bb1f93-7b84-47f9-bd31-2785cadcc856
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak and Potatoes with Bravas-Style Tomatoes
Recipe Summary: Patatas bravas are a traditionally served as tapas in Spain – chunks of crispy fried potato served with a ‘fierce’ (bravas) tomato-based sauce and garlicy aioli. In this version, the Patatas Bravas are served with sliced grilled steak that’s been basted after grilling with a fresh herb rub and, instead of a cooked tomato sauce, this recipe is garnished with smoky wilted grape tomatoes. This would be good with a guacamole as well.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 36
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 66
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Grill-Roasted Patatas 
	- Vegetable oil cooking spray
	- 3 russet potatoes, thinly sliced
	- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 sprigs fresh thyme
	-  Bravas-style Tomatoes 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) kosher salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) smoked paprika
	- 1/8 tsp (0.5 mL) chili powder
	- 12 whole grape tomatoes
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- Cider vinegar
	-  Steak 
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Porterhouse Grilling Steak, about ½ to ¾ inch (1 to 2 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH packed fresh cilantro, basil and parsley leaves
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) anchovy paste
	- Grated zest of ½ lemon
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Olive oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil cooking spray
	- 3 russet potatoes
	- 1 small onion
	- Olive oil
	- Butter
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 sprigs fresh thyme
	- Kosher salt
	- Smoked paprika
	- Chili powder
	- 12 whole grape tomatoes
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Cider vinegar
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Porterhouse Grilling Steak, about ½ to ¾ inch (1 to 2 cm) thick
	- Fresh cilantro
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Anchovy paste
	- Lemons
	- Fresh basil
	- Fresh parsley leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Grill-Roasted Patatas: Spray a single sheet of heavy-duty foil with cooking spray. Add potatoes, onion, olive oil and butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste and toss with your hands to mix. Top with thyme sprigs and cover with a second sheet of sprayed foil. Crimp edges of foil to make a packet. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for about 30 minutes, turning packet often, or until potatoes are soft and beginning to crisp up.
	2. Bravas-style Tomatoes: Meanwhile, combine olive oil, salt, paprika and chili powder in a medium bowl; add tomatoes and toss to coat. Cook over medium-high heat in a nonstick skillet, stirring often, for about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until tomatoes are wilted, about 5 minutes. Finish with splash of vinegar. Set aside.
	3. Steak: Meanwhile, mince cilantro, basil, parsley and garlic together on a cutting board. Add anchovy paste, lemon zest, a squeeze of lemon juice and splash of olive oil. Mix together on the cutting board; set aside. 
	4. Pat steak dry with paper towel. Brush steak with a bit of olive oil and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ to ¾ inch (1 to 2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	5. Transfer steak on the herb mixture on the cutting board, flipping the steak several times to coat with the herb mixture. Let rest for 5 minutes.
	6. To serve, spoon Grill-Roasted Patatas on the plate, carve steak across the grain into very thin slices and arrange on top of potatoes. Top with Bravas-style Tomatoes.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 73093715-38b9-4032-b3be-96b5f6035256
Recipe Title: Big Batch Beef
Recipe Summary: Big Batch Beef is not only a speedy supper solution, it’s a nutrition bonus too – stir in a scoop as an easy way to enrich soups, spaghetti sauces and more. Add in some diced sweet pepper or grated carrot along with the onions and garlic as an easy way to sneak in more veggie content.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Extra-Lean or Lean Ground Beef or Lean Ground Sirloin, Chuck or Round
	-  4 EACH onions and garlic cloves, minced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Extra-Lean or Lean Ground Beef or Lean Ground Sirloin, Chuck or Round
	- 4 EACH onions and garlic cloves
Recipe Methods:
	Cook ground beef in Dutch oven over medium-high heat for 9 to 10 minutes, breaking into small chunks with back of spoon, until browned and completely cooked. Drain, and return to pot. Add onion and garlic simmer for 12 to 15 minutes until vegetables are softened.
	Spread mixture in a single layer on several foil or parchment paper-lined baking trays; freeze just until meat is firm, about 1 hour.
	Loosen beef mixture into chunks; scoop meal-sized portions into freezer bags. Freeze for up to 3 months.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 735d446a-b1a7-48d2-bb08-6b5b6785990e
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Tahini Sauce and Charred Tomatoes
Recipe Summary: Made from toasted sesame seeds, tahini paste is popular in Middle Eastern cuisine. Since it has a rich texture, it is a great accompaniment for a lean cut like Strip Loin Steak. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) EACH ground cumin, chili powder and ground coriander
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) garlic powder
	- 1¼ lb (625 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2 steaks)
	- 12 oz (375 g) cherry tomatoes on the vine, cut into clusters
	- Tahini Sauce
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) tahini paste 
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH fresh lemon juice and olive oil
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) liquid honey
		- 1 clove garlic, minced
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) toasted sesame seeds
		- Lemon wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Ground cumin
	- Chili powder
	- Ground coriander
	- Garlic powder
	- 1¼ lb (625 g)  Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak,  1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2 steaks)
	- 12 oz (375 g) cherry tomatoes on the vine
	- Tahini paste
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Liquid honey
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Fresh parsley
	- Toasted sesame seeds
	- Lemon wedges
	- Olive oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine salt, pepper, cumin, chili powder, coriander and garlic powder in a small bowl. Transfer 1 tsp (5 mL) to another small bowl for the Tahini Sauce. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; rub steaks all over with remaining spice mixture.
	2. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Grill tomatoes during the last 3 to 5 minutes of steak grilling time, until softened and lightly charred.
	3. Transfer steaks to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Transfer tomatoes to a warmed serving platter.
	Tahini Sauce: : 
		4. Meanwhile, add tahini paste, lemon juice, olive oil, honey, garlic and 3 tbsp (45 mL) water to reserved spice mixture; whisk until smooth and blended. 
		5. Slice steaks across the grain. Arrange steak on serving platter with charred tomatoes; sprinkle beef with parsley and sesame seeds. Serve with Tahini Sauce and lemon wedges. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute Tahini Sauce with prepared tzatziki sauce for a quick variation.
---
Recipe ID: 746f9137-7980-4000-ac98-3701c36adcec
Recipe Title: Barbecued Carne Asada-Style Beef with Corn Salsa
Recipe Summary: Understood literally as grilled beef, Carne Asada is practically a Mexican staple typically made with Top Sirloin Cap Roast (known as Picanha). This rendition is simple, with a bold sauce and a fresh corn salsa to accessorize. Find dried ancho chili powder in the spice section of major grocers.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 60
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 90
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) steak sauce (approx)
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground coriander, cumin and oregano
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground ancho, chipotle or regular chili powder
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Oven Roast (Picanha)
	-  Fresh Corn Salsa 
	- 1 cob corn, husked
	- ½ sweet red pepper, seeded
	- ½ sweet onion, sliced in thick rounds
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) black beans, drained and rinsed
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) chopped fresh cilantro
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH olive oil and fresh lime juice
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Steak sauce
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Ground coriander
	- Ground ancho
	- Salt
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Top Sirloin Cap Oven Roast (Picanha)
	- 1 cob corn
	- Sweet red pepper, seeded
	- Sweet onion
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) black beans
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Olive oil
	- Cumin
	- Oregano
	- Chipotle or regular chili powder
	- Fresh lime juice
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine ¼ cup (60 mL) steak sauce, garlic, coriander, cumin, oregano, chili, salt and 1 tbsp (15 mL) water in a small bowl; pour half into large resealable freezer bag, reserving the remainder as basting sauce. Pierce beef all over with fork; add to bag, massaging to coat; seal and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 48 hours.
	2. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Insert oven-safe thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on greased grill over medium-high heat (400°F); close lid and cook, turning occasionally and basting with reserved sauce, for 15 to 20 minutes for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). (NOTE: Move roast to cooler part of grill if it begins to overbrown.)
	3. Fresh Corn Salsa : Meanwhile, add corn, red pepper and onion to grill and cook with lid closed over medium-high heat for 10 to 15 minutes or until tender and slightly charred, 10 to 15 minutes. Cut corn kernels off cob into bowl. Dice red pepper and onion; add to corn. Stir in black beans, cilantro, oil, lime juice and salt.
	 4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for about 10 minutes. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices. Serve with Fresh Corn Salsa and some extra steak sauce for dipping. 
Recipe Tips:
  - When buying a beef oven roast, buy 12 oz (375 g) beef per person for bone-in-roasts or for boneless roasts, buy 6 to 8 oz (175 to 250 g) beef per person.
---
Recipe ID: 75ef4475-db8f-47ad-8bb8-0a2a54b5c913
Recipe Title: Cheesy Beef & Lentil Pasta Bake with Roasted Veg
Recipe Summary: Healthy AND delicious come together in this baked pasta dish inspired by the cuisine of Northern Italy. A beefy tomato sauce studded with plenty of roasted vegetables and fibre-rich lentils enrobes whole-grain noodles. Topped with creamy ricotta cheese, this recipe is perfect for serving a hungry crowd.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 70
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 90
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp olive oil
	- 1 onion, chopped
	- 1 carrot, scrubbed well and diced or grated
	- 1 stalk celery, diced
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 lb (500 g) lean ground beef
	- 1 tbsp dried Italian herb seasoning
	- 1½ tsp salt
	- ¾ cup red or white wine
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) crushed tomatoes
	- ½ cup dry green or brown lentils, picked over and rinsed
	- 12 fresh basil leaves, chopped
	- 2 tbsp olive oil
	- 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
	- 1 tbsp dried Italian herb seasoning
	- ½ tsp EACH salt and freshly ground black pepper
	- 2 zucchini, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks (about 3 cups)
	- 1 large red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
	- ½ medium eggplant, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks, unpeeled (about 3 cups)
	- 1 lb whole-grain penne
	- 1½ cups shredded mozzarella cheese
	- ¾ cup whole milk ricotta cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Onion
	- Carrot
	- Celery
	- Garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g) lean ground beef
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- Red or white wine
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) crushed tomatoes
	- Dry green or brown lentils
	- Fresh basil leaves
	- Olive oil
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- Salt and freshly ground black pepper
	- 2 zucchini
	- 1 large red bell pepper
	- Medium eggplant
	- 1 lb whole-grain penne
	- Shredded mozzarella cheese
	- Whole milk ricotta cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Bolognese Sauce: Heat oil in a Dutch oven or large saucepan set over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, celery and garlic. Cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until softened. Increase heat to medium-high and crumble in beef; sprinkle with herb seasoning and salt. 
	2. Cook, stirring often and breaking up with a spoon, for 5 minutes or until browned (do not drain). Add wine; cook for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes, lentils and 2 cups water.
	3. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer sauce, partially covered and stirring occasionally, for 35 to 40 minutes or until thickened and lentils are cooked through. Remove from heat; stir in basil.
	4. Roasted Vegetables: Meanwhile, preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl, whisk oil with garlic, herb seasoning, salt and pepper; toss to coat with zucchini, bell pepper and eggplant. Transfer to prepared baking sheet; roast vegetables, tossing once, for 15 to 20 minutes or until softened.
	5. Pasta: Prepare penne according to package directions; drain and return to pot with the prepared sauce and roasted vegetables. Gently toss to combine and transfer to a (3.5 L) deep, ovenproof baking dish (round/rectangle). Top with mozzarella and dollops of ricotta. Tent loosely with foil. Reduce oven temperature to 375°F (190°C). Bake pasta dish for 20 to 25 minutes or until gooey and bubbling on top. Let stand for 5 minutes before servi
Recipe Tips:
  - Customize the combination of vegetables to suit your family’s preferences. Try mushrooms, cauliflower, broccoli or Brussels sprouts.
  - Add a pinch or two of hot pepper flakes to the sauce for a spicy version.
  - Short cut this recipe by using some prepared ingredient to get this dish on the table in less than an hour. Brown the beef and simmer with wine, then stir in 3½ cups prepared marinara sauce. Add 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) drained lentils; simmer for 10 minutes. Toss with roasted vegetables and spoon over cooked noodles. Skip the mozzarella and dollop with ricotta to serve.
---
Recipe ID: 7615fa66-3624-4acd-97fe-c15951bebde5
Recipe Title: Surf and Turf Grilled Beef Burger
Recipe Summary: This is a budget-wise version of the steak-house classic. Lean Beef burgers deliver an excellent source of protein, zinc and vitamin B12 – not to mention flavour!
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) steak sauce
	- 1 small onion, finely chopped
	- 1 egg
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) minced fresh dill, divided
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) dry bread crumbs
	- Shrimp Salsa
	- 1 cup (250 mL) cooked shrimp, shells and tails removed, deveined
	- 3 radishes, thinly sliced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH mayonnaise and seafood cocktail sauce
	- 4 Hamburger buns
	- Optional garnish: mayonnaise, minced fresh dill, lettuce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Steak sauce
	- 1 small onion
	- 1 egg
	- Fresh dill
	- Salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Dry bread crumbs
	- Cooked shrimp, shells and tails removed, deveined
	- 3 radishes
	- Mayonnaise
	- Seafood cocktail sauce
	- 4 Hamburger buns
	- Optional garnish: mayonnaise, minced fresh dill, lettuce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine steak sauce, onion, egg, 3 tbsp (45 mL) fresh dill and salt in a bowl with a fork. Mix in beef and bread crumbs. Gently form into four 3/4-inch (2 cm) thick patties. Press a dimple into the centre of each patty. Place on a plate, cover and refrigerate for 15 minutes.
	2. Shrimp Salsa: Meanwhile, chop the shrimp. Combine shrimp with radishes, mayonnaise, cocktail sauce and remaining fresh dill in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate.
	3. Grill patties over medium-high heat in a closed preheated barbecue for 10 to 14 minutes, turning twice, until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each patty reads 160°F (71°C). 
	4. If desired, spread some additional mayonnaise on each bun and garnish with fresh dill. Top with burgers and lettuce (if using). Top each with Shrimp Salsa.
Recipe Tips:
  - Ground beef is 100% beef with no additives, fillers or colours.
---
Recipe ID: 76d3f826-d39c-4c0e-ba12-d764894e3034
Recipe Title: Slow-Cooker Simmering Beef Goulash
Recipe Summary: Serve this hearty dish with a dollop of sour cream, if you like, and steaming hot egg noodles or mashed potatoes.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 510
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 525
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Simmering Steaks, cut in 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 onions, cut lengthwise into eighths
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) dry red wine
	- 1 cup (250 mL) bottled chili sauce
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) paprika
	- Chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- All-purpose flour
	- Salt and pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Simmering Steaks, cut in 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 onions
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Dry red wine
	- Bottled chili sauce
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- Paprika
	- Fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine flour, salt and pepper in minimum 5-qt (5 L) slow cooker. Add beef and toss to coat. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in large skillet; brown seasoned meat, in 4 batches and adding more oil as needed, for about 8 to 10 minutes, turning until browned on all sides. Return meat to slow cooker. 
	2. Add remaining oil to skillet. Cook onions, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes, until starting to soften; add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute, until softened. Add wine and bring to a boil, scraping up brown bits from bottom of pan. Pour over beef; stir in chili sauce, tomatoes and paprika.
	3. Cover and cook on LOW for 8 to 10 hours or on HIGH for 4 to 6 hours, until meat is fork-tender. Serve sprinkled with parsley, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Beef stews are great for entertaining since they can be made a day ahead. Cool cover and refrigerate overnight, then gently reheat in the slow cooker or oven until steaming.
---
Recipe ID: 7729338c-03f1-4958-9425-b93311306610
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef and Red Pepper Skewers with Honey Glaze
Recipe Summary: Super kid-friendly, and equally satisfying for adults, these sweet and tangy beef skewers get grilled with a chili-cumin seasoning and brushed with a honey-lime glaze. Try this same combination on grilled steaks or roasts as well. Serve skewers with tzatziki, hummus, honey mustard or sweet barbecue sauce for dipping. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 23
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 long or 8 medium bamboo skewers, soaked for 30 minutes
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH liquid honey and fresh lime juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chili powder
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) ground cumin 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH garlic powder, salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 sweet red peppers, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks (about 28 pieces)
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 long or 8 medium bamboo skewers
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak,  1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Liquid honey
	- Olive oil
	- Chili powder
	- Ground cumin
	- Garlic powder
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 sweet red peppers
	- Lime wedges
	- Fresh lime juice
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut steak into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes (about 28 pieces). Pat beef dry with paper towel; set aside.
	2. Combine honey with lime juice in a small bowl; set aside for basting. 
	 3. Combine oil, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add beef cubes and red pepper chunks; stir until well coated. Thread evenly onto the skewers, alternating beef and red pepper chunks.
	4. Grill skewers in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides and basting with honey-lime glaze during the last 2 minutes of cooking, or until peppers are tender and beef is cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	 5. Serve skewers with lime wedges. 
Recipe Tips:
  - This versatile recipe can be served over rice, salad greens, power bowls or removed from skewers and used as a filling for tacos, burritos or quesadillas.
---
Recipe ID: 77528535-88ab-487e-a848-7e2f327813bb
Recipe Title: Oven Roast Beef with Simple Red Wine Pan Sauce
Recipe Summary: Everyone needs a roast beef and sauce recipe in their repertoire – if you’re looking for classic, this is it! Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 4½-in (11.25 cm) long x 5-in (12.5 cm) wide x 4¼-in (10.5 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 165
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 175
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Coarse sea salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Rib Eye Oven Roast
	- 6 to 8 cloves garlic, smashed
	- 1 to 2 shallots, chopped
	- 3 to 4 sprigs fresh thyme (or ½ tsp dried thyme leaves)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) red wine
	- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Coarse sea salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Rib Eye Oven Roast
	- 6 to 8 cloves garlic
	- 1 to 2 shallots
	- 3 to 4 sprigs fresh thyme (or ½ tsp dried thyme leaves)
	- Red wine
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rub salt and pepper all over roast to your taste. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: see ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	2. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before carving. 
	3. Meanwhile, skim off all but 2 tbsp (30 mL) fat from drippings from roasting pan. Heat pan drippings in roasting pan over medium-high heat on stove-top. Add garlic and shallots, to taste; cook, stirring, for about 1 to 2 minutes or until softened. Add thyme and red wine to pan; bring to a boil stirring and scraping up any brown bits from pan; reduce heat and simmer until wine is almost cooked dry. Add broth and boil gently, stirring often, for about 20 minutes or until reduced by about half. Gradually whisk in cornstarch mixture and boil, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened. Discard thyme stems. Mash garlic into sauce, if desired, or discard. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a gravy boat and serve with roast.
Recipe Tips:
  - When oven-roasting roast beef, roast without a lid for best browning.
---
Recipe ID: 77c5fd6e-4f4c-4180-9341-e8b279731b99
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef Burgers with Teriyaki Topper
