Recipe Summary: Grilling pineapple helps to emphasize its sweetness and teriyaki sauce is the perfect match to tie beef and pineapple together! The crunchy bean sprouts take the place of the lettuce as the standard burger topper.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sesame seeds
	- 1/2 cup (125 mL) Sriracha mayonnaise
	- 1 green onion, minced
	- 4 sesame hamburger buns, split
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Patties
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) teriyaki sauce
	- 4 pineapple slices
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) bean sprouts
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Sesame seeds
	- Sriracha mayonnaise
	- 1 green onion
	- 4 sesame hamburger buns, split
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Patties
	- Teriyaki sauce
	- Pineapple slices
	- Bean sprouts
Recipe Methods:
	1. Toast sesame seeds in a small nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, for 3 minutes or until lightly browned; transfer to a shallow dish and set aside. 
	 2. Combine mayonnaise with green onion in small bowl; spread about 1 tbsp (15 mL) onto cut surfaces of each bun; set aside.
	3. Grill patties on a lightly oiled grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 10 to 14 minutes for ¾-inch (2 cm) thick patties, turning twice or more or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each patty reads 160°F (71°C).
	4. Meanwhile, grill pineapple slices, turning frequently, and cut surfaces of buns for 1 to 2 minutes, until pineapple is grill-marked and buns are just lightly toasted.
	5. Brush each cooked patty all over with teriyaki sauce and flip each once or twice in the toasted sesame seeds to lightly coat. Top each bun with a patty, grilled pineapple slice and some bean sprouts. Top each with more siracha mayonnaise mixture, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Use a digital instant-read thermometer as the most reliable way to determine that ground beef patties are cooked to the proper doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 78036f04-d343-45dc-bd7e-9b4f2aae9ee3
Recipe Title: Slow Cooker Braised Beef Sandwiches with Pickled Veg
Recipe Summary: This recipe can be easily doubled if you’re serving a crowd. The Quick Giardinera recipe makes more than needed and it’s delicious served with cold cuts or cheese and perfect on charcuterie trays. If you prefer, you can use ½ cup (125 mL) store-bought giardinera instead of making your own.
Recipe Prep Time: 40
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 380
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 420
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 whole small-sized Beef Digital Flexor Meat (EACH about 10 to 12 oz/300 to 375 g)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) finely diced onion
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced 
	- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) dry red wine
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH dried oregano and dried basil
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) dried thyme
	- Pinch hot pepper flakes
	- Four 6-inch (15 cm) crusty torpedo rolls, split
	- Butter, softened
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded provolone or other melting cheese 
	-  Quick Giardinera 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) white vinegar
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt, divided
	- 2 cups (500 mL) tiny cauliflower florets (about ½-inch/1 cm pieces) 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) thinly sliced carrots
	- ½ cup (125 mL) thinly sliced celery
	- 2 serrano chili peppers
	- ½ cup (125 mL) diced sweet red pepper 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) dried oregano
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) pitted green olives, thinly sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 whole small-sized  Beef Digital Flexor Meat  (EACH about 10 to 12 oz/300 to 375 g)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onions
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth
	- Dry red wine
	- Dried oregano
	- Dried basil
	- Dried thyme
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Four 6-inch (15 cm) crusty torpedo rolls, split
	- Butter
	- Shredded provolone or other melting cheese
	- White vinegar
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Tiny cauliflower florets (about ½-inch/1 cm pieces)
	- Carrots
	- Celery
	- 2 serrano chili peppers
	- Sweet red pepper
	- Dried oregano
	- Pitted green olives
	- Olive oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Slice the meat in half lengthwise and cut each piece in half crosswise. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add meat, in batches as necessary, and cook, turning with tongs, until browned on all sides. Transfer to a minimum 4-qt (4 L) slow cooker. 
	2. Add onions and garlic to the pan; cook, stirring, for about 2 to 3 minutes or until the onions soften and lightly brown. Add to the beef. Stir broth, red wine, oregano, basil, thyme, hot pepper flakes and ½ tsp (2 mL) salt into slow cooker.
	3. Cook on HIGH for 6 hours, until beef is falling-apart tender and the liquid reduced to about one-thirds. Crush the beef with a spoon and adjust the seasoning with salt. Keep warm.
	4. Quick Giardinera : Meanwhile, combine the vinegar, bay leaf, ½ tsp (2 mL) salt and 1 cup (250mL) water in a nonreactive saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add cauliflower, carrots, celery, chili peppers to your taste and red pepper and return to a boil; reduce heat and boil gently for 3 to 4 minutes or until the cauliflower is barely tender. Drain vegetables and return to saucepan, reserving 3 tbsp (45 mL) of the cooking liquid. Add reserved liquid, remaining salt, oregano, olives and olive oil to vegetables and toss to coat. Transfer to a jar or airtight container and refrigerate until chilled. (Make Ahead: Store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.) 
	5. Arrange rolls on a rimmed baking sheet with the cut sides up. Toast under preheated broiler until golden. Butter and sprinkle both cut sides with cheese. Broil until cheese is melted. Spoon the meat into the buns and tuck a spoonful of giardinera into each. Serve immediately with extra giardinera on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - To oven-braise instead of using the slow cooker: Brown meat as in Step 1 using a Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster instead of a skillet. Transfer meat to a platter; cook onions and garlic as in step 2, adding broth and seasonings to pan after browning. Return meat to Dutch oven, cover with tight fitting lid and transfer to a preheated 325°F (160°C) oven to braise until meat is fall-apart tender, about 1½ to 2 hours.
---
Recipe ID: 780ae686-3657-4b54-98ef-8d4446950191
Recipe Title: Beef Satay (Neua Satay) 
Recipe Summary: Satay is ubiquitous in Thailand—you can find it as street food, or even as an appetizer in a sit-down restaurant. When I was a kid, we frequented a neighborhood restaurant that sold mostly noodles, but the satay and peanut sauce was their specialty appetizer. The satay was always the highlight of the meal for me, more so than the noodles! While most satays in Thailand are made from pork nowadays, the original satay came to Thailand as beef, because it originated from Indonesia, a primarily Muslim country that does not eat much pork. This slowly changed to pork because in Thailand pork is more accessible.  Our satay is always served with white toast and ajaad, a quick cucumber pickle that serves as a crunchy, fresh and acidic element to balance the richness of the peanut sauce. The toast is there to sop up any extra peanut sauce left at the end, and it’s my favourite part of satay! 
Recipe Prep Time: 35
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 75
Recipe Marinating Time: 60
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 170
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Satay
		- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) coconut milk
		- Twelve to fourteen 6-inch (15 cm) bamboo skewers
		- 4 slices white bread
	- Marinade
		- 1½ tsp (7 mL) coriander seeds, toasted
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) cumin seeds, toasted
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) black peppercorns
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) thinly sliced lemongrass (bottom part only)
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped galangal (optional)
		- 1-inch (2.5 cm) piece fresh turmeric (or ½ tsp/2 mL ground turmeric) 
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) brown sugar
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground cinnamon
		- ⅔ cup (150 mL) coconut milk
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) white vinegar
	- Peanut Sauce
		- ½ cup (150 mL) roasted peanuts
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) toasted white sesame seeds
		- 1¼ cups (300 mL) coconut milk, divided
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Thai red curry paste
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped palm sugar or brown sugar (approx)
		- 2 to 3 tbsp (30 to 45 mL) tamarind paste
		- 1 to 2 tsp (5 to 10 mL) fish sauce
	- Ajaad
		- ½ cup (125 mL) white vinegar
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) granulated sugar
		- ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) salt
		- ½ cup (125 mL) sliced quartered cucumber
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) thinly sliced shallot
		- 8 to 10 slices Thai chili peppers or jalapeños
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Lemongrass
	- Galangal (optional)
	- Fresh turmeric (or ground turmeric)
	- Cucumber
	- Shallots
	- Thai chili peppers or jalapeños
	- White bread
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak
	- 2¼ cups (560 mL) coconut milk (approx)
	- Thai red curry paste
	- Tamarind paste
	- Fish sauce
	- Coriander seeds
	- Cumin seeds
	- Black peppercorns
	- Ground cinnamon
	- White vinegar
	- Palm sugar or brown sugar
	- Brown sugar
	- Granulated sugar
	- Salt
	- Roasted peanuts
	- White sesame seeds
	- Twelve to fourteen 6-inch (15 cm) bamboo skewers
Recipe Methods:
	Cut the beef across the grain into ¼-inch (0.5 cm) thick slices, then cut each slice crosswise into small, bite-sized pieces. Place in a bowl and set aside.
	Marinade: 
		Grind coriander seeds, cumin seeds and black peppercorns using a mortar and pestle until very fine. Add lemongrass, galangal (if using) and fresh turmeric (if using); pound into a fine paste. Add ground turmeric (if using), brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, coconut milk and vinegar; stir to mix well.
		Pour marinade over beef and massage it with your hands, making sure that no pieces of meat are stuck together. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to overnight. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	Peanut Sauce: 
		Meanwhile, grind peanuts and sesame seeds in a food processor or using a mortar and pestle into a fine meal, being careful not to over grind them into nut butter. Set aside.
		Bring ¼ cup (60 mL) of the coconut milk to a boil over medium heat in a small saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in red curry paste, mixing well. Simmer for about 2 minutes, stirring, until it is very thick and coconut oil starts to separate from the paste.&nbsp;Stir in remaining coconut milk, ground peanuts and sesame seeds, palm sugar, 2 tbsp (30 mL) tamarind paste and 1 tsp (5 mL) fish sauce. Simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring often, until thickened into a dip-like consistency. Remove from heat. Taste and adjust seasoning with more sugar, fish sauce and tamarind paste as needed. Set aside.
	Ajadd: 
		Combine vinegar, sugar and salt in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring, just until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool completely.&nbsp;
		Remove beef from marinade; discard marinade. Skewer 3 pieces of beef onto each of the soaked skewers, making sure the skewer goes through the beef so the bamboo isn’t exposed and making sure tip of the skewer also is covered with beef. Place flat on a plate.&nbsp;
		Just before cooking the skewers, combine cucumber, shallot and chilies in a small bowl, then pour in cooled vinegar mixture over to make the Ajaad. Let stand for up to 10 minutes at the most.
		Cut 2 pieces of foil, each 8 inches (20 cm) wide. Fold each in half lengthwise so that you have a long rectangle about 4 inches (10 cm) wide. Place onto the grill to act as guards to prevent the handles of the skewers from burning. Brush the top side of skewers with coconut milk. Place the brushed side down on an oiled preheated grill over medium heat (350°F/180°C) with the handle of skewers resting on foil. Grill for about 1 minute or until grill marked while brushing the top side of the skewers with remaining coconut milk. Flip the skewers and grill for about 2 to 3 minutes or until cooked to medium-rare at the least (145°F/63°C). Meanwhile, if you have space on the grill, grill bread until toasted on both sides or transfer skewers to a clean plate and grill bread.
		Serve the Satay on a platter alongside the Peanut Sauce, Ajaad and toast.
Recipe Tips:
  - For the ajaad, combine the cucumber with the pickling liquid no longer than about 10 minutes before serving to preserve the crunch and freshness of the cucumber.
---
Recipe ID: 78846b3e-9d2f-4cfc-82b8-91e8e281d574
Recipe Title: Grilled Sake and Teriyaki-Marinated Beef
Recipe Summary: Sake &amp; Teriyaki is more than just a cute title – it’s a delicious flavour combo that works really well with bold beefy cuts like short ribs!
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 508
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Grilling Short Ribs (thin-cut Maui/Korean-style)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) teriyaki sauce, divided 
	- ½ cup (125 mL) sake or mirin 
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced 
	- 5 tsp (25 mL) finely grated gingerroot, divided 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) mayonnaise
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) sesame oil 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Grilling Short Ribs  (thin-cut Maui/Korean-style)
	- Teriyaki sauce
	- Sake or mirin
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- Mayonnaise
	- Sesame oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine ¾ cup (175 mL) of the teriyaki sauce, sake, garlic and 4 tsp (20 mL) of the gingerroot in a large sealable freezer bag. Pierce short ribs all over with a fork. Add ribs to bag, massaging to coat; seal and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or up to 24 hours. 
	2. Meanwhile, whisk together mayonnaise, the remaining ¼ cup (60 mL) teriyaki sauce, 1 tsp (5 mL) gingerroot and the sesame oil in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. 
	3. Discard marinade from ribs. Pat ribs dry with paper towel. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning twice or more or until cooked to medium-rare doneness (145°F/63°C) at the most. Serve ribs with the mayonnaise mixture alongside for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - To complete this meal, serve the ribs with steamed rice and a colourful vegetable stir-fry of sweet red peppers, snow peas, carrots, baby corn and sliced water chestnuts.
---
Recipe ID: 78d61ba5-8bf0-4c5a-8550-6e0805bbc3c5
Recipe Title: Baked Souvlaki-Style Beef Meatballs with Vegetable Sauté
Recipe Summary: Studded with crumbled feta, these meatballs are extra tasty! Serve with the Greek-inspired stir-fry and a drizzle of your favourite creamy Greek salad dressing.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 egg
	- 1 small onion, finely chopped
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried oregano leaves
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh or dried bread crumbs
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) crumbled feta cheese (optional)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Regular Ground Beef
	- Vegetable Sauté
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
		- 2 onions, cut into lengthwise wedges
		- 2 sweet yellow peppers, seeded and thinly sliced
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH dried oregano leaves, salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 egg
	- 3 onions
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Salt and pepper
	- Fresh or dried bread crumbs
	- Crumbled feta cheese (optional)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Regular Ground Beef
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 sweet yellow peppers, seeded
Recipe Methods:
	1. Beat egg, onion, oregano, salt and pepper with a fork in a large bowl; blend in bread crumbs and feta cheese (if using). Gently mix in ground beef (don't over-mix). Scoop about 1 heaping tablespoonfuls (15 mL) and shape into meatballs.
	2. Place on rack on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet and bake in preheated 375°F oven for about 15 minutes or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several meatballs reads 160°F (71°C).
	3. Greek Vegetable Sauté: Meanwhile, heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add onions, yellow peppers, oregano, salt and pepper; cook, stirring, for about 8 minutes or until vegetables are softened and slightly golden.
	 4. Serve meatballs with Greek Vegetable Sauté. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Ground beef is 100% beef with no additives, fillers or colours.
---
Recipe ID: 7922b2ee-13ca-404d-be92-36567b641fe5
Recipe Title: Grilled Lime-Marinated Beef Tostada Salad
Recipe Summary: With lean grilled beef and market-fresh veggies, this crispy crunchy main-course salad has all the satisfaction of a nacho platter with a fraction of the fat and a BIG boost of nutrients. Using oven-toasted whole wheat flour tortillas as the tostada base is a healthier choice than traditional fried corn tortillas. When cooking the corn and tomatoes, heat just enough to combine and develop their flavours.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 65
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Marinade/Dressing
		- 4 large cloves garlic, minced
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) grated lime zest
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh lime juice (about 2 limes)
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced fresh cilantro or parsley
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chili powder
		- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Flap Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
		- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Tostadas
		- 8 small (7-inch/18 cm) whole wheat flour tortillas
		- Vegetable oil cooking spray
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) vegetable oil, divided
		- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped red onion
		- 2 cloves garlic, minced
		- 2 cups (500 mL) EACH quartered mushrooms and grape tomatoes, halved
		- 2 cups (500 mL) fresh or frozen corn kernels, thawed
		- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded lettuce
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced fresh cilantro or parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 large cloves garlic
	- 2 limes
	- Fresh cilantro or parsley
	- Chili powder
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Flap Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 8 small (7-inch/18 cm) whole wheat flour tortillas
	- Vegetable oil cooking spray
	- Vegetable oil
	- Red onion
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Quartered mushrooms
	- Grape tomatoes
	- Fresh or frozen corn kernels
	- Lettuce
Recipe Methods:
	Marinade/Dressing: : 
		1. Combine garlic, lime zest and juice, cilantro and chili powder in a small bowl. Transfer 3 tbsp (45 mL) to a large bowl and set aside for dressing. Place steaks on a plate and brush all over with remaining marinade; cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or for up to 4 hours.
	Tostadas: : 
		2. Meanwhile, spray both sides of tortillas with cooking spray; place in single layer on baking sheet. Bake in preheated 350°F oven for 10 minutes or until crisp and lightly browned. Set aside.
		3. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. 
		4. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
		5. Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil over medium-high heat in large skillet. Add onion and garlic; cook, stirring, for about 4 minutes or until onion is softened. Add mushrooms; cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until all liquid is released. Reduce heat to medium; add tomatoes and corn. Cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes or just until softened. Remove from heat.
		6. Whisk remaining oil into reserved marinade to complete the dressing. Cut steak across the grain into thinly slices; add to dressing along with mushroom mixture, lettuce and cilantro, tossing gently to coat. Pile beef mixture on top of tortillas, dividing equally, to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital read instant thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 79dca9b0-b843-4284-8545-6e5ad3e851db
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Bahamian Corned Beef 
Recipe Summary: This unpretentious sumptuous dish, is often called Fire Engine as the vibrant colours are reminiscent of those of a fire truck) The dish is traditionally made with canned corned beef in the islands, but in this case, my recipe takes fresh corned beef brisket instead, taking it to the next level! The corned beef is cooked, shredded coarsely and sautéed with herbs, spices, and tomatoes for brightness. Traditionally this dish is served with steamed white rice and slices of ripe avocado. As a kid it was one of my favourite breakfast (when paired with white corn grits), as well as a quick weeknight dinner.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 63
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 88
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Corned Beef Brisket
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil
	- 1 white or yellow flesh potato, cubed
	- Half onion, sliced
	- Half sweet green pepper, diced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) tomato paste
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) canned diced tomatoes
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) ketchup
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) vegetable broth or water
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Caribbean hot pepper sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh thyme leaves
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground black pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Corned Beef Brisket
	- Olive oil
	- 1 white or yellow flesh potato
	- Half onion, sliced
	- Half sweet green pepper, diced
	- Tomato paste
	- Canned diced tomatoes
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Ketchup
	- Vegetable broth or water
	- Caribbean hot pepper sauce
	- Fresh thyme leaves
	- Ground black pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut brisket into 2-inch (5 cm) cubes. Place in a stovetop pressure cooker pot. Cook according to manufacturer’s instructions for 30 minutes or until fork tender. Remove from heat and place in the sink. Run cold water over pressure cooker until cool enough to open. Transfer beef to a bowl, discarding liquid. Let cool for about 10 minutes. NOTE: follow the manufacturers’ instructions on how to cook if using an electric pressure cooker.
	2. Transfer beef to a food processor, in batches, and pulse until coarsely shredded. Transfer to another bowl; repeat with remaining cubes of beef. Set aside.
	3. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Cook potatoes, stirring often, for 10 minutes until al dente (potatoes should be cooked but still firm). Add onions and cook, stirring for 3 minutes or until translucent. Add green pepper and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Add tomato paste, cook, stirring, for 3 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, broth and pepper sauce. 
	4. Stir in shredded beef, increase heat to high and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. Stir in thyme and pepper; season with salt to taste if necessary. Cook, without stirring, for 5 minutes or until bottom of beef is crispy like a paella.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 7a10e6b2-f1a9-4ab7-8452-75368c5837ed
Recipe Title: Beef Honeycomb Tripe Braised with Pancetta and Cannellini Beans
Recipe Summary: A much beloved dish in Rome, this stew is delicious served either with or without the cannellini beans. While the tripe is simmering, prepare the rest of the ingredients for efficiency. Instead of stove-top simmering, use an electric pressure cooker to cook the tripe to save time (see Tip, below). Bread is a must with this dish.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 225
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 245
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Honeycomb Tripe 
	- Salt
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 2 oz (60 g) pancetta, finely diced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) finely diced onion
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH finely diced carrot and celery
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- Pinch hot pepper flakes (approx.)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) dry white wine
	- 1 jar (630 mL) strained tomatoes (passata) 
	- 3 cups (750 mL) beef broth
	- 1 piece Parmesan or Pecorino Romano cheese rind (optional)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 1 can (14 oz/400 mL) cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
	- ½ cup (125 mL) freshly grated Parmesan or Pecorino Romano cheese
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) coarsely chopped fresh mint
	- Crusty bread
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Honeycomb Tripe 
	- Salt
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- 2 oz (60 g) pancetta
	- Onions
	- Carrot
	- Celery
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Dry white wine
	- 1 jar (630 mL) strained tomatoes (passata) 
	- Beef broth
	- 1 piece Parmesan or Pecorino Romano cheese rind (optional)
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 1 can (14 oz/400 mL) cannellini beans
	- Parmesan or Pecorino Romano cheese
	- Fresh mint
	- Crusty bread
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rinse the tripe under cold water. Cut the tripe into pieces 1 inch (2.5 cm) wide and 4 inches (10 cm) long. Place in a large deep pot and add 8 cups (2 L) water and 1 tsp (5 mL) salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 2½ hours until the tripe is tender and just slightly chewy. Drain, discarding the cooking liquid. 
	2. Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in a large saucepan. Add pancetta and cook, stirring, until the fat is released. Add onion, carrot, celery and garlic; cook, stirring, for about 4 to 5 minutes or until the onion is soft but not brown. Stir in wine and hot pepper flakes; simmer until liquid is reduced by half. Stir in tomato purée, beef stock, Parmesan rind (if using), pepper and ½ tsp (2 mL) salt. Remove from the heat; set aside.
	3. Stir tripe into the sauce. Bring to a simmer; reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour, adding water if the sauce becomes too thick, or until tripe is very tender. Season with salt and hot pepper flakes to taste. Stir in cannellini beans and heat through. Serve garnished with mint and sprinkled with the cheese. Serve bread on the side for dipping into the sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - To cook the tripe in an electric pressure cooker, use 4 cups (1 L) water instead of 8 cups (2 L). Seal the lid on the pot making sure the vent is closed. Set pressure to High and timer for 1 hour. When the timer beeps, quick release the pressure. Proceed with the rest of the recipe.
---
Recipe ID: 7a2b9e53-27d2-46cc-9c00-e07a87b43a64
Recipe Title: Classic Oven Roast Beef with Rosemary Cream Sauce
Recipe Summary: Roast beef is so simple (and impressive) for entertaining – just season (simply), oven-sear and slow-roast for best results. Use a meat thermometer to cook your roast to the doneness that you like the best – without overcooking it! Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 8½-in (21 cm) long x 4½-in (11 cm) wide x 3½-in (9 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 145
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 160
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- Salt and coarsely ground pepper
	- 1 head garlic
	- Rosemary Cream Sauce
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH olive oil and butter
		- 1 shallot, minced
		- 1 cup (250 mL) beef or chicken broth
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) dry white wine
		- ½ sprig fresh rosemary
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) whipping cream
		- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast
	- Olive oil
	- Salt and coarsely ground pepper
	- 1 head garlic
	- Butter
	- 1 shallot
	- Beef or chicken broth
	- Dry white wine
	- ½ sprig fresh rosemary
	- Whipping cream
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rub roast all over with oil and salt and pepper to your taste.
	2. Slice the top ½-inch (1 cm) off the whole head of garlic; place cut side up under rack in shallow roasting pan, if possible, or on top of rack. Place roast on rack; insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before carving into thin slices. Set garlic aside.
	Rosemary Cream Sauce: : 
		4. Meanwhile, drain off fat from pan drippings. Heat pan drippings in roasting pan over medium heat. Add olive oil and butter; add shallot and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes, until softened. Stir in broth and wine, scraping up any browned bits from pan. Bring to a boil; boil until liquid is reduced by half. Add rosemary and heat through. Stir in whipping cream; simmer, stirring, until desired consistency. Discard rosemary and season with salt and pepper.
		5. Serve sliced roast with Rosemary Cream Sauce and roasted garlic cloves squeezed out from the whole roasted garlic.
Recipe Tips:
  - To serve roast beef, carve across the grain into thin slices to optimize tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: 7a7b3fc2-5abf-4877-93b7-de734a48bc8c
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Beef Tongue Tacos
Recipe Summary: A very simple and delicious taco to prepare and a good introduction to cooking tongue. Serve tomato or tomatillo salsa and guacamole alongside tacos as desired.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 105
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Tongue  (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- 12 cilantro stems
	- 6 cloves garlic, peeled
	- 6 whole cloves
	- 4 bay leaves
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) salt
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried oregano, preferably Mexican
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil (optional)
	- 18 small corn tortillas, warmed
	- 1 cup (250 mL) finely diced onion
	- 1 cup (250 mL) coarsely chopped fresh cilantro 
	- 2 limes, cut into wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Tongue   (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- 12 cilantro stems
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- 6 whole cloves
	- 4 bay leaves
	- Salt
	- Dried oregano, preferably Mexican
	- Vegetable oil (optional)
	- 18 small corn tortillas
	- Onions
	- Fresh cilantro
	- 2 limes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim any excess fat from tongue with a sharp knife. Place in an electric pressure cooker and add the 4 cups (1 L) water, cilantro stems, garlic, cloves, bay leaves, salt and oregano. Seal the pot making sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to HIGH and time for 1½ hours. When the timer beeps, let the pressure release naturally.
	2. Remove the tongue from the liquid and transfer to a cutting board; let cool. You can strain the liquid and serve it along with the tacos with a squeeze of lime, or discard.
	3. When tongue is cool enough to handle, peel off the skin. Start at the back end and use a small knife to lift up the skin; then, using your fingers, peel off the skin like removing a mitten, being careful to not rip the meat at the tip. Discard the skin, trim off any fat, gristle or bumps at the back of the tongue. 
	4. There are three ways to prepare the meat for serving. The meat can be roughly chopped and served as-is, it can be cut fried until crisp, or you can serve a combination of each. To crisp the meat, cut the meat into ¼- to 1/2-inch (5 mm to 1 cm) slices. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of vegetable oil in a nonstick skillet. Add a single layer of the meat, leaving space between each piece. Fry, stirring occasionally, for 6 to 8 minutes until the meat is crisp. Repeat with remaining slices, as necessary, adding oil to pan between batches.  
	5. Serve tongue on a plate with tortillas, onions, cilantro and lime wedges in bowls for each person to build their own tacos.
Recipe Tips:
  - The tongue can be cooked on top of the stove instead of the electric pressure cooker. Proceed with step 1 placing the tongue in a large pot with enough water to cover it by 2 inches (5 cm). Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 3 to 4 hours until the tongue is tender, replenishing the water as necessary. Remove a thin slice from the thickest part of the tongue to check. If you wish to serve the liquid, remove the tongue and boil liquid until reduced to 4 cups (1 L). Proceed with step 2.
---
Recipe ID: 7acc95b6-d188-412e-ac05-d01e8818b351
Recipe Title: Grilled Fajita-Style Layered Steak Salad
Recipe Summary: Take grilled steaks to the next level with this clever make-ahead option to traditional fajitas. Serving up this fajita salad allows your steaks go further, and its smoky Spanish flavour is sure to have everyone saying ‘ole!’!
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Louisiana hot pepper sauce, such as Frank’s
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground cumin, dried oregano, salt and pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Grilling Steaks, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 1 EACH sweet red and yellow pepper, thinly sliced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped green onions or 1 small red onion, cut into wedges lengthwise
	- 2 cups (500 mL) warm cooked rice
	- 2 cups (500 mL) shredded iceberg lettuce
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH ranch dressing and sour cream
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) shredded Cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped tomato
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 6 small flour tortillas, warmed
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Louisiana hot pepper sauce, such as Frank’s
	- Ground cumin
	- Salt and pepper
	- Dried oregano
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Grilling Steaks, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Sweet red and yellow peppers
	- Green onions or 1 small red onion
	- Rice
	- Iceberg lettuce
	- Ranch dressing
	- Sour cream
	- Shredded Cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese
	- Tomato
	- 2 green onions
	- 6 small flour tortillas
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine oil, hot pepper sauce, cumin, oregano, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Brush half the mixture over steak; set aside. Place the peppers and chopped green onions on a large sheet of heavy-duty foil; drizzle with the remaining oil mixture. Fold over to make a secure, flat packet, crimping the edges to seal.
	2. Grill vegetables in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 15 minutes, turning the packet occasionally. Meanwhile, grill steaks in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. 
	3. Transfer steaks to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Cut across the grain into thin slices. 
	4. Place sliced steak and grilled vegetables into a large, straight-sided glass bowl or trifle dish or 4 individual serving bowls. Top with the rice and shredded lettuce. Combine dressing and sour cream in a bowl; spoon over lettuce. Garnish with cheese, sliced green onion and tomato. Serve with warm tortillas, cut into pieces, on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 7b6bab37-5f74-4f2a-956a-36458174ae71
Recipe Title: All-Dressed Beef Burgers with Special Sauce & Crispy Onions
Recipe Summary: With a familiar creamy burger sauce and fried onions, this tasty burger is crazy delicious. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Special Sauce
		- ⅔ cup (150 mL) mayonnaise
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH ketchup, relish, Dijon mustard and dill or sweet pickle juice
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) smoked sweet paprika
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH garlic powder and onion powder
	- Burgers
		- 6 Lean Ground Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
		- 6 burger buns, split 
		- 2 cups (500 mL) shredded lettuce
		- ¾ cup (175 mL) sliced dill or sweet pickles
		- 1 cup (250 mL) French fried onions (see Tip)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Mayonnaise
	- Ketchup
	- Relish
	- Dijon mustard
	- Sliced dill or sweet pickles
	- Dill or sweet pickle juice
	- Smoked sweet paprika
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder
	- 6  Lean Ground Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 6 burger buns, split 
	- Lettuce
	- Onions
Recipe Methods:
	Special Sauce: : 
		1. Combine mayonnaise, ketchup, relish, mustard, pickle juice, smoked paprika, garlic powder and onion powder in a medium bowl; cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. 
	Burgers: : 
		2. Make a thumbprint depression in centre of each burger (to prevent puffing while grilling). Grill burgers on oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 14 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick burgers, turning twice or more, and until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each burger reads 160°F (71°C). 
		3. Meanwhile, grill buns, cut sides down, on barbecue for 30 to 60 seconds or until well-marked and toasted.
		4. Place lettuce and grilled burgers on bun bottoms. Top with Special Sauce, pickles, fried onion and bun tops.
Recipe Tips:
  - French fried onions are often used as the topping on the traditional holiday green bean casserole, and can be found in the salad dressing aisle of the supermarket, or in the produce department with prepared croutons. For cheeseburgers, top burgers with sliced Cheddar cheese during the last 2 minutes of grilling or until melted. Burgers can be pan-fried on the stove top over medium heat in a large cast-iron skillet or grill pan. Toast buns in pan or under broiler.

Recipe ID: 7be294e1-d85b-4006-adb2-0c6ee2384a29
Recipe Title: Grilled Peppered Steak with Fruit Salsa
Recipe Summary: The fruit salsa is a cooling contrast to the heat of the peppered steak. You can make the salsa with fresh or frozen mango. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (25 mL) grape tomatoes, halved (or 2 plum tomatoes, diced)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) diced red onion 
	- 1 ripe mango, peeled and diced
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) diced English cucumber
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh cilantro
	- Grated zest and juice of ½ lime
	- Salt and pepper
	- 4 small Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1½ lb/750 g)
	- Salt and cracked black pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Grape tomatoes (or 2 plum tomatoes)
	- Red onion
	- 1 ripe mango
	- English cucumber
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Grated zest and juice of ½ lime
	- Salt and pepper
	- 4 small Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1½ lb/750 g)
	- Cracked black pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Fruit Salsa: Combine tomato, red onion, mango, cucumber, cilantro, lime zest and juice in medium bowl; season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate. (Make ahead: Salsa may be made several hours in advance.)
	2. Steaks: Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and cracked black pepper to your taste. 
	3. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steaks reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	4. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving with Fruit Salsa.
Recipe Tips:
  - Seasoning prior to grilling enhances the flavour better than if you season the steaks after grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 7c164410-8086-496b-8fb8-7208963200b5
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Japanese-Style Beef Curry
Recipe Summary: In the 1870’s, the developing Japanese navy modeled itself on the British navy. The curry meals served on board were adopted and quickly became part of the food culture in Japan. As a point of reference, it’s as popular as ramen is. Curries have been adapted over the years and may be seasoned with honey and ketchup to make it sweeter, and mayonnaise to give it a creamier texture. 
Recipe Prep Time: 40
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 100
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Boneless Hind Shank (Bubble Meat)
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2-inch (5 cm) piece fresh gingerroot, peeled and grated
	- 2 tart and sweet apples such as Fuji, peeled, cored and shredded 
	- 3 cups (750 mL) beef broth
	- 2 to 4 tbsp (30 to 60 mL) soy sauce
	- 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 6 tbsp (90 mL) unsalted butter 
	- 6 tbsp (90 mL) all-purpose flour 
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) curry powder 
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) cocoa powder 
	- 1 lb (500 g) potatoes, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 12 oz (375 g) medium carrots, peeled, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices
	- Cooked short grain rice
	- Sliced green onions (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Boneless Hind Shank (Bubble Meat)
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- 2-inch (5 cm) piece fresh gingerroot
	- 2 tart and sweet apples such as Fuji
	- Beef broth
	- Soy sauce
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Unsalted butter
	- All-purpose flour
	- Curry powder
	- Cocoa powder
	- 1 lb (500 g) potatoes
	- 12 oz (375 g) medium carrots
	- Short grain rice
	- Green onions (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Slice the meat in half lengthwise and cut each piece crosswise into 2-inch (5 cm) lengths. Heat 2 tbsp (30 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add the beef, in batches, and cook until brown on all sides, adding more oil as needed. Using a slotted spoon, transfer beef to an electric pressure cooker as it’s browned. 
	2. Reduce heat to medium-low and add any remaining oil to pan. Add onions, garlic and gingerroot to skillet; cook, stirring frequently, for about 10 minutes until golden brown and very soft. Transfer to pressure cooker and stir in apples, broth and 2 tbsp (30 mL) soy sauce. Secure the electric pressure cooker lid making sure the valve is closed. Set the pressure to HIGH and time for 1 hour. 
	3. Meanwhile, make a curry thickening mixture: melt butter over medium-low heat in a small skillet; add flour and cook, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes or until mixture turns a lightly toasted, almond brown. Add curry powder and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in cocoa powder. Set aside.
	4. When the timer beeps, quick release the pressure and remove lid. Scoop out 1 cup (250 mL) of the liquid and gradually whisk into the curry mixture, then gradually whisk mixture back into the liquid in the pot. Stir in potatoes and carrots. Set the cooker to medium sauté and cook, uncovered and stirring occasionally, for about 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
	5. Stir in 1 tbsp (15 mL) Worcestershire sauce. Taste and adjust with more soy sauce and Worcestershire, if desired. Serve immediately with rice. Garnish with green onions, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - To prepare on the stovetop, add ingredients to a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster instead of an electric pressure cooker. Add 2 cups (500 mL) extra beef broth. Cover and simmer over low heat for 3 hours making sure the liquid covers the beef and adding more if necessary. Add the curry mixture and vegetables. Simmer, uncovered, for 20 to 30 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
---
Recipe ID: 7d26a176-2dcb-49b7-9941-97b377598125
Recipe Title: Southwestern Grilled Steak with Succotash Sauté
Recipe Summary: Succotash Sauté is a simple side-dish that is the perfect market-fresh pairing with the Cajun-spiced steak. Use ½ cup (125 mL) frozen corn kernels if fresh corn is not in season.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH Cajun spice (see Tip, below) and ground cumin
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and hot pepper flakes
	- 1½ lb (500 g) Beef Bone-in Strip Loin (Wing) Grilling Steaks , ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 2)
	-  Simple Succotash Sauté 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 ear corn, kernels cut off 
	- 2 small zucchini, sliced
	- 1 small sweet red pepper, diced
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) frozen shelled edamame (optional)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) minced fresh parsley or chives
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Cajun spice
	- Ground cumin
	- Salt and hot pepper flakes
	- 1½ lb (500 g)  Beef Bone-in Strip Loin (Wing) Grilling Steaks , ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 2)
	- Butter
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 ear corn
	- 2 small zucchini
	- 1 small sweet red pepper
	- Frozen shelled edamame (optional)
	- Fresh parsley or chives
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine Cajun spice, cumin, salt and hot pepper flakes in small bowl. Set aside half of mixture. Season steak all over with remaining spice mixture. Set aside.
	2. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	3. Simple Succotash Sauté: Meanwhile, melt butter over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add garlic, corn, zucchini, red pepper, edamame (if using) and reserved spice mix; cook, stirring occasionally, for about 8 minutes or until vegetables are just tender. Remove from heat and stir in parsley.
	4. Carve steaks off the bone and cut into thin slices across the grain. Serve sliced steak on a platter along with the bones and serve with Simple Succotash Sauté. 
Recipe Tips:
  - You can purchase Cajun Spice at the grocery store or you can make your own by stirring together ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH paprika, dried oregano, garlic powder and dried thyme. If you’re buying a spice blend, be sure to look for one without added salt.
---
Recipe ID: 7d3a1e35-817b-45d4-8472-552405ed4538
Recipe Title: Beef Rolls (Braciole) in Tomato Sauce
Recipe Summary: We always enjoy eating braciole with different vegetables but hands down rapini is a family favourite. These meat rolls need a bit of pounding to get that tender texture everyone loves to enjoy. Because each one is tied it’s like unwrapping your present on your plate to enjoy the surprise inside! Serve the braciola and some sauce with sautéed rapini; toss the extra sauce with pasta or save it for another recipe.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 165
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 190
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round or Eye of Round cutlets/fast-fry steaks (about 4 to 6 cutlets)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- ½ cup (125 mL) fresh grated Parmesan cheese 
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) chopped fresh flat leaf parsley
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- ½ cup (125 mL) dry white wine
	- Tomato Sauce 
		- 1 jar (680 mL) tomato passata (strained tomatoes)
		- 2 sprigs fresh basil (about 10 leaves)
		- 1 small onion, halved
		- 2 cloves garlic
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried oregano leaves
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh flat leaf parsley
	- Garlic 
	- Fresh basil
	- 1 small onion
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round or Eye of Round cutlets/fast-fry steaks (about 4 to 6 cutlets)
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Dry white wine
	- 1 jar (680 mL) tomato passata (strained tomatoes)
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Grated Parmesan cheese 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut a sealable bag along one side and bottom to open up easily. Place a cutlet inside and close bag.&nbsp; Pound out the cutlet using a flat meat mallet until very thin. Remove to a baking sheet and repeat with remaining cutlets. 
	2. Arrange cutlets in a single layer on the sheet and sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. Spread cutlets with cheese, parsley and garlic, dividing equally. Starting the narrower short side, roll up jelly-roll style and secure with butcher’s string or a toothpick. 
	3. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a wide saucepan. Add beef and brown, turning, until browned on all sides. Add wine and turn rolls again; simmer for 2 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low.
	4. Tomato Sauce: Add tomato passata, ½ cup (125 mL) water, basil, onion, garlic, oregano, salt and hot pepper flakes to pan and stir gently. Bring to a simmer. 
	5. Cover, reduce heat to low and gently simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 2½ hours or until beef is fork-tender. Scoop beef from sauce and place on serving plates.
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to tell your family and guests to remove the string or toothpick before enjoying! If you do not have sealable bags, use plastic wrap, parchment paper or waxed paper to pound the beef out thinly. If cutlets are very large cut them in half crosswise to get 2 similar-size cutlets; it helps cook the braciole evenly when you start with cutlets all the same size.
---
Recipe ID: 7da835be-f3f8-4ecf-a9da-5d9d808ce7f3
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef Heart with Chipotle Chilies
Recipe Summary: This recipe is a good introduction to cooking beef heart. Beef heart has a steak-like quality and is very lean. It’s good for grilling or pan-frying cooked to medium-rare at the most for the best texture. Beef heart can also be braised like a stew or pot roast–low-temperature cooking in a liquid.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 5
Recipe Marinating Time: 60
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 85
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) piece Beef Heart 
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) finely minced canned chipotle chilies in adobo (with sauce) 
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH fresh ground pepper, ground cumin and dried oregano
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) salt
	- Large pinch ground cloves
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) red wine vinegar
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) vegetable oil
	- Four 10-inch (25 cm) bamboo or metal skewers
	- To serve (as desired) 
	- Salsa, guacamole, tortillas and lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) piece  Beef Heart 
	- Canned chipotle chilies in adobo (with sauce)
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Ground cumin
	- Dried oregano
	- Salt
	- Ground cloves
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Vegetable oil
	- Four 10-inch (25 cm) bamboo or metal skewers
	- Salsa and/or guacamole
	- Tortillas
	- Lime wedges (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rinse heart under cold water. Trim off fat, membranes and any fibrous tissue from the heart. Cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
	2. Combine the chipotles, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin, oregano, cloves, vinegar and oil in a medium bowl. Add heart cubes and toss to coat; cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or up to overnight. Meanwhile, soak bamboo skewers (if using) in water for at least 30 minutes.
	3. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Thread the meat onto skewers, dividing equally. Lightly oil meat if it seems dry. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted in cubes reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the most. Serve immediately with salsa, guacamole, tortillas and lime wedges, as desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Instead of grilling, you can cook the heart in a heavy skillet. Heat lightly-oiled skillet over high heat and add the skewers; cook as directed.
---
Recipe ID: 7e87dda7-c7f4-40af-b013-e025bef31da0
Recipe Title: Fennel Quinoa Pilaf
Recipe Summary: Here is your grain and vegetable side dish all in one. With Mediterranean-influenced flavours it’s a perfect pairing for a barbecued marinated roast or steak, or garlicky-marinated beef kabobs.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 bulb fennel
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 2 shallots or 1 small onion, thinly sliced
	- 1 small sweet red pepper, seeded and finely chopped
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary (or ¼ tsp/1 mL crumbled dried rosemary)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 1 cup (250 mL) quinoa, rinsed
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated orange or lemon zest
	- 3 cups (750 mL) baby spinach
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) grated Parmesan cheese
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim feathery fronds from fennel bulb; coarsely chop and set aside for garnish. Trim off thick stalks from bulb and discard. Cut bulb in half lengthwise and trim out tough core. Place bulb halves cut side-down and cut crosswise into thin slices.&nbsp;
	2. Heat oil over medium heat in a large saucepan. Add shallots and fennel; cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until fennel starts to soften. Add red pepper, garlic, rosemary, salt and pepper; cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until pepper is softened.&nbsp;
	3. Stir in quinoa. Pour in 2 cups (500 mL) water and balsamic vinegar and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for about 15 minutes or until almost all the liquid has been absorbed. Remove from heat.&nbsp;
	4. Sprinkle in orange zest and spinach; fold in gently with a spatula. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes until spinach is wilted. Stir Parmesan into pilaf and garnish with reserved fennel fronds.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - Fennel has a mild licorice flavour and a texture similar to celery. Be sure to save the feathery fronds to use like an herb for garnish–they’re pretty and add a punch of fresh flavour. If fennel bulb isn’t available, substitute 3 stalks of celery, thinly sliced, and ½ tsp (2 mL) crushed fennel or anise seeds.
---
Recipe ID: 7eeef9fc-9843-48d1-99a8-5204a6e31e28
Recipe Title: Saucy Barbecue-Smoked Beef Burnt Ends
Recipe Summary: The burnt ends from a smoked Beef Brisket are highly coveted in the barbecue world. This recipe uses boneless Beef Rib Finger Meat and your barbecue with soaked wood chips to create a similar effect. It’s a labour of love, as it will take a few hours, but the delicious results are well worth the wait! 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 190
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 200
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Wood chips, soaked according to package directions 
	- 2½ lb (1.3 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Montreal-style steak spice
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) barbecue sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter, melted
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Wood chips, soaked according to package directions 
	- 2½ lb (1.3 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat
	- Montreal-style steak spice
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Butter
Recipe Methods:
	1. Fill drip pan part way with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). Turn off burner under drip pan. 
	2. Add soaked wood chips to smoker box. Alternatively, wrap 2 cups (5 oz/150 g) wood chips loosely in foil to create a small pouch, punching a few holes at the top of the pouch to let the smoke out. Place smoker box or pouch on the grill grate above the burner that is turned on for 10 to 20 minutes, or until starting to smoke.
	3. Meanwhile, trim excess fat from the meat to your taste. Starting at the thicker end of each piece of meat, make a cut in between the meat and the fibrous silverskin, lifting the fat and silverskin away from the meat while you trim along the strip of meat. (Tip: Grip the silverskin with a paper towel to prevent slipping.). Discard the trim. 
	4. Place meat in a large bowl. Sprinkle with steak spice and toss until evenly coated.
	5. When wood chips start to smoke, place meat on grill over the drip pan (off the heat). Close lid and cook for about 2 hours or until a thick crust has developed.
	6. Remove meat from grill; let cool for 10 minutes. Cut meat crosswise into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces. Transfer to a 13 x 9-inch (3 L) foil pan. Combine barbecue sauce with melted butter in a bowl; pour over meat and toss to coat. Cover pan tightly with foil. 
	7. Place foil pan on grill over drip pan. Close lid and cook for 45 to 60 minutes or until meat is fork-tender. Remove foil cover; continue to cook for 15 to 20 minutes or until sauce has caramelized and meat is glazed. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Serve Ends as an appetizer as beef bites with toothpicks, or as a meal, in a bun with slaw and an array of barbecue sides, or as a topping for poutine, mac and cheese or tacos, or even as a decadent breakfast or brunch side dish. The fibrous silverskin on finger meat is tough. Removing it before cooking makes the meat much more tender. Double the recipe to serve a hungry crowd.
---
Recipe ID: 7fb429e5-9e15-4292-a529-3ea1bdb5b025
Recipe Title: Mediterranean Oven Roast and Carrots
Recipe Summary: Fragrant herbs and garlic season the Top Sirloin and vegetables as they slow roast in the oven. The sun-dried tomato sauce adds that finishing touch for a taste of the Mediterranean. Use a meat thermometer to cook your roast to the doneness that you like the best – without overcooking it! NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 150
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 red onion, sliced
	- 2 cups (500 mL) mini carrots
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) melted butter
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried thyme
	- Salt
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) herbes de Provence seasoning, crumbled
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast
	- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 8 dry-packed sun-dried tomatoes, soaked and chopped
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp (30 mL) cold water
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 red onion
	- Mini carrots
	- Butter
	- Dried thyme
	- Herbes de Provence seasoning
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 8 dry-packed sun-dried tomatoes
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Toss sliced onion and carrots with butter, thyme and ½ tsp (2 mL) salt in a shallow roasting pan. Combine herbes de Provence, garlic and salt and pepper to your taste in a small bowl and rub all over roast. 
	2. Place roast on top of vegetables in roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 1¾ to 2¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: see ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Transfer vegetables to a serving dish and keep warm.
	4. Meanwhile, stir broth into roasting pan drippings over medium heat. Stir in tomatoes and bring to boil, stirring up any browned bits from the pan. Boil until liquid is slightly reduced. Gradually whisk cornstarch mixture into simmering broth; cook, whisking, for about 3 minutes or until sauce is thickened. 
	5. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with sauce and vegetables.
Recipe Tips:
  - When buying a beef oven roast, buy 12 oz (375 g) beef per person for bone-in-roasts or for boneless roasts, buy 6 to 8 oz (175 to 250 g) beef per person.
---
Recipe ID: 80729631-5535-48ca-8229-d5e4aae40232
Recipe Title: Grilled Coffee-Rubbed Steak
Recipe Summary: This rub works well with thick, tender and juicy Grilling Steaks. The resulting sweet, savoury and charred flavours bring out the best in your beef and work beautifully with bold red wines and dark craft beers like black lagers, porters and stouts.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 15
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH ground coffee and packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH kosher salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 Beef T-bone Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Ground coffee
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Kosher salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 Beef T-bone Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine coffee, sugar, salt and pepper in a bowl. Remove ¼ cup (60 mL) and store remaining in a jar for your next barbecue. Rub ¼ cup (60 mL) of the coffee mixture all over steaks. Let stand for 15 minutes.
	2. Grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
	3. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Carve to share at the table.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 82cbdf0b-5df4-44f7-8051-7c654249e323
Recipe Title: Grilled Greek-Style Marinated Steak with Couscous Salad
Recipe Summary: This unique warm main-course salad has powerful protein, calcium-rich dairy, fibre from whole grain and some veggies too. If you’re really time-pressed use a prepared vinaigrette-style Greek dressing as a sub for the scratch-made marinade and salad dressing. A squeeze of lemon heightens flavours. You can substitute any chopped fresh green herb for the parsley – maybe some new chives from your garden?
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 525
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lemons
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) olive oil, divided
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried oregano
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Flank Marinating Steak
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whole wheat couscous
	- 1 cup (250 mL) crumbled feta cheese (about 4 oz/125 g)
	- 1 small tomato, seeded and diced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH diced cucumber and sliced pitted black olives
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) diced red onion
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh mint
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lemons
	- Olive oil
	- Dried oregano
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Flank Marinating Steak
	- Whole wheat couscous
	- Crumbled feta cheese (about 4 oz/125 g)
	- 1 small tomato
	- Cucumber
	- Sliced pitted black olives
	- Red onion
	- Fresh parsley
	- Fresh mint
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Grate lemon zest finely and squeeze lemon juice. Set half the zest and 3 tbsp (45 mL) of the juice aside. Combine remaining lemon peel and juice, 3 tbsp (45 mL) of the olive oil and oregano in large sealable freezer bag, Pierce steak all over with a fork; add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours. 
	2. Bring 1 cup (250 mL) water to boil in medium saucepan. Remove from heat and stir in couscous; cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with wooden spoon. Stir in remaining oil and reserved lemon zest and juice. Let cool slightly. 
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat steak dry with paper towel.
	4. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least.
	5. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, gently stir feta, tomato, cucumber, olives, onion, parsley and mint into couscous; season with salt and pepper to taste. Slice steak thinly across the grain and serve warm with couscous salad.
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to let steaks rest for about 5 minutes after cooking so that the juices get the chance to settle before you serve or slice.
---
Recipe ID: 840c8179-335f-4a29-a049-bc95aeda6e7f
Recipe Title: Sous Vide Osso Buco-style Simmering Steak
Recipe Summary: With the traditional flavours of tomato- and wine-braised osso buco, this simmering steak can go from every day to entertaining-worthy with ease. Slow, even sous vide cooking is just the thing to make the most of this beef cut. You can even cook it to medium-rare and get a tender, juicy result which is quite different from the well-done temperature of traditional braising. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 368
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 383
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Boneless Beef Cross Rib Simmering Steak, , about ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil (approx)
	- 1 EACH onion, stalk celery and carrot, finely chopped
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) dry white or red wine
	- 1 cup (250 mL) chopped canned tomatoes with juice, preferably San Marzano style
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped fresh parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Boneless Beef Cross Rib Simmering Steak, , about ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- 1 onion
	- 1 stalk celery
	- 1 carrot
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Dry white or red wine
	- Canned tomatoes with juice, preferably San Marzano style
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 130°F (54.5°C) for medium-rare or 140°F (60°C) for medium according to manufacturer’s directions.
	2. Cut steak into 4 equal pieces. Pat dry with paper towel and season all over with pepper and salt. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a skillet. Brown steaks for about 2 to 3 minutes, turning once, until browned on both sides. Transfer to a plate and set aside. 
	3. Reduce heat to medium-low and a little oil, if necessary to make a thin layer. Add onion, celery and carrot; cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add wine and cook, stirring and scraping up brown bits from pan. Remove from heat, stir in tomatoes and ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper. 
	4. Place steaks in a large bag for sous vide (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Pour in tomato mixture. Remove as much air as possible and vacuum or manually seal. 
	5. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure it to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Cover water bath with foil or plastic to reduce evaporation. Cook sous vide for 6 hours.
	6. Remove beef from water bath. Transfer steaks from bag with a slotted spoon to warmed serving dishes. Tent with foil and keep warm.
	7. Pour sauce into a medium saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and boil for 2 to 3 minutes or until slightly reduced. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in parsley. Pour hot sauce over steaks to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - To make ahead, after removing from water bath, immerse beef in sauce in bag in a sink or bowl of ice water and chill, replenishing ice as necessary until cold. Refrigerate in bag for up to 3 days. To serve, heat in a saucepan over medium heat simmering beef in the sauce until hot. This recipe can be easily doubled. Brown the steaks in two batches in the skillet and use 1 or 2 large sous vide bags to cook.
---
Recipe ID: 841348c7-b2f3-497e-b33d-850c294e4a58
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Sweet Thai Chili Sauce
Recipe Summary: This Thai-inspired grilled steak recipe is simple, satisfying and faster to prepare than ordering take-out for dinner. Serve with steamed green beans and plain steamed jasmine rice or rice noodles tossed with a little sesame oil and sliced green onions.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 15
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH fresh lime juice and vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH minced garlic and gingerroot
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) soy sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt 
	- 2 Beef T-bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) sweet Thai chili sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) crushed roasted peanuts (optional)
	- 1 fresh red Thai or finger chili pepper, sliced (optional)
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Garlic
	- Soy sauce
	- Salt
	- 2 Beef T-bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
	- Sweet Thai chili sauce
	- Crushed roasted peanuts (optional)
	- 1 fresh red Thai or finger chili pepper (optional)
	- Lime wedges
	- Vegetable oil
	- Gingerroot
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine lime juice, oil, garlic, gingerroot, soy sauce and salt in a large dish. Pierce steaks all over with a fork. Add to dish and turn to coat steaks with marinade; cover and refrigerate for 15 minutes.
	2. Remove steaks from marinade and pat dry with paper towel; discard used marinade. 
	 3. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more and basting with sweet Thai chili sauce during the last 2 to 3 minutes of grilling, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer steaks to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	4. Carve meat from the bone, then across the grain into slices. Sprinkle with peanuts and fresh chili pepper (if using). Serve with lime wedges. 
Recipe Tips:
  - If desired, grill lime halves, cut side down, for 3 to 4 minutes or until grill-marked and lightly charred.
---
Recipe ID: 84a2695e-4760-4b15-87ef-e5cf0144f41b
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Beef Broth
Recipe Summary: The programmable electric pressure cooker makes it much faster to make basic broths for soups and sauces. This recipe makes 10 cups (2.5 L) that can be refrigerated for up to 3 days or frozen for up to 6 months. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 200
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2½ lb (1.25 kg) Beef Soup Bones, 2- to 3-inch (5 to 7.5 cm) pieces
	- 2 carrots, trimmed and cut into large pieces
	- 2 stalks celery, cut in thirds
	- 1 onion, quartered (unpeeled)
	- 1 head garlic, cut in half crosswise
	- 3 sprigs fresh thyme
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2½ lb (1.25 kg)  Beef Soup Bones, 2- to 3-inch (5 to 7.5 cm) pieces
	- 2 carrots
	- 2 stalks celery
	- 1 onion
	- 1 head garlic
	- 3 sprigs fresh thyme
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place beef bones in a roasting pan and roast in preheated 400°F oven for 25 minutes or until golden brown.
	 2. Transfer bones to a minimum 6-qt (6 L) electric pressure cooker, scraping brown bits from roasting pan into pot. Add carrots, celery, onion, garlic and thyme. Add cold water (about 10 cups/2.5 L) up to the maximum fill line. 
	3. Secure the lid making sure the valve is closed. Set the pressure to High and time for 2 hours. When the timer beeps, let pressure release naturally for 30 minutes. Release any remaining pressure, remove inner pot from cooker and let broth cool.
	4. Drain the broth through a colander or large sieve into a large bowl or another pot, pressing down on the solids. Discard solids. Cover broth and refrigerate overnight. 
	5. Remove any fat from the surface of the broth. Use immediately, refrigerate for up to 3 days or portion out into containers or resealable bags and freeze for up to 6 months.
Recipe Tips:
  - Roasting the bones in advance of pressure-cooking helps develop a good beefy flavour.
---
Recipe ID: 84f172f2-b94f-48ab-9619-71ee150fdef9
Recipe Title: Traditional Italian Meatballs in Tomato Sauce
Recipe Summary: A restaurant favourite known as “Polpette al Sugo”, tender, flavourful meatballs are simmered in a simple tomato sauce to enjoy with toasted garlic bread. Chef Ponzo prefers to use medium ground beef for these meatballs but lean works well, too. This recipe was adapted from Chef Ponzo’s original and modified, as necessary, for home cooks.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 60
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 140
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Meatballs
		- 1 cup (250 mL) cubed dried crustless bread (see Tip)
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) milk
		- 1 clove garlic, minced
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced fresh parsley
		- 1 egg
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh ground pepper 
		- 1 lb (500 g) Medium or Lean Ground Beef
		- ¾ cup (175 mL) grated Parmesan cheese, preferably Parmigiano Reggiano (about 2½ oz/75 g)
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil (approx)
	- Sauce
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
		- Half red onion, diced
		- 1 clove garlic, minced 
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
		- 2 bottles (EACH 680 mL) passata (strained tomatoes) or 5½ cups (1.375 L) canned crushed tomatoes
		- 1 bay leaf
	- Garlic Bread
		- 4 slices crusty bread
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) garlic butter, at room temperature
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic
	- Red onion
	- Fresh parsley
	- Crusty bread
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium or Lean Ground Beef
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) grated Parmesan cheese, preferably Parmigiano Reggiano (about 2½ oz/75 g)
	- Olive oil
	- Salt
	- Pepper 
	- Bay leaf
	- 2 bottles (EACH 680 mL) passata (strained tomatoes) or 2 cans (EACH 28 oz/796 mL) canned crushed tomatoes
	- Egg
	- Garlic butter
	- Milk
Recipe Methods:
	1. Meatballs: Place bread cubes in a large bowl and pour in milk; stir to coat. Let soak for 15 minutes.
	2. Sauce: Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in a wide sauté pan or deep skillet. Cook onion, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until soft. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until fragrant. Stir in tomatoes, pepper and bay leaf. Rinse passata bottles with about ¼ cup (60 mL) water each and pour into pan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 30 minutes.
	3. Meanwhile, mash soaked bread into small pieces with a fork. Add garlic, parsley, egg, salt and pepper and beat with a fork until blended. Add beef and Parmesan and gently mix in with fork (careful not to over-mix).
	4. Scoop heaping tablespoonfuls (15 mL) of the meat mixture and roll into about twenty 1½ -inch (4 cm) meatballs. Place on a baking sheet or plate.
	5. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Cook meatballs, in batches and turning as needed, until browned all over. Transfer to simmering sauce as they are browned. Add more oil to skillet between batches, as necessary. 
	6. Spoon sauce over meatballs to cover; simmer in sauce, gently stirring occasionally, for about 20 minutes or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into several meatballs reads 160°F (71°C) at the least.
	7. Garlic Bread: Just before serving, spread one side of each bread slice with garlic butter. Toast bread, buttered side down, over medium heat in a nonstick skillet for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown.
	8. Spoon meatballs and sauce into shallow serving bowls and serve with Garlic Bread.
Recipe Tips:
  - Soaking dried bread makes for extra-moist, tender meatballs. You’ll need 1 to 2 slices of bread to make the cubes for the meatballs. Use bread that’s a day or two old, or cut into cubes and let dry at room temperature for a day or spread on a baking sheet and dry in a 250F (x C) oven for about 30 minutes. If using canned crushed tomatoes, you’ll need about one-and-three-quarters 28 oz (796 mL) cans for this recipe. Refrigerate or freeze any extra tomatoes in an airtight container for another use.
---
Recipe ID: 858f225e-e098-4e95-9870-6a3f2b2aa079
Recipe Title: Traditional Fast-Fry Chicken Fried Steak
Recipe Summary: Chicken or steak? This odd ball named steak is a Southern U.S. diner steak classic, that has the crispy coating resembling fried chicken. The key to success is to have your ingredients all at the ready before you start to cook – don’t skip this important step. For a classic Southern meal, serve with mashed potatoes, green beans and warm biscuits.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 12 Beef Inside Round Fast-fry Steaks, each 6 inches (15 cm) long (about 1½ lb/750 g total)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) all-purpose flour
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) milk
	- 2 eggs, beaten
	- ½ cup (125 mL) vegetable oil, divided (approx)
	-  Gravy
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) butter
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 3 cups (750 mL) milk
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 12 Beef Inside Round Fast-fry Steaks,  each 6 inches (15 cm) long (about 1½ lb/750 g total)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Milk
	- 2 eggs
	- Vegetable oil
	- Butter
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper. Place flour in a shallow bowl. Whisk milk with eggs in a separate shallow bowl. Working with one slice at a time, coat steak in flour, dip in milk mixture and then return to flour. Coat steak completely with flour; pressing firmly yet carefully, so that the coating adheres to the meat. Arrange steaks in a single layer on a large baking sheet. 
	2. Heat half the oil over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet; cook steaks, in batches, for 4 minutes, turning once, until meat is cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF), coating is golden brown and meat is still pink inside. Transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and keep warm in preheated 250ºF oven. Add more oil to skillet as needed between batches. (If steaks begin to brown too quickly, reduce heat slightly or if steaks are not sizzling when added to the pan, increase heat.) 
	3. Gravy Discard any remaining oil from skillet. Wipe skillet with paper towel to remove any overly browned bits. Melt butter over medium heat in skillet. Sprinkle in flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes or until a lightly browned paste forms. Pour in about ½ cup (125 mL) of the milk, whisking constantly, until mixture is smooth. Whisk in remaining milk; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and boil gently, stirring occasionally, for about 3 to 5 minutes or until sauce has thickened to gravy consistency. Season with salt and ½ tsp (2 mL) pepper. 
	4. Serve sauce over steaks and finish with additional pepper, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
