  - Avoid crowding the pan during the frying to ensure an evenly golden coating and don’t layer the cooked steaks on top of each other, as this will cause the coating to steam and become soggy. You can elevate the cream sauce by adding a splash of white wine and up to 1 tsp (5 mL) dried thyme or crumbled sage leaves before whisking in the milk.
---
Recipe ID: 875d92e5-7f0c-4f29-8094-b0c34f7c472d
Recipe Title: North African-Style Braised Beef
Recipe Summary: These North African-style braised Beef Short Ribs simmer in a red wine, tomato and soy broth, accented with dried figs, cinnamon and star anise. This recipe may seem complex, but essentially it is just a simple stew with a unique fragrant and flavourful braise that is impressive to serve. Serve with couscous as a traditional side dish or substitute with quinoa or rice. This recipe also works well with 6 thick-cut bone-in short ribs that are about 4 inches (10 cm) long. 
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 155
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 185
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 12 Boneless Short Ribs, about 2 inches (5 cm) thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 1 EACH onion, carrot and stalk celery, finely chopped
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced gingerroot
	- 2 cinnamon sticks, EACH about 2 inches (5 cm) long
	- 2 star anise
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) dry red wine
	- 12 dried figs, stemmed and quartered
	- 1 can (796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 1 cup (250 mL) reduced-sodium chicken or beef broth (approx)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) soy sauce
	-  Herbed Couscous 
	- 2 cups (500 mL) couscous (uncooked)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH olive oil and fresh lemon juice
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh parsley and mint
	- Lemon wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 12 Boneless Short Ribs, about 2 inches (5 cm) thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 2 cinnamon sticks, EACH about 2 inches (5 cm) long
	- 2 star anise
	- Dry red wine
	- 12 dried figs
	- 1 can (796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- Reduced-sodium chicken or beef broth
	- Soy sauce
	- Couscous (uncooked)
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh parsley and mint
	- Lemons
	- Carrot
	- Stalk celery
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat short ribs dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster; brown short ribs, in batches and adding more oil as needed, until browned on all sides. Transfer ribs to a plate.
	 2. Reduce heat to medium. Add onion, carrot, celery, garlic, gingerroot, cinnamon sticks and star anise to pan; cook, stirring often, for 4 to 6 minutes or until vegetables are starting to soften and spices are fragrant. Add red wine and figs; bring to a boil scraping up any browned bits from pan. Boil for about 2 to 3 minutes or until reduced slightly. Stir in tomatoes, broth and soy sauce; return to a boil. Return ribs and any accumulated juices to pan.
	3. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, adding water or additional broth if needed to keep beef covered while braising, for about 2 to 2½ hours, or until beef is fork-tender.
	4. Herbed Couscous: Meanwhile, cook couscous according to package directions. Fluff couscous with a fork and toss with olive oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper, parsley and mint. 
	5. Remove beef from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Skim any fat from sauce and discard. Remove cinnamon sticks and star anise; discard.
	6. Divide Herbed Couscous evenly among shallow serving bowls. Top each serving with two short ribs and the sauce. Serve with lemon wedges.
Recipe Tips:
  - Serve with store-bought pickled lemon for North African-style condiment. The flavours of the braise will blend nicely when made ahead, so will taste even better made, refrigerated overnight and served the next day. To make-ahead, prepare through step 3, let cool to room temperature, cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days. Before serving, , skim fat from surface, then gently reheat short ribs in sauce over medium heat until sauce is simmering and beef is heated through, then proceed with step 4.
---
Recipe ID: 87fe39ad-6a25-4dbd-8768-be4a11ee8799
Recipe Title: Confit-Style Sous Vide Beef Tongue
Recipe Summary: This tongue goes well in a sandwich, with sweet and sour red cabbage, cooked brown lentils or on a salad of robust greens.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 2160
Recipe Marinating Time: 1440
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 3620
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 small Beef Tongue  (1¾ to 2 lb/875 g to 1 kg) 
	- 6 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) coarsely ground coriander seeds
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) coarsely ground black pepper
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground cloves 
	- 4 bay leaves, crumbled
	- 6 sprigs fresh thyme, coarsely chopped
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) duck, pork or bacon fat
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 small  Beef Tongue   (1¾ to 2 lb/875 g to 1 kg) 
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Salt
	- Coarsely ground coriander seeds
	- Coarsely ground black pepper
	- Ground cloves
	- 4 bay leaves
	- 6 sprigs fresh thyme
	- Duck, pork or bacon fat
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim any excess fat from the tongue using a sharp knife. Cut a slit lengthwise through the top side of the tongue, about ½-inch (1 cm) deep.
	2. Combine garlic, salt, coriander, pepper, cloves, bay leaves and thyme in small bowl. Press into the slit and all over the tongue, especially on the underside. Place in a large resealable freezer bag or resealable silicone food bag or vacuum seal bag. Remove as much air as possible and seal the bag or using vacuum sealer. Refrigerate for 24 hours.
	3. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 170ºF (76.7ºC) according to manufacturer’s directions.
	4. Remove tongue from bag and rinse off marinade under cold water; discard excess marinade. Place in a new vacuum seal bag and add the fat. Remove as much air as possible and seal bag using vacuum sealer. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure it to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Cover water bath with foil or plastic to reduce evaporation. Cook sous vide for 36 hours, replenishing with hot water as needed. 
	5. Remove bag from water bath and place in a sink filled with cold water; let stand until tongue is cool enough to handle, replenishing cold water, as necessary. Remove tongue from the bag and discard liquid. Peel off the skin. Start at the back end and use a small knife to lift up the skin; then, using your fingers, peel off the skin like removing a mitten, being careful to not rip the meat at the tip. Discard the skin, trim off any fat, gristle or bumps at the back of the tongue. 
	6. Carve tongue into thick slices and serve warm, or fry slices over medium heat in an oiled skillet for 3 minutes per side, until crisp and browned.
Recipe Tips:
  - At the end of step 5, you can store cooked tongue in the fridge for up to 3 days (or freeze for up to 3 months). Wrap tightly before storing.
---
Recipe ID: 886f9c8e-5840-4bd9-bdce-603e26c91dea
Recipe Title: Braised Beef Kare Kare
Recipe Summary: Inspired by the dish from the Philippines, this stew has an intense aroma the traditional rich sauce. Serve as is over rice as a simple stew or, to enjoy as a fun street food as in the Philippines, tuck beef into warmed tortillas and top with mango, grilled eggplant and green beans.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 210
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 230
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 to 1.3 kg) Beef Chuck Flap Tail
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 cup (250 mL) diced onion
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sweet paprika or annatto
	- ½ cup (125 mL) natural peanut butter
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch or rice flour
	- 2½ cups (625 mL) beef broth
	- Fish sauce (optional)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 to 1.3 kg)  Beef Chuck Flap Tail
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onion
	- Sweet paprika or annatto
	- Natural peanut butter
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Cornstarch or rice flour
	- Beef broth
	- Fish sauce (optional)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut the beef into 6 cubes. Pat beef dry with paper towel. Heat oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef, in batches, for about 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a plate.
	2. Reduce heat to medium. Cook onion, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in paprika, peanut butter and garlic. Whisk cornstarch into the broth and add all at once to the pan. Bring to a simmer, stirring. Return beef and accumulated juices to pan. 
	3. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 3 hours, turning the beef over occasionally, until beef is fork-tender. Season with fish sauce (if using), salt and pepper to taste.
	4. Transfer beef to a bowl using a slotted spoon. Use 2 forks to shred the cooked beef. Skim fat from sauce, then return beef to sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - The beef can be enjoyed immediately or cooled and stored in an airtight container for up to 3 days. Reheat in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring often, until hot and bubbling.
---
Recipe ID: 88aeacaf-22f1-42cc-b53b-ee372e2f0fa7
Recipe Title: Grilled Whisky-Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Open the bar to enjoy this delicious marinade! But if you want to save your whisky to have on the side with your steak dinner, you can substitute apple juice (or brandy) for the whisky, and if you’d rather, use soy sauce instead of teriyaki sauce. All kinds of options!
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 260
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) rye whiskey
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH teriyaki sauce and vegetable oil
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) liquid honey
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH chili powder, herbes de Provence seasoning and coarsely ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Tri-tip Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 6 small steaks)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Rye whiskey
	- Teriyaki sauce
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Liquid honey
	- Chili powder
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Tri-tip Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 6 small steaks)
	- Vegetable oil
	- Herbes de Provence seasoning
	- Coarsely ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine whiskey, teriyaki sauce, vegetable oil, garlic, honey, chili powder, herbes de Provence and pepper in a large sealable freezer bag. Add steaks to bag, massaging marinade into meat; seal and refrigerate for 4 to 8 hours.
	2. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Pat steaks dry with paper towel. Grill steaks in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
	3. Transfer steaks to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest 5 minutes. Slice thinly on the diagonal to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to let steaks rest for about 5 minutes after cooking so that the juices get the chance to settle before you serve or slice.
---
Recipe ID: 890f8600-4f7c-4116-a449-ceaea9797a75
Recipe Title: Charred Cedar-Planked Steak and Fresh Veggie Salsa
Recipe Summary: You’ve probably tried planked salmon – but how about beef? The smouldering plank provides a delicate smoke-flavour effect that’s a natural with a thick beef grilling steak.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 70
Recipe Marinating Time: 120
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 220
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) barbecue sauce 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) prepared horseradish 
	- 3 sprigs fresh rosemary, leaves only, coarsely chopped (about 1 tbsp/15 mL) 
	- 1 Beef Tomahawk-style Rib Grilling Steak, 1-bone thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- Large cedar plank (or 2 if necessary, see Tip below)
	- 1 can or bottle (355 to 473 mL) dark beer 
	- Warm water
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- Vegetable oil 
	-  Salsa 
	- 2 cups (500 mL) grape tomatoes 
	- 8 cloves garlic, peeled 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 ears corn, husked 
	- 4 green onions, trimmed 
	- 1 EACH sweet yellow and red pepper, seeded, cut into quarters
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Prepared horseradish
	- 3 sprigs fresh rosemary
	- 1  Beef Tomahawk-style Rib Grilling Steak,  1-bone thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- Large cedar plank (or 2 if necessary, see Tip below)
	- 1 can or bottle (355 to 473 mL) dark beer 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- Vegetable oil 
	-  Salsa 
	- Grape tomatoes
	- 8 cloves garlic
	- Vegetable oil
	- 4 ears corn
	- 4 green onions
	- Sweet yellow and red peppers, seeded
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine barbecue sauce, lemon juice, horseradish and rosemary in an extra-large or large sealable freezer bag. Transfer ½ cup (125 mL) to a bowl and set aside for Salsa. Pat steak dry with paper towel and add to bag, massaging meat with marinade; close bag (it may not seal if bone sticks out), place in a large container and refrigerate for 2 hours. 
	2. Meanwhile, soak cedar plank for at least 2 hours in a container with enough beer and warm water mixture to cover, weighing down with heavy jars to submerge. 
	 3. Salsa: Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes. Alternately thread grape tomatoes and garlic onto skewers. Brush skewers, corn, green onions and peppers all over with oil and season with salt and pepper. Starting with corn, grill vegetables in closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400˚F/200˚C), turning occasionally, until charred all over. Let cool slightly. Cut kernels from cobs into a bowl. Remove tomatoes and garlic from skewers. Coarsely chop remaining vegetables and add to corn with reserved barbecue sauce mixture, tossing to coat.
	4. Remove steak from marinade; discard marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel; wipe any marinade off bone well. Season meat all over with salt and pepper to your taste. 
	5. Discard soaking liquid from plank. Heat plank in closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400˚F/200˚C) for about 3 minutes or until plank crackles and smokes. Brush top side with oil.
	6. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into the centre of the steak, avoiding fat or bone. Place steak on plank. Cook in closed barbecue, without turning, for about 45 minutes or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into steak reads 120˚F (49˚C). 
	7. Remove steak from plank (let plank cool and discard) and sear steak directly on the hot grill with the lid open, turning once, for 4 to 6 minutes for medium-rare, removing from grill when 10°F (6°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer steak to cutting board, cover loosely with foil and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes.
	8. Carve meat from the bone and across the grain into thin slices. Arrange on cutting board or platter with the bone and serve with Salsa.
Recipe Tips:
  - Depending on the size of your steak and the cedar planks, you may need 2 planks. The meat and bone should fit on top over plank (or planks) without overhanging. If using 2 planks, push them together on the grill as close as possible before placing the steak on top. When marinating the steak in the bag, keep the bone out of the marinade; this will prevent it from charring too much when grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 89fa0a74-d774-4aea-bdd9-c987289c49e6
Recipe Title: Southwest Grilled Vegetable and Black Bean Salad
Recipe Summary: A colourful salad of grilled vegetables and black beans combine with a zesty, smoky dressing with just a touch of heat to liven up any summertime meal. Grill your favourite beef steak or burgers alongside the vegetables for the salad. It’s also good with rotisserie roast beef or brisket on the grill.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH olive oil and orange juice
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) minced chipotles in adobo sauce
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) freshly ground black pepper
	- 2 small zucchini, halved lengthwise
	- 2 ears corn, husked
	- 2 sweet orange peppers, halved and seeded
	- 2 cups (500 mL) halved cherry tomatoes
	- 1 cup (250 mL) cooked or canned black beans, drained and rinsed
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) torn fresh cilantro leaves
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) toasted green pumpkin seeds (pepitas)
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk together oil, orange juice, garlic, chipotle, salt and pepper in small bowl. Pour 3 tbsp (45 mL) over the zucchini, corn and peppers in a large bowl; toss to coat. Set remaining dressing aside.
	2. Grill vegetables on oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium heat (350°F/180°C), turning occasionally, for 10 to 12 minutes or until tender and slightly charred. Transfer to cutting board; let cool.
	 3. Cut corn kernels off the cob into a large bowl. Chop zucchini into bite-sized pieces and slice peppers into thin strips; add to corn in bowl. (Make ahead: Prepare the salad to this point, cover and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour or refrigerate for up to 1 day).
	4. Add tomatoes, beans and the remaining dressing, tossing to coat. Sprinkle with cilantro and pumpkin seeds.
Recipe Tips:
  - If you don’t have fresh corn on the cob, use 1 cup (250 mL) frozen corn kernels, thawed or drained canned corn. Toss with dressing as directed and spread on a grilling sheet, or sheet of heavy-duty foil with the edges turned up to form a rim; grill, stirring often, for about 8 minutes or until slightly charred.
---
Recipe ID: 8a37a991-175b-498c-bd21-4a249b05682f
Recipe Title: Crusted Oven-Roasted Beef and Veg with Horseradish Sauce
Recipe Summary: With just a few simple fresh ingredients, ordinary roast beef becomes extraordinary. The horseradish is an interesting base for the roast's crusty coating, adding heat and zing. You reap its flavourful benefits in the vegetables and sauce, too, by having bits of the crust come off from the roast into the pan. You can use regular potatoes, sweet potatoes or a mix of both.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 3
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 large carrots, cut in wedges
	- 2 medium potatoes, peeled or scrubbed, cut in wedges
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- Pinch EACH salt, pepper and crushed dried rosemary
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH prepared horseradish and Dijon mustard
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH minced garlic and cracked black pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Oven Roast, Petite Tender
	- Horseradish Sauce (optional)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) beef broth
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 large carrots
	- 2 medium potatoes
	- Olive oil
	- Prepared horseradish
	- Garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Oven Roast, Petite Tender
	- Horseradish Sauce (optional) 
	- Beef broth
	- Cornstarch
	- Salt and pepper
	- Dried rosemary
	- Dijon mustard
	- Cracked black pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Toss carrots and potatoes with olive oil, salt pepper and rosemary in a small shallow roasting pan or ovenproof skillet. Stir together horseradish, mustard, garlic and cracked pepper in a small bowl; rub all over roast. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer lengthwise into centre of roast. Place roast on top of vegetables.
	2. Roast, uncovered, in preheated 350ºF oven for about 45 to 60 minutes for medium-rare or until thermometer reads 145°F (63°C) at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer roast to cutting board, cover loosely with foil and let rest for 5 minutes.
	3. Meanwhile, if necessary, return vegetables to oven for about 5 minutes, cooking until tender. Transfer vegetables to a serving platter and keep warm.
	4. Horseradish Sauce: Place roasting pan over medium-high heat on the stove-top; pour in broth and rub off about 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the crust from the roast into pan. Bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up any bits stuck to pan. Gradually whisk in cornstarch mixture; cook, stirring, for about 2 minutes or until thickened slightly. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
	5. Carve roast across the grain into very thin slices and serve with vegetables and Horseradish Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Oven-roast beef on a rack or up on a layer of vegetables to encourage more even cooking.
---
Recipe ID: 8a40f321-6fd6-43d2-81cd-ea4ab276f6c8
Recipe Title: Slow-Simmered Oxtail Soup with Sherry
Recipe Summary: Nothing is more soothing or satisfying than soup simmering on the stove - and this simple yet rich tasting recipe is proof! Warm and hearty, featuring rich tender beef, a delicious sherry-infused broth and vegetables, this recipe paired with some crusty bread is comfort food at its best.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 160
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Oxtail , cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion, finely chopped
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried thyme
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 4 stalks celery, coarsely chopped, divided
	- 2 large carrots, coarsely chopped, divided
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) dry sherry
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 8 cups (2 L) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 bay leaf
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped fresh parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Oxtail , cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion
	- Dried thyme
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 4 stalks celery
	- 2 large carrots
	- Dry sherry
	- Tomato paste
	- All-purpose flour
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat oxtail dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or large heavy-bottom stockpot or saucepan. Sear oxtail, turning with tongs, for about 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil.
	2. Reduce heat to medium. Add onion, thyme, garlic and half of celery and carrots to pot. Cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until softened. 
	3. Add sherry and tomato paste; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Sprinkle flour over top; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Gradually stir in broth and add bay leaf; bring to a boil.
	4. Return oxtail to pot along with any accumulated juices. Cover, reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 2 hours or until meat is very tender. During cooking, skim surface of broth to remove any pools of fat. Using tongs, transfer oxtail to a dish and set aside until just cool enough to handle. Discard bay leaf.
	5. Add remaining carrots and celery to pot. Simmer, partially covered, for 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender and soup is slightly thickened. 
	6. Meanwhile, pull meat from oxtail; discard bones and trim. Tear meat into small pieces and stir into soup. Simmer for 5 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Portion soup into freezer-safe containers, seal tightly and label with recipe name and date. Soup can be stored in the freezer for up to 6 months. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator.
---
Recipe ID: 8a860d16-48ed-4b84-ac8d-991f1a6425fc
Recipe Title: Braised Barbacoa-Style Steak
Recipe Summary: This slow simmer dinner is perfect for the family on a cold winter's day. Since it is made with Simmering Steak, you get a meal that is much like a stew or pot roast. It's perfect to prepare in the slow cooker.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 100
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak (or 2½ lb /1.25 kg Bone-in), 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) chili powder
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 can (540 mL) chopped stewed tomatoes
	- 1 large onion, sliced lengthwise
	- ½ (38.5 g envelope) onion soup mix
	- ½ cup (125 mL) barbecue sauce
	- ½ (341 mL bottle) beer (or 1/2 cup/125 mL water)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak (or 2½ lb /1.25 kg Bone-in), 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- Chili powder
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 can (540 mL) chopped stewed tomatoes
	- 1 large onion
	- Onion soup mix (38.5 g envelope)
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Beer (or water)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut steak into 6 equal pieces. Season all over with 1/2 tsp (2 mL) each salt and pepper and chili powder. Heat oil in enamelled cast-iron pan with lid or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown steaks, in batches, for about 3 minutes on each side. Transfer to a plate and repeat with remaining steaks.
	2. Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, onion, onion soup mix, barbecue sauce and beer in a large measuring cup or bowl. 
	3. Return steaks to pot and pour in tomato mixture and bring to a simmer. Cover, reduce heat and simmer on stove top or in preheated 325°F oven for about 1¼ to 2 hours or until beef is fork-tender (OR cook in slow cooker on LOW setting for 6 to 8 hours).
	4. Remove steak from pot and keep warm. Skim fat from sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve steaks topped with sauce and onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can also choose to serve as pulled beef, tucked into taco shells or flour tortillas or use to top baked potatoes. Shred cooked beef by pulling apart with 2 forks; toss with sauce and onions.
---
Recipe ID: 8b3077e8-4276-4881-bc35-7e6ab0607633
Recipe Title: Grilled Baharat-Seasoned Beef Skewers with Salata Hara
Recipe Summary: Baharat is a Middle Eastern blend which means “spices” in Arabic and Turkish. Most households have their own favourite blend of spices, Serve these spiced beef skewers and spiced tomato sauce, Salata Hara, with pita or other flat bread and tzatziki.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 6
Recipe Marinating Time: 60
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 96
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Baharat Spice Blend 
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH fresh ground pepper, sweet paprika, ground cumin and ground coriander
	- ½ tsp (2.5 mL) ground cinnamon
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground cloves
	- ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) EACH ground nutmeg and ground cardamom
	-  Beef 
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat 
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) dried marjoram
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- Four 10-inch (25 cm) bamboo or metal skewers
	-  Salata Hara
	- 3 ripe large tomatoes 
	- ½ cup (125 mL) coarsely chopped fresh cilantro
	- 1 medium serrano or jalapeño pepper, thinly sliced
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt (approx)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Ground cloves
	- Ground nutmeg
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Rib Finger Meat 
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Salt
	- Dried marjoram
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Four 10-inch (25 cm) bamboo or metal skewers
	- 3 ripe large tomatoes 
	- Fresh cilantro
	- 1 medium serrano or jalapeño pepper
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Sweet paprika
	- Ground cumin
	- Ground coriander
	- Ground cardamom
Recipe Methods:
	1. Baharat Spice Blend: Combine pepper, paprika, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg and cardamom in a small jar, cover and shake well to combine. Measure 2 tsp (10 mL) for the Salata Hara and set remaining aside for the beef.
	2. Trim excess fat from the meat to your taste. Starting at the thicker end of each piece of meat, make a cut in between the meat and the fibrous silverskin, lifting the fat and silverskin away from the meat while you trim along the strip of meat. (Tip: Grip the silverskin with a paper towel to prevent slipping.). Discard the trim. Cut the meat crosswise into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces and place in a bowl.
	3. Add reserved Baharat Spice Mix for beef, garlic, salt, marjoram and oil to the beef. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. If using bamboo skewers, soak in water for at least 30 minutes.
	4. Salata Hara: Meanwhile, cut out core from the tomatoes; cut each tomato in half crosswise and squeeze out the seeds. Chop coarsely and place in a food processor. Add cilantro, serrano, garlic, lemon juice, salt and reserved 2 tsp (10 mL) Baharat Spice Blend. Pulse until the tomatoes are finely chopped. Season with salt to taste. Cover and refrigerate until serving, for up to 1 day.
	5. Thread the meat pieces onto skewers, dividing evenly. Grill skewers on a lightly oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 10 minutes, turning twice or more, until instant-read thermometer inserted into cubes reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Serve immediately with Salata Hara for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - The membrane on finger meat is tough. Removing it from the meat makes the meat more tender.
---
Recipe ID: 8c2c7daf-5f37-4440-9c62-0a77cd809258
Recipe Title: Teriyaki-Style Basted Oven Roast
Recipe Summary: Nothing could be more simple or delicious than savoury roast beef with an easy-to-make teriyaki glaze. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 6¼-in (15 cm) long x 5¼-in (13 cm wide) x 4¾-in (12 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 190
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH soy sauce and sherry
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dry mustard
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Soy sauce
	- Dry mustard
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast
	- Sherry
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, sherry and dry mustard in a small bowl for glaze. Brush over roast.
	2. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. 
	3. Remove roast from oven and brush all over with about 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the glaze. Reduce oven to 275°F; return roast to oven and roast, uncovered, basting with glaze once per hour, for about 2 hours and 40 minutes for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	4. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - Carving roast beef across the grain into thin slices optimizes tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: 8c6861eb-34b5-4dbb-aba7-d696949a010b
Recipe Title: Barbecue Roast Beef with Whisky BBQ Sauce
Recipe Summary: A savoury and smoky blend of spices complement the Beef Top Sirloin Roast – a lean yet flavorful juicy roast thanks to its modest marbling. When you have guests for a backyard gathering, try cooking roast beef by indirect heat in the barbecue as an easier option to grilling multiple steaks. Use a meat thermometer to ensure the roast is cooked perfectly to the doneness that you like the best – without overcooking it! NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 85
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 100
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Whisky BBQ Sauce 
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) store-bought smoky-flavoured barbecue sauce
	- ½ cup (125 mL) whisky, bourbon or rye
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) maple syrup 
	- Beef 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chili powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dried oregano leaves, ground cumin, salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH sweet smoked paprika, ground coriander and garlic powder
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast 
Recipe Shopping List:
	-  Whisky BBQ Sauce 
	- Smoky-flavoured barbecue sauce
	- Whisky, bourbon or rye
	- Maple syrup
	- Chili powder
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Sweet smoked paprika
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast 
	- Ground cumin
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Ground coriander
	- Garlic powder
Recipe Methods:
	1. Fill a drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). 
	2. Whisky BBQ Sauce: Meanwhile, combine barbecue sauce, whisky and maple syrup in a small saucepan; bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 to 8 minutes or until slightly thickened and flavours marry. Measure out ½ cup (125 mL) to use as basting sauce; reserve remaining sauce for serving. 
	3. Beef: Combine chili powder, oregano, cumin, salt, pepper, paprika, coriander and garlic in a small bowl. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Rub roast all over with seasoning mixture. 
	4. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 60 to 70 minutes for medium-rare, starting to baste with the basting portion of the Whisky BBQ Sauce 3 times after the first 20 minutes. Remove roast from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	5. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.  6. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with reserved remaining Whisky BBQ Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Transform roast and sauce into mile-high sandwiches, perfect for tailgate parties or picnics, by serving it on soft rolls with creamy coleslaw.
---
Recipe ID: 8c865286-c786-4f9c-a21f-77fc2d7385e1
Recipe Title: Grilled Spice-Rubbed Steak with Mediterranean Pasta Salad
Recipe Summary: Casual cooking is a grilled steak carved for sharing paired with a pasta salad for passing at the table.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 15
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) hot pepper sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced fresh thyme, divided
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chili powder
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steaks, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Salad
	- 3 cups (750 mL) uncooked short pasta, such as penne, rigatoni or Scoobi Doo (cavatappi), preferably whole wheat
	- 3 plum tomatoes, quartered
	- 1 EACH sweet red and yellow pepper, cut into chunks
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra virgin olive oil, divided
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH snow peas and green and yellow beans, trimmed and blanched
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) crumbled feta cheese
	- Lemon wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Hot pepper sauce
	- Fresh thyme
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Chili powder
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steaks, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Uncooked short pasta, such as penne, rigatoni or Scoobi Doo (cavatappi), preferably whole wheat
	- 3 plum tomatoes
	- Sweet red and yellow peppers
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Salt and pepper
	- Snow peas
	- 2 green onions
	- Crumbled feta cheese
	- Lemon wedges
	- Green and yellow beans
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine hot sauce, half the thyme, garlic and chili powder in medium bowl to make smooth paste. Add steaks and rub all over with spice mixture to coat; cover and refrigerate for 15 to 30 minutes.
	2. Salad: Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions. 
	3. Toss together tomatoes, red and yellow peppers, garlic and 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper to taste. Spread vegetables out on foil-lined rimmed baking sheet or transfer to a grilling basket. Broil vegetables, or grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C), stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes or until tender-crisp. 
	4. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted in centre of steak reads for 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Transfer to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 5 minutes.
	5. Drain pasta and add to the bowl used for vegetables. Add cooked vegetables to bowl and toss to combine. Add snow peas and green and yellow beans, green onions, feta cheese, and remaining thyme and oil; toss together. Season to taste with a squeeze of lemon juice.
	6. Carve steaks across the grain and serve with pasta salad and lemon wedges to squeeze over top. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 8c8f65fb-869c-4066-b296-a3ebfa789ef2
Recipe Title: Southwestern Pan-Fried Minute Steak and Kidney Beans
Recipe Summary: This recipe is much like having a stir-fry without the cooking urgency that a typical stir-fry demands. For dinner in 20 minutes, start by making the rice; as it cooks, you can get everything else made and ready to serve.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH Cajun spice (see Tip) and ground cumin
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and hot pepper flakes
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Minute/Sandwich/Fast-fry Steaks
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil, divided
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped red onion
	- 1 sweet red pepper, diced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH salsa and frozen corn kernels
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) ketchup
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Cajun spice
	- Salt and hot pepper flakes
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Minute/Sandwich/Fast-fry Steaks
	- Olive oil
	- Red onion
	- 1 sweet red pepper
	- Salsa
	- Ketchup
	- Red kidney beans
	- Lime wedges
	- Ground cumin
	- Frozen corn kernels
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine Cajun spice, cumin, salt and hot pepper flakes in a small bowl; set half aside. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; sprinkle both sides with remaining spice mixture.
	 2. Heat half the oil in nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and cook steaks, in batches as necessary, for 4 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more until steaks are cooked to medium (160°F/71°C) at the least. Transfer to a plate, cover with foil to keep warm; set aside.
	 3. Meanwhile, reduce heat to medium and add remaining oil to skillet. Cook onion, red pepper and reserved spice mixture, stirring occasionally, for about 4 minutes or until onion is softened. Stir in salsa, corn, ketchup and beans; cook, stirring, for about 4 minutes or until heated through.
	 4. Cut steak across the grain into thin slices. Add to vegetable mixture and toss to combine. Serve with squeeze of lime.
Recipe Tips:
  - If you don’t have Cajun spice, use ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH sweet paprika, dried oregano leaves, garlic powder and dried thyme leaves.
---
Recipe ID: 8ce1c113-bddb-442a-bfea-c5586f21083a
Recipe Title: Sweet and Tangy Apple Mint Slaw
Recipe Summary: The colourful crispy apple slaw is the perfect match for beef sausage, burgers and even as a taco topper.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH rice vinegar and vegetable oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH fresh lemon or lime juice and liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced fresh mint, cilantro or parsley
	- 1 large apple (skin on), julienned
	- 1 large carrot, julienned or grated
	- 1 stalk celery, thinly sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) thinly sliced red onion
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk together vinegar, oil, lemon juice, honey and mint in a medium bowl.&nbsp;
	2. Add apple, carrot, celery and onion to dressing; toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste; toss well. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes before serving.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - To make ahead, cover and refrigerate the slaw for up to 4 hours before serving. Use a cortland or gala apple, if possible, as they don’t brown as quickly as some varieties.
---
Recipe ID: 8d635c89-e799-4182-824f-d311f897bab6
Recipe Title: Burgers with Creamy Dill Sauce on Garlic Parm Texas Toast
Recipe Summary: You will be a barbecue hero when you make these juicy homemade Canadian beef burgers with swoon-worthy burger sauce set atop crusty Furlani Garlic Parm Texas Toast. Switch up the burger toppings to suit your family’s favourites! Get more meal ideas using lean ground beef at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH grated Parmesan cheese and grated yellow or red onion
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Dijon mustard 
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) mayonnaise 
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped dill pickles
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh dill (or 2 tsp/10 mL dried dill weed)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) pickle juice
	- ½ cup (125 mL) seasoned dry bread crumbs
	- 2 eggs, beaten
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 1¼ lb (625 g) Canadian Lean Ground Beef
	- 8 slices Furlani® Garlic Parm Texas Toast 
	- 4 slices Cheddar cheese (optional)
	- Green leaf lettuce
	- Sliced tomatoes
	- Shaved red onion
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
	- Dijon mustard
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Mayonnaise
	- Dill pickles
	- Pickle juice
	- Fresh dill (or dried dill weed)
	- Seasoned dry bread crumbs
	- 2 eggs
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1¼ lb (625 g)  Canadian Lean Ground Beef
	- 8 slices Garlic Parm Texas Toast
	- 4 slices Cheddar cheese (optional)
	- Green leaf lettuce
	- Sliced tomatoes
	- 1 Red onion
	- 1 Yellow or red onion
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine Parmesan, onion, mustard and garlic in a large bowl. Measure out 2 tbsp (30 mL) and combine with mayonnaise, chopped pickles, dill and pickle juice in a medium bowl. Cover and refrigerate dill sauce for at least 20 minutes or up to 3 days. 
	2. Add bread crumbs, eggs, salt and pepper to the large bowl; stir to combine. Gently mix in your Canadian ground beef with a fork (careful not to over-mix). Divide evenly into four portions and form into ¾-inch (2 cm) thick patties.  
	3. Make a thumbprint depression in centre of each patty (to prevent puffing while grilling). Grill burgers on oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 14 minutes, turning twice or more, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each burger reads 160°F (71°C). (Note – top each burger with a cheese slice near the end of cooking if using).
	4. Meanwhile, grill Furlani Garlic Parm Texas Toast according to package instructions.  
	5. Arrange lettuce, tomato, burgers, about 2 tbsp (30 mL) dill sauce and onion on grilled Furlani Garlic Parm Texas Toast slices. Cap with remaining toast slices. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Plan ahead and enjoy easy summer meals by preparing a double batch of the burger patties. Stack four uncooked patties between pieces of waxed or parchment paper and store in an airtight container or place in sealable plastic bag. Freeze for up to 3 months. These burgers are also delicious served on Furlani® Garlic Texas Toast. Any leftover dill sauce can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Use as a dip for crunchy vegetables, as a salad dressing or sandwich spread. Get more information and recipes for over 70 beef cuts at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
---
Recipe ID: 8d74eb6a-19f7-4010-9a1f-9f1836a2f533
Recipe Title: Herb and Garlic Oven-Roasted Beef with Chimichurri Sauce
Recipe Summary: Roast beef is studded with thyme and garlic, marinated and then oven-roasted to perfection. Everyone needs a good chimichurri sauce recipe to serve with roast beef, and this one is the perfect match! NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 560
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 6 cloves garlic, cut into slivers, divided
	- 9 thyme sprigs, divided
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH red wine vinegar and vegetable oil
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Oven Roast 
	-  Chimichurri Sauce 
	- 2 cups (500 mL) lightly packed cilantro, leaves and stems
	- 1 cup (250 mL) lightly packed Italian parsley, leaves and stems
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper sauce
	- ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) salt
	- Pinch fresh ground pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lemon juice
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- 9 thyme sprigs
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Top Sirloin Cap Oven Roast 
	- Cilantro, leaves and stems
	- Italian parsley, leaves and stems
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Hot pepper sauce
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Vegetable oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine half of the garlic slivers, six of the thyme sprigs, vinegar, oil, and a pinch of salt in a large sealable freezer bag. Using the point of a sharp knife, score the fat side of the sirloin cap in a crosshatch pattern. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste; place in bag, massaging marinade into meat; seal bag and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan, fat side up. Cut shallow slits all over roast; insert remaining garlic slivers and leaves from the remaining thyme sprigs into slits. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Cook, uncovered, in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 50 minutes for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	 3. Chimichurri Sauce : Meanwhile, combine cilantro, parsley, garlic, hot pepper sauce, salt and pepper in food processor; pulse until chopped. With motor running, gradually blend in olive oil and lemon juice until mixture resembles pesto. (Make-ahead: Chimichurri Sauce can be prepared up to 12 hours in advance and kept refrigerated for up to 2 days.)
	4. Transfer roast to cutting board and let rest for 15 minutes. Carve across the grain into thin slices and arrange on a serving platter with the chimichurri alongside.
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your oven roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: 8d7e57a4-3fd0-49bc-89d0-75ea03424c07
Recipe Title: Stovetop Beef Noodle Bowl
Recipe Summary: Noodle bowls are a traditional comfort food in Asian cuisines. Made with a ginger-infused broth and Beef Stir-fry Strips, this delicious meal-soup recipe is low in fat and high in flavour.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 15
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) sodium-reduced soy sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Asian chili sauce
	- 12 oz (375 g) Beef Stir-Fry Strips
	- 5 cups (1.25 L) reduced-sodium chicken broth
	- 3 slices (¼-inch /5 mm thick) gingerroot
	- 2 cloves garlic, sliced
	- 2 cups (500 mL) sliced bok choy or spinach leaves
	- ½ pkg (350 g) refrigerated fresh chow mein noodles
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH slivered sweet red pepper, sliced carrot and sliced green beans
	- Chopped green onion and fresh cilantro
	- Sesame oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Sodium-reduced soy sauce
	- Asian chili sauce
	- 12 oz (375 g) Beef Stir-Fry Strips
	- Reduced-sodium chicken broth
	- 3 slices (¼-inch /5 mm thick) gingerroot
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Bok choy or spinach leaves
	- ½ pkg (350 g) refrigerated fresh chow mein noodles
	- Sweet red pepper
	- Green onion
	- Sesame oil
	- Carrot
	- Green beans
	- Fresh cilantro
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce and chili sauce in medium bowl. Add beef strips, toss to coat and set aside. 
	2. Combine broth, gingerroot and garlic in large pot and bring to boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in bok choy and noodles; return to simmer and cook for 3 minutes. Add beef with marinade; return to simmer and cook for 3 minutes or until beef is just pink inside and noodles are tender.
	3. Transfer about 1 cup (250 mL) noodles, meat and bok choy with tongs to each of 4 soup bowls. Top each with red pepper, carrot and green beans. Garnish with green onion and cilantro, to taste, and ladle in remaining hot broth. Finish each bowl with a few drops of sesame oil.
Recipe Tips:
  - Since Beef Stir-Fry Strips are thinly cut, marinating time can be brief.
---
Recipe ID: 8e21b3a6-a729-4dce-be90-db68be6ecf2f
Recipe Title: Brazilian-Style Barbecued Roast with Pineapple Skewers
Recipe Summary: Our roast is rubbed all over with a sweet and savoury spice blend that transforms into a delicious crust when cooked on the grill. Red pepper and pineapple chunks, tossed in a traditional Brazilian-style cinnamon butter, then skewered and grilled, act as the perfect sweet and colourful side. It’s enough beef to serve a crowd, and yet it’s so easy to prepare since most of the time is handled by the barbecue!
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 100
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 130
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Roast 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH dried oregano and salt
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground coriander, ground cumin and paprika 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH garlic powder, onion powder and fresh ground pepper
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground cinnamon
	- 1 Beef Bottom Sirloin Ball Tip Oven Roast (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- Kabobs 
	- 8 long bamboo skewers
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH packed brown sugar, vegetable oil and melted butter
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground cinnamon
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
	- 3 sweet red peppers, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
	- 1 cored peeled pineapple, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Dried oregano
	- Ground coriander
	- Garlic powder
	- Ground cinnamon
	- 1  Beef Bottom Sirloin Ball Tip Oven Roast (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 8 long bamboo skewers
	- Vegetable oil
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Salt
	- 3 sweet red peppers
	- 1 pineapple
	- Ground cumin
	- Paprika
	- Onion powder
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Butter
Recipe Methods:
	1. Roast: Whisk together brown sugar, oregano, salt, coriander, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper and cinnamon in a small bowl. Pierce roast all over with fork. Rub roast all over with all of the spice mixture until evenly coated. Place on a plate and cover loosely with a clean kitchen towel. Refrigerate for 1 hour. 
	 2. Fill drip pan with ½ inch (1 cm) water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	3. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1½ hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: see ‘ESTIMATED COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. 
	5. Kabobs: Meanwhile, whisk brown sugar, oil, melted butter, cinnamon and salt in a large bowl until well combined. Add red pepper and pineapple chunks; toss to coat evenly. Thread pineapple, alternating with red pepper, onto soaked skewers. 
	6. Grill skewers over medium-high heat, turning as needed, for 8 to 10 minutes or until tender and lightly charred at the edges. Carve roast across the grain into very thin slices. Serve warm roast with grilled kabobs.
Recipe Tips:
  - Leftover roast can be stored, tightly covered, in the refrigerator for 3 to 5 days. Carve thinly to make cold roast beef sandwiches, serve over salad or finely chop to make quesadillas.
---
Recipe ID: 8e4354f5-1992-4255-8d2a-501a0208b2cb
Recipe Title: Goulash-Style Braised Beef with Noodles
Recipe Summary: This delicious beef braise is based on the flavours of goulash.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 105
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 whole small-sized Beef Digital Flexor Meat (each about 10 oz/300 g), ends trimmed
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) finely diced onions
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) sweet paprika
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) caraway seeds, crushed
	- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth
	- 6 tbsp (90 mL) tomato paste
	- 2 sprigs fresh thyme (or 1/4 tsp/1 mL dried)
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Pinch EACH cayenne pepper and ground cloves
	- Cooked egg noodles, rice or potatoes
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) coarsely chopped fresh dill
	- Sour cream (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 whole small-sized  Beef Digital Flexor Meat  (each about 10 oz/300 g), ends trimmed
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onions
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Sweet paprika
	- Caraway seeds
	- Beef broth
	- Tomato paste
	- 2 sprigs fresh thyme (or 1/4 tsp/1 mL dried)
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Cayenne pepper
	- Cooked egg noodles, rice or potatoes
	- Fresh dill
	- Sour cream (optional)
	- Ground cloves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Season beef all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef and cook, turning with tongs, until browned on all sides (it will curl while cooking and this is fine). Transfer to electric pressure cooker. Set aside. 
	 2. Add onions and garlic to the skillet and reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring frequently, for about 10 minutes or until the onions soften and start to brown. Add paprika and caraway seeds; cook, stirring, for about 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add the beef broth and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. 
	3. Pour broth mixture over the beef in pressure cooker. Stir in tomato paste, thyme, bay leaf, cayenne, cloves and ½ tsp (2 mL) salt. Seal the electric pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to HIGH and time for 1 hour. 
	4. When the timer beeps, allow pressure to release naturally for 10 minutes, then quick release remaining pressure. Turn off the pot and remove the lid. The sauce should be lightly thickened. If not, remove the meat with a slotted spoon and keep warm in a bowl. Set cooker on sauté and boil sauce until it thickens slightly. There should be approximately 3 cups (750 mL) of sauce. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary, adding a good sprinkling of pepper. Discard bay leaf and thyme stems.
	5. Slice each piece of meat across the grain into slices. Arrange the meat in 4 separate bowls or plates with your noodles. Cover with the sauce and sprinkle with dill. Serve with sour cream, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Stovetop instructions: Prepare the ingredients, adding them to a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster instead of an electric pressure cooker. Increase the beef broth to 4 cups (1 L). Cover tightly and simmer over low heat for three hours.
---
Recipe ID: 8e614b71-ab5e-42b7-a114-4a1f3dd75e8a
Recipe Title: Beef Nihari
Recipe Summary: Beef shank is the star in this Indian-style stew. Tender and full of so much flavour. This is a special occasion dish. Serve with naan.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Nihari seasoning mix (see Tip)
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) canola or sunflower oil
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Boneless Shank, cut into 3-inch (8 cm) pieces 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) fried onions (see Tip**)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH garlic paste and gingerroot paste (see Tip*)
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) sweet paprika
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground fennel seed
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground turmeric 
	- Julienned gingerroot
	- Fresh cilantro leaves, chopped
	- Green chili peppers, chopped
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic paste*
	- Gingerroot paste*
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Green chili peppers
	- Limes
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Boneless Shank, cut into 3-inch (8 cm) pieces 
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Sweet paprika
	- Ground fennel seed
	- Nihari seasoning mix (see Tip)
	- Ground turmeric 
	- Fried onions**
	- All-purpose flour
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk flour with 2 cups (500 mL) water in a medium bowl. Whisk Nihari seasoning with ½ cup (125 mL) water in a measuring cup or small bowl. Set both aside separately.
	2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven or cast-iron enamelled roaster. Add beef and fried onions; cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. Stir in garlic, gingerroot paste, paprika, fennel and turmeric. Stir in 5 cups (1.25 L) water and bring to a simmer. Gradually stir in flour mixture and Nihari seasoning mixture.
	3. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 2 to 3 hours until beef is fork-tender. Check the stew as it simmers and add more water as needed to keep it saucy. 
	4. Serve garnished with julienned gingerroot, cilantro, green chilies and lime wedges to squeeze over top. 
	Tips:
	Look for powdered Nihari seasoning mix in the Southeast Asian section of well-stocked supermarkets or specialty grocery stores.
	*For the garlic and gingerroot paste, you can use the purée or paste found in jars in the grocery store or use a fine grater, such as a Microplane, to make your own purée in small amounts just as you need it.
	**Fried onions, which are crispy, dehydrated fried onions, can be found in packages or containers at any Indian grocery store or in the Southeast Asian section of well-stocked supermarkets. 
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 900c5a70-f7de-42b2-906f-1befbadeda08
Recipe Title: Korean-Style Slow-Simmered Beef Soup
Recipe Summary: This rich and creamy broth is the “Big Daddy” of bone broths. The lively and multiple boilings of the broth extract all of the goodness from the bones. This is a much-loved soup in Korea and is eagerly anticipated in winter. Use as you would any bone broth or use in cooking when clarity of the broth is not important.
Recipe Prep Time: 60
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 810
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 870
Recipe Servings: 12
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 lbs (3.5 kg) Beef Soup Bones, 2- to 3-inch (5 to 7.5 cm) pieces
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Digital Flexor Meat or Hind Shank (Bubble Meat) 
	- Cooked short grain rice 
	- A generous amount of thinly sliced green onions
	- Salt
	- Kimchi
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 8 lbs (3.5 kg)  Beef Soup Bones,  2- to 3-inch (5 to 7.5 cm) pieces
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Boneless Beef Digital Flexor Meat or Hind Shank (Bubble Meat) 
	- Cooked short grain rice 
	- Green onions
	- Salt
	- Kimchi
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rinse the bones and meat with cold water. Place in a large bowl, pot or container and add cold water to cover bones. Cover and refrigerate overnight.
	2. Drain off soaking water. Combine beef bones and meat in a 12-quart (12 L) stockpot. Add cold water to cover by 2 inches (5 cm). Bring to a boil over high heat; boil, uncovered, for 15 minutes. Drain and discard the water. 
	3. Rinse the bones and meat under cool water, carefully removing any scum clinging to the bones. Wash out the pot and return the bones and meat to the pot. Add 8 quarts (8 L) water and return to a boil over high heat. Remove any scum that rises to the surface with a large spoon, then turn down to a medium-low. Cover and boil for 2 to 3 hours, until meat is tender (timing will depend on the cut used). 
	4. Remove the meat from broth with a slotted spoon and place in a bowl of cold water to prevent it from darkening. When meat is cool, remove from the water, cover and refrigerate until serving. Meanwhile, continue boiling the broth for 1 to 2 hours longer (for a total of 4 hours), maintaining a water level of 2 inches (7.5 cm) above the bones by adding water as needed, until flavour is developed. Maintain a steady boil while cooking. 
	 5. Drain the broth through a colander or large sieve into a large bowl or another pot; reserve the liquid and return bones to the stockpot. Let broth from this first cooking cool, then cover and refrigerate. Add 6 quarts (6 L) of water to the bones and return to the heat. Cover and cook, as above, maintaining a steady boil for 4 hours.
	6. Add the first broth to the broth in the pot. Cover and boil once more for 4 hours, allowing the water to reduce to just above the level of the bones. Remove from the heat and strain, reserving the liquid. Discard solids. There should be approximately 6 quarts (6 L). If you’re not serving it immediately, let cool and refrigerate. Store broth in airtight containers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 6 months.
	7. Soup: When ready to serve, skim off the fat, if desired. For each serving, bring 2 cups (500 mL) broth to a boil over high heat in a saucepan. Slice the reserved meat across the grain into ¼-inch (5 mm) thick slices, using 6 slices per person, or more or less as you prefer. Ladle the broth into bowls and add slices of the meat. Set out individual bowls of rice, green onions, salt and kimchi for each diner to add to their serving to their taste. Or alternatively, the rice can be put into the soup or eaten on the side with kimchi.
Recipe Tips:
  - The broth and bones from the first boiling can be refrigerated overnight and the second boiling of the bones resumed the next day. Soaking the bones and meat overnight plus the initial brief boiling ensures that the broth remains white, rather than turning an unappetizing pinky-gray colour.
---
Recipe ID: 9012df26-8308-42a8-a5fe-a868d4c7973a
Recipe Title: Pear and Goat Cheese Watercress Salad
Recipe Summary: Peppery watercress is accented with sweet pear, tangy goat cheese and garlicky croutons in this upscale salad. Serve on the side, or top with, your favourite grilled steak or leftover roast beef.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 18
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 33
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 thick slices garlic bread
	- Half a shallot, cut in half
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) sherry vinegar or wine vinegar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
	- 8 oz (250 g) watercress or baby arugula (about 2 packages)
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) thinly sliced red onion
	- 1 ripe pear, peeled, if desired, and thinly sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) crumbled goat cheese
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut garlic bread into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes and spread in a single layer on a parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet. Bake in preheated 325°F oven for about 18 to 20 minutes, stirring twice, or until golden brown and crispy all the way through. Let stand for 2 to 4 hours before serving.
	2. Combine shallot, vinegar, oil and salt in a mini chopper; pulse until mixture is almost smooth.
	3. Pour half of the dressing over watercress in a large bowl; toss to coat. Arrange on serving plates, top with onion and pear and drizzle with remaining dressing. Scatter goat cheese and croutons over salads.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can used store-bought garlic bread to make the croutons or make your own. To make your own, combine 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH olive oil and softened butter, 1 small clove garlic, finely grated or minced, and salt and pepper to taste in a small bowl. Spread over four ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices of bakery-style crusty bread, then cut into cubes and bake as directed.

Recipe ID: 90f14596-c46b-4580-a6ca-313d25bd1270
Recipe Title: Barbecued Mustard-Rubbed Roast Beef with Apple Salsa
Recipe Summary: This juicy roast beef features a savoury herb and mustard crust and unique apple salsa. Use a meat thermometer to cook your roast to the doneness that you like the best – without overcooking it! Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 4½-in (11 cm) long x 6½-in (16 cm) wide x 2½-in (6.5 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 110
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) grainy or plain Dijon mustard
	- 3 large cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) Worcestershire sauce 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dried oregano, thyme and rosemary, crushed (or 1 tbsp/15 mL each chopped fresh)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast
	-  Apple Salsa 
	- 1 large tart apple, such as McIntosh, diced
	- 1 plum tomato, seeded and diced
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) chopped green onion
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH cider vinegar and chopped fresh cilantro or parsley
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) prepared horseradish
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 3 to 4 tsp (15 to 20 mL) minced fresh or pickled jalapeño peppers
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Grainy or plain Dijon mustard
	- 3 large cloves garlic
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Dried oregano (or fresh)
	- Dried thyme (or fresh)
	- Dried rosemary (or fresh)
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast
	- 1 large tart apple, such as McIntosh
	- 1 plum tomato
	- Green onion
	- Cider vinegar
	- Prepared horseradish
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Fresh or pickled jalapeño peppers
	- Salt and pepper
	- Fresh cilantro or parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine mustard, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, thyme, rosemary and pepper to make a thick, spreadable paste. Spread all over roast.
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	3. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1½ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	4. Apple Salsa: Meanwhile, combine apple, tomato, green onion, cider vinegar, cilantro, horseradish, garlic, jalapeño peppers to taste, and salt and pepper to taste. Mix well; let stand for 30 minutes. Taste before serving; add more herbs or seasonings if needed. Makes about 1¾ cups (425 mL).
	5. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Slice thinly across the grain. Serve with Apple Salsa.
Recipe Tips:
  - To serve roast beef, carve across the grain into thin slices to optimize tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: 91b9d4ce-15f0-460b-bc9c-3245d00918fb
Recipe Title: Creole Mustard Beef Oscar
Recipe Summary: You can add even more flavour by seasoning the meat with your favourite steak spice.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 oz	(250 g)	fresh or frozen raw shrimp and scallops, shelled
	- 8 spears		fresh or frozen asparagus, cut into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces
	- 1 lb	(500 g)	Beef Grilling Steaks (e.g. Strip Loin or Rib Eye)
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 tsp	(5 mL)	minced garlic
	- 1/2 bottle	(175 mL)	Renee’s Gourmet Creole Mustard Sauce
	- 1/2 tsp	(2 mL)	dried parsley or tarragon
	- 2 tbsp	(30 mL)	grated Parmesan cheese (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 8 oz fresh or frozen raw shrimp and scallops, shelled
	- 8 spears fresh or frozen asparagus
	- 1 lb	(500 g)	Beef Grilling Steaks (e.g. Strip Loin or Rib Eye)
	- Salt and pepper
	- Garlic
	- Creole Mustard Sauce
	- Dried parsley or tarragon
	- Grated Parmesan cheese (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook seafood and asparagus in large saucepan of boiling, salted water for 2 to 3 minutes or until shrimp are pink and scallops are opaque. Drain and set aside.
	2. Season steaks with salt and pepper; broil, grill or pan-fry to desired doneness. 
	3. Sauté garlic in lightly oiled frying pan. Stir in Creole Mustard Sauce, parsley, cooked seafood and asparagus; heat through. Pour over cooked steaks. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, if desired.
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: 923ce25f-6c59-4ddd-9f38-f1b469ab1bd7
Recipe Title: Bibimbap-Style Grilled Beef Burgers with Veggies and Cucumber Salad
Recipe Summary: A sweet-salty contrast and a touch of chili heat, pack this Asian-inspired recipe with a real flavour punch. Topped with a mound of delicious sautéed vegetables and served with a cucumber side salad, this weeknight burger recipe will impress and satisfy all.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Cucumber Salad
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) rice vinegar
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) reduced-sodium soy sauce
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) granulated sugar
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) Korean chili paste (Gochujang) or Sriracha
		- 2 English cucumbers, diagonally sliced
	- Sautéed Vegetables
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) reduced-sodium soy sauce
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) packed brown sugar
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH minced garlic and minced gingerroot
		- 4 tsp (20 mL) sesame oil
		- 1 lb (500 g) sliced mixed mushrooms, such as cremini, shiitake and oyster
		- 1 cup (250 mL) matchstick or shredded carrots
		- 1 pkg (142 g) baby spinach (about 6 cups/1.5 L)
	- Burgers
		- 6 Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
		- 6 small whole-wheat hamburger buns, lightly toasted
		- 6 eggs, fried
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH black and white toasted sesame seeds
		-  Korean-style Mayo 
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) light mayonnaise
		- 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) Korean chili paste (Gochujang) or Sriracha
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Rice vinegar
	- Reduced-sodium soy sauce
	- Granulated sugar
	- Korean chili paste (Gochujang) or Sriracha
	- 2 English cucumbers
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Garlic
	- Sesame oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced mixed mushrooms, such as cremini, shiitake and oyster
	- Carrots
	- 1 pkg (142 g) baby spinach (about 6 cups/1.5 L)
	- 6  Beef Burgers,  ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 6 small whole-wheat hamburger buns, lightly toasted
	- 6 eggs
	- Black and white toasted sesame seeds
	- Light mayonnaise
	- Gingerroot
Recipe Methods:
	Cucumber Salad: : 
		1. Whisk together vinegar, soy sauce, sugar and chili paste in a large bowl. Add cucumbers; toss and set aside until ready to serve.
	Sautéed Vegetables: : 
		2. Whisk together soy sauce, sugar, garlic and ginger in a small bowl. Heat sesame oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add mushrooms; cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until softened and lightly browned. Add carrots; cook, stirring, 2 minutes or until softened. Add spinach and soy sauce mixture. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until wilted. Remove from heat, cover and keep warm.
	Burgers: : 
		3. Make a thumbprint depression in centre of each burger (to prevent rounding while grilling). Grill burgers over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) in a closed preheated barbecue for 10 to 14 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick burgers, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each burger reads 160°F (71°C).
		4. Korean-style Mayo: Meanwhile, whisk together mayonnaise and chili paste to taste in a small bowl. Set aside.
		5. Place bun bottoms on 6 serving plates and spread cut sides with Korean-style Mayo, top with burgers then sautéed vegetables, a fried egg and sesame seeds and bun tops. Serve with cucumber salad on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - Transform this into a Burger Bowl by omitting the bun and serving vegetables and burgers over cooked whole-grain rice dolloped with mayo.

Recipe ID: 9245227c-3a91-4689-84da-bbef2b9ad47d
Recipe Title: Grilled Mustard-Rubbed Steak with Berry Salsa
Recipe Summary: This colourful salsa and steak recipe combination is perfect for the summer berry season. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 12
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 27
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) halved strawberries
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whole blueberries
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar 
	- 1 small jalapeño pepper, seeded and thinly diced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) grated gingerroot
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely grated orange zest
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely grated lemon zest
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dry mustard
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1 steak)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Strawberries
	- Whole blueberries
	- Liquid honey
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- 1 small jalapeño pepper
	- Gingeroot
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Orange zest
	- Lemon zest
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Dry mustard
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1 steak)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine berries, honey and vinegar in food processor or blender; process until coarsely chopped. Transfer to a bowl; stir in jalapeño and gingerroot. (This can be covered and refrigerated for up to 2 hours.)
	2. Combine garlic, orange zest, lemon zest and juice, mustard, salt and pepper in small bowl. Spread on both sides of steaks.
	3. Grill steaks over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	4. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steaks across the grain and serve with a spoonful of the Berry Salsa.
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to let steaks rest for about 5 minutes after cooking so that the juices get the chance to settle before you serve or slice.
---
Recipe ID: 9256f3f2-ab72-4e5e-8313-3e30efe7ee38
Recipe Title: Indirect Heat Barbecue-Roasted Thick-Cut Steak
Recipe Summary: For cooking super-thick steaks or roasts on the barbecue, the best way to cook them is by indirect heat which basically turns your barbecue into an outdoor oven. This method will have you cooking outdoors all summer.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Tomahawk-style Rib Grilling Steak, 1-bone thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- Coarse salt and ground pepper 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Tomahawk-style Rib Grilling Steak,  1-bone thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- Coarse salt and ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Fill drip pan part way with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). 
	2. Pat steak dry with paper towel. Season all over with coarse salt and ground pepper. 
	3. Place steak on grill over flame and cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until nicely browned. Move steak to grill over the drip pan; insert oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into the centre of the steak, avoiding fat or bone. Turn off burner under drip pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into centre of steak, avoiding fat or bone. Close lid and cook with indirect heat for about 40 to 50 minutes for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	4. Transfer steak to cutting board, cover loosely with foil and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes. Carve meat from the bone, then across the grain into thin slices. Arrange on cutting board or platter with the bone. Sprinkle with coarse salt and ground pepper to finish.
Recipe Tips:
  - For a pristine look to the bone, wrap it in foil prior to cooking.
---
Recipe ID: 92c0b051-2393-46fe-bc27-a3167e14052f
Recipe Title: Zesty-marinated Grilled Steak with Stir-fried Veggies
Recipe Summary: Simple ingredients combine for a zesty marinade for value-priced Eye of Round Steaks. The stir-fried vegetables are ready in just minutes and add a burst of colour and antioxidants to the plate. Serve over steamed rice or creamy polenta.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 505
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) tomato paste
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Eye of Round Marinating Steaks, 1/2 inch (1 cm) thick (about 4)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sesame oil
	- 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
	- 1 EACH large sweet red and green pepper, cut into large pieces
	- ½ red onion, cut into chunks
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- Salt
	- Sliced green onions
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Tomato paste
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Eye of Round Marinating Steaks, 1/2 inch (1 cm) thick (about 4)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- Sesame oil
	- 1 EACH large sweet red and green peppers
	- Red onion
	- Green onions
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine garlic, Worcestershire sauce and tomato paste in a sealable freezer bag. Pierce steaks all over and add to bag, massaging marinade into meat; seal and refrigerate for at least 8 to 12 hours.
