	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. 
	3. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer steaks to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	4. Stir-fried Vegetables: Meanwhile, heat vegetable and sesame oils over high heat in a large skillet or wok. Stir-fry garlic, red and green peppers and onion for 2 to 3 minutes or until tender-crisp. Add Worcestershire sauce and stir-fry for 30 to 60 seconds or until vegetables are coated. Season to taste with salt.
	5. Slice steaks thinly across the grain at a 45-degree angle. Serve with stir-fried vegetables and garnish with green onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - Carving Marinating Steaks across the grain maximizes tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: 93850252-594d-487a-a5b7-71998170b71f
Recipe Title: Sous Vide Caesar-Dressed Steak and Salad
Recipe Summary: The steakhouse classic gets reinvented with a sous vide cooking technique and simple bed of salad for serving. The act of cooking vacuum-sealed food, in a low-temperature water bath, produces steak that’s cooked to the doneness that’s perfect for your preference every time. Sous vide cooking is easy to master. Use the manufacturer’s instructions and reputable resources, such as cookbooks, to source more tips and tricks to mastering this cooking trend. This steak is also known as a Porterhouse Grilling Steak and it has the same type of bone you find in a T-bone Steak.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 165
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) grated Parmesan cheese, divided
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) olive oil 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH mayonnaise and fresh lemon juice
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH anchovy paste and Worcestershire sauce 
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- 2 Beef Porterhouse T-bone Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- 2 romaine lettuce hearts, torn
	- 1 cup (250 mL) large garlic-flavoured croutons, crushed
	- Lemon wedges
	- Additional fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
	- Olive oil
	- Mayonnaise
	- Dijon mustard
	- Anchovy paste
	- Garlic
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 Beef Porterhouse T-bone Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- 2 romaine lettuce hearts
	- Large garlic-flavoured croutons
	- 2 lemons
	- Worcestershire sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 130°F (54.5°C) for medium-rare or 140°F (60°C) for medium according to manufacturer’s directions. 
	2. Combine ¼ cup (60 mL) of the Parmesan, oil, mayonnaise, lemon juice, mustard, anchovy paste, Worcestershire sauce, garlic and ½ tsp (2 mL) each of the salt and pepper in a small bowl. Measure out ¼ cup (60 mL) and set aside to dress the lettuce. Pat steaks dry with paper towel, place on a plate and coat all over with remaining dressing mixture. 
	3. Place each steak in a large vacuum seal bag and vacuum seal the bags. 
	4. Immerse bags in preheated water bath and weigh down to submerge, if necessary. Cook sous vide for 2½ hours. 
	5. To serve, preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C).
	6. Remove the beef from the water bath. Remove steaks from bags, discarding liquid from bags, and transfer to a plate. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; season all over with remaining salt and pepper. Grill steaks for 2 to 4 minutes, turning once, or until sizzling and well-browned on both sides.
	 7. Transfer steaks to a cutting board. Carve meat from the bone, then across the grain into slices. 
	8. Toss lettuce with reserved dressing in a large bowl. Add Parmesan, croutons and additional pepper, to taste, and toss to combine. Arrange carved steak on a serving platter with salad and garnish with lemon wedges.
Recipe Tips:
  - Place croutons in a sealable plastic bag and smash with a heavy-bottomed saucepan or the side of a rolling pin to crush into coarse crumbs (not dust). Alternatively, you can serve this recipe as lettuce wraps: place a slice of steak in a halved Romaine lettuce leaf, drizzle with reserved dressing and sprinkle with Parmesan, pepper and crushed croutons.
---
Recipe ID: 93a21513-e96a-4a4c-aea4-5ad93a42e41f
Recipe Title: Oven-Braised Beef Sinigang
Recipe Summary: This dish has a lovely fresh flavour from the mango and fresh tomatoes. Slightly exotic but made from basic ingredients. If making this dish as a starter course, it is best to cut the short ribs into ¾-inch (2 cm) cubes.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 5
Recipe Total Time: 145
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) thick-cut Boneless Beef Simmering Short Ribs (about 6)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 red onion, diced
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 2½ cups (625 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 3 slightly under-ripe alphonso mangoes, peeled, pitted and diced (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 3 tomatoes, diced (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- 3 cups (750 mL) baby spinach (about 3 oz/90 g)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 red onion
	- 3 slightly under-ripe alphonso mangoes (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 3 tomatoes, diced (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- 3 oz (90 g) baby spinach
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) thick-cut Boneless Beef Simmering Short Ribs (about 6)
	- Vegetable oil
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim fat from meat, if desired. Pat dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef, in batches, for about 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a plate.
	2. Drain off all but 2 tbsp (30 mL) fat from the pan. Reduce heat to medium. Cook onion, stirring, for about 4 minutes or until softened. Stir in canned tomatoes (with juice) and beef broth. Return beef and accumulated juices to pot. Bring to boil.
	3. Cover and bake in preheated 325°F oven for 1½ to 2 hours or until meat is fork-tender. Stir in diced mango, fresh tomatoes and spinach until spinach is wilted.
Recipe Tips:
  - Simmer beef in the oven rather than on the stove-top for a constant simmer with less chance of scorching.
---
Recipe ID: 9401781c-c362-4cc0-9b40-4bfc89d49cc2
Recipe Title: Stovetop Ground Beef Pantry Chili
Recipe Summary: This recipe is a snap to pull together with simple pantry ingredients. Use it to fill tortillas and bake as a casserole (see Tip for Chili Enchiladas recipe) or just serve from the pot with wedges of baked tortillas. If you prefer a fiery version, add a teaspoon or so of chopped canned chipotle peppers.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef Sirloin
	- 1 large onion, diced
	- 1 large sweet pepper, diced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chili powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground cumin
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes (with juice)
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) tomato sauce
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) black beans, drained and rinsed
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) thawed frozen corn kernels
	- Sliced green onions (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef Sirloin
	- 1 large onion
	- 1 large sweet pepper
	- Chili powder
	- Ground cumin
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes (with juice)
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) tomato sauce
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) black beans
	- Frozen corn kernels
	- Green onions (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook beef, onion, sweet pepper, chili powder and cumin over medium heat in large saucepan or Dutch oven, stirring and breaking up beef with a spoon, for about 6 to 8 minutes or until meat is completely cooked. Remove from heat; drain. 
	2. Stir in tomatoes with juice, tomato sauce, beans and corn and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover, reduce heat to medium and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes, or until chili is thickened and flavours are blended. Garnish with green onions, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - For Chili Enchiladas, spread 2 cups (500 mL) chili in 13- x 9-inch (3 L) baking dish; set aside. Spoon ½ cup (125 mL) chili onto centre of each of 8 small flour tortillas. Roll up; place seam side down in baking dish. Spoon remaining chili over enchiladas. Sprinkle with 1 cup (250 mL) shredded Cheddar cheese. Bake in 350°F oven for 30 minutes until hot and bubbling. Makes 8 enchiladas.
---
Recipe ID: 94129410-7cee-4bd6-84c8-9b64be12ee26
Recipe Title: Chinese Beef Stew with Daikon 
Recipe Summary: A classic melt-in-your-mouth Chinese beef stew with tender daikon radish. The sauce is delicious and helps the beef braise to perfect tenderness every time. The flavourings star anise, cinnamon stick, dried chenpi (mandarin peel), Chinese five spice, and the classic Chu Hou paste provide the authentic taste you would get from a Hong Kong-style café. This stew pairs perfectly with steamed rice or a bowl of noodles. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 155
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 dried chenpi (dried mandarin peel) 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) warm water
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Brisket or Blade Pot Roast, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- 2-inch (5 cm) piece gingerroot, cut into 6 slices, divided
	- 6 star anise, divided
	- Cold water
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sunflower or canola oil
	- 1 shallot, diced
	- 5 to 6 cloves garlic
	- 1 cinnamon stick
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Chinese five spice powder
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Chinese cooking wine
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, soy sauce and dark soy sauce
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) Chu Hou paste
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1-inch (2.5 cm) piece rock sugar, about 26 g (or 1 tbsp/15 mL packed brown sugar)
	- 1 daikon radish (about 1¼ lb/625 g), scrubbed and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) cornstarch
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Gingerroot
	- 1 shallot
	- Garlic
	- 1 daikon radish (about 1¼ lb/625 g)
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Brisket or Blade Pot Roast, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- Sunflower or canola oil
	- Chinese cooking wine
	- Oyster sauce
	- Hoisin sauce
	- Soy sauce
	- Dark soy sauce
	- Chu Hou paste
	- Cinnamon stick
	- Chinese five spice powder
	- 1 dried chenpi (dried mandarin peel) 
	- Star anise
	- Salt
	- Bay leaves
	- Rock sugar or brown sugar
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine chenpi and warm water in a bowl. Let soak for about 15 minutes. Drain, discarding soaking water.
	2. Meanwhile, combine beef, 3 of the gingerroot slices and 3 of the star anise in a medium stock pot or Dutch oven. Fill the pot with cold water (about 5 cups/1.25 L), or enough to cover the beef. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Skim away any foam from surface.
	3. Drain beef in a colander; discard the gingerroot slices and star anise. Rinse beef and the pot with cold water to remove any excess foam. Set aside separately to dry and let cool.
	4. Return pot to medium-high heat. Add oil and swirl to coat; add shallot, garlic to taste, cinnamon stick, reserved beef and remaining gingerroot slices and star anise. Cook, stirring, for 4 to 5 minutes until beef is lightly browned. Stir in Chinese five spice powder, Chinese cooking wine, oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, dark soy sauce and Chu Hou paste. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes until the beef is coated with the sauce. Stir in salt, bay leaves, sugar, rehydrated chenpi and 3 cups (750 mL) water. Bring to a boil.
	5. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour, turning beef occasionally, and checking after 30 minutes to ensure there is enough water to prevent the meat from drying out. The liquid should have reduced to about half the original amount. If there isn’t enough liquid, add up to ½ cup (125 mL) water. 
	6. Stir in daikon and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 to 45 minutes until beef and radish are tender.
	7. Stir 3 tbsp (45 mL) cold water into cornstarch in a small bowl, mixing until smooth. Gradually stir into the stew. Bring to a boil, stirring, Boil for 2 to 3 minutes or until sauce has thickened slightly. Discard bay leaves.
Recipe Tips:
  - Beef brisket or blade are the cuts most suited to this recipe. Try to pick out meat that has even marbling for optimal flavour and tenderness. If using lean meat with little marbling, reduce simmering time in step 4 by 30 minutes. Freeze the beef for 15 minutes before you cut the cubes to make it easier to cut.
---
Recipe ID: 94c174e4-f584-4115-8961-b4dc44e5d5d0
Recipe Title: Barley Slaw
Recipe Summary: Barley turns a simple slaw into a hearty whole grain and veggie side dish that works well alongside beef sausages, a burger, roast beef or steak. The slaw can be enjoyed right after tossing it together but the standing time does help bring the flavours together and helps soften the vegetables slightly.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) dry pearl barley
	- Salt
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH red wine vinegar and grainy Dijon mustard
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) liquid honey
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) celery seed (optional)
	- 1 bag (397 g) shredded coleslaw blend (about 4 cups/1 L)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) thinly sliced celery
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) chopped fresh dill or parsley
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) chopped green onions
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine barley, ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt and 1½ cups (375 mL) water in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for about 30 minutes or until barley is tender and liquid is absorbed. Transfer to a large bowl and let cool.
	2. Meanwhile, whisk together 1 tsp (5 mL) salt, oil, vinegar, mustard, honey, pepper and celery seed (if using) in a small bowl. Add to barley with coleslaw blend, celery, dill and green onions; toss to combine. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - Make ahead: the slaw can be prepared, covered and refrigerated overnight before serving.
---
Recipe ID: 956b45f3-3580-4b2f-a976-3d35e3a766c3
Recipe Title: Pan-Seared Shallot and Thyme Butter-Basted Steak
Recipe Summary: This steak gets cooked entirely on the stove top using the time-tested method of basting with a generous amount of butter (so worth it!) that results in a wonderful golden-brown crust. Nonstick skillets do not brown steak as well, so be sure to use a cast-iron or heavy stainless steel skillet. This steak is also known as a Porterhouse Grilling Steak and it has the same type of bone you find in a T-bone Steak.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Porterhouse T-bone Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1¼ lb/675 g)
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) salt 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- ½ cup (125 mL) butter
	- 2 shallots, halved
	- 4 sprigs fresh thyme
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) coarse salt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 Beef Porterhouse T-bone Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1¼ lb/675 g)
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Butter
	- 2 shallots
	- 4 sprigs fresh thyme
	- Coarse salt
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steak dry with a paper towel and season all over with ¾ tsp (4 mL) salt and pepper. 
	 2. Heat a 9-inch (23 cm) cast-iron skillet or shallow heavy-bottomed stainless skillet over medium heat. Add butter, shallots and thyme, cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until butter is melted and starting to sizzle. 
	3. Push shallots and thyme to one side of pan; add steak. Cook, basting steak all over with butter often, for 4 to 5 minutes, or until steak is browned and releases easily from pan. Flip over and cook for 4 to 5 minutes more for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, or until nicely browned and digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	4. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Reserve pan drippings; keep warm. Discard shallots and thyme.
	5. Carve meat from bone, then across the grain into slices. Arrange steak and bone on a warmed platter and spoon drippings over steak. Sprinkle with coarse salt. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Tilt and rotate the skillet often, to help butter pool in one place so you can scoop it up to baste, and to promote even cooking during basting. Turn the range hood fan to HIGH to avoid setting off the smoke detector, and wear an apron while basting with butter, as the butter may splatter during cooking.
---
Recipe ID: 95834151-2966-4571-9475-89fd4120d081
Recipe Title: Italian-style Hamburger Soup
Recipe Summary: Hamburger soups are everyone’s favourite. This simple scratch version can be made with just about whatever vegetables you have in the fridge or freezer. It’s super hearty and flavourful since it’s made with ground chuck.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Chuck
	- 1 large onion, chopped
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH thinly sliced carrot, celery and zucchini
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) dried Italian herb seasoning
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes (optional)
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 1 carton (900 mL) reduced-sodium chicken broth
	- 1 can (213 mL) tomato sauce
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded fresh spinach (optional)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped fresh parsley (optional)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) broken whole wheat spaghetti
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Chuck
	- 1 large onion
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Carrot
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- Hot pepper flakes (optional)
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 1 carton (900 mL) reduced-sodium chicken broth
	- 1 can (213 mL) tomato sauce
	- Fresh spinach (optional)
	- Fresh parsley (optional)
	- Whole wheat spaghetti
	- Celery
	- Zucchini
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook beef, onion, garlic, carrot, celery, zucchini, Italian seasoning, and hot pepper flakes (if using) over medium-high heat in Dutch oven, breaking up beef with a spoon and stirring often, for 10 to 15 minutes or until meat is completely cooked and any liquid has evaporated or drain if needed.
	2. Add tomatoes with juice, broth and tomato sauce; bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
	3. Stir in spinach and parsley (if using). Stir in pasta; simmer for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Recipe Tips:
  - All ground beef comes designated as Extra Lean, Lean, Medium or Regular, based on the maximum fat content. This designation is the same for all ground meats: beef, turkey, veal, chicken, pork and lamb.
---
Recipe ID: 95b9824a-03ab-4aef-acbf-8fe0f2155ce9
Recipe Title: Red Wine-Braised Beef Pot Roast in Potato Skins  
Recipe Summary: Canada Beef was a proud partner of Food & Drink’s 30th Anniversary Event where guests enjoyed this recipe, adapted from the original created by Christopher St. Onge for the Holiday 2017 issue of Food & Drink magazine (www.lcbo.com/foodanddrink). All the components of this knockout hors d’oeuvre can be made ahead of time – even the fried potato skins. Which, of course, means it’s party perfect. Frying in olive oil is a luxury here but common in Mediterranean countries where it is considerably cheaper than here. It does make for tasty potato skins, so it’s worth a go if you’re feeling flush.
Recipe Prep Time: 45
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 36
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil, divided
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter
	- 1 small onion, finely chopped
	- 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH finely chopped carrot and celery
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary leaves
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH all-purpose flour and tomato paste
	- 1 lb (500 g) Boneless Beef Blade Pot Roast
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine
	- ½ cup (125 mL) beef broth or water
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 18 mini yellow-flesh potatoes, halved
	- Peanut or olive oil, for frying
	- Sea salt
	- Arugula Salsa Verde
		- 1 cup (250 mL) firmly packed arugula
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh oregano leaves
		- 1½ tsp (7 mL) red wine vinegar
		- 1 clove garlic
		- 2 oil-packed anchovy fillets
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) extra virgin olive oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 small onion
	- Garlic
	- 1 carrot
	- Celery
	- Fresh rosemary 
	- 18 mini yellow-flesh potatoes
	- Arugula
	- Fresh oregano leaves
	- 1 lb (500 g) Boneless Beef Blade Pot Roast
	- Olive oil
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Peanut or olive oil, for frying
	- Beef broth (optional)
	- Salt
	- Sea salt
	- Pepper
	- Bay leaf
	- All-purpose flour
	- Tomato paste
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Oil-packed anchovy fillets
	- Butter
	- Dry red wine
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil with butter over medium heat in a Dutch oven or ovenproof pot with a tight-fitting lid. Cook onion and garlic, stirring often, for 3 minutes, until starting to soften. Stir in carrot, celery and rosemary; cook, stirring often, for 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in flour and tomato paste. Transfer to a heatproof bowl and set aside.
	2. Wipe pot clean and return to high heat. Cut beef into 3 or 4 large chunks and pat dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Add remaining 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil to pot; brown beef for about 6 minutes, turning to brown all sides. Pour in wine and broth; stir in reserved vegetable mixture. Boil for 1 minute or until thickened. Add bay leaf.
	3. Cover and bake in preheated 325°F (160°C) oven for 2½ hours or until meat is fork-tender.
	4. Meanwhile, prepare the potato halves by using a melon baller to scoop out most of the flesh, leaving a ¼-inch (5 mm) layer of potato next to the skin (reserve flesh for use in hash browns or another use). Heat a 2-inch (5 cm) depth of peanut oil over medium heat in a deep pot until it reaches 375°F (190°C) on a deep-fry/candy thermometer. Fry potato skins, in batches, for 3 minutes or until golden brown; remove with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined baking sheet. Season with sea salt. Let drain. (Potato skins may be made up to 1 day in advance, covered and refrigerated until ready to warm and serve.)
	5. Once beef is tender, remove from braising liquid with slotted spoon, and transfer to cutting board. Discard bay leaf from liquid. Cut meat into ½-inch (1 cm) chunks. Return to liquid. (Beef can be cooked up to 3 days in advance; cover and refrigerated until ready to heat and serve.)
	6. Arugula Salsa Verde: Up to 2 hours before serving, combine arugula, oregano, vinegar, garlic, anchovies and oil in a food processor; pulse until the consistency of pesto, scraping down sides as necessary. Set aside.
	7. To serve, if necessary, reheat beef and sauce on stovetop over medium heat until warmed through. Heat potatoes on an unlined baking sheet in preheated 375 to 425°F (190 to 220°C) oven for about 1 minute, until warm. 
	8. Arrange potatoes on a serving platter, spoon meat and sauce into each potato and garnish with a small spoonful of Arugula Salsa Verde.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 960a369a-1f83-49f1-a060-2f90954a3438
Recipe Title: Chinese-Style Dim Sum Steamed Beef Balls
Recipe Summary: Traditional Chinese-style steamed beef balls that are savoury, springy and absolutely delicious. This iconic dim sum staple features water chestnuts, cilantro, ground beef, green onion and authentic seasonings. It is served with tofu skin and a Worcestershire dipping sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 70
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 100
Recipe Servings: 21
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Day 1
		- 1¾ lb (875 g) Lean Ground Beef
		- 4 tsp (20 mL) baking soda
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) kansui (see Tip*)
	- Day 2
		- 1 chenpi (dried mandarin peel)
		- 1 cup (250 mL) warm water
		- ⅔ oz (20 g) dried tofu skin
		- Boiling water 
		- ⅔ cup (150 mL) potato starch
		- 2 tbsp + 1 tsp (35 mL) granulated sugar
		- 2½ tsp (12 mL) chicken bouillon powder
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH ground white pepper and sesame oil
		- 1⅔ oz (50 g) beef fat or butter (about 2 tbsp/30 mL), cubed
		- 5 oz (150 g) drained canned sliced water chestnuts, minced
		- 2/3 cup (150 mL) finely chopped fresh cilantro (1⅓ oz/40 g)
		- 2 green onions, finely chopped
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Green onions
	- 1¾ lb (875 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Beef fat or butter
	- Sesame oil
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Baking soda
	- Ground white pepper
	- Salt
	- Potato starch
	- Granulated sugar
	- Chicken bouillon powder
	- Kansui (see Tip*)
	- 1 chenpi (dried mandarin peel)
	- Dried tofu skin
	- 1 can (approx 5 oz/150 g) sliced water chestnuts
Recipe Methods:
	1. Day 1: Combine ground beef, baking soda, salt and alkaline water in bowl of a stand mixer. Mix on medium speed with paddle attachment for 3 minutes. With mixer running on medium speed, gradually add 1¼ cups (300 mL) water, 1 tbsp (15 mL) at a time, mixing each addition until the water is fully absorbed into the beef. (To mix by hand, stir using a spatula for 10 minutes, adding 1¼ cups/300 mL water, 1 tbsp/15 mL at a time and mixing for 30 seconds before the next addition.) Cover and refrigerator overnight.
	2. Day 2: Combine chenpi (dried mandarin peel) in warm water in a small bowl and let soak for 15 minutes. 
	3. Meanwhile, place dried tofu skin in a heatproof bowl and add boiling water to cover. Let soak for 15 minutes.
	4. Drain chenpi, reserving ¾ cup (175 mL) soaking liquid. Finely dice chenpi and return to bowl with reserved soaking liquid. Add potato starch, sugar, chicken bouillon powder, white pepper and sesame oil and mix well.
	5. Return beef mixture to stand mixer bowl. Add beef fat, water chestnuts, cilantro and green onions. Mix on medium-low speed to combine. With mixer running on medium-low speed, gradually add in the chenpi mixture, 1 tbsp (15 mL) at a time, letting the beef absorb the liquid before adding more in. &nbsp;(To mix by hand, stir using a spatula chenpi mixture, 1 tbsp/15 mL at a time and mixing for 30 seconds before the next addition.)
	6. Scoop 2 tbsp (30 mL) of beef mixture (about the size of a small onion) and roll into a ball. Place on a plate. Repeat to make 21 balls total. Set aside.
	7. Drain tofu skin and place on a steamer basket in a single layer. Place 3 balls into the basket. Cover and steam on medium-high heat for 10 minutes until the beef is thoroughly cooked and “bouncy” in texture. Repeat with remaining balls, adding more water to steamer, as necessary between batches. Serve hot with Worcestershire for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - *Kansui is also know as food-grade lye water or alkaline water and is a traditional ingredient which helps tenderize and enhance the flavours of the beef. Bottled kansui is a solution of potassium carbonate and sodium bicarbonate and is available in Chinese or Japanese grocery stores. To make a homemade version, combine 1 tsp (5 mL) baking soda with 4 tsp (20 mL) water in a very small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring, just to dissolve soda. Let cool completely. Store any extra in glass jar with lid in a cool area for up to 3 months. If you don’t want to cook all the meatballs at once, roll out the balls and freeze on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet until solid. Transfer to an airtight container and freeze for up to 3 months. When you’re ready to enjoy them, remove from freezer and steam from frozen, increasing the cooking time for 12 minutes per batch.
---
Recipe ID: 96748e44-533c-4b0c-ac6d-a7742ae00839
Recipe Title: Braised Italian-Style Oxtail Stew
Recipe Summary: This rich, flavourful and succulent stew, made with beefy oxtail, tomatoes, red wine and lovely fresh herbs will definitely become a Sunday supper favourite! Serve with crusty bread, over creamy polenta or toss with hot cooked noodles. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 160
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Oxtail, cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) freshly ground black pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 2 EACH carrots and stalks celery, chopped
	- 1 onion, chopped
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH chopped fresh rosemary and sage
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) anchovy paste
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 4 cups (1 L) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1 Parmesan rind (about 3-inches/8 cm long)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- Grated Parmesan cheese (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Oxtail, cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- Salt
	- Freshly ground black pepper
	- Olive oil
	- Carrots
	- 1 onion
	- Fresh rosemary and sage
	- Tomato paste
	- Anchovy paste
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Dry red wine
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1 Parmesan rind (about 3-inches/8 cm long)
	- Fresh parsley
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Grated Parmesan cheese (optional)
	- Celery
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat oxtail dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or large heavy-bottom stockpot or saucepan. Sear oxtail, turning with tongs, for about 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil.
	2. Reduce heat to medium. Add carrots, celery, onion, rosemary, sage, tomato paste, anchovy paste and garlic to pot. Cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in wine to deglaze pan, scraping up any browned bits and simmering until reduced by half. Add tomatoes, broth and bay leaves; bring to a boil.
	3. Return oxtail to pot along with any accumulated juices and Parmesan rind. Cover, reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 2 hours or until meat is very tender. During cooking, skim any pools of fat from surface of broth and discard. Add a splash of water to stew during the last hour of cooking if it begins to thicken too quickly. 
	4. Using tongs, transfer oxtail to a dish. Set aside until just cool enough to handle. Discard bay leaves and Parmesan rind. Simmer stew, partially covered and stirring often, for 15 minutes or until thickened. 
	5. Meanwhile, pull meat from oxtail; discard bones and trim. Tear meat into small pieces and stir into stew. Simmer for 5 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley and vinegar. Serve with grated Parmesan, if desired. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Anchovy paste adds a unique richness, often referred to as umami. Using it in soups and stews brings out the full flavour of the other ingredients without tasting fishy. Look for it in the refrigerated section of the fish and seafood department.
---
Recipe ID: 96cfbf77-b150-489c-b93f-7daa5af75a54
Recipe Title: Baked Ground Beef Empanadas De Picadillo
Recipe Summary: Serve as a tapas course or make larger-sized versions for a main course. You can skip the pastry in this recipe if you like and enjoy this Spanish-style ground beef as a filling in taco shells or as a topping for baked potatoes or rice. To make ahead empanadas ahead, freeze unbaked in sealed container for up to 1 month; bake from frozen in 350°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes for appetizer size or 30 minutes for large.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 onion, minced
	- ½ sweet red or green pepper, finely diced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef Sirloin   
	- 1 cup (250 mL) salsa
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chili powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground cumin
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) sliced green olives
	- ½ cup (125 mL) raisins
	- Salt and pepper
	- 4 frozen pie shells (9-inch/25 cm), thawed or enough homemade pastry for 2 double-crust pies
	- 1 egg, lightly beaten
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 onion
	- Sweet red or green pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef Sirloin      
	- Salsa
	- Chili powder
	- Ground cumin
	- Sliced green olives
	- Raisins
	- Salt and pepper
	- 4 frozen pie shells (9-inch/25 cm) or enough homemade pastry for 2 double-crust pies
	- 1 egg
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook garlic, onion, diced pepper and ground beef over medium heat in a large skillet, stirring occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes until beef is browned and completely cooked. Remove from heat; drain.
	2. Stir in salsa, chili powder and cumin; reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in olives and raisins. Season with salt and pepper to taste and let cool completely.
	3. Cut each pie shell in half. Form each of the 8 pastry pieces into a ball; roll out each into a 7-inch (18 cm) round. Use 1/2 cup (125 mL) ground beef mixture for each empanada. Moisten pastry edges with water; fold over and seal with fork. Place empanadas on parchment paper- or foil-lined baking sheet; prick tops and brush each with beaten egg.
	 4. Bake in preheated 425°F oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown (check the bottoms are brown).
Recipe Tips:
  - To make tapa-sized Empanadas, chop olives finely. Cut each pie shell into ten 3-inch (8 cm) rounds, rerolling scraps, and fill with 1 tbsp (15 mL) beef mixture. Reduce baking time to about 10 to 15 minutes. Makes 40.
---
Recipe ID: 9749dc54-13d5-44b5-affd-b7e4578ed536
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Braised Beef Birria
Recipe Summary: Beef Birria is a popular dish that can be served as a soup or in a taco. Guajillo chilies are not hot and you can add your own level of heat to your serving with serrano chilies or hot pepper sauce. To make tacos, the tortilla is dipped into the broth, filled with meat, and fried on both sides to crisp it slightly. You can skim the fat from the birria and use it for frying. The taco is then dipped in the broth as you eat it. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 75
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 95
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 6 dried guajillo chili peppers (or ancho or pasilla peppers)
	- 2 cups (500 mL) boiling water
	- 6 whole cloves 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) cumin seeds
	- 1/2 tsp (2 mL) whole black peppercorns
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 2 cups (500 mL) finely diced onions
	- 6 cloves garlic, minced 
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Boneless Hind Shank (Bubble Meat)
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) coarsely chopped ripe tomatoes (or one 14-oz/398 mL can diced tomatoes)
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) dried oregano, preferably Mexican
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground cinnamon 
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Salt
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cider vinegar (approx)
	- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth, warmed
	- To serve (as desired) Chopped cilantro, sliced serrano chilies or hot pepper sauce, lime wedges, sliced red onions, radishes, avocados, shredded cabbage, tortillas
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 6 dried guajillo chili peppers (or ancho or pasilla peppers)
	- 6 whole cloves 
	- Cumin seeds
	- Whole black peppercorns
	- Olive oil
	- Onions
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Boneless Hind Shank (Bubble Meat)
	- Ripe tomatoes (or one 14-oz/398 mL can diced tomatoes)
	- Dried oregano, preferably Mexican
	- Ground cinnamon
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Salt
	- Cider vinegar (approx)
	- Beef broth
	- To serve (as desired): Fresh cilantro, serrano chilies or hot pepper sauce, lime, red onions, radishes, avocados, cabbage, tortillas
Recipe Methods:
	1. Snip off the stem end of each chili pepper with scissors and split each chili open lengthwise. Open up and scrape out seeds and membranes. Heat a heavy medium-size skillet over medium heat. To toast the chilies, place one or two in the pan skin side down and press it with a metal spatula until it softens and blisters. Flip the chili over and toast the inside being careful not to burn it. Transfer to a heatproof bowl and continue with the remaining chilies. Pour boiling water over chilies; set aside.
	2. To the same skillet, add cloves, cumin seeds and peppercorns and toast over low heat, shaking pan constantly, for about 1 to 2 minutes until fragrant. Transfer to a plate to cool. Grind the toasted spices finely in a mortar using a pestle or in a spice grinder. Set aside.
	3. Heat olive oil in the same skillet over medium heat. Cook onions and garlic, stirring frequently, for about 5 to 10 minutes or until the onions become translucent and turn lightly brown. Transfer to electric pressure cooker.
	4. Slice the meat in half lengthwise and cut each piece crosswise into 2-inch (5 cm) lengths. Add to pressure cooker; stir in tomatoes, oregano, cinnamon, bay leaves, vinegar, reserved ground toasted spices and 1 tsp (5 mL) salt.
	5. Drain the chilies and place in a blender with the beef stock; purée until smooth. Pour through a sieve directly over beef mixture, pressing down on the solids; discard solids. Seal the electric pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to HIGH and time for 1 hour. When the timer beeps, let the pressure reduce naturally. Remove the lid and taste; adjust the seasoning to your taste with salt and vinegar. (The consistency should be in between a soup and a stew.)
	6. Serve in bowls as a stew or shred the meat and serve as tacos. Garnish with cilantro, serrano chilies or hot pepper sauce, lime wedges, onions, radishes, avocados, cabbage and tortillas as desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - To prepare on the stove-top, add ingredients to a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster instead of an electric pressure cooker. Add 2 cups (500 mL) additional beef broth. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Cover and simmer over low heat for 3 hours, making sure the liquid covers the beef and adding more if necessary.
---
Recipe ID: 97c5d12e-a6d9-44ae-aacc-04df29a0f5a7
Recipe Title: Roasted Red Pepper and Feta Beef Burger)
Recipe Summary: A combination of zesty Mediterranean ingredients come together in this tasty burger recipe. Serve as burgers in a toasted bun or over lettuce leaves, or transform into a grain bowl by serving over cooked rice or quinoa. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated lemon zest
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH smoked sweet paprika, dried oregano leaves and hot pepper flakes
	- 1 cup (250 mL) thinly sliced roasted red peppers
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH plain Greek yogurt and crumbled feta cheese
	- Pinch EACH salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 6 Lean Ground Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 6 ciabatta buns or burger buns, split 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) arugula
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Lemon zest
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Smoked sweet paprika
	- Roasted red peppers
	- Plain Greek yogurt
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 6  Lean Ground Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 6 ciabatta buns or burger buns, split 
	- Arugula
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Crumbled feta cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, garlic, paprika, oregano and hot pepper flakes in a medium bowl. Transfer 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the oil mixture to another medium bowl for the yogurt sauce; set aside. Add roasted red pepper slices to remaining oil mixture; toss to combine. Let peppers marinate for 15 minutes.
	2. Meanwhile, add yogurt, feta, salt and pepper to reserved oil mixture and stir until blended; set aside for serving. 
	3. Make a thumbprint depression in centre of each burger (to prevent puffing while grilling). Grill burgers on oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 14 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick burgers, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each burger reads 160°F (71°C). 
	4. Meanwhile, grill buns, cut sides down, on barbecue for 30 to 60 seconds or until well-marked and toasted. 
	5. Place grilled burgers on bun bottoms. Top with yogurt-feta sauce, marinated roasted red pepper slices, arugula and bun tops.
Recipe Tips:
  - Burgers can be pan-fried on the stove top over medium heat in a cast-iron skillet or grill pan. Toast buns in skillet or under broiler. You can use roasted red peppers from a jar, the deli section or make your own. To roast, grill whole sweet red peppers in a closed preheated barbecue over high heat (500°F/260°C), turning often, for 10 to 15 minutes or until charred all over. Transfer to a heat-safe bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. Let stand for 15 minutes. Peel, stem and seed peppers; discard. Thinly slice peppers.
---
Recipe ID: 9859362c-6237-4de9-8011-2495890eb330
Recipe Title: Smash Burger Tacos  
Recipe Summary: These tacos are best enjoyed immediately so serve them up as soon as they come out of the pan. Let guests add their own toppings while you continue to cook up the rest of the tacos. This recipe was adapted from Chef Galati’s original and modified to cook at home.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Burger Sauce
		- ½ cup (125 mL) mayonnaise
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sweet green relish 
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) prepared yellow mustard
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH sweet paprika and white vinegar
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH onion powder, garlic powder and salt
	- Tacos
		- 4 tsp (20 mL) butter, softened, divided
		- 4 small (7-inch/18 cm) flour tortillas 
		- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
		- Salt and pepper
		- 4 large slices Cheddar cheese
		- ½ cup (125 mL) drained sliced pickles
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) diced white onion 
		- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded iceberg lettuce 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- White onion 
	- Iceberg lettuce 
	- Small (7-inch/18 cm) flour tortillas 
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Mayonnaise
	- White vinegar
	- Sweet green relish 
	- Prepared yellow mustard
	- Sweet paprika
	- Onion powder
	- Garlic powder
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Sliced Cheddar cheese
	- Sliced pickles
	- Butter
Recipe Methods:
	1. Burger Sauce: Combine mayonnaise, relish, mustard, paprika, vinegar, onion powder, garlic powder and salt, stirring well. Set aside. 
	2. Tacos: Spread 1 tsp (5 mL) of butter on one side of each tortilla in a thin, even layer.&nbsp; Divide beef into 4 equal-sized balls. Press each ball onto buttered side of a tortilla, pressing down until tortilla is covered with beef in an even, flat layer. Season with salt and pepper to your taste; set aside.
	3. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Place one tortilla, with the meat side down, onto skillet and firmly press down with the back of a spatula for 5 seconds. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until beef is well browned; flip over and place a slice of cheese on meat. Cover skillet and cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted and beef is cooked to 160°F (71°C) at the least.
	4. Slide taco onto serving plate and top with 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) of burger sauce, one-quarter each of the pickles, diced onion and lettuce. Repeat with remaining tacos and toppings.
Recipe Tips:
  - Serve any additional Burger Sauce on the side if you like. Leftovers can be covered and refrigerated for up to 1 week. Use it on burgers or roast beef sandwiches or make more smash burger tacos.
---
Recipe ID: 98883fc2-dafb-4651-ae37-1cb6b59cb7db
Recipe Title: Speedy One-Pot Ground Beef Rotini
Recipe Summary: Perfect for busy weeknights, this one-pan wonder pasta gets finished with shredded Italian cheese for a saucy and ooey, gooey dish that the whole family will love. Rotini pasta is used in this recipe, but you can substitute with your favourite short-cut pasta, such as fusilli, penne or medium shells. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion, finely chopped
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dried Italian herb Seasoning
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 cups (500 mL) EACH tomato sauce and reduced-sodium chicken broth
	- 12 oz (375 g) dry rotini pasta
	- 2 cups (500 mL) shredded Italian cheese blend or mozzarella 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Tomato sauce
	- 12 oz (375 g) dry rotini pasta
	- Shredded Italian cheese blend or mozzarella
	- Reduced-sodium chicken broth
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large sauté pan or deep skillet. Cook beef, onion, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper, stirring often and using back of spoon to break up meat into small chunks, for 8 to 10 minutes or until beef is browned. 
	2. Add tomato sauce, broth, rotini and 1 cup (250 mL) water, stirring to submerge pasta in liquid; bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 12 to 15 minutes or until pasta is tender and has absorbed most of the liquid. Reduce heat to low.
	3. Stir in half the cheese; sprinkle remaining cheese over top. Cover, remove from heat and let stand for 2 to 3 minutes or until cheese has melted.
Recipe Tips:
  - Stir in 2 cups (500 mL) baby spinach or kale before adding cheese, if desired.
---
Recipe ID: 988cb9c8-3eb8-4dcf-aa52-8fbae6e4b6bc
Recipe Title: Boiled beef with Dumplings
Recipe Summary: Indigenous people love to boil food and boiling beef is no exception. Mom always started by boiling roast cuts with parsley, carrots, thyme and root vegetables in a big pot of stew. Once the stew had set up, she would boil dumplings right in the stew. It was a classic staple in our household and we’d devour it on a cold winter night. This recipe technique actually goes against standard culinary training but it doesn’t matter to me as we’ve been cooking like this for hundreds of years.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 80
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 100
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Boiled Beef
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sunflower or canola oil
		- 3 potatoes, coarsely chopped
		- 2 EACH onions, carrots and sweet potatoes, coarsely chopped
		- 2 cloves garlic, minced
		- ¾ lb (375 g) Beef Blade Roast, cut into ½- to ¾-inch (1 to 2 cm) cubes
		- 3 bay leaves
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) hot pepper flakes
		- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- Dumplings
		- 1 cup (250 mL) all-purpose flour
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) baking soda
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 potatoes
	- 2 onions
	- 2 carrots 
	- 2 sweet potatoes
	- Garlic
	- ¾ lb (375 g) Beef Blade Roast, cut into ½- to ¾-inch (1 to 2 cm) cubes
	- Sunflower or canola oil
	- Bay leaves
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Baking soda
Recipe Methods:
	1. Boiled Beef: Heat oil over high heat in a heavy stockpot or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Add potatoes, onions, carrots, sweet potatoes, garlic and beef. Cook, stirring, for about 20 minutes, until onions soften. Add bay leaves, hot pepper flakes, salt, pepper and 1 cup (250 mL) water. Bring to a boil.
	2. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes.
	3. Dumplings: Meanwhile, combine flour, baking soda and salt in a bowl. Set aside.
	4. After the beef has simmered for about 25 minutes, add ⅓ cup (75 mL) water to flour mixture and slowly mix the dough by hand until shaggy (well mixed but slightly lumpy). Transfer dough to work surface and gently shape by hand into ping-pong sized rough balls.
	5. Drop each dumpling ball into the Boiled Beef. Cover tightly with the lid and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, until puffed up and springy to touch and beef and vegetables are fork-tender. (Note – you can cut one open to test that they are fully cooked, not gooey in the centre).
	6. Discard bay leaves. Ladle the Boiled Beef and broth into 4 bowls and top each with dumplings.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 9a00a398-a23a-401e-be05-e42735bcf363
Recipe Title: Beef and Cheese Cabbage Rolls
Recipe Summary: Here’s a beautiful recipe that reminds me of my grandma and our fall meals. This recipe is an adaptation of what I remember of hers. A mix of well-seasoned ground beef with rice and cheese that she loved to serve us. Easy to make and above all, easy to adapt! In the fall, the markets are full of fresh produce and we often forget the inexpensive green cabbage. My grandma jumped on the occasion! This is a recipe that you will want to repeat regularly. Thank you for your inspiration, Grandma, I miss our time cooking together!
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 145
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Savoy cabbage
	- 12 oz (375 g) bacon
	- 1 jar (648 mL) marinara sauce
	- 1 small onion, finely chopped
	- 3 large garlic cloves, finely chopped
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
	- ½ cup (125 mL) grated Parmesan cheese
	- ½ cup (125 mL) uncooked basmati rice
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) herbes de Provence
	- 1¼ lb (625 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 Savoy cabbage
	- 12 oz (375 g) bacon
	- 1 jar (648 mL) marinara sauce
	- 1 small onion
	- 3 large garlic cloves
	- Sharp Cheddar cheese
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
	- Basmati rice
	- Herbes de Provence
	- 1¼ lb (625 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut off the base of the cabbage and carefully remove 9 large leaves (reserve remaining cabbage for another use). Blanch cabbage leaves, a few at a time, in a saucepan of boiling salted water for 2 minutes. Remove from water with tongs, drain and set aside. Repeat with remaining leaves.
	2. Arrange bacon slices in a single layer on a large parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet. Bake in preheated 400°F oven for 20 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain off fat. Coarsely chop and place in a large bowl. Reduce oven to 350°F.
	3. Meanwhile, heat marinara sauce over medium heat in a saucepan just until bubbling. Remove from heat, cover and keep warm.
	4. Add onion, garlic, Cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, uncooked rice and herbes de Provence to bowl and stir to combine. Gently mix in ground beef with a fork (careful not to over-mix). &nbsp;Generously season with salt and pepper to your taste.
	5. Place one cabbage leaf on a work surface with the stem side down. Scoop ⅓ to ½ cup (75 to 125 mL) of the meat mixture and form a small sausage. Place at the base of the leaf and roll up tightly, folding in the sides and enclosing the filling. Continue with remaining leaves and filling.
	6. Spread marinara sauce into a large baking dish. Place the cabbage rolls on the sauce, seam side down, and cover the dish with foil. Cook in 350°F oven for 2 hours or until sauce is bubbling and a digital instant-ready thermometer inserted in the centre of several rolls reads 160°F (71°C) Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: 9b0ceaae-8c16-4a72-826c-8d4b04d2fc7e
Recipe Title: Barbecued Marinated Roast Beef
Recipe Summary: Vinaigrette salad dressing is a super-easy marinade and since it comes in so many varieties, you always have all kinds of flavour options right at your fingertips. Roast beef is so simple to cook in the barbecue by indirect heat roasting. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 8-in (20 cm) long x 5-in (12.5 cm wide) x 4-in (10 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 720
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 830
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Outside Round Oven Roast
	- 2 cups (500 mL) vinaigrette salad dressing (such as, balsamic vinaigrette or sun-dried tomato)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Outside Round Oven Roast
	- Vinaigrette salad dressing (such as, balsamic vinaigrette or sun-dried tomato)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pierce roast all over with fork. Place in large sealable freezer bag with dressing, massaging to coat; seal and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours.
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat roast dry with paper towel. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1 hour 40 minutes for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	NOTE: see ‘ESTIMATED COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Carve across the grain into thin slices to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your oven roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: 9bbe3fa2-ad22-424f-a897-460ff29d97d8
Recipe Title: Miso-marinated Steak with Asian-style Cucumber Salsa
Recipe Summary: A tender cut like Strip Loin Steak Grilling Steak is marinated for just 20 minutes here just to impart flavour. Resting time is important after steaks are grilled as it allows the juices in the meat to settle and cooking to come to completion – key for the juiciest steak.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 6
Recipe Marinating Time: 20
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 46
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH white miso paste and rice vinegar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sesame oil 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH minced gingerroot and soy sauce
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) liquid honey
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- Pinch hot pepper flakes
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 2 steaks)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Asian-style Cucumber Salsa
		- 2 cups (500 mL) finely chopped cucumber
		- 1 cup (250 mL) cooked shelled edamame (frozen or fresh)
		- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
		- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- White miso paste
	- Sesame oil
	- Gingerroot
	- Liquid honey
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak,  ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 2 steaks)
	- Cucumber
	- Shelled edamame (frozen or fresh)
	- 2 green onions
	- Lime wedges
	- Rice vinegar
	- Soy sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine miso, vinegar, sesame oil, gingerroot, soy sauce, honey, garlic and hot pepper flakes in a small bowl. Transfer half the marinade to a medium bowl for the salsa; set aside. Place steaks in a shallow dish; pour in remaining marinade and turn steaks to coat; cover and refrigerate for 20 minutes. 
	 2. Remove beef from marinade; discard marinade. Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. 
	3. Asian-style Cucumber Salsa: Meanwhile, add cucumber, edamame, green onions to reserved marinade; toss until well coated.
	4. Slice steaks across the grain. Arrange on a platter with Asian-style Cucumber Salsa. Serve with lime wedges. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Tip: Shelled edamame can be purchased frozen and blanched in boiling water before using to prepare salsa. Alternatively, substitute with chopped raw snap or snow peas.
---
Recipe ID: 9c283a58-16e5-471d-844a-5392fc5207f1
Recipe Title: Easy Oven Roast Beef with Harvest Vegetable Sauce
Recipe Summary: Encrusted with fragrant harvest-season spices, this Eye of Round roast smells fantastic as it cooks in the oven. Serve with the rich roasted vegetable sauce that is naturally creamy without the addition of cream. To maximize browning, the roast is cooked separately from the vegetables. 
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH brown sugar, paprika and ground coriander 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground ginger, allspice and garlic powder
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH ground cinnamon and cloves 
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 1 cup (250 mL) chopped fennel bulb (reserve fennel fronds for serving)
	- 1 EACH carrot, onion, stalk celery and peeled apple, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) pieces
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Harvest Vegetable Sauce
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter, divided
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
		- ½ cup (125 mL) dry sherry 
		- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Brown sugar
	- Ground ginger
	- Ground cinnamon
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- Vegetable oil
	- Fennel bulb (reserve fennel fronds for serving)
	- Carrot
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Butter
	- Tomato paste
	- Dry sherry
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Paprika
	- Ground coriander
	- Allspice
	- Garlic powder
	- Ground cloves
	- Onion
	- Celery
	- Apple
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine salt, pepper, sugar, paprika, coriander, ginger, allspice, garlic powder, cinnamon and cloves in a small bowl. Reserve 1 tsp (5 mL) spice blend for vegetables. 
	 2. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Rub with 2 tbsp (30 mL) oil and season all over with remaining spice blend. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. 
	3. Toss fennel, apple, carrot, onion, celery and garlic cloves with remaining oil and reserved spice blend in a large bowl. Arrange in a single layer on parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet. 
	4. Place roast on middle rack and vegetables on lower rack in a preheated 450°F oven. Oven-sear roast and vegetables for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F (135°C); roast, uncovered, for about 1¾ to 2¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium at the most) and vegetables are golden brown and tender. 
	 5. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Divide the vegetables in half; cover one portion with foil to keep warm. 
	Harvest Vegetable Sauce: : 
		6. Meanwhile, melt half the butter over medium heat in the roasting pan with any drippings. Add tomato paste; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Stir in sherry; bring to a boil, scraping up any browned bits from pan. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until reduced slightly and starting to thicken. Stir in remaining roasted vegetables and broth; bring to a boil. 
		7. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 8 to 10 minutes or until flavours blend together. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Carefully transfer to a blender or to a tall, narrow pitcher or measuring cup and use an immersion blender; purée sauce until smooth. Stir in remaining butter; season with salt and pepper. 
		8. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices. Serve with roasted vegetables and Harvest Vegetable Sauce. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Eye of round is a very lean cut, so our recommendation is to cook no more than to medium doneness and to slice thinly. The shape of roast and cut are major factors in determining cooking time (as is the accuracy of your oven), so the best way to check the doneness of your oven roast is to use a meat thermometer. There are 2 basic types of meat thermometers. The programmable oven-safe digital models with a probe that you insert directly into the roast before placing in the oven and a read-out screen which allows you to monitor the temperature without continually opening the door. Digital instant-read meat thermometers are not oven-safe, so these are not inserted into the roast before cooking. Therefore, you must remove the roast from the oven and then insert the thermometer in the centre of roast to check for doneness.
---
Recipe ID: 9c54339b-721a-4228-a978-c9ca590eff54
Recipe Title: Barbecued Southern-Style Smoked Roast Beef
Recipe Summary: Perfectly suited for a casual gathering, the Southern flavours of smoke and sarsaparilla linger in this relaxed roast! Marinate ahead and then barbecue-smoke for easy hands-off cooking! 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 450
Recipe Marinating Time: 1440
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 1905
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 heads garlic
	- 1 large onion, sliced
	- 1 can (355 mL) root beer
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH Worcestershire sauce and red wine vinegar
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH packed brown sugar and liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dry mustard
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) pepper
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Brisket Pot Roast, thick Double/Point End/Deckle section (not Flat End/First Cut)
	- Hardwood chips
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 heads garlic
	- 1 large onion
	- 1 can (355 mL) root beer
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Dry mustard
	- Pepper
	- Salt
	- 4 lb (2 kg)  Beef Brisket Pot Roast, thick Double/Point End/Deckle section (not Flat End/First Cut)
	- Hardwood chips
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Liquid honey
Recipe Methods:
	1. Slice off top of garlic heads; wrap in foil and bake in 350°F (180°C) oven until softened, about 50 minutes. Squeeze garlic cloves into large sealable freezer bag; stir in onion, root beer, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, sugar, honey, mustard, pepper and salt.
	2. Pierce roast all over with fork. Add to bag, massaging with marinade; seal, squeezing out as much air as possible and refrigerate for 24 hours, turning occasionally.
	3. Fill drip pan with ½ inch (1 cm) water and place under grill (off to one side; this burner will be turned off). Preheat barbecue to low (225ºF). Soak hardwood chips for at least 15 minutes. Drain off water and wrap chips in a foil packet; poke packet with holes to let smoke escape. Place under grill over burner that will stay lit.
	 4. Remove meat from marinade, reserving marinade; set roast aside. Pour marinade into small saucepan and add 1 cup (250 mL) water. Bring to a boil over high heat; boil for 3 minutes. Set aside.
	5. Place roast, fat-side up, on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan, close lid and cook at constant temperature, turning every 2 hours and basting with marinade, for 5 to 6 hours until fork tender when tested with a barbecue fork or skewer, and thermometer reads between 180°F (82°C) to 200°F (100°C).
	 6. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for at least 15 minutes.
	7. Meanwhile, reduce the remaining marinade to use as a dipping sauce by boiling over medium-high heat for about 20 minutes or until thickened and onions are softened. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with dipping sauce. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your brisket roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: 9cf3807f-886b-477b-80b2-e09800eef8ee
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Ranchero Sauce
Recipe Summary: Pay homage to the grill with your favourite Canadian beef steak. The sauce in this recipe goes well with any Grilling or Marinating steak -- it's somewhat smoky and spicy and loaded with garden vegetables. If you can't take the heat, reduce the amount of chipotle pepper by half.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- 1 sweet onion, sliced lengthwise 
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) sliced mushrooms
	- 1 sweet red pepper, cut into strips
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) herbes de Provence or dried thyme
	- 3 tomatoes, diced 
	- 1 canned chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, divided
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH tomato sauce and beer
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) barbecue sauce
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Flap Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- 1 sweet onion
	- Sliced mushrooms
	- 1 sweet red pepper
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Herbes de Provence or dried thyme
	- 3 tomatoes
	- 1 canned chipotle pepper in adobo sauce
	- Tomato sauce
	- Barbecue sauce
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Bottom Sirloin Flap Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Lime wedges
	- Beer
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil in over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet; cook onion, mushrooms, red pepper, garlic and herbes de Provence, stirring, for about 10 minutes or until vegetables start to soften and brown. Add tomatoes and chipotle pepper; cook, stirring often, for about 8 minutes or until most of the liquid has evaporated.
	2. Stir in tomato sauce, beer and barbecue sauce; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes stirring occasionally or until liquid has reduced to half or third.
	3. Meanwhile, pat steak dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	4. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Cut across the grain into thin slices and serve with the vegetables, sauce and lime wedges to squeeze over top.
Recipe Tips:
  - For best browning and flavour, pat steaks dry with paper towels before grilling.
---
Recipe ID: 9d15fd18-d98b-465f-a6f1-d81fbe974f56
Recipe Title: Egg and Veggie Fried Rice
Recipe Summary: Convenient packaged and frozen vegetables make the prep for this recipe even easier than going for take-out. Cold rice is key to making good fried rice–if it’s too warm and soft it will clump together and become mushy so plan ahead to cook it in the morning or the day before, or purchase a package of unflavoured pre-cooked rice. Serve with your favourite beef stir-fry or fast-fry steaks or simply slice up leftover roast beef and toss it in at the end to warm through.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 eggs
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 small onion, finely chopped
	- 2 cups (500 mL) cauliflower rice, thawed if frozen
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) soy sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sesame oil
	- 1 ½ cups (375 mL) mixed frozen peas and carrots, thawed
	- 2 cups (500 mL) cold cooked long-grain brown rice (about ⅔ cup/150 mL uncooked)
	- 3 green onions, chopped
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk eggs in a medium bowl until well blended. Set aside.
	2. Heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Stir-fry onion for about 2 minutes or until softened. Add cauliflower rice, soy sauce and sesame oil; stir-fry for 2 minutes. Push vegetables to one side of the pan. Pour eggs into the cleared side of the pan. As eggs begin to set, gently move a spatula across bottom and sides of pan to form marble-sized, soft curds of egg. Cook for about 3 minutes or until eggs are thickened and no visible liquid egg remains.&nbsp;
	3. Add peas and carrots and cold rice to pan; gently mix into eggs and vegetables. Cook, gently folding with the spatula, for about 3 to 5 minutes or until rice is hot. Serve sprinkled with green onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - Cauliflower rice may also be labeled as “riced cauliflower” or “crumbled cauliflower”. Look for it in the packaged/prepared section of the produce department and in the frozen vegetable section. You can make your own by finely chopping fresh cauliflower with a large chef’s knife, grating on the medium or large holes of a box grater or by using short pulses in a food processor (just be careful not to purée it!).
---
Recipe ID: 9d3e1cfd-8b05-4fa3-95d7-91cc9ef81925
Recipe Title: Guava Barbecue Beef Ribs 
Recipe Summary: Here’s a scrumptious lip-smacking good recipe for barbecue lovers with an exotic twist of tropical guavas. Guavas are the strawberries of the Bahamas. It’s used in our national dessert (Guava Duff), and when the fruit is not in season, it’s substituted with canned guavas or guava paste. It’s a staple ingredient in Bahamian culinary culture that is used year-round in jams, jellies, pastries, ice cream and barbecue sauces. Serve these glazed ribs with mac ‘n’ cheese or other favourite barbecue side dishes.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 rack Canadian Beef Grilling Short Ribs (about 7 ribs), about 5 lb (2.2 kg)
	- Olive oil
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH smoked sweet paprika and ancho chili powder
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH garlic powder, onion powder and fine sea salt
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) ground cumin
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) cayenne pepper
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dry mustard
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground mace and fresh ground pepper
	- Guava Barbecue Sauce
		- 2 cups (500 mL) store-bought guava paste (see Tip), cubed
		- 1 cup (250 mL) bourbon- or hickory smoke-flavoured barbecue sauce
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sambal oelek
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground cinnamon
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground black pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 rack Canadian Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 7 ribs), about 5 lb (2.2 kg)
	- Olive oil
	- 1 cup (250 mL) bourbon- or hickory smoke-flavoured barbecue sauce
	- Sambal oelek
	- Smoked sweet paprika
	- Ancho chili powder
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder
	- Fine sea salt
	- Ground cumin
	- Cayenne pepper
	- Dry mustard
	- Ground mace
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Pepper
	- Brown sugar
	- 2 cups (500 mL) store-bought guava paste (see Tip)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place rack of ribs onto a parchment-lined rimmed baking sheet; set aside. 
	2. Combine sugar, smoked paprika, ancho chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, cumin, cayenne, dry mustard, mace and pepper in a small container fitted with an airtight lid; shake well to mix the rub. Drizzle both sides of the ribs with some olive oil. Season the rack of ribs generously on both sides with spice rub. Store remaining spice rub in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 6 months. Let stand for 15 to 20 minutes. 
	3. Guava Barbecue Sauce: Meanwhile, combine guava paste cubes and ½ cup (125 mL) water in a medium saucepan. Heat over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes or until paste is melted. Add more water. if needed, to make a smooth paste without lumps just thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Remove from heat. Stir in barbecue sauce, sambal oelek, cinnamon and pepper; set aside. 
	4. Grill rack of ribs in closed preheated barbecue over medium heat (350°F/180°C) for 10 minutes, turning once, until grill marked. Transfer rack of ribs back to parchment lined baking sheet.
	5. Brush ribs generously all over with Guava Barbecue Sauce. Cover with foil and bake in preheated 325°F oven for 2 hours or until meat is fork-tender. Transfer to a cutting board and cut into individual ribs to serve. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Guava paste is a sweet, dense paste is available in packages, tubs and cans in the Caribbeans foods dry goods section of well-stocked supermarkets and at Caribbean markets. It’s not to be confused with guava purée which is quite different.
---
Recipe ID: 9d53ae64-197f-45ba-aef4-9fb809b7aedb
Recipe Title: Cheeseburger-Style Pizza with Beef Sausage
Recipe Summary: Seasoned beef sausage meat adds a lot of flavour to a pizza that has all the trappings of your favourite burger. Choose different varieties of beef sausage to change up the flavours each time you make the recipe.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 Beef Sausages (about 4 oz/125 g EACH)
	- One 12-inch (30 cm) ready-made or rolled pizza dough crust
	- ½ cup (125 mL) pizza sauce
	- ½ red onion, thinly sliced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded Cheddar cheese
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded Mozzarella cheese
	-  Toppings (optional) 
	- Diced tomato
	- Shredded iceberg lettuce
	- Mayonnaise or Sriracha mayonnaise, in squeeze bottle
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2  Beef Sausages  (about 4 oz/125 g EACH)
	- One 12-inch (30 cm) ready-made or rolled pizza dough crust
	- Pizza sauce
	- Red onion
	- Shredded Cheddar cheese
	- Shredded Mozzarella cheese
	-  Toppings (optional) 
	- Tomato
	- Iceberg lettuce
	- Mayonnaise or Sriracha mayonnaise, in squeeze bottle
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut sausage casings open; cook sausage meat over medium-high heat in nonstick skillet for 8 to 10 minutes, breaking into small chunks with back of spoon, until browned and completely cooked. Remove from heat and drain.
	2. Place pizza crust on a pizza pan or large baking sheet. Spread with pizza sauce and top with cooked sausage meat, onion and cheeses.
	3. Bake in preheated 425°F oven for about 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and crust is crispy and golden. Top with diced tomato, shredded lettuce and a squiggle of mayonnaise/sriracha mayonnaise, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Handle beef sausage meat as you would ground beef: Use or freeze within a day of purchase and cook to 160°F (71°C).
---
Recipe ID: 9ea2e2d0-9357-49cf-b259-fe36b4ed8b6d
Recipe Title: Oven-Roasted Asian-Style Pepper Beef
Recipe Summary: This dish has flavours similar to traditional barbecued pork. The beef is rubbed with a blend of seasonings and then basted with a sweet, tangy Asian inspired barbecue sauce while being slow roasted to medium-rare at the least. Serve sliced on a spicy noodle dish or in a sandwich.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 60
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 130
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH grated peeled gingerroot and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Chuck Flap Tail,about 3 inches (8 cm) thick by 10 inches (25 cm) long
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH soy sauce, ketchup and hoisin sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) rice vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) liquid honey
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Chuck Flap Tail,about 3 inches (8 cm) thick by 10 inches (25 cm) long
	- Soy sauce
	- Rice vinegar
	- Liquid honey
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Ketchup
	- Hoisin sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine garlic, gingerroot and black pepper in a small bowl. Trim the meat, if necessary. Pierce beef all over with a fork. Place on a platter; rub the spices into the meat to coat all over. Set aside. 
	 2. Combine soy sauce, ketchup, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar and honey in a medium bowl to make a glaze. Measure out ¼ cup (60 mL) and brush all over beef. Refrigerate, uncovered, for 1 hour to marinate. Set remaining glaze aside to baste meat during cooking
	3. Place roast on rack in a foil-lined shallow pan. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for 50 to 60 minutes for medium-rare, basting with the reserved glaze every 15 minutes, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	4. Transfer to cutting board, cover loosely with foil and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes. Carve across the grain into thin slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can cook the roast ahead, let it cool, then refrigerate for up to 3 days then reheat and slice to use in a stir-fry or Asian-style soup.
---
Recipe ID: a068a32b-0df4-4bc4-80e2-549a16e46d3c
Recipe Title: Grilled Marinated Steak on Focaccia with Red Onion Relish
Recipe Summary: This caramelized onion relish is the perfect foil for grilled steak. If you have extra, cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 270
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) chopped Spanish onion 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh rosemary leaves, minced
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH mustard seeds and cracked black pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) dry red wine
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) teriyaki sauce
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Outside Skirt Marinating Steak 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 large tomato
	- 4 pieces focaccia
	-  Red Onion Relish 
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) olive oil
	- 2 red onions (about 1 lb/500 g), thinly sliced
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) red wine vinegar
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) liquid honey
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Spanish onion
	- Fresh rosemary leaves
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Mustard seeds
	- Dry red wine
	- Teriyaki sauce
	- Olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Outside Skirt Marinating Steak 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 large tomato
	- 4 pieces focaccia
	- 2 red onions (about 1 lb/500 g)
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Liquid honey
	- Cracked black pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine Spanish onion, rosemary, garlic, mustard seeds, pepper, red wine, teriyaki sauce and olive oil in a large sealable freezer bag or container. Pierce steak all over with a fork and add to bag, massaging with marinade; seal and refrigerate for 4 to 12 hours.
