	2. Red Onion Relish: Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in a large sauté pan or skillet; cook red onion, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add the vinegar and boil, stirring often, until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the honey and boil gently, stirring often, for about 5 minutes or until thickened and the honey coats the onion. Remove from heat and set aside.
	3. Remove the steak from the marinade; discard marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. 
	4. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	5. Meanwhile, slice focaccia and warm in toaster or oven. Cut tomato in half crosswise and place on a rimmed baking sheet. Broil for 3 to 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cool slightly. Chop tomato into chunks. 
	6. Carve steak thinly across the grain into short thin strips; layer on warmed focaccia. Top with chunks of tomato and Red Onion Relish. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Marinades are all about building steak flavour and juiciness. Piercing steak all over with a fork is what helps tenderize the steak.
---
Recipe ID: a127bf5b-d539-4632-812f-1982ab3f7403
Recipe Title: Simple Succotash Sauté
Recipe Summary: This colourful vegetable sauté is a simple, market-fresh side dish that’s the perfect pairing for pan-fried, grilled or oven-roasted beef.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 23
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 ear corn, kernels cut off (or ½ cup/125 mL frozen corn kernels, thawed)
	- 2 small zucchini, sliced
	- 1 small sweet red pepper, diced
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) frozen shelled edamame (optional)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH Cajun spice and ground cumin
	- ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) EACH salt and hot pepper flakes
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) minced fresh parsley or chives
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Melt butter over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add garlic, corn, zucchini, red pepper, edamame (if using), Cajun spice, cumin, salt and hot pepper flakes; cook, stirring occasionally, for about 8 minutes or until vegetables are just tender. Remove from heat and stir in parsley.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can purchase Cajun Spice at the grocery store or you can make your own by stirring together ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) EACH paprika, dried oregano, garlic powder and dried thyme. If you’re buying a spice blend look for one without added salt.
---
Recipe ID: a196d8c8-10a8-4e42-855e-7acfe3507a86
Recipe Title: Seared Steak and Potato Pancake with Salsa Verde
Recipe Summary: This steak and potato recipe definitely has the chef’s touch – from the simple sauce with the pop of fresh from herbs, capers and vinegar to pique the tastebuds, to the twist on potato done rosti-style, and a pan-seared steak that’s comes down to technique to be at its best. This recipe was adapted from Chef Cory Vitello’s original and modified, as necessary, for home cooks.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Salsa Verde
		- 1 garlic clove
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH fresh parsley and basil leaves
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) drained capers
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil 
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) red wine vinegar 
		- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Potato Pancake
		- 2 cups (500 mL) grated peeled potato (see Tip)
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
		- 1 egg
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) grated onion
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) chopped fresh thyme leaves
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
		- Fresh ground pepper
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) unsalted butter
		- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Steaks
		- 2 Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (EACH about 4 oz/125 g)
	- Garnish
		- Thinly sliced radishes, sliced avocado, arugula and halved cherry tomatoes
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Potatoes (russet or yellow-fleshed, see Tip)
	- 1 small onion
	- Fresh thyme
	- Fresh parsley 
	- Fresh basil
	- Garlic
	- 1 lemon
	- 2 radishes
	- Avocado
	- Arugula
	- Cherry tomatoes
	- 2 Beef Top Blade Flat Iron Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (EACH about 4 oz/125 g)
	- Olive oil 
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Capers
	- Red wine vinegar 
	- Unsalted butter
	- Egg
Recipe Methods:
	1. Salsa Verde: Combine garlic, parsley, basil and capers on a cutting board; mince until fine. Transfer to a bowl and stir in oil, lemon juice and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
	2. Potato Pancake: Place potato in a medium bowl and sprinkle with salt; toss to combine and let stand for 5 minutes. Drain in a sieve, squeezing handfuls of the potato to extract excess liquid.
	3. Add egg to same bowl and whisk until blended. Add drained potatoes, onion, thyme, flour and pepper to your taste. Toss to combine and set aside.
	4. Steaks: Pat steaks dry and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat; add a thin layer of oil and swirl to coat. Pan-fry steaks, &nbsp;for 8 to 10 minutes, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer steak to a plate, cover with foil and let rest.
	5. Meanwhile, heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Add butter and 2 tsp (10 mL) oil and let butter melt. Add potato mixture, spreading into an even layer to make 1 pancake. Reduce heat to medium-low and let cook for about 8 minutes or until bottom is well browned and crisp. 
	6. Invert a plate over potato pancake and, wearing oven mitts, carefully flip out onto plate. Slide back into skillet with the uncooked side down. Cook for about 8 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender and bottom is well browned and crisp.
	7. Transfer Potato Pancake to a cutting board; cut in half or quarters. Place on serving plates and top with steaks. Spoon Salsa Verde on top and garnish with radish, avocado, arugula and tomatoes. 
Recipe Tips:
  - For the potato pancake, oblong baking potatoes, such as russet, or yellow-fleshed potatoes work best (avoid waxy new potatoes). You’ll need about 3 medium (1 lb/500 g); use the coarse side of a box cheese grater to grate them. It’s important to squeeze out the liquid to ensure the pancake holds together and you get a crisp, golden brown cake.
---
Recipe ID: a2b8670b-7264-4084-9049-a7317fc6907c
Recipe Title: Pan-Seared Steak au Poivre  
Recipe Summary: There are may versions of the classic recipe. This one is my favourite, although, I have been known to add in a little horseradish and sometimes I like to use English mustard in place of the Dijon, too. This recipe was adapted from Chef Bonacini’s original to cook at home.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks (EACH 6 oz/175 g), trimmed
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) mixed black and white peppercorns, crushed
	- Salt 
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) unsalted butter, divided (approx)
	- 1½ oz (45 mL) brandy
	- Dry white wine 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) no-salt-added beef broth
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) Dijon mustard
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) whipping cream
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) drained green peppercorns
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) pink peppercorns, crushed
	- Chopped fresh parsley and chives 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh parsley
	- Fresh chives
	- 2 Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks (EACH 6 oz/175 g), trimmed
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- No-salt-added beef broth
	- Dijon mustard
	- Salt
	- Black peppercorns
	- White peppercorns
	- Green peppercorns
	- Pink peppercorns
	- Whipping cream
	- Unsalted butter
	- Brandy
	- Dry white wine 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut each steak across the grain into three medallions. Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season all over with black and white peppercorns and salt to your taste. 2. Heat a large, heavy skillet over medium-high heat; add a splash of oil and half the butter. Add steaks, without overcrowding pan; cook for about 2 to 3 minutes, until browned on underside and steak releases easily from pan. Turn with tongs. Cook, basting with a little butter and adding more butter, if needed, for about 3 minutes, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steaks reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Transfer to a plate and let rest for 5 minutes.
	 3. Reduce heat to medium; drain off excess fat from pan. Add brandy and boil, allowing the alcohol to burn off, then add a splash of white wine and simmer for a moment to reduce and allow alcohol to burn off. Pour in beef stock and simmer, stirring and scraping up browned bits from pan. Simmer until liquid is reduced by almost three quarters. 
	4. Stir in mustard, then cream; simmer until reduced and thickened to a sauce consistency. Pour in any accumulated juices from the steaks. Stir in green and pink peppercorns and season with salt to taste.
	 5. Place the steaks onto a hot serving plates, spoon sauce over the top and sprinkle with chopped parsley and chives.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: a36a02eb-66ad-45e5-ab8a-ea639e36fe04
Recipe Title: Spanish-Spiced Grilled Steak
Recipe Summary: Smoked paprika adds a touch of mellow smoke flavour and Spanish flair to an impressive, thick Grilling Steak. Use a hot smoked paprika if you like a bit of kick or a sweet one for a mild fragrant rub. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 120
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 145
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH smoked paprika and chopped fresh rosemary
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 1 Bone-in Prime Rib Grilling Steak, 1½ inch (4 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- Lemon wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Smoked paprika
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 1 Bone-in Prime Rib Grilling Steak, 1½ inch (4 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- Lemons
	- Fresh rosemary
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine smoked paprika, rosemary, garlic, salt and pepper in a bowl. Rub all over steak. Place on a plate; cover and refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours.
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). 
	3. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into middle of steak, not touching bone. Grill steak over direct medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 3 to 4 minutes, turning twice or more, or until browned. Place over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 10 to 15 minutes for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
	4. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Carve meat from the bone, then across the grain into slices and finish with a squeeze of lemon juice.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: a3adf093-01c9-443e-a1a3-d16ed0163543
Recipe Title: Grilled 30-Minute Kiwi and Cola-Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Kiwi and cola combine to make a powerful marinade that works to tenderize value-priced steak in record time. Be careful to not marinate longer than 30 minutes as there is a risk of over-tenderizing the meat.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Outside Round Marinating Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 1 kiwi, peeled
	- 1 cup (250 mL) cola beverage or cranberry juice
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) lemon pepper or steak spice
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Outside Round Marinating Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 1 kiwi
	- Cola beverage or cranberry juice
	- Lemon pepper or steak spice
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place kiwi in sealable freezer bag; seal bag and mash kiwi to a pulp. Add cola to the bag; seal bag and massage to combine. Pierce steak all over with fork and add to bag, massaging with marinade. Seal and refrigerate for 30 minutes (no longer or the meat will go mushy). 
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steak dry with paper towel. Season all over with lemon pepper. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue, or pan-fry or broil using medium-high heat for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	3. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steak across the grain to serve. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Carve Marinating Steaks across the grain to maximize tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: a3bb8f91-0530-4aa5-9a24-658c12d13874
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef & Bacon Skewers with Dip Trio
Recipe Summary: Served with a trio of dips, you will wow everyone with these irresistible beef and bacon skewers. Simplify the recipe by serving with just one dip, but you may have difficulty choosing just one! 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 7
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 27
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 medium bamboo skewers, soaked for 30 minutes
	- 1 cup (250 mL) mayonnaise, divided
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely chopped fresh chives
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely crumbled blue cheese
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) Buffalo-style hot pepper sauce
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) white miso paste
	- 1 small clove garlic, minced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Montreal steak spice
	- 8 slices bacon
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 8 medium bamboo skewers
	- Mayonnaise
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Fresh chives
	- Crumbled blue cheese
	- Buffalo-style hot pepper sauce
	- White miso paste
	- 1 small clove garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak,  1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Montreal steak spice
	- 8 slices bacon
Recipe Methods:
	1. Divide mayonnaise equally into 3 small bowls. Stir mustard and chives into one bowl, blue cheese and hot pepper sauce into second bowl and miso and garlic into third bowl. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve or up to 3 days. 
	2. Cut steak into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes (about 32 pieces). Pat beef dry with paper towel and season all over with steak spice. Cut each slice of bacon crosswise into 4 equal pieces. Wrap each piece around a cube of beef and thread bacon-wrapped beef cubes onto skewers, dividing equally.
	3. Grill skewers in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 7 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides, until bacon is crisp and beef is cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	4. Serve beef and bacon skewers with the trio of dips. 
Recipe Tips:
  - For a cocktail-size appetizer version of this recipe, use mini skewers, threading one or two bacon-wrapped beef cubes onto each skewer. Stay close to the barbecue while cooking the skewers, as grilling bacon can cause flare-ups.
---
Recipe ID: a3ebe807-8b6c-46bd-bfb9-bffbf3f87b6e
Recipe Title: Pesto-Rubbed Oven Roast with Sheet-Pan Vegetables
Recipe Summary: This colourful nutrient-rich dinner cooks all at once for minimal fuss. Serve with cooked couscous, quinoa, rice or pasta. Any extras from tonight’s dinner can be used to jump-start tomorrow’s lunch or dinner. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 125
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 plum tomatoes, cored and quartered
	- 8 oz (250 g) zucchini (about 2), cut into 1/2-inch (1 cm) slices
	- 1 small Spanish onion, cut into 12 wedges
	- 1 EACH baby eggplant and sweet red and yellow pepper, cut into chunks
	- 4 oz (125 g) mushrooms, quartered
	- 6 cloves garlic, peeled
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) basil pesto
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) liquid honey
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast
	- Pinch EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) basil pesto
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 plum tomatoes
	- Zucchini (about 2)
	- 1 small Spanish onion
	- Baby eggplant
	- 4 oz (125 g) mushrooms
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Basil pesto
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Liquid honey
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- Basil pesto
	- Sweet red and yellow peppers
Recipe Methods:
	1. Roasted Vegetables: In large bowl, combine tomatoes, zucchini, onion, eggplant, peppers, mushrooms, garlic and pesto; toss to coat. Spread on foil-lined rimmed baking sheet lightly coated with vegetable cooking spray; set aside.
	2. Beef: Pat beef dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil in heavy sauté pan or ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Brown roast, turning with tongs, for about 10 minutes, until browned all over. Spread pesto all over roast; place on rack in same sauté pan. 
	3. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Roast beef and vegetables in preheated 275°F oven, uncovered, with vegetables on lower rack, for about 1½ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Continue roasting vegetables, if necessary, until tender. 
	5. Using rubber spatula, scrape vegetables into large bowl; toss with vinegar and honey. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with vegetables.
Recipe Tips:
  - When buying a beef oven roast, buy 12 oz (375 g) beef per person for bone-in-roasts, or for boneless roasts, buy 6 to 8 oz (175 to 250 g) beef per person.
---
Recipe ID: a46fd844-293e-4b68-974e-22c44fbe7c3f
Recipe Title: Stir-Fried Thai Beef Salad
Recipe Summary: For those who think salad can never be supper, this spicy Thai version is the real meal deal! Just call it a stir-fry for the skeptics.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 10
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH cornstarch and reduced-sodium soy sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH minced gingerroot and fresh lime juice
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH sesame oil and Asian chili sauce
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-fry Strips
	- Chili-Lime Vinaigrette 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated lime zest
	- 1/4 cup (60 mL) fresh lime juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) rice vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH reduced-sodium soy sauce and liquid honey
	- Dash Asian chili sauce
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) vegetable oil
	- Salad
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 1 cup (250 mL) halved grape tomatoes
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH julienned cucumber, sweet yellow pepper and red onion
	- 8 cups (2 L) torn romaine lettuce
	- Chopped peanuts (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Cornstarch
	- Gingerroot
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Sesame oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-fry Strips
	- 3 or 4 limes
	- Rice vinegar
	- Reduced-sodium soy sauce
	- Vegetable oil
	- Grape tomatoes
	- Cucumber
	- Romaine lettuce
	- Chopped peanuts (optional)
	- Asian Chili Sauce
	- Liquid honey
	- Sweet yellow pepper
	- Red onion
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine cornstarch, soy sauce, gingerroot, lime juice, garlic, sesame oil and chili sauce in a medium bowl. Add beef and toss to coat; let stand for 10 minutes.
	2. Chili-Lime Vinaigrette : Meanwhile, whisk together lime zest, lime juice, vinegar, soy sauce, honey and chili sauce in a small bowl; gradually whisk in oil until blended. Set aside.
	 3. Salad: Heat 1 tsp (5 mL) oil in large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Stir-fry tomatoes, cucumber, yellow pepper and onion until hot and just wilted; transfer to clean large bowl. Heat remaining oil in same pan; add beef and cook for about 1 minute per side, until browned all over. Add to wilted vegetables; toss to combine.
	 4. Add Chili-Lime Vinaigrette to pan. Cook over medium heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits from bottom of pan, until slightly thickened and hot. 
	5. Pour with just enough hot vinaigrette over romaine in a large bowl to moisten; divide among 4 rimmed dinner plates. Top romaine with beef and vegetable mixture. Drizzle remaining vinaigrette over each serving. Garnish with peanuts, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - For making stir-fry at home, a large, flat-bottomed skillet works better than a wok since it’s difficult to get enough heat on a home stove for using a wok, unless you are cooking on a gas stovetop.
---
Recipe ID: a49dcde9-03f5-46d8-8117-956acb024df1
Recipe Title: Grilled Honey Garlic Beef
Recipe Summary: Honey garlic is a classic flavour combination for short ribs. The Chuck Short Ribs used in this recipe are also known as bone-in Miami- or Korean-style Short Ribs. These are cut across the bones into strips, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick. These ribs can be marinated then grilled quickly or can be braised like stewing beef. Serve ribs with coleslaw or potato salad.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 270
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) packed brown sugar
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH soy sauce, liquid honey and rice vinegar 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sesame oil 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced gingerroot 
	- 10 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Chuck Short Ribs, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 8)
	- 4 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) toasted sesame seeds
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Soy sauce
	- Sesame oil
	- Gingerroot
	- 10 cloves garlic
	- Cornstarch
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Chuck Short Ribs, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 8)
	- 4 green onions
	- Toasted sesame seeds
	- Liquid honey
	- Rice vinegar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine sugar, soy sauce, honey, vinegar, sesame oil, gingerroot and garlic in a small saucepan; bring to a boil over medium heat. Gradually whisk cornstarch mixture into sauce; bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook, stirring often, for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened and glossy. Remove from heat; pour into a bowl and let cool completely. 
	2. Pour half the marinade into a large sealable freezer bag; cover remaining sauce in bowl and refrigerate. 
	3. Pierce rib meat all over with a fork. Add ribs to marinade in the bag, massaging sauce into meat to coat; seal bag and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to 24 hours. 
	4. Remove ribs from marinade and pat dry; discard used marinade. Grill ribs in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning often and basting with reserved marinade, until browned and tender.
	5. Serve ribs garnished with green onions and sesame seeds. 
Recipe Tips:
  - You can substitute the marinade/basting sauce with about 1 cup (250 mL) of your favourite store-bought variety, adding a drizzle of sriracha for a spicy kick if you want.
---
Recipe ID: a4dda05d-8137-4575-a03a-dd9b5291edd6
Recipe Title: Classic Braised Beef and Root Vegetables
Recipe Summary: Classic beef stew takes on a new look using bone-in short ribs instead of stewing beef cubes.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 160
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) thick-cut Beef Bone-in Chuck Short Ribs (about 6)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper (approx)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 2 onions, cut into wedges lengthwise
	- 2 carrots, sliced
	- 2 celery stalks, sliced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) tomato paste
	- 3 cups (750 mL) dry red wine
	- 8 sprigs fresh thyme
	- 2 sprigs fresh rosemary
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 3 cups (750 ml) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) thick-cut  Beef Bone-in Chuck Short Ribs  (about 6)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 onions
	- 2 carrots
	- 2 celery stalks
	- All-purpose flour
	- Tomato paste
	- Dry red wine
	- 8 sprigs fresh thyme
	- 2 sprigs fresh rosemary
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat beef dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Heat half of oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef in batches, adding more oil as needed, for about 10 minutes, until browned all over. Transfer beef to plate.
	2. Add onion, carrots and celery to pot. Cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes until onions are golden. Add flour and tomato paste, cook, stirring, for about 2 minutes or until deep red. Stir in wine; reduce heat to medium and bring to boil, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pot. Add thyme, rosemary, bay leaves and broth; return to a boil. Add beef and any accumulated juices to the pot. 
	3. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for about 2 hours or until beef is fork-tender.
	4. Discard bay leaves and herb stems. Transfer ribs to a bowl using a slotted spoon. Skim fat from sauce. Whisk cornstarch mixture into sauce; simmer over medium heat, stirring, for about 2 minutes or until sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon sauce over ribs to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - A tight-fitting lid and a heavy pot are essential for best braising.
---
Recipe ID: a54537b4-c561-497f-8000-ae73be1f444e
Recipe Title: Sous Vide Beer-braised Beef Stew
Recipe Summary: Convenient cubes of beef cook to perfect tenderness in a beer-laced broth; the beef remains a little pink inside which keeps the meat juicy. Look for well marbled beef for the best flavour and texture in this stew. The natural juices of the beef and aromatic vegetables are all you need for a deep flavour. The resulting broth is thinner than a typical stew and is best served over creamy mashed potatoes or egg noodles. The stew can be served directly from the sous vide though it’s not as hot as a typical stew, so a quick heat-up in the saucepan just before serving will bring it up to steaming.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 856
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 876
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 1 large onion, finely chopped
	- 3 EACH carrots and parsnips, finely chopped
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) dried rosemary
	- 1 cup (250 mL) beer, preferably dark or amber
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) tomato paste
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Stew Cubes 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion
	- Carrots
	- Dried rosemary
	- Beer, preferably dark or amber
	- Tomato paste
	- Parsnips
Recipe Methods:
	1. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 140°F (60°C) according to manufacturer’s directions.
	 2. Pat beef dry with paper towel and season with ½ tsp (2 mL) salt and ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Brown beef, in 2 batches and adding more oil as needed, for 8 to 10 minutes, turning until browned on all sides. With slotted spoon, transfer to a bowl. Set aside.
	 3. Add remaining oil to skillet and reduce heat to medium-low. Add onion, carrots, parsnips, rosemary and ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, for about 8 minutes or until onions are softened. Add to beef in bowl. Pour beer and tomato paste into skillet and bring to a boil, scraping up brown bits from bottom of pan. Remove from heat.
	4. Add beef and vegetable mixture to a large bag for sous vide (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Pour in beer mixture. Remove as much air as possible and seal the bag&nbsp; using vacuum sealer. 
	 5. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure it to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Cover water bath with foil or plastic to reduce evaporation. Cook sous vide for 14 hours, replenishing water as necessary.
	 6. Remove the beef from the water bath. Open bag and pour stew into a large saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring often, just until piping hot. Serve in warmed bowls.
Recipe Tips:
  - To make ahead, after removing from water bath, immerse stew in bag in a sink or bowl of ice water and chill, replenishing ice as necessary until cold. Refrigerate in bag for up to 3 days. To serve, heat in a saucepan as directed in step 6.
---
Recipe ID: a63aa54c-9921-446d-8b62-2fcb3f2a0df8
Recipe Title: Spicy Cajun Beef Stir-Fry
Recipe Summary: Capture the spicy flavour of jambalaya in a fraction of the usual preparation time. Streamline it further by preparing the vegetables while the meat marinates. Serve over hot whole grain rice or couscous.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-fry Strips
	- Vegetable oil cooking spray
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH chopped onion, celery and sweet green pepper
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) frozen or drained canned corn kernels
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Chopped fresh parsley
	- Cajun Spice Mix (from scratch or 2 tsp/10 mL purchased Cajun spice)
	- 4½ tsp (22 mL) paprika
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH dried basil and oregano
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) dried thyme
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) garlic powder
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH cayenne pepper and ground mace
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) black pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- Cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-fry Strips
	- Vegetable oil cooking spray
	- Chopped onion
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Frozen or canned corn kernels
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Chopped fresh parsley
	- Cajun Spice Mix (from scratch or 2 tsp/10 mL purchased Cajun spice)
	- Paprika
	- Dried basil
	- Dried thyme
	- Garlic powder
	- Cayenne pepper
	- Black pepper
	- Celery
	- Sweet green pepper
	- Dried oregano
	- Ground mace
Recipe Methods:
	1. Stir-fry: Drain tomatoes, collecting juice in sealable freezer bag; set tomatoes aside. Add cornstarch to juice in bag and stir to combine. Add beef strips to bag, massaging with marinade; seal and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
	2. Cajun Spice Mix: Meanwhile, combine paprika, basil, oregano, thyme, garlic powder, cayenne, mace and pepper in a small bowl. Set 2 tsp (10 mL) aside for stir-fry and store remaining in a jar or airtight container for another use. (Makes about ¼ cup/60 mL.)
	3. Drain meat through colander set over bowl, reserving marinade. Heat a large nonstick skillet or wok over medium-high heat and spray with cooking spray. Cook beef strips for 1 minute per side or until just browned. Transfer to bowl.
	4. Add onion, celery, green pepper and garlic to pan; stir-fry for 5 minutes or until almost tender-crisp. Stir in reserved Cajun Spice Mix, reserved marinade, tomatoes, beef and any accumulated juices and corn. Bring to boil; cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until sauce is thickened. Remove from heat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with parsley.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use remaining Cajun Spice Mix for another stir-fry or as a rub on beef roasts or steaks before roasting or grilling.
---
Recipe ID: a6588be2-62c3-4817-bed5-b7a5c9faaa5a
Recipe Title: Spicy Italian Sandwich Steak with Provolone
Recipe Summary: Weeknight dinners, tailgate parties or hearty lunches – all are made better with this hero sandwich. Tender beef strips are tossed with sautéed onions, peppers, mushrooms and rapini then served in a garlic-butter roll with gooey cheese. Top off with pickled banana peppers for a spicy finish! 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Sandwich Steaks, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) wide strips
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil, divided
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 pkg (227g) sliced mushrooms
	- 1 onion, sliced
	- 3 cups (750 mL) chopped trimmed rapini, broccolini, broccoli florets or torn kale leaves
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried Italian herb seasoning
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) garlic butter
	- 6 Italian buns, split 
	- 12 slices provolone cheese
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) drained pickled sliced Italian banana peppers or thinly sliced roasted red peppers
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Sandwich Steaks, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) wide strips
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- 1 pkg (227g) sliced mushrooms
	- 1 onion
	- Trimmed rapini, broccolini, broccoli florets or torn kale leaves
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Garlic butter
	- 6 Italian buns, split 
	- 12 slices provolone cheese
	- Pickled sliced Italian banana peppers or roasted red peppers
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat beef strips dry with paper towel; season with half each of the salt and pepper.
	2. Heat half the oil over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet; cook beef strips and garlic for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring, until cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF) and browned but just slightly pink inside. Transfer to a bowl.
	3. Add remaining oil to skillet; cook mushrooms, onion, rapini, Italian seasoning, hot pepper flakes and remaining salt and pepper, stirring often, for 5 to 7 minutes or until softened. Return beef with any accumulated juices to skillet and toss to combine. Remove from heat. 
	4. Meanwhile, spread garlic butter on cut sides of buns. Place buttered-side up on a rimmed baking sheet. Broil for 2 minutes until bread is lightly toasted. Arrange cheese slices inside each bun; broil for 2 minutes until cheese is melted. Using tongs, fill each bun with the beef mixture. Top with pickled peppers.
Recipe Tips:
  - Make your own garlic butter by combining ¼ cup (60 mL) softened butter, 2 cloves garlic, minced, ½ tsp (2 mL) dried Italian herb seasoning and a pinch of each salt and pepper.
---
Recipe ID: a688ac59-10f6-4f07-9301-6b5dc645ae6d
Recipe Title: Sous Vide Salt-Rubbed Beef
Recipe Summary: The sous vide technique is a good way to cook beef cuts that would normally be braised, such as stew cubes, simmering steaks, short ribs and small beef pot roasts and these beef cheeks.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 720
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 730
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 Beef Cheeks (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) coarse sea salt 
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 10 fresh sage leaves, roughly chopped
	- 4 tbsp (60 mL) bacon fat or beef tallow (approx)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3  Beef Cheeks  (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- Coarse sea salt
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- 10 fresh sage leaves
	- Bacon fat or beef tallow
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim fat and any silver skin from the beef cheeks. Place on a platter. Combine salt, garlic and sage in a bowl. Spread salt mixture all over beef to heavily coat. Refrigerate, uncovered, for 3 hours.
	2. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 185°F (85°C) according to manufacturer’s directions.
	3. Rinse the salt mixture from the beef and pat dry with paper towel. Place 1 cheek in its own vacuum seal bag; add 1 tbsp (15 mL) bacon fat per bag. Remove as much air as possible and seal bags using vacuum sealer.
	 4. Immerse bags in preheated water bath and secure to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bags above the surface of the water. Cover water bath with foil or plastic to reduce evaporation. Cook sous vide for 12 hours.
	5. Remove each cheek from its bag, discarding liquid. Pat beef dry with paper towel. Heat a large cast-iron skillet over high heat. Add just enough of the remaining bacon fat to coat the skillet. Add beef cheeks and sear for about 30 seconds per side, turning once, until browned. Cut each in half to serve. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Cooking sous vide at this high temperature causes the water to evaporate during the cooking process. Cover your cooking container with foil to reduce evaporation and check level often, replenishing with hot water, as necessary.
---
Recipe ID: a720a863-6ac7-407c-82e5-2ce56ce0792d
Recipe Title: Java Pepper Steak
Recipe Summary: The coffee in this recipe may seem unusual, but it beautifully balances the other flavours. If it’s too unconventional for your liking, it can be omitted.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 12
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 17
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) finely ground coffee (not instant), optional
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) pepper
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) ground cumin
	- 4 Beef Grilling Medallions (e.g. Rib Eye, Strip Loin or Top Sirloin), 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (1-1/2 lb/750 g)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Finely ground coffee (not instant), optional
	- Pepper
	- Ground cumin
	- 4 Beef Grilling Medallions (e.g. Rib Eye, Strip Loin or Top Sirloin), 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (1-1/2 lb/750 g)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine coffee, pepper, cumin, and salt to taste in large sealable freezer bag. Shake each medallion separately in bag until evenly coated.
	2. Place medallions on lightly oiled grill over medium-high heat; close lid and cook, turning once, for 6 to 7 minutes per side for medium or to desired doneness.
	3. Remove to platter; tent with foil and let stand for 5 minutes.
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: a77c0336-f295-4708-8947-fb88804319a2
Recipe Title: Grilled Barbecue-Basted Beef
Recipe Summary: Store-bought barbecue sauce gets jazzed up with molasses, Worcestershire sauce and mustard for a boost of umami flavours that beautifully compliment the richness of the beef short ribs. Spice lovers can add a good dash of hot sauce for some extra heat. Serve with corn on the cob and potato salad for the perfect summer meal.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 258
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH sweet paprika and packed brown sugar
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dried thyme leaves, garlic powder and dry mustard 
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Chuck Short Ribs, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 8)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) barbecue sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH fancy molasses and Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) yellow or spicy mustard
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Sweet paprika
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Dried thyme leaves
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Chuck Short Ribs, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 8)
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Fancy molasses
	- Yellow or spicy mustard
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Garlic powder
	- Dry mustard
	- Worcestershire sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine paprika, sugar, salt, pepper, thyme, garlic powder and dried mustard in a small bowl. Pat short ribs dry with paper towel. Rub ribs all over with spice blend and place on platter or plate. Tightly cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to one day. 
	2. Combine barbecue sauce, molasses, Worcestershire sauce and mustard; set aside for basting.
	3. Grill ribs in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning often and basting with barbecue sauce mixture during the last 3 minutes of grilling, until browned, glossy and tender.
Recipe Tips:
  - Chuck Short Ribs used in this recipe are also known as bone-in Miami- or Korean-style Short Ribs. These are cut across the bones into strips, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick. These ribs can be marinated then grilled quickly or can be braised like stewing beef.
---
Recipe ID: a7e583b4-ac54-4e67-bf77-585e0ddf6014
Recipe Title: Speedy Skillet Minute Steak with Rapid Ratatouille
Recipe Summary: A super-simple rendition of ratatouille served with a seasoned minute steak to match and bump up the protein content of the meal. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 Beef Minute/Sandwich/Fast-fry Steaks, 4 to 6 oz (125 to 175 g) each
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) herbes de Provence, divided (or a mix of dried tarragon, oregano, thyme leaves)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 medium zucchini, diced
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 small sweet onion, diced
	- 20 cherry tomatoes, halved
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) crumbled feta cheese
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) minced Italian parsley or basil (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 Beef Minute/Sandwich/Fast-fry Steaks, 4 to 6 oz (125 to 175 g) each
	- Herbes de Provence (or a mix of dried tarragon, oregano, thyme leaves)
	- Salt and pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 medium zucchini
	- 1 clove garlic
	- 1 small sweet onion
	- 20 cherry tomatoes
	- Crumbled feta cheese
	- Italian parsley or basil (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; season each steak, on both sides, with ½ tsp (2 mL) of the herbes de Provence and salt and pepper.
	 2. Heat oil in nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and cook steaks for 4 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more until steaks are cooked to medium (160°F/71°C) at the least. Transfer to a plate, cover with foil to keep warm; set aside. 
	 3. Add zucchini, garlic, onion and remaining 1 tsp (5 mL) herbes de Provence to pan. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until onion starts to soften. Add tomatoes and continue to cook, stirring often, for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in feta and parsley (if using) and serve over steaks.
Recipe Tips:
  - Seasoning prior to cooking enhances the flavour of steaks better than if you season the steaks after cooking.
---
Recipe ID: a8478b54-3011-4b26-b746-c725761eec5b
Recipe Title: Fruity-Glazed Slow Cooker Beef Meatballs
Recipe Summary: Folks just can’t seem to get enough of this slow-cooker party classic with its tangy sweet-and-sour sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 250
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 265
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Meatballs, about sixteen 1-inch (2.5 cm), uncooked
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH chili sauce (bottled or homemade) and canned whole berry cranberry sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) soy sauce
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) lemon juice
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Meatballs, about sixteen 1-inch (2.5 cm), uncooked
	- Chili sauce (bottled or homemade)
	- Packed brown sugar
	- Soy sauce
	- Lemon juice
	- Canned whole berry cranberry sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Arrange meatballs on lightly oiled parchment paper- or foil-lined rimmed baking sheet, spacing them apart. Bake in preheated 400°F oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several meatballs reads at least 160°F (71°C).
	2. Meanwhile, combine chili sauce, cranberry sauce, brown sugar, soy sauce and lemon juice in a 3 to 4-qt (3 to 4 L) slow cooker. Add meatballs and stir gently to coat.
	3. Cook, covered, on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours, or until sauce is bubbly and meatballs are hot.
Recipe Tips:
  - If desired, to serve as individual appetizers, remove the meatballs from the slow cooker with a slotted spoon and skim fat from sauce. Skewer meatballs and serve in small dishes on a pool of sauce.
---
Recipe ID: a86a8e20-0992-406b-b126-269556bb78c7
Recipe Title: Spiced Turmeric Beef Broth
Recipe Summary: This bone broth is a lovely golden colour thanks to the turmeric and the aromatics which are boosted by the spices. Each one adds a special warming flavour and fragrance to the broth. The initial brief boiling ensures that the broth remains clear. The recipe makes about 6 quarts (6 L), enough for twenty-four 1-cup (250 mL) servings
Recipe Prep Time: 50
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 540
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 590
Recipe Servings: 24
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 lb (3.5 kg) Beef Soup Bones, 2- to 3-inch (5 to 7.5 cm) pieces
	- 2 heads garlic, cut in half crosswise
	- 1 large bunch kale, trimmed, stems left on
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) thinly sliced gingerroot
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) thinly sliced fresh turmeric root (or 1 tsp/5 mL ground turmeric)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) coriander seeds
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH fenugreek seeds and whole black peppercorns
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 8 lb (3.5 kg)  Beef Soup Bones,  2- to 3-inch (5 to 7.5 cm) pieces
	- 2 heads garlic
	- 1 large bunch kale
	- Gingerroot
	- Fresh turmeric root (or 1 tsp/5 mL ground turmeric)
	- Coriander seeds
	- Fenugreek seeds
	- Whole black peppercorns
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place beef bones in a minimum 12-quart (12 L) stockpot. Add enough cold water to cover by 2 inches (5 cm). Bring to a boil over high heat; boil, uncovered, for 15 minutes. Drain and discard the water.
	2. Rinse the bones under cool water, carefully removing any scum clinging to the bones. Wash out the pot and return the bones to pot. Add 8 quarts (8 L) water and return to a boil over high heat. Remove any scum that rises to the surface with a large spoon, then turn down to a simmer. Gently simmer broth for 7 to 11 hours, maintaining a water level of 3 inches (7.5 cm) above the bones by adding water as needed, until flavour is developed.
	3. Stir in garlic, kale, ginger, turmeric, coriander seeds, fenugreek seeds and peppercorns. Gently simmer for 1 hour.
	4. Drain the broth through a colander or large sieve into a large bowl or another pot, pressing down on the solids. Discard solids. Use immediately or let broth cool. Store in airtight containers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 6 months.
Recipe Tips:
  - Soup Bones can come as a knuckle bone or straight femur type or as a mixture of the two.
---
Recipe ID: a88d01ad-0e05-4cfd-9a71-9008a1277758
Recipe Title: Bacon-Wrapped Skillet Steak Medallions with Garlic Butter
Recipe Summary: The classic bacon-wrapped tenderloin stands the test of time because it is simply so delicious. It makes a wonderful main for a dinner party for four, or half the recipe for a special dinner for two. Pan-searing the steaks on the stove-top promotes even browning and finishing in the oven cooks the bacon to perfection. Note: you can substitute any thick beef medallion for the tenderloin – try Strip Loin or Top Sirloin Medallions if you find them at the meat counter. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Garlic Compound Butter
		- ½ cup (125 mL) butter, softened 
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH grated Parmesan cheese and finely chopped fresh parsley
		- 2 large cloves garlic, minced
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Steaks
		- 4 Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (EACH about 5 oz/150 g or 1¼ lb/625 g total)
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh ground pepper
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
		- 4 slices bacon
		- 4 tsp (20 mL) vegetable oil
		- Butcher’s twine or toothpicks
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Butter
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
	- Fresh parsley
	- 2 large cloves garlic
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4  Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks,  1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (EACH about 5 oz/150 g or 1¼ lb/625 g total)
	- 4 slices bacon
	- Vegetable oil
	- Butcher’s twine or toothpicks
Recipe Methods:
	Garlic Compound Butter: : 
		1. Combine butter, Parmesan cheese, parsley, garlic, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Spoon butter mixture into a log shape on a piece of plastic wrap. Roll butter mixture tightly in plastic wrap, twisting the ends to seal. Freeze for 10 to 15 minutes, until firm enough to slice.
	Steaks: : 
		2. Meanwhile, pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with pepper and salt. Wrap one slice of bacon around each steak; secure with butcher’s twine or toothpicks. 
		3. Heat oil over medium-high heat in large cast-iron or oven-safe heavy stainless steel skillet. Add steaks and sear for 4 to 6 minutes, turning once. 
		4. Transfer skillet to preheated 400°F oven and cook steaks for 5 to 7 minutes for medium-rare doneness (145°F/63°C) at the least, testing doneness with a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into steak (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
		5. Cut compound butter into ¼-inch (5 mm) thick coins and place 1 to 2 coins on each steak. Cover loosely with foil and let rest for 5 minutes. Cut butcher’s twine or remove toothpicks and discard before serving. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Store extra compound butter in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Use to flavour steamed vegetables, croutons, spread over grilled bread or toast, or to toss with cooked potatoes, rice or noodles.
---
Recipe ID: a8fc957c-75bb-4bef-a84e-024e9414ba8e
Recipe Title: Grilled Szechwan-Style Steak with Sesame Noodles
Recipe Summary: Want a secret recipe for healthy eating? Pick ingredients that pack in a nutrient punch. This recipe has it all: whole grain, powerful protein (Beef), and a variety of colourful vegetables.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 16
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 36
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 green onions
	- 2 cups (500 mL) sugar snap peas, trimmed
	- 2 sweet red peppers, cut into chunks
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) hoisin sauce
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH rice vinegar, minced gingerroot and minced garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) Chinese five-spice powder
	- 1 pkg (375 g) whole wheat linguine (uncooked)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sesame oil
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- ½ cup (125 mL) unsalted roasted peanuts
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 green onions
	- Sugar snap peas
	- 2 sweet red peppers
	- Hoisin sauce
	- Rice vinegar
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Chinese five-spice powder
	- 1 pkg (375 g) whole wheat linguine (uncooked)
	- Sesame oil
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Unsalted roasted peanuts
	- Gingerroot
	- Garlic
Recipe Methods:
	1. Thinly slice dark green portion of onion tops; set aside. Cut remaining onion portions into 2-inch (5 cm) lengths; toss together with peas, peppers, hoisin, vinegar, gingerroot and garlic on large foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Set aside.
	2. Rub beef all over with Chinese five-spice powder. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted in centre of steak reads for 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Transfer to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 10 minutes.
	3. Meanwhile, cook linguine in a large pot of boiling salted water according to package directions until tender. Drain well and return to pot. Add reserved sliced green onions, sesame oil and hot pepper flakes, tossing to coat.
	4. Broil vegetables for 5 to 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until lightly charred. 
	 5. Cut steak across the grain into thin slices. Mound Sesame Noodles on plates; top with broiled vegetables and serve with beef slices. Sprinkle with peanuts.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling.
---
Recipe ID: a961519b-5319-47fa-998b-91096db9ba4a
Recipe Title: Garlic-Sautéed Mushrooms
Recipe Summary: A simple grilled, broiled or pan-fried steak or burger turns into a restaurant-worthy dish with the addition of perfectly seasoned, sautéed mushrooms. The trick is to cook the mushrooms long enough to release and evaporate the liquid for a deep, caramelized flavour.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 15
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH olive oil and butter
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced cremini and/or button mushrooms
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) steak spice
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil and butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Cook mushrooms, garlic and steak spice and a pinch each of salt and pepper, stirring often, for 10 minutes or until liquid is released and evaporates, and mushrooms are softened and golden brown. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Recipe Tips:
  - Switch up the seasoning to suit your tastes and the rest of the meal. Instead of steak spice, try Cajun spice or substitute 1 tsp (5 mL) chopped fresh thyme or sage or 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh parsley or basil. You can add a splash or cream to finish if you like.
