Recipe ID: a9c54add-5d39-4946-b18c-0004c69235e7
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef Sausage with Tangy Fresh Slaw
Recipe Summary: The colourful crispy apple slaw is the perfect match for beef sausage – especially the Oktoberfest variety.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH rice vinegar and vegetable oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH fresh lemon or lime juice and liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced fresh mint, cilantro or parsley
	- 1 apple (skin on), julienned or thinly sliced
	- 1 small carrot, julienned or grated
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) thinly sliced red onion
	- ½ stalk celery, thinly sliced
	- Salt and pepper 
	- 4 Beef Sausages (about 1 lb/500 g)
	- 4 sausage buns
	- Grainy or smooth Dijon mustard (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Rice vinegar
	- Fresh lemon or lime juice
	- Fresh mint, cilantro or parsley
	- 1 apple (skin on)
	- 1 small carrot
	- Red onion
	- Stalk celery
	- Salt and pepper 
	- 4 Beef Sausages  (about 1 lb/500 g)
	- 4 sausage buns
	- Grainy or smooth Dijon mustard (optional)
	- Vegetable oil
	- Liquid honey
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk together vinegar, oil, lemon juice, honey and mint in a medium bowl. Add apple, carrot, onion and celery; toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste; toss well. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.
	2. Meanwhile, grill the sausages on a lightly oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 14 minutes, turning often, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted lengthwise into centre of each sausage reads 160°F (71°C). Transfer to a plate and keep warm. Toast the buns lightly, split side down on the grill. 
	 3. Assemble sausages into toasted buns and use tongs or a slotted spoon to top with the Apple Slaw and Dijon mustard (if using) to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer to best judge if sausage is done. Cutting sausages open to check for doneness reduces the juiciness of sausages and is not a true way to test doneness.
---
Recipe ID: a9c7c996-7fea-4d0f-9119-2fa501d22770
Recipe Title: Roasted Beef Marrow Bone Osso Buco-Style with Gremolata
Recipe Summary: The creamy marrow is one of the highlights when eating osso buco. This recipe lets you indulge all you want. Serve with a loaf of good, crusty bread to spread the marrow on before dipping it into the sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 140
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 12 pieces Beef Marrow Bones, Cross-cut,2 inches (5 cm) thick
	- Salt
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh ground pepper
	-  Sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra-virgin olive oil 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) finely diced onion	
	- ½ cup (125 mL) finely diced carrot
	- ½ cup (125 mL) finely diced celery
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley
	- 2 medium cloves garlic, minced	
	- 1 lemon	
	- 2 bay leaves	
	- 1 cup (250 mL) strained tomatoes (passata)
	- 3 cups (750 mL) beef broth
	- Salt and pepper
	-  Gremolata
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley	
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) minced garlic
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 12 pieces  Beef Marrow Bones, Cross-cut,2 inches (5 cm) thick
	- Olive oil
	- Extra-virgin olive oil
	- Onion
	- Carrot
	- Celery
	- Fresh parsley
	- Garlic
	- 1 lemon	
	- 2 bay leaves	
	- 1 cup (250 mL) strained tomatoes (passata)
	- Beef broth
	- Salt and pepper
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. To prepare marrow bones, with the back of a sturdy knife, scrape off any meat clinging to the outside of the bones. In a large container or nonreactive bowl, stir 3 tbsp (45 mL) salt and 4 quarts (4 L) water together until salt is dissolved. Add the marrow bones, cover and refrigerate overnight or for 24 hours. Drain bones well. 
	2. Sauce: Heat oil over medium heat in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Add onion, carrot, celery, and parsley and sauté until the vegetables are soft but not browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
	 3. Meanwhile, using a vegetable peeler, peel 2 strips of the yellow zest (avoiding the white pith) from lemon. Finely grate 4 tsp (20 mL) zest and set aside for the gremolata (wrap and refrigerate if making sauce ahead). Reserve remaining lemon for another use.
	 4. Add strips of lemon zest, garlic, bay leaves, tomatoes, wine and broth to pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 1½ hours or until reduced by two-thirds and thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. (Make ahead: The sauce may be prepared up to 2 days in advance. Let cool, cover and refrigerate.)
	5. Gremolata: When ready to serve, combine the grated lemon zest, parsley and garlic in a small bowl and set aside.
	6. Place the marrow bones 2 inches (5 cm) apart on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Brush bones lightly with oil and season lightly with salt and pepper. Bake in preheated 350ºF for 15 minutes. Reheat the sauce in a saucepan over medium heat until simmering while the bones are roasting. 
	7. Spoon sauce on 4 heated plates and place 3 marrow bones on each. Sprinkle with the gremolata and serve immediately.
Recipe Tips:
  - When preparing the Marrow Bones, the soaking step helps firm up the marrow and helps it be a creamy white. Scraping helps make the bones look more attractive. You can skip this step if you prefer.
---
Recipe ID: ac3e4eef-d00a-405a-bf2a-31260b6bbacc
Recipe Title: Beef Curry
Recipe Summary: Beef Blade is cooked for a couple of hours in this beef curry, resulting in a tender, flavourful dish. This makes a great Sunday meal with lots of extra so you have enough for lunches during the week. Serve with rice or naan.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Boneless Blade Pot Roast or Simmering Steak, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH garlic paste and gingerroot paste (see Tip*)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sunflower or canola oil
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) fried onions (see Tip**)
	- 6 tbsp (90 mL) canned crushed tomatoes
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) tomato paste
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) garam masala
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground cumin and coriander
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground turmeric 
	- 1 to 2 green chili peppers, chopped (optional)
	- Fresh cilantro leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic paste*
	- Gingerroot paste*
	- 1 to 2 green chili peppers (optional)
	- Fresh cilantro
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Boneless Blade Pot Roast or Simmering Steak, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Garam masala
	- Ground cumin 
	- Ground coriander
	- Salt
	- Ground turmeric 
	- Fried onions**
	- Canned crushed tomatoes
	- Tomato paste
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine beef, garlic and ginger in a bowl.
	2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef, in batches, turning, until browned all over.
	3. Stir in fried onions, crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, garam masala, cumin, coriander, salt and turmeric. Cook, stirring, until the tomato and oil separates. Stir in green chilies to taste, if using.
	4. Stir in 2 cups (500 mL) water and bring to a simmer. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for about 2 hours or until the beef is fork-tender. Check the curry as it simmers and add more water as needed to keep the curry saucy. Serve garnished with cilantro.
Recipe Tips:
  - *For the garlic and gingerroot paste, you can use the purée or paste found in jars in the grocery store or use a fine grater, such as a Microplane, to make your own purée in small amounts just as you need it. **Fried onions, which are crispy, dehydrated fried onions, can be found in packages or containers at any Indian grocery store or in the Southeast Asian section of well-stocked supermarkets.
---
Recipe ID: acaf2c0a-39b7-477d-bee4-06165fee342f
Recipe Title: Smoker-Style Barbecued Beef Roast with Herb Mop
Recipe Summary: With a few steps and just a few basic ingredients, you can make this subtly smoked Beef Brisket without a smoker! You can skip the Herb Mop and simply add 2 tbsp (30 mL) each chopped fresh rosemary, thyme and oregano leaves to the vinegar sauce. Adding wood chips to the barbecue won’t produce the same intense flavour as a smoker and the brisket won’t achieve the coveted smoke ring but it will have a great crust and will be beautifully tender. For the strongest smoke flavour, select a hard wood, such as hickory or mesquite. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 480
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 495
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Wood chips, such as hickory or mesquite, soaked according to package directions 
	- Herb Mop
		- 1 small bunch rosemary sprigs
		- 1 small bunch thyme sprigs
		- 1 small bunch oregano sprigs
		- 1 stick, twig or old wooden spoon
		- Butcher’s twine
	- Smoked Brisket
		- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH white vinegar and cider vinegar
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH packed brown sugar and ketchup 
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) hot pepper sauce, such as Frank’s
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dry mustard, garlic powder and onion powder
		- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Brisket, Point Portion (Pot Roast)
		- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Wood chips, such as hickory or mesquite
	- 1 small bunch rosemary sprigs
	- 1 small bunch thyme sprigs
	- 1 small bunch oregano sprigs
	- 1 stick, twig or old wooden spoon
	- Butcher’s twine
	- White vinegar
	- Cider vinegar
	- Brown sugar
	- Ketchup
	- Hot pepper sauce, such as Frank’s
	- Dry mustard
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Brisket, Point Portion (Pot Roast)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder
Recipe Methods:
	1. Fill drip pan part way with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). Turn off burner under drip pan.
	2. Add soaked wood chips to smoker box. Alternatively, wrap 2 cups (5 oz/150 g) wood chips loosely in foil to create a small pouch, punching a few holes at the top of the pouch to let the smoke out. Place smoker box or pouch on the grill grate above the burner that is turned on for 10 to 20 minutes, or until starting to smoke.
	Herb Mop: : 
		3. Meanwhile, arrange rosemary, thyme and oregano sprigs together like a bouquet of flowers. Attach to the end of a stick, twig or wooden spoon by tying together with butcher’s twine to make a broom handle or the herb “mop”; set aside.
	Smoked Brisket: : 
		4. Combine white vinegar, cider vinegar, sugar, ketchup, hot pepper sauce, mustard, garlic powder and onion powder in a medium bowl; set aside for basting. Pat beef dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper. 
		5. Place roast on grill over drip pan (off the heat). Insert an oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into centre of roast, avoiding fat.
		 6. Close lid and cook for 2 hours. Flip roast and baste with vinegar sauce using herb mop. Repeat flipping and basting every 2 hours, for 8 to 10 hours total cooking time until meat is fork-tender and thermometer reads between 200°F (93°C) and 205°F (96°C).
		7. Transfer brisket to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for at least 15 minutes.
		 8. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Avoid lifting the barbecue lid to ‘peek’ at the brisket between mopping intervals. For best flavour and tenderness, you want to keep the smoke inside and maintain an even temperature. When flipping and basting, work quickly and close the lid as soon possible. Let your brisket stand at least 15 minutes before carving to allow the juices to settle. Serve with your favourite barbecue sauce on the side, if desired. Leftover brisket will develop a smokier flavour the next day.
---
Recipe ID: ad6648fb-c437-4dc0-b9a1-3e6db4e116e6
Recipe Title: Beef Steak, Kidney and Mushroom Pie
Recipe Summary: A classic dish that’s good served with mashed potatoes. 
Recipe Prep Time: 40
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 140
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Kidney (about 1 lb/500 g) 
	- Salt
	- 4 tbsp (60 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) unsalted butter
	- 1 cup (250 mL) diced onion
	- ½ cup (125 mL) diced celery
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine
	- 3 cups (750 mL) beef broth
	- 3 sprigs fresh thyme (or ¼ tsp/1 mL dried)
	- 2 bay leaves 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 2 cups (500 mL) sliced (½-inch/1 cm thick) carrots
	- 12 oz (375 g) small mushrooms, halved
	- Pie pastry for double-crust 9-inch (23 cm) pie (homemade or store-bought)
	- 1 egg yolk beaten with 2 tsp (10 mL) water
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Kidney (about 1 lb/500 g) 
	- Salt
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Unsalted butter
	- Onion
	- Celery
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- All-purpose flour
	- Dry red wine
	- Beef broth
	- Dry or fresh thyme
	- Bay leaves
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Carrots
	- Small mushrooms
	- Pie pastry for double-crust 9-inch (23 cm) pie (homemade or store-bought)
	- 1 egg
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut the beef kidney in half lengthwise. Trim out any fat and membranes. Cut kidney into ¼-inch (5 mm) thick slices. Place 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt and 4 cups (1 l) water in a medium pot. Add the kidney and bring to a boil. Turn off the heat and let sit for 15 minutes. Drain and rinse under cool water, removing any scum. Cover and refrigerate while you prepare the rest of the ingredients.
	2. Season blade steak with salt to your taste. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over high heat in a Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Add beef, in 2 batches, and cook until browned on all sides. Transfer to a plate. Add 1 tbsp (15 mL) more oil to pot between batches. 
	 3. Add butter to pot and melt over medium heat. Cook onion, celery and garlic, stirring occasionally, for 4 to 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle in flour and stir well (the mixture will be dry). Gradually whisk in the wine. Whisk in the broth and bring to a boil. Stir in beef and any accumulated juices, kidney, thyme, bay leaves, Worcestershire sauce and ½ tsp (2 mL) salt.
	4. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 2½ to 3 hours, adding carrots for the last 30 minutes, until the kidney and beef are fork-tender. Discard thyme stems and bay leaves.
	 5. Heat remaining 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Cook mushrooms, stirring, for 4 to 5 minutes or until they start to brown around the edges. Stir into beef mixture. Transfer to an 11 by 7-inch (28 x 17.5 cm) baking dish.
	 6. Roll the pastry on a lightly floured surface into a rectangle that is 1 inch (2.5 cm) larger than the dimensions of the baking dish. Drape the pastry evenly over the dish and fold the overhang under, crimping it around the edge. With a small sharp knife, cut 4 V-shaped vents down the middle of the pastry. Brush the pastry with the egg yolk mixture.
	 7. Place dish on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet to catch any drips. Bake in preheated 400ºF oven for 30 to 40 minutes until the pastry is golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
Recipe Tips:
  - While the filling simmers in step 4, check the level of the liquid. It should be reduced to a medium-thick sauce by the end of cooking; add splashes of water if it’s reducing too quickly. If the sauce is too thin at the end of cooking, uncover and cook over medium heat until it thickens.
---
Recipe ID: ad66ee33-38c6-407a-9d76-0179ba60ae67
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef Burger Luxe
Recipe Summary: A fine-dining burger with sophisticated toppings that you can easily make at home with store-bought Ground Beef Patties.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Patties
	- ½ cup (125 mL) mayonnaise
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced drained capers
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced fresh dillweed (optional)
	- 4 ciabatta buns, split
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH baby spinach leaves and shaved prosciutto
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) diced red onion
	- ½ cup (125 mL) crumbled feta cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Patties
	- Mayonnaise
	- Capers
	- Fresh dillweed (optional)
	- 4 ciabatta buns
	- Baby spinach leaves
	- Shaved prosciutto
	- Red onion
	- Crumbled feta cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Grill patties on a lightly oiled grill over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 10 to 14 minutes for ¾-inch (2 cm) thick patties, turning twice or more, or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each patty reads 160°F (71°C).&nbsp;
	 2. Meanwhile, combine mayonnaise, capers and dillweed (if using) in a small bowl. Toast ciabatta buns.
	 3. Place patties on toasted buns, spread with mayo mixture then top with spinach, prosciutto and onion and sprinkle with feta cheese.
Recipe Tips:
  - All ground beef patties come designated as Extra Lean, Lean, Medium or Regular, based on the maximum fat content. This designation is the same for all ground meats and ground meat patties: beef, turkey, veal, chicken, pork and lamb.
---
Recipe ID: adaf9b03-70d4-4b19-afac-2b0b4719e702
Recipe Title: Barbecued Jerk-Style Marinated Roast with Avocado Salad
Recipe Summary: This makes a great patio supper and is perfect for a gathering of friends and family. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 7¼-in (18 cm) long x 5½-in (14 cm) wide x 3¾-in (9.5 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 720
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 840
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) EACH minced onion and vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH fresh lime juice or cider vinegar and packed brown sugar
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH minced garlic, ground allspice, dried thyme and hot pepper sauce
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, pepper and hot pepper flakes
	- 3½ lb (1.75 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast
	- 10 large flatbreads, such as roti or flour tortillas
	- Avocado Salad
		- 2 medium tomatoes, seeded and cut into chunks
		- 2 avocados, cut into chunks
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lime juice
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) minced garlic
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) hot pepper sauce (approx)
		- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil
	- Fresh lime juice or cider vinegar
	- Ground allspice
	- Dried thyme
	- Hot pepper sauce
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Nutmeg
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- 3½ lb (1.75 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast
	- 10 large flatbreads, such as roti or flour tortillas
	- 2 medium tomatoes
	- 2 avocados
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Garlic
	- Hot pepper sauce (approx)
	- Brown Sugar
	- Onion
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine onion, oil, lime juice, brown sugar, garlic, allspice, thyme, hot pepper sauce, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, pepper and hot pepper flakes in large sealable freezer bag. Remove 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the marinade and set aside to use in the Avocado Salad. Pierce roast all over with fork and add to bag, massaging marinade into roast; seal and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours. 
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat roast dry with paper towel. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1¾ hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: see ‘ESTIMATED COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	4. Avocado Salad: Meanwhile, gently combine tomatoes and avocados in a bowl. Stir in 2 tbsp (30 mL) reserved marinade, lime juice, garlic and hot pepper sauce. Season with salt, pepper and additional hot pepper sauce to taste. 
	5. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, grill flatbreads over medium heat, for about 1 minute per side, or until warmed and grill-marked. Wrap in a clean towel or foil to keep warm. 
	6. Carve roast thinly across the grain and serve with warm flatbreads and Avocado Salad.
Recipe Tips:
  - Carving roast beef across the grain into thin slices optimizes tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: ae74b483-dd3d-40a1-ae2e-270f8fd1a6c9
Recipe Title: Draft Test Mediterranean Grilled Sirloin
Recipe Summary: Marinate Sirloin Tip steaks with fragrant herbs and a hit of garlic and lemon. Serve with chunky grilled sweet peppers and zucchini, and boiled new potatoes with a dollop of plain Greek yogurt.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH fresh parsley, oregano, rosemary and thyme leaves
	- 4 garlic cloves
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) black peppercorns
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 lemon
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 12oz Sirloin
	- 1 Lemon
	- 4 Galric Cloves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh parsley
	- Oregano
	- Black peppercorns
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 lemon
	- Salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 1 Lemon
	- 8 Galric Cloves
	- Rosemary
	- Thyme leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine parsley, oregano, rosemary, thyme, garlic and peppercorns in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle; grind until a fine paste
	2. Transfer to sealable freezer bag; add 1 tbsp (15 mL) lemon juice, and salt (set lemon zest and remaining juice aside). Pierce steak all over with a fork and cut into 4 equal pieces. Add steaks to bag, seal and massage marinade into the; refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Grill in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat for 10 to 12 minutes, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least, or 160°F (71°C) for medium, or 170°F (77°C) for well-done. 
	4. Let rest for 5 minutes. Lightly season steak, and any accompanying grilled veggies and potatoes with a sprinkle of some of the reserved lemon zest and juice.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can also cut steak into 1-inch cubes and use to make beef kabob cubes. Marinate kabob cubes for just 1 to 2 hours.
---
Recipe ID: ae7ff55e-bd50-46d9-8770-4ec23ca00634
Recipe Title: Spicy Grilled Caesar Cocktail-Marinated Steak with Celery Salad
Recipe Summary: Inspired by the beloved Canadian cocktail, this marinated steak transforms even a weeknight meal into a good time! Served with a crunchy celery salad, this true north recipe is fit for any occasion. Like the cocktail, this recipe can be customized to suit individual preferences. Make it spicier or milder by adding more, or less hot sauce, and horseradish to the marinade.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 505
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1¼ cups (300 mL) extra-spicy tomato clam cocktail
	- 2 oz (60 mL) vodka (optional) 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) dill pickle juice
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH hot pepper sauce, prepared horseradish and Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 Beef Outside Skirt Marinating Steak (about 1½ lb/750 g)
	- 2 cloves garlic, smashed
	- 4 stalks celery, thinly sliced on a bias, leaves reserved
	- 1 large dill pickle, finely chopped
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) celery salt, divided
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Extra-spicy tomato clam cocktail
	- Vodka (optional)
	- Dill pickle juice
	- Hot pepper sauce
	- 1  Beef Outside Skirt Marinating Steak  (about 1½ lb/750 g)
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 4 stalks celery
	- 1 large dill pickle
	- Horseradish
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Celery salt
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine tomato clam cocktail, vodka (if using), pickle juice, hot sauce, prepared horseradish and Worcestershire sauce in a bowl. Measure out ⅓ cup (75 mL) for salad and set aside in a medium bowl. Pour remaining marinade into a large sealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with fork. Add to marinade in bag with garlic, massaging to coat. Seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Meanwhile, add celery and pickle to reserved marinade and toss to coat. Tightly cover and refrigerate until serving, for up to 8 hours. 
	 3. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel. Season all over with 1 tsp (5 mL) celery salt. 
	4. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	 5. Slice steak thinly across the grain and serve warm with celery salad. Sprinkle with remaining celery salt and reserved celery leaves. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Indoor method: Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil in a cast-iron or heavy-bottom skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook steak, turning at least twice, for 6 to 8 minutes or until a digital instant-read thermometer reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare when inserted sideways into steak.
---
Recipe ID: aecc7f57-409f-4783-94a5-e7b52414ec50
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef and Asparagus Bundles
Recipe Summary: This recipe is the perfect way to celebrate the beginning of grill season with local asparagus and tasty tenderloin in this elegant appetizer or light lunch/brunch idea.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 6
Recipe Marinating Time: 15
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 31
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) olive oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH red wine vinegar and grainy Dijon mustard
	- 2 green onions, finely chopped
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 24 asparagus spears
	- 1 sweet red pepper, cut into 12 strips
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut
	- Olive oil
	- Red wine vinegar
	- 2 green onions
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Salt and pepper
	- 24 asparagus spears
	- 1 sweet red pepper
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place beef in freezer for 1 hour or until firm enough to slice easily. Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, mustard, green onions, garlic, salt and pepper in a bowl. Slice roast across the grain into twelve ⅓-inch (8 mm) thick slices. Toss with half the olive oil mixture in shallow baking dish. Let stand for 15 minutes. 
	2. Trim asparagus to same length as pepper strips. Blanch asparagus and red pepper in large pot of boiling salted water for 2 minutes; drain and let cool slightly. Wrap each beef slice around 2 asparagus spears and 1 red pepper strip, overlapping the meat slightly; discard any excess marinade. Secure the rolls with metal picks or soaked wooden toothpicks.
	3. Grill beef rolls, on lightly oiled grill over medium-high heat, for 3 to 4 minutes, basting with remaining oil mixture and turning often, until heated through, well-marked and cooked to preferred doneness.
Recipe Tips:
  - Purchasing the centre-cut of tenderloin, rather than the tapered ends, will ensure all beef slices are the same diameter and size for uniform bundle
---
Recipe ID: af14f051-d17a-4c6c-90e0-c897c6943e16
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Northern Thai-Style Beef with Noodles
Recipe Summary: An extremely popular northern Thai dish, it’s typically garnished with shallots and pickled mustard greens which add layers of crunch and flavour.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 45
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat 
	- 1 stalk lemongrass, trimmed and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- Four ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices galangal
	- 6 lime leaves
	- 6 shallots, peeled
	- 3 cloves garlic, peeled
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced gingerroot
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) Thai red curry paste
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) curry powder
	- 2 cans (each 14 oz/400 mL) coconut milk
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) palm or brown sugar (approx)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tamarind concentrate or fresh lime juice (approx)
	- 1-2 tbsp (15-30 mL) fish sauce (optional)
	- 1 lb (500 g) fresh Chinese-style egg noodles
	-  To serve (as desired) 
	- Cilantro, bean sprouts, lime wedges, thinly sliced Thai chilies, quartered whole shallots, pickled sour mustard greens (haam choy)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Rib Finger Meat 
	- 1 stalk lemongrass
	- Four ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices galangal
	- Lime leaves
	- 6 shallots
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Vegetable oil
	- Gingerroot
	- Thai red curry paste
	- Curry powder
	- Coconut milk
	- Palm or brown sugar
	- Tamarind concentrate or fresh lime juice
	- Fish sauce (optional)
	- Fresh Chinese-style egg noodles
	- Cilantro
	- Bean sprouts
	- Lime wedges
	- Thinly sliced Thai chilies
	- Shallots
	- Pickled sour mustard greens (haam choy)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim excess fat from the meat to your taste. Starting at the thicker end of each piece of meat, make a cut in between the meat and the fibrous silverskin, lifting the fat and silverskin away from the meat while you trim along the strip of meat. (Tip: Grip the silverskin with a paper towel to prevent slipping.). Discard the trim. Cut the meat crosswise into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces.
	2. Place meat in an electric pressure cooker. Add 2 cups (500 mL) water, lemongrass, galangal, lime leaves, shallots and garlic. Seal the pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to HIGH and time for 20 minutes
	 3. When the timer beeps, quick release the pressure. Drain through a large sieve or colander into a bowl; reserve the liquid. Return the beef to the liquid and discard remaining solids.
	4. Clean and dry pressure cooker insert and return to cooker. Set cooker to Medium/Normal Sauté/Sear and add 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil. When the oil is hot, add the ginger; cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Add curry paste; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes until fragrant. Stir in curry powder until blended, then stir in coconut milk, sugar, tamarind, reserved liquid and beef. Simmer, uncovered and stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes, until flavours are blended. Taste and adjust the seasoning with sugar, tamarind and fish sauce, as desired (depending on the curry paste, you may not need the fish sauce).
	5. Meanwhile, heat 1 inch (2.5 cm) of vegetable in a skillet to 350ºF. Remove 1/6 of the noodles from the package and loosen them up. Shape into 4 nests and slide into the oil. Cook, for about 1 minute, turning once, until crisp. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel to drain (don’t worry if they’ve lost their nest shape). Set aside.
	 6. Just before serving, cook remaining noodles in a large pot of boiling water for 2 to 3 minutes or until tender. Drain quickly and divide among 4 serving bowls. Ladle the meat and sauce over the noodles, top with a fried noodle nest and serve immediately with the desired garnishes.
Recipe Tips:
  - To cook on a stove-top, proceed with Step 2 using a Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster; increase the water to 4 cups (1 L), and simmer, covered, for 1½ hours, until meat is tender and liquid is reduced by half. If there is too much liquid, boil, uncovered, over high heat until reduced or add water if sauce is too thick. Continue with the recipe directed.
---
Recipe ID: af901457-158a-42a0-869a-8436b3d1f716
Recipe Title: Classic Mac ‘n Beef with Garlic Texas Toast Crumb & Toast
Recipe Summary: This is a great dish to make ahead and keeps well in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Don’t have any elbow macaroni? Any medium-sized pasta shape will work just as well.
Get more recipes with lean ground beef at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 50
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Canadian Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion, minced
	- 1 sweet green pepper, seeded and finely diced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced garlic (about 2 cloves)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt (approx)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dried oregano and basil leaves
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) pepper (approx)
	- Pinch granulated sugar
	- 1 can (398 mL) tomato sauce
	- 1 can (540 mL) diced stewed tomatoes
	- 1 cup (250 mL) beef broth or water
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry elbow macaroni
	- 3 or more slices Furlani® Garlic Texas Toast 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped fresh parsley (optional)
	- 6 slices Furlani® Garlic Texas Toast
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Canadian Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion
	- 1 sweet green pepper
	- Garlic (about 2 cloves)
	- Salt
	- Dried oregano
	- Pepper
	- Granulated sugar
	- 1 can (398 mL) tomato sauce
	- 1 can (540 mL) diced stewed tomatoes
	- Beef broth or water
	- Tomato paste
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Dry elbow macaroni
	- 9 or more slices Garlic Texas Toast
	- Fresh parsley (optional)
	- Basil leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook ground beef, onion, green pepper and garlic over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven or large saucepan, stirring and using back of spoon to break up beef into chunks, for 8 to 10 minutes until meat is thoroughly cooked and vegetables are softened. Drain, if needed. 
	2. Stir in salt, oregano, basil, pepper, sugar, tomato sauce, stewed tomatoes, beef broth, tomato paste and Worcestershire sauce; bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes, until flavours blend.
	 3. Garlic Texas Toast Crumb: Meanwhile, cut slices of Furlani Garlic Texas Toast into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes. Arrange in a single layer on parchment-lined rimmed baking sheet. Bake in preheated 350°F oven, stirring twice or more, for 18 to 20 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy all the way through. Let cool to room temperature. Fold parchment paper over cubes and crush into crumbs using the bottom of a skillet or palm of your hand. Measure out 3 tbsp (45 mL) for topping, reserving extra for another use (see Tip); set aside. 
	4. Stir macaroni into beef mixture, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, for 20 minutes or until pasta is cooked to al dente. Meanwhile, bake the Furlani Garlic Texas Toast according to package directions.
	5. Remove pasta mixture from heat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve garnished with fresh chopped parsley (if using) and Garlic Texas Toast Crumb. Serve with slices of toasted Furlani Garlic Texas Toast.
Recipe Tips:
  - Tips: Use Garlic Texas Toast Crumb to top pasta dishes or in your favourite beef burgers, meatballs or meat loaves instead of purchased dry breadcrumbs. Turn this dish into a goulash, by adding 2 tbsp (30 mL) sweet paprika with the dried herbs. For a spicy southwest version, just add 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) chili powder with the dried herbs and 1 cup (250 mL) drained corn kernels (thawed frozen or canned) when adding the macaroni. Looking for a faster cooking option? Cook the pasta separately while you are simmering the sauce! Here’s how: proceed with the recipe but omit the beef broth; after 20 minutes of simmering the sauce, stir in drained cooked pasta, heat through and serve. Get more beef information at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
---
Recipe ID: afc45373-f222-4d2d-8487-8343d7916832
Recipe Title: Marinated Barbecued Asian-Style Roast with Salsa 
Recipe Summary: This recipe is the perfect way to enjoy roast beef in the summertime. As the glaze is prone to charring, use for roasts sized at 3 lb (1.5 kg) at the most. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 7½-in (19 cm) long x 5-in (12.5 cm wide) x 3-in (7.5 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 720
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 820
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH soy sauce and rice vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Asian chili sauce
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH sesame oil and minced gingerroot
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- Tropical Salsa
		- 1 mango, cut into chunks
		- ½ cup (125 mL) drained crushed or finely chopped pineapple
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH chopped fresh mint or cilantro, sugar and rice vinegar
		- 1½ tsp (7 mL) Asian chili sauce
		- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Soy sauce
	- Liquid honey
	- Asian chili sauce
	- Sesame oil
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- Mango
	- Pineapple
	- Fresh mint or cilantro
	- Salt and pepper
	- Rice vinegar
	- Gingerroot
	- Sugar
	- Rice vinegar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, vinegar, honey, chili sauce, sesame oil and gingerroot in large sealable freezer bag or bowl. Pierce roast all over with a fork and add to bag, massaging to coat; seal bag and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours.
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	3. Remove meat from marinade; discard marinade. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1½ hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: see ‘ESTIMATED COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts. 
	 4. Tropical Salsa: Meanwhile, purée mango in a blender or in a tall cup using an immersion blender. Transfer to a bowl and stir in pineapple, mint, sugar, vinegar and chili sauce; season with salt and pepper to taste.
	5. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover tent with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with Tropical Salsa.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can make the roast ahead to serve cold. After resting for 15 minutes, wrap and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Make the salsa up to an hour or so before serving.
---
Recipe ID: b09294e4-2df1-4954-853c-c500be08ec78
Recipe Title: Baked Ground Beef Quesadillas
Recipe Summary: These mildly-spiced, nutrient-packed quesadillas are more of a meal than the traditional cheese variety. These quesadillas can be browned on a medium grill or in an ungreased skillet on the stove top, turning once, instead of baking them in the oven.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Regular Ground Beef
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) chili powder
	- ⅔ cup (150 mL) EACH shredded Cheddar cheese and refried beans
	- ½ cup (125 mL) salsa
	- 2 green onions, chopped
	- 12 small flour tortillas
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Regular Ground Beef
	- Chili powder
	- Shredded Cheddar cheese
	- ½ cup (125 mL) salsa
	- 2 green onions
	- 12 small flour tortillas
	- Refried beans
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pan-fry ground beef with chili powder over medium-high heat in a nonstick skillet, for 6 to 8 minutes, breaking up meat with back of spoon until completely cooked. Remove from heat; drain.
	 2. Stir cheese, refried beans, salsa and green onions into beef. Spread about ½ cup (125 mL) over 1 tortilla; top with a second tortilla. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
	 3. Place 3 quesadillas on each of 2 rimmed baking sheets in a single layer. Bake in preheated 450°F oven for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden and cheese is melted. Transfer to a cutting board and cut into wedges to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Any remaining refried beans can be frozen in an airtight container then thawed for the next time you make a batch of these quesadillas.
---
Recipe ID: b0b7ea6e-659e-429b-8953-7f99fb96e00c
Recipe Title: Tex-Mex Oven Roast with Peppers and Onions
Recipe Summary: This roast beef dinner with Tex-Mex flavours is a feast that will definitely become a family favourite. You can substitute the rice side with warm corn or flour tortillas for a yummy taco version. 
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 77
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 102
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 pkg (24 g) taco seasoning mix, divided
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast 
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 2 onions, thinly sliced
	- 1 EACH sweet red and green pepper, thinly sliced
	- Hot cooked white rice
	- Guacamole
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 pkg (24 g) taco seasoning mix
	- Salt
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast 
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 onions
	- Sweet red and green peppers
	- White rice
	- Guacamole
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Methods:
	1. Measure out 1 tbsp (15 mL) taco seasoning mix and reserve for vegetables. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Rub with 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil and sprinkle evenly with remaining taco seasoning mix and salt. 
	2. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 1 to 1¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	3. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	 4. Meanwhile, toss onions with red pepper, green pepper, remaining oil and reserved taco seasoning mix in a large bowl. Arrange in even layer on foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Broil on middle rack in oven, tossing once, for 7 to 10 minutes or until lightly golden and tender-crisp.
	  5. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices. Serve with rice, vegetables, guacamole and lime wedges.
Recipe Tips:
  - Add a handful of tortilla chips and warm queso dip to each serving for a party-worthy platter. Make your own creamy guacamole by combining 2 ripe mashed avocados with ¼ cup (60 mL) sour cream, 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lime juice, ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground cumin and salt. Fold in one small chopped tomato and chopped cilantro, if desired.
---
Recipe ID: b1793d98-d34a-45c5-b11c-3b8a8a21e47c
Recipe Title: Easy Italian Wedding Soup
Recipe Summary: Quick and easy, this simple soup is super tasty and satisfying. Pastina or “tiny pasta” can be found shaped in rounds, stars or alphabets, but you can also use orzo, tubetti or mini shells. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 cups (2 L) reduced-sodium chicken broth
	- 2 carrots, thinly sliced 
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) grated Parmesan cheese, divided (approx)
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) seasoned dry bread crumbs
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried Italian herb seasoning
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 3 eggs, divided
	- ¾ lb (375 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef 
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) dry pastina pasta
	- 1 pkg (142 g) baby spinach (about 6 cups/1.5 L)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lemon juice 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Reduced-sodium chicken broth
	- 2 carrots
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
	- Seasoned dry bread crumbs
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 clove garlic
	- 3 eggs
	- ¾ lb (375 g)  Extra Lean Ground Beef 
	- Dry pastina pasta
	- 1 pkg (142 g) baby spinach
	- Fresh lemon juice
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine broth and carrots to a boil in a large saucepan; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes or until carrots are just softened.
	2. Meanwhile, combine ¼ cup (60 mL) Parmesan, bread crumbs, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper, garlic and 1 egg in a large bowl. Gently mix in ground beef with a fork (careful not to over-mix).
	 3. Using a melon baller, cookie scoop or small spoon, portion and loosely shape meat into about 48 meatballs and place onto a baking sheet. 
	4. Carefully drop meatballs all at once into broth; return to a simmer. Stir in pastina. Simmer for 5 to 8 minutes or until meatballs are cooked through and pastina is tender. Add spinach and cook for 2 minutes or until wilted. Whisk remaining eggs with remaining ½ cup (125 mL) Parmesan in a bowl; gradually pour into simmering soup while stirring constantly. 
	 5. Remove pan from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Portion into serving bowls and top each serving with a sprinkle of additional Parmesan, if desired. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute spinach with shredded escarole, kale, Swiss chard or dandelion greens.
---
Recipe ID: b18c9e83-b6a1-4362-b470-2245d8c883c4
Recipe Title: Skillet Herbed Potatoes and Peas
Recipe Summary: Here’s a new way to cook potatoes for your steak dinner! Fragrant with garlic and herbs, these potatoes simmer until tender and get lightly browned all in one skillet. Add the peas and a splash of lemon at the end to finish. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dried fines herbes, thyme or oregano leaves
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) baby yellow potatoes, halved (quartered, if large)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) frozen peas, thawed
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add butter, garlic and dried herbs; cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. Stir in potatoes and ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper; toss to coat well. Pour in 1 cup (250 mL) water and bring to a boil.
	2. Cover and boil, stirring occasionally, for about 15 to 18 minutes or until potatoes are fork-tender and lightly browned. (Add more water, ¼ cup/60 mL at a time, if pan becomes dry before potatoes are cooked.)&nbsp;
	3. Uncover, stir in peas and cook, stirring often, for about 3 minutes or until peas are hot and any liquid is evaporated. Stir in lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Recipe Tips:
  - Although the presentation won’t be as attractive, you can use regular-size potatoes instead of baby potatoes if that’s what you have on hand; cut them into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks.
---
Recipe ID: b1a80163-6391-4ba9-80cb-48221d7d9e73
Recipe Title: Poached German-Style Beef Marrow Bone Dumplings
Recipe Summary: These tasty dumplings use white bread as the base for a bit of convenience to made-from-scratch dumplings. Add these tender dumplings to a simmering pot of broth or hearty soup or stew.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 to 2½ lb (1 to 1.25 kg) Beef Marrow Bones, Canoe-cut
	- ½ cup (125 mL) milk 
	- 6 slices white sandwich bread, crusts cut off
	- ½ cup (125 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) dry bread crumbs 
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt, pepper and grated nutmeg
	- 1 extra-large egg, beaten
	- 4 to 6 cups (1 to 1.5 L) beef stock, soup or stew
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 to 2½ lb (1 to 1.25 kg)  Beef Marrow Bones, Canoe-cut
	- Milk
	- 6 slices white sandwich bread
	- All-purpose flour
	- Dry bread crumbs
	- Fresh parsley
	- Salt and pepper
	- Extra-large egg
	- Beef stock, soup or stew
	- Grated nutmeg
Recipe Methods:
	1. Spoon out the bone marrow (you should have about 4 oz/125 g). Place in a small saucepan and melt over a medium heat. Strain through a sieve and measure out ½ cup (125 mL), reserving any extra for another use. Transfer to a large bowl.
	2. Heat the milk in a clean small saucepan over medium-low heat to just until warm. Remove from heat and add bread slices; let soak for 2 minutes. 
	3. Squeeze the bread out to remove excess milk (discard excess milk). Roughly chop the bread and add it to the bone marrow. Add flour, bread crumbs, parsley, salt, pepper, nutmeg and egg. Mix to form a dough. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm up the dough.
	4. Roll the dumpling dough into small balls, about 1-inch (2.5 cm) in diameter and place on a baking sheet or plate. Drop the bone marrow dumplings into a large pot of simmering stock, soup or stew over medium-low heat; simmer for about 5 minutes, or until they float to the surface.
Recipe Tips:
  - Dumplings made with fresh white bread get a kick-start that shortens the process of starting completely from scratch.
---
Recipe ID: b1cac65f-e024-4e23-b228-517c9d6fdc0c
Recipe Title: Braised Oxtails with Assorted Farm Vegetables
Recipe Summary: When I was growing up, oxtails were not very popular for most families though they were in our home. My mom would spend all day slowly braising oxtails for dinner, cooking them with garlic, thyme and bay leaves. It quickly became a family favourite and one that I continue to make today in her honour.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 170
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (50 mL) all-purpose flour 
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Oxtail, cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) sunflower or canola oil, divided
	- 2 lb (1 kg) butternut or acorn squash, peeled and cut into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes
	- 6 russet potatoes (unpeeled), cut into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes 
	- 6 stalks celery, diced 
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced 
	- 3 bay leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) butternut or acorn squash
	- 6 russet potatoes
	- Celery
	- Garlic 
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Oxtail, cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- Sunflower or canola oil
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Bay leaves
	- All-purpose flour 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine flour with salt and pepper to your taste in a large bowl. Add oxtail pieces and toss to coat. Set aside. 
	2. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium heat in a shallow heavy skillet. Add squash, potatoes, celery, garlic and bay leaves; cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until starting to soften. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low and let cook while you brown the oxtail.
	3. Meanwhile, heat remaining oil over medium heat in a large enamelled cast-iron roaster, Dutch oven or heavy stockpot. Shake excess flour from oxtail and add to pot; discard excess flour mixture. Cook, turning often, until browned all over. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
	4. Discard any extra oil from the pot; add simmered vegetables, browned oxtail and 1 cup (250 mL) water. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 hours, stirring occasionally, until meat is fork-tender. Discard bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: b280a804-f9b0-45fb-9c87-e14a9bba1dba
Recipe Title: Classic Pan-Fried Beef Liver with Onions and Bacon
Recipe Summary: By cooking the liver so it’s still slightly pink in the center and springy to the touch, the delicate texture is beautifully preserved, and perfectly complemented by the sweet caramelized onions. Serve with creamy mashed potatoes and buttered peas to replicate this tasty traditional diner favourite. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 35
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced Beef or Veal Liver, about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick
	- 2 slices thick-cut bacon, finely chopped 
	- 1 Vidalia or Spanish onion, thinly sliced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh thyme leaves (or 1 tsp/5 mL dried thyme)
	- 1/2 tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper, divided
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) red wine vinegar
	- 1/2 cup (125 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced Beef or Veal Liver, about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick
	- 2 slices thick-cut bacon
	- 1 Vidalia or Spanish onion
	- Fresh thyme leaves (or dried thyme)
	- Salt and pepper
	- Red wine vinegar
	- All-purpose flour
	- Vegetable oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Scatter bacon in a large nonstick skillet set over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until crisp. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Set aside.  
	2. Add onion and thyme to skillet. Sprinkle with 1/4 tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook, stirring often, for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown and very soft. If pan is gets too dry, add a splash of water to prevent scorching. Stir in vinegar and crisp bacon. Transfer to a plate; keep warm. 
	3. Meanwhile, cut liver slices into 1-inch (2.5 cm) wide strips; pat dry with paper towel. Arrange liver in a single layer on a large plate. Stir flour with remaining salt and pepper; sprinkle over liver. Toss gently to coat. 
	4. Heat oil in the same skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook liver, in batches and turning pieces halfway through cooking, for 5 to 6 minutes or until evenly browned on the outside and still slightly pink on the inside. (Liver is best when cooked to medium doneness, at most.)
	5. Arrange cooked liver on a shallow platter. Top with warm onions and bacon. Serve immediately. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Beef liver can have a stronger flavour and aroma than calf’s liver, although not necessarily so. One method to mellow the flavour is by soaking the beef liver in milk, in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Drain and discard milk, then pat liver dry before coating with flour.
---
Recipe ID: b291a70c-2fb9-4163-bd9d-959ceadbd2ab
Recipe Title: Tomato & Wine Sous Vide-braised Beef Osso Buco
Recipe Summary: Thick slices of beef shank with traditional flavours cooked in an untraditional way will make you glad you discovered sous vide! The rich flavour of the beef with the aromatic tomato sauce makes a perfect match and the long, slow cooking tenderizes the beef beautifully. This even keeps the beef a touch pink inside and you won’t believe the melt-in-your-mouth tenderness as a result. It does take more than a full day to cook but with a simple finish just before serving and the make-ahead option (see Tip), this is the perfect entertaining dish to dazzle guests. Serve with Parmesan risotto, pasta or gnocchi and tender-crisp green beans.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 1705
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 1720
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 slices Beef Centre Cut Shank, 1½ inches (4 cm) thick (about 1 lb/500 g each)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil, divided (approx)
	- 2 carrots, finely chopped
	- 1 onion, finely chopped
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) dried rosemary, crumbled
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) dry red or white wine
	- 1¾ cups (425 mL) canned tomatoes with juice, preferably San Marzano style, coarsely chopped (about half a 28 oz/796 mL can)
	- Chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 slices  Beef Centre Cut Shank,  1½ inches (4 cm) thick (about 1 lb/500 g each)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- 2 carrots
	- 1 onion
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Dried rosemary
	- Tomato paste
	- Dry red or white wine
	- Canned tomatoes with juice, preferably San Marzano style
	- Chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 158°F (70°C) according to manufacturer’s directions.
	 2. Pat beef dry with paper towel and season all over with ½ tsp (2 mL) salt and ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Brown beef, in batches, for about 4 minutes, turning once, until browned on both sides. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Add more oil to pan between batches, as necessary.
	3. Reduce heat to medium-low and a little oil, if necessary to make a thin layer. Add carrots and onion; cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic, rosemary and ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add wine and cook, stirring and scraping up brown bits from pan. Remove from heat, stir in tomatoes. 
	 4. Place 2 slices beef in each of 2 large bags for sous vide (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Pour half of tomato mixture into each bag (about 1¾ cups/425 mL per bag). Arrange beef slices in a single layer in bags. Remove as much air as possible and vacuum or manually seal. 
	 5. Immerse bags in preheated water bath and secure to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Cover water bath with foil or plastic to reduce evaporation. Cook sous vide for 28 hours, replenishing water as necessary.
	6. Remove beef from water bath. Transfer beef from bag with a slotted spoon to warmed serving dishes. Tent with foil and keep warm.
	7. Pour sauce into a medium saucepan and skim off fat. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat and boil for about 10 minutes or until slightly reduced. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Divide bones and meat between 4 serving dishes, breaking meat into chunks if some slices of shank are meatier than others. Pour hot sauce over beef and garnish with parsley, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - The flavour improves even more when made ahead. To make ahead, after removing from water bath, immerse beef in sauce in bags in a sink or bowl of ice water and chill, replenishing ice as necessary until cold. Refrigerate in bags for up to 3 days. To serve, reheat in the bags in a 158°F (70°C) water bath for 1 hour or in a large, wide saucepan over medium heat simmering beef in the sauce until hot.
---
Recipe ID: b2d37462-7aac-407a-9fe4-2707719967c0
Recipe Title: Grilled Marinated Steak with Peach and Quinoa Salad
Recipe Summary: Beef steak marinated in a honey-balsamic blend creates a delicious sweet and savoury flavour to complement this hearty salad. Switch mango or pineapple for the peaches off season. Creamy burrata cheese adds a touch of dairy calcium to the protein portion of the plate. A 100 g serving of beef provides 79% of your daily needs for the zinc you need to boost your immune system.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 22
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 72
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Marinade/Dressing
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH olive oil and balsamic vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) liquid honey
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Hanger Grilling Steak
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- Salad 
	- 2 peaches, cut into wedges
	- Olive oil
	- 6 cups (1.5 L) mixed greens
	- 2 cups (500 mL) cherry tomatoes, preferably mixed heirloom, halved
	- 1 cup (250 mL) thinly sliced cucumber
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) thinly sliced red onion
	- 2 cups (500 mL) cooked red quinoa, cooled (about 1 cup/250 mL raw)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) torn fresh basil leaves
	- 5 oz (150 g) burrata cheese, drained (optional)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) roasted sunflower seeds
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Liquid honey
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Hanger Grilling Steak
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Peaches
	- Mixed greens
	- Cherry tomatoes, preferably mixed heirloom
	- Cucumber
	- Red onion
	- Red quinoa
	- Fresh basil leaves
	- 5 oz (150 g) burrata cheese (optional)
	- Roasted sunflower seeds
	- Balsamic vinegar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Marinade/Dressing: Whisk together oil, vinegar, honey and mustard in a large bowl. Place half into a sealable freezer bag; set remaining aside for Salad. Pierce steak all over with a fork and add to bag along with garlic; massage marinade into meat; seal and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 12 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steak dry with paper towel. Season steak all over with ½ tsp (2 mL) each salt and pepper. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 18 to 22 minutes for 1½-inch (4 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and lest for 5 minutes.
	3. Salad : Meanwhile, lightly brush peaches with oil. Place in grilling basket; grill for 2 minutes per side or until well-marked but still firm.
	 4. Whisk remaining salt and pepper into reserved dressing. Toss with mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber and onion until well coated. Add quinoa and basil; toss to combine. Arrange salad on a shallow serving platter. Top with grilled peaches, burrata (if using) and sunflower seeds. Carve steak across the grain on the bias into thin slices and serve with salad.
Recipe Tips:
  - Burrata can be found in the cheese or deli department of well-stocked grocers or you can substitute with ricotta, bocconcini or sliced fresh mozzarella.
---
Recipe ID: b43652fd-9d56-4c71-942a-f98198a31423
Recipe Title: Blue Cheese Crowned Beef Steak Medallions
Recipe Summary: This steakhouse-style recipe has the sophistication of a fancy blue cheese and sour cream topping on tender steak but is super-easy to prepare. Serve with a mixed green salad or steamed asparagus. Note: you can substitute any thick beef medallion for the tenderloin – try Strip Loin or Top Sirloin Medallions if you find them at the meat counter.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely crumbled blue cheese
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH grated Parmesan cheese and sour cream
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely chopped fresh chives
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) butter, melted
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 4 Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (EACH about 5 oz/150 g or 1¼ lb/625 g total)
	- Additional chopped fresh chives (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Crumbled blue cheese
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
	- Sour cream
	- Fresh chives
	- Butter
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 4  Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks,  1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (EACH about 5 oz/150 g or 1¼ lb/625 g total)
	- Additional chopped fresh chives (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine blue cheese, Parmesan cheese, sour cream and 1 tbsp (15 mL) chives in a small bowl; set aside.
	2. Combine butter, garlic, salt and pepper in another small bowl. Pat steaks dry with paper towel. Brush all over with butter mixture. 
	 3. Heat a large broiler-safe cast-iron or heavy stainless steel skillet over medium-high heat. Sear steaks for 4 to 6 minutes, turning once until browned on both sides. Spoon reserved blue cheese mixture evenly over top of steaks, dividing equally.
	4. Broil steaks on middle rack of oven for 3 to 4 minutes or until topping is bubbling and steak is cooked to medium-rare doneness (145°F/63°C) at the least, testing doneness with a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into each steak (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	5. Transfer steaks to warmed plates. Let rest for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with additional chives before serving, if desired. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute blue cheese with goat cheese, if preferred.
---
Recipe ID: b46d69b7-c7ed-468d-be2b-39c96d470100
Recipe Title: Steak Cobb Salad with  Grilled Garlic Croutons
Recipe Summary: You can easily adapt this salad to what you have on hand: try sweet peppers or snap peas, grilled peaches or fresh raspberries, and shredded Cheddar or blue cheese. No time to marinate? Simply season the Beef Top Sirloin Steak with salt and pepper before grilling and brush with dressing to finish.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 360
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 420
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 loaf (284g) Furlani® Garlic Bread 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) liquid honey
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated lime zest
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) lime juice
	- 1 small clove garlic, minced
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) light olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Canadian Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak
	- 6 cups (1.5 L) chopped Romaine lettuce
	- 4 hard cooked eggs, peeled and quartered
	- 2 ripe avocados, chopped
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH halved cherry tomatoes and strawberries (quartered if large)
	- Half English cucumber, chopped
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) crumbled feta cheese
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH thinly sliced red onion and crumbled cooked bacon
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and freshly ground pepper
	- *1 cup (250 mL) garlic croutons
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 loaf (284g) Garlic Bread
	- Liquid honey
	- Dijon mustard
	- Grated lime zest
	- Lime juice
	- 1 small clove garlic
	- Light olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Canadian Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak
	- Romaine lettuce
	- Eggs
	- 2 ripe avocados
	- Cherry tomatoes
	- Strawberries
	- English cucumber
	- Crumbled feta cheese
	- Red onion
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- Garlic croutons
	- Bacon
Recipe Methods:
	1. Garlic Croutons: Use Furlani Garlic Bread to make homemade croutons for this and many more summer salads. Preheat barbecue to medium-high heat (400˚F/200˚C). Cut Furlani Garlic Bread into 1/2-inch (1 cm) cubes. Arrange bread cubes, in an even layer, in a large foil pan. Place pan off to one side of barbecue and turn off the burners directly under the pan. Cook in closed barbecue, tossing occasionally, for 20 to 25 minutes or until croutons are golden brown and crispy all the way through. Let cool. *Set aside 1 cup (250 mL) for this Cobb Salad. (Let the remaining croutons cool for 2 to 4 hours before transferring to an airtight container to store for up to 1 week.) 
	 2. Dressing: Whisk together honey, mustard, lime zest, and lime juice in a small bowl. Gradually pour in the oil while whisking until emulsified. 
	3. Salad: Pierce steak all over with a fork. Transfer steak and ¼ cup (60 mL) of the dressing to sealable container or freezer bag, coat meat with dressing; seal and refrigerate for 6 to 8 hours. Cover and refrigerate remaining dressing.
	 4. Arrange lettuce in an even layer on a large shallow platter. Top with eggs, avocado, tomatoes, strawberries, cucumber, feta, red onion, and bacon. Leave a spot for steak and croutons. (Salad can be covered and refrigerated for up to 1 hour.)
	5. Remove steak from marinade; discard used marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	6. Slice steak thinly across the grain. Arrange steak and 1 cup (250 mL) reserved croutons over salad; drizzle reserved dressing over top. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute lime juice and zest with orange or lemon, or a mixture of all three. Explore how to cook 70+ cuts of beef at the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
---
Recipe ID: b46dd2ee-53c6-41ef-8000-749be5bb9143
Recipe Title: Braised Beef with Porcini Mushrooms and Red Wine
Recipe Summary: Digital Flexor Meat is great substitute for Pot Roast if you are a small household. The meat cooks up into an attractive oval shape that can be sliced for an elegant presentation. Since the oven is on for a long period of time, adding pans of vegetables and potatoes at the 2-hour mark to roast alongside makes an easy and delicious meal. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 210
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 225
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 oz (30 g) dried porcini mushrooms
	- 1 cup (250 mL) boiling water
	- 4 whole small-sized Beef Digital Flexor Meat (EACH about 10 to 12 oz/300 to 375 g)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) finely diced onion
	- ½ cup (125 mL) finely diced carrot
	- ½ cup (125 mL) finely diced celery
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) coarsely chopped fresh parsley
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine
	- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) tomato paste
	- 2 sprigs fresh thyme (or ¼ tsp/1 mL dried)
	- 1 small sprig fresh rosemary
	- 1 bay leaf 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Dried porcini mushrooms (1 oz 30 g)
	- 4 whole small-sized  Beef Digital Flexor Meat  (EACH about 10 to 12 oz/300 to 375 g)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onion
	- Carrots
	- Celery
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Fresh parsley
	- Dry red wine
	- Beef broth
	- Tomato paste
	- 2 sprigs fresh thyme (or ¼ tsp/1 mL dried)
	- 1 small sprig fresh rosemary
	- 1 bay leaf 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place the porcini mushrooms in a heatproof bowl and pour in boiling water. Let soak while preparing the remaining ingredients.
	 2. Season the meat all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven or large enamelled cast-iron roaster with a tight-fitting lid. Add beef and cook, turning with tongs, until browned on all sides (it will curl while cooking and this is fine). Transfer to a plate.
	  3. Add onion, carrot, celery, garlic and parsley to the pot and reduce heat low. Cook, stirring frequently, for about 5 to 6 minutes or until the vegetables soften and start to brown. Add the wine and bring to a boil, scraping up brown bits stuck to pot. Return meat and any accumulated juices to pot. Stir in broth, tomato paste, thyme, rosemary bay leaf and ½ tsp (2 mL). 
	 4. Strain the porcini mushrooms, reserving the liquid. Coarsely chop the mushrooms and add to the pot. Carefully pour the mushroom water into the pot leaving any sediment behind. Cover with the lid and cook in preheated 300ºF oven for 2 hours, check every hour to ensure that the liquid comes halfway up the beef and adding water, if needed to maintain that level. Turn beef over, cover and cook for about 1 hour longer or until beef is fork-tender and the sauce lightly thickened. 
	5. Transfer beef to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Strain the vegetables out of the liquid, if desired, or leave them in the sauce. Discard herb stems and bay leaf. Slice each piece of beef across the grain into 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick slices and spoon sauce over to serve. 
Recipe Tips:
  - The pot roasts can be braised on top of the stovetop for the same amount of time, maintaining a gentle simmer, or in an electric pressure cooker on HIGH pressure for 1 hour with a natural release. Reduce the beef broth to 1 cup (250 ml) if using pressure cooker.
---
Recipe ID: b47b3537-183c-45a6-9558-c025b2cce8d7
Recipe Title: Garlic-Studded Oven Roast with Simple Pan Sauce
Recipe Summary: In this recipe, simple seasoning highlights the rich flavour of roast beef and adds depth to the simple pan gravy. The shape of the roast has as much to do with the cook time as the size and the cut. Our time-test results are based on a 3-rib roast that was about 7-in (18 cm) long x 6-in (15 cm) wide x 3-in (8 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 240
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 250
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 7 lb (3.15 kg) Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	- 8 cloves garlic, cut into slivers
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce or grainy mustard
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- Simple Pan Gravy
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) red wine
	- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water (optional)
	- Salt and pepper
	- Whipping cream and/or balsamic or wine vinegar (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 7 lb (3.15 kg) Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	- 8 cloves garlic
	- Worcestershire sauce or grainy mustard
	- Olive oil
	- Red wine
	- Beef broth
	- Cornstarch
	- Salt and pepper
	- Whipping cream and/or balsamic or wine vinegar (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut shallow slits all over roast; insert garlic slivers into slits. Rub roast all over with Worcestershire sauce. Place roast, bones down, on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 3½ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	 2. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	3. Simple Pan Gravy: Meanwhile, place roasting pan with drippings on stove-top over medium-high heat; add wine, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pan. Stir in beef broth and bring to a boil. Strain (if desired) and skim off any fat; return to pan. Thicken by boiling until broth reduces (an au jus-style sauce) OR, for a thickened gravy, whisk in cornstarch mixture and bring to a boil; boil for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened and glossy. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add splash of cream and/or balsamic or wine vinegar to taste, if desired.
	 4. Carve roast across the grain into slices and serve with Simple Pan Gravy.
Recipe Tips:
  - When oven-roasting roast beef, roast without a lid for best browning.
---
Recipe ID: b4826278-5e07-4701-a542-6401031a804e
Recipe Title: Jerk Fast-Fry Steak Tacos with Pear Salsa 
Recipe Summary: ???
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 7
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: ???
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Tacos
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH brown sugar and cornstarch
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) orange juice
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lime juice
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) soy sauce
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) canola or sunflower oil
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) thinly sliced green onion
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH minced garlic and gingerroot
		- ¼ to ½ tsp (1 to 2 mL) minced Scotch bonnet pepper
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) dried thyme leaves
		- ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) ground allspice
		- Pinch EACH ground cloves and fresh ground nutmeg
		- 10 oz (300 g) Beef Top Sirloin Fast-fry Steak, cut into thin strips
		- Salt
		- 6 small corn tortillas, warmed
	- Pear Salsa
		- ½ cup (125 mL) diced Bartlett pear
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH thinly sliced green onion and chopped fresh cilantro
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) grated lime zest
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) fresh lime juice
		- Salt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 orange or orange juice
	- 2 limes
	- Green onions
	- Garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 1 Scotch bonnet pepper
	- 1 Bartlett pear
	- Fresh cilantro
	- 6 small corn tortillas, warmed
	- 10 oz (300 g) Beef Top Sirloin Fast-fry Steak, cut into thin strips
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Soy sauce
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Dried thyme leaves
	- Ground allspice
	- Ground cloves
	- Whole nutmeg
	- Brown sugar
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Tacos: Whisk together brown sugar, cornstarch, orange juice, lime juice and soy sauce in a small bowl; set aside.
	2. Heat a skillet over medium-low heat. Add oil, green onion, garlic, gingerroot and Scotch bonnet pepper to your taste; cook, stirring, for about 2 to 3 minutes, until softened. Stir in pepper, thyme, allspice, cloves and nutmeg. Increase heat to medium; add beef. Cook, stirring often, for about 4 minutes or until the beef is browned but still pink inside. 
	3. Stir the sauce mixture to dissolve cornstarch and immediately pour over beef. Simmer, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes, until sauce thickens. Season with salt to taste. Remove from heat; set aside.
	4. Pear Salsa: Combine pear, green onion, cilantro, lime zest and lime juice; season with salt to taste.
	5. To serve, divide beef mixture among warmed corn tortillas and top with Pear Salsa.
Recipe Tips: ???
