Recipe ID: b4c86477-d198-4e73-8ed3-f13c9adcd9a8
Recipe Title: Pan-Fried Egyptian-Style Ground Beef Bowl
Recipe Summary: Inspired by Koshari, a traditional street food in Egypt, this weeknight rice bowl features a hearty mixture of protein-rich ground beef and fibre-rich whole grain and beans, all topped with a zesty tomato salsa. This meal gets an iron boost with the synergy-effect of combining meat, beans, chard and whole grain.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 35
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Salsa 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) white vinegar
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) granulated sugar
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
	- 3 ripe tomatoes, seeded and chopped
	- 1 shallot, thinly sliced
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- Rice and Beef 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- 6 Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) ground cumin
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and ground cinnamon
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH ground allspice and nutmeg, ginger and coriander
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) long-grain brown rice
	- 1 cup (250 mL) no-salt added canned kidney beans or chickpeas, rinsed and drained
	- Wilted Greens 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 bunch kale and/or rainbow Swiss chard, trimmed and torn 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- White vinegar
	- Granulated sugar
	- 3 ripe tomatoes
	- 1 shallot
	- Fresh parsley
	- 6  Beef Burgers,  ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Ground cumin
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Ground allspice
	- Nutmeg
	- Ginger
	- Coriander
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Long-grain brown rice
	- No-salt added canned kidney beans or chickpeas
	- 1 bunch kale and/or rainbow Swiss chard
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Salsa: Whisk together oil, vinegar, sugar and salt in a medium bowl until dissolved. Add tomatoes, shallot and parsley; toss to coat. Let stand at room temperature until ready to serve.
	 2. Rice and Beef: Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Crumble up beef burgers and add to pan. Stir in cumin, salt, cinnamon, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, coriander and garlic. Cook, breaking up into small crumbles, for 5 to 7 minutes or until browned.
	 3. Stir in rice until well combined. Add 3 cups (750 mL) water and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. 
	4. Wilted Greens: Meanwhile, heat oil with garlic over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add kale and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 to 5 minutes or until wilted.
	5. Remove rice mixture from heat and stir in beans. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Serve over wilted greens and top with Salsa.
Recipe Tips:
  - Seeding the tomatoes makes the salsa less watery and thus, more flavourful. Here’s how: cut the tomatoes in half crosswise. Working over the sink or a bowl, use your fingers or a spoon to pull out the seeds from the seed cavities. Let tomatoes sit cut-side down on paper towel for 5 to 10 minutes to allow juice to drain.
---
Recipe ID: b539a625-9a26-4389-92c0-0323686064d5
Recipe Title: Barbecue Smoked Beef Roast
Recipe Summary: Earn your barbecue badge of honour by making smoked brisket – without even investing in a smoker! Whether done in propane or gas or charcoal kettle barbecue, settle in for a low temperature, slow roast that lets a subtle smoky flavour and tenderness to develop. Follow the steps below for perfection. If you prefer a smaller roast, use a 4 lb (2 kg) Flat/First Cut section or Double/Point End/Deckle section and reduce the rub ingredients by half. If cooking the thinner Flat/First Cut, reduce the cooking time in step 5 to about 2 to 2¼ hours.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 420
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 450
Recipe Servings: 15
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Brisket Pot Roast , 8 to 10 lb (3.5 to 4.5 kg) 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) coarsely ground black pepper 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) granulated onion 
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) granulated garlic 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) dry mustard 
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) Kosher salt 
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) packed brown sugar 
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) smoked paprika 
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) sweet paprika 
	- Hardwood chips
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 Beef Brisket Pot Roast , 8 to 10 lb (3.5 to 4.5 kg) 
	- Coarsely ground black pepper
	- Granulated onion
	- Granulated garlic
	- Dry mustard
	- Kosher salt
	- Brown sugar
	- Smoked paprika
	- Sweet paprika
	- Hardwood chips
Recipe Methods:
	FOR THE BRISKET:
	1. Trim brisket, leaving ¼ inch (5 mm) fat cap on top, and make two ¾-inch (2 cm) deep scores across the grain of meat on one side of the flat at ½- to ¾-inch (1 to 2 cm) intervals. This will help make sure you slice it properly after the brisket is cooked (and you can’t see the grains as easily).
	 2. Combine salt, pepper, granulated garlic, granulated onion, sugar, smoked paprika, sweet paprika and dry mustard in a bowl. Season the brisket heavily, pressing the rub into the meat. Wrap brisket in plastic wrap, place on a baking sheet or tray and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or for up to 12 hours.
	TO USE A KETTLE BBQ:
	 1. Remove the top grill off the barbecue, and place an empty basket in the corner of the base. Fill one-third of the basket with cold charcoal, leaving room for the hot coals. Get a smaller amount of charcoal white hot in a chimney starter, then place them in the one-third space left in the basket. The heat will slowly “snake” across the rest of the charcoal.
	2. Soak 2 cups (500 mL) wood chips in water for at least 15 minutes. Drain off water; scatter the soaked chips over the charcoal. Alternately you can use large chunks of barbecue wood (such as hickory, mesquite, etc) without soaking.
	3. Place a small foil pan next to the basket and fill it with hot water.
	 4. Fill a large foil drip pan with ½ inch (1 cm) water and place on base underneath where the brisket will go, then replace the top grill back on the barbecue. Close the lid, making sure the vent holes are on the opposite side of the charcoal (this will direct the heat and smoke to go over the brisket side of the barbecue), and preheat to 250°F. Soak more wood chips for replenishing as you cook.
	TO USE A PROPANE/GAS BARBECUE:
	1. Soak 2 cups (500 mL) wood chips in water for at least 15 minutes. Drain off water and place wood chips in the smoke box (if your barbecue is equipped), or wrap in a square of foil in a package the size of a deck of cards and poke holes in packet to let smoke escape; place wood chip pack under grill (off to one side), directly on top of the burners. 
	2. Place a small foil pan under the grill next to the wood chips; fill it with hot water. 
	3. Fill a large foil drip pan with ½ inch (1 cm) water and place under the grill, on opposite the side of the barbecue from the wood chips (or over the burner furthest from the smoke box). Heat the side of the barbecue under the wood chips (or closest to smoke box) to low. Close the lid and pre-heat the grill on medium-low to 250°F. Soak more wood chips for replenishing as you cook.
	TO COOK:
	1. Unwrap brisket. Place brisket on grill over the drip pan, fat cap up. Insert oven-safe digital meat thermometer into centre of roast. Close the lid and cook for 2 hours. Check the brisket. If it looks dry, brush or spray those areas with water to keep it moist. Rotate the brisket for even cooking. Add more wood chips if needed to maintain smoke.
	 2. Cook for 2 hours longer or until thermometer registers 140°F (60°C). Carefully lift brisket onto a large piece foil, keeping the fat cap up, and wrap into a packet, sealing around edges (this will steam the brisket, which will speed up the cooking time and keep the brisket moist). 
	 3. Return the wrapped brisket to barbecue, close lid, and cook for 3 hours longer (for a total of 7 hours) until thermometer registers 180 to 200°F (82 to 93°C), and meat is tender in both the point (double) and the flat (single) sections. Check the tenderness by sliding a skewer (or thermometer) through the foil until there is zero resistance and meat feels very tender.
	 4. Transfer brisket to cutting board, open foil wrap and let rest for 20 to 30 minutes, or until roast has cooled 140°F (60°C). Carve across the grain into thin slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - When moistening the brisket while cooking, a spray bottle works best to avoid removing the rub but you can use a mop, a pastry brush, or even just a paper towel dipped in water instead.
---
Recipe ID: b5767284-ee4d-4bc0-8833-e1f36847139e
Recipe Title: Oven Roast Beef with Stout and Mushroom Sauce
Recipe Summary: With Irish inspired ingredients, this Beef Tenderloin roast is brushed with a Dijon-butter mixture and served with a rich stout sauce accented with cream, Worcestershire sauce and mushrooms. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments. Serve with a side of creamy mashed potatoes topped with chopped chives or green onions for a delicious Emerald Isle-inspired meal. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 80
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 95
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH Dijon mustard and melted butter
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut, tied
	- Stout-mushroom Sauce:
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
		- 1 pkg (227 g) sliced mushrooms
		- 2 shallots, finely chopped
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper 
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
		- ½ cup (125 mL) stout beer
		- 1½ cups (375 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
		- ½ cup (125 mL) whipping cream
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH Dijon mustard and Worcestershire sauce
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) granulated sugar
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut, tied
	- Butter
	- Sliced mushrooms
	- 2 shallots
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Stout beer
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Whipping cream
	- Dijon mustard
	- Granulated sugar
	- Worcestershire sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine mustard, butter, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Brush mustard mixture all over roast. 
	2. Place roast on a rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast for about 50 to 60 minutes for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	 3. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	Stout-mushroom Sauce: : 
		4. Meanwhile, melt butter over medium-high heat in roasting pan. Add mushrooms, shallots, salt and pepper; cook, stirring often, for 6 to 8 minutes or until starting to brown and soften. Sprinkle with flour; cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until well combined. 
		 5. Gradually pour in stout, stirring and scraping up any browned bits from the pan. Add broth, cream, mustard, Worcestershire sauce and sugar; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, stirring constantly, for 8 to 10 minutes or until thickened and flavours are blended. Remove from heat. 
		6. Carve roast across the grain into thick slices and serve with Stout-mushroom Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Serve this roast with authentic Irish potato side dishes, such as colcannon or champ. Use leftover roast and sauce to make open-face hot roast beef sandwiches using toasted sourdough bread.
---
Recipe ID: b59de411-ab9a-4da3-89ed-ce44ea9839bd
Recipe Title: Grilled Surf and Turf Mediterranean Sharing Board
Recipe Summary: Perfect for weeknight dinners or casual gatherings, this style of meal can take many names: grazing table, smorgasbord, mixed grill, etc. Whatever you call it, this take on traditional surf &amp; turf is a fun way to think of foods for grazing. For more info on Grilling Steaks visit the Canadian Beef Information Gateway. 
Recipe Prep Time: 45
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 ml) dried oregano leaves
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) grated lemon zest
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) lemon juice
	- 4 cloves garlic, finely chopped
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes (optional) 
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) light olive oil
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 8 to 10 multi-coloured grape tomatoes, halved
	- 1 log (140 g) soft goat cheese 
	- 4 oz (125 g) thinly sliced hard cheese, such as manchego, Asiago or Pecorino Romano 
	- Fresh veggies cut for dipping: cucumber, carrots, celery, sweet peppers, etc
	- 1 lb (500 g) Canadian Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick 
	- 12 jumbo raw shrimp, peeled with tails intact 
	- 4 large bamboo skewers, soaked
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 1 package (660g; 12 breadsticks) Furlani® Garlic Parm Breadsticks 
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- 1 lemon, cut into wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Grated lemon zest
	- Lemon juice
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Hot pepper flakes (optional)
	- Light olive oil
	- Fresh parsley
	- 8 to 10 multi-coloured grape tomatoes
	- Soft goat cheese
	- Thinly sliced hard cheese, such as manchego, Asiago or Pecorino Romano
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Canadian Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak,  about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick 
	- 12 jumbo raw shrimp, peeled with tails intact 
	- 4 large bamboo skewers
	- Garlic  Breadsticks
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- 1 lemon, cut into wedges
	- Fresh veggies cut for dipping: cucumber, carrots, celery, sweet peppers, etc
Recipe Methods:
	1. Dressing: Combine oregano, lemon zest, lemon juice, garlic, salt, pepper, and hot pepper flakes (if using) in a small bowl. Gradually pour in the olive oil while whisking until emulsified. Stir in parsley. Measure out ¾ cup (175 mL) of the dressing and pour into individual serving bowls to use as a dip for the breadsticks at time of serving.
	2. Accompaniments: Combine tomatoes with ¼ cup (60 mL) of the remaining dressing. Place bowl on a large wooden serving board. Place goat cheese in a shallow, rimmed serving dish; use another 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the remaining dressing to spoon over the cheese. Place cheese in its serving dish on the board; add sliced cheese and fresh veggies to the board. Cover and set aside for up to 30 minutes.
	3. Grill: Cut steak into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes. Thread steak and shrimp onto soaked skewers. Brush skewers all over with the remaining dressing.
	 4. Grill skewers in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides, until shrimp is opaque and beef is cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (160°F/71°C for medium or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Remove from heat. Leave the barbecue on to grill the breadsticks. Arrange skewers on the board; drizzle with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice. 
	 5. Heat Furlani Garlic Parm Breadsticks: Transfer breadsticks into a foil lasagna pan and heat in barbecue with lid closed until warm to touch, about 5 to 6 minutes.
	6. As part of the sharing board, serve warm breadsticks immediately with the reserved dressing that was set aside in individual bowls for dipping 
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: b68220d6-2fa1-45f4-bac4-003c237492d2
Recipe Title: Tandoori-Style Stir-Fried Beef Wraps
Recipe Summary: Meant for hand-held dining, these fold-over wraps are reminiscent of Shawarma or Gyro with Indian flavours. Feel free to top with any thinly sliced crispy veggies you like, such as shredded cucumber or carrot or even your favourite slaw. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 5
Recipe Marinating Time: 10
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Cumin-scented Dressing 
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) EACH mayonnaise and ranch dressing
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) ground cumin
	- Wraps
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 lime
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) orange juice
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chutney
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground cumin and cornstarch
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil (approx)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-fry Strips
	- 4 naan bread
	- ½ cup (125 mL) thinly sliced red or sweet onion
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Mayonnaise
	- Ranch dressing
	- Ground cumin
	-  Fajitas 
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 lime
	- Orange juice
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chutney
	- Cornstarch
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-fry Strips
	- 4 naan bread
	- Red or sweet onion
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cumin-scented Dressing: Combine mayonnaise, ranch dressing and cumin in a small bowl. Cover and refrigerate. (Makes 1 1/2 cups (375 mL).
	2. Beef Stir-Fry: Combine lime zest and juice, orange juice, garlic, chutney, cumin and cornstarch in a large bowl. Add the stir-fry strips and toss to coat; cover and refrigerate for 10 minutes or up to 2 hours.
	3. Wrap naan breads in foil. Warm in preheated 400°F oven while you cook the beef.
	4. Transfer beef strips from marinade with a slotted spoon to a clean bowl; discard marinade. Pat beef strips dry with paper towel. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil in large, deep nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook beef, in batches, for about 1 minute per side or until browned all over; transfer to another clean bowl. 
	 5. Divide beef among warmed naan breads. Top each with sliced onion and some of the Cumin-scented Dressing and fold over to eat. Serve with more of the Dressing as a dipping sauce. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Since Beef Stir-Fry Strips are thinly cut, marinating time can be brief.
---
Recipe ID: b69676be-a40f-4d31-abf3-460f35885544
Recipe Title: Grilled Mediterranean Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Marinate Sirloin Tip steaks with fragrant herbs and a hint of garlic and lemon, for 8 to 12 hours. Serve with chunky grilled sweet peppers and zucchini, and boiled new potatoes with a dollop of plain Greek yogurt.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 505
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH fresh parsley, oregano, rosemary and thyme leaves
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) black peppercorns
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 lemon
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Black peppercorns
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 lemon
	- Salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Oregano
	- Fresh parsley
	- Rosemary
	- Thyme leaves
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine parsley, oregano, rosemary, thyme, garlic and peppercorns in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle; grind until a fine paste.
	2. Transfer to sealable freezer bag; add 1 tbsp (15 mL) lemon juice, and salt (set lemon zest and remaining juice aside). Pierce steak all over with a fork and cut into 4 equal pieces. Add steaks to bag, massaging marinade into meat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Grill in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	4. Let rest for 5 minutes. Lightly season steak, and any accompanying grilled veggies and potatoes, with a sprinkle of some of the reserved lemon zest and juice.
Recipe Tips:
  - Marinades are all about building steak flavour and juiciness. Piercing steak all over with a fork is what helps tenderize the steak.
---
Recipe ID: b6a5e3e6-97e9-450a-837a-e102bc67b30a
Recipe Title: Stovetop Rich Ragù Ground Beef Meat Sauce 
Recipe Summary: This rich ragù uses the alchemy of tomato, black olives and red wine combined to bring all the beefy flavour to the forefront – a potent combination to tease taste buds with that fifth flavour known as umami. Serve over hot pasta and top with freshly grated Parmesan.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 40
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- 1 onion, diced
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) diced vegetables (such as zucchini and sweet pepper)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef Sirloin
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes (with juice)
	- 1 can (5½ oz/156 mL) tomato paste
	- ½ cup (125 mL) pitted Kalamata olives, chopped
	- ½ cup (125 mL) dry red wine
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) packed brown sugar
	- ½ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) dried oregano
	- Salt and pepper
	- Freshly grated Parmesan
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- 1 onion
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Vegetables (such as zucchini and sweet pepper)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef Sirloin
	- Diced tomatoes (with juice)
	- Tomato paste
	- Pitted Kalamata olives
	- Dry red wine
	- Brown sugar
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Dried oregano
	- Salt and pepper
	- Freshly grated Parmesan
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil over medium heat in large heavy saucepan. Add onion, garlic, vegetables and beef; cook, stirring occasionally and breaking up meat with a spoon, for 8 to 10 minutes or until beef is completely cooked. Remove from heat; drain.
	2. Add tomatoes with juice, tomato paste, olives, wine, sugar, hot pepper flake and oregano; bring to boil, stirring often. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes, or until sauce is thickened and flavours are blended. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve sprinkled with Parmesan.
Recipe Tips:
  - Ground beef is 100% beef with no additives, fillers or colours.
---
Recipe ID: b6d31f8e-53c3-4054-bc1d-c32f4fb65b15
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Berry Salsa
Recipe Summary: This colourful salsa and steak recipe combination is perfect for the summer berry season. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 12
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 27
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) halved strawberries
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whole blueberries
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 1 small jalapeño pepper, seeded and finely diced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) grated gingerroot
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely grated orange zest
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely grated lemon zest
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dry mustard
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steaks, ½ inch (2 cm) thick 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Strawberries
	- Whole blueberries
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- 1 small jalapeño pepper
	- Gingerroot
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Grated orange zest
	- Grated lemon zest
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Dry mustard
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steaks, ½ inch (2 cm) thick 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine berries, honey and vinegar in food processor or blender; process until coarsely chopped. Transfer to a bowl; stir in jalapeño and gingerroot. (This can be covered and refrigerated for up to 2 hours.)
	 2. Combine garlic, orange zest, lemon zest and juice, mustard, salt and pepper in small bowl. Spread on both sides of steaks.
	3. Grill steaks over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	4. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steaks across the grain and serve with a spoonful of the Berry Salsa.
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to let steaks rest for about 5 minutes after cooking so that the juices get the chance to settle before you serve or slice.
---
Recipe ID: b71c61d8-d6d4-4eee-8d5c-7ca843171819
Recipe Title: Grilled Tex-Mex Marinated Beef Kabob Wraps
Recipe Summary: Kabobs don’t have to always be served on a stick – they’re perfect to tuck into warmed tortillas, pita, Greek-style flatbread or naan. Top with some crispy veggies, beans and crumbled cheese to make a balanced meal.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lime juice
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) vinaigrette salad dressing, divided
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) chili powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Cubes. 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 8 bamboo skewers
	- Pinch EACH salt and pepper
	- 1 cup (250 mL) frozen shelled edamame, thawed
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) diced seeded plum tomatoes
	- ½ cup (125 mL) diced sweet yellow pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) diced red onion
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced fresh cilantro
	- 8 small whole wheat tortillas or other flatbreads
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Vinaigrette salad dressing
	- Chili powder
	- Cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Cubes. 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Bamboo skewers
	- Salt and pepper
	- Frozen shelled edamame
	- Plum tomatoes
	- Sweet yellow pepper
	- Red onion
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Fresh cilantro
	- 8 small whole wheat tortillas or other flatbreads
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine lime juice, 2 tbsp (30 mL) dressing, chili powder and cornstarch in large sealable freezer bag. Add beef cubes, massaging with marinade. Seal and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	2. Meanwhile, combine edamame, tomatoes, sweet pepper, onion, garlic, cilantro and remaining 2 tbsp (30 mL) dressing in a large bowl, tossing to coat. 
	3. Discard marinade from meat. Pat beef cubes with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper. Thread beef cubes onto soaked skewers.
	4. Grill kabobs over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides, until cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Lightly grill tortillas just to warm.
	5. Remove beef cubes from skewers and divide among warm tortillas; top each with vegetable mixture. Fold over and pin each tortilla with a toothpick to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Cornstarch is often used in marinades to give the sensation of tenderizing.

Recipe ID: b91b9eed-dc98-4ede-a049-acf1e61b9559
Recipe Title: Hungarian-style Braised Beef
Recipe Summary: Hot and fiery flavours of hot paprika blend with sweet paprika, to give this braised beef complexity in flavour with very little effort. You can even make it a day ahead and simply reheat to serve. Serve over cooked noodles or rice sprinkled with minced fresh cilantro or parsley if you wish.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 140
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 155
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg) Beef Cheeks (about 2 or 3) 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil, divided
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 EACH onion, carrot and sweet green pepper, diced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sweet paprika
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) dried marjoram
	- ½ to 1 tsp (2 to 5 mL) hot paprika
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- 3½ cups (875 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 2 small bay leaves
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2½ lb (1.3 kg)  Beef Cheeks (about 2 or 3) 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- Onion
	- All-purpose flour
	- Sweet paprika
	- Dried marjoram
	- Hot paprika
	- Tomato paste
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 2 small bay leaves
	- Carrot
	- Sweet green pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil over medium-high heat in large Dutch oven or enamelled cast iron roaster. Brown beef, turning occasionally, for about 8 minutes or until dark golden-brown all over. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
	2. Reduce heat to medium and add remaining oil to pot. Cook garlic, onion, green pepper and carrot, stirring, for about 4 minutes or until softened. Sprinkle in flour, sweet paprika, marjoram and hot paprika; add tomato paste. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until blended. Gradually whisk in broth; add bay leaf. Bring to a boil, scraping up browned bits from bottom of pot. Add beef and accumulated juices, turning beef to coat in sauce.
	 3. Cover and cook in preheated 325ºF oven, stirring occasionally, for about 2 hours or until meat is fork-tender.
	4. Use a slotted spoon to transfer beef to a bowl; break the beef into large chunks with a fork. Skim fat from sauce and discard bay leaves. Stir beef back into sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Recipe Tips:
  - A braise like this actually tastes better when made the day ahead! Here’s how: Refrigerate cooked beef overnight in its braising sauce. Next day, skim any fat from sauce and break up beef into large chunks; place meat in ovenproof casserole. Heat sauce on the stove-top and pour over meat. Cover and heat in 350°F oven for about 25 minutes.
---
Recipe ID: b920d9db-c04d-4b77-b218-5cd1d6458837
Recipe Title: Grilled Garlic Smashed Potatoes
Recipe Summary: Partially cooking mini potatoes, then tossing them with a garlicky vinaigrette before crisping them up on the grill will make you wonder why you haven’t been serving potatoes like this before! Tip: you can substitute any purchased vinaigrette-style dressing instead of making your own – just open up your fridge.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) mini potatoes, scrubbed
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cider or rice vinegar
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1.&nbsp;Place potatoes in a pot of cold water; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and boil gently for about 12 minutes or until tender. Drain and let cool slightly.
	2. Flatten each potato lightly with your hand while keeping it intact. Whisk together oil, vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add potatoes and toss gently to coat.
	3. Grill potatoes (reserving bowl) in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 3 to 5 minutes, turning once, until crisp and golden. Return to bowl and toss gently to coat with any remaining vinaigrette.
Recipe Tips:
  - Instead of grilling on a barbecue, heat a large cast-iron skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat until very hot, then add coated potatoes, in batches as necessary, and pan-fry until crisp and golden.
---
Recipe ID: b9d59982-b88f-4d6a-b7b1-939817cd8402
Recipe Title: Baked Asian-Inspired Meatballs with Veggies
Recipe Summary: Sesame seed- and cilantro-studded meatballs are perfect with the roasted veggies in this sheet-pan dinner. Serve with the super-simple sauce you can whip up by combining a few of your fridge condiment ingredients together.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Veggies 
	- 1 head broccoli, cut into small florets 
	- 2 carrots, cut into small batons 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- Meatballs 
	- 1 lb (500 g) Regular Ground Beef
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) ground Chinese five spice
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) minced gingerroot
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) soy sauce
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) chopped fresh cilantro
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) sesame seeds
	- Hoisin Dipping Sauce 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) hoisin sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) mayonnaise
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) Sambal Oelek
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sesame oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 head broccoli
	- 2 carrots
	- Vegetable oil
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Regular Ground Beef
	- 2 green onions
	- Ground Chinese five spice
	- Gingerroot
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Soy sauce
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Sesame seeds
	- Hoisin sauce
	- Mayonnaise
	- Sambal Oelek
	- Sesame oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Veggies: Combine broccoli, carrots, oil, salt and pepper in a large bowl; toss to coat. Spread out on a foil-lined large rimmed baking sheet; set aside.
	2. Meatballs: Combine ground beef, green onions, five spice powder, gingerroot, garlic and soy sauce with a fork in a large bowl; mix just until ingredients are worked evenly into beef (don’t over-mix). Combine cilantro and sesame seeds on a large plate. Scoop heaping tablespoonfuls (15 mL) of meat mixture and shape into meatballs. Roll in cilantro and sesame seed mixture to coat. Place meatballs on a rack on another foil-lined large rimmed baking sheet. Discard any excess cilantro-seed mixture.
	3. Bake vegetables and meatballs on upper and lower racks in preheated 375°F oven for about 25 minutes, switching pans halfway, or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several meatballs reads 160°F (71°C) and vegetables are tender. If vegetables are not tender, remove meatballs from oven and bake vegetables for about 5 minutes longer or until desired doneness.
	 4. Hoisin Dipping Sauce: Meanwhile, combine hoisin, mayo, Sambal Oelek and sesame oil in a small bowl.
	 5. Toss meatballs and vegetables together in a large serving bowl and serve Hoisin Dipping Sauce on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Use a digital instant-read thermometer as the most reliable way to determine that ground beef meatballs are cooked to the proper doneness.
---
Recipe ID: ba019845-1d1f-4bfa-876d-20164cad6cf8
Recipe Title: Teriyaki-Style Stir-Fried Beef with Noodles
Recipe Summary: Take out-inspired, this heart-healthy one-dish dinner is a snap to make with beef stir-fry strips. If sodium content is a concern, you can use reduced-sodium soy sauce instead of regular soy sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 10
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Teriyaki Sauce
		- 1 lemon
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH soy sauce, rice wine or sherry and granulated sugar
		- 1 clove garlic, peeled and smashed
		- 1-inch (2.5 cm) piece gingerroot, peeled and smashed
	- Stir-fry
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch
		- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-fry Strips
		- 8 oz (250 g) fresh Asian-style noodles (or 4 oz/125 g dried), such as soba 
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
		- 1 EACH onion, carrot and celery stalk, thinly sliced
		- 1 sweet red pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
		- 3 shiitake or cremini mushrooms, stemmed, caps sliced
		- 1½ cups (375 mL) broccoli florets
		- ⅔ cup (150 mL) boiling water
		- 4 green onions, sliced on diagonal 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lemon
	- Soy sauce
	- Rice wine or sherry
	- Granulated sugar
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- Cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Stir-fry Strips
	- 8 oz (250 g) fresh Asian-style noodles (or 4 oz/125 g dried), such as soba 
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onion
	- Carrot
	- Celery stalk
	- 1 sweet red pepper
	- 3 shiitake or cremini mushrooms
	- Broccoli florets
	- 4 green onions
Recipe Methods:
	Teriyaki Sauce: : 
		1. With a vegetable peeler, peel a 1-inch (2.5 cm) strip of zest from lemon, avoiding the white pith; reserve remaining lemon for another use. Combine lemon zest, soy sauce, rice wine, granulated sugar, garlic, gingerroot and 3 tbsp (45 mL) water in a small saucepan. Bring to boil over high heat; reduce heat and boil gently, stirring occasionally, until mixture is reduced by half. Let cool. Discard garlic, ginger and lemon peel. 
	Stir-fry: : 
		2. Combine cornstarch with 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the Teriyaki Sauce in a large bowl. Add beef and toss to coat; cover and refrigerate for at least 10 minutes or for up to 2 hours.
		3. Cook noodles according to package directions; drain well and set aside.
		4. Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil in a large, deep nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add stir-fry strips with marinade, in batches, and cook for about 1 minute per side or until browned all over. Transfer to a clean bowl; cover to keep warm.
		5. Clean pan, if necessary, and heat remaining oil over medium-high heat. Add onion, carrot, celery, red pepper, mushrooms and broccoli. Stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes or until vegetables are almost tender.
		6. Return beef and accumulated juices to pan; add remaining Teriyaki Sauce and boiling water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Add noodles and vegetables to pan and cook, tossing everything together, for 2 to 3 minutes or until noodles absorb juices but dish is still very moist. Toss with green onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - To save prep time, you can substitute ⅓ cup (75 mL) store-bought teriyaki sauce for the homemade in this recipe.
---
Recipe ID: ba44bb74-8b5f-4014-a9b6-6d58a1eb467b
Recipe Title: Sous Vide Beef Meatballs with Yogurt Greek Salad in Pitas
Recipe Summary: An interesting aspect of sous vide is the long cooking time at a steady temperature allows the ground beef to cook safely even though the temperature is lower than conventional heat methods. This technique keeps the meatballs moist and tender and is surprisingly easy to do. These Greek-inspired meatballs can be served in pitas with salad as we have here, or on their own with your favourite side dishes and the bonus is you can make them ahead, too.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 124
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 144
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Meatballs
		- 1 egg
		- 1 clove garlic, minced
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) grated lemon zest
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and dried oregano
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
		- Pinch hot pepper flakes
		- 1½ lb (750 g) Lean Ground Beef 
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) dry bread crumbs
		- 6 medium (6- to 7-inch/15 to 19 cm) whole wheat pitas with pockets
	- Yogurt Greek Salad
		- ½ cup (125 mL) plain Greek yogurt
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) extra virgin olive oil (approx)
		- 1 large tomato, seeded and chopped
		- ½ sweet red or yellow pepper, chopped
		- 1 cup (250 mL) chopped cucumber
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely chopped red onion
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) quartered pitted kalamata or other black olives
		- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 egg
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Lemon zest
	- Dried oregano
	- Pinch hot pepper flakes
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Lean Ground Beef 
	- Dry bread crumbs
	- 6 medium whole wheat pitas with pockets
	-  Yogurt Greek Salad
	- Plain Greek yogurt
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 large tomato
	- Sweet red or yellow pepper
	- Cucumber
	- Red onion
	- Pitted kalamata or other black olives
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	Meatballs: : 
		1. Combine egg, garlic, lemon zest, salt, oregano, pepper and hot pepper flakes in a large bowl; whisk with a fork until blended. Add beef and bread crumbs and mix with fork just until blended (don’t overmix). 
		2. Shape heaping tablespoonfuls (15 mL) of meat mixture into 1½-inch (4 cm) balls and place on a plastic wrap or parchment-lined baking sheet, spacing them apart. Freeze for 15 to 30 minutes or until firm but not solid.
		3. Meanwhile, set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 140°F (60°C) according to manufacturer’s directions.
		4. Place about 8 meatballs into each of 3 medium bags for sous vide (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Remove as much air as possible and seal the bags using vacuum sealer. 
		5. Immerse bags in preheated water bath and secure them to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bags above the surface of the water. Cook sous vide for 2 hours.
	Yogurt Greek Salad:&nbsp;: 
		6. Meanwhile, whisk together yogurt and oil in a medium bowl. Add tomato, red pepper, cucumber, onion and olives, tossing to coat. Add a little more oil, as necessary, to thin the yogurt. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate for up to 1 hour before serving.
		 7. Remove beef from water bath and let rest in bags for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat broiler with rack 4 inches (10 cm) from heat.
		8. Remove meatballs from bags using tongs or a slotted spoon and place on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet, spacing them apart. Discard liquid from bags. Broil meatballs, turning once, for 4 to 6 minutes or until browned.
		9. Cut about one-third off the tops of pitas, open pockets and stuff trimmed-off portion into bottom of each pita. Fill with meatballs and salad. Serve immediately.
Recipe Tips:
  - To make the meatballs ahead, after removing from water bath, immerse bags in a sink or bowl of ice water and chill, replenishing ice as necessary until cold. Refrigerate in bags for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 6 months. Thaw in refrigerator overnight. Reheat in a 140°F (60°C) water bath for 30 minutes, then proceed with broiling.
---
Recipe ID: baa3f857-962c-4b6e-a4dd-0db71e9f469d
Recipe Title: Grilled Jamaican Jump-Up Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Spiked with coffee, rum and island spices, jump-up your steak game with this peppy marinade. Serve with rice and beans and sweet potatoes to complete the meal.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 505
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH steak sauce and strong-brewed coffee
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH balsamic vinegar and dark rum
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH minced gingerroot and fresh thyme
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) ground allspice
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Strong-brewed coffee
	- Steak sauce
	- Dark rum
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Vegetable oil
	- Gingerroot
	- Fresh thyme
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Ground allspice
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine steak sauce, coffee, balsamic vinegar, rum, oil, gingerroot, thyme, garlic, allspice, salt and pepper in a sealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with fork and cut into 2 equal pieces. Add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. 
	3. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. 
	4. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steak across the grain to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can use this marinade for up to 2 pounds (1 kg) of steak if you’re feeding a crowd or want leftovers. Let leftovers cool slightly, then wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 days. Serve in wraps, sandwiches or on a rice bowl.
  - No grill? Pan-fry these steaks over medium-high heat in an oiled skillet or place on a rack over a rimmed baking sheet and broil instead of grilling.
---
Recipe ID: bab25af9-52a2-4eb2-996b-ab089817752e
Recipe Title: Garden Vegetable Oxtail Stew with Barley
Recipe Summary: Tuck into a rich and hearty bowl of goodness! Oxtail has a deep and satisfying beefy flavour, and becomes beautifully tender when braised. Loaded with large chunks of vegetables, this stew is so incredibly satisfying.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 210
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Oxtail, cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt (approx.)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper (approx.)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion, chopped
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) dried thyme
	- 4 stalks celery, coarsely chopped, divided
	- 2 large carrots, coarsely chopped, divided
	- 8 cups (2 L) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 4 parsnips, coarsely chopped
	- 1 large yellow-fleshed potato, peeled (if desired) and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) pearl barley, rinsed and drained
	- 1 cup (250 mL) frozen peas
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) cider vinegar
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Oxtail, cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion
	- Dried thyme
	- 4 stalks celery
	- 2 large carrots
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 4 parsnips
	- 1 large yellow-fleshed potato
	- Pearl barley
	- Frozen peas
	- Cider vinegar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat oxtail dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or large heavy-bottom stockpot or saucepan. Sear oxtail, turning with tongs, for about 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil.
	2. Reduce heat to medium. Add onion, thyme and half of celery and carrots to pot. Cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add broth and bay leaf; bring to a boil.
	3. Return oxtail to pot along with any accumulated juices. Cover, reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 2 hours or until meat is very tender. During cooking, skim surface of broth to remove any pools of fat. Add a splash of water to stew during the last hour of cooking if it begins to thicken too quickly. Using tongs, transfer oxtail to a dish. Set aside until just cool enough to handle. Discard bay leaf.
	4. Add remaining celery and carrots to pot, along with parsnips and potatoes; bring to a boil. Stir in barley. Cover, reduce heat and simmer, stirring often, for 25 to 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender, barley is cooked through and broth has thickened.
	5. Meanwhile, pull meat from oxtail; discard bones and trim. Tear meat into small pieces.
	6. Season stew with salt and pepper to taste. Stir meat into stew with the peas. Simmer for 5 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in vinegar.
Recipe Tips:
  - Portion stew into freezer-safe containers, seal tightly and label with recipe name and date. Stew can be stored in the freezer up to 6 months. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator.
---
Recipe ID: bac8e571-a393-4834-b68a-f59dc5ec2c2f
Recipe Title: Grilled Veggie and Ground Beef Burger Bowl
Recipe Summary: This is a new way to think about the traditional ‘burger’ meal with lots of colourful veggies, a spicy yogurt sauce and a whole grain option instead of the bun.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 50
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 70
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Grilled Vegetable Salad 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH olive oil and orange juice
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) minced chipotles in adobo sauce
	- ¾ tsp (3 mL) salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) freshly ground black pepper
	- 2 small zucchini, halved lengthwise
	- 2 ears corn, husked
	- 2 sweet orange peppers, halved and seeded
	- 2 cups (500 mL) halved cherry tomatoes
	- 1 cup (250 mL) cooked or canned black beans, drained and rinsed
	- 6 Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	-  To Serve 
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) 2% plain Greek yogurt
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) minced chipotles in adobo sauce
	- 3 cups (750 mL) cooked whole-grain rice or quinoa, warmed
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) torn fresh cilantro leaves
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) toasted green pumpkin seeds (pepitas)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Orange juice
	- Olive oil
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Salt
	- Freshly ground black pepper
	- 2 small zucchini
	- 2 ears corn
	- 2 sweet orange peppers
	- Cherry tomatoes
	- Cooked or canned black beans
	- 6  Beef Burgers, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- 2% plain Greek yogurt
	- Chipotles in adobo sauce
	- Whole-grain rice or quinoa
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Toasted green pumpkin seeds (pepitas)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Grilled Vegetable Salad: Whisk together oil, orange juice, garlic, chipotle, salt and pepper in small bowl. Toss 3 tbsp (45 mL) dressing with the zucchini, corn and peppers in a large bowl. Grill vegetables on oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium heat (350°F/180°C), turning occasionally, for 10 to 12 minutes or until tender and slightly charred. Transfer to cutting board; let cool.
	2. Cut corn kernels off the cob into a large bowl. Chop zucchini into bite-sized pieces and slice peppers into thin strips; add to corn in bowl. Add tomatoes, beans and 3 tbsp (45 mL) of the remaining dressing, tossing to coat. Set aside.
	 3. Make a thumbprint depression in centre of each burger (to prevent rounding while grilling). Grill burgers over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) in a closed preheated barbecue for 10 to 14 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick burgers, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each burger reads 160°F (71°C).
	 4. To Serve: Stir remaining dressing with yogurt and chipotle until smooth and well combined. Divide warm rice, Grilled Vegetable Salad and burgers evenly among 6 shallow bowls. Top with yogurt sauce. Sprinkle with cilantro and pumpkin seeds.
Recipe Tips:
  - To Cook Indoors: Cook burgers in a cast-iron skillet or grill pan over medium heat. Cut zucchini into chunks and thinly slice peppers. Use 1 cup (250 mL) frozen corn kernels. Sauté vegetables in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat with 3 tbsp (45 mL) of the dressing mixture for 10 minutes or until tender.
---
Recipe ID: bb5c8c1a-6201-43ee-938a-41d11fe6acac
Recipe Title: Balsamic-braised Beef Steak & Roasted Veggies
Recipe Summary: The aroma of this hearty, oven-braised beef recipe and slow-roasted veggies is a warm welcome on a cool evening.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 135
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 EACH carrots and parsnips, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH cubed butternut squash and sweet potato (1-inch/2.5 cm cubes)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH balsamic vinegar, olive oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh rosemary (or 1 tsp/5 mL dried, crumbled)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ½ EACH sweet red and green pepper, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- 2 slices bacon, chopped
	- 1 lb (500 g) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak (or 1¼ lb/625 g Bone-in), 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 medium onions, diced
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) dried thyme
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) beef broth
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) balsamic vinegar, divided
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Carrots and parsnips
	- Butternut squash
	- Sweet potato
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Sweet red and green pepper
	- 2 slices bacon
	- 1 lb (500 g) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak (or 1¼ lb/625 g Bone-in), 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 medium onions
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Dried thyme
	- Beef broth
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Roasted Vegetables: Combine carrots, parsnips, squash and sweet potato in a large bowl. Add balsamic vinegar, olive oil, rosemary and ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper; toss to coat. Spread in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet or shallow roasting pan and roast in bottom third of 425°F oven for 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 325°F and continue roasting vegetables for about 1 hour.
	2. Braised Beef: Meanwhile, cook bacon in a Dutch oven or sauté pan with lid over medium-high heat, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until crisp; transfer bacon to a bowl and set aside.
	3. Cut steak into 4 equal pieces and pat dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Add to bacon drippings in pot and brown for 2 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer to bowl with bacon and set aside. Reduce heat to medium and add onions, garlic and thyme to pot; cook, stirring occasionally, for about 8 minutes or until onions are soft and golden brown. Stir in 2 tbsp (30 mL) of vinegar, scraping up brown bits stuck to pot.
	4. Stir in broth and bay leaves; bring to a simmer. Return bacon and steaks with accumulated juice to pan; cover and simmer in oven on rack above vegetables for about 1¼ hours or until meat is fork tender. 
	5. Stir red and green peppers into vegetables and roast for about 15 minutes until vegetables are browned and tender. Remove vegetables from the oven and keep warm if they’re tender before beef is ready. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
	6. Transfer steaks to cutting board. Return pot of sauce to medium heat on the stove top and return to a simmer. Stir cornstarch with remaining 1 tbsp (15 mL) vinegar and stir into pot. Boil, stirring, for about 2 minutes or until thickened and glossy. Discard bay leaves. Season sauce with salt and pepper to taste. Slice steaks across the grain and serve with sauce and roasted vegetables.
Recipe Tips:
  - If a blade steak is not available, buy a boneless blade roast and cut crosswise into 1-inch (2.5 cm) slices, discarding string (you can freeze extra for another use). Once untied, the slices will separate into smaller pieces so you may have more than 4 and can skip slicing steaks before serving.
---
Recipe ID: bb7bfc34-5640-4dfa-828a-5f81ecb0c643
Recipe Title: Ground Beef Skewers with Golden Grilled Vegetables
Recipe Summary: This is a great casual summer entertaining dish that goes beyond burgers and buns. Set out the grilled meat, vegetables and pitas on platters and let family and friends have the fun of assembling their own dinners. Place meat and vegetables into pita pockets to eat.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 12
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 32
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed coarsely chopped fresh parsley
	- 3 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH paprika, salt and pepper
	- 1 egg
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) dry bread crumbs
	- 12 bamboo skewers, soaked for 30 minutes
	- 6 pitas (with pockets)
	- Steak sauce
	- Golden Grilled Vegetables
	- 3 medium onions, thinly sliced
	- 1 sweet red or green pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) steak sauce (approx)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh parsley
	- 3 green onions
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Paprika
	- 1 egg
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- Dry bread crumbs
	- 12 bamboo skewers
	- 6 pitas (with pockets)
	- Steak sauce
	- 3 medium onions
	- 1 sweet red or green pepper
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine parsley, green onions, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, paprika, salt and pepper with a fork. Beat in egg and 2 tbsp (30 mL) water. Mix in ground beef and bread crumbs. Scoop a heaping 2 tablespoonsful (30 mL) and squeeze into a small sausage shape on skewer. Repeat to make 12 skewers. Set aside.
	2. Golden Grilled Vegetables: Scatter onions and red pepper in centre of large square of double-thickness heavy-duty foil. Drizzle with oil, ¼ cup (60 mL) steak sauce, salt and pepper; toss to coat. Cover with another square of double-thickness foil; seal edges tightly. 
	3. Grill vegetable packet over medium heat in a closed barbecue for about 20 minutes, turning occasionally, until vegetables are tender. Meanwhile, place skewers on greased grill over medium heat; close lid and grill for about 12 minutes, turning once until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each reads 160°F (71°C). 
	4. Remove meat and vegetables from grill. Slit top of foil packet and fold back. Set aside. Grill pitas, turning once, for about 2 minutes or until warmed. 
	5. Toss vegetables with additional steak sauce, if desired. Cut each pita in half and open to form pockets. Remove meat from skewers and serve with Golden Grilled Vegetables tucked into pita pockets. Drizzle meat with steak sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Use a digital instant-read thermometer as the most reliable way to determine that ground beef on skewers is cooked to the proper doneness.
---
Recipe ID: bbcc7c4a-8dc9-4ecb-a265-9c902486339d
Recipe Title: Mediterranean-Style Oven Roast with Sheet Pan Veggies
Recipe Summary: This colourful nutrient-rich dinner cooks all at once for minimal fuss. Serve with cooked couscous, quinoa grain, rice or pasta. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 125
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Roasted Vegetables
		- 3 plum tomatoes, cored and quartered
		- 8 oz (250 g) zucchini (about 2), halved lengthwise and cut into ½-inch (1 cm) slices
		- 1 small red onion, cut lengthwise into thin wedges
		- 1 baby eggplant, cut into chunks
		- 1 EACH sweet red and yellow pepper, seeded and cut into chunks
		- 4 oz (125 g) mushrooms, quartered
		- 6 cloves garlic, peeled
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) prepared basil pesto
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) balsamic vinegar
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) liquid honey
	- Beef
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) olive oil
		- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast
		- Pinch EACH salt and pepper
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) prepared basil pesto
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 plum tomatoes
	- Zucchini (about 2)
	- 1 small red onion
	- 1 baby eggplant
	- Sweet red and yellow pepper
	- Mushrooms
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Basil pesto
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Liquid honey
	- Olive oil
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Roasted Vegetables: In large bowl, combine tomatoes, zucchini, onion, eggplant, red and yellow peppers, mushrooms, garlic and pesto; toss to coat. Spread on foil-lined rimmed baking sheet lightly coated with vegetable cooking spray; set aside.
	2. Beef: Heat oil in wide heavy sauté pan or ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Season beef all over with salt and pepper. Brown all over, turning with tongs, about 10 minutes. Spread pesto all over roast; place on rack in same sauté pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Cook beef and vegetables, uncovered, in preheated 275°F oven for about 1½ hours or until thermometer reads 140°F (60°C) for medium-rare (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. 
	4. Meanwhile, using a rubber spatula, scrape vegetables into large bowl; toss with vinegar and honey. Keep warm. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with vegetables.
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your oven roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: bbf01190-da2b-49e1-a2d5-850128c0c841
Recipe Title: Slow-Roasted Thick Steak with Tahini Sauce and Greens
Recipe Summary: This recipe is a whole new vision for beef: a thick juicy steak that’s carved and passed family style at the table along with garden greens and veggies, nuts, and seeds is like having a power-bowl, without the bowl. Serve with this something other than gravy (like the Tahini Sauce here) and a whole grain, like a farro or barley to complete the power-bowl experience.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 46
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 56
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Tomahawk-style Rib Grilling Steak, 1-bone thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- ½ to 1 tsp (2 to 5 mL) steak spice or salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	-  Homemade Tahini Sauce 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) tahini paste
	- Juice of ½ lemon
	- 1 small clove garlic, minced (or ¼ tsp/1 mL garlic powder)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground cumin and ground coriander
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH smoked or regular paprika, Dijon mustard and salt
	- Pinch fresh ground pepper
	-  Salad 
	- Baby arugula, spinach or micro-greens
	- Sweet red or yellow peppers, cut into chunks
	- Thinly sliced red onion, radish and cucumber
	- Seeds/nuts, such as toasted pumpkin, sunflower or sliced almonds 
	- Fresh cilantro sprigs
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Tomahawk-style Rib Grilling Steak,  1-bone thick (about 2½ lb/1.3 kg)
	- Steak spice
	- Vegetable oil
	-  Homemade Tahini Sauce 
	- Tahini paste
	- 1 lemon
	- 1 small clove garlic (or garlic powder)
	- Ground cumin
	- Ground coriander
	- Smoked or regular paprika
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Baby arugula, spinach or micro-greens
	- Sweet red or yellow peppers
	- Red onion
	- Radish
	- Cucumber
	- Seeds/nuts, such as toasted pumpkin, sunflower or sliced almonds 
	- Fresh cilantro sprigs
	- Salt
	- Dijon mustard
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steak dry with paper towel. Season meat all over with steak spice; just enough to coat but not crust the steak. Rub or pat in the spice. Wrap steak tightly in plastic wrap. Place in a large container and refrigerate for at least 6 hours or, preferably, overnight.
	2. Homemade Tahini Sauce: Meanwhile, mash tahini paste and lemon juice with the back of a spoon in a bowl (the sauce will become very thick). Add 2 tbsp (30 mL) water and continue to mash the mixture, adding water, 1 tbsp (15 mL) at a time until you achieve a sauce the thickness of runny yogurt. Stir in garlic, cumin, coriander, paprika, mustard, salt and pepper. Taste and adjust seasonings. (Make ahead: Refrigerate until ready to use, for up to 3 days.)
	3. Unwrap steak (do not rinse). Pat dry with paper towel. Heat a large cast-iron skillet or other ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add oil and swirl to coat. Add steak; cook for 3 to 5 minutes per side, until brown on both sides. 
	 4. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into the centre of the steak, avoiding fat or bone. If bone extends beyond edge of pan, place skillet on a rimmed baking sheet to catch any drips. Cook in preheated 275°F oven for about 40 minutes for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	 5. Transfer steak to cutting board, cover loosely with foil and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes. Carve meat from the bone, then across the grain into thin slices. Arrange steak on a large platter with the bone.
	 6. Serve slices of steak with a small salad of a handful of greens, red or yellow peppers, red onion, radish and cucumber; drizzle all over with Homemade Tahini Sauce. Sprinkle with seeds and/or nuts and cilantro. Serve immediately.
Recipe Tips:
  - If you don’t have an ovenproof skillet wide enough to fit the steak, sear it in your largest skillet, positioning steak as necessary, to brown all over. Transfer steak to a wire rack on top of a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet and cook as directed in the oven.
---
Recipe ID: bd545e53-b4d8-44a9-a64b-5fbabeadf62f
Recipe Title: Tomato Herb Pasta
Recipe Summary: Try making this sauce loaded with fresh tomatoes and herbs as a nice change from a traditional cooked pasta sauce. The heat of the pasta warms the sauce slightly while keeping the flavours bright and fresh. Serve with your favourite grilled steak, kabobs or burgers.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 cups (750 mL) dry penne or rotini pasta (about 9 oz/270 g)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH packed fresh parsley and cilantro or basil leaves
	- ¼ small onion 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) bottled vinaigrette salad dressing
	- Salt, fresh ground pepper and hot pepper flakes
	- 2 cups (500 mL) grape tomatoes, quartered
	- Freshly grated Parmesan cheese
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water for about 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain well and return to pot (off the heat).
	2. Meanwhile, combine parsley, cilantro, onion, salad dressing, ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) salt, ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper and a pinch of hot pepper flakes in a blender; purée until smooth.&nbsp;
	3. Pour herb mixture over pasta in pot and add tomatoes; toss to combine. Season with salt, pepper and hot pepper flakes to taste. Serve sprinkled with Parmesan.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - Instead of the upright blender, the herb mixture can be puréed using an immersion blender in a tall cup if you like.
---
Recipe ID: bd60dd99-34a2-4f43-864e-0ed7ea63abcf
Recipe Title: Braised Beef Tongue with Vegetable Ragu
Recipe Summary: After church, we would visit the local butcher shop where my dad went to buy meat. Often the butcher would give us offcuts for free, cuts like beef tongue that were less popular. As kids, we didn’t really know what beef tongue was as my mom presented it as a ‘roast’ and we kids loved it! Although not necessarily standard fare these days, beef tongue is now a big staple when I participate in events. I seem to be the only one who serves it and it actually makes me happy even if only a few visitors come to my booth. It feels like a well-kept culinary secret.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 70
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 90
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Tongue (unpeeled) 
	- Salt and pepper
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) sunflower or canola oil
	- 3 fresh sage leaves
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) whole black peppercorns
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth
	- Vegetable Ragu
		- 2 beets (unpeeled), finely diced 
		- 2 cloves garlic, minced 
		- 2 bay leaves
		- 1 onion, finely diced
		- Sunflower or canola oil (optional)
		- 2 EACH carrots and potatoes (unpeeled), diced 
		- Half stalk celery, diced
		- Salt and pepper
		- ⅓ cup (75 mL) butter, cut into cubes
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 beets 
	- Garlic 
	- 1 onion
	- 2 carrots
	- 2 potatoes 
	- Celery
	- 1 Beef Tongue (unpeeled)
	- Sunflower or canola oil
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Fresh sage leaves
	- Bay leaves
	- Whole black peppercorns
	- Butter
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut beef tongue crosswise into 4 equal pieces. Score each piece lengthwise deeply, almost but not all the way through, to butterfly. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. 
	2. Heat oil over medium heat in a large heavy nonstick skillet until sizzling. Add beef, cut side down, and sear, turning once, for 4 to 6 minutes or until golden brown on both sides. Set aside.
	3. Combine sage, bay leaves, peppercorns, broth and 3 cups (750 mL) water in a heavy Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add seared beef (reserving oil in skillet) and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer vigourously for 45 minutes or until fork-tender.
	4. Vegetable Ragu: Meanwhile, add beets, garlic, bay leaves and onion to the reserved skillet. Cook over medium-low heat, adding more oil if necessary to keep moist, stirring often, for 10 minutes, until beginning to soften. Add carrots, potatoes and celery. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper to your taste; cook, stirring often, for 10 to 15 minutes, until just tender. Set aside and let cool slightly.
	5. To serve, remove beef from heat and set aside. Reheat the skillet of vegetables over low heat; discard bay leaves. Add butter; stirring to melt and glaze the vegetables. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
	6. Transfer beef to a cutting board, discarding broth. Carve crosswise into thin slices. Spoon vegetables in centre of a medium-sized platter and top with slices of tongue.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: bdf49225-01a2-4477-bf8c-ae0a2767340d
Recipe Title: Orange-Glazed Baked Beef Meatball Kabobs
Recipe Summary: If you’re looking for a change from your stand-by burgers, try these colourful kid-friendly meatball and veggie skewers. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped sweet mixed pickles
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) prepared yellow mustard
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 8 EACH bite-size chunks sweet red and green peppers and red onion
	- 8 button mushrooms, trimmed
	- 8 bamboo skewers, soaked for 30 minutes
	- 2 cups (500 mL) hot cooked rice
	- Glaze
	- ½ cup (125 mL) prepared yellow mustard
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH orange juice concentrate and packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cider vinegar
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) hot pepper sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- Sweet mixed pickles
	- Yellow mustard
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Salt and pepper
	- Sweet red and green peppers
	- Red onion
	- Button mushrooms
	- Bamboo skewers
	- Rice
	- Orange juice concentrate
	- Brown sugar
	- Cider vinegar
	- Hot pepper sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine ground beef, pickles, mustard, garlic, salt and pepper with a fork in a large bowl; mix just until ingredients are worked evenly into beef (don’t over-mix). Scoop heaping tablespoonfuls (15 mL) of meat mixture and shape into 1½ inch (4 cm) meatballs. Thread onto soaked skewers, alternating with red and green peppers, onion and mushrooms. Place on a plate, cover and refrigerate while preparing Glaze.
	2. Combine mustard, orange juice concentrate, sugar, vinegar and hot pepper sauce in a small saucepan; bring to a boil, stirring, over medium heat. Pour half into a bowl for dipping sauce; set aside.
	 3. Arrange kabobs on a lightly greased rack on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet, spacing them apart. Brush all over with remaining glaze. Bake in preheated 425°F oven for about 12 minutes, turning occasionally, or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several meatballs reads 160°F (71°C) and vegetables are tender.
	4. Serve kabobs over hot rice with reserved Glaze on the side as dipping sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Use a digital instant-read thermometer as the most reliable way to determine that ground beef meatballs are cooked to the proper doneness.
---
Recipe ID: be03c26d-4117-4640-9f41-0330ac511a00
Recipe Title: Barbecued Five-Spiced Roast Beef
Recipe Summary: Asian spices and condiments add wonderfully unique flavours and aromas to beef. Serve this roast with grilled bok choy and steamed rice. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 45
Recipe Marinating Time: 720
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 775
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) soy sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) liquid honey
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH minced gingerroot and garlic
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) ground Chinese Five Spice
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Sambal Oelek hot pepper condiment (or hot pepper flakes, to taste)
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast
	- Green onions
	- Sesame seeds
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Soy sauce
	- Liquid honey
	- Gingerroot
	- Garlic
	- Ground Chinese Five Spice
	- Sambal Oelek hot pepper condiment (or hot pepper flakes, to taste)
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Oven Roast
	- Green onions
	- Sesame seeds
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, honey, gingerroot, garlic, five spice and Sambal Oelek in sealable freezer bag. Pierce roast numerous times with fork. Add roast to bag, massaging to coat; seal bag and refrigerate for 12 hours.
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	3. Remove meat from marinade, reserving marinade. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 45 to 60 minutes for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: see ‘ESTIMATED COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, bring reserved marinade to a boil over medium-high heat in a small saucepan. Boil for 1 minute.
	 5. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with sauce and garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.
Recipe Tips:
  - When buying a beef oven roast, buy 12 oz (375 g) beef per person for bone-in-roasts or for boneless roasts, buy 6 to 8 oz (175 to 250 g) beef per person.
---
Recipe ID: be4f8ff2-3f81-4eba-b23d-75fadf10025d
Recipe Title: Oven-Baked Ground Beef Koftas
Recipe Summary: Serve koftas as a main course or thread one per skewer to serve as appetizers. For a smoky touch, use smoked paprika. Serve with warmed pita, a chunky marinated vegetable salad and a dipping sauce, such as yogurt with chopped mint and a bit of ground cumin stirred in.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed minced fresh parsley
	- 3 green onions, minced
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire Sauce
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) paprika
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and pepper
	- 1 egg
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) dry bread crumbs
	- Bamboo skewers, soaked for 30 minutes
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh parsley
	- Green onions
	- Garlic
	- Worcestershire Sauce
	- Paprika
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 egg
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Dry bread crumbs
	- Bamboo skewers
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine parsley, green onions, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, paprika, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Beat in egg with a fork. Mix in beef and bread crumbs.
	2. Scoop about a heaping 1 tbsp (15 mL) and shape into meatballs; thread onto soaked skewers, spacing apart slightly. Place onto a&nbsp;parchment- or&nbsp;&nbsp;lightly oiled&nbsp;foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Press slightly to flatten.
	3. Bake in&nbsp;a preheated&nbsp;400°F oven for 10 to 15 minutes, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several meatballs reads&nbsp;160°F (71°C).
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Cook to 160°F (71°C), checking the doneness of several meatballs with a digital instant-read thermometer.
