Recipe ID: c6860a52-09e5-4486-b912-e9e56b4cdc5d
Recipe Title: Shawarma-Style Barbecue-Roasted Beef
Recipe Summary: Serve thin slices of this aromatic roast beef on split sub buns, spread with a store-bought humus and top with a crunchy coleslaw. Try mixing cauliflower florets into your slaw for a change. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 75
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 135
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Dry Rub
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH sweet paprika, ground cumin and dried oregano leaves
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH ground coriander and garlic powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground ginger, ground allspice and ground cinnamon
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) cayenne pepper
	-  Roast Beef 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Oven Roast 
	- 8 soft submarine buns, split
	- Prepared hummus and slaw (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Sweet paprika
	- Ground cumin
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Ground coriander
	- Garlic powder
	- Ground ginger
	- Ground allspice
	- Ground cinnamon
	- Cayenne pepper
	- Salt
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Top Sirloin Cap Oven Roast
	- 8 soft submarine buns
	- Prepared hummus and slaw (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1.  Dry Rub: Combine paprika, cumin, oregano leaves, coriander, garlic powder, ginger, allspice, cinnamon and cayenne in a bowl or jar; transfer 3 tbsp (45 mL) to a small bowl for the roast and store remaining rub in covered jar or an airtight container for up to 6 months. (Makes 3/4 cup/175 mL dry rub.)
	2. Roast Beef : Stir salt into bowl with reserved dry rub. Rub all over roast and place in a large dish. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 24 hours.
	3. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	4. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1¼ to 1½ hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	 5. Transfer to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Carve across the grain into thin slices and serve on buns spread with hummus (if using). Top with your favourite slaw, if desired. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: c6fbd6d3-3ffa-4c87-99b3-e34e132fd68e
Recipe Title: Sous Vide Sweet and Sticky Beef (Prime Rib Bones) 
Recipe Summary: Sous vide cooking is a slow-cook method where food is vacuum sealed and cooked at a constant low temperature in a water bath for tender, succulent and perfectly-cooked meats. Use the manufacturer’s instructions and reputable resources, such as cookbooks, to find more tips and tricks to mastering this cooking method.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 975
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 990
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) red pepper jelly, orange marmalade or apricot jam 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH packed brown sugar, red wine vinegar and Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH grainy Dijon mustard and chili powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH garlic powder and onion powder
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground allspice 
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) red wine vinegar 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Red pepper jelly, orange marmalade or apricot jam
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Brown sugar
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Chili powder
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder
	- Ground allspice
	- 1 rack Beef Grilling Back Ribs (about 5 lb/2.2 kg)
	- Cornstarch
	- Red wine vinegar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 158°F (70°C) according to manufacturer’s instructions. 
	2. Combine red pepper jelly, brown sugar, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, chili powder, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder and allspice in a small bowl. Brush jelly mixture all over ribs. 
	3. Place the ribs in an extra-large sous vide bag (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Remove as much air as possible and vacuum or manually seal. 
	4. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Weigh bag down to submerge, if necessary. Cover water bath with foil or plastic to reduce evaporation. Cook sous vide for 16 hours, replenishing water as necessary.
	5. Carefully remove bag from water bath and let rest for 5 minutes before opening and removing ribs. Pour the rib cooking liquid into a small saucepan; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Combine cornstarch with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water in a small bowl; gradually whisk into saucepan and simmer, whisking, for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened and glossy. Remove pan from heat, stir in vinegar; set aside. 
	6. Grill ribs in a closed preheated barbecue over medium heat (350°F/180°C), or place on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet and broil on the middle rack, for 5 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally, until ribs are browned. 
	7. Transfer to a cutting board. Cut rack into individual ribs. Serve with warm sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Removing the silverskin from the rack before brushing with the jelly mixture allows the flavours to penetrate the meat better, and enhances tenderness. To remove it from the rack, slide a thin knife between the meat and the membrane, pull up until there is enough to grab hold of with a paper towel. Like removing wallpaper, pull it off with even pressure to remove as one large sheet.
---
Recipe ID: c74eb103-34dd-4ee2-b801-80899d8dbf91
Recipe Title: Grilled Mexican-Style Marinated Steak and Bean Salad
Recipe Summary: This recipe was inspired by Chef Alexis Bostelmann from Mexico. Serve the marinated grilled steak and fresh-tasting bean salad over wilted greens like chard or spinach.
Recipe Prep Time: 45
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 540
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH vegetable oil and wine vinegar
	- 1 bay leaf, crumbled
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Eye of Round Marinating Steaks, 3/4 inch (2 cm) thick (about 4 small)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 long fresh red chili or jalapeño pepper, halved, seeded and thinly sliced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) black beans, drained and rinsed
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH fresh cilantro and mint leaves, torn
	- 1 sweet green pepper, diced
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 lemon (about 3 tbsp/45 mL juice)
	- 4 radishes, halved and sliced
	- 1/4 red onion, sliced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic
	- Chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- Vegetable oil
	- Wine vinegar
	- Bay leaf
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Eye of Round Marinating Steaks, 3/4 inch (2 cm) thick (about 4 small)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 long fresh red chili or jalapeño pepper
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) black beans
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Fresh mint leaves
	- 1 sweet green pepper
	- 1 lemon
	- Radishes
	- Red onion
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine chipotle peppers, garlic and crushed bay leaf in sealable freezer bag. Pierce steaks all over with fork and add to bag, massaging marinade into meat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Herbed Bean Salad: Meanwhile, heat oil in small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, chili, salt and pepper; cook, stirring for about 2 minutes or until aromatic. Add beans, and heat, stirring, for about 4 minutes or until warmed through. Transfer to a bowl and let cool. Stir in cilantro, mint, green pepper, lemon zest and lemon juice. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. (Make-ahead: Can be stored in airtight container for up to 1 day.)
	3. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper.
	4. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. 
	5. Transfer steaks to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice thinly across the grain on a 45-degree angle. Divide Herbed Bean Salad between serving plates, top with sliced steak and garnish with radishes and onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling.
---
Recipe ID: c87cd0ee-1026-4a6e-b72e-2f1a92f15091
Recipe Title: Herb-Crusted Oven-Roasted Beef
Recipe Summary: Designed for a small-sized beef oven roast, this recipe has a classic rub that serves as a crust for the roast.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 33
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 43
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried thyme
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) paprika
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Oven Roast, Petite Tender
	- Kosher salt and coarsely ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Dijon mustard
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh parsley
	- Dried thyme
	- Paprika
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Oven Roast
	- Kosher salt
	- Coarsely ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- Dijon mustard
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine parsley, thyme, paprika and garlic in small bowl; set aside.
	 2. Pat roast dry and rub all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat in heavy oven-proof skillet; add beef and cook, turning, for about 8 minutes until brown all over.
	 3. Brush roast all over with Dijon mustard. Coat all over with reserved herb mixture, pressing to adhere. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer lengthwise into centre of roast and place a small rack in the pan. Roast on rack, uncovered, in preheated 350°F oven for about 25 to 30 minutes for medium-rare or until thermometer reads 145°F (63°C) at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	4. Transfer to cutting board, cover loosely with foil and let rest for 5 minutes. Carve across the grain into thin slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your oven roast stand at least 5 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: c93c1aba-2cc2-43a1-ad95-b21e74a95bfa
Recipe Title: Two-step Pan-seared Steak with Buttery Port Pan Sauce
Recipe Summary: T-bone is always impressive when carved to serve at the table with the bone as part of the presentation. You can use either tawny or ruby port for the pan sauce in this recipe, as both will impart sweet, rich flavour. Ruby ports will give a fruity, berry flavour, while tawny ports will result in a more nutty, caramel flavour. Substitute port with a rich and fruity dry red wine, if desired.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh rosemary and thyme
	- 1¼ tsp (6 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 Beef T-bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter
	- Buttery Port Pan Sauce
		- 2 shallots, minced
		- 1 cup (250 mL) tawny or ruby port 
		- ½ cup (125 mL) whole berry cranberry sauce
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) Dijon mustard
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) cold butter, cut into cubes 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Fresh thyme
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 Beef T-bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
	- 2 shallots
	- Tawny or ruby port
	- Whole berry cranberry sauce
	- Dijon mustard
	- Butter
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine rosemary, thyme, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat steaks dry with paper towel and rub all over with herb mixture.
	 2. Melt butter over medium-high heat in a 9-inch (23 cm) cast-iron or heavy-bottomed stainless skillet. Add steaks and cook for 4 to 6 minutes, turning once or until browned on both sides. Transfer steaks to a rack on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Set skillet aside to make the sauce.
	3. Cook steaks in preheated 400°F (200°C) oven for 6 to 8 minutes or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	4. Transfer steaks to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	 5. Buttery Port Pan Sauce: Meanwhile, set reserved skillet over medium heat. Add shallots and cook, stirring often, for 1 to 2 minutes or until starting to soften. Pour in port; bring to a boil. Boil for 5 to 8 minutes or until reduced by half. Stir in cranberry sauce and mustard; return to a boil. Boil, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until sauce is thickened to syrupy consistency. Remove from heat.
	6. Add butter to sauce, one cube at a time, stirring until each piece melts before adding the next.
	  7. Carve meat from bone, then across the grain into slices. Serve with Buttery Port Pan Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute cranberry sauce with your favorite jam or jelly: cherry, strawberry, blueberry, orange marmalade, fig or apricot preserves all will work well with this recipe.
---
Recipe ID: c998c3ad-f77b-4503-8c16-7bf6166fd6a6
Recipe Title: Rosemary Grilled Steak with Brie and Pecans
Recipe Summary: This restaurant-inspired steak uses creamy Brie, apricot jam and pecans to balance out the sharp rosemary and Dijon mustard flavours. Serve with a side of steamed green beans or quickly sautéed spinach. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 6
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 16
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh rosemary, olive oil and Dijon mustard
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak, ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 4 small steaks)
	- 3 oz (90 g) Brie cheese, cut into small pieces
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped toasted pecans
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) apricot jam
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Olive oil
	- Dijon mustard
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak
	- Brie cheese
	- Chopped toasted pecans
	- Apricot jam
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine rosemary, oil, mustard, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; rub steaks all over with rosemary mixture. Set aside.
	2. Gently combine cheese, pecans and jam in a small bowl; set aside. 
	3. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more and topping with cheese mixture for the last 2 minutes, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	4. Transfer steaks to a warm platter or serving plates and let rest for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute apricot jam with honey or maple syrup, and/or substitute Brie with goat cheese or blue cheese.
---
Recipe ID: c9bdb7cb-980f-4faf-8468-9fddf881c797
Recipe Title: Sous Vide Roast Beef Dip Sandwiches
Recipe Summary: Sous vide is a slow-cook method that tenderizes meat while keeping it very juicy. (See Tip for cooking by oven-roasting if you don’t have a sous-vide appliance.) Add pickled onions to these sandwiches for an extra punch of flavour if you wish.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 255
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 270
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Bottom Sirloin Ball Tip Oven Roast (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) garlic powder
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) salt
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 1 shallot, minced
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 5 sprigs fresh thyme
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth
	- 8 oblong soft buns
	- Grainy mustard, horseradish and/or mayonnaise 
	- Pickled or fresh sliced hot peppers 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Bottom Sirloin Ball Tip Oven Roast  (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- Garlic powder
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 shallot
	- 1 clove garlic
	- 5 sprigs fresh thyme
	- Beef broth
	- 8 oblong soft buns
	- Grainy mustard, horseradish and/or mayonnaise 
	- Pickled or fresh sliced hot peppers 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 140°F (60°C) according to manufacturer’s directions.
	2. Season roast all over with garlic powder and salt and pepper. Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until very hot. Add 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil and heat oil. Brown roast, for about 15 minutes, turning until browned on all sides. Transfer the roast to a plate and let cool. 
	3. Reduce heat to low and add the remaining oil to skillet. Cook shallots and garlic, stirring, for 30 seconds. Add thyme and beef broth; bring to a simmer. Simmer for 5 minutes. Strain the broth through a sieve into a medium saucepan and refrigerate. Set strained solids aside. 
	4. Place the roast along with the strained solids into a large resealable freezer bag, vacuum seal bag or resealable silicone food storage bag. Remove as much air as possible and seal the bag or using vacuum sealer. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure it to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Cook sous vide for 4 hours.
	 5. Remove the beef from the pot. Open the bag and transfer beef from the bag to a cutting board, reserving the juices. Cover roast with foil and let rest for 10 minutes.
	 6. Meanwhile, strain beef cooking juices into the refrigerated reserved broth; discard solids. Heat the broth mixture over medium-high heat to a strong simmer. Reduce heat to low and keep warm.
	 7. Meanwhile, preheat broiler. Carve beef across the grain into thin slices. Slice the buns in half and open flat; place on a large baking sheet. Spread with mustard, horseradish and/or mayonnaise as desired. Top one side of buns with beef then hot peppers. Broil for 2 to 3 minutes or until buns are toasted around the edges.
	 8. Pour hot broth into ramekins and serve with the hot sandwiches for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - To roast beef in oven, skip step 1. Mince thyme leaves and rub over roast with garlic powder, salt and pepper and omit browning in skillet. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Proceed with cooking shallot and garlic as directed in step 3.
---
Recipe ID: c9e570de-9448-4042-9fac-48c20eb4450e
Recipe Title: Sicilian-Inspired Oven Roast with Fresh Herb Sauce
Recipe Summary: Instead of gravy, or pan sauce, this roast is served with a fragrant, fresh herb pesto-like sauce that is a mixture of authentic flavours from Italy's most southern region. Use a top-quality extra virgin olive oil for the sauce and use a more economical variety for slathering the roast. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 210
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) light olive oil
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh parsley and sage
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh rosemary and anchovy paste
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) grated lemon zest
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) drained capers, finely chopped
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Rib Eye Oven Roast or Boneless Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	-  Fresh Herb Sauce
	- ½ cup (125 mL) good-quality extra virgin olive oil 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Light olive oil
	- Fresh parsley
	- Sage
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Anchovy paste
	- Lemon
	- Capers
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Rib Eye Oven Roast or Boneless Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	- Good-quality extra virgin olive oil
	- Fresh parsley
	- Hot pepper flakes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine light oil, parsley, sage, rosemary, anchovy paste, lemon zest, lemon juice, capers, garlic, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Transfer ⅓ cup (75 mL) of the paste to another small bowl and set aside for the Fresh Herb Sauce. Rub remaining paste all over roast.
	2. Place roast, fat side up, on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2¾ to 3 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before carving.
	  4. Fresh Herb Sauce: Meanwhile, add extra virgin olive oil, parsley and hot pepper flakes to reserved herb paste; stir until blended. 
	 5. Carve roast across the grain into slices and serve with Fresh Herb Sauce on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - Anchovy paste can be found refrigerated in the fresh fish department of most well-stocked grocery stores.
---
Recipe ID: caa1a165-f032-4efe-8dd3-ef27edc540c8
Recipe Title: Mushroom-Crusted Oven Roast with Wine Sauce
Recipe Summary: Add something new to your roast beef repertoire with this mushroom-crusted version. Made from dried mushrooms, the crust adds an intense mushroom flavour to the beef and sauce. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 8-in (20 cm) long x 4¾-in (12 cm wide) x 3½-in (8 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 150
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH olive oil and Dijon mustard
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh thyme
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) pepper
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- ¾ oz (21 g) sliced dried mushrooms (such as portobello, porcini, or shiitake), about 1 cup (250 mL)
	- Wine Sauce
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
		- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped onion
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
		- ½ cup (125 mL) red wine
		- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
		- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Dijon mustard
	- Fresh thyme
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- Mushrooms (such as portobello, porcini, or shiitake)
	- Butter
	- Onion
	- All-purpose flour
	- Red wine
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Wine Sauce
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine oil, mustard, thyme, garlic and pepper in a small bowl; rub all over roast. Finely chop dried mushrooms by pulsing in a mini chopper or small food processor; press onto mustard coating all over roast. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer lengthwise into centre of roast so shaft is not visible. Place on rack in shallow roasting pan or ovenproof skillet. Add ¼ inch (5 mm) water to pan.
	 2. Cook roast, uncovered, in preheated 275°F (140°C) oven for about 2¼ hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes
	4. Wine Sauce: Meanwhile, place roasting pan over medium-high heat. If necessary, boil off water from roasting pan. Add butter and stir until melted. Add onion and cook, stirring, for about 5 to 10 minutes or until onions are softened and any pan liquid has evaporated. Stir in flour until moistened. Gradually stir in wine and bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up any brown bits from pan. Stir in beef broth; simmer, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 
	5. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with Wine Sauce.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your oven roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: cb687349-6ae5-4859-aab5-207493dc953f
Recipe Title: Slow-Simmered Coconut Beef Curry
Recipe Summary: Red curry paste, a flavourful compliment to beef, is popular in Indian and Thai dishes and can be found in the Asian food section of the supermarket. If you can’t find it, use curry powder instead. Serve with hot cooked couscous or basmati rice.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 120
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil (approx)
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Simmering Steaks, cut in ¼-inch (5 mm) wide strips
	- 2 onions, sliced lengthwise
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sweet paprika
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) ground cumin
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) red curry paste (or 1 tbsp/15 mL curry powder)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground cinnamon
	- 4 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
	- 1 lb (500 g) baby carrots
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) coconut milk
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
	- ½ cup (125 mL) dried apricots, sliced
	- Toasted slivered almonds and/or chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Simmering Steaks, cut in ¼-inch (5 mm) wide strips
	- 2 onions
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Sweet paprika
	- Ground cumin
	- Red curry paste or curry powder
	- Ground cinnamon
	- 4 medium potatoes
	- Baby carrots
	- Coconut milk
	- Tomato paste
	- Salt
	- Dried apricots
	- Toasted slivered almonds and/or chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil over medium-high heat in heavy Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef strips, in batches and adding more oil as needed, for 2 to 3 minutes, turning once, or until browned. Transfer beef to a bowl. Set aside.
	2. Add onions, garlic, paprika, cumin, curry paste and cinnamon; cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until fragrant and onions are softened. Stir in reserved browned beef and accumulated juices, potatoes, carrots, coconut milk, tomato paste, salt and ½ cup (125 mL) water. Bring to a simmer.
	3. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for 1½ hours or until beef is fork-tender. Stir in apricots; cover, return to oven and cook for 15 minutes. Serve sprinkled with almonds and/or cilantro, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Simmer beef in the oven rather than on the stovetop for a constant simmer with less chance of scorching.
---
Recipe ID: cb95553a-966e-4990-8432-7abefd1a0a94
Recipe Title: Homemade Deli-Style Oven Roast Beef
Recipe Summary: This easy roast is the perfect weekend make-ahead recipe to use in a variety of ways for weeknight meals. The possibilities for tasty roast beef sandwiches are endless, whether using bread, buns or pita or tortillas for wraps. Try a simple sandwich with thin slices of roast beef layered onto baguette, with horseradish mayo, arugula and aged Cheddar. The roast beef slices are also handy for salads or grain bowls. For deli-thin slices, carve the roast when well-chilled, using a sharp carving or slicing knife. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 85
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 90
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH brown sugar, dry mustard, salt and cracked black pepper 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH garlic powder and onion powder
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder
	- Vegetable oil
	- Salt and cracked black peppers
	- Dry mustard
	- Brown sugar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine sugar, mustard, salt, pepper, garlic powder and onion powder in a small bowl. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Drizzle oil over roast; season all over with spice blend. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast.
	2. Oven-sear roast in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 1½ to 2 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium at the most).
	3. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Refrigerate to cool completely. 
	4. To serve, cut across the grain, shaving roast into thin slices using a sharp knife. Store sliced or unsliced roast refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 to 5 days. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Double, or even triple the spice blend, to have on hand for quickly adding flavour to roasts, steaks or burgers. Store in an airtight container, at room temperature, for up to 6 months. Eye of round is a very lean cut, so our recommendation is to cook no more than to medium doneness and to slice thinly.
---
Recipe ID: cc032db3-ee6c-4416-bf37-a23bb12372e0
Recipe Title: Harissa-Crusted Oven Roast and Potatoes with Yogurt Sauce
Recipe Summary: Harissa is a North African spice blend with cumin, coriander and garlic accents. It’s perfect to jazz up this basic roast beef and potato dinner, served with a cool mint yogurt sauce to balance the spices. Store-bought harissa seasoning does vary in heat level, so adjust the amount to suit your taste. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 100
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 115
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt, divided 
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) freshly ground pepper, divided
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) dry harissa seasoning
	- 2 lb (1 kg) yellow-flesh potatoes, cut into 2-inch (5 cm) chunks
	- Mint Yogurt Sauce
		- 1 cup (250 mL) plain Greek yogurt
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh mint
		- 4 tsp (20 mL) fresh lemon juice 
		- 1 clove garlic, minced
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
	- Salt
	- Freshly ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- Dry harissa seasoning
	- Yellow-flesh potatoes
	- Plain Greek yogurt
	- Fresh mint
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- 1 clove garlic
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat roast dry with paper towel and season all over with half each salt and pepper. Stir oil with harissa seasoning in a small bowl; brush 2 tbsp (30 mL) of this paste all over roast. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast.
	 2. Toss potatoes with remaining harissa paste, salt and pepper. Arrange in single layer on parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet. 
	3. Place roast on middle rack and potatoes on lower rack in a preheated 450°F oven. Oven-sear roast and potatoes for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 1½ to 1¾ hours until potatoes are golden brown and tender, and roast is medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium at the most).
	  4. Transfer roast to a cutting board. Cover roast with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Cover potatoes with foil to keep warm.
	Mint Yogurt Sauce: : 
		5. Meanwhile, stir yogurt, mint, lemon juice, garlic, salt and pepper together in a small bowl. 
		6. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices. Serve with potatoes and Mint Yogurt Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Tips: Letting the roast rest after cooking, allows the juices to settle, making for a more tender and juicier roast. Eye of round is a very lean cut, so our recommendation is to cook no more than to medium doneness and to slice thinly.
---
Recipe ID: ccca090b-925c-4ddb-b5dd-0f157a4c149c
Recipe Title: French Onion Roast Beef Sandwich
Recipe Summary: The flavours of classic bistro fare with a twist! We take many of the components of the famous soup recipe and offer them up in this delicious and special sandwich. A fancy offering that can serve a crowd, and yet is easy to prepare – most of the time and effort is handled by your oven!
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Roast 
	- 1 Beef Bottom Sirloin Ball Tip Oven Roast (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dried herb blend, such as herbs de Provence, fine herbs or Italian seasoning
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	-  Onion Jus 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- 4 cups (1 L) thinly sliced sweet onions, such as Vidalia or Spanish 
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) dried herb blend, such as herbs de Provence, fine herbs or Italian seasoning
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) dry red wine
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) soy sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	-  To Serve 
	- 6 slices sourdough bread, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 2 cups (500 mL) shredded Gruyère or mozzarella cheese
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Bottom Sirloin Ball Tip Oven Roast (about 3 lb/1.5 kg)
	- Vegetable oil
	- Butter
	- Sweet onions, such as Vidalia or Spanish
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- Dried herb blend, such as herbs de Provence, fine herbs or Italian seasoning
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Dry red wine
	- Soy sauce
	- All-purpose flour
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 6 slices sourdough bread
	- Shredded Gruyère or mozzarella cheese
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Roast: Rub roast all over with oil, dried herbs, salt and pepper. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes.
	2. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	 3. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. 
	4. Onion Jus: Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet set over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, dried herbs, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring often, for 10 minutes or until softened and lightly browned. Add up to ½ cup (125 mL) water if pan gets dry and onions begin to stick. 
	 5. Add wine and soy sauce. Simmer for 3 minutes or until reduced by half. Sprinkle in flour; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in broth; bring to a simmer. Cook, stirring often, for 10 minutes or until very thick. Remove from heat. 
	 6. To Serve: Carve roast across the grain into very thin slices. Preheat broiler to high; position rack in top third of oven. Arrange bread slices on a large foil-lined baking sheet. Toast for 2 minutes per side or until lightly golden. Top bread with sliced roast. Spoon warm Onion Jus evenly over beef (careful it does not run over the sides).
	  7. Toss cheese with parsley in a bowl; sprinkle evenly over each portion. Broil for 3 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and lightly browned in spots. Let stand for 2 minutes before serving.
Recipe Tips:
  - Leftover roast can be stored, tightly covered, in the refrigerator for 3 to 5 days. Carve thinly to make cold roast beef sandwiches or finely chop and add to quesadilla fillings.
---
Recipe ID: ccff4025-9a60-46fc-a757-13fc276a161d
Recipe Title: Grilled Thyme-Marinated Steak with Blue Cheese Butter
Recipe Summary: Flavoured butters add a touch of classic steak-house dining to the dinner done at home. It’s a finishing touch that can be made well-ahead making it so easy to do! Feel free to improvise the ingredients in your butter mix once you’ve tried this one out for a taste-drive!
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) red wine vinegar
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) chopped fresh thyme
	- 1 small clove garlic, minced
	- Pinch EACH salt and pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Tri-tip Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 4 small steaks)
	- Blue Cheese Butter 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH unsalted butter, softened, and crumbled blue cheese (such as Stilton)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH finely chopped pecans or walnuts and chopped fresh Italian parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Fresh thyme
	- 1 small clove garlic
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Tri-tip Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 4 small steaks)
	- Blue Cheese Butter 
	- Unsalted butter
	- Crumbled blue cheese (such as Stilton)
	- Chopped pecans or walnuts
	- Fresh Italian parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk together oil, vinegar, thyme, garlic, salt and pepper in large shallow dish. Add steaks and turn to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or for up to 4 hours.
	2. Blue Cheese Butter : Meanwhile, in a bowl, mash together butter, blue cheese, walnuts and parsley until well combined. Scrape onto a piece of plastic wrap and using plastic wrap as a guide, roll into a log-shape, about 5 inches (12.5 cm) long. Refrigerate until ready to use.
	3. Remove steaks from marinade; discard marinade. Pat steaks dry with paper towel. Grill on a lightly oiled grill in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for about 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. 
	4. Transfer steaks to a plate, cover and let rest for 5 minutes. Place steaks on serving plates; top each with a slice of Blue Cheese Butter. Let flavoured butter melt slightly for about 1 minute before serving. (Refrigerate any extra Blue Cheese Butter for up to 2 weeks for another use.)
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling. 
---
Recipe ID: cda67055-1a74-4017-8b8e-fd0d5b24b459
Recipe Title: Barbecue-Roasted Beef with Fresh Chow Chow Relish
Recipe Summary: Serve dinner picnic-style, featuring a platter of delicious sliced barbecue roast beef that you make ahead and yummy Fresh Chow Chow Relish. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 50
Recipe Marinating Time: 60
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 130
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Oven Roast 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) barbecue sauce
	- Salt and pepper (optional)
	-  Fresh Chow Chow Relish 
	- 2 cups (500 mL) EACH cauliflower florets and coarsely chopped carrots
	- Salt
	- 1 sweet green pepper, coarsely chopped
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH chopped red onion and barbecue sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH vinegar and minced fresh parsley
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) prepared hot mustard
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Top Sirloin Cap Oven Roast 
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Salt and pepper
	- Cauliflower
	- Carrots
	- 1 sweet green pepper
	- Red onion
	- Barbecue sauce
	- Vinegar
	- Fresh parsley
	- Hot mustard
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pierce roast all over with fork. Place in large sealable freezer bag with barbecue sauce, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours. 
	2. Fresh Chow Chow Relish : Meanwhile, cook cauliflower florets and carrots in pot of boiling salted water for about 4 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain well; place in bowl. Stir in green pepper, red onion, barbecue sauce, vinegar, parsley and hot mustard. Cover and refrigerate for up to 1 week. (Makes 4 cups/1 L)
	 3. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	 4. Remove roast from marinade; discard marinade. Pat roast dry with paper towel and season with salt and pepper, if desired. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 50 to 60 minutes for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	 5. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for to 15 minutes at least (Make ahead: Let roast cool, cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days to serve cold.). Carve across the grain into thin slices and serve with Fresh Chow Chow Relish on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - To serve roast beef, carve across the grain into thin slices to optimize tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: cee2bf55-300f-4361-a29a-d7b0658e4677
Recipe Title: Red Beer-braised Beef Shepherd's Pie
Recipe Summary: My grandmother and I always made a great shepherd's pie on cold winter days. Nothing is more comforting than some good mashed potatoes, accented with celeriac, with meat and good corn. I still remember the aroma of the onion cooking with the ground beef. I had a lot of trouble mashing the potatoes and I remember she added a lot of butter! This version is a tribute to the dish of my childhood. Did you know that this dish was invented in the 19th century during the construction of the Canadian Pacific Railway? Back then, workers were fed corn, beef and potatoes but it’s the Asian workers who started to combine their rations and created this dish! French Canadian workers started to name it "pâté chinois” shortly after.
Recipe Prep Time: 40
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 190
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 230
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Blade Roast, trimmed, cut into quarters
	- Olive oil
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Half onion, finely chopped
	- 3 garlic cloves, finely chopped
	- 2 cans (EACH 355 mL) red beer, 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) beef broth
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) maple syrup
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) herbes de Provence
	- 1 lb (500 g) cheese curds
	- 2 cups (500 mL) frozen corn kernels
	- Sweet smoked paprika
	- Mashed Potatoes
		- 4 white potatoes, peeled and diced (about 2 lb/1 kg)
		- 1 celeriac, peeled and diced
		- Salt
		- 3 tbsp (45 mL) butter
		- ½ cup (125 mL) grated fresh Parmesan
		- ⅓ cup (75 mL) milk
		- Fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Blade Roast
	- Olive oil
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Half onion 
	- 3 garlic cloves
	- 2 cans (EACH 355 mL) red beer
	- Beef broth
	- Maple syrup
	- Bay leaves
	- Herbes de Provence
	- 1 lb (500 g) cheese curds
	- Frozen corn kernels
	- Sweet smoked paprika
	- 4 white potatoes, peeled and diced (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- 1 celeriac, peeled and diced
	- Butter
	- Grated fresh Parmesan
	- Milk
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat beef dry with paper towel Heat a generous layer of oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron pan. Brown beef, in batches as necessary, turning, for about 10 to 12 minutes, until browned on all sides. Season with salt and pepper generously. Transfer to a plate.
	2. Add a thin layer of oil to the pot. Cook onion and garlic, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until softened. Pour in beer and bring to a boil, scraping up brown bits from bottom of the pot. Stir in broth, maple syrup, bay leaves and herbes de Provence. Season with salt and pepper to your taste. 
	3. Cover and bring to a boil. Cook, covered, in preheated 350°F oven for 2½ hours or until meat is fork-tender.
	4. Mashed Potatoes: Meanwhile, place potatoes and celeriac in a large saucepan. Add water to cover and bring to a boil. Season with salt. Reduce heat and boil gently for about 25 minutes or until the vegetables are fork-tender. Pour into a colander, drain and return to the pan. Add butter and stir until melted. Add the Parmesan and milk. Mash until smooth using a potato masher. Season with salt and pepper to taste; set aside.
	5. Transfer meat to a bowl with a slotted spoon and shred the meat with two forks. Discard the fat and bay leaves. Skim fat from juice in pot.
	6. Pour the meat into a 9 x 13-inch (3 L) baking dish and sprinkle with a few ladles of the cooking juices. Scatter the cheese curds on top and set aside.
	7. Heat a thin layer of oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Cook corn, stirring frequently, for 4 to 5 minutes, until corn is golden brown. Spoon over the meat and cheese. Spoon the Mashed Potatoes over the meat and spread to cover. Sprinkle with smoked paprika to taste. 
	8. Bake in preheated 400°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until filling is bubbling and topping is golden brown. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
Recipe Tips:
  - The red beer used for this recipe was Nord Star by Micro brasserie Grande Allée
---
Recipe ID: cf5b2d13-fc99-4201-8c64-f3e90d11109e
Recipe Title: Garlic-Studded Oven Roast with Honey Mustard Glaze
Recipe Summary: Small slits made into the roast allow slivers of garlic to flavour the meat as it cooks and provides amazing pan drippings for a delicious gravy in the end. Use a meat thermometer to cook your roast to the doneness that you like the best – without overcooking it! NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 135
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH Dijon mustard and liquid honey
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary leaves
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast 
	- 6 cloves garlic, cut into slivers
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) garlic powder
	- Gravy
	- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch 
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Dijon mustard
	- Liquid honey
	- Fresh rosemary leaves
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast 
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Garlic powder
	- Gravy
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine mustard, honey and rosemary in a small bowl until blended to make a glaze. Transfer 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the glaze to another small bowl for gravy; set aside. 
	 2. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Cut shallow slits all over roast using a thin sharp knife; insert garlic slivers into slits. Season roast all over with salt, pepper and garlic powder.
	3. Place roast, fat side up, on rack in shallow roasting pan; insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Carefully remove from oven and brush with glaze. Return to oven and reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 1½ to 2 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	  4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. 
	5. Gravy: Meanwhile, drain off fat from pan drippings. Heat pan drippings in roasting pan over medium heat. Stir in broth and reserved glaze and bring to a boil, scraping up any browned bits from pan. Cook, stirring often, for 8 to 10 minutes or until flavours blend. Whisk cornstarch with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water and gradually whisk into gravy; boil, whisking constantly for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened and glossy. Season with salt and pepper.
	 6. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with Gravy.
Recipe Tips:
  - Reheat leftover roast slices and gravy together and serve on toasted crusty rolls with slices of aged Cheddar cheese and sautéed onions to make tasty hot beef sandwiches.
---
Recipe ID: cf5f37d3-0e46-40f5-8f7e-ed57f3677d28
Recipe Title: Grilled Hawaiian-Style Marinated Beef Kabobs
Recipe Summary: This recipe is a marinating marvel – with marinating time cut from hours to minutes by using beef cut into cubes instead of a whole steak. Kabobs are a great grill option when you have a gathering – the work can all be done in advance, the grilling is fuss-free and the serving is simple. This recipe makes lots of extra sauce that’s nice for dipping.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) steak sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH liquid honey and frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Bamboo skewers
	- 2 sweet red peppers, seeded and cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) chunks
	- 1¼ cups (300 mL) fresh pineapple chunks (or 1 can 14 oz/398 mL drained)
	- Chopped fresh chives
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Steak sauce
	- Liquid honey
	- Frozen orange juice
	- Cornstarch
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Cubes, 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Bamboo skewers
	- 2 sweet red pepperS
	- Pineapple chunks
	- Chopped fresh chives
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine steak sauce, honey and orange juice concentrate in sealable freezer bag. Set aside ¼ cup (60 mL) for basting and ¼ cup (60 mL) for dipping in separate bowls. Mix cornstarch into bag. Add beef cubes, massaging with marinade. Seal and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes. Meanwhile, soak skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
	 2. Discard marinade from meat. Pat beef cubes dry with paper towel. Thread beef cubes onto soaked skewers alternating with red pepper and pineapple chunks. 
	3. Grill kabobs over medium-high heat in a closed barbecue, basting with ¼ cup (60 mL) reserved sauce, for about 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides, until cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	4. Garnish kabobs with chives. Serve with remaining ¼ cup (60 mL) sauce for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - Consistently-sized kabob cubes make it easier to get even doneness throughout the meat when cooking.
---
Recipe ID: d03c210f-beb7-406b-a6fc-ac3de1bc88de
Recipe Title: Roast Beef with No-Cook Béarnaise Sauce
Recipe Summary: This classic restaurant combination of Beef Tenderloin and Béarnaise sauce sounds intimidating at first, but with a quick no-cook sour cream base and a no-fail roasting method, it will be easy to master. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments. This sauce can also be served with grilled steaks or burgers, or even with steamed asparagus or broccoli.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) herbes de Provence, crumbled
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast,center cut, tied
	- No-cook Béarnaise Sauce
		- ¾ cup (175 mL) EACH sour cream and mayonnaise
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) white wine vinegar
		- 4 tsp (20 mL) Dijon mustard
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper 
		- Pinch cayenne pepper
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) minced shallots
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh tarragon and chives
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Herbs of Provence
	- Vegetable oil
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast,center cut, tied
	- Sour cream
	- Mayonnaise
	- White wine vinegar
	- Dijon mustard
	- Cayenne pepper
	- Shallots
	- Fresh tarragon
	- Chives
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine herbes de Provence, oil, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Rub herb mixture all over roast. 
	2. Place roast on a rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast for about 50 to 60 minutes for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	3. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	No-cook Béarnaise Sauce: : 
		4. Meanwhile, combine sour cream, mayonnaise, vinegar, mustard, salt, pepper and cayenne in a medium bowl until blended. Stir in shallots, tarragon and chives. 
		 5. Carve roast across the grain into thick slices and serve with No-cook Béarnaise Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Serve this delicious Beef Tenderloin roast with steamed green beans, sautéed mushrooms and boiled or roasted potatoes.
---
Recipe ID: d082cd4d-b276-4591-a61a-81bc2653baca
Recipe Title: Italian-Style Grilled Fast-Fry Steak Involtini with Red Wine Sauce 
Recipe Summary: Steak Involtini with Red Wine Peppercorn Sauce is a simple way to impress guests – it sounds fancy but is actually very easy to put together! Lightly pounding the steaks helps with both tenderness, and with making the involtini easier to roll. With savoury portobello mushrooms, sweet sun-dried tomatoes and fresh basil, this dish is perfect for a romantic date night in. We’ve even considered changing the name to ‘Marry Me Beef’ because it’s so good and it just might prompt a proposal! 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Top Sirloin Fast-fry Steaks (about 9)
	- 1 large portobello mushroom, stem trimmed, cap thinly sliced 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH olive oil and balsamic vinegar 
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) dried oregano leaves
	- Salt and pepper 
	- 9 sun-dried tomatoes (approx)
	- 9 to 18 fresh basil leaves (approx)
	- Metal skewers
	- Freshly grated Parmesan cheese and fresh basil leaves 
	- Red Wine Peppercorn Sauce
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) butter
		- Half small onion, finely minced
		- 2 to 3 cloves garlic, finely minced 
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) flour
		- 1 cup (250 mL) red wine
		- 1 cup (250 mL) beef broth 
		- 1 bay leaf 
		- ¾ tsp (4 mL) coarse cracked black pepper 
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) Worcestershire sauce 
		- Salt
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine mushroom slices, oil, vinegar and oregano in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste, stir gently to coat. Set aside.
	2. Place one steak between two sheets of parchment paper. Pound with the flat side of a meat mallet or rolling pin until about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick; repeat with remaining steaks. Season steaks all over with salt and pepper to your taste.
	3. Place one sun-dried tomato, one or two basil leaves (depending on how large they are), and a slice or two of the marinated mushroom on one narrow end of a steak. Tightly roll the steak around the filling. Insert a metal skewer at each end of the roll to secure. Repeat with remaining steaks and filling. Season the outside of the involtini with salt and pepper to your taste.
	4. Grill involtini in a closed preheated barbecue over high heat (500°F/250°C) for 6 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserting sideways into each roll reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 10 minutes.
	5. Red Wine Peppercorn Sauce: Meanwhile, heat a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and swirl to melt. Cook onions, stirring, for 1 minute. Add garlic to taste; cook, stirring, for 1 minute, until fragrant. Sprinkle in flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Gradually pour in wine, stirring continuously. Stir in broth, bay leaf, pepper and Worcestershire sauce; season with salt to taste. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes, until thickened. Remove from heat.&nbsp;
	6. Remove skewers and slice the involtini crosswise. Spoon the sauce onto plates and arrange involtini on top. Garnish with Parmesan cheese and fresh basil.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - To cook on a charcoal barbecue: Set up your grill for direct heat cooking. Place lit charcoal directly in the centre of the grill, where you plan on cooking the steaks. If you’re looking for a smokier flavour, add a couple chunks of wood to the lit coals before adding the grill grate. Sugar maple or pecan wood would be a nice flavour pairing with this recipe. Close the lid and allow the grill to preheat to (500°F/250°C) for 10 to 12 minutes. Grill involtini on the grill grate directly over top of the coals for 6 to 8 minutes, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserting sideways into each roll reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing to serve.
---
Recipe ID: d0c8c898-0f8a-424e-8f2c-6d6798c7a70e
Recipe Title: Braised Balsamic Beef Sandwiches
Recipe Summary: This open-faced sandwich is perfect to serve with a garden salad. The meat and sauce can both be made the day ahead so that supper is super simple to make the next day. Try tucking the meat with some of the sauce into warmed tortillas as burritos, soft tacos, or quesadillas and it’s also delicious when used to top baked potatoes. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH diced onion, celery and carrot
	- ½ cup (125 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) chicken broth
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) dry red wine
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Cheeks (about 2 small)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded Cheddar cheese
	- 4 slices herb focaccia or Italian loaf
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Vegetable oil
	- Onion
	- Celery
	- Carrot
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Chicken broth
	- Dry red wine
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Cheeks  (about 2 small)
	- Shredded Cheddar cheese
	- 4 slices herb focaccia or Italian loaf
Recipe Methods:
	1. Bring beef broth to boil over high heat in a saucepan; boil for about 10 minutes or until reduced to about ½ cup (125 mL). Set aside.
	 2. Meanwhile, heat half the oil over medium-high heat in large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef, turning occasionally, for about 8 minutes or until dark golden-brown all over. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
	3. Reduce heat to medium and add remaining oil to pot. Cook onion, celery and carrot, stirring, for about 4 minutes or until softened. Add the balsamic vinegar and garlic; boil for about 8 minutes or until reduced to a syrup-like consistency. Add reserved beef broth, chicken broth, red wine, bay leaf and salt and pepper to your taste; bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add beef and accumulated juices, turning beef to coat in sauce.
	 4. Cover and cook in preheated 325ºF oven, stirring occasionally, for about 2 hours or until meat is fork-tender.
	5. Use a slotted spoon to transfer beef to a bowl; cover with foil and keep warm. Strain the cooking liquid, discarding solids and return to pot. Boil over medium heat for about 8 minutes or until slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
	 6. Preheat broiler. Shred the meat using 2 forks. Return the beef to the sauce and keep warm. Toast the bread slices and place on a baking sheet; top with the beef and sauce mixture and sprinkle with Cheddar cheese. Broil until cheese is melted.
Recipe Tips:
  - If you want to thicken the sauce, while sauce is boiling in Step 5, gradually stir in 1½ tsp (7 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) of cold water. Boil, stirring, until thickened.
---
Recipe ID: d11b40ed-1b9a-452c-86fd-4eb23994ec02
Recipe Title: Bahraini-Style Beef Mafrook with Labneh Badinjan  
Recipe Summary: Beef Mafrook and Labneh Badinjan are traditional home comfort food recipes that are a staple of Khaleej culture and heritage. However, the recipes here are slightly modified to give respect to and appreciate Canadian bounty. The combination of these two dishes together creates a delicious and exquisite flavour profile when indulged. This recipe was adapted from Chef Suman Ali’s original to cook at home.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 47
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Medium eggplant
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) finely chopped red onion
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) ground coriander
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) Bahraini Baharat spice (see Tip)
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) cumin seeds
	- ½ lb (250 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) tomato purée
	- Salt
	- 1 cup (250 mL) labneh
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) ground Aleppo pepper
	- Fresh lemon juice
	- Garnish
		- Pomegranate molasses, chili oil, fresh mint leaves, Aleppo pepper and dried Persian berries (Barberries) and/or pomegranate seeds
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 Medium eggplant
	- 1 red onion
	- 1 lemon
	- ½ lb (250 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- Olive oil
	- Tomato purée
	- Bay leaf
	- Ground coriander
	- Bahraini Baharat spice (see Tip)
	- Cumin seeds
	- Ground Aleppo pepper
	- Salt
	- Labneh
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pierce eggplant all over with a fork. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium heat (350°F/180°C) or on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet under broiler, turning frequently, for about 30 minutes until skin is charred and inside is very soft. Place in a bowl, cover and let steam for 15 minutes, or until cool enough to handle. Scoop eggplant flesh from skin; discard skin and stem. Measure ½ cup (125 mL) eggplant, reserving remaining for another use. Set aside.
	2. Heat oil over medium heat in a nonstick skillet. Cook onion and garlic, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add bay leaf, coriander, Bahraini Baharat spice and cumin seeds; cook, stirring, for 1 minute, until fragrant. Add beef; cook, stirring and using back of spoon to break up meat into small chunks, for 3 minutes. Stir in tomato paste; cover and simmer for 8 minutes or until beef is thoroughly cooked. Season with salt to taste.
	3. Meanwhile, combine eggplant, labneh, Aleppo pepper, 1 tsp (5 mL) salt and lemon juice to taste; whisk vigorously until smooth and fluffy. Set aside.
	4. Remove beef from heat; discard bay leaf. Spread whipped labneh mixture onto serving plates and spoon beef in the centre. Garnish with pomegranate molasses, chili oil, fresh mint, Aleppo pepper, Persian berries and/or pomegranate seeds as desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Bahraini Baharat spice is a peppery, strongly flavoured spice blend used in Middle Eastern and North African cuisine. Find it at Middle Eastern grocery stores, specialty spice shops or online.
---
Recipe ID: d1508ef1-8028-4bdf-97e0-b0fcc5008581
Recipe Title: Chili-Cocoa Crusted Barbecued Steak
Recipe Summary: The rich, beefy flavour is the perfect companion for this bold chili-cocoa spice blend. Marinating overnight allows the flavours to permeate the steak, as well as tenderize the meat. Cooking no more than medium-rare and thinly slicing across the grain, will result in beautifully tender steak. Double, or even triple, the spice blend to have on hand for quick and easy preparation. Store at room temperature, in an airtight and labeled container, for up to six months. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 498
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) unsweetened cocoa powder
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt 
	- ¾ tsp (3 mL) EACH chili powder, ground cumin and dried thyme
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH chipotle powder, garlic powder, onion powder and pepper 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 Beef Inside Skirt Marinating Steak (about 1 lb/500g)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Brown sugar
	- Unsweetened cocoa powder
	- Salt and Pepper
	- Chili powder
	- Ground cumin
	- Dried thyme
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1  Beef Inside Skirt Marinating Steak  (about 1 lb/500g)
	- Chipotle powder
	- Garlic powder
	- Onion powder
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine brown sugar, cocoa powder, salt, chili powder, cumin, thyme, chipotle powder, garlic powder, onion powder and black pepper in a small bowl.
	 2. Pierce steak all over with fork. Sprinkle spice mixture all over steak. Drizzle oil over top and rub in spice mixture to coat steak evenly. Cover and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	 3. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice thinly across the grain. Serve warm. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Indoor method: Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil in a cast iron or heavy-bottom skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook steak for 6 to 8 minutes, turning at least twice, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least.
---
Recipe ID: d1dd1da4-2f72-46ce-ae1f-ab05a5622037
Recipe Title: Grilled Coulis-Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: Jam moves from breakfast to dinner in this flavourful triple-duty marinade, basting and dipping sauce for your steak barbecue. Peach or apricot jam would be good substitutes for the marmalade and, if you use chutney, you can add fragrant spices and a touch of heat to the mix. To maximize tenderness, cook to medium-rare or medium doneness at most and carve into thin slices to serve.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 495
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) steak sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) orange marmalade (or jam or chutney)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fruit juice
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Medallions, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about four 6-oz/175 g steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Steak sauce
	- Orange marmalade (or jam or chutney)
	- Fruit juice
	- Dijon mustard
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 green onions
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Medallions, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about four 6-oz/175 g steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine steak sauce, orange marmalade, fruit juice, mustard, garlic and green onions in large sealable freezer bag. Transfer ¼ cup (60 mL) to a small bowl for basting and ¼ cup (60 mL) to another bowl for dipping sauce; cover and refrigerate both bowls. Pierce steaks all over with a fork. Add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C), brushing with reserved basting sauce, for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾-inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
	3. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 5 minutes. Cut into thin slices and serve with reserved dipping sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: d3462bf1-a08b-45c4-8415-1bf8bb739111
Recipe Title: Island-Inspired Grilled Beef
Recipe Summary: The strong brewed coffee adds a deep flavour to this tropical island-inspired marinade. You can substitute espresso for the coffee if you wish.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 498
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Grilling Short Ribs (thin-cut Maui/Korean-style)  
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH Worcestershire sauce and strong brewed coffee
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) pineapple juice or balsamic vinegar
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH soy sauce and vegetable oil
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced gingerroot
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Sliced green onions (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Grilling Short Ribs (thin-cut Maui/Korean-style)    
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Strong brewed coffee
	- Pineapple juice or balsamic vinegar
	- Soy sauce
	- Vegetable oil
	- Gingerroot
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Sliced green onions (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine Worcestershire sauce, brewed coffee, pineapple juice, soy sauce, vegetable oil, gingerroot, garlic and pepper to your taste in a large sealable freezer bag. Pierce short ribs all over with a fork. Add ribs to bag, massaging to coat; seal and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or up to 24 hours. 2. Discard marinade from ribs. Pat ribs dry with paper towel. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning twice or more or until cooked to medium-rare doneness (145°F/63°C) at the most. Garnish with sliced green onions, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - The advantage of marinating in a sealable freezer bag is that you can mix the marinade ingredients right in the bag, and that since the meat is immersed in the marinade, there is no need to turn the meat while marinating. And since the clean-up is easy, using the freezer bag for marinating is great for cooking while camping.

Recipe ID: d3923835-a8c9-4842-867e-f34774b3fd7f
Recipe Title: Oven-Braised Korean-Style Beef
Recipe Summary: Serve beef with steamed rice. Leftovers can be cut into chunks and stir-fried with vegetables and leftover sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 120
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Bone-in Short Ribs, 2 inches (5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sesame oil
	- 1 whole head of garlic, separated into cloves and peeled
	- ½ cup (125 mL) Korean or Japanese soy sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) chopped gingerroot
	- ½ cup (125 mL) coarsely chopped green onions
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) rice vinegar or cider vinegar
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Bone-in Short Ribs, 2 inches (5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Sesame oil
	- 1 whole head of garlic
	- Korean or Japanese soy sauce
	- Brown sugar
	- Gingerroot
	- Green onions
	- Rice vinegar or cider vinegar
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat short ribs dry with paper towel. Season with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or large heavy pot; brown short ribs, in batches as necessary, until browned all over. Transfer to a bowl.
	 2. Add garlic, soy sauce, brown sugar, gingerroot, green onions, vinegar and 2 cups (500 mL) water to pot; bring to a boil. Return ribs and accumulated juices to pot.
	3. Cover and braise in preheated 325°F oven for about 1½ to 2 hours or until beef is fork-tender.
	  4. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Skim fat from surface of sauce and discard. Cut ribs into 6 portions and serve with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - If a thicker sauce is desired, remove meat from sauce and keep warm. Set pot of sauce over medium-high heat. Combine 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch with 2 tbsp (30 mL) cold water in a small bowl. Gradually whisk in a about half of cornstarch mixture into sauce and boiling, stirring, for about 2 minutes until sauce thickens, adding more cornstarch mixture for thicker results.

Recipe ID: d3c8c1e6-27c6-4aad-b371-00bb415acfce
Recipe Title: Double Decker Italian Sloppy Joes
Recipe Summary: Who doesn’t love Sloppy Joes? So easy to make for nourishing weeknight dinners with pantry staples and lean ground beef. This version is just a bit more special, served atop slices of warm Furlani Garlic Texas Toast. For more simple meal ideas with Canadian lean ground beef check out the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 slices Furlani® Garlic Texas Toast (half a 638g pkg)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Canadian Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion, finely chopped
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 2 cups (500 mL) marinara sauce
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded mozzarella cheese
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped fresh basil (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 8 slices  Furlani® Garlic Texas Toast  (half a 638g pkg)
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Canadian Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Marinara sauce
	- Shredded mozzarella cheese
	- Chopped fresh basil (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook beef over medium-high heat in a large, deep skillet, stirring often and using back of spoon to break up meat into small chunks, for 8 to 10 minutes. Drain any excess fat. Return to heat and add onion, garlic, salt and pepper; cook, stirring, for 5 minutes until onion is translucent. Add marinara sauce; reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes, until bubbling. 
	2. Meanwhile, bake Furlani Garlic Texas Toast slices according to package directions.
	 3. To serve, place one piece of garlic toast on each of 4 serving plates. Top with a large, heaping spoonful of the beef mixture; sprinkle with shredded cheese. Place a second slice of garlic toast on top, layering once again with the beef mixture and shredded cheese. Sprinkle with chopped basil, if desired. Crave more? The Canadian Beef Information Gateway has nutrition and how-to-cook information, and more for over 70 beef cuts. 
Recipe Tips: ???
