Recipe ID: d456d665-cbb9-4141-9979-ee82fb734e55
Recipe Title: XO Beef Gyozas and Sautéed Snow Peas Leaves with Creamy Sesame Dressing 
Recipe Summary: Growing up in a Chinese-Canadian household, making dumplings with my mom is a cherished tradition that connected me to my roots and created lasting family memories. Mixing simple ingredients you likely have on hand, amplifying flavours with different staple sauces, folding and shaping each dumpling is a pocket of love. Using local Canadian ingredients to make a traditional Chinese dish is not limited to dumplings but it extends to our entire family’s way of life. This recipe was adapted from Chef Fung’s original to cook at home.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Creamy Sesame Dressing
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) white sesame seeds
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) mayonnaise
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) liquid honey
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH soy sauce and roasted sesame oil
		- 1 to 2 tsp (5 to 10 mL) rice vinegar
	- Gyozas
		- ¼ lb (125 g) Medium Ground Beef
		- ½ cup (125 mL) shredded napa cabbage
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) finely diced carrot
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) minced gingerroot
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) chicken or beef bouillon powder
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) MSG seasoning
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH xo sauce, sesame oil and vegetable oil
		- Salt and pepper
		- 12 gyoza wrappers
	- To Fry the Gyozas
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp (30 mL) cold water
	- Snow Pea Leaves
		- 1 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
		- 2 cloves garlic, minced
		- 4 oz (125 g) snow pea leaves
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) chicken bouillon powder
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
	- Garnish
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) microgreens
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) crispy garlic
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sliced green onions (scallions)
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) nori flakes
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Napa cabbage
	- 1 carrot
	- Gingerroot
	- Garlic
	- 4 oz (125 g) snow pea leaves
	- Microgreens
	- Green onions (scallions)
	- ¼ lb (125 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- Vegetable oil
	- Mayonnaise
	- Soy sauce
	- Roasted sesame oil
	- Rice vinegar
	- Xo sauce
	- Sesame oil
	- Cornstarch
	- Chicken bouillon powder
	- Beef bouillon powder (optional)
	- MSG seasoning
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- White sesame seeds
	- Liquid honey
	- 12 gyoza wrappers
	- Crispy garlic
	- Nori flakes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Creamy Sesame Dressing: Whisk sesame seeds, mayonnaise, honey, soy sauce, sesame oil and vinegar to taste. Set aside.
	2. Gyozas: Combine ground beef, shredded cabbage, carrots, gingerroot, cornstarch, bouillon, MSG, XO sauce, sesame oil and vegetable oil. Season with salt and pepper to your taste. Mix well. Drizzle in ¼ cup (60 mL) water and mix to combine. This will make your beef more tender. Set aside.
	3. Place a gyoza wrapper in your hand or a clean surface. Spoon a small amount of the dumpling mix (about ½ oz/16 g) onto the center of the gyoza wrapper. Moisten the edges of the wrapper with water. Fold the wrapper in half to form a half-moon shape and seal. Set the gyoza on a flat surface or in your hand. Dab a little bit of water, twist, and pinch in the middle. Alternatively, you can design it however you would like! Repeat to make 12 dumplings. Set aside.
	4. To Fry the Gyozas: Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil and swirl to coat. Immediately add the dumplings with the bottoms down to the oil. Drizzle the cornstarch slurry evenly into the pan. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for 5 minutes or until gyoza skins are translucent. There should be still some water or liquid left in the bottom of the pan.
	5. Remove the lid and increase heat to a medium-high. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes until bottoms are crispy and can be easily lifted from pan and liquid is evaporated. Transfer to a plate and keep warm.
	6. Snow Pea Leaves: Heat another nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until slightly smoky. Add vegetable oil. Add garlic and stir-fry for a few seconds. Add snow pea leaves, bouillon and 3 tbsp (45 mL) water. Cover and cook for 30 seconds. Remove the lid and stir in the cornstarch mixture. Cook, stirring, for about 1 minute or until leaves are glossy.
	7. To serve: Place Snow Pea Leaves on serving plates; top with Gyozas arranging with crispy bottoms up. Garnish with microgreens, crispy garlic, green onions and nori flakes. Drizzle the Creamy Sesame Dressing over top or serve in separate bowls as a dip.
Recipe Tips:
  - It is very important to use a good nonstick pan to fry the gyoza in order to get a crispy bottom without them sticking and tearing in the pan.
---
Recipe ID: d51c6087-5f58-4305-bdba-b2dcd7793643
Recipe Title: Beef and Yellow Split Pea Stew (Khoresh Gheymeh)
Recipe Summary: Stews play a huge part in Iranian cuisine. Even though there are many different Iranian stews, a few of them are more popular among Iranians and they are pretty well-known around the world. Khoresh Gheymeh definitely stands on top three of the popular Iranian stews. In Farsi, Khoresh means stew. Gheymeh consists of beef, yellow split peas, Persian dried lime, onion and tomato paste. It’s one of the most popular dishes in every household and it takes around 3 to 4 hours to cook. In our family Gheymeh was more of a weekend lunch dish. My mom used to start making it around 8 or 9 o’clock in the morning and I would wake up to a great smell of rich tomato sauce and Limoo Amani. Limo Amani or Persian dried lime is a specific lime that has been dehydrated, usually after having spent a majority of its drying time in the sun. It’s very aromatic and tastes sour and citrusy with an earthy, somewhat smoky, taste and is a staple to Iranian cuisine. Gheymeh is always served with saffron rice. The most common sides that can be served with any stews are Shirazi salad and Torshi (pickled vegetables).
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 210
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 220
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) canola or sunflower oil, divided
	- 1 cup (250 mL) yellow split peas
	- 1 large onion, finely diced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground turmeric and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- Boiling water
	- 1 cinnamon stick
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) saffron threads
	- Ice cubes
	- 5 Persian dried limes
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 large onion
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Stew Cubes
	- Sunflower or canola oil
	- Ground turmeric
	- Pepper
	- Tomato paste
	- Cinnamon stick
	- Saffron threads
	- Salt
	- Yellow split peas
	- 5 Persian dried limes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat 1 tsp (5 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven or enameled cast-iron roaster. Add split peas and cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes (this helps them hold their shape in the stew). Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
	2. Add remaining oil to the pot. Cook onion, stirring, for about 5 minutes until soft and golden brown. Add beef and cook, stirring, until beef is browned all over. Add turmeric, pepper and tomato paste; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
	3. Pour in enough boiling water to cover the meat, then add the cinnamon stick. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1½ hours.
	4. Meanwhile, grind the saffron using a mortar and pestle, then add 2 ice cubes. Set it aside and let ice melt for saffron to bloom slowly. Poke holes in dried limes with a fork.
	5. Stir saffron water, dried limes, split peas and salt into the stew. Add more boiling water, if necessary, to cover beef. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally for 1½ to 2 hours or until meat is
	fork-tender and split peas are softened.
Recipe Tips:
  - Letting the saffron bloom in melting ice prevents the saffron flavor from being shocked and allows time to release all of the flavor and color. If you’re short on time, you can add 2 tbsp (30 mL) boiling water to the ground saffron instead.
---
Recipe ID: d55d1989-d360-4355-b410-02aa75050878
Recipe Title: Sirloin Kabobs with Garlic Toast
Recipe Summary: Tender cubes of Canadian Beef Top Sirloin Steak, marinated in Middle Eastern spices and served with Furlani® Garlic Texas Toast will be sure to get the whole family to the table pronto.. Inspired by Lebanese-style beef kabobs these skewers are perfect under the broiler or on the grill, making this dish a must-have all year round! Get to know Top Sirloin Steak on the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 275
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground cumin, ground coriander, sweet paprika and salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 1 red onion, thinly sliced
	- Juice of 1 lemon
	- ½ cup (125 mL) dry red wine 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Canadian Beef Top Sirloin Steak, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes 
	- 4 long bamboo or metal skewers
	- 1 red onion, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- 1 EACH sweet yellow and red pepper, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- 8 slices Furlani® Garlic Texas Toast (half a 638g pkg)
	- Hummus and tabouleh (store-bought or homemade)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Ground cumin
	- Ground coriander
	- Sweet paprika
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Salt and Fresh ground pepper
	- 1 lemon
	- Dry red wine
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Canadian Beef Top Sirloin Steak,  cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes 
	- 4 long bamboo or metal skewers
	- 2 red onion
	- Sweet yellow and red pepper
	- Garlic Toast
	- Hummus
	- Tabouleh
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine garlic, cumin, coriander, paprika, salt, hot pepper flakes, and ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper in a large bowl. Add beef and toss together until evenly coated. Sprinkle thinly sliced red onion over the top, then pour in lemon juice, wine and oil. Stir well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or, preferably, overnight.
	2. Meanwhile, if using bamboo or wooden skewers, soak skewers in water for at least 1 hour. 
	 3. Remove beef from marinade; discard marinade. Thread the beef, red onion pieces and yellow and red peppers on skewers, alternating with the meat nestled in between the vegetables. Season with more pepper to taste. 
	 4. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides, until cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	 5. Meanwhile, prepare Furlani Garlic Texas Toast according to package directions. 
	 6. Serve kabobs with Furlani Garlic Texas Toast and your favourite Middle Eastern-inspired sides, such as hummus and tabouleh. 
Recipe Tips:
  - To broil kabobs instead of grilling, arrange kabobs on a rimmed baking sheet, spacing them apart. Broil for 8 to 10 minutes, turning once, or until cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Cover loosely with foil and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes. To get more beefy recipes with how-to videos and more go to the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
---
Recipe ID: d58193cd-0366-4c9a-b87a-beea68ffe9af
Recipe Title: Next Day Roast Beef Salad
Recipe Summary: Sometimes the best thing about roast beef is the meal that you can make the day after! This salad uses ingredients more in-step with winter cooking, so it is a nice way to use leftover Sunday-night roast during the week in the colder weather. See ‘Tip’ below for how to cook a 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) walnut halves, broken
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) white wine vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) prepared horseradish
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) vegetable oil
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 12 oz (375 g) leftover roast beef, such as Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast (see Tip, below), slivered (about 2 cups/500 mL)
	- 6 cups (1.5 L) baby greens, such as baby kale mix
	- ½ small red onion, thinly sliced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) crumbled feta cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Walnut
	- White wine vinegar
	- Horseradish
	- Vegetable oil
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 12 oz (375 g) leftover roast beef, such as Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast (see Tip, below), slivered (about 2 cups/500 mL)
	- Baby greens, such as baby kale mix
	- Red onion
	- Crumbled feta cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Toast walnuts over medium heat in a small dry skillet, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes or until browned and fragrant. Immediately transfer to a heatproof bowl and let cool.
	 2. Whisk together vinegar, horseradish, oil, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add cooked beef, greens, onion, cheese and toasted walnuts; toss to coat with dressing. Serve immediately
Recipe Tips:
  - To make roast beef, rub a 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Strip Loin Oven Roast all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Place, fat side up, on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F. Cook for about 1¾ to 2 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. To serve hot, carve across the grain into thin slices or let cool, wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 days to serve cold.
---
Recipe ID: d5fcb464-f6ce-4c02-aa97-83c1081d2cb3
Recipe Title: Braised Beef Honeycomb Tripe and Oxtail in Peanut Sauce
Recipe Summary: This is a mildly flavoured dish from the Philippines, generally served for special occasions. The condiment of choice is bagoong alamang, a salty, sweet-and-sour shrimp paste-based sauce. Serve it with rice, lime wedges and a chili sauce such as Sriracha to spice it up. The annatto seeds lend colour and a mild flavour to the dish, they can be omitted if you prefer.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 210
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 230
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Honeycomb Tripe 
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Oxtail , cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- Salt
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) finely diced onions (about 2)
	- 8 cloves garlic, minced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) annatto seeds
	- 1 cup (250 mL) boiling water
	- ½ cup (125 mL) glutinous rice flour
	- 1 cup (250 mL) smooth natural peanut butter
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fish sauce
	- 1 large Chinese eggplant, about 8 oz (250 g), cut crosswise into ¼-inch (5 mm) thick slices
	- 6 oz (170 g) long beans or green beans, trimmed and cut into 2-inch (5 cm) lengths
	- 8 oz (250 g) small-sized Chinese greens such as bok choy, choi sum or gai lan, trimmed
	- Hot cooked rice
	- Chopped peanuts (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Honeycomb Tripe 
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Oxtail , cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- Salt
	- Onions (about 2)
	- 8 cloves garlic
	- Annatto seeds
	- Glutinous rice flour
	- Smooth natural peanut butter
	- Fish sauce
	- 1 large Chinese eggplant
	- Long beans or green beans
	- Chinese greens such as bok choy, choi sum or gai lan
	- Hot cooked rice
	- Chopped peanuts (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place the tripe and oxtails into a large pot. Add enough cold water to cover and add 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Boil for 10 minutes. Drain into a colander in the sink. Rinse the tripe and oxtails under cold water, removing any scum. 
	2. Cut the tripe into pieces 1 inch (2.5 cm) wide and 2 inches (5 cm) long. Return to the pot with the oxtail. Add 4 quarts (4 L) fresh water, onion, garlic and 1 tsp (5 mL) salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 2½ hours, and adding more water as necessary to make sure water covers ingredients, until the meat is almost tender and the liquid is reduced to about 1 inch (2.5 cm) above the meat.
	3. Meanwhile, heat a small heavy skillet over low heat. Add glutinous rice flour and toast, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes or until a shade beyond golden brown. Transfer to a bowl and let cool.
	 4. Place the annatto seeds in a small heatproof bowl. Pour in boiling water and set aside. 
	5. Bring another large pot of water to a boil over high heat. One vegetable at a time, cook the green beans, Chinese greens, then the eggplant in the boiling water for about 2 minutes per batch, until barely tender, removing them with a skimmer and rinsing under cold water to cool. Drain well and reserve. 
	 6. When the meat is almost tender, place the peanut butter in a blender and add 3 cups (750 mL) of the cooking liquid. Blend until smooth using safety precautions for blending hot liquids. Add the toasted rice powder and blend again. Stir the mixture into the pot. 
	7. Without cleaning the blender, add the annatto seeds and their soaking liquid to the blender. Blend until the seeds are broken down into small granules. Drain through a sieve directly into the pot; discard solids. 
	8. Simmer, uncovered and stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes or until stew is lightly thickened and meat is tender. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and fish sauce. Add the vegetables and heat through. Serve immediately over rice; garnish with peanuts, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Tripe should be rinsed or blanched before proceeding to cook. Shallow slashes on the smoother side of the tripe will help reduce curling during cooking.
---
Recipe ID: d6af428d-0c36-4edc-978f-e001d81b4040
Recipe Title: Oven-Baked Ground Beef Gratin
Recipe Summary: A cheesy skillet-bake that’s reminiscent of a shepherd’s pie. Use Yukon Gold potatoes and orange Cheddar for the ultimate golden topping.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 75
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Buttermilk Mashed Potatoes
	- 1½ lb (750 g) potatoes, peeled and cubed
	- Salt
	- ½ cup (125 mL) buttermilk
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) butter
	- Beef
	- 1 onion, chopped
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) dried thyme
	- Pepper
	- ¼ cup (50 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 2 cups (500 mL) frozen mixed vegetables
	- 1 cup (250 mL) sodium-reduced beef broth
	- 1 cup (250 mL) shredded aged Cheddar cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Potatoes
	- Salt
	- Buttermilk
	- Butter
	- Beef
	- 1 onion
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- Dried thyme
	- Pepper
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Tomato paste
	- All-purpose flour
	- Frozen mixed vegetables
	- Sodium-reduced beef broth
	- Shredded aged Cheddar cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Buttermilk Mashed Potatoes: Cover potatoes with cold salted water in a large pot. Bring to boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat and simmer for about 25 minutes or until tender.
	 2. Beef: Meanwhile, cook onion, beef, thyme and pepper, to your taste, over medium-high heat in a 12-inch (30 cm) ovenproof skillet, breaking up meat with wooden spoon, for about 10 minutes or until beef is browned and onion is softened. Drain. Reduce heat to medium; stir in Worcestershire sauce, tomato paste and flour. Stir in vegetables and broth; simmer, stirring, until slightly thickened, about 3 minutes.
	3. Drain potatoes and return to pot over medium heat; heat until dry, about 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/2 cup (125 mL) buttermilk and 1/4 cup (50 mL) butter; mash until smooth.
	 4. Gradually stir half of the cheese into potatoes; spread evenly over beef mixture. Top with remaining cheese; bake in preheated 425°F oven for about 25 minutes until lightly golden. Broil for about 3 minutes until topping is rich golden-brown. 
Recipe Tips:
  - If you don’t have an ovenproof skillet, at the end of step 2, transfer the beef mixture to a gratin dish and proceed with the recipe.
---
Recipe ID: d6dc58c4-0d1f-488e-8328-0d0a3fd8e554
Recipe Title: Steak and Sweet Potato Fries with Chipotle Mayo
Recipe Summary: Simple yet satisfying, this restaurant-worthy meal is easy to prepare and ready in less than an hour. Wing Steaks, also known as Bone-in Strip Loin Grilling Steaks, are juicy and delicious in part because of the attached bone. If Wing Steaks are challenging to find, ask the butcher to special order, or substitute with traditional boneless Strip Loin Steaks. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) large sweet potatoes (unpeeled), scrubbed (about 2) 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) Montreal-style steak spice
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Wing Steaks, ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 2)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) mayonnaise
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped canned chipotle in adobo sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Large sweet potatoes
	- Olive oil
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Montreal-style steak spice
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Wing Steaks, ½ inch (1 cm) thick (about 2)
	- Mayonnaise
	- Chopped canned chipotle in adobo sauce
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut potato lengthwise into ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices. Place slices cut-side down and cut lengthwise into thin sticks, about ½ inch (1 cm) thick. Toss with oil, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Arrange in a single layer on two parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheets. Roast in preheated 425°F oven, rotating the pans from top to bottom once, for 25 to 30 minutes or until tender and golden around the edges.
	2. Meanwhile, pat steaks dry with paper towel and season all over with steak spice. 
	3. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	 4. Whisk mayonnaise with chipotle in a small bowl until blended. 
	5. Carve steaks off the bone and cut into thin slices across the grain. Serve sliced steak on a platter along with the bones, sweet potato fries and chipotle mayo. 
Recipe Tips:
  - As a short-cut, use frozen sweet potato fries and ready-made chipotle or sriracha mayo, baking fries according to package directions.
---
Recipe ID: d6df5c6f-cd96-44fc-bf7d-57a72fc0166d
Recipe Title: Classic Simmered Swiss Steak
Recipe Summary: The rich beefy flavour of Blade Steak combines with zippy steak sauce to create this slow-simmer comfort food classic recipe.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 90
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 105
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak (or 1 lb 14 oz/900 g Bone-in), ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 medium Spanish onion, sliced
	- 1 EACH small sweet red and green pepper, cut into thin strips
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH red wine and tomato juice
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) steak sauce
	- 1 lb (500 g) baby new potatoes, halved, or regular red potatoes, cut into 2-inch (5 cm) chunks
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak (or 1 lb 14 oz/900 g Bone-in), ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 medium Spanish onion
	- Small sweet red and green pepper
	- Red wine
	- Tomato juice
	- Steak sauce
	- Baby new potatoes or regular red potatoes
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steak dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large deep ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Brown steak on both sides; transfer to a plate and set aside. 
	2. Preheat oven to 325°F. Add onion and red and green peppers to pan; cook, stirring, for 4 to 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in wine and tomato juice, scraping up bits stuck to pan. Stir in steak sauce and bring to boil; add potatoes and return steak and accumulated juices to pan.
	3. Cover and cook in 325°F oven for 1¼ hours, or until beef and potatoes are fork-tender.
Recipe Tips:
  - Simmering steaks are great for entertaining since they can be made a day ahead. Flavours meld together as the dish sits, so it tastes even better the next day. Gently re-heat in the oven, microwave or slow cooker to serve.
---
Recipe ID: d7067ed1-d758-4062-b0b6-441b535fcfe3
Recipe Title: Smarter Grilled Beef Burgers 
Recipe Summary: WOW – finally a great-tasting lean burger! Chopped mushrooms and evaporated milk are added for extra juiciness, and Worcestershire sauce is a super-simple seasoning. Use a moderate heat for grilling to avoid scorching.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 egg, lightly beaten
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH finely chopped onion and mushrooms
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) evaporated milk
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce 
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- Pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef
	- ½ cup (125 mL) dry bread crumbs
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 egg
	- Mushrooms
	- Onion
	- Evaporated milk
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Pepper
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef
	- Dry bread crumbs
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine egg, onion, mushrooms, milk, Worcestershire sauce, garlic and pepper, to your taste, in a bowl with a fork. Mix in beef and bread crumbs. Gently form into six 3/4-inch (2 cm) thick patties. Press a dimple into the centre of each patty. Place onto a lightly oiled parchment- or foil-lined rimmed baking sheet; cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or for up to 1 day.
	2. Grill patties in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 14 minutes, turning twice, until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each patty reads 160°F (71°C).
Recipe Tips:
  - Ground beef comes designated as Extra Lean, Lean, Medium or Regular, based on the maximum fat content. This designation is the same for all ground meats: beef, turkey, veal, chicken, pork and lamb.
---
Recipe ID: d81b8f2b-77ec-4820-a56c-653e849aef09
Recipe Title: Maple-Glazed Sweet Potatoes and Brussels Sprouts
Recipe Summary: Classic autumn vegetables get dressed up with maple syrup and a touch of vinegar and mustard for a cool-weather side dish that’s perfect with roast beef and pot roasts.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 75
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 95
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 sweet potatoes (about 2 lb/1 kg), peeled and cut into wedges
	- 2 cups (500 mL) Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil, divided
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH balsamic vinegar and maple syrup
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) grainy mustard
Recipe Shopping List: ???
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine sweet potatoes, Brussels sprouts and 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil in a foil-lined shallow roasting pan. Season with salt and pepper to taste and toss to coat. Spread out in a single layer.
	2. Roast in preheated 425°F oven for 1 hour, stirring twice.
	3. Meanwhile, whisk together the remaining oil, and the vinegar, maple syrup and mustard in a small bowl. Drizzle over vegetables; toss to coat and spread in a single layer. Return to oven and roast for 10 to 15 minutes longer or until vegetables are tender and glazed.
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: d8317e3b-93b0-429e-b7c6-7e910c9567c2
Recipe Title: Slow Cooker Cholent  
Recipe Summary: Warm your soul with a bowl of this comforting cholent. Packed with short ribs, potatoes, onions, chickpeas (also known as garbanzo beans), kasha, spices and herbs, it’s sure to hit the spot.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 390
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 420
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Cholent
		- 1 cup (250 mL) dried chickpeas (garbanzo beans)
		- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Simmering Short Ribs, cut into 2-inch (5 cm) cubes
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) salt (approx)
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh ground pepper (approx)
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sunflower oil
		- 2 lb (1 kg) baby potatoes, halved
		- 2 onions, diced
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) dry white wine
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) kasha 
		- 3 whole cloves garlic
		- 3 sprigs fresh thyme
		- 2 bay leaves
		- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH smoked sweet paprika and ground turmeric
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground cumin
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) cayenne pepper
		- 4 cups (1 L) high-quality unsalted beef stock or no-salt-added beef broth (approx)
	- Soft-cooked Eggs
		- 8 eggs
		- Ice water
	- Green Sauce
		- 1 small clove garlic, minced 
		- ½ cup (125 mL) sunflower oil
		- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped fresh parsley 
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH chopped fresh dill and chives
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice
		- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Garnish
		- 2 sprigs fresh dill sprigs, chopped
		- 1 bunch fresh chives, cut into ¾-inch (2 cm) pieces
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) baby potatoes
	- 2 onions
	- Garlic
	- Fresh thyme
	- Fresh parsley 
	- Fresh dill
	- Fresh chives
	- 1 lemon
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Simmering Short Ribs, cut into 2-inch (5 cm) cubes
	- Sunflower oil
	- 4 cups (1 L) high-quality unsalted beef stock or no-salt-added beef broth
	- Smoked sweet paprika
	- Ground turmeric
	- Ground cumin
	- Cayenne pepper
	- Bay leaves
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Kasha 
	- Dried chickpeas (garbanzo beans)
	- Eggs
	- Dry white wine
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cholent: Rinse chickpeas and place in a bowl. Add water to cover and let soak overnight. Drain well and set aside.
	2. Pat beef dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat oil over high heat in a skillet. Brown beef, in batches to &nbsp;avoid overcrowding the pan, turning, until browned all over. Transfer beef to a plate, reserving skillet.
	3. Place potatoes in a single layer on the bottom of a 4- to 6-qt (4 to 6 L) slow cooker and place beef on top. 
	4. Return skillet to medium-low heat. Stir in onion and salt to taste; cover and cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add white wine and bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up brown bits from pan; boil, stirring, until nearly evaporated. Layer onions over beef in slow cooker.
	5. Scatter chickpeas and kasha over onions. Place garlic, thyme sprigs and bay leaves on top, then sprinkle evenly with smoked&nbsp;paprika, turmeric, cumin and cayenne pepper. Pour in stock to cover.
	6. Cover and cook on HIGH for 6 hours, checking occasionally and add more stock if mixture looks dry, or until beef is fork-tender.
	7. Soft-cooked Eggs: Bring a saucepan of water to a boil over high heat. Add eggs (in the shell), reduce heat and boil gently for 6 minutes. Transfer eggs with a slotted spoon to an ice bath and let cool completely. Peel and refrigerate until serving.
	8. Green Sauce: Combine garlic, oil, parsley, dill, chives, lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste in a bowl. Set aside.
	9. Discard bay leaves and thyme stems. Scoop Cholent into the center of each serving bowl. Create an indent in the center and place an egg in the indent. Spoon Green Sauce around the outer edge of the cholent and sprinkle the egg with fresh dill and chives.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: d87f0804-819f-41e9-b1e5-0c9face33593
Recipe Title: Oven-Roasted Asian-Style Pepper Beef 
Recipe Summary: This dish has flavours similar to traditional barbecued pork. The beef is rubbed with a blend of seasonings and then basted with a sweet, tangy Asian inspired barbecue sauce while being slow roasted to medium-rare at the least. Serve sliced on a spicy noodle dish or in a sandwich.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 130
Recipe Marinating Time: 60
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 200
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH grated peeled gingerroot and fresh ground pepper
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Top Sirloin Oven Roast
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH soy sauce, ketchup and hoisin sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) rice vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) liquid honey
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast, about 3 inches (8 cm) thick by 10 inches (25 cm) long
	- Soy sauce
	- Ketchup
	- Hoisin sauce
	- Rice vinegar
	- Liquid honey
	- Pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine garlic, gingerroot and black pepper in a small bowl. Trim the meat, if necessary. Pierce beef all over with a fork. Place on a platter; rub the spices into the meat to coat all over. Set aside.&nbsp;
	2. Combine soy sauce, ketchup, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar and honey in a medium bowl to make a glaze. Measure out ¼ cup (60 mL) and brush all over beef. Refrigerate, uncovered, for 1 hour to marinate. Set remaining glaze aside to baste meat during cooking
	3. Place roast on rack in a foil-lined shallow pan. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 1 hour. Begin basting with the reserved glaze every 15 minutes, removing from oven after about 45 to 60 minutes, when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).&nbsp;
	4. Transfer to cutting board, cover loosely with foil and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes. Carve across the grain into thin slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can cook the roast ahead, let it cool, then refrigerate for up to 3 days then reheat and slice to use in a stir-fry or Asian-style soup.
---
Recipe ID: d95e9ca6-fbcc-4ad1-a15a-dc8a829fd98f
Recipe Title: Baked Greek Ground Beef Sliders in Pita
Recipe Summary: This quick assembly dinner or lunch, starts with uncooked meatballs that morph into sliders by simply flattening into slider patties. Top with a Greek-style salad or marinated veggies, and matching dressing or change up the type of bread, salad and dressing combo to your favourite cultural cuisine. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef Meatballs, about sixteen 1-inch (2.5 cm), uncooked
	- 4 pitas with pockets (about 6-inch/15 cm pitas)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) creamy Greek salad dressing
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Lean Ground Beef Meatballs, about sixteen 1-inch (2.5 cm), uncooked
	- 4 pitas with pockets
	- Creamy Greek salad dressing
Recipe Methods:
	1. Flatten each meatball into a 3/4-inch (2 cm) thick patty. Arrange patties on a rack set on parchment paper- or foil-lined rimmed baking sheet, spacing them apart.
	2. Bake in preheated 375ºF (190ºC) oven for 15 minutes until digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several patties reads 160°F (71°C). Wrap pitas in a foil packet and warm in oven for 5 minutes.
	3. Cut pitas in half to make pockets. Tuck slider patties into pita pockets and drizzle with dressing.
Recipe Tips:
  - The colour of cooked ground beef is not a reliable indicator of doneness. Use a digital instant-read thermometer as the most reliable way to determine that ground beef patties are cooked to the proper doneness.
---
Recipe ID: d9eaac67-9c35-46a6-a1aa-b96a1c47f6fd
Recipe Title: Skillet Beef Kidney with Bacon Balsamic Cream
Recipe Summary: Tangy and creamy, the sauce complements the lean meat of the kidney. This can be served on crostini as an appetizer and the recipe can be easily doubled to serve four people as a main course.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 85
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 100
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef Kidney (about 1 lb/500 g) 
	- Salt
	- 4 thick bacon slices, cut crosswise into ¼-inch (5 mm) pieces
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) minced shallots
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whipping cream
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1  Beef Kidney (about 1 lb/500 g) 
	- Salt
	- 4 thick bacon slices
	- Shallot
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Brown sugar
	- Whipping cream
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cut the beef kidney in half lengthwise. Trim out any fat and membranes. Combine 1 tbsp (15 mL) salt and 4 cups (1 L) water in a medium pot. Add the kidney and bring to a boil over high heat. Turn off the heat and let stand for 15 minutes. Drain and rinse under cool water, removing any scum. Clean out the pot and add 4 cups (1 L) fresh water. Return the kidney and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for about 1 hour or until the kidney is tender. Drain and rinse. (Make ahead: The kidneys can be prepared up to 1 day in advance. Cover and refrigerate.)
	2. Cut the kidney into ¼-inch (5 mm) slices. Cook bacon over medium heat in a heavy skillet for 4 to 5 minutes or until crisp. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Reserve 3 tbsp (45 mL) of the drippings in the pan; discard remaining. Cook shallots, stirring, for about 1 to 2 minutes or until they sizzle. Add the vinegar and boil for about 1 minute or until reduced by half. Stir in brown sugar and cream. Simmer for about 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in kidneys and cooked bacon; simmer for about 2 minutes or until heated through. Season with salt to taste. Serve immediately. 
Recipe Tips:
  - The initial cooking tenderizes the kidney and makes it milder in flavour.
---
Recipe ID: db228ebd-b6e0-4b80-8b1f-76ffa51b1fa2
Recipe Title: Barbecue-Roasted Orange-Miso Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: This thick steak gets cooked like a small roast, slowly roasted over indirect heat on the barbecue to develop gorgeous browning and flavour. The simple marinade is loaded with umami and richness with a splash of freshness from the orange juice. Serve with a simple coleslaw: toss bagged coleslaw with prepared Asian-style sesame salad dressing, cucumber, green onion, edamame and orange segments. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 75
Recipe Marinating Time: 240
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 330
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) finely grated orange zest
	- ½ cup (125 mL) orange juice 
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) miso paste
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) rice vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH maple syrup and soy sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH minced garlic and gingerroot
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced on a bias, divided
	- 1 Beef Frenched Rib Steak, 1-bone thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg) 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) cold unsalted butter, cut into cubes
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) toasted sesame seeds
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Orange
	- Miso paste
	- Rice vinegar
	- Maple syrup
	- Soy Sauce
	- Garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 2 green onions
	- 1  Beef Frenched Rib Steak, 1-bone thick (about 3 lb/1.5 kg) 
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Unsalted butter
	- Toasted sesame seeds
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine orange juice, miso, rice vinegar, maple syrup, soy sauce, garlic, gingerroot and half the green onion in small bowl. 
	2. Pierce steak all over with a fork. Transfer steak and half the orange-miso marinade to sealable freezer bag, massaging marinade into meat. Remove as much air as possible from the bag and cinch around the bone; secure with an elastic band. Place in a shallow dish and refrigerate for 4 to 12 hours. Cover and refrigerate remaining orange-miso marinade separately. 
	 3. Fill drip pan part way with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). 
	 4. Remove steak from marinade and pat dry with paper towel; discard marinade. Season steak all over with salt and pepper. 
	5. Place steak on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into centre of steak, avoiding fat or bone. Close lid and cook for about 60 to 75 minutes for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	6. Transfer steak to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	 7. Meanwhile, pour reserved orange-miso marinade into a small saucepan; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring often, for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened and reduced to a syrupy consistency. Reduce heat to low. Add butter cubes, one at a time, swirling pan and stirring often, allowing each piece to melt before adding the next. Place saucepan on and off the heat as needed to melt butter to creamy consistency without letting it boil, about 2 to 3 minutes. (If the heat is too high, sauce will separate.) Stir in orange zest.
	  8. Carve meat from the bone, then into thin slices. Arrange steak on a large platter with the bone. Drizzle with some of the sauce and sprinkle with remaining green onion and the sesame seeds. Serve remaining sauce on the side. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Add the leftover bone to enrich and flavour stocks, soups and stews. A Frenched Rib Steak a similar to a Tomahawk-style Steak that is cut 1-bone thick with an exposed bone. For the Frenched Rib Steak, the bone is cleaned or “Frenched” and about 4 inches (10 cm) long.
---
Recipe ID: db402ea6-4101-41f5-a5f8-0fe14353f281
Recipe Title: Korean-Style Noodle Bowl with Fast-Fry Steak Strips 
Recipe Summary: Skip takeout and prepare this deliciously sticky noodle dish at home. Serve family-style on a large platter or serve in individual bowls so everyone can dig right in! Rice noodles can be found in the international aisle or can be substituted with angel hair pasta. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 5
Recipe Marinating Time: 20
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ cup (125 mL) soy sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH Asian chili paste, such as Gochujang, and minced gingerroot
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Eye of Round Fast-fry Steaks, cut into ¼-inch (5 mm) wide strips
	- ½ lb (250 g) vermicelli rice noodles 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 cups (500 mL) shredded butter (Bibb or Boston) lettuce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sesame seeds
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- Lime wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Gingerroot
	- Garlic
	- Butter (Bibb or Boston) lettuce
	- Green onions
	- 1 lime 
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Eye of Round Fast-fry Steaks
	- Vegetable oil
	- Soy sauce
	- Asian chili paste, such as Gochujang
	- Brown sugar
	- Sesame seeds
	- ½ lb (250 g) vermicelli rice noodles
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, chili paste, gingerroot and garlic in a large shallow bowl. Add beef strips, tossing to coat; cover and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes.&nbsp;
	2. Meanwhile, cook or soak rice noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
	3. Heat oil over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet; cook beef strips with the marinade for 2 to 4 minutes, stirring often, until meat is cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF) and browned but still pink inside, and sauce is sticky but not dry. Remove from heat.
	4. Arrange noodles on a large, shallow platter. Top with shredded lettuce and saucy beef. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and green onions. Serve with lime wedges.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - Gochujang is the most authentic chili paste when preparing Korean dishes. It can be found in the international aisle of well-stocked grocers or at specialty Asian markets, but you can use sriracha or sambal oelek as a substitute. For a less spicy version, reduce chili paste to 2 tsp (10 mL) or omit completely.
