Recipe ID: db7a6d3b-b6f9-4fc6-a314-bf340bcc64fd
Recipe Title: Easy Oven Roast Beef with Root Vegetables and Gravy
Recipe Summary: Roast beef was traditionally served as Sunday night dinner in many households. Top Sirloin tends to be more moderately priced than Prime Rib and is lean, yet flavourful, with enough marbling for juicy tender roast beef. Use a meat thermometer to cook your roast to the doneness that you like the best – without overcooking it! NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 140
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable or olive oil
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dried thyme leaves, salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Roasted Root Vegetables
	- 2 lb (1 kg) yellow-flesh potatoes, cut into 2-inch (5 cm) chunks
	- 1 lb (500 g) carrots, cut into 2-inch (5 cm) chunks
	- 1 onion, chopped
	- 12 cloves garlic 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable or olive oil
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) salt
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	-  Pan Gravy
	- 3½ cups (875 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour 
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Top Sirloin Oven Roast 
	- Vegetable or olive oil
	- Dried thyme leaves
	- Roasted Root Vegetables
	- Yellow-flesh potatoes
	- Carrots
	- 1 onion
	- 12 cloves garlic 
	-  Pan Gravy
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- All-purpose flour
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Rub roast all over with oil, thyme, salt and pepper. Place roast. fat side up. on rack in shallow roasting pan; insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Set aside. 
	2. Roasted Root Vegetables: Toss potatoes, carrots, onion, garlic, oil, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Arrange in single layer on parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet. 
	 3. Oven-sear roast and vegetables, side by side in the bottom third of preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 1½ to 2 hours or until vegetables are tender and roast is medium-rare, removing roast from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). 
	 4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover vegetables and roast loosely with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. 
	5. Pan Gravy: Meanwhile, drain off fat from pan drippings and discard. Heat pan drippings in roasting pan over medium heat. Stir in broth and bring to a boil, scraping up any browned bits from pan. In a small bowl, whisk flour with ¼ cup (60 mL) cold water until smooth; gradually whisk into pan and bring to a boil. Cook, whisking often, for 7 to 10 minutes or until thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
	 6. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices. Serve with Roasted Root Vegetables and Pan Gravy.
Recipe Tips:
  - For roasted winter vegetable medley, substitute potatoes with a mix of parsnips, turnip or rutabaga.
---
Recipe ID: db9f3c84-db3c-4f23-b516-403f8189b20d
Recipe Title: Braised Barcelona-Style Beef Ragoût
Recipe Summary: The flavours of citrus, oregano, tomatoes, black olives and artichokes accent this hearty, flavourful stew. Serve with polenta, pasta, rice or garlic mashed potatoes. Garnish with minced parsley, or toasted bread crumbs.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 140
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Chuck Flap Tail, cut into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ½ cup (125 mL) all-purpose flour
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil, divided
	- 4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced
	- 1 EACH medium onion and sweet green pepper, diced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) beef broth (approx.)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH canned crushed tomatoes, canned diced tomatoes, and red wine
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 EACH orange and lemon
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH packed brown sugar and dried oregano
	- 1 bay leaf
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) pitted whole black olives
	- 6 canned artichoke hearts, cut into wedges
	- Chopped fresh parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Chuck Flap Tail, cut into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Olive oil
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Chopped fresh parsley
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Beef broth
	- 6 canned artichoke hearts
	- Canned crushed tomatoes
	- Canned diced tomatoes
	- Red wine
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 EACH orange and lemon
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH packed brown sugar and dried oregano
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) pitted whole black olives
	- 1 EACH medium onion and sweet green pepper, diced
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat beef dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Place in a large bowl; add flour and toss to coat. Shake off excess flour, reserving excess.
	 2. Heat half the oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef, in batches, for about 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a clean bowl. Add more oil to pot between batches, as necessary.
	 3. Add remaining oil to pot. Cook garlic, onion and green pepper, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until softened. Sprinkle in reserved flour; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually, stir in beef broth. Stir in crushed tomatoes, diced tomatoes, wine, orange zest and juice, lemon zest and juice, brown sugar, oregano and bay leaf. Bring to a boil, scraping up brown bits from bottom of pan. Season with salt and pepper to your taste. Stir in beef with accumulated juices.
	4. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for 1 hour. Stir in artichokes and olives; add more broth if stew is too thick. Cover and cook for 30 minutes longer or until beef is fork-tender. Skim fat from sauce and discard bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve sprinkled with parsley.
Recipe Tips:
  - Ensure beef cubes are all of similar size to ensure the cubes cook at the same rate.
---
Recipe ID: dc375a81-c1e2-4380-96c5-62a1e8e51329
Recipe Title: Ginger-Miso Meatball and Vegetable Soup with Barley
Recipe Summary: Gently poaching meatballs in a simmering broth has 2 benefits: it adds a meatier flavour to the broth and makes the most tender, juicy meatballs. Miso can be purchased in the refrigerated section in Asian grocery stores and keeps a long time in the fridge. Try using it as a rub for a steak as a for a flavour boost sometime. This recipe was adapted from Chef Buckett’s original and modified, as necessary, for home cooks.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Soup
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) canola oil
		- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH finely diced onion and celery
		- 5 cremini mushrooms, halved and sliced
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) minced fresh gingerroot
		- 1 clove garlic, minced
		- ½ red finger chili pepper, thinly sliced
		- 1 cup (250 mL) coarsely chopped kale
		- 2 cups (500 mL) beef broth 
		- ¾ cup (175 mL) cooked barley or brown rice
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) yellow miso
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lime juice
	- Meatballs
		- 8 oz (250 g) Lean Ground Beef
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced fresh gingerroot 
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground coriander and chili-garlic sauce
		- ⅛ tsp (0.5 mL) salt
	- Garnish
		- Fresh cilantro leaves
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) chili-garlic sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 onion
	- Celery
	- 5 cremini mushrooms
	- Fresh gingerroot
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Red finger chili pepper
	- Kale
	- 1 lime
	- Fresh cilantro leaves
	- 8 oz (250 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Canola oil
	- Beef broth 
	- Ground coriander
	- Chili-garlic sauce
	- Yellow miso
	- Barley or brown rice (cooked)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Soup: Heat oil over medium heat in a medium saucepan. Cook onion, celery, mushrooms, gingerroot, garlic and chili pepper, stirring occasionally, for about 4 minutes or until soft. Add kale; cook, stirring often, for 3 minutes, until wilted. Pour in broth and 1½ cups (375 mL) water; cover and bring to a simmer.
	2. Meatballs: Meanwhile, combine ground beef, gingerroot, coriander, chili-garlic sauce and salt; gently mix with a fork (careful not to over-mix). Scoop meat mixture by a heaping teaspoonful (5 mL) and roll into small meatballs; place on a plate.
	3. Gently add meatballs into the simmering soup; cover and return to a simmer. Simmer for about 5 minutes or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted into several meatballs reads 160°F (71°C). Add barley and reduce heat to medium-low.
	4. Whisk miso and lime juice into ½ cup (125 mL) water in a measuring cup or bowl. Pour into the soup, while stirring. Heat gently (do not let soup simmer or boil).
	5. Ladle soup into bowls and garnish with a few cilantro leaves and chili-garlic sauce, as desired.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: dc9228ba-6cba-4f63-b922-a4463b26f240
Recipe Title: Slow-Simmered Beef and Barley Soup
Recipe Summary: Comfort food doesn’t get any better than this! This classic has a lightened touch with the addition of dried thyme. This soup is a perfect balanced meal with whole grain, powerful protein and a variety of veggies.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 150
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil (approx)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Simmering Steaks, cut in ¾-inch (2 cm) cubes
	- 6 cups (1.5 L) finely diced vegetables (onions, carrots, celery, rutabaga and/or potatoes)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) pot or pearl barley
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH dried thyme, dillweed and pepper
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth
	- Chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Shoulder Cross Rib Simmering Steaks, cut in ¾-inch (2 cm) cubes
	- Vegetables (onions, carrots, celery, rutabaga and/or potatoes)
	- Pot or pearl barley
	- Dried thyme
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Dillweed
	- Pepper
	- Beef broth
	- Chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster until sizzling hot. Brown beef, in batches and adding more oil as needed, for 8 to 10 minutes, turning until browned on all sides. Return beef and accumulated juices to pot.
	2. Stir in vegetables, barley, thyme, dill, pepper and bay leaf. Add broth and bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up browned bits from pan. 
	 3. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for about 2 hours or until beef and barley are tender. Discard bay leaf. Serve sprinkled with parsley, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - For the best flavour, brown beef in batches small enough to allow space between each piece to help prevent steaming which enhances browning.
---
Recipe ID: de97c00c-3480-4899-b4f7-e829deabc7a4
Recipe Title: Easy Beef Lasagna
Recipe Summary: With fresh lasagna noodles, three cheeses and a simple beefy tomato sauce, this baked lasagna is comfort food at its best! You can substitute the fresh basil with a few tablespoons of basil pesto if you don’t have fresh on hand. Serve with a mixed green salad to complete dinner.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 85
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 105
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion, finely chopped
	- 3 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dried Italian herb seasoning
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 jar (680 mL) strained puréed tomatoes (passata)
	- 1 can (796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 1 cup (250 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed sliced fresh basil leaves
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 1 pkg (350 g) fresh lasagna sheets (8 sheets)
	- 1 lb (500 g) shredded mozzarella 
	- 1 tub (500 g) ricotta, drained
	- 1 cup (250 mL) grated Parmesan cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 onion
	- 3 cloves garlic
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Strained puréed tomatoes
	- Diced tomatoes
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Fresh basil leaves
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Lasagna sheets (8 sheets)
	- 1 lb (500 g) shredded mozzarella 
	- 1 tub (500 g) ricotta, drained
	- 1 cup (250 mL) grated Parmesan cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large deep nonstick skillet. Cook beef, onion, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper, stirring often and using back of spoon to break up meat into small chunks, for 8 to 10 minutes or until beef is browned. Stir in passata, diced tomatoes and broth; bring to a boil. 
	2. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes until sauce has thickened. Stir in basil and vinegar; remove from heat. 
	3. The lasagna will have four layers of noodles: spread 1 cup (250 mL) sauce over the bottom of a 13 x 9-inch (3 L) baking dish. Top with 2 lasagna sheets, 1/4 of the remaining sauce, 1 cup (250 mL) mozzarella, 1/3 of the ricotta and ¼ cup (60 mL) Parmesan. Repeat layers twice. Top with remaining noodles, sauce, mozzarella and Parmesan. Cover with foil. 
	 4. Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 45 minutes. Remove foil cover and bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting to serve.
	Make ahead: Assemble lasagna in a foil pan, cover and freeze for up to 3 months. Bake from frozen in preheated 350°F oven for 2 hours. Remove foil cover and bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting to serve. Look for fresh lasagna noodles in the refrigerated section of the deli or the dairy section near the brick cheeses.  Substitute fresh noodles with 11 oven-ready dry lasagna noodles and make 3 layers of noodles, instead of 4 layers. The lasagna will be slightly saucier than the original version, which is great for reheating leftovers.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: dfbb1648-4b6f-49aa-bcbc-2c4fdde532d1
Recipe Title: Tuscan Braised Beef with Farro Pilaf
Recipe Summary: Slow cooking makes for delicious deep flavour and fall-off-the-bone goodness in this classic man-magnet dish served over a veggie-rich pilaf. Beef belongs in this plant-forward dinner. DYK that folks who eat meat are more likely to eat more fruit and veggies. It’s true!
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 210
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Braised Ribs
		- 4 lb (2 kg) thick-cut Beef Bone-in Chuck Short Ribs (about 6 ribs)
		- Salt and fresh ground pepper
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable or olive oil, divided
		- 2 carrots, finely chopped
		- 2 stalks celery, chopped
		- 1 onion, finely chopped
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh rosemary
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) fennel seeds, crushed (optional)
		- 4 cloves garlic, minced
		- ½ cup (125 mL) dry red wine
		- 2 cups (500 mL) no-salt-added beef broth
		- 1 cup (250 mL) canned no-salt-added crushed tomatoes
		- 2 bay leaves
		- 2 tsp (10 mL) red wine vinegar
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) chopped fresh parsley
	- Pilaf
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
		- 8 oz (250 g) mixed sliced mushrooms, such as cremini, shiitake and king oyster
		- 1 small onion, finely chopped
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh thyme
		- 2 cloves garlic, minced
		- 1½ cups (375 mL) farro
		- Salt and fresh ground pepper
		- 2 cups (500 mL) no-salt-added chicken broth
		- 4 cups (1 L) baby spinach (abut 4 oz/125 g)
		- 1 cup (250 mL) frozen peas
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) grated Parmesan cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) thick-cut  Beef Bone-in Chuck Short Ribs  (about 6 ribs)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- 2 carrots
	- 2 stalks celery
	- 2 onions
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Fennel seeds
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Dry red wine
	- No-salt-added beef broth
	- Canned no-salt-added crushed tomatoes
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Fresh parsley
	- Mixed sliced mushrooms, such as cremini, shiitake and king oyster
	- Fresh thyme
	- Farro
	- No-salt-added chicken broth
	- Baby spinach
	- Frozen peas
	- Parmesan cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Braised Ribs: Pat ribs dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat half of oil over medium-high heat in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef in batches, adding more oil as needed, for about 10 minutes, until browned all over. Transfer to a plate.
	 2. Reduce heat to medium. Add carrots, celery, onion, rosemary and fennel seeds (if using) to pot. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in wine, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pot; simmer until reduced by half. Stir in garlic. Add broth, tomatoes and bay leaves. Bring to a boil.
	3. Return ribs to the pot along with any accumulated juices. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven, turning ribs every 45 minutes, for about 2½ to 3 hours, uncovering for the last 30 minutes, or until meat is very tender.
	4. Pilaf: Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in a large saucepan. Cook mushrooms, onion and thyme, stirring often, for 7 to 10 minutes or until softened and lightly browned. Stir in farro and garlic. Season with salt and pepper to your taste. Add broth; bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or liquid is absorbed and farro is tender. Stir in spinach, peas and Parmesan. Remove from heat and let stand for 3 to 5 minutes or until spinach is wilted and peas heated through.
	 5. Discard bay leaves from rib sauce. Skim as much fat as possible off the top of sauce; discard. Divide pilaf evenly among 8 plates. Top each serving with a short rib. Stir in vinegar and parsley into sauce; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Spoon sauce over each rib.
Recipe Tips:
  - Farro can be replaced with 1 cup (250 mL) long-grain brown rice or barley; cook according to package directions.
---
Recipe ID: dfc8d773-b6ce-46f6-b34f-d1af07a523e3
Recipe Title: Pressure Cooker Weeknight Mongolian Beef
Recipe Summary: Mongolian Beef is actually a dish from Taiwan and is often served in Canadian-style Chinese restaurants. Usually made with Flank Steak, this recipe with Beef Rib Finger Meat makes a wonderful and flavourful substitute. Cooking the beef in a pressure cooker means this braise cooks in a fraction of the time. You could also serve this saucy beef over rice noodles, cellophane noodles or ramen noodles instead of rice.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 45
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 60
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced gingerroot
	- 6 green onions, thinly sliced, divided
	- ½ cup (125 mL) soy sauce
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH sesame oil and Asian chili sauce, such as sambal oelek or sriracha 
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) cornstarch 
	- Hot cooked rice
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat
	- Vegetable oil
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Gingerroot
	- 6 green onions
	- Soy sauce
	- Brown sugar
	- Sesame oil
	- Asian chili sauce, such as sambal oelek or sriracha
	- Cornstarch
	- Hot cooked rice
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim excess fat from the meat to your taste. Starting at the thicker end of each piece of meat, make a cut in between the meat and the fibrous silverskin, lifting the fat and silverskin away from the meat while you trim along the strip of meat. (Tip: Grip the silverskin with a paper towel to prevent slipping.). Discard the trim. Cut meat crosswise into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces.
	 2. Preheat electric pressure cooker on the sear/sauté function. 
	3. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil in pressure cooker pot. Brown beef in batches, turning and adding remaining oil as needed, until browned on all sides. Transfer to a plate. 
	 4. Add garlic, gingerroot and half the green onions to pot. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until starting to soften. Return beef to the pot with any accumulated juices. Stir in ½ cup (125 mL) water, soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil and chili sauce. 
	5. Seal the pressure cooker lid and make sure the vent is closed. Set the pressure to HIGH and set time for 20 minutes. When the timer beeps, let pressure release naturally for 10 minutes. Quick release any remaining pressure.
	6. Skim fat from surface of sauce; discard. Combine cornstarch with 4 tsp (20 mL) cold water in a small bowl. Set pressure cooker on the sear/sauté function; bring sauce to a boil. Slowly whisk in cornstarch mixture; return to a boil. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until sauce is thickened and glossy. 
	 7. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with remaining green onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - The fibrous silverskin on finger meat is tough. Removing it before cooking makes the meat much more tender.
---
Recipe ID: e00ba47a-716e-4432-aca3-3eeed731ac58
Recipe Title: Slow-Simmered Steak Provençal
Recipe Summary: This hearty meal is reminiscent of Osso Bucco. Serve steak with buttered new potatoes and green beans.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 105
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 120
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak (or 1¼ lb/625 g Bone-in), 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 5 cloves garlic, chopped
	- 1 small onion, diced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) diced carrot
	- ½ cup (125 mL) diced celery
	- 1 cup (250 mL) beef broth or dry white wine
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) grated lemon zest
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh thyme leaves (or 1 tsp/5 mL dried)
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Boneless Beef Blade Simmering Steak (or 1¼ lb/625 g Bone-in), 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Vegetable oil
	- 5 cloves garlic
	- 1 small onion
	- Carrot
	- Celery
	- Beef broth or dry white wine
	- Lemon zest
	- Fresh thyme leaves
	- 1 bay leaf
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steak dry with paper towel. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil over medium-high heat in enamelled cast-iron pan with lid or Dutch oven and brown meat on both sides; transfer to a plate and set aside.
	2. Preheat oven to 325°F. Heat remaining oil in pan; add garlic, onion, carrot and celery and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in beef broth, lemon zest, thyme and bay leaf; bring to boil, scraping up bits stuck to pan.
	3. Return browned meat and accumulated juices to pan. Cover and cook in a 325°F oven for about 1½ hours or until beef is fork-tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 
	4. Discard bay leaf. Cut steak into thin slices and serve with pan sauce and vegetables.
Recipe Tips:
  - For best browning and flavour, pat steaks dry with paper towels before searing.
---
Recipe ID: e171699e-12d5-479a-976c-f98e2dfd71a0
Recipe Title: Oven Roast Beef with Berry Wine Sauce
Recipe Summary: Cranberries and red wine give the sauce a pretty, rosy hue that's the perfect pairing with medium-rare roast beef. The shape of the roast has as much to do with the cook time as the size and the cut. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 255
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 265
Recipe Servings: 12
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 8 lb (3.5 kg) Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) steak spice
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) herbes de Provence seasoning
	- Berry Wine Sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) diced shallot or onion
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) EACH reduced-sodium beef broth and red wine
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
	- ½ cup (125 mL) cranberry sauce
	- Whipping cream (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 8 lb (3.5 kg) Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Steak spice
	- Herbes de Provence seasoning
	- Berry Wine Sauce
	- Shallot or onion
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Red wine
	- Cornstarch
	- Cranberry sauce
	- Whipping cream (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rub roast all over with Worcestershire sauce, then steak spice and herbes de Provence.
	2. Place roast, bones down, on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 3¾ to 4 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: NOTE: see ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	3. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before carving. 
	 4. Berry Wine Sauce: Meanwhile, drain off fat from drippings. Heat pan drippings in roasting pan over medium-high heat. Stir in shallot and garlic; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until softened. Gradually stir in beef broth and red wine. Bring to a boil, scraping up any browned bits from pan; boil until mixture reduces to about 1 cup (250 mL). Gradually whisk in cornstarch mixture; bring to boil and cook, whisking, for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Stir in cranberry sauce and heat through. Add a splash of whipping cream, if desired. Serve with roast.
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your oven roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: e22fd911-0695-4709-b252-07c48bf8a160
Recipe Title: Beef Honeycomb Tripe Braised with Chorizo and Saffron
Recipe Summary: Tripe is extra delicious when combined with spicy chorizo sausage. For prep time efficiency, while the tripe is simmering, prepare the rest of the ingredients. Instead of stove-top simmering, use an electric pressure cooker to cook the tripe to shorten the cooking time (see Tip, below).
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 225
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 245
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Honeycomb Tripe 
	- Salt
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) fresh chorizo sausages, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- 1 cup (250 mL) finely diced onion
	- ½ cup (125 mL) EACH finely diced sweet red pepper and celery
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- Large pinch saffron threads
	- 1 cup (250 ml) dry white wine
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) strained tomatoes (passata) 
	- 3 cups (750 mL) beef broth
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- Chopped fresh parsley
	- Crusty garlic bread
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Honeycomb Tripe 
	- Salt
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) fresh chorizo sausages, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
	- Onion
	- Sweet red pepper
	- Celery
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Large pinch saffron threads
	- Dry white wine
	- Strained tomatoes
	- Beef broth
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Chopped fresh parsley
	- Crusty garlic bread
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rinse the tripe under cold water. Cut the tripe into pieces 1 inch (2.5 cm) wide and 4 inches (10 cm) long. Place in a large deep pot and add 8 cups (2 L) water and 1 tsp (5 mL) salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 2½ hours until the tripe is tender and just slightly chewy. Drain, discarding the cooking liquid. 
	 2. Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in a large saucepan. Add the chorizo and cook, stirring, until the sausage browns lightly. Add onion, red pepper, celery and garlic; cook, stirring, for about 4 to 5 minutes or until the onion is soft but not brown. Add saffron and wine. Simmer until reduced by half. Add the tomatoes and beef stock. Remove from the heat; set aside.
	3. Stir tripe into the sauce. Bring to a simmer; recue heat and simmer for 1 hour, adding water if the sauce becomes too thick, or until tripe is very tender. Season with ½ tsp (2 mL) salt and pepper, or to taste. Serve sprinkled with parsley and with bread for dipping into the sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - To cook the tripe in an electric pressure cooker, use 4 cups (1 L) water instead of 8 cups (2 L). Seal the lid on the pot making sure the vent is closed. Set pressure to High and timer for 1 hour. When the timer beeps, quick release the pressure. Proceed with the rest of the recipe.
---
Recipe ID: e28714c6-1759-4a18-90d7-1f392cd83cb0
Recipe Title: 20-Minute Skillet Steak Dinner for Two
Recipe Summary: Delicious and healthy to boot, this quick and easy dinner for two can easily be adapted to serve 4 by doubling the recipe and cooking the vegetables on a baking sheet. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (EACH about 6 oz/175 g or 12 oz/375 g total)
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) Montreal-style steak spice
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) olive oil, divided
	- 16 asparagus spears, trimmed
	- ½ lb (250 g) cherry tomatoes on the vine
	- Pinch EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 demi-baguette 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh chives and fresh lemon juice
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2  Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks
	- Montreal-style steak spice
	- Olive oil
	- 16 asparagus spears
	- Cherry tomatoes on the vine
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 demi-baguette 
	- Fresh chives
	- Fresh lemon juice
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with steak spice. 
	2. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in large cast-iron or oven-safe shallow heavy skillet. Add steaks and asparagus; cook for 4 to 6 minutes, turning steak once and tossing asparagus occasionally. (Note: If asparagus is very thin, add to pan with cherry tomatoes in step 3 instead).
	 3. Brush cherry tomatoes with remaining oil; add to pan and season with salt and pepper. Transfer pan to preheated 400°F oven and cook steak for 5 to 7 minutes for medium-rare doneness (145°F/63°C) at the least, testing doneness with a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into steak (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). The asparagus should be tender-crisp and tomatoes starting to blister. (If steak is done before vegetables, transfer to plate and keep warm.) 
	 4. Let steaks rest for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, place baguette in hot oven and bake for 4 to 5 minutes or until warmed. 
	 5. Sprinkle steak and vegetables with chives and lemon juice. Serve with warm baguette. 
Recipe Tips:
  - If asparagus is very thin, add to pan with cherry tomatoes in step 3. Serve with a dollop of basil pesto or olive tapenade for the vegetables or baguette. Add crumbled feta or goat cheese to vegetables as soon as they come from oven, if desired.
---
Recipe ID: e2ad440f-a501-490a-8192-a8584739a527
Recipe Title: Slow-Simmered Italian-Style Pot Roast with Mushrooms
Recipe Summary: This delicious dish is pure comfort food–perfect for a winter weekend dinner when the weather is cold and warmth is needed. Add a little cooked and diced pancetta or bacon to the sauce for a bourguignon-like flavour. Served here with egg noodles, pappardelle or tagliatelle, you could substitute with mashed potatoes or creamy polenta, or simply with crusty bread.  
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 210
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 235
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Flat Portion (Pot Roast)
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- ½ lb (250 g) sliced mushrooms
	- 1 onion, finely chopped
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) tomato paste
	- 1 cup (250 mL) dry red wine 
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ½ oz (14 g) dried sliced mushrooms
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1 lb (500 g) dry broad egg noodles, pappardelle or tagliatelle 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh parsley
	- ½ cup (125 mL) grated Parmesan cheese 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Brisket, Flat Portion (Pot Roast)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- Sliced mushrooms
	- 1 onion
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Tomato paste
	- Dry red wine
	- Diced tomatoes
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Sliced mushrooms
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 1 lb (500 g) dry broad egg noodles, pappardelle or tagliatelle 
	- Fresh parsley
	- Parmesan cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat beef dry with paper towel. Season all over with 1 tsp (5 mL) each salt and pepper. Heat half the oil over medium-high heat in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster; brown beef, turning until browned all over. Transfer to a plate. 
	 2. Add remaining oil to pot. Add sliced mushrooms, onion, garlic, rosemary and remaining salt and pepper. Cook, stirring often, for 5 to 8 minutes or until starting to soften and brown. Stir in tomato paste; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until deep red. Pour in wine and simmer, stirring and scraping up browned bits from bottom of pot, for 3 to 5 minutes or until reduced by half. Stir in diced tomatoes, broth, dried mushrooms and bay leaves; bring to a boil. 
	3. Return beef and any accumulated juices to pot; nestle beef in sauce to ensure it is covered in liquid. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for about 3 to 3½ hours or until meat is fork-tender.
	 4. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Skim fat from sauce and remove bay leaves; discard.
	 5. Meanwhile, cook noodles according to package directions; drain. Toss cooked noodles with half the sauce and the parsley in a large bowl until well coated.
	 6. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and arrange over noodles, top with remaining sauce. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Recipe Tips:
  - A Dutch oven, enamelled cast-iron roaster or heavy, ovenproof saucepan with a tight-fitting lid are essential when braising, as they keep the moisture and heat evenly distributed, resulting in tender and juicy meat. Some chefs will not only cover with a lid, but will also cut a piece of parchment paper (called a cartouche) to fit snugly inside the pan directly over the braising mixture to further enhance the moisture of the braise.
---
Recipe ID: e37cf8b4-f868-44fc-8758-0e87e0e79435
Recipe Title: Beef Soup with Horseradish Gremolata Crostini
Recipe Summary: Beef shank is a wonderful cut that is commonly braised in a hearty red wine sauce, but for this recipe one of the muscles on the shank–known as “Bubble Meat”–is poached until tender in a flavourful beef stock and served in a soup that can be enjoyed as a main course along with a gremalota-topped crostini for dipping or to float on top.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 390
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 420
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Soup Bones
	- 8 cups (2 L) unsalted beef stock or broth
	- 1 carrot, diced
	- 1 white onion, diced
	- 1 stalk celery, diced
	- ½ leek, diced
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 whole cloves
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) whole black peppercorns
	- 2 small or 1 large Beef Boneless Hind Shank (Bubble Meat)(2 to 2 ½ lb/1 to 1.25 kg)
	- 2 bay leaves
	- 6 sprigs fresh thyme
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) salt (approx)
	-  Horseradish Gremolata Crostini
	- 1 small baguette (a demi-baguette or half regular)
	- Olive oil
	- Salt and pepper
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) finely chopped fresh Italian parsley
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) grated lemon zest
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) prepared horseradish
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg)  Beef Soup Bones
	- Unsalted beef stock or broth
	- 1 carrot
	- 1 white onion
	- 1 stalk celery
	- 1 leek
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Cloves
	- Black peppercorns
	- 2 small or 1 large  Beef Boneless Hind Shank (Bubble Meat)(2 to 2 ½ lb/1 to 1.25 kg)
	- 2 bay leaves
	- Fresh thyme
	-  Horseradish Gremolata Crostini
	- 1 small baguette (a demi-baguette or half regular)
	- Olive oil
	- Salt and pepper
	- Fresh Italian parsley
	- Lemon
	- Prepared horseradish
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rinse beef bones and pat dry with paper towel. Arrange in a single layer in a roasting pan or rimmed baking sheet. Roast in preheated 400°F oven for about 30 minutes or until golden brown.
	 2. Transfer roasted bones to a large stock pot or Dutch oven, scraping in brown bits from pan. Add beef stock, carrot, onion, celery, leek, garlic, cloves and peppercorns. Add enough water to cover the bones by about 3 inches (7.5 cm). Bring to a simmer over a medium-low heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 2 hours, skimming of any scum that rises to the surface frequently.
	 3. Add Bubble Meat, bay leaves, thyme and salt to the pot. Simmer for 3 hours longer, or until a skewer easily pierces and slides in and out of the bubble meat. Remove the pot from the heat; transfer the meat to a bowl and let both cool to room temperature. Strain the stock through a colander or a large sieve into a clean pot; discarding solids. Cover and refrigerate both stock and meat separately until ready to serve (overnight) or for up to 3 days.
	 4. Horseradish Gremolata Crostini: Cut the baguette into about 12 thin slices, about ¼-inch (5 mm) thick. Place in single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Brush both sides of slices with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake in preheated 350°F oven for 15 to 20 minutes, until crispy and golden, turning over if not browning on the undersides. Set aside.
	5. Combine parsley, garlic, lemon zest and horseradish in a small bowl; season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve (Make ahead: Refrigerate for up to 1 day.)
	 6. To serve: bring stock to a simmer over medium heat. Taste for seasoning and add more salt, if needed.
	7. Carve the Bubble Meat across the grain into slices no thicker than ½ inch (1 cm). Add the sliced meat to the soup to heat up, about 1 minute.
	 8. Ladle the soup into 6 warmed serving bowls and add 2 to 3 slices of meat to each bowl. Spoon Horseradish Gremolata on top of crostini; float 2 crostini in each bowl of soup or serve on the side with spoon, steak knife and fork.
Recipe Tips:
  - Centre-cut Shank can be used as an alternative to the Bubble Meat, reducing the cooking time for the meat to 2 hours in step 3.
---
Recipe ID: e40b8672-b44f-42d9-b0b9-ae6e5439bdce
Recipe Title: Pan-Fried Maple-Balsamic Steak with Pecans & Blue Cheese
Recipe Summary: This easy, yet elegant, recipe is perfect for a romantic dinner for two. Serve with creamy mashed potatoes and a lightly dressed arugula or spinach salad. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 510
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) maple syrup
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Worcestershire sauce or soy sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely chopped fresh thyme
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 12 oz (375 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) crumbled blue cheese
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped toasted pecans
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Balsamic vinegar
	- Maple syrup
	- Worcestershire sauce or soy sauce
	- Fresh thyme
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 12 oz (375 kg) Beef Sirloin Tip Marinating Steak, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- Crumbled blue cheese
	- Chopped toasted pecans
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine vinegar, maple syrup, Worcestershire sauce, thyme and garlic in a sealable freezer bag. Pierce steak all over with a fork and add to bag, massaging marinade into meat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours. 
	2. Remove beef from marinade, reserving marinade. Pat steak dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper.
	 3. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large cast-iron or stainless-steel skillet. Cook steak for 4 to 6 minutes, turning once, until browned; transfer steak to a wire rack on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Set skillet aside to make the sauce. 
	4. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer sideways into centre of steak. To finish cooking, place in preheated 450°F (230°C) oven for 6 to 8 minutes for medium-rare doneness (145°F/63°C) at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	5. Meanwhile, add reserved marinade to the skillet and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat; simmer for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring, until thickened and reduced to a syrupy consistency. 
	6. Slice steak thinly across the grain and divide between 2 warmed plates. Top with pan sauce, blue cheese and pecans.
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute crumbled blue cheese with goat cheese or feta if preferred, and substitute pecans with walnuts, almonds or hazelnuts.
---
Recipe ID: e45dc278-5dc5-45b3-8c1b-4d0e35e8ff0f
Recipe Title: Grilled Sous Vide Flank Steak with Mushroom Lemon Tapenade
Recipe Summary: A marinating flank steak doesn’t even need to be marinated ahead when you cook sous vide; it becomes juicy and tender as it cooks in its own juices. Sous vide cooking takes the guesswork out of cooking steak to your desired doneness–the temperature you set your water bath is the internal temperature your steak will cook to, every time! Be sure to sear on a hot grill or grill pan for the final browning. The savoury tapenade with mushrooms is a twist on the French classic and tailor made to go with beef. Roast potatoes or frites and a leafy, vinaigrette-dressed salad would be ideal to complete the meal. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 255
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 270
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Steak
	- Salt
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Flank Marinating Steak 
	- Fresh ground pepper
	-  Mushroom Lemon Tapenade 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil, divided (approx)
	- 8 oz (250 g) cremini mushrooms, chopped
	- 1 clove garlic, chopped
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) fennel seeds, crushed
	- Pinch dried thyme leaves
	- ½ cup (125 mL) drained pitted green olives
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated lemon zest
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) freshly squeezed lemon juice
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) chopped fresh parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	-  Steak
	- Salt
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Flank Marinating Steak 
	- Fresh ground pepper
	-  Mushroom Lemon Tapenade 
	- Olive oil
	- Cremini mushrooms
	- 1 clove garlic
	- Fennel seeds
	- Pinch dried thyme leaves
	- Pitted green olives
	- Lemon
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Steak: Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 130°F (54.5°C) for medium-rare or 140°F (60°C) for medium according to manufacturer’s directions.
	2. Combine fennel seeds and ¼ tsp (1 mL) salt in a small bowl. Pat steak dry with paper towel and pierce all over with a fork. Rub fennel mixture all over steak. Place in a large bag for sous vide (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Pour in lemon juice, massaging to evenly coat meat. Remove as much air as possible and vacuum or manually seal. 
	 3. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure it to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Weigh bag down with a large spoon, if necessary to keep it immersed. Cook sous vide for 4 hours.
	4. Mushroom Lemon Tapenade : Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Cook mushrooms, garlic, fennel seeds and thyme, stirring, for about 10 minutes or until mushrooms release their liquid and start to brown. Let cool slightly.
	5. Combine mushroom mixture, olives, lemon zest and juice in a small food processor until fine or mash in a mortar with pestle. Add just enough of the remaining oil until tapenade is the desired texture. Transfer to a bowl, stir in parsley and season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour for flavours to blend or for up to 3 days. Let warm to room temperature before serving.
	 6. To serve, preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C) or heat a large grill pan over medium-high heat until very hot.
	7. Remove the beef from the water bath. Remove steak from bag, discarding liquid from bag, and transfer to a plate. Pat steak dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper. Lightly oil pan, if using. Grill steak for 2 to 4 minutes, turning once, or until sizzling and well-browned on both sides. Transfer to a cutting board.
	8. Cut steak across the grain on a diagonal into thin slices and serve on warmed plates with Mushroom Lemon Tapenade.
Recipe Tips:
  - For convenience, you can cook the steak in step 3 for up to 6 hours. To make ahead, immerse bag in a sink or bowl of ice water and chill, replenishing ice as necessary until cold. Refrigerate in bag for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 6 months. Thaw in refrigerator overnight. Reheat in a 130°F (54.5°C) or 140°F (60°C) water bath for 30 minutes, then proceed with grilling.
---
Recipe ID: e4e13c6a-482c-4a7a-8f2d-bd4634c0e665
Recipe Title: Oven Roast Beef with Simple Wine Sauce
Recipe Summary: For busy parents, roast beef has to be the easiest meal to make. Just rub it all over with salt and pepper, pop it in the oven and the job is done! Let it rest while you make a simple pan sauce. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 6¼-in (15 cm) long x 5¼-in (13 cm wide) x 4¾-in (12 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 180
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 195
Recipe Servings: 10
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast
	- Coarse sea salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 6 to 8 cloves garlic, smashed
	- 1 to 2 shallots, chopped
	- 3 to 4 sprigs fresh thyme (or ½ tsp/2 mL dried thyme leaves)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) red wine
	- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast
	- Coarse sea salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 6 to 8 cloves garlic
	- 1 to 2 shallots
	- Fresh thyme
	- Red wine
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Cornstarch
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rub roast all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes.
	  2. Reduce heat to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2 hours and 40 minutes for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	3. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	 4. Meanwhile, skim off all but 2 tbsp (30 mL) of fat from drippings in roasting pan. Heat drippings over medium-high heat. Add garlic and shallots, to your taste, and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until softened. Add thyme and red wine to pan, stirring to scrape up browned bits stuck to pan; simmer until wine is almost cooked dry. Stir in beef broth and boil gently until reduced by half. Gradually stir in the cornstarch mixture; simmer, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
	5. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - When oven-roasting roast beef, roast without a lid for best browning.
---
Recipe ID: e4e34c1b-fd13-4cd7-99e7-29ea0ae9fc3a
Recipe Title: Lettuce Wrapped Mushroom, Swiss, Bacon Burger with Barley Slaw
Recipe Summary: A gourmet burger recipe gets lightened up by using lettuce instead of a burger bun. Served with a fresh yet hearty coleslaw accented with barley, grainy mustard and fresh dill, this dinner will satisfy a hungry appetite. Easily transform this recipe into a gluten-free option by using cooked quinoa instead of the barley.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 40
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup olive oil
	- 3 tbsp EACH red wine vinegar and grainy Dijon mustard
	- 1 tbsp liquid honey
	- 1 tsp salt
	- ¾ cup dry pearl barley, cooked and cooled to room temperature
	- 1 bag (397 g) shredded coleslaw blend (about 4 cups)
	- 1 cup thinly sliced celery
	- ⅓ cup chopped fresh dill or parsley
	- ⅓ cup chopped green onion
	- 1 tbsp olive oil
	- 1 lb (500 g) sliced cremini or button mushrooms
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp steak spice blend
	- 1 lb (500 g) extra lean ground beef
	- 4 strips raw maple smoked bacon, diced
	- 1-1/2 tsp steak spice blend
	- 6 slices Swiss cheese
	- Leaf, Boston or Bibb lettuce leaves, washed and dried well
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Grainy Dijon mustard
	- Liquid honey
	- Salt
	- Dry pearl barle
	- Shredded coleslaw blend
	- Celery
	- Chopped fresh dill or parsley
	- Green onion
	- Cremini or button mushrooms
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Steak spice blend
	- 1 lb (500 g) extra lean ground beef
	- 4 strips raw maple smoked bacon
	- 6 slices Swiss cheese
	- Boston or Bibb lettuce leaves
Recipe Methods:
	Slaw: 
	1. In a large bowl, whisk oil with vinegar, mustard, honey, salt, pepper and celery seed (if using).
	2. Add barley, coleslaw blend, celery, dill and onion; toss to combine. Refrigerate, covered, for 30 minutes before serving.
	Mushrooms: 
	Meanwhile, heat oil in a medium, nonstick skillet set over medium heat. Cook mushrooms with garlic and steak spice blend, stirring often, for 10 minutes or until softened and lightly browned. Remove from heat, cover and keep warm.
	Burgers:
	1. In a large bowl, gently mix beef with bacon and steak spice blend. Divide mixture into 6 equal portions; form into ¾-inch (2 cm) thick patties. Make a thumbprint depression in centre of each patty (to prevent puffing while grilling).
	2. Preheat grill to medium heat; grease grates well. Grill for 5 to 7 minutes per side, testing doneness with a digital instant read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each patty to ensure patties are cooked to 160°F (71°C). 
	3. Top burgers with cheese slices during the last 2 minutes of grilling, or until melted. Place each burger on top of a lettuce leaf on 6 serving plates; top burgers evenly with mushroom mixture and serve with slaw on the side.
	To Cook Indoors: 
	1. Cook burgers in a cast-iron skillet over medium heat. 
	2. Maple smoked bacon can be replaced with any type of side bacon, such as applewood smoked, peppercorn crusted or chipotle. 
	Make ahead: 
	Slaw can be prepared, covered and refrigerated overnight before serving. Assemble burger patties and refrigerate, covered, for 1 hour or up to 1 day before cooking and serving.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: e5b8b113-4870-40a0-948b-62e81c0e3be5
Recipe Title: Jamaican-Style Oxtail Stew with Butter Beans
Recipe Summary: Braising oxtail pieces and hearty butter beans in a broth featuring Jamaican curry powder, ginger, garlic, allspice and thyme creates a beautifully rich and flavourful stew. The Scotch bonnet pepper adds a nice kick of heat that adds an authentic warmth to the dish, without being too overpowering. Serve over plain long grain rice, or rice and peas, for a traditional and satisfying meal. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 160
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Oxtail, cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) freshly ground black pepper 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion, finely chopped
	- 4 green onions, chopped, divided
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) Jamaican or Madras curry powder
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH packed brown sugar, minced gingerroot and soy sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH tomato paste and Worcestershire sauce
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) dried thyme
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) ground allspice 
	- 4 cups (1 L) reduced-sodium beef broth 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
	- 1 whole Scotch bonnet pepper
	- 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) butter beans or lima beans, drained and rinsed 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Oxtail, cut into 1½-inch (4 cm) pieces
	- Salt
	- Ground black pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 large onion
	- 4 green onions
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Jamaican or Madras curry powder
	- Brown sugar
	- Soy sauce
	- Gingerroot
	- Tomato paste
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Dried thyme
	- Ground allspice
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- All-purpose flour
	- 1 whole Scotch bonnet pepper
	- Butter beans or lima beans
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat oxtail dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or large heavy-bottom stockpot or saucepan. Sear oxtail, turning with tongs, for 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil.
	2. Reduce heat to medium. Add onion, half the green onions, garlic, curry powder, brown sugar, ginger, soy sauce, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, thyme and allspice to pot. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. 
	3. Pour in 1 cup (250 mL) broth. Cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until onion is softened. Sprinkle in flour; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually stir in remaining broth and 4 cups (1 L) water; bring to a boil. Add scotch bonnet. 
	4. Return oxtail to pot along with any accumulated juices. Cover, reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 2 hours or until meat is very tender. During cooking, skim surface of broth to remove any pools of fat. Add a splash of water to stew during the last hour of cooking if it begins to thicken too quickly. Discard scotch bonnet.
	 5. Stir in butter beans. Simmer, partially covered, for 15 to 20 minutes or until stew is thickened. Serve sprinkled with remaining green onions. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Jamaican curry powder can be found in the spice section or in the international aisle of most grocery stores. While Jamaican curry powder is made from a unique spice blend, mild Indian curry powder can be substituted in this recipe.
---
Recipe ID: e74de865-667f-4588-95fe-41b8218b7550
Recipe Title: Skillet Fast-Fry Steaks with Simple Cranberry Pan Sauce 
Recipe Summary: Bold flavours and a simple technique elevate this quick-cooking moderately-priced steak to a weeknight date night or solo dinner (with leftovers). Serve with mashed potatoes, whipped cauliflower or crusty bread to help soak up all the delicious sauce! 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ½ lb (250 g) Beef Eye of Round Fast-fry Steaks (about 2 steaks)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth 
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) dry red wine
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) whole berry cranberry sauce or red pepper jelly
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cold butter, cut into cubes
	- Chopped fresh parsley 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Garlic
	- Fresh rosemary
	- Fresh parsley
	- ½ lb (250 g) Beef Eye of Round Fast-fry Steaks (about 2 steaks)
	- Vegetable oil
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth 
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Whole berry cranberry sauce or red pepper jelly
	- Butter
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) dry red wine
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper.
	2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in nonstick skillet; cook steaks, for 4 to 6 minutes, turning once or more until steaks are cooked to medium (160ºF/71ºF) and browned but still pink inside. Transfer to a plate, cover loosely with foil to keep warm; set aside.
	3. Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic and rosemary to skillet; cook, stirring, for 30 to 60 seconds or until fragrant. Pour in beef broth and red wine; bring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 3 to 5 minutes or until reduced by half. Stir in cranberry sauce. Reduce heat to low.&nbsp;
	4. Add butter, one cube at a time, stirring or swirling skillet to allow each piece to dissolve before adding the next. Move skillet back and forth from heat, for about 2 to 3 minutes or as needed, to dissolve butter to a creamy consistency.&nbsp;
	5. Serve sauce over steaks. Sprinkle with parsley.&nbsp;
Recipe Tips:
  - The secret to this luscious sauce is the cold butter. Using cold butter to finish a pan sauce adds body and sheen, and is a classic French technique called mounting. There are a few key elements needed for success; the butter must be cold and the heat cannot be too high or the sauce will separate. Be sure that each piece of butter is fully incorporated before adding the next piece. If the sauce is getting too hot, just remove from the heat for a few seconds before adding the next butter cube.
---
Recipe ID: e762bee0-d556-4eed-88d5-c3e268d11128
Recipe Title: Grilled Miso Steak with Romaine Salad
Recipe Summary: A delightful dinner doesn’t have to be difficult! Rub a steak with miso in the morning and make the simple salad to pair with it that night.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 6
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 506
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Beef Bone-in Strip Loin (Wing) Grilling Steaks 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) miso paste
	-  Dressing 
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) vegetable oil
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH fish sauce and fresh lime juice
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) miso paste
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH hot pepper flakes and granulated sugar
	- Salt and pepper
	-  Salad 
	- 4 cups (1 L) torn romaine lettuce leaves
	- ½ sweet red pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
	- 1 Mandarin orange, peeled and segmented, segments halved crosswise
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH torn fresh cilantro leaves and roasted peanuts, crushed
Recipe Shopping List:
	-  Beef Bone-in Strip Loin (Wing) Grilling Steaks 
	- Miso paste
	- Vegetable oil
	- Fish sauce
	- Fresh lime juice
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Granulated sugar
	- Salt and pepper
	- Romaine lettuce leaves
	- Sweet red pepper
	- 1 Mandarin orange
	- Cilantro leaves
	- Roasted peanuts
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rub steaks all over with miso paste. Wrap in plastic wrap, place in a shallow dish and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. 
	2. Dressing: Meanwhile, whisk together vegetable oil, fish sauce, lime juice, miso paste, hot pepper flakes and sugar in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days.
	 3. Wipe paste off steaks with paper towel. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ½ inch (1 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. 
	4. Salad: Meanwhile, combine lettuce, red pepper, orange, cilantro and peanuts in a large bowl. Add dressing and toss to coat. Carve steaks off the bone and cut into thin slices across the grain. Serve sliced steak on a platter along with the bones. Pass at the table to top the dressed salad.
Recipe Tips:
  - Miso Paste: The magic of miso is FLAVOUR! This condiment is a pantry staple in Japanese cuisine. Made from fermented soybeans, its rich sweet-salty nuttiness blends perfectly with beef’s big flavour. Find miso in the sushi-ingredient section at the grocery store and keep refrigerated. Try it in marinades, dressings and mixed into bold beef burgers!
---
Recipe ID: e7689bcc-f2dc-44b8-a6c8-dbbec7add142
Recipe Title: Grilled Barcelona-Marinated Steak with Couscous Salad
Recipe Summary: The beef develops a deep flavour in this simple Spanish-accented marinade. Serve with the Spanish Couscous Salad and grilled peaches for a full meal that includes whole grain, fruits and veggies too.
Recipe Prep Time: 12
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 27
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Grated zest and juice of 1 medium orange 
	- 1/4 cup	(50 mL)	EACH minced onion and cider vinegar
	- 1 tsp	(5 mL)	EACH chopped garlic and crushed dried rosemary
	- 1/2 tsp	(2 mL)	EACH salt, pepper and ground cumin
	- 4 small Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1½ lb/750 g)
	- Spanish Couscous Salad (recipe follows)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) whole wheat couscous
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) boiling water
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH chopped sweet red and green pepper
	- 1 orange, segments chopped
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh oregano or cilantro
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 medium oranges
	- Onion
	- Garlic
	- Sweet red and green peppers
	- Fresh oregano or cilantro
	- Cider vinegar
	- Dried rosemary or oregano
	- Ground cumin
	- Salt and pepper
	- 4 small Beef Tenderloin Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1½ lb/750 g)
	- Whole wheat couscous
Recipe Methods:
	1.&nbsp;Combine orange juice and zest, onion, vinegar, garlic, rosemary, salt, pepper and cumin in large sealable freezer bag. Add steaks to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for just 30 to 60 minutes.
	2. Spanish Couscous Salad:&nbsp;Place couscous in a large heatproof bowl. Pour in boiling water, cover and let stand for 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in red and green pepper, oranges and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Let stand at room temperature for up to 1 hour.
	3.&nbsp;Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel.&nbsp;
	4.&nbsp;Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steaks reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	5.&nbsp;Let rest for 5 minutes before serving with Spanish Couscous Salad.
Recipe Tips:
  - Steaks cook more evenly when flipped at least twice during grilling.
---
Recipe ID: e78184a3-5740-41b6-afa2-d722f6df68b9
Recipe Title: Grilled Beef and Haloumi Skewers with Mustard Baste
Recipe Summary: Beef, cheese and mushrooms on the grill is a perfect combination for skewers as they work together to build umami flavour. The mustard-beer baste can easily be pulled together from ingredients you likely have on hand in the kitchen. This recipe would work well with any grilling steak: Tenderloin, Strip Loin or Rib Eye for example. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 12
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 32
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Steak, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 1 pkg (approx 320 g) haloumi cheese, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes 
	- 1 red onion, cut into large chunks
	- ½ lb (250 g) medium-size white mushrooms
	- Bamboo skewers, soaked
	- Baste
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) light beer
		- 2 tbsp (15 mL) EACH maple syrup, olive oil, Dijon mustard and grainy mustard
		- Salt and pepper 
		- Canola or olive oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Steak
	- 1 pkg (approx 320 g) haloumi cheese
	- 1 red onion, cut into large chunks
	- ½ lb (250 g) medium-size white mushrooms
	- Bamboo skewers
	- 1 can or bottle light beer
	- Maple syrup
	- Olive oil
	- Dijon mustard 
	- Grainy mustard
	- Salt and pepper 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Thread beef, cheese, onion and mushrooms evenly and alternating onto soaked bamboo skewers. Set aside.
	2. Baste: Whisk together beer, syrup, olive oil, Dijon and grainy mustard in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper to your taste; set aside.
	3. Cook skewers on oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides and generously brushing with the Baste, or until vegetables are tender and beef is cooked to 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
Recipe Tips: ???

Recipe ID: e7902438-d453-4eb3-91b0-569200df569f
Recipe Title: Beef Pot Pies with Dark Ale and Leeks
Recipe Summary: Sophisticated, flavourful beef pot pies.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Chuck Flap Tail, cut into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 2/3 cup (150 mL) all-purpose flour
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- 3 EACH stalks celery and small carrots, halved lengthwise and thickly sliced
	- 2 cloves garlic, chopped
	- 1 large leek, white and pale green part only, halved lengthwise and chopped
	- 3 cups (750 mL) beef broth
	- 1¼ cups (300 mL) dark ale
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried thyme
	- 1 cup (250 mL) frozen peas
	- 1 pkg (about 1 lb/500 g) frozen puff pastry, thawed (2 sheets)
	- 1 egg
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Chuck Flap Tail
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- All-purpose flour
	- Vegetable oil
	- Celery
	- Small carrots
	- 2 cloves garlic, chopped
	- 1 large leek
	- Beef broth
	- Dark ale
	- Tomato paste
	- Dried thyme
	- Frozen peas
	- Frozen puff pastry
	- 1 egg
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat beef dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Place in a large bowl; add flour and toss to coat. Shake off excess flour, reserving excess.
	 2. Heat half the oil over medium-high heat in Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster. Brown beef, in batches, for about 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a clean bowl. Add more oil to pot between batches, as necessary.
	3. Add remaining oil to pan. Cook celery, carrots, garlic and leeks, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Sprinkle in reserved flour; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually, stir in beef broth. Stir in ale, tomato paste and thyme. Bring to a boil, scraping up brown bits from bottom of pan. Season with salt and pepper to your taste. Stir in beef with accumulated juices.
	 4. Cover and cook in preheated 325°F oven for about 1½ hours or until beef is fork-tender. 
	5. Meanwhile, set six 1½-cup (375 mL) oven-safe serving dishes on a parchment-lined rimmed baking sheet. Roll out puff pastry dough on lightly floured board to a thickness of ¼-inch (5 mm). Using a sharp knife or cookie cutter, cut pastry into six circles or squares about ½ inch (1 cm) larger than top of dishes. Pierce each pastry piece several times with a fork. Return pastry to refrigerator while beef is cooking.
	 6. Remove beef filling from oven. Increase oven temperature to 400ºF. Stir peas into beef filling. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon filling into dishes. Place a piece of pastry on top of each dish and pinch around edges to seal to the dish. Whisk egg with 1 tbsp (15 mL) water in a small bowl and brush pastry with egg wash. Cut a few slits in the centre of pastry.
	 7. Bake pot pies on baking sheet for 15 to 20 minutes or until pastry is puffed and golden brown. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
Recipe Tips:
  - You can make the beef filling a day ahead. At the end of step 4, let cool, then cover and refrigerate in an airtight container. Reheat over medium heat in a large saucepan, stirring, often until filling is hot and bubbling then proceed with step 5.
---
Recipe ID: e7e53f26-57d6-4252-9dab-cfdd42bf3c9c
Recipe Title: Beef Borscht 
Recipe Summary: Warm your soul with a delicious bowl of this rib-sticking borscht. The beef foreshank, flavourful herbs and spices and root vegetables make it the ultimate comfort food.
Recipe Prep Time: 25
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 160
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) sunflower oil, divided
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Bone-in Foreshank, meat cut into large chunks, reserving bone
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- 1 Spanish onion, diced (about 1½ cups/375 mL)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) dry red wine
	- 8 cups (2 L) high-quality unsalted beef stock or no-salt-added beef broth, divided
	- 3 sprigs fresh thyme
	- 2 bay leaves 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dill seed and smoked Hungarian paprika
	- 4 EACH beets and carrots, peeled and diced
	- 1 yellow-fleshed potato, peeled and diced
	- 2 cups (500 mL) thinly sliced cabbage
	- ½ cup (125 mL) fresh dill sprigs, chopped, divided (approx)
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) red wine vinegar (approx)
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) honey (approx)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) sour cream
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 Spanish onion
	- Fresh thyme
	- Fresh dill
	- 4 beets
	- 4 carrots
	- 1 yellow-fleshed potato
	- Cabbage
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Bone-in Foreshank, meat cut into large chunks, reserving bone
	- Sunflower oil
	- Salt
	- Pepper 
	- 8 cups (2 L) high-quality unsalted beef stock or no-salt-added beef broth
	- Bay leaves
	- Dill seed
	- Smoked Hungarian paprika
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Honey
	- 1 cup (250 mL) sour cream 
	- Dry red wine
Recipe Methods:
	1. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven or heavy bottom stockpot until almost smoking.
	2. Meanwhile, season meat generously all over with salt and pepper. 
	3. Add meat to pot and brown, turning, until browned on all sides. Add onion and cook, stirring, for about 8 minutes or until lightly caramelized. Add wine and bring to a boil, scraping up browned bits from bottom of pot; boil until wine is evaporated. 
	4. Add reserved bone and 4 cups (1 L) stock or enough to cover beef. Add thyme, bay leaves, dill seed, dill, and smoked Hungarian paprika. Cover, reduce heat to low and gently simmer for about 1½ hours or until meat is fork-tender. 
	5. Meanwhile heat remaining oil over medium-high heat in a deep sauté pan or pot. Cook beets, carrots and potato, stirring often, for about 6 minutes or until starting to soften. Add remaining stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and boil vegetables for 8 to 10 minutes or until cooked through but still al dente. Remove from heat. 
	6. Remove beef and bones from liquid (reserve liquid in pot) with a slotted spoon and transfer to a bowl; discard bone. Shred beef with 2 forks and return to broth in pot. Add vegetables with their cooking liquid and cabbage. Return to a simmer over medium heat; reduce heat and simmer for about 30 minutes to develop flavours.
	7. Stir in half of the fresh dill. Season with red wine vinegar, honey, salt and pepper and more dill to taste, if desired. Discard bay leaves.
	8. To serve, ladle a healthy portion of borscht into serving bowls. Garnish with a dollop of sour cream and dill.
Recipe Tips:
  - Seek out Beef Foreshank at a butcher shop; it may come as one large piece or cut into slices. You can have the butcher cut the meat from the bone for you or cut it yourself. Be sure to include the bone when simmering the beef to enrich the broth.
---
Recipe ID: e91b1848-6c09-4e1d-adb7-700632a493e3
Recipe Title: Deconstructed Individual Beef Wellingtons
Recipe Summary: Beef Wellington comes un-done in this delicious version and elegant presentation. Although there are many ingredients, broken down into the components, it’s not that difficult to tackle.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 75
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 105
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 pkg (397 g) frozen puff pastry dough, thawed
	- All-purpose flour
	- 1 egg
	- 2½ lb (1.25 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut, cut into six 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick medallions
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- Coarsely ground salt and pepper
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter, divided
	- 2 shallots, finely sliced
	- 1 green onion, finely sliced
	- 2 cups (500 mL) finely chopped mushrooms
	- 2½ oz (75 g) chicken or duck liver pâté, thinly sliced
	- 4 cups (1 L) beef broth
	- ⅔ cup (150 mL) Madeira
	- Whipping cream
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tsp (5 mL) cold water (optional)
	- Salt and pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) minced garlic
	- 4 cups (1 L) baby spinach
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Frozen puff pastry dough
	- All-purpose flour
	- 1 egg
	- 2½ lb (1.25 kg) Beef Tenderloin Premium Oven Roast, centre-cut, cut into six 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick medallions
	- Vegetable oil
	- Coarsely ground salt and pepper
	- Butter
	- 2 shallots
	- 1 green onion
	- Chopped mushrooms
	- Chicken or duck liver pâté
	- Beef broth
	- Madeira
	- Whipping cream
	- Cornstarch (optional)
	- Salt and pepper
	- Garlic
	- Baby spinach
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Puff Pastry Wellies: Roll out the puff pastry dough on lightly floured board to a thickness of ½-inch (1 cm). Using a sharp knife or cookie cutter, cut pastry into 3-inch (7.5 cm) circles. Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet, spacing them apart. Pierce each pastry piece several times with a fork. Whisk egg with 1 tbsp (15 mL) water in a small bowl and brush pastry circles with egg wash. Bake in preheated oven 425ºF for 10 to 12 minutes until golden brown. Set aside.
	 2. Beef Medallions: Reduce oven heat to 375ºF. Brush both sides of beef medallions with 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the oil and season with salt and pepper to your taste. Heat remaining oil and 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter over medium-high heat in a heavy skillet; in batches as necessary, brown meat on both sides, about 1 to 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a baking sheet; set aside.
	 3. Melt remaining butter in same skillet. Add shallots and onion; cook, stirring, for about 1 minute or until softened. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 to 10 minutes or until liquid has evaporated and mushrooms start to brown. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer mushroom mixture to a bowl and set pan aside to use for Madeira Mushroom Sauce.
	4. Madeira Mushroom Sauce: Place reserved skillet over medium-high heat; add beef broth and bring to a boil, stirring up brown bits from bottom of pan. Boil for 15 to 20 minutes to reduce to about 1⅔ cups (400 mL). Stir in Madeira and continue to boil for about 5 minutes or until liquid is reduced again to 1⅔ cups (400 mL). 
	5. Meanwhile, top each beef medallion with pâté slices and mushroom mixture. Bake in oven for 8 to 10 minutes or until digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of medallions registers 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done) to finish. 
	6. To finish sauce, stir in a generous splash of whipping cream to taste. If desired, thicken sauce by stirring in cornstarch mixture; cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes until slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour onto gravy boat to serve; reserve skillet for spinach.
	7. Wilted Spinach: Return skillet to medium-high heat; add butter and garlic; cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add baby spinach and salt and pepper to your taste, stir to cover with butter for 30 seconds. Turn off heat, cover and allow spinach to wilt.
	 8. Arrange Wilted Spinach and 1 or 2 Puff Pastry Wellies on serving plates; place Beef Medallions on top of spinach and spoon Madeira Mushroom Sauce over beef.
Recipe Tips:
  - If you buy puff pastry in pre-rolled sheets, stack the 2 sheets and pinch around edges to squeeze the sheets together making sure there are no air bubble between the sheets. Roll just slightly to help sheets adhere to each other. It may be a little thinner than ½-inch (1 cm) thick but will still work. The package sizes may range between 397 g and 500 g and any of these will work for this recipe.
---
Recipe ID: e9ab2618-d006-415d-941d-4d2f5ca24bcc
Recipe Title: Grilled Marinated Beef Sandwich with Melted Onions
Recipe Summary: This flavourful sandwich is a twist on the traditional hot beef sandwich! Serve with a bun top as a hand-held meal or open-faced for knife-and-fork dining. Take advantage of garden-fresh baby greens for a pop of brightness and a enjoy with a light beer or flavoured water for a bistro-style dinner or lunch.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 60
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 95
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) olive oil, divided
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) red wine vinegar
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- Salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Tri-tip Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 4 small steaks)
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 1 sweet onion (such as Vidalia), sliced
	- 1 whole wheat or regular baguette, quartered and halved lengthwise
	- Olive oil or softened butter
	- 2 cups (500 mL) baby arugula
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Red wine vinegar
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Salt
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Bottom Sirloin Tri-tip Grilling Steak, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about 4 small steaks)
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- 1 sweet onion
	- 1 whole wheat or regular baguette
	- Olive oil or softened butter
	- Baby arugula
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine 2 tbsp (30 mL) oil, vinegar, garlic, hot pepper flakes and ½ tsp (2 mL) salt in sealable freezer bag. Transfer 2 tbsp (30 mL) of marinade to a small bowl; set aside. Pierce meat all over with a fork; add to marinade in bag, turning to coat. Seal and refrigerate for 1 hour.
	 2. Remove steaks from marinade; discard marinade. Pat steaks dry with paper towel; season all over with salt and pepper. Grill steaks in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Grill baguette pieces, cut side down, over medium heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until warmed, if desired. Transfer steaks to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 10 minutes. Brush oil over grilled sides of baguettes.
	3. Meanwhile, heat remaining 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium heat in nonstick skillet; cook onion, stirring often, for 10 minutes or until softened and golden. Remove from heat and toss with reserved marinade.
