	4. Slice steaks thinly on the diagonal. Drape slices of steak on each baguette bottom piece. Top each with warm onions and arugula and top of baguette.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: ea071060-deca-46a7-8105-37664180d150
Recipe Title: Stir-Fried Ginger Beef and Mushrooms
Recipe Summary: A variety of textures and colours are a feature of most stir-fries. Here, tender Beef Stir-Fry Strips pair up with delicious crisp-tender vegetables and velvety mushrooms. For convenience you can slice or chop ingredients and refrigerate for up to one day ahead. 
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 15
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 55
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) reduced-sodium soy sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) rice vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sugar
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) sesame oil
	- 4 tsp (20 mL) cornstarch
	- 8 oz (250 g) Beef Stir-Fry Strips
	- 1 cup (250 mL) wholegrain brown rice
	- 6 baby bok choy
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil, divided
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) julienned gingerroot
	- 3 large cloves garlic, minced
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes (optional)
	- 2 EACH medium carrots, thinly sliced and medium onions, sliced
	- 8 oz (227 g) sliced white or crimini mushrooms
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chicken broth or water
	- ½ cup (125 mL) frozen corn kernels, thawed (optional)
	- ½ cup (125 mL) unsalted peanuts
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped cilantro leaves or sliced green onions
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Reduced-sodium soy sauce
	- Rice vinegar
	- Sugar
	- Sesame oil
	- Cornstarch
	- 8 oz (250 g) Beef Stir-Fry Strips
	- Wholegrain brown rice
	- 6 baby bok choy
	- Vegetable oil
	- Julienned gingerroot
	- 3 large cloves garlic
	- Hot pepper flakes (optional)
	- Carrots
	- Sliced white or crimini mushrooms
	- Chicken broth or water
	- Frozen corn kernels
	- Unsalted peanuts
	- Cilantro leaves or green onions
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk together soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, sesame oil and cornstarch together in small measuring cup. Pour half into a medium bowl for marinade and set remaining aside. Add stir-fry strips to marinade and toss to coat; cover and refrigerate for 15 to 30 minutes.
	 2. Meanwhile cook rice according to package directions. Separate individual bok choy leaves from stalks; set aside. Remove beef from marinade with slotted spoon, reserving marinade. Place beef on a plate. 
	 3. Heat 2 tsp (10 mL) of the vegetable oil over medium heat in large nonstick skillet or wok until hot. Add gingerroot, garlic and hot pepper flakes (if using); stir-fry for 30 seconds or until fragrant but not browned. Add beef to skillet. Cook for about 1 minute per side, or until browned. Transfer to a clean bowl; keep warm.
	 4. Add remaining vegetable oil to the skillet; stir-fry bok choy, carrots, onions and mushrooms for 3 to 5 minutes or until carrots start to soften. Add broth and corn (if using); cover and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are just tender-crisp. Push vegetables to the sides of skillet. 
	5. Pour reserved soy sauce mixture and leftover marinade into centre of skillet; boil for 1 minute, stirring constantly until slightly thickened. Return beef mixture along with any accumulated juices to skillet and add peanuts; toss with vegetables and heat through. Serve over hot rice and garnish with cilantro.
Recipe Tips:
  - For making stir-fry at home, a large, flat-bottomed skillet works better than a wok since it’s difficult to get enough heat on a home stove for using a wok, unless you are cooking on a gas stove-top.
---
Recipe ID: ea159ec7-8586-4040-a7ac-254116abaa87
Recipe Title: Classic Cabbage Rolls
Recipe Summary: Although not difficult to make, cabbage rolls do take some time to prepare and assemble but are well worth the effort. Although not traditional, you can substitute basmati rice for the long-grain rice. Serve with simple boiled potatoes, steamed green beans and a dollop of sour cream for a decadent and cool finish.
Recipe Prep Time: 45
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 180
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 green cabbage, about 4 lb (2 kg)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
	- 1 onion, finely chopped
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- ½ cup (125 mL) uncooked long-grain white rice
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sweet paprika
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 egg, beaten
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 bay leaves
	- 1 jar (680 mL) strained puréed tomatoes (passata)
	- 2 cups (500 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth (approx)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 green cabbage
	- Olive oil
	- 1 onion
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Long-grain white rice
	- Sweet paprika
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Extra Lean Ground Beef 
	- 1 egg
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 4 bay leaves
	- Strained puréed tomatoes
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
Recipe Methods:
	1. Place cabbage on a cutting board with the bottom pointing up. Firmly push a fork into the core of the cabbage and grip the fork to hold the cabbage in place. Using the tip of a thin sharp knife, insert point-down just outside the core on an angle, then cut around the core to remove (the core should be a cone shape once removed). 
	 2. Bring 3 inches (8 cm) of water to a boil in a large, deep pot over medium-high heat. Place cabbage, core-side down, in water. Cook cabbage, covered, for 3 to 5 minutes or until outer leaves are wilted and pliable. Leaving cabbage in the pot, use tongs to carefully pull outer leaves from cabbage and transfer to a paper towel-lined baking sheet. If leaves do not release easily, cover pot again and steam cabbage for an additional 2 to 3 minutes, continuing process until there are 18 to 20 large leaves. Drain remaining head of cabbage and set aside. Let leaves cool completely. 
	 3. Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in a medium nonstick skillet. Cook onions and garlic, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until starting to soften. Add rice and paprika; cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until well coated. Transfer to a large bowl; let cool completely. Gently mix in ground beef, egg, salt and pepper with a fork (careful not to over-mix).
	  4. Thinly slice remaining cabbage on the head and arrange 2 cups (500 mL) in bottom of a greased large roasting pan. Set aside remaining sliced cabbage to cover rolls once assembled. Trim hard veins from center of each large cabbage leaf; discard.
	 5. Working with one leaf at a time, place 2 tbsp (30 mL) beef filling on core end of the leaf, fold in sides over filling and roll up tightly from core-end to tip of leaf to enclose. Place rolls, seam side down, in prepared roasting pan. Top with bay leaves.
	6. Pour passata and broth over cabbage rolls to cover. Add a splash of broth or water to the passata jar, cap with lid and shake to rinse jar; pour into the pan. (If cabbage rolls are not covered, add some water or additional broth). Top with reserved sliced cabbage.
	 7. Cover and bake in preheated 350°F oven for 1½ hours or until cabbage is tender. Uncover and add up to 2 cups (500 mL) water or additional broth if cabbage rolls look dry. Bake, uncovered, for an additional 30 to 45 minutes or until sauce has thickened. Discard bay leaves. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
Recipe Tips:
  - For big and bold flavours, layer sauerkraut and a few strips of lightly cooked bacon strips over the cabbage rolls before baking. A savoy cabbage will work just as well for this recipe but the cabbage rolls may bake slightly faster due to the thinner, more tender leaves.
---
Recipe ID: ea4db3ee-ce5f-465b-92e0-c9c839473bb5
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Pistou
Recipe Summary: Serve grilled beef steaks with boiled new potatoes. Pistou is the French version of Italian pesto sauce. Serve with boiled new potatoes and steamed vegetables
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 cup (250 mL) packed fresh basil leaves (about two 28-g packages)
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) freshly grated Parmesan cheese
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) tomato paste
	- 3 tbsp (45mL) olive oil
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 2 T-Bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
	- 1 lemon, cut in half crosswise (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Fresh basil leaves
	- Grated Parmesan cheese
	- Tomato paste
	- Olive oil
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 2 T-Bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
	- 1 lemon (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Chop garlic and basil in mini chopper or tall cup using an immersion blender, pulsing 10 to 20 times. Add Parmesan and tomato paste and pulse about 10 times or until blended. Add 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the oil and purée until blended; add enough of the remaining oil until desired consistency. If you prefer a thinner sauce, add a little water. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
	2. Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat, turning at least twice, for about 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Meanwhile, if desired, grill lemon halves, cut-side down, for about 4 minutes or until browned. 
	3. Transfer steaks to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Brush steaks with some of the pistou. Slice across the grain and serve with grilled lemons (if using) and pistou on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to let steaks rest for about 5 minutes after cooking so that the juices get the chance to settle before you serve or slice.
---
Recipe ID: eaf48b57-e4a8-4a3d-88dd-487141c5d54c
Recipe Title: Grilled Rosemary Beef Skewers with Winter Salad
Recipe Summary: Include vegetables and fruits rich in Vitamin C with your meals to boost iron absorption. The oranges, grapes, beets and pomegranate juice in this recipe are clever food combos that do just that. BONUS: These ingredients provide powerful antioxidants too.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 8
Recipe Marinating Time: 15
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 53
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) EACH pomegranate juice and canola oil
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) EACH maple syrup and red wine vinegar
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH Dijon mustard and grated orange zest
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) minced fresh rosemary
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick, cut into thin strips
	- 12 skewers
	- 4 oranges, peels cut off
	- 1 cup (250 mL) halved red seedless grapes
	- 1 can (14 oz/398 mL) beets, drained, rinsed and quartered
	- 8 cups (2 L) mixed salad greens, such as baby spinach, radicchio, Belgian endive and frisée lettuce
	- ½ cup (125 mL) chopped toasted salted or tamari almonds
	- Salt and pepper (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Pomegranate juice
	- Canola oil
	- Maple syrup
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Dijon mustard
	- 4 oranges
	- Fresh rosemary
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Cap Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick, cut into thin strips
	- 12 skewers
	- Red seedless grapes
	- Beets
	- Mixed salad greens, such as baby spinach, radicchio, Belgian endive and frisée lettuce
	- Chopped toasted salted or tamari almonds
	- Salt and pepper (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Whisk together pomegranate juice, oil, maple syrup, vinegar, mustard and orange zest in a large bowl. Pour ¼ cup (60 mL) of dressing into a shallow container; stir in rosemary and add beef strips, tossing to coat. Let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes or cover and refrigerate for up to 4 hours. If using bamboo skewers, soak in water for at least 30 minutes.
	2. Meanwhile, working over the large bowl with dressing, cut oranges between membranes into segments, letting any juice release into dressing; discard membranes. Add segments, grapes and beets to dressing; toss to coat. Set aside.
	3. Remove beef from marinade; discard marinade. Pat beef dry with paper towel. Thread beef strips onto skewers. Broil on a rack on a rimmed baking sheet, or grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C), for about 3 minutes per side, until browned and cooked to medium-rare at the least. 
	4. Gently toss greens with dressing mixture and almonds. Season with salt and pepper to taste, if desired. Serve salad into shallow bowls and top each with 2 beef skewers.
Recipe Tips:
  - Ensure beef cubes are all of similar size to ensure the cubes cook at the same rate.
---
Recipe ID: eb91016b-242d-43d4-96d7-6dbd54340ddd
Recipe Title: Moroccan Ground Beef Stir-Fry
Recipe Summary: This Moroccan-inspired recipe features spices you probably already have in your cupboard that will turn ground beef into an interesting supper dish with exotic North African flavours. Serve over steaming hot couscous to soak up the sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef
	- 1 onion, chopped
	- 1 EACH carrot and sweet red pepper, cut into matchstick pieces
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) paprika
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH ground ginger, cumin and cinnamon
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) EACH hot pepper flakes, salt and pepper
	- 1 can (28 oz/796 mL) diced tomatoes, with juice
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) sliced green olives
	- Toasted pine nuts or slivered almonds
	- Chopped fresh cilantro
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) Extra Lean Ground Beef
	- 1 onion
	- Carrot
	- Sweet red pepper
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Paprika
	- Ground ginger
	- Cumin
	- Cinnamon
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Salt and pepper
	- Diced tomatoes
	- Sliced green olives
	- Toasted pine nuts or slivered almonds
	- Chopped fresh cilantro
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook ground beef, onion, carrots and sweet pepper over medium-high heat in large skillet, breaking beef up into small chunks with back of spoon, for 8 to 10 minutes, or until beef is completely cooked and vegetables are tender-crisp. Drain if necessary.
	 2. Stir in garlic, paprika, ginger, cumin, cinnamon, hot pepper flakes, salt and pepper; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes with juice; bring to boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer, covered, for 5 to 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
	3. Stir in olives; heat through. Garnish with pine nuts and cilantro to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Ground beef is 100% beef with no additives, fillers or colours.
---
Recipe ID: ec99caf3-b809-47fb-a3f2-b04542e73d49
Recipe Title: Pesto-Stuffed Rolled Oven Roast
Recipe Summary: Roast beef with an impressive presentation –a spiral stuffed roast with a flavourful pesto stuffing. When purchasing the Eye of Round roast, ask for the centre cut that is not tapered and one that is 4 inches (10 cm) or less in diameter. This will make it easier to cut into an even thickness and form a rectangle that is easy to stuff and roll. For convenience, you can ask the butcher to roll-cut (or spiral-cut) the roast for you and purchase prepared pesto. 
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 150
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 slices bread, crusts removed
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) prepared basil pesto
	- 1 cup (250 mL) fresh Italian parsley leaves
	- 2 lb (1 kg)Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast, well trimmed
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 slices bread
	- Basil pesto
	- Italian parsley leaves
	- 2 lb (1 kg)Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast, well trimmed
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Olive oil
Recipe Methods:
	1. Tear bread into chunks and place in small food processor. Add pesto and parsley; process to form paste. Set aside.
	 2. Place roast on a cutting board with one round end toward you. Starting on one side at the top, with the knife parallel to the cutting board, cut horizontally into ½-inch (1 cm) thickness, while slowly rolling the roast in the opposite direction, cutting as you “unroll” from the centre to form a flat, rectangular strip. Pound gently with a jagged side of the meat mallet to even thickness, about ¼ inch (5 mm). Season with salt and pepper to your taste. Set aside.
	3. Spread paste evenly over meat, leaving a ½-inch (1 cm) border around edge. Starting with a short side, roll up like a jelly roll. Tie tightly in 1-inch (2.5 cm) intervals with butcher’s twine to secure. Brush with olive oil; season with salt and pepper to your taste.
	 4. Place on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast, making sure tip is in meat, not stuffing. Roast, uncovered, in preheated 300°F oven for about 2 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	 5. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Cut across the grain into ¼-inch (5 mm) thick slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - To prep this roast ahead for entertaining, you can cut and pound the meat up to 1 day ahead. Roll up and wrap tightly, then refrigerate for up to 1 day. Make the pesto stuffing up to 8 hours ahead, transfer to a bowl, cover and refrigerate until about 30 minutes before assembling the roast. Assemble just before roasting.
---
Recipe ID: ec9ba58f-c23f-46c6-9f3c-d74e9f9b107f
Recipe Title: Classic Baked Meat Loaf with Pepper Jelly Glaze 
Recipe Summary: When it comes to comfort food, meat loaf is the perfect definition! It doesn't have to be fussy, but can take on some interesting twists with just a few embellishments. Adding finely shredded carrot and milk-soaked fresh bread crumbs to the meat loaf mix before cooking helps keep meat loaf moist and tender.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 80
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) vegetable oil
	- 1 onion, diced
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 carrot, shredded
	- 1 egg
	- ½ cup (125 mL) milk
	- 2 slices bread, finely chopped
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH Dijon mustard and Worcestershire sauce
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- ½ cup (125 mL) red pepper jelly
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) unsweetened apple sauce (optional)
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) ketchup
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Worcestershire sauce
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Vegetable oil
	- 1 onion
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 carrot
	- 1 egg
	- Milk
	- 2 slices bread
	- Dijon mustard
	- Worcestershire sauce
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Lean Ground Beef
	- Red pepper jelly
	- Unsweetened apple sauce (optional)
	- Ketchup
Recipe Methods:
	1. Meat Loaf: Heat oil over medium-high heat in a skillet. Cook onion, garlic and carrot, stirring for 5 minutes or until softened. Set aside.
	 2. Beat egg and milk together with a fork in a large bowl; blend in bread, mustard, Worcestershire, salt and pepper. Mix in ground beef and reserved onion, garlic and carrot (don't over-mix). Set aside.
	3. Pepper Jelly Glaze: Combine red pepper jelly, apple sauce (if using), ketchup and Worcestershire sauce in a microwaveable bowl. Microwave on high for 1 to 2 minutes or until bubbling, stirring once. (NOTE: To cook on the stove-top, combine in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat; boil, stirring, for 1 minute.) Set aside ⅓ cup (75 mL). Let cool. 
	 4. Preheat oven to 350°F. Form ground beef mixture into a loaf shape (about 9 inches/23 cm long by 5 inches/12 cm wide) on lightly oiled foil or parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet or large oven-safe casserole OR place in foil-lined 9 x 5-inch (2 L) loaf pan. (NOTE: By cooking the loaf free-form on a baking sheet there is more crust formed than if baked in a loaf pan.)
	5. Top with the reserved ⅓ cup (75 mL) Pepper Jelly Glaze. Cook in the 350°F oven for 55 to 70 minutes until digital instant-read thermometer inserted into centre of loaf reads 160°F (71°C). (If baked in loaf pan, using foil, lift meat loaf from pan, draining off any fat.) Tent with foil and let stand 10 minutes. Cut into slices and serve with remaining Pepper Jelly Glaze.
Recipe Tips:
  - Ground beef is 100% beef with no additives, fillers or colours.
---
Recipe ID: ecd5d539-d7be-4e5c-ad2b-f5cd3573e4bb
Recipe Title: Beef Khichdo 
Recipe Summary: This fragrant beef stew is full of barley, lentils, rice and even oatmeal along with quality Canadian Beef—it’s comfort food in a bowl. This recipe brings back memories of family gatherings with everyone enjoying an almost one-pot meal. While there are many different versions of this recipe, this is my mom’s version, which I truly love. 
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 145
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 165
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) pearl barley
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH mixed lentils (see Tip) and basmati rice 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) canola or sunflower oil
	- 1 cup (250 mL) fried onions* 
	- 4 whole black peppercorns 
	- 2 EACH cinnamon sticks, whole cloves and cardamom pods 
	- 1 cup (250 mL) canned crushed tomatoes 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH garlic paste and gingerroot paste*
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) salt 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground cumin and ground coriander 
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground turmeric 
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Boneless Blade Pot Roast or Simmering Steak, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- 1 kiwi, peeled and chopped
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) quick-cooking rolled oats
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) garam masala
	- Fresh cilantro and mint leaves, chopped
	- Green chili peppers, chopped
	- Lemon wedges
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Fried onions* 
	- Garlic paste*
	- Gingerroot paste* 
	- 1 kiwi
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Fresh mint
	- Green chili peppers
	- 1 or 2 lemons
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Boneless Blade Pot Roast or Simmering Steak, cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Whole black peppercorns 
	- Cinnamon sticks
	- Whole cloves
	- Cardamom pods 
	- Canned crushed tomatoes 
	- Salt 
	- Ground cumin
	- Ground coriander 
	- Ground turmeric 
	- Garam masala
	- Pearl barley
	- Mixed lentils (see Tip)
	- Basmati rice
	- Quick-cooking rolled oats 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine barley, lentils and rice in a medium bowl. Add enough water to cover by 3 inches (7.5 cm). Cover and let soak in the refrigerator overnight.
	2. Drain barley mixture and transfer to a large saucepan. Add 4 cups (1 L) fresh water and bring to a boil over high heat. Cook at a constant, rolling boil for 20 to 30 minutes or until soft. Remove from heat.
	3. Purée in the saucepan using an immersion blender (or let cool slightly and transfer in batches to an upright blender), blending until fairly smooth. Set aside.
	4. Heat oil over medium heat in a large enamelled cast-iron roaster, Dutch oven or heavy stock pot. Add peppercorns, cinnamon, cloves and cardamom; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add fried onions and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add tomatoes, garlic, gingerroot, salt, cumin, coriander and turmeric; cook, stirring, for about 10 to 15 minutes or until the mixture separates from the oil. 
	6. Stir in beef and kiwi, mixing well. Stir in puréed barley, oats and 4 cups (1 L) water. Bring to a simmer, stirring often.
	7. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 1½ to 2 hours, stirring often, until beef is fork-tender. 
	Stir in garam masala, cilantro and mint to taste and a squeeze of lemon. 
	8. Serve garnished with additional cilantro and mint, chili peppers and lemon wedges to squeeze over top.
Recipe Tips:
  - I use a mix of red lentils, split chickpeas, split black lentils and split mung beans but you can also just use a combination of two of these. *For the garlic and gingerroot paste, you can use the purée or paste found in jars in the grocery store or use a fine grater, such as a Microplane, to make your own purée in small amounts just as you need it. **Fried onions, which are crispy, dehydrated fried onions, can be found in packages or containers at any Indian grocery store or in the Southeast Asian section of well-stocked supermarkets.
---
Recipe ID: ed89cb0c-8fff-4915-ac09-d4c74e11306b
Recipe Title: Pan-Seared Steak with Poached Pears and Port-Cherry Sauce
Recipe Summary: Live a little luxury with this special recipe for two, featuring Beef Rib Eye steak, seared pears and a luscious dried cherry sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) butter
	- 1 large clove garlic, crushed or minced
	- 1 cup (250 mL) beef broth
	- ½ cup (125 mL) port 
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) pear nectar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) dried cherries
	- 1 medium pear, firm but ripe, peeled, cored and cut in half
	- 1 Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 10 oz/300 g)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) coarsely ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) crumbled blue cheese
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Butter
	- 1 large clove garlic
	- Beef broth
	- Port
	- Pear nectar
	- Dried cherries
	- 1 medium pear
	- 1 Beef Rib Eye Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 10 oz/300 g)
	- Ground pepper
	- Vegetable oil
	- Crumbled blue cheese
Recipe Methods:
	1. Melt butter over medium heat in skillet; add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute, until softened. Add broth, port, pear nectar and cherries; bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium and add pear halves, cut side down. Cover and cook for 10 to 15 minutes, until tender, turning and basting occasionally. Remove pears and set aside. Reduce heat to low and boil gently, stirring occasionally, for 12 to 15 minutes, until sauce is syrupy and reduced to about ⅓ cup (75 mL). Cover and keep warm. 
	2. Meanwhile, pat steak dry with paper towel. Season all over with pepper. In a second lightly oiled skillet, heat over medium-high; pan-fry steak for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Transfer to a plate and let rest for 5 minutes.
	3. Return skillet used to cook steak to medium heat. Add port mixture to the pan, scraping up any brown bits from the bottom of the skillet.
	4. Cut steak into 2 portions and serve both with sauce, poached pear slices and top with crumbled blue cheese. 
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: edbc0082-befd-4b7a-920f-ce3b9278007d
Recipe Title: Air-Fryer Steak Frites for Two with Garlic Aioli
Recipe Summary: Choose to dine-in with this date-night worthy dinner that is so simple to prepare. The air fryer takes care of the tender and juicy Strip Loin Steak, cooked to your liking, while the fries bake in the oven. All served with a bistro-inspired homemade aioli! Wine anyone? Time saver tip: substitute fresh-cut potato with 8 oz (250 g) frozen fries (about 2 cups/500 mL) and serve with a store-bought aioli or garlic mayonnaise. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 35
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Oven-Roasted Frites
		- 1 large russet potato (unpeeled), scrubbed
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and fresh ground pepper
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) finely shredded Parmesan cheese
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) finely chopped fresh thyme (optional)
	- Air-fryer Steak
		- ¾ lb (375 g) Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (1 steak)
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) olive oil 
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) coarsely ground pepper
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- Garlic Aioli
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) mayonnaise
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH olive oil and finely shredded Parmesan cheese
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH finely grated lemon zest and fresh lemon juice
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) finely chopped fresh thyme or pinch dried thyme leaves
		- 1 small clove garlic, minced
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 large russet potato
	- olive oil
	- Salt
	- fresh ground pepper
	- shredded Parmesan cheese
	- fresh thyme (optional)
	- ¾ lb (375 g)  Beef Strip Loin Grilling Steak
	- mayonnaise
	- lemon
	- 1 small clove garlic
Recipe Methods:
	1. Oven-Roasted Frites: Cut potato lengthwise into ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices. Place slices cut-side down and cut into thin sticks, about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick. Toss with oil, salt and pepper in a medium bowl and arrange in single layer on parchment paper-lined rimmed baking sheet. Roast fries in preheated 425°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown around the edges with a tender center. Sprinkle Parmesan and thyme (if using) over fries. 
	2. Air-fryer Steak: Meanwhile, pat steak dry with paper towel; rub with oil and season all over with coarse pepper and salt. Place steak in basket of air fryer and cook at 400°F (200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. 
	3. Garlic Aioli: Meanwhile, combine mayonnaise, olive oil, Parmesan, lemon zest, lemon juice, thyme and garlic in a small bowl.
	 4. Slice steak across the grain and serve with Oven-roasted Frites and Garlic Aioli for dipping.
Recipe Tips:
  - For the best browning, do not turn steak during cooking in air-fryer.
  - Alternatively, grill steak in a preheated closed barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more, until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
---
Recipe ID: ef015393-8f74-4775-8d5e-17bcdbdab7bf
Recipe Title: Grilled Chipotle Big Basted Marinated Steak
Recipe Summary: The secret to getting a subtle smoky flavour for steak without using soaked wood chips is to use chipotle peppers in adobo sauce in a marinade and barbecue basting and dipping sauce. The chipotle peppers combined with the salsa here add a touch of heat as well.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 480
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 495
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 cup (250 mL) steak sauce
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) salsa
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) Dijon mustard
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Medallions, ¾ inch (2 cm) thick (about four 6-oz/175 g steaks)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- Sliced green onions (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Steak sauce
	- Salsa
	- Dijon mustard
	- Chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 2 green onions
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Inside Round Marinating Medallions
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper 
	- Sliced green onions (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine steak sauce, salsa, mustard, chipotle peppers, garlic and green onions in large sealable freezer bag. Transfer ¼ cup (60 mL) to a small bowl for basting and ¼ cup (60 mL) to another bowl for dipping sauce; cover and refrigerate both bowls. Pierce steaks all over with a fork. Add to bag, turning to coat; seal and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
	2. Discard marinade from meat; pat steaks dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C), brushing with reserved basting sauce, for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾-inch (2 cm) thick steaks, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
	3. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 5 minutes before serving with reserved dipping sauce. Garnish with green onions, if desired.
Recipe Tips:
  - Use a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak for the best way to determine doneness.
---
Recipe ID: ef6e532f-abb9-40dd-93e3-5987837944e3
Recipe Title: Moroccan-Spiced Grilled Steak
Recipe Summary: Simple spices combine to lend an exotic touch to a juicy, thick steak. Present this on your favourite cutting board and carve at the table to serve. Serve with a rice and vegetable pilaf.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 20
Recipe Marinating Time: 120
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 145
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH paprika and ground coriander
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH ground cumin and chopped fresh mint
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) brown sugar
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH ground allspice and salt
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) fresh ground pepper
	- 1 Bone-in Prime Rib Grilling Steak, 1½ inch (4 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- paprika
	- ground cumin
	- brown sugar
	- ground allspice
	- fresh ground pepper
	- 1 Bone-in Prime Rib Grilling Steak, 1½ inch (4 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg)
	- ground coriander
	- chopped fresh mint
	- salt
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine paprika, coriander, cumin, mint, brown sugar, allspice, salt and pepper in a bowl. Rub all over steak. Place on a plate; cover and refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours.
	2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). 
	3. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into middle of steak, not touching bone. Grill steak over direct medium-high heat in a closed barbecue for 3 to 4 minutes, turning twice or more, or until browned. Place over drip pan; turn off burner under drip plan. Close lid and cook for about 10 to 15 minutes for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least.
	4. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Carve meat from the bone, then across the grain into slices to serve.
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to let steaks rest for about 5 minutes after cooking so that the juices get the chance to settle before you slice.
---
Recipe ID: f12668ea-ee63-4d83-851e-0111715b0480
Recipe Title: Barbecue-Roasted Porchetta-Style Rolled Beef Roast
Recipe Summary: With the bold flavours of fresh herbs, fennel seeds and garlic, this barbecue-roasted Inside Round Roast is perfect to serve when hosting a crowd, served with roasted potatoes and sautéed rapini. Or as impressive sandwiches, tuck thin slices of roast beef into toasted ciabatta buns and load on jarred roasted red peppers, arugula, provolone cheese and a mixture of sun-dried tomato pesto and mayonnaise. 
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 75
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 105
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) EACH finely chopped fresh parsley and sage
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh rosemary
	- 6 cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated lemon zest
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fresh lemon juice 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) fennel seeds, lightly crushed
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- 4 lb (2 kg) Beef Inside Round Oven Roast 
	- Butcher’s twine
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Olive oil
	- Fresh parsley
	- Sage
	- Fresh rosemary
	- 6 cloves garlic
	- Lemon
	- Fennel seeds
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- 4 lb (2 kg)  Beef Inside Round Oven Roast 
	- Butcher’s twine
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine olive oil, parsley, sage, rosemary, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, fennel seeds, salt, pepper and hot pepper flakes in a small bowl; set aside. 
	 2. Pat roast dry with paper towel. Using a carving knife, slice roast in half lengthwise, stopping when you are about 1 inch (2.5 cm) from bottom of the roast. Open the roast up like a book and cut one side to ‘unroll’ the roast to be about 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick. Repeat with the other side so that you end up with a rectangular piece of meat that is about 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick. Using the textured side of a meat mallet, pound beef to even thickness, if needed. 
	3. Spread three-quarters of the herb mixture over the inside of the beef (cut side). Starting at one long side, roll roast up into a log, jelly-roll style. Tie with butcher’s string, at about 2-inch (5 cm) intervals. Brush remaining herb mixture all over outside of roast. Set aside in refrigerator while you heat up the barbecue.
	 4. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). 
	 5. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1¼ to 1¾ hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	  6. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Cut twine and remove. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - Letting roast rest and carving it thinly across the grain will help ensure meat is tender and juicy.
---
Recipe ID: f3520bab-f79b-4711-84f4-046202e76ee6
Recipe Title: Barbecued Beef Roast with Coffee Cocoa Rub
Recipe Summary: Rubbed with the bold and rich flavours of coffee, cocoa and chili powder, this indirect heat barbecued roast is balanced by basting with a classic and sweet store-bought barbecue sauce. Make sure to pat roast dry for best browning and flavour. 
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 75
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 85
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH vegetable oil and apple cider vinegar 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH instant espresso powder or instant coffee and cocoa powder
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH chili powder, fresh ground pepper and brown sugar
	- 2 tsp (10 mL) salt 
	- ⅔ cup (150 mL) store-bought barbecue sauce
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Apple cider vinegar
	- Vegetable oil
	- Cocoa powder
	- Instant espresso powder or instant coffee
	- Chili powder
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Brown sugar
	- Salt
	- Barbecue sauce
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Eye of Round Oven Roast
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine oil, vinegar, espresso powder, cocoa powder, chili powder, pepper, brown sugar and salt. Stir 1 tbsp (15 mL) coffee-cocoa rub into barbecue sauce; set aside. Pat roast dry with paper towel and brush evenly with remaining coffee-cocoa rub. 
	 2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F/200°C). 
	3. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook for about 1¼ to 1½ hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium at the most).
	 4. Transfer roast to a cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with reserved barbecue sauce mixture.
Recipe Tips:
  - Leftover roast beef can be diced and simmered in barbecue sauce, and then served in warm corn tortillas with guacamole, corn, jalapeño slices and crumbled feta. Eye of Round is a very lean cut, so our recommendation is to cook no more than to medium doneness and to slice thinly.
---
Recipe ID: f440f480-432f-4c86-acda-3829a7e83445
Recipe Title: Pan-Fried Peppered Garlic Beef Bites
Recipe Summary: This dish is quick to prepare and packed with flavour. Serve with a crisp green salad and crusty bread.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 30
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Rib Finger Meat 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) oyster sauce
	- 1½ tsp (7 mL) fresh ground pepper 
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) granulated garlic
	- 1 to 2 tbsp (15 to 30 mL) vegetable oil
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) unsalted butter
	- 4 large cloves garlic, minced
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) minced fresh parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Rib Finger Meat 
	- Oyster sauce
	- Fresh ground pepper
	- Granulated garlic
	- Vegetable oil
	- Unsalted butter
	- 4 large cloves garlic
	- Fresh parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim excess fat from the meat to your taste. Starting at the thicker end of each piece of meat, make a cut in between the meat and the fibrous silverskin, lifting the fat and silver skin away from the meat while you trim along the strip of meat. (Tip: Grip the silverskin with a paper towel to prevent slipping.) Discard the trim. Cut the meat crosswise into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces. Place in a bowl and add oyster sauce, pepper and granulated garlic, tossing to coat.
	 2. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Cook beef, in batches, for about 2 to 3 minutes per side, letting the beef brown without moving it around to develop a good crust before turning, until well browned on both sides and a digital instant-read thermometer inserted into cubes reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer to a plate. Add more oil to pan between batches, as necessary.
	3. Add butter to skillet and melt over medium heat. Cook garlic, stirring, for about 1 minute or until golden around the edges. Add the beef and quickly toss to coat it in the garlic butter. Toss with the parsley and serve immediately.
Recipe Tips:
  - The membrane on finger meat is tough. Removing it before cooking makes the meat significantly more tender.
---
Recipe ID: f485bf72-190e-432e-b0df-f8f34df3a9a1
Recipe Title: Horseradish-Crusted Oven Roast with Classic Pan Gravy
Recipe Summary: The horseradish and cracked pepper crust makes simple seem special with this oven roast. To crack the peppercorns, place them in a sturdy plastic freezer bag and crush with the back of a heavy skillet or hammer. Our time-test results are based on a roast that was about 7¼-in (18 cm) long x 5¼-in (13 cm wide) x 3½-in (9 cm) deep. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as oven and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 135
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 150
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) prepared horseradish
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) cracked multi-coloured peppercorns
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) coarse salt (such kosher or Maldon)
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Outside Round Oven Roast
	- Classic Pan Gravy
		- ½ cup (125 mL) red wine
		- 1 cup (250 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
		- A few sprigs fresh thyme
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp (15 mL) cold water
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
		- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Horseradish
	- Cracked multi-coloured peppercorns
	- Coarse salt (such kosher or Maldon)
	- 3 lb (1.5 kg) Beef Outside Round Oven Roast
	- Classic Pan Sauce
	- Red wine
	- Reduced-sodium beef broth
	- Fresh thyme
	- Corn starch
	- Butter
	- Salt and pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat roast dry with paper towel and pierce all over with a fork. Combine horseradish, peppercorns and salt in small bowl; brush all over roast. 
	 2. Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Oven-sear in preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes. 
	3.Reduce oven to 275°F; roast, uncovered, for about 2 hours for medium-rare, removing from oven when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). NOTE: See ‘AVERAGE ROAST COOKING TIMES’ chart below for timing estimates for all types and sizes of beef roasts.
	 4. Transfer roast to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes.
	 5.&nbsp;Classic Pan Gravy:&nbsp;Meanwhile, add&nbsp;wine&nbsp;to pan drippings; bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits stuck to pan. Pour in beef broth; add thyme and bring to a simmer.&nbsp;Gradually stir cornstarch mixture into pan. Boil, whisking, for about 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Add butter and stir until melted. Discard thyme stems. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Carve roast across the grain into thin slices and serve with gravy.
Recipe Tips:
  - Piercing the roast with a long barbecue fork before roasting and carving the cooked roast beef across the grain into very thin slices optimizes tenderness.
---
Recipe ID: f538306a-12ab-4cc4-9129-8b7b638e6565
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak with Pistou
Recipe Summary: Serve grilled beef steaks with boiled new potatoes. Pistou is the French version of Italian pesto sauce. Serve with boiled new potatoes and steamed vegetables
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 25
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- 1 cup (250 mL) packed fresh basil leaves (about two 28-g packages)
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) freshly grated Parmesan cheese
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) tomato paste
	- 3 tbsp (45mL) olive oil
	- Salt and freshly ground pepper
	- 2 T-Bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 2¼ lb/1.125 kg)
	- 1 lemon, cut in half crosswise (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- fresh basil leaves
	- grated Parmesan cheese
	- tomato paste
	- olive oil
	- salt
	- freshly ground pepper
	- 2 T-Bone Grilling Steaks
	- 1 lemon (optional)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Chop garlic and basil in mini chopper or tall cup using an immersion blender, pulsing 10 to 20 times. Add Parmesan and tomato paste and pulse about 10 times or until blended. Add 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the oil and purée until blended; add enough of the remaining oil until desired consistency. If you prefer a thinner sauce, add a little water. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
	2. Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season with salt and pepper to your taste. Grill in a closed barbecue over medium-high heat, turning at least twice, for about 10 to 12 minutes for 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick steaks for medium-rare 145°F (63°C) at the least. Meanwhile, if desired, grill lemon halves, cut-side down, for about 4 minutes or until browned. 
	3. Transfer steaks to cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Brush steaks with some of the pistou. Slice across the grain and serve with grilled lemons (if using) and pistou on the side.
Recipe Tips:
  - Be sure to let steaks rest for about 5 minutes after cooking so that the juices get the chance to settle before you serve or slice.
---
Recipe ID: f54a1e0b-b3b1-4d05-be19-22b075353d9e
Recipe Title: Beef Biryani
Recipe Summary: This fragrant beef and rice dish is a staple at any celebratory dinner. From weddings to important days, beef biryani is a must! It was served at my henna party the day before my wedding. Every celebration must have biryani. The raw papaya has strong tenderizing powers.
Recipe Prep Time: 30
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 120
Recipe Marinating Time: 120
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 270
Recipe Servings: 8
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Pinch saffron threads 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) milk
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Boneless Blade Simmering Steak
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced papaya
	- 1 cup (250 mL) plain yogurt
	- 1 cup (250 mL) chopped tomatoes
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH gingerroot paste and garlic paste (See Tip*)
	- ¼ tsp (1 mL) ground turmeric
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) fresh lemon juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) EACH chopped fresh cilantro and mint
	- Salt
	- 2 cups (500 mL) basmati rice
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- 4 small potatoes, cut in half 
	- 4 cardamom pods
	- 4 whole cloves
	- 2 cinnamon sticks 
	- Yellow food colouring
	- 1½ cups (375 mL) fried onions, divided (See Tip**) 
	- Additional plain yogurt
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Papaya
	- 2 tomatoes
	- Gingerroot paste
	- Garlic paste
	- 1 lemon
	- Fresh cilantro
	- Fresh mint
	- 4 small potatoes 
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Boneless Blade Simmering Steak
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Salt
	- Ground turmeric
	- Saffron threads
	- Cardamom pods
	- Whole cloves
	- Cinnamon sticks 
	- Yellow food colouring
	- Basmati rice
	- Fried onions** 
	- Plain yogurt
	- Milk
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine saffron threads with milk in a small bowl; set aside to soak.
	2. Cut beef into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces and place in a bowl. Add papaya and stir to combine. Stir in yogurt, tomatoes, gingerroot, garlic, turmeric, lemon juice, cilantro, mint, 1 tsp (5 mL) salt and saffron mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or for up to 24 hours.
	3. Meanwhile, place rice in a medium bowl, add cold water and swish the rice. Drain off water and repeat 3 more times until the water in the bowl is somewhat clear. Cover with fresh water and let soak for 2 hours. 
	4. Heat 2 to 3 inches (5 to 7.5 cm) of oil over medium in a deep saucepan until oil reaches 350°F (180°C). Deep-fry potatoes for about 5 to 7 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate with a slotted spoon and set aside.
	5. Drain rice and place in a saucepan. Add fresh water to cover by about 2 inches (5 cm) and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Season water with salt, reduce heat and boil gently for 5 to 10 minutes or until rice is half-cooked. Drain and set aside.
	6. Combine beef mixture, potatoes and ¼ cup (60 mL) oil in a large Dutch oven or enamelled cast-iron roaster, mixing well. Spoon par-boiled rice over top and spread in an even layer.
	7. Heat ¼ cup (60 mL) oil over medium-low heat in a small saucepan. Add cardamom, cloves and cinnamon sticks; heat for 2 minutes or until sizzling and fragrant. Pour spices and oil over rice. Drizzle a few drops of food colouring onto the tip of a knife and run it through the rice to distribute. Scatter a handful of fried onions over top.
	8. Cover pot with foil and place the lid over foil (this prevents steam from escaping). Bake in preheated 330°F oven for about 2 hours or until the meat is fork-tender.
	9. Transfer to a serving platter. Serve with additional yogurt and remaining fried onions.
Recipe Tips:
  - *For the garlic and gingerroot paste, you can use the purée or paste found in jars in the grocery store or use a fine grater, such as a Microplane, to make your own purée in small amounts just as you need it. **Fried onions, which are crispy, dehydrated fried onions, can be found in packages or containers at any Indian grocery store or in the Southeast Asian section of well-stocked supermarkets.
---
Recipe ID: f5c0f5b6-8fb6-4d8e-88d7-518e6f9020ba
Recipe Title: Pesto Bruschetta Beef Burger with Fresh Mozzarella
Recipe Summary: With crowd-pleasing Italian-inspired flavours, this delicious burger is perfect for quick summer weeknight dinners or easy weekend entertaining. Serve the burger open-faced or on radicchio lettuce leaves if preferred. 
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 20
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 cups (500 mL) halved grape tomatoes
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) prepared basil pesto
	- 6 Lean Ground Beef Burgers,¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) olive oil
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) dried Italian herb seasoning
	- 1 large clove garlic, minced
	- 6 ciabatta buns, split
	- 8 oz (250 g) fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced
	- Balsamic glaze
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Grape tomatoes
	- Basil pesto
	- 6  Lean Ground Beef Burgers,¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- Olive oil
	- Dried Italian herb seasoning
	- 1 large clove garlic
	- 6 ciabatta buns
	- Fresh mozzarella cheese
	- Balsamic glaze
Recipe Methods:
	1. Combine tomatoes and pesto in a medium bowl; set aside.]
	 2. Make a thumbprint depression in centre of each burger (to prevent puffing while grilling). Grill burgers on oiled grill in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 10 to 14 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick burgers, turning twice or more, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of each burger reads 160°F (71°C.) 
	3. Meanwhile, whisk oil with Italian seasoning and garlic in a small bowl. Brush on the cut sides of each bun. Grill buns, oiled sides down, on barbecue for 30 to 60 seconds or until well-marked and toasted. 
	4. Place grilled burgers on bun bottoms. Top with mozzarella slices, reserved tomato-pesto mixture, a drizzle of balsamic glaze and bun tops.
Recipe Tips:
  - Substitute halved cherry tomatoes with diced seeded tomato. Alternatively, cut a large beefsteak tomato into thick slices and brush with pesto. Burgers can be pan-fried on the stove top over medium heat in a cast-iron skillet or grill pan. Toast buns in skillet or under broiler.
---
Recipe ID: f5f5620d-edaf-415f-8558-cbe5c6cf2ddf
Recipe Title: Grilled Steak and Veggies with Creamy Pesto Quinoa
Recipe Summary: Wholesome and delicious and eye-candy when served up on a platter. Beef is iron-rich plus and since this recipe comes with whole grain and veggie goodness too, this is the perfect feast for the whole family.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 25
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	-  Creamy Pesto Quinoa 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) 2% plain Greek yogurt
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) prepared pesto
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) quinoa, cooked according to package directions (about 2 cups/500 mL cooked)
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) crumbled feta or goat cheese (optional)
	-  Steak and Vegetables 
	- 2 cloves garlic, minced
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) balsamic vinegar
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) grated orange zest
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) orange juice
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) grainy Dijon mustard
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) maple syrup
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) olive oil
	- 16 cherry tomatoes
	- 1 sweet red or orange pepper, sliced
	- 1 zucchini, sliced on a diagonal
	- ½ small eggplant, sliced
	- 1½ lb (750 g) Beef Porterhouse Grilling Steak, about ¾ inch (2 cm) thick 
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) EACH salt and pepper, divided
Recipe Shopping List:
	-  Creamy Pesto Quinoa 
	- 2% plain Greek yogurt
	- prepared pesto
	- quinoa
	- crumbled feta or goat cheese (optional)
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- balsamic vinegar
	- orange
	- Dijon mustard
	- maple syrup
	- olive oil
	- 16 cherry tomatoes
	- 1 sweet red or orange pepper
	- 1 zucchini
	- small eggplant
	- 1½ lb (750 g)  Beef Porterhouse Grilling Steak, about ¾ inch (2 cm) thick
	- pepper
	- salt
Recipe Methods:
	1. Creamy Pesto Quinoa: Whisk yogurt with pesto in a small bowl; drizzle over cooked quinoa in a medium bowl; toss to coat. Top with crumbled feta (if using). Set aside. (Can be served warm, room temperature or chilled.)
	 2. Steak and Vegetables: Whisk together garlic, vinegar, orange zest and juice, Dijon mustard and maple syrup in a medium bowl. Slowly drizzle in oil, while whisking constantly. Measure out ⅓ cup (75 mL) for vegetables and set remaining aside for steak. 
	3. Combine tomatoes, peppers, zucchini and eggplant in a large bowl; add the ⅓ cup (75 mL) glaze and toss to coat. Arrange vegetables in an even layer in a grill basket. Save any leftover glaze from bowl for cooked vegetables (do not use for raw beef.)
	 4. Place basket on preheated grill over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C); close lid and grill vegetables, tossing occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes or until tender-crisp. Return to bowl and toss with any leftover glaze. Transfer to a platter and season with ¼ tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper; tent with foil.
	 5. Meanwhile, pat steak dry with paper towel. Season all over with remaining salt and pepper; brush with some of the reserved glaze and set aside.
	 6. Grill steak in a closed preheated barbecue over medium-high heat (400°F/200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes for ¾ inch (2 cm) thick steak, turning twice or more and basting with remaining glaze, or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least.
	 7. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes before serving. Carve across the grain into slices and serve with quinoa and vegetables.
Recipe Tips:
  - Leftovers can also be tossed together to make a cold beef and quinoa salad for lunch the next day.
---
Recipe ID: f6723740-7493-4f15-9496-0d2ccb0996aa
Recipe Title: Barbecued Roast for Two
Recipe Summary: Put your barbecue to work to cook roast beef to perfection. Use indirect heat to cook the roast evenly without flare-ups. The shape of the roast has as much to do with the cook time as the size and the cut. NOTE: ‘Time-to-cook’ figures are rough guidelines only as cook time is dependent on so many factors such as: barbecue and thermometer accuracy, starting temperature of roast, roast shape and cut. A good thermometer is one of your best kitchen investments.
Recipe Prep Time: 5
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 60
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 65
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 garlic cloves, minced
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast, about 2 inches (5 cm) thick (1 rib)
	- Salt and fresh ground pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 2 garlic cloves
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Prime Rib Premium Oven Roast, about 2 inches (5 cm) thick (1 rib)
	- Salt
	- Fresh ground pepper
Recipe Methods:
	1. Rub roast with garlic, and salt and pepper to your taste.
	 2. Fill drip pan with water and place under grill (off to one side). Preheat barbecue to medium-high (400°F). 
	3. Insert oven-safe meat thermometer into centre of roast. Place roast on grill over flame and cook for 5 minutes per side. Move roast to grill over the drip pan; turn off burner under drip pan. Close lid and cook with indirect heat for about 50 minutes hours for medium-rare, removing from grill when 5°F (3°C) below desired finished temperature (145°F/63°C for medium-rare, or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done).
	4. Transfer to cutting board, cover with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before carving into slices.
Recipe Tips:
  - Let your roast stand at least 15 minutes after cooking to allow the juices settle before carving.
---
Recipe ID: f6a55c5d-9953-4d7e-81d1-4c585e0257b4
Recipe Title: Big Mac-Style Smash Burgers  
Recipe Summary: Just like the fast-food classic, this Big Mac-Style Smash Burger is made with two thin Canadian beef patties, topped with cheddar cheese, diced onions, lettuce and pickles, then drenched in our “mac” sauce. This recipe was adapted from Chef Mattai and Lago’s original to cook at home.
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 10
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 0
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- Burgers
		- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
		- Salt and pepper
		- 8 slices Cheddar cheese
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) butter, divided
		- 4 sesame seed buns, cut horizontally into thirds
		- ½ cup (125 mL) minced white onion
		- 2 cups (500 mL) shredded iceberg lettuce
		- 2 dill pickles, thinly sliced into rounds (16 to 24 slices)
	- “Mac” Sauce
		- 1 cup (250 mL) mayonnaise
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) minced dill pickle
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) minced white onion
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) prepared yellow mustard
		- 4 tsp (20 mL) pickle juice or white wine vinegar
		- 4 tsp (20 mL) ketchup
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) sweet paprika
		- ½ tsp (2 mL) garlic powder
		- Salt and pepper
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 white onion
	- Iceberg lettuce
	- 4 sesame seed buns (unsliced)
	- 1 lb (500 g) Medium Ground Beef
	- Mayonnaise
	- Prepared yellow mustard
	- Ketchup
	- Dill pickles
	- Pickle juice or white wine vinegar
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Sweet paprika
	- Garlic powder
	- 8 slices Cheddar cheese
	- Butter
Recipe Methods:
	1. Burgers: Divide the ground beef into 8 equal portions and loosely shape into balls. Place on a tray, cover and refrigerate while preparing remaining ingredients. 
	2. “Mac” Sauce: Combine mayonnaise, minced pickle, onion, mustard, pickle juice, ketchup, paprika and garlic powder in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside.
	3. Heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Place 1 ball of meat in the pan, off centre, and quickly smash it firmly with a flat metal spatula or burger press until it is about ¼ inch (5 mm) thick. Repeat with 1 to 3 more balls, as the size of the skillet allows. Season liberally with salt and pepper. Cook for about 2 minutes, until the edges are browned and crispy. Flip the patties, season with salt and pepper and lay a cheese slice on each. Cook for 1 minute more, or until browned and cooked to 160°F (71°C) doneness at the least. Transfer to plate and set aside to rest. Repeat with remaining beef.
	4. Drain any excess fat from pan and discard. Return skillet to medium-high. Melt 1 tbsp (15 mL) of the butter and arrange one of the buns, cut-side down, to toast until just golden, flipping the middle slice to toast on the other side. Set aside. Repeat with remaining butter and buns.
	5. To assemble, for each burger, place bottom bun on a plate. Spread with "Mac" Sauce, sprinkle with 1 tbsp (15 mL) of onion, ¼ cup (60 mL) lettuce, 1 patty with cheese facing down, then 3 pickles. Top with middle bun and repeat topping with “Mac” Sauce, onion, lettuce, burger patty and pickles. Drizzle with remaining sauce and sandwich with the top bun and give it a squeeze.
Recipe Tips:
  - Keep the meat in the fridge until just before cooking, this ensures the fat in the meat stays solid, resulting in a juicier, more crisp patty, than using less cold meat. Use a square of parchment paper placed on top of the patties before smashing them to ensure that the meat does not stick to the spatula or burger press.
---
Recipe ID: f7a44ceb-2967-41a9-954f-65c2375bf94f
Recipe Title: Garlic Bread Banh Mi with Satay Beef
Recipe Summary: A bit like an Asian-style sub sandwich, Banh Mi has both Vietnamese and French cultural influences. Thinly sliced beef cooks super-fast in just about the time it takes to heat the garlic bread. For more on the quick-cooking cuts of beef, check out the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
Recipe Prep Time: 40
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 15
Recipe Marinating Time: 30
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 85
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) fresh or thawed hot pot style slices* of Canadian Beef Top Sirloin or Rib Eye Roast or Steak (beef cut across the grain into very thin slices)
	- 1 shallot, minced
	- 4 cloves garlic, minced
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) soy sauce
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) fish sauce 
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) sesame oil
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) canola or sunflower oil (approx)
	- 1 cup (250 mL) julienned carrots
	- 1 cup (250 mL) julienned daikon radish (or 8 red radishes)
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) white vinegar
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) granulated sugar
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) salt
	- 1 pkg (284g) Furlani® Garlic Bread 
	- ½ red onion, sliced into thin strips
	- 1 cucumber, cut lengthwise into long strips
	- 4 to 6 fresh cilantro sprigs (stems with leaves)
	- 1 jalapeño, sliced crosswise
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) soy sauce
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) crushed peanuts (optional)
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 lb (500 g) fresh or thawed hot pot style slices* of  Canadian Beef Top Sirloin or Rib Eye Roast or Steak
	- 1 shallot
	- 4 cloves garlic
	- soy sauce
	- fish sauce
	- sesame oil
	- brown sugar
	- pepper
	- canola or sunflower oil
	- julienned carrots
	- julienned daikon radish
	- white vinegar
	- granulated sugar
	- salt
	- Garlic Bread
	- red onion
	- 1 cucumber
	- 4 to 6 fresh cilantro sprigs
	- 1 jalapeño
	- soy sauce
	- crushed peanuts
Recipe Methods:
	1. Satay Beef: Combine sliced beef, shallot, garlic, soy sauce, fish sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, and pepper in a large bowl. Mix well, making sure beef is evenly coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or for up to 12 hours
	  2. Pickled Carrots and Radish: Combine carrots, daikon, vinegar, ¼ cup (60 mL) water, sugar and salt in a 2 cup (500 mL) mason jar. Seal jar with lid and shake gently to mix thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate for up to 12 hours, until ready to assemble the sandwich. 
	 3. Remove beef from marinade; discard marinade. Heat 1 tbsp (15 mL) oil over medium-high heat in a cast-iron skillet. Cook beef, in 2 batches, for 5 to 7 minutes, turning frequently with tongs, until the beef is cooked through and is slightly charred. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Add more oil to the skillet between batches, if necessary.
	4. Sandwiches: Bake Furlani Garlic Bread according to package instructions. 
	5. Place garlic bread loaf halves with the cut side up on a cutting board lined with a sheet of parchment. Run the backside of a serving spoon along the cut side of each loaf half, to make an indentation to hold the filling. Arrange Satay Beef on bottom half of the loaf, filling the indentation that was made. Top beef with cucumber, onion and jalapeño. Top the second half of the loaf with drained Pickled Carrots and Daikon, filling the indentation. (Serve any extra Pickled Carrots and Radish as a side dish to go along with the sandwich.) Top with cilantro, soy sauce and crushed peanuts, if using. Put the sandwich top and bottom together, rolling up in the parchment paper. Cut through the parchment paper, cutting the sandwich diagonally in half.
Recipe Tips:
  - *Hot pot-style beef is thinly sliced rib eye or top sirloin, typically sold in Asian or Quebec grocery stores in the freezer section or fresh meat counter. If you’re unable to find pre-sliced beef, partially freeze a beef steak and carefully carve across the grain into thin slices using a sharp knife. Explore some of the many wonders of over 70+ cuts of beef on the Canadian Beef Information Gateway.
---
Recipe ID: f83b8551-91aa-4443-854f-0a306703ca29
Recipe Title: Italian Beef Stew (Spezzatino)
Recipe Summary: Slow cooked beef would always fill the kitchen with an aroma that would bring everyone to the table. When my mom was growing up, beef wasn’t plentiful in her small country town in Italy, so my grandmother would usually get less tender cuts that would create delicious stew-type meals like this one. Serve this saucy stew with plenty of crusty bread to soak up the sauce.
Recipe Prep Time: 20
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 165
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 185
Recipe Servings: 6
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Blade Roast, Blade Steak or Beef Stew Cubes
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) extra virgin olive oil
	- 1 large carrot, thinly sliced
	- 1 onion, thinly sliced
	- 1 large clove garlic, minced
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) salt, divided
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) dry red wine 
	- 2 cups (500 mL) tomato passata (strained tomatoes)
	- 1 bay leaf
	- 1 sprig fresh rosemary 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) hot pepper flakes
	- 6 fresh basil leaves, torn
	- Potatoes
		- 2 lb (1 kg) yellow-flesh potatoes, peeled
		- Salt
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) extra virgin olive oil
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 large carrot
	- 1 onion
	- Garlic
	- Fresh rosemary 
	- Fresh basil
	- 2 lb (1 kg) yellow-flesh potatoes
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Boneless Beef Blade Roast, Blade Steak or Beef Stew Cubes
	- Extra virgin olive oil
	- Salt
	- Bay leaf
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- 2 cups (500 mL) tomato passata (strained tomatoes)
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) dry red wine 
Recipe Methods:
	1. Trim visible fat from beef. Cut beef into about ½-inch (1 cm) pieces. Pat dry with paper towel and set aside.
	2. In a Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add carrot, onion and garlic; cook, stirring for about 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in beef and ¼ tsp (1 mL) of the salt. Cook, stirring, for about 3 to 4 minutes or until beef starts to change colour, but not brown. Add wine and increase heat to medium-high; bring to a boil. 
	3. Stir in passata, bay leaf, rosemary, hot pepper flakes and remaining salt; return to a simmer. Cover, reduce heat and simmer, stirring frequently, for about 2½ hours or until beef is very tender. 
	4. Potatoes: Meanwhile, place potatoes in a saucepan and add cold water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat. Season water with salt. Reduce heat and boil gently for about 25 minutes or until tender but firm. Drain well and return to pot. Drizzle with oil and ¾ tsp (4 mL) salt and stir to break into chunks; keep warm. 
	5. Stir basil into stew and simmer, uncovered, for about 10 minutes until slightly thickened. Discard bay leaf and rosemary stem. Serve spezzatino with Potatoes.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: f9330c79-6567-466a-92b3-94bddcb1e793
Recipe Title: Soy & Lime Sous Vide Short Ribs
Recipe Summary: These short ribs are a great example of how sous vide cooking makes a melt-in-your-mouth tender dish out of a tougher cut of meat. The ribs cook in the sweet and zesty marinade and get a quick broil to glaze at the end. Serve these ribs with sticky rice and stir-fried vegetables and some kimchi on the side.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 1446
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 1456
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 onion, finely chopped
	- 1 clove garlic, minced
	- ¼ cup (60 mL) packed brown sugar
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) reduced-sodium soy sauce
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) grated lime zest
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) EACH fresh lime juice and rice vinegar
	- 1 tsp (5 mL) sriracha or other hot pepper sauce
	- 2 lb (1 kg) Beef Short Ribs (Maui/Korean-style), about ½ inch (1 cm) thick
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 onion
	- 1 clove garlic
	- brown sugar
	- reduced-sodium soy sauce
	- lime zest
	- rice vinegar
	- fresh lime juice
	- sriracha or other hot pepper sauce
	- 2 lb (1 kg)  Beef Short Ribs (Maui/Korean-style)
Recipe Methods:
	1. Set up water bath for sous vide and preheat to 135°F (57°C) according to manufacturer’s directions.
	 2. Combine onion, garlic, brown sugar, soy sauce, lime zest and juice, vinegar and sriracha in a medium bowl, stirring until sugar is dissolved.
	3. Place ribs in a large bag for sous vide (vacuum, sealable freezer or reusable silicone). Pour in onion mixture, massaging to evenly coat meat. Arrange strips of ribs in a single layer in bag. Remove as much air as possible and vacuum or manually seal. 
	 4. Immerse bag in preheated water bath and secure it to the side of the pot with a clip, keeping the top of the bag above the surface of the water. Cover water bath with foil or plastic to reduce evaporation. Cook sous vide for 24 hours, replenishing water as necessary.
	 5. To serve, preheat broiler with rack 6 inches (15 cm) from heat.
	 6. Remove beef from water bath. Carefully remove ribs from bag and place on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Discard liquid. Broil ribs, rotating pan as necessary, for 4 minutes or until browned. Flip ribs over and broil for 2 to 3 minutes or until browned.  
Recipe Tips:
  - The ribs are so tender they may fall apart as you remove them the bag. Place the bag horizontally on a cutting board and use a large slotted spatula to lift ribs out of back to keep the strips in tact.
---
Recipe ID: f9541e0a-c9b6-4cb1-9be7-20b5808eec30
Recipe Title: Speedy Bourguignon Skillet
Recipe Summary: This speedy skillet version of a truly classic recipe uses flavourful top sirloin strips instead of the traditional braising beef cuts. Delicious, easy to prepare, yet still honouring Bourguignon tradition with ingredients such as bacon, mushrooms, onions, red wine and thyme!
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 35
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 50
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 slices bacon, diced
	- 1 lb (500 g) Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak, , sliced into thin strips
	- ¾ tsp (4 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper, divided 
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) butter
	- 1 pkg (227 g) sliced mushrooms
	- 1 onion, finely chopped 
	- 1 carrot, thinly sliced 
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) dried thyme leaves
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) tomato paste
	- 2½ cups (625 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- ¾ cup (175 mL) dry red wine
	- 3 tbsp (45 mL) all-purpose flour
	- ⅓ cup (75 mL) cold water
	- 2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh chives
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 4 slices bacon
	- 1 lb (500 g)  Beef Top Sirloin Grilling Steak
	- salt
	- fresh ground pepper
	- butter
	- sliced mushrooms
	- 1 onion
	- 1 carrot
	- dried thyme leaves
	- tomato paste
	- 2½ cups (625 mL) reduced-sodium beef broth
	- dry red wine
	- all-purpose flour
	- fresh chives
Recipe Methods:
	1. Cook bacon in a large deep skillet over medium heat for 5 to 7 minutes, stirring often, or until crispy around the edges. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Reserve fat in skillet. 
	2. Meanwhile, pat beef strips dry with paper towel and season all over with ½ tsp (2 mL) each salt and pepper. Heat reserved skillet over medium-high heat. Cook beef for 3 to 5 minutes, tossing occasionally, until browned but still pink inside; transfer to a bowl and cover. 
	 3. Add butter, mushrooms, onion, carrot, thyme and remaining salt and pepper to skillet. Reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until vegetables are starting to soften and brown. Stir in tomato paste; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in broth and wine; bring to a boil. 
	4. Whisk flour with cold water in a small bowl until smooth. Gradually stir into skillet; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, stirring often, for 5 to 7 minutes or until sauce is thickened and vegetables are tender. 
	 5. Return bacon, beef and any accumulated juices to skillet. Simmer, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until beef is heated through. Serve sprinkled with chives. 
Recipe Tips:
  - This saucy stew is perfect served over cooked broad egg noodles, steamed rice or boiled potatoes, or serve with fresh baguette slices for dipping.
---
Recipe ID: f963b442-b72a-44c7-9cff-d2ca7296e7a8
Recipe Title: Red Wine-Braised Short Ribs (Sudderlapjes)
Recipe Summary: There wasn’t a week that went by in my household where we did not have braised beef. My mother would slow cook it for hours filling up the home with delicious aromas; a welcoming smell after coming home from a long day at school. Now this recipe is a staple in my household and with hardly any prep time, it’s become a fan favorite for quick dinner parties or family dinners on Sunday. Serve with your favorite side dish, such as mashed potatoes, rice or pasta.
Recipe Prep Time: 10
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 240
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 250
Recipe Servings: 4
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 4 Beef Bone-in Short Ribs, 2 inches (5 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg total)
	- Salt and pepper
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- 3 stalks celery, diced
	- 2 carrots, diced
	- 1 onion, diced 
	- 8 cloves garlic, smashed
	- 1 bottle (750 mL) dry red wine
	- 1½ to 2 cups (375 to 500 mL) beef broth
	- 3 sprigs fresh oregano
	- 3 sprigs fresh thyme 
	- 1 bay leaf 
Recipe Shopping List:
	- Celery
	- 2 carrots
	- 1 onion 
	- Garlic
	- Fresh oregano
	- Fresh thyme 
	- 4 Beef Bone-in Short Ribs, 2 inches (5 cm) thick (about 2 lb/1 kg total)
	- Canola or sunflower oil
	- Beef broth
	- Salt
	- Pepper
	- Bay leaf 
	- 1 bottle (750 mL) dry red wine
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat short ribs dry with paper towel and season generously with salt and pepper. Heat a thin layer of oil over medium-high heat in a medium to large Dutch oven. Brown beef, in batches, turning to brown all sides. Transfer to a bowl. 
	2. Add celery, carrots and onion to pot; cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes or until onion is translucent and soft. Stir in garlic; cook, stirring for 5 minutes.
	3. Pour in wine and bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up browned bits from bottom of pot. Return beef and accumulated juices to pot. Pour in enough beef broth to cover beef.
	4. Cover and bake in preheated 350°F oven for 3½ hours or until beef is very tender and falls off the bone easily. Discard bay leaf and oregano and thyme stems. Season sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Recipe Tips: ???
---
Recipe ID: f988881a-2469-4599-8352-7607e0d8ca93
Recipe Title: Pan-seared T-bone Steak Puttanesca for Two
Recipe Summary: Puttanesca sauce is a classic tomato pasta sauce featuring olives, capers and anchovy. Prepared with fresh grape tomatoes here, this zesty sauce is ready in minutes and pairs wonderfully with this pan-seared steak. 
Recipe Prep Time: 15
Recipe Chill Time: 0
Recipe Cooking Time: 30
Recipe Marinating Time: 0
Recipe Freezing Time: 0
Recipe Total Time: 45
Recipe Servings: 2
Recipe Difficulty: ???
Recipe Ingredients List:
	- 1 Beef T-bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1 lb/500 g)
	- ½ tsp (2 mL) EACH salt and fresh ground pepper
	- 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
	- Puttanesca Sauce
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
		- 2 cloves garlic, very thinly sliced
		- 1 tsp (5 mL) EACH dried oregano leaves and anchovy paste
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) hot pepper flakes
		- 2 cups (500 mL) grape tomatoes, halved
		- ¼ cup (60 mL) halved pitted black or green olives
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) red wine vinegar
		- 1 tbsp (15 mL) drained capers
		- ¼ tsp (1 mL) granulated sugar
		- 2 tbsp (30 mL) chopped fresh basil or parsley
Recipe Shopping List:
	- 1 Beef T-bone Grilling Steaks, 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick (about 1 lb/500 g)
	- Salt
	- Ground pepper
	- Olive oil
	- 2 cloves garlic
	- Dried oregano leaves
	- Anchovy paste
	- Hot pepper flakes
	- Grape tomatoes
	- Pitted black or green olives
	- Red wine vinegar
	- Capers
	- Granulated sugar
	- Fresh basil or parsley
Recipe Methods:
	1. Pat steak dry with paper towel and season all over with salt and pepper. 
	 2. Heat oil over medium-high heat in large heavy-bottom stainless skillet. Add steaks and cook for 4 to 6 minutes, turning once or until browned on both sides. Transfer steaks to a rack on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Set skillet aside to make the sauce.
	 3. Cook steak in preheated 400°F oven for 6 to 8 minutes or until a digital instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into centre of steak reads 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare doneness at the least (or 160°F/71°C for medium, or 170°F/77°C for well-done). Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
	Puttanesca Sauce: : 
		4. Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in the reserved skillet. Cook garlic, oregano, anchovy paste and hot pepper flakes, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until fragrant. Add tomatoes, olives, vinegar, capers, sugar and ¼ cup (60 mL) water; bring to a simmer. Cover and boil for 8 to 10 minutes or until thickened and saucy. Remove from heat; stir in basil. 
		5. Carve meat from the bone, then across the grain into slices. Serve with Puttanesca Sauce.
Recipe Tips:
  - If desired, toss sauce with hot, cooked pasta and serve with sliced steak. Drizzle pasta with a touch more olive oil and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
---
Recipe ID: f9c4c3dd-b946-41fb-af21-3e5085b9b09f
Recipe Title: Beer Braised Beef Roast and Root Vegetables
